title: NEW ASSAULT DUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 3With the city of Quangtri lost, two South Vietnamese fire bases on the approaches to the former im perial capital of Hue were re ported under enemy attack yes terday.

title: Faltering Amtrak
description: Amtrak moves into its second year almost as trouble beset as the railroads whose inadequacies spawned it. Far from reviving intercity rail passenger service, the corporation created by Congress in hope that selfsupport would come quickly through the Improvements it gener ated seems destined primarily to swell the Federal deficit.

title: Hummer Gets Operation
description: BUFFALO, May 2 (AP)John Hummer, the Buffalo Braves' forward, was recovering today from surgery to repair a partly torn left Achilles tendon.

title: Five Housing Aides Held on Extortion
description: The top two officials of the City Housing Authority's demolition division and three of the unit's six inspectors were arrested yesterday and charged with extorting bribes from struggling blackowned and Puerto Rican owned demolition companies work ing in Model Cities neighbor hoods.

title: Tass Reports Death
description: MOSCOW, May 2 (UPI) Tass, the official Soviet press agency, reported today the death of J. Edgar Hoover in a onesentence dispatch from New York. It said: J. Edgar Hoover, who headed the United States Federal Bureau of In vestigation since 1924, died in Washington at the age of 77.

title: Cambodian Drive Stalled
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 2 (UPI)A Cambodian attempt to oust enemy troops occupy ing 60 miles of Route 1, Pnom penh's land link with Saigon, was reported stalled today by heavy resistance.

title: New Factory Orders Up In March to Record Total
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  Manufacturers' new orders rose more in March than earlier es timates had indicated, but in ventory growth continued slug gish, the Commerce Depart ment reported today.

title: Curb on Offensive Missiles Expected by U.S. in Pact
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 2 On the basis of the under standing with the Soviet Union announced in Washington yes terday, the United States re portedly assumes that the first agreement on limitation of stra tegic armaments will set nu merical limits on landbased and submarinebased offensive missiles as well as on defensive ones.

title: Executive Changes
description: The CocaCola Bottling Company of New York, Inc., has elected William J. Sullivan as senior vice president. Before joining the company in 1968, he was assistant treasurer at ChesebroughPond's, Inc.

title: RISE IN RELIEF COST SLOWS NATIONWIDE
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP)  Tighter state rules on wel fare eligibility have had a brak ing effect on national relief costs, which hit a record total of $17.7billion last year, Gov ernment statistics showed to day.

title: The Air War Over Indochina
description: ITHACA, N. Y.The American peo ple are learning, many with surprise, that their President has been telling them the truth about his commitment of U.S. air power to the Indochina conflict. Mr. Nixon evidently means business with his bombers. However, the spectacular air strikes which occa sioned this surprise are only the tip of the iceberg. The other ninetenths of the monster are submergedthe tonaminute, workaday blasting of Indochina.

title: Books of The Times
description: MIDNIGHT OIL. By V. S. Pritchett. 271 pages. Random House. $6.95.

title: Faculty at Brawn Votes To Abolish Naval R.O.T.C.
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May (AP)  Faculty members at Brown University voted today to abolish the 31yearold Naval Reserve Officers Train ing Corps program by next month.

title: Sperry Rand Net Up 15% In Quarter, Off 16% in Year
Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: News Analysis
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 2The loss of South Vietnam's northernmost province and the collapse of two of its combat divisions in the last week have brought the Government of President Nguyen Van Thieu to a perilous stage.

title: Rockefeller Forced Out Dentzer, Bankers Assert
description: William T. Dentzer Jr., the former New York State Superintendent of Banks, was ousted by Governor Rocke feller last week as a result of heavy pressure from some of the state's largest banking in stitutions, informed bankers said yesterday.

title: Wallace Defeat Narrow
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 2 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota won a narrow vic tory tonight over Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama in the Indiana Presidential primary.

title: India Considers Atom Tests For Industrial Development
description: NEW DELPHI, May 2De fense Minister Jagjivan Ram said today that India was studying the technology for carrying out underground nu clear explosions for peaceful purposes.

title: U.S. Increases Its Duties On Italian Compressors
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) The Treasury Department re taliated today against Italy for giving tax subsidies to com panies that export compressors and parts to the United States.

title: Advertising:
description: Generally speaking, the public members of the five monthold National Adver tising Review Boardout numbered four to one by advertising professionals  are optimistic about the suc cess of the first major indtistry effort at selfregu lation. But they are not complacent.

title: STOCKS BATTERED FOR 2D DAY IN ROW
description: A dispirited stock market ab sorbed its second large loss of the week yesterday. After a rally at midsession failed to hold its token gain, prices sank steadily during the afternoon.

title: Most Budgets Approved For Schools in Suburbs
description: Voters in Nassau, Suffolk and Westchester Counties went to the polls yesterday to choose members of their school boards and vote on school budgets for the 197273 academic year.

title: Service Station Hearings
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI)  A House subcommit tee on small business will hold a series of hearings this month on problems of service stations and other gasoline marketers, it was announced today.

title: ALFRED M. STAEHLE
description: SCOTTSDALE, Ariz., May 2 Alfred M. Staehle, who re tired as a vice president of the McGrawHill Publishing Com pany in 1960, died last Tuesday at his home here. He was 77 years old.

title: DELAYED TRAUMA IN VETERANS CITED
description: DALLAS, May 2Evidence is accumulating that the Viet nam war, though it has pro duced the lowest rate of psy chiatric casualties during com bat of any major war, is caus ing a remarkable number of delayed psychiatric problems that emerge only after the vet eran returns to civilian life.

title: Arab Turnout Heavy in Orderly West Bank Elections
description: BETHLEHEM, Israelioccupied Jordan, May 2 (AP)Arabs liv ing under Israeli occupation ignored guerrilla warnings to day and turned out heavily in an election test of ArabJewish coexistence.

title: Market Place: Conglomerates And Reports
description: It wasn't so long ago that the Securities and Exchange Commission asked corpora tions with multiline products and services to provide breakdowns of sales.

title: Rangers Lose 2d Straight, 21
description: BOSTON, May 2Unable to score up close, flailing at and missing rebounds, the Rangers suffered their second straight defeat by the Boston Bruins, 21, in the Stanley Cup final playoffs tonight.

title: Smith Returns to Helsinki
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 2 (AP)Gerard C. Smith, the chief United States delegate to the talks on limitation of stra tegic arms here, returned today from Washington where he consulted with President Nixon.

title: If Y'all Hanker for Barbecue, Gaylen's in Texas, Is the Place
description: ARLINGTON, Tex.  It is now possible to travel the length and breadth of the land and eat exactly the same thing at every stop. Thus it is nice to know, in this world of Pizza Huts and Whataburgers, that there is still a Gaylen's BarBQ.

title: U.S. Smelting Is Changing Its Name to UV Industries
description: The United States Smelting, Refining and Mining Company announced yesterday that it planned to change its name to UV Industries, Inc. The com pany said the change would eliminate references to opera tions that no longer reflect the principal interests and di rection of the company. UV is the symbol for the company's shares on the New York Stock Exchange.

title: Frazier, Ali Ask $5Million Each
description: VANCOUVER, British Colum bia, May 2  Negotiations will intensify tomorrow in New York for a world heavyweight title rematch between Joe Frazier and Muhammad Ali with each gladiator seeking a $5million guarantee, double each's earnings in last Year's extravaganza.

title: Bridge: A New Book on Finessing Fills Gap for Enthusiasts
description: One might suppose that in the 46  year history of the game every major aspect would have been made the subject of a book. But this is not quite true, and Fred Karpin of Washington, who is equally prominent as a teacher and a writer, has now filled one of the gaps with The Finesse, pub lished today. This 273  page book is well designed, and is a worthy addition to the PrenticeHall contract bridge series, although the prices show inflationary tendencies: $7.95 hard cover, or $2.95 paper.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1 No Title

title: OpenEnded War
description: The strong offensive by North Vietnamese troops that resulted in capture of Quangtri, undertaken almost simul taneously with the trip to Paris of Hanoi Politburo mem ber Le Duc Tho, could not have been coincidental. The militarydiplomatic character of the current Communist offensive has been evident from the start. That offensive, designed to improve the Communist bargaining position in Paris, is now challenging President Nixon's Vietnam policies as never before in this long and fruitless war.

title: Potofsky and Another Officer of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers to Resign
description: Two of labor's oldest and most respected leaders, Jacob S. Potofsky and Frank Rosen blum, have decided not to seek reelection as top officers of the 385,000member Amalga mated Clothing Workers of America.

title: SHAREHOLDER SUIT AGAINST IHC SETTLED
description: IHC, Inc., announced yester day that a shareholder suit against it, the New York Stock Exchange and Hayden, Stone, Inc., a former member firm of the exchange, had been settled on terms previously proposed.

title: Slight Earnings Rise Is Seen by Plane Maker
description: BURBANK, Calif., May 2 (AP) Daniel J. Haughton, chairman of the Lockheed Air craft Corporation, predicted at the concern's annual meeting today that profits this year would be slightly more than the $15.4million, or $1.36 a share, earned in 1971.

title: 3 Computer Training Schools Accused by F.T.C. of Deception
description: WASHINGTON, May 2The Federal Trade Commission ac cused three of the country's largest computer training schools today of false advertis ing and other deceptive selling practices.

title: WALLACE IS GREETED BY CROWDS IN TEXAS
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., May 2Two large and highly parti san crowds greeted Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama today on his second swing into this state seeking delegates to the Democratic National Con vention.

title: Sarnoff Points to 10% Rise in Quarter Net
description: BURBANK; Calif., May 2 The RCA Corporation has sur vived a turbulent period of heavy writeoffs and is now in its strongest position since 1969, Robert W. Sarnoff, chairman, told shareholders at the com pany's 53d annual meeting here today.

title: Reputed Crime Leader Indicted for Tax Evasion
description: Aniello Dellacroce, charac terized as the most powerful organized crime boss in the state, was indicted by a Federal grand jury here yesterday on charges of income tax evasion.

title: Bunker Meets Thieu Twice in 24 Hours
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 3 (AP)The United States Ambassador, Ellsworth Bunker, conferred this morning with President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam their second meet ing in 24 hours, informed, sources said.

title: RESHEVSKY GAINS IN NATIONAL CHESS
description: Sammy Reshevsky of Spring Valley, N.Y., defeated Orest Popovych in an adjourned fifth round game and then drew with Arthur Feuerstein, a one time Manhattan Chess Club champion, in the 21st Annual National chess championship.

title: Blue Finally Signs OneYear Contract, Says He Is Happy
description: BOSTON, May 2 (UPI)Vida Blue signed a oneyear con tract with the Oakland today, ending a lengthy salary dis pute.

title: New Boycott of Lettuce Announced by Chavez
description: LOS ANGELES, May 2 (UPI) Another nationwide buyer boycott of lettuce was announced today by Cesar Chavez, whose United Farm Workers Union has previ ously sponsored boycotts of lettuce and grapes.

title: WarnerLambert Holders Vote Against 2 Proposals
description: Should a pharmaceutical company sell Its products abroad under the same con ditions it sells them at home?

title: Bullets Are Said to Be Set For '74 Move to Suburbia
description: UPPER MARLBORO, Md., May 2 (UPI)The Baltimore Bullets of the National Basket ball Association will move to the Washington suburb of Prince Georges County in the near future, the chairman of the Prince Georges County Council announced today.

title: WHITE HOUSE NAMES 12 TO SAFETY PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) The White House announced today President Nixon's ap pointment of 12 persons to threeyear terms on the Na tional Highway Safety Advisory Committee.

title: Rome Again Tests Fareless Transit To Reduce Traffic
description: ROME, May 1Romans were again able today to travel on municipal buses and streetcars without paying any fares, and city officials hoped that many commuters would leave their cars at home.

title: Key to the Mint Captures Derby Trial
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 2 Key to the Mint, in his first appearance since March 15 at Hialeah, demonstrated today that he could run a mile com petently enough as he won the Derby Trial at Churchill Downs.

title: David Kreinik Weds Mrs. GrosselRossil
description: Mrs. Sandra Snee Grossel Rossi and David Kreinik were married yesterday morning at the Palazzo Vecchio in Flor ence, Italy, by Dr. Mario Leone, Vice Mayor of Florence.

title: East Orange Mayor Asks Black Officials To Stand By Israel
description: EAST ORANGE, May 2  Mayor William S. Hart today urged 27 black elected officials across the country to rescind a resolution adopted at the Na tional Black Political Conven tion that called for the dismem berment of Israel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ORANTES VICTOR IN ITALIAN FINAL
description: ROME, May 2 (UPI)Manuel Orantes scored the biggest vic tory of his tennis career today by defeating Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia, 46, 61, 75, 62, in the final of the Italian championship, one of the world's major clay tourna ments.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Mets' Gentry Defeats Giants, 42
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 2 Willie Mays was on the bench for the fifth straight game to night as Gary Gentry pitched the New York Mets to a two hit 42 victory over the San Francisco Giants that moved the Mets into first place in the Eastern Division.

title: When Family Is Struck by Catastrophe
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J.What happens to a family when a young mother sud denly becomes ill? Who takes care of the children? Last November, Mrs. Angela Clifford of Harrison needed an immediate answer to that question.

title: AUSTRALIA PLANS TAKEOVER RULES
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 2 The Federal Cabinet will meet here tomorrow to begin fram ing new guidelines to control foreign takeovers of Austra lian companies  a move given added impetus by the future over the International Tele phone and Telegraph Corpora tion's proposal to buy into the Australian food industry.

title: Stasiuk Replaces Laycoe As Coach of Canuck Six
description: VANCOUVER, British Co lumbia, May 2 (AP)The Van couver Canucks of the Na tional Hockey League signed Vic Stasiuk today to a one year contract as coach.

title: 110 in Maine Fined for SitIn
description: WATERVILLE, Me., May 2 (AP)Ten students who staged a weekend sitin at Colby Col lege's Air Force Reserve Offi cers Training Corps office have been fined $100 each and given suspended 10day jail sentences.

title: Foe Says Saigon Lost 10,000
description: PARIS, Mary 2 (AP)North Vietnam said today that Com munistled forces killed, wound ed or captured nearly 10,000 allied troops in the five days of fighting that culminated in the capture of Quangtri.

title: E.B. White Rehones His Verbal Razor
description: Transmuted by E. B. White, The Elements of Style has emerged in a second edition.

title: The Ramp: A Delicacy and Abomination
description: WAYNESVILLE, N. C., May 1There was a sprinkling of rain along about midafter noon yesterday, but most of the people who celebrate spring by standing around eating highintensity spring onions called ramps didn't seem to notice. They prob ably wouldn't have noticed anything short of a real frog strangler.

title: Roundup: McNally Posts Third Shutout for Orioles
description: Dave McNally, a 20game winner the last four seasons, seems to be right back in his southpaw groove. Last night in Baltimore, McNally set down the Chicago White Sox on four hits in pitching the Orioles to a 30 decision.

title: Byrnes Statue Unveiled
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., May 2 (AP)A statue of the late James F. Byrnes was unveiled today and the former Secretary of State, Supreme Court Jus tice and assistant President was described as a mart for all offices, by Gen, Mark W. Clark.

title: Notes on People
description: It took my breath away, said Dr. Ren Dubos, the re tired Rockefeller University microbiologist, on learning he had won the first $50,000 Institute of Life prize for his work devoted to environ mental problems.

title: Laotian Gains Reported
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 2 (Agence FrancePresse)  With the upsurge of fighting in South Vietnam, a lull has fallen on the Laotian battlefronts, Amer ican military sources said to day, and Government forces have taken control of most of Route 13 linking Vientiane with the royal capital of Luang Prabng.

title: Economic Analysis
description: A new round in the peren nial battle between capitalists and Socialists has begun. The opening gong was sounded by the Penn Central bankruptcy, the Lockheed bailout, the I.T.T. consent decree that permitted it to acquire Hartford Fire Insurance, the scandals in urban housing. What all these cases have in common is that they involve busi ness  Government relations. In ef fect, corporate ex ecutives and Government offi cials have been charged with going into that noman'sland between their sectors and, like World War I antagonists, playing volleyball and ex changing money and pictures from home.

title: Halpern's Withdrawal Announced Officially
description: WASHINGTON, May 2  Representative Seymour Hal pern of Queens, the only Republican member of the House from New York City, officially announced today that he would not seek re election to an eighth term.

title: The Air War Over Indochina
description: WASHINGTONA substantial furor has been generated over the increase in American bombing in Indochina. But the bombing is simply the appro priate response to the blatant invasion of South Vietnam by the North Viet namese on March 30. This latest esca lation by the North Vietnamese is a major gamble in their strategy to dom inate Indochina, for they stand to lose much more than they could possibly gain.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MEDFORD, Mass., May 2 (AP)  The faculty of arts and sciences of Tufts University voted today, 49 to 32, to sus pend classes Thursday in sup port of the national mora torium against the Vietnam war.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Merger News
description: An agreement to merge Fan steel, Inc., into Gould, Inc., through an exchange of stock worth more than $27million was approved yesterday by Fansteel directors, subject to ratification by the Gould board and Fansteel shareholders.

title: F.D.A. CONDEMNS BARBITURATE ABUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) The Food and Drug Admin istration said today that it had asked drug makers to stop pro moting dangerous drugs for the relief of the minor, everyday tensions of life.

title: Tornadoes Strike 2 Areas In Western Part of State
description: Tornadoes swept through at least two western New York communities last night, causing damage to homes and barns and killing livestock. No human in juries were reported.

title: Tass Office Is Bombed
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) A smoke bomb was tossed today into the Washington of fice of Tass, the Soviet press agency, the police said. There were no injuries or damage.

title: COPYRIGHT PLEA OF C.B.S REJECTED
description: The Teleprompter Corpora tion, a major operator of cable television systems, won a de cision in Federal Court here yesterday against Columbia Broadcasting Systems, Inc., which had charged Teleprompt er with importing C.B.S. TV programs from outside its fran chise area without payment of copyright fees.

title: Big Redevelopment Plan For Piccadilly Is Offered
description: LONDON, May 2  Picca dilly Circus, the 19thcentury landmark that blends the faded sparkle of Broadway with the noisy throb of Fifth Avenue, is set for a huge face lift.

title: Story of Joe Gallo's Murder: 5 in Colombo Gang Implicated
description: An associate of the Mafia family of Joseph A. Colombo Sr. has turned himself in to the Federal Bureau of Investiga tion and said that he and four other men carried out the kill ing of Joseph Gallo on April 7, according to lawenforcement officials.

title: CARL J. NEUMANN
description: Carl J. Neumann, president of the C. J. Neumann Realty Corporation of Brooklyn, died yesterday at his home, 84 Brix ton Road, Garden City, L. I. He was 74 years old.

title: Jersey Town's Zoning Is Voided; Court Orders Housing for Poor
description: MOUNT LAUREL, N. J., May 2In what was regarded as a breakthrough for legal at tacks against exclusionary su burban zoning practices in the country, this Burlington County community in southern New Jersey was ordered today to provide for its present and fu ture housing needs for the poor.

title: Pension Fund Assailed
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (UPI) A Senate investigation of the pension fund for 12,000 hard coal miners has disclosed mis use of funds, conflict of inter est, payroll padding and alleged kickbacks, Senator Harrison A. Williams Jr., chairman of the Senate Labor Committee, said today.

title: Australia Beats Japan, 41
description: TOKYO, May 2 (AP)  Aus tralia won both singles matches today and defeated Japan, 41, in the Eastern Zone A Davis Cup tennis competition. The Aussies next play India in the zone final.

title: WOMEN ADMITTED TO LONDON BOARD
description: LONDON, May 2 (AP)The London Stock Exchange, an all male bastion for centuries, de cided today to let in women as members next year.

title: Moon Rocks Appear To Hold Great Promise
description: HOUSTON, May 2 (UPI) Geologists reported today, after quickly examining some of the Apollo 16 moon rock collection, that the astro nauts may have returned with a fantastically lucky cross section of the upper lunar crust, exceeding all expectations.

title: TWO PLEAD GUILTY IN HOUSING BRIBERY
description: NEWARK, May 2 (UPI)A former housing appraiser for the Federal Housing Authority pleaded guilty today for asking for and taking bribes to inflate his appraisals, and a Paterson real estate broker admitted he had submitted false documents to the F.H.A.

title: ExNazi Chief of Warsaw Goes on Trial in Hamburg
description: HAMBURG, West Germany, May 2 (AP)The former Nazi police chief of Warsaw went on trial today.

title: Canada Announces Plans To Curb Foreign Business
description: OTTAWA, May 2Canada announced her longawaited plans today to tighten controls over takeovers of Canadian businesses by foreign interests. Under proposed legislation, which is expected to pass, the Government would screen take overs involving Canadian busi nesses worth $250,000 or more and whose annual revenues exceeded $3million.

title: C.P.A. COUNCIL BACKS NEW STANDARDS UNIT
description: The governing body of the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants, as ex pected, approved yesterday a basic overhaul of the ma chinery through which account ing rules are determined.

title: Britons Are Indifferent to Ulster Crisis
description: BEDFORD, England, April 27 Even with London now ex ercising direct rule over North ern Ireland, most people in Britain show a surprising indif ference toward events in the troubled province.

title: Federal Aides Mediate Newark Housing Dispute
description: NEWARK, May 2 Federal officials moved today to medi ate a dispute between Mayor Kenneth A. Gibson and the Newark Housing Authority that threatens the survival of Fed erally financed urban renewal and housing programs.

title: Jockey Sidelined 6 Weeks
description: BALTIMORE, May 2 (AP) Vincent Bracciale Jr., the lead ing jockey at Pimlico Race Course, will be out of action at least six weeks after being thrown from his mount yester day, track officials announced today. The jockey suffered a broken rib and bruised spleen after his horse, Golden Rock, stepped on him.

title: John Attle Presents a Lively Program of Songs
description: Ever since New York lost the Blue Angel and Le Reuben Bleu, people have been prowling around town hoping to find an intimate room where the kind of performers who once ap peared in those memorable places could be seen and heard to advantage. The Blue Room Cabaret, which is built into the middle of the Mercer Arts Cen ter, 240 Mercer Street, is not quite like the Angel or Le Reu ben Blueit is not quite like anything elsebut it could serve the purpose.

title: Columbia Campus Quiet
description: The Columbia University campus was quiet yesterday while black and Latin students continued their occupation of Lewisohn Hall and an offcam pus brownstone on 115th Street owned by the university's Urban Center. A demonstration called by the Young Lords to show support for the demonstrators attracted only 25 people to a 1 P.M. rally at the sundial.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Bigtime drag racing comes to the metropolitan area this weekend with meets at Race way Park near Englishtown, N. J., and New York National Speedway at Center Moriches, L. I. As is customary in the East these days, the major interest will be in the funny cars, the wolves in sheeps' clothing that re semble conven tional muscle sedans. These 1,500horsepower monsters coverthe quartermile dash from a standing start in less than 7 seconds and at a terminal speed in the 200milesan hour bracket. To please all tastes, however, the pro grams will be filled out with dragsters, pro stock, super stock, roadsters, gas couples and altereds.

title: Son Ange's Nose Triumph Sets Off Dispute
description: A successful comeback effort in the feature event by Calu met's favored Son Ange  a nose  after a 10month lay off touched off a bit of extra curricular excitement at Aqueduct yesterday as some fans in the crowd of 20,414 questioned the stewards' offi cial finding.

title: Mrs. Robb Had Slated Interview With Hoover
description: WASHINGTON, May 2 (AP) Mrs. Charles S. Robb, daugh ter of former President Lyn don B. Johnson, had a 10:15 A.M. appointment today with J. Edgar Hoover for an inter view.

title: Man in the News
description: Erect and vigorouslooking, despite his 77 years, Jacob Samuel Potofsky stood yes terday before a microphone at a journalism award lunch eon in the Commodore Hotel and declared:

title: FASHION TALK
description: Seventh Avenue settled down to the monthlong business of introducing fall collections yesterday. Within the next few weeks, the shape of the clothes women will be wearing from September on will be settled. But already the major trends are estab lished. Designers are busily updating the classics, avoid ing the bizarre and think ing in terms of mixor match separates. And with the influx of French design ers who are having their styles manufactured here, Seventh Avenue is becoming as bilingual as, say, Montreal.

title: Advertising:
description: Two Grey executives have gone over to J. Walter Thompson to join their old boss and to run the new re search and planning depart ment.

title: Bruce Cabot, Film Actor, Dies; Played the Hero in King Kong
description: HOLLYWOOD, May 3 (AP) Bruce Cabot, whose starring role in the 1933 screen classic King Kong was his best known part during four decades of acting, died today at the age of 67. He succumbed to lung cancer at the Motion Picture Country Home and Hospital in Woodland Hills.

title: Royals' Owner Not Indicted Or Convicted for Conspiracy
description: A United Press International story carried in yesterday's New York Times incorrectly stated that Jeremy Jacobs, owner of the Cincinnati Royals of the National Basketball As sociation, had been convicted by a Federal jury in Los An geles for conspiracy in a Las Vegas hotel transaction.

title: Books of The Times
description: NUNAGA: Ten Years of Eskimo Life. By Duncan Pryda. 285 pages. Illustrated. Walker. $7.95.

title: Hoover Lies in State in Capitol
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 The body of J. Edgar Hoover, an almost mythical American who inspired both dread and veneration in his lifetime, was carried through the rain today, to lie in state at the Capitol.

title: At 77, She's Made It to the Whitney
description: Who would have ever dreamed that somebody like me would make it to the Whitney in New York? I'm a 77yearold Negro woman, after all, who was born in Columbus, Georgia. But Alma Thomas has made it to the Whitney Museum, where she is being honored with an exhibition of her lively and colorful abstract paintings, and she has made it to other places as well.

title: Earl Warren Honored In Award at Brandeis
description: WALTHAM, Mass., May 3 (AP)  Former Chief Justice Earl Warren today became the first recipient of Brandeis University's Samuel C. and Minna Dretzin Prize. To com memorate the occasion, Mr. Warren was asked to plant a willow tree on the campus.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: $130,000 Awarded to Pilot For Libel in Hochhuth Play
description: LONDON, May 3Rolf Hoch huth, the West German play wright, was ordered today to pay $130,000 in damages for having suggested in his play Soldiers that Winston Church ill had ordered Gen. Wladi slaw Sikorski, the Polish leader in World War II, to be killed.

title: Bridge: Solving Playing Puzzle Is Step on Victory Road
description: The biggest team event ever played in the New York metropolitan area was con ducted Sunday at Roosevelt Raceway, Westbury, L. I., where 192 teams showed up for the twosession Swiss event. This format has proved attractive for lesser teams who do not hope to win, since they can win master points for each winning match, and exciting for the experts, since a decisive en counter between the leading teams in the last round near ly always develops.

title: Albany Bill Asks Nonpublic School Aid
description: ALBANY, May 3The Senate, trying for the third consecutive year to find a constitutional way for the state to help fi nance parochialschool educa tion, voted today to provide $33million in state aid for nonpublic schools.

title: Food in Moscow Improving, Two Students Report
600 at Dedication of Eleanor Roosevelt Wings for F.D.R. Library
description: HYDE PARK, N. Y., May 3 Ten years after the death of Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt, two additions to the Franklin D. Roosevelt Library were dedicated here today in her honor.

title: Hoover Freedom Award Set Up by Boys' Clubs
description: The Boys' Clubs of America announced yesterday the es tablishment of a J. Edgar Hoover Freedom Award to perpetuate the late F.B.I. di rector's memory and his in spiration to millions of Amer ican boys.

title: ABRAMS REPORTS ON DANGER AREA
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  Gen. Creighton W. Abrams, the cortunander of United States forces in South Vietnam, is re ported to have advised Wash ington that the most critical military situation was develop ing in the central region, where three enemy divisions are said to be trying to cut the country in two.

title: WILLIAM GROSVENOR, HEADED COTTON MILL
description: NEWPORT, R. I., May 3  William Grosvenor, former president of Grosvenor Dale Company, one of New Eng land's largest cotton mills, died at his home, Hilltop, here last night. He was 85 years old.

title: Networks Said to Keep Escape Plane Near Hue
description: The three major broadcast networks have reportedly chartered a plane as an escape vehicle for their news crews in Hue, South Viet nam.

title: Lakers Beat Knicks, 10796, and Lead Final, 21
description: The Los Angeles Lakers, in the National Basketball Associ ation championship round for the eighth time in the last 11 years, moved closer to their first N.B.A. title last night by beating the New York Knicks, 10796, at Madison Square Gar den.

title: Rescuers Strive to Save 58 Trapped by Fire Deep in Silver Mine
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, May 3 Rescuers continued to battle today a smoky, choking fire that had trapped 82 men deep beneath the surface of the country's largest silver mine.

title: Lockheed Gets Big Contract
description: The Lockheed Aircraft Cor poration announced yesterday that it had been awarded a $120,833,943 fixedprice incen tive contract for production models of the S3A Viking anti submarine warfare aircraft by the United States Navy. A spokesman said seven of the aircraft would be delivered in 1973 and the remaining six in the first quarter of 1974.

title: BOARD OF EDUCATION RESTORES PRINCIPAL
description: The city Board of Education, overruling School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner, has rein stated a controversial junior high school principal who was denied tenure by Community School Board 3 and removed from office in late 1970.

title: Dow Chemical
description: C. B. Branch, president of the Dow Chemical Company, told the annual meeting in Mid land, Mich., that company earn ings this year were expected to increase by 15 per cent, from a net of $154.7million, or $3.41 a share in 1971.

title: Frederick Douglass Program
description: The Negro Ensemble Com pany will present as its final show of the season a program entitled, Frederick Douglass. ...Through His Own Words, at the St. Mark's Playhouse, 133 Second Avenue, Tuesday. It will run through June 4. Douglas Turner Ward, Adolph Caesar and Duane. Jones will appear in the program.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 3The City Council of Miami Beach extended a formal invitation to the Republican party today to hold its national convention here starting Aug. 21.

title: Drug Bureau Chief Names New Unit To Find Source of Illegal Barbiturates
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  John John E. Ingersoll, director of the Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs, has formed special secobarbital intelligence force to track down a gigantic operation in the CaliforniaMex ico border area that he says is flooding the country with the drug.

title: IN THE NATION
description: President Nixon did the wise thing imAppointing an interim director of the F.B.I. immediately after the death of J. Edgar Hoover. Not only does the White House announcement that As sistant Attorney General Gray would serve at least until the November elec tion suggest that ample time will be taken in the selection of a successor; it also makes clear that if Mr. Nixon should be defeated in November, the choicewould be left to the new Presi dent.

title: Castro Begins 2Month Visit To Africa and East Europe
description: MIAMI, May 3 (AP)Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba began a ninenation tour of African and East European countries today. The Cuban leader is scheduled to spend six or seven days in each place, with a longer stay in the Soviet Union.

title: Kaiser Industries
description: Kaiser Industries Corporation expects its 1972 earnings to be somewhat lower than the $14.6million, or 50 cents a share earned In 1971 before a $9.3million extraordinary charge, Edgar Kaiser, chairman, told yesterday's annual meet ing at Oakland, Calif.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: CROTON  ON  HUDSON, N. Y.Two days of striped bass angling on the Croton and Hudson Rivers, yielded, it is somewhat embarrassing to disclose, only one under sized fish.

title: Demonstration Outside
description: RICHMOND, May 3  With mountain people demonstrating outside the doors and several minor stockholders voicing con cern from within, the Pittston Company held its annual stock holders' meeting here today.

title: COTTON FUTURES SHOW PRICE DROP
description: Cotton futures No. 2 closed $1 a bale higher to 75 cents lower yesterday on the New York Cotton Exchange. Only the nearby May contracts showed a gain for the day, clos ing at 42.90 cents a pound, up from 42.70 cents on Tuesday.

title: Inquiry Is Set on Neighborhood Unit
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that the city would investigate allegations of pro cedural improprieties in the Office of Neighborhood Govern ment, whose director has taken a leave of absence pending the investigation.

title: Man in the News
description: Jerry Finkelstein sat over lunch at the Twenty One Club yesterday wondering why Governor Rockefeller had named him to the Port of New York Authority. He readily admitted that he knew almost nothing about the vast bistate agency and that he had little more than a waving ac quaintance with some of the other Commis sioners. What is more, he added, his contacts with the Gov ernor, whom he labored to defeat two years ago, have centered on their mutual in terest in the narcotics prob lem.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 3  A large turnout of black voters in Indianapolis and Gary helped Senator Hubert H. Humphrey defeat Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama in yesterday's In diana Presidential primary.

title: Seymour Proposes New Plan for Addicts
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 Federal prosecutors of the Southern and Eastern Districts of New York and White House drugabuse prevention officials took the first steps here today to put into effect a plan to offer treatment or methadone maintenance to every addict defendant arrested in the South ern and Eastern Districts of New York.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: NASHVILLE, May 3Gov. George C. Wallace, glowing with optimism over his prospects in Tennessee's Presidential pri mary tomorrow, told state Dem ocratic leaders today that the party was in for tough sled ding if he does not receive delegate votes to which he is entitled.

title: Broadway and Prudential Planning Merger of Banks
description: The Broadway Savings Bank and the Prudential Savings Bank, both based in Manhhat tan, confirmed yesterday that they are planning to merge, subject to approval of Federaland state regulatory authori ties. The combined bank would have assets of roughly $600million, and 10 offices, plus two more branches that have been authorized but are as yet unopened.

title: ANNINA CELLI SHOWS DEVOTION TO OPERA
description: Annina Celli, a mezzoso prano from New York who has studied and sung in Germany, gave a recital at Carnegie Re cital Hall on Tuesday night with David Garvey as her piano accompanist.

title: Deception in Albany
description: The Legislature did its deceptive best to create the impression that its new public housing bill aims at speeding construction and saving money. In fact, the measure will delay construction, or block it altogether. This may reduce spending, but at the cost of worsening the city's public housing situationalready a disaster.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Rogers Arrives in London
description: LONDON, May 3 (UPI)Sec retary of State Rogers arrived in London tonight from Iceland for talks with British leaders.

title: New Bid to Save Dam
description: CIAREMONT, N. H., May 3 (AP)A city reservoir was drained today to release pres sure against the temporarily shoredup Whitewater Dam that seemed about to crumble Monday.

title: Idaho Mine Had. Failed to Correct Safety Hazards Found by Federal Inspectors
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Re peated failures by the Sunshine Mine in Idaho to correct safety hazards within time limits set by Federal inspectors were dis closed today in reports to the Bureau of Mines. More than a score of miners were killed in a fire at the mine yesterday.

title: Dance: Royal Ballet Presents Its New Swan Lake
description: The Royal Ballet's new production of Swan Lake, seen for the first time in America at the Metropolitan Opera House on Tuesday night, is not really new but old. Let me not confuse the issue. Swan Lake has been in the repertory of the Royal Ballet almost since its for mation. In 1934 Nicolai Ser geyev, the Russian ballet master, reproduced the au thentic Russian version with the 1895 choreography of Petipa and Ivanov.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 2d Quarter Net Higher
description: American Brands, Inc. force cast for 1972 record results for the ninth successive year at yesterday's twohour annual meeting in the grand ballroom of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel attended by some 900 stock holders.

title: Political Unknowns Victorious In the Arab West Bank Election
description: TEL AVIV, May 3Local elections in the Israelioccupied West Bank of the Jordan River yesterday went against the Arab incumbents.

title: Veterans' Parade Canceled
description: CINCINNATI, May 3 (AP) A lack of interest by veterans' groups has been cited as a reason for the cancellation of the 104th annual Memorial Day Parade in Cincinnati. All wehad in the parade last year was the mayor and about 30 peo ple, Otis Writer, president of the Memorial Day Parade As sociation, said today. He said that many veterans groups planned to hold parades in suburban areas.

title: NEW CHARGES MADE OF FRAUD IN U.S.O.
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (UPI) Representative Les Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, re leased new charges today of wrongdoing by United Service Organizations personnel in South Vietnam, which he said might link the organization's executive director with a ma jor multimillion dollar scandal involving the cheating of our G.I.'s in Vietnam.

title: Merger of A.B.A., N.B.A. Is Called Aid to Monopoly
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Vig orous attacks from three direc tions were made today on the bill that would permit the American and National Basket ball Associations to merge.

title: 15 to 20 More Policemen Facing Charges in Brooklyn Bribery Case
description: Serious departmental charges are expected to be brought against 15 to 20 more police men in connection with the in dictment Tuesday of 24 police men accused of accepting a quarter of a million dollars a year in payoffs from Brooklyn gamblers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Notes on People
description: Howard R. Leary, who re signed as New York's Police Commissioner two years ago, will become a professor of crimdnal justice at Trenton State College in September. Mr. Leary, who was Police Commissioner in Philadelphia before taking his post here, has been a vice president of Abraham & Strauss and pres ident of Holmes Protection lbw., since he left the commis sioners job. He resigned from Holmes several months ago.

title: Roundup: Pirates Defeat Astros, End Loss Streak
description: The world champion Pitts burgh Pirates broke a six game losing streak by beat ing the Houston Astros, 32, last night behind the com bined sixhit pitching of Dock Ellis and Bruce Kison.

title: Groucho, at 81, Discusses Favorite Topic: Women
description: Groucho Marx, opponent of women's lib incarnate and in person, slipped into New York this week.

title: LUCIE NOEL, 72, FASHION WRITER
description: PARIS, May 3  Lucie Noel, who for over four decades re ported to American readers on French fashions, died at the suburban American Hospital last Saturday after a long ill ness. She was 72 years old.

title: CUNNINGHAM WINS LINDSAY'S PRAISE
description: Risking the wrath of Reform Democrats, Mayor Lindsay praised Patrick P. Cunningham, the Bronx Democratic leader, last night as my kind of politician.

title: Control Data
description: William C. Norris, chairman of the Control Data Corporation told the annual meeting yes terday in St. Paul, Minn., that the company might pay a stock dividend of about 5 per cent later in the year. He said that the company's cash require ments precluded payment of a cash dividend at this time.

title: JOSEPH DAVIS
description: BUFFALO, May 3 (AP) Joseph Davis, chairman of the Niagara Frontier State Parks Commission since 1948, died today in Buffalo General Hos pital. He was 77 years old.

title: SEVEN ARE WOUNDED BY ULSTER GUNFIRE
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 3 (AP)  Seven persons were wounded by gunfire in Northern Ireland today, the au thorities reported.

title: 42 SENIORS AWARDED MERIT SCHOLARSHIPS
description: Fortytwo seniors in New York State high schools have been selected for National Merit scholarships given by the colleges they will attend, the National Merit Scholarship Cor poration announced yesterday. Half of the 42 are from New York City and Westchester, Rockland, Nassau and Suffolk Counties.

title: Warrants for Hughes Aides Quashed by Canadian Judge
description: MONTREAL, May 3 (AP) A municipal court judge today quashed warrants issued for the arrest of two Americans, one described as a top aide to Howard R. Hughes, the United States billionaire. In the ruling, the judge also ordered an in vestigation to determine wheth er grounds exist to issue new warrants against the two.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of 665,761 shares of Global Marine, Inc., common stock at $20.75 per share was announced yester day by White, Weld & Co., Inc., manager of the underwriting group. All of the shares offered are being sold for the accounts of certain selling stockholders. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Ex change, closed yesterday at 20, down .

title: Iceland Officials Assure Rogers They Do Not Seek U.S. Pullout
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland, May 3 Iceland assured Secretary of State William P. Rogers today that her Government had no plans to press for a withdrawal of American Naval and Air Force personnel from Iceland.

title: Executive Changes
description: Pinkerton's, Inc., has promoted Richard W. Ernst to vice presidenttreasurer and elected him to the board of the large private security concern.

title: Congress Votes $115Million To Curb Sickle Cell Anemia
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (UPI) The House passed and sent to President Nixon today legis lation authorizing $115million for a threeyear effort to curb sickle cell anemia, a blood dis ease that afflicts one of every 10 black Americans.

title: News of Dogs
description: An English springer span iel appeared at the Manhat tan Savings Bank, Madison Avenue and 47th Street, yes terday and drew 100 per cent interest from the spectators, many of whom had come in to make deposits at the con ventional 5 per cent.

title: SCRIBNER TO ACT IN WRIGHT CASE
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner plans to look into charges that Assemblyman Sam uel D. Wright has misspent community education funds in the Ocean HillBrownsville sec tion of Brooklyn and abused, his powers as president of Com munity School Board 23 to re ward political supporters.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 3John Con nally, had a big barbecue at his Texas ranch the other day. The President came. So did a number of guests powerful Texans, The New York Times called them; the kind of people who fly around in private jets, accord ing to The Washington Post.

title: Kin Shy Away From Kidney Donations
description: DALLAS, May 3for weeks after John's doctor told him that his life depended on a kidney transplant and that the best chance of success was with a kidney donated by a close relative, John could not bring himself to ask for a volunteer.

title: MUSEUM WEIGHS STAFF CUTBACKS
description: Because it cannot meet its payroll, the Metropolitan Mu seum of Art is considering lay ing off at least 65 and pos sibly more of its staff mem bers in the budget area not covered by city funds.

title: CHURCH OF ENGLAND BARS MERGER PLAN
description: LONDON, May 3The Church of England rejected today for the second time in three years reunification with the Metho dist Church.

title: SAMUEL DININ DIES; FILM PHOTOGRAPHER
description: Samuel Dinin, a motion picture, photographer, died yes terday in Queens General Hos pital, after a brief illness. He was 58 years old and lived at 8520 Kingston Place, Jamaica Estates, Queens.

title: Washington,: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT

title: British Night Patrols Mocked in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ire land  At night squads of British soldiers  faces and hands blackened so they cannot easily be seen patrol the Roman Catholic areas of Belfast where they are most despised.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 3. A sudden flood of large contri butions is irrigating Senator George McGovern's Presiden tial campaign, which survived largely on a trickle of $10 and $20 contributions until his first primary victory in Wisconsin a month ago.

title: U.S. DENIES RUMOR OF PEACE ACCORD
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Re ports that the United States and North Vietnam were ap proaching agreement on broad peace settlement circu lated throughout world capitals today but drew strenuous denials from the Nixon Admin istration.

title: Soviet Development Submerges a Siberian Culture
description: YAKUTSK, U.S.S.R.Before the Soviet Communists reached out to embrace the vast Si berian back yard known as Yakutia, the only Russians here were political exiles, mission aries of the Russian Orthodox Church and a few hardy schol ars interested in studying near Arctic conditions.

title: Consumers' Credit Climbs
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Con sumer installment credit rose by record amount in March, the Federal Reserve Board re ported today.

title: May 4, 1970
description: PITTSBURGHIn the afternoon of May 4, 1970, my wife and I learned, through telephone calls and radio newscasts, that our daugh ter Allison had been killed at Kent State University. Several hours later we arrived at the hospital in Ravenna, Ohio, to Witness a scene of military activity in the town which recalled for me similar scenes from the last months of the war in France and Germany.

title: It's Everyone for 1 Himself As Troops Rampage in Hue
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 3The fabric of Hue is dis integrating today, with at least 150,000 panicstricken people fleeing south on foot, by truck and in flotillas of leaking sampans as the North Vietnamese push ever closer.

title: Rain Puts Off Pinehurst Golf
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 3 (AP)Heavy rain forced post ponement today of the third and fourth rounds of the North and South men's amateur golf tournament. The 32 players in the match play event will start tomorrow with the same scores and positions they held when the rains came.

title: Best Second Period Is Recorded Since 65 on $6.3Million Profit
description: DETROIT, May 3The Amer ican Motors Corporation today reported March quarter profits of $6.3million, or 23 cents a share.

title: SILENCE BACKED ON PENTAGON CASE
description: BOSTON, May 3The United States Court of Appeals for the First Circuit barred a Fed eral grand jury today from asking a key witness in the Pentagon Papers case to dis close his opinion about who possessed the secret war study before its unauthorized pub lication last June.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: HOME STUDY PLAN SET FOR RUTGERS
description: Rutgers University and three other American institutions of higher education will take part in a oneyeartrial of materials used by Britain's Open Uni versity, which offers work at the college level to students in their homes.

title: Botany Problems Are Long and Diverse
description: When Botany Industries, Inc., filed for reorganization last week under Chapter XI of the Bankrupcty Act, shock waves were felt throughout the men's apparel industry.

title: 1968 HERO SENT IN
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, May 4  President Nguyen Van Thieu ordered a shakeup in the army command last night in the rake of the loss of South Vietnam's north ernmost province, Quangtri, to the North Vietnamese.

title: Head of House Unit Bids Nixon Delay Secrecy Rule
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP) The head of a House sub committee investigating Gov einment secrecy asked Presi dent Nixon today to postpone indefinitely the June 1 effec tive date of a new Executive order on the classification of documents.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Rudi Gernreich upheld the honor of American design, Christian Aujard showed how they do things in Paris and Deanna Littell straddled the issue as fall fashion openings continued on Seventh Avenue.

title: Sharp Profits Rise In Quarter Posted By CNA Financial
Roche's Shooting Lift Nets' Chances Against Squires Tonight
description: John Roche, whose long hair flipflops in Pete Maravich fashion, and whose reputation was that of a brawling tough kid from New York's East Side, has passed the playoff test.

title: Move Welcomed in U.S. By BRENDAN JONES
description: The Canadian Government's plans for tightening controls over the acquisition of Cana dian businesses by foreign com panies were termed rather mild yesterday by business and financial executives here.

title: PRICE MARKS SET IN GOLD TRADING
description: LONDON, May 3for the fourth day, gold was traded here today at record prices of more than $50 an ounce, with indications that the high prices may themselves be driving the price even higher.

title: A New Role in Military Open to French Women
description: PARIS, May 3 (Reuters) French women joined the armed forces for a new form of national service today but it was not for the pay.

title: Sales of Savings Bonds Slackened During April
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP)  Sales of United States savings bonds slackened in April, but sales still exceeded redemptions by $162million, the Treasury Department said today.

title: Chess: Success of Young Players Sparks Italian Renaissance
description: For a country with little chess tradition to develop an important program of chess activity at any level it is usu ally necessary that there be one or two strong players around first. Some foreign players of repute may, for one reason or other, decide to settle there, and thus stimulate the local players to improve their game, or one or two nativeborn players may overcome the consider able handicap imposed by the lack of readily available com petition and rise to eminence in international play, thus in spiring some of their coun trymen to try to do likewise.

title: Deathtraps in the Sky
description: The steampipe explosion which killed seven persons in a financial district skyscraper yesterday indicates that the city's new fire safety code for highrise office building needs broadening even before its adoption by the City Council.

title: Suspect in Slaying Of Policeman Faces A Death Penalty
description: A 21yearold man who was found guilty Tuesday night of stabbing to death a policeman in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn will receive a hearing May 8 on a possible death pen alty.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BELFAST, May 3 (UPI)A bomb exploded in the center of Belfast today, blowing in the front of a flour mill and smashing windows over a two block area, but causing no casualties.

title: A Soldier's Code
description: WEST POINT, N. Y.  Lucian K. Trugcott 3d said, on the OpEd page Feb. 4: A West Point classmate and a friend of mine, recently promoted to brigadier general, admitted to me that he found he had to be dishonest to do well as a battalion commander in Vietnam.... He had to be cor rupt....

title: Big Board Sells Seat
description: The New York Stock Ex change said yesterday, it sold a membership for $230,000, un changed from the last preced ing sale on April 25. The cur rent market is $210,000 bid, $245,000 offered.

title: Shooting of Offenders Is Authorized by Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 3 (Agence FrancePress) President Nguyen Van Thieu warned today that ci vilian and military authori ties had the right to shoot troublemakers on the spot.

title: ASTRONAUT HAILS CREWS ON GROUND
description: HOUSTON, May 3 (UPI)  Capt. John W. Young of Navy said today that the Apollo 16 flight to the moon, which he commanded, had been cliff hanger saved only the superb performance engineers on earth.

title: Pirates Release Veale
description: PITTSBURGH, May 3 (AP) The Pittsburgh Pirates gave Bob Veale his outright release tonight and replaced infielder Bill Mazeroski on the roster. The 37yearold Veale was a starting pitcher for seven con secutive years until last sea son when he became a re liever.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Thursday, May 4Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota ap peared early today to have squeezed out a narrow victory over Senator George McGovern of South Dakota in Ohio's Dem ocratic Presidential primary.

title: What She Was Herself
description: CONWAY, Mass.For many years after she died Eleanor Roosevelt was still here in time with the rest of us more here, it sometimes seemed, than we were. But years pass even for the most living of the dead and sooner or later they too drop back into that distance we call history. The scholarly rites are performed, the let ters, records, photographs, memora bilia, are collected and arranged. And there is a second parting.

title: 1,000 Quakers in Capital stage vigil Against War
description: WASHINGTON, May 3Lin ing Pennsylvania Avenue for three blocks in front of the White House, about 1,000 Quakers held a silent vigil, against the Vietnam war this afternoon.

title: JAME'S PRIDE FINALLY ARRIVES
description: YONKERS, May 3  Jamele's Pride, a 5yearold trotter, and Jim Tallman, a 30 yearold driver, are enjoying the best starts of their careers in harness racing.

title: King's Death Called Accident
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 3Burundi's delegate, Nsanze Terence, said today that his country's deposed King Ntare had been killed ac cidentally last week when he was caught in crossfire be tween Burundian soldiers who were holding him in protec tive custody and plotters try ing to rescue him as part of a political coup.

title: Columbia Quiet as Classes Are Held in Hamilton Hall
description: Columbia University's cam pus remained quiet yesterday as classes were held in Hamil ton Hall for the first time in eight days. Antiwar protesters occupied the building until early last Monday, when it was cleared of demonstrators by campus police.

title: Rubinstein to Play Pippin
description: John Rubinstein, the son of Artur Rubinstein, has been selected to play the title role in the forthcoming new musi cal, The Adventures of Pip pin, scheduled to open on Broadway Oct. 29. Mr. Rubin stein was chosen from among more than 500 candidates. He has appeared in a number of films and on television. He also has acted at the Mark Taper Forum in Los Angeles and in touring musicals.

title: BERRIGAN REQUEST ON WIRETAPS FAILS
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 3 (UPI)A Federal district judge ruled today that attorneys for the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan could not see secret Govern ment wiretapping files but he agreed to hear more defense ar guments on electronic surveil lance May 15.

title: LI High School Senior Elected School Trustee
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 3 Thomas DiNapoli, an 18year old Mineola High School senior, defeated Bernard Zinober, school trustee, by a vote of 712 to 571 today.

title: Mayor Indicates He. Is Willing To Compromise on Forest Hills
description: Mayor Lindsay indicated for the first time yesterday that he would be willing to com promise on the Forest Hills housing controversy if the scattersite project plan was resubmitted to the Board of Estimate.

title: Advertising:
description: Are you beginning to won der why it is that with so many advertising people coming up with ideas to make things better, things aren't better?

title: City Ballet Stages Three Works In Opening Its Spring Season
description: The highlight of the New York City Ballet's spring sea son will be its extraordinary tribute to Igor Stravinsky from June 18 through June 25. Tues day night, the company opened up shop at the State Theater more quietly with three ballets from the repertory.

title: Outlook Dims for Bonn Accord on Pacts
description: BONN, May 3Prospects for a parliamentary compromise leading to ratification of West Germany's disputed treaties with the Soviet bloc took a turn for the worse today as opposition leaders raised new demands on the Government of Chancellor Willy Brandt.

title: Personal Finance: FairCredit Billing
description: Ironically, the father of the new Fair Credit Billing Act passed by the Senate has disavowed his child as a weakling. Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wis consin, asked that his name he removed from the bill and he cited a half dozen dele tions as a reason.

title: SOVIET MAY ENTER MONETARY TALKS
description: PARIS, May 3  Qualified diplomats and international monetary specialists in Paris believe the Soviet Union is preparing to raise the possi bility of its participation in a new world monetary and trad ing system, when President Nixon visits Moscow later this month.

title: Ecuador Seizes U.S. Boat
description: QUITO, Ecuador, May 3 (UPI) The Ecuadorean Navy re ported today the seizure of a United States tuna boat, the City of Lisbon, allegedly for fishing in territorial waters. Ecuador claims a 200mile limit. The United States recog nizes only a 12mile fishing limit. Last year, Ecuador seized more than 50 American tuna boats and they paid about $2 million in fines and license fees. Today's was the first seizure in over two months.

title: A Portrait Gallery Recalls the Presidential Losers
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  Who remembers Charles Cotesworth Pinckney, Rufus King, William Wirt, Belva Ann Lockwood, Victoria Claf lin Woodhull and Horatio Sey mour? The National Portrait Gallery does.

title: Sports of The Times
description: On May 23 last year the spectacular Vida Blue had just won his 10th consecutive game and was rocketing along to a season of impressive accomplishment. On the corresponding date this season it is virtually certain that Vida's victory total will amount to zero. The gifted young lefthander with the extraordinary skills has finally ended his long holdout battle with the hardheaded Charles O. (for Owner) Finley and the severity of the damage has yet to be estimated. His absence from the pitching mound forfive or six weeks has to bruise and hurt a lot of people, including Vida.

title: Times's Pulitzer Prize Is Criticized by Agnew
description: CHARLESTON, S. C., May 3 Vice President Agnew said in Charleston today that the Pulitzer award to The New York Times for the theft of Government documents de means the Pulitzer Prize.

title: CANTORS PRESENT LITURGY CONCERT
description: The American Conference of Cantors, which represents Re form Judaism, believes that Jewish liturgical music deserves a wider audience than it gets at the services in temples. Last spring it presented a concert in Tully Hall. On Tuesday night it took an ecumenical direction by offering a similar program in All Saints Church. The event benefited the International Jewish Music Library at Lin coln Center.

title: DeBusschere Finds Motions Are Limited
description: I felt I wasn't helping the team, said Dave DeBus schere of the Knicks, in ex planation of his sitting on the bench for the entire sec ond half in New York's play off loss to the Lakers last night at Madison Square Gar den.

title: 2 Are Found Guilty In L.I Murder Plot
description: MINEOLA, L. I. May 3A former principal of a public school in Brooklyn and one of his fourthgrade teachers were convicted today of conspiring to murder the principal's wife in August, 1970.

title: Royal Ballet Dancers Step Gingerly Around the City
description: The dancers were rehears ing Swan Lake, which they do not like to do because they have done it so often be fore, and a man was calling out: We'll have the ups and downs. Are you ready? There was the slap of many slippered feet, and then up and down, up and down, the girls of the Royal Ballet were swan maidens.

title: Humphrey Chief Gainer In 4 Races for Delegates
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Thursday, May 4Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota won the most delegates in the four Presidential primaries Tuesday, late returns indicated this morning. He also ap peared to have won the close ly fought Ohio contest, the centerpiece in the day's events.

title: REYKJAVIK AWARDED TITLE CHESS SERIES
description: It was Bobby Fischer's move yesterday in the preliminaries for the world chess champion shipand the American chal lenger remained incommunica do on the latest proposal to hold his matches with Boris Spassky of the Soviet Union in Reykjavik. Iceland, starting July 2.

title: Divided Democrats
description: For many months, it was the hope of some starryeyed Democrats that their party would settle early upon one strong contender for the Presidency, thereby avoiding the bitterness of a protracted struggle for the nomination and saving money and energy for the main battle against Mr. Nixon. But the smooth logical resolution of its prob lems is not the Democratic party way, and could hardly be expected from such a complex heterogeneous coalition.

title: 7 Die in SteamPipe Blast In Wall St. Area Building
description: Seven persons were killed yesterday when a highpressure steam riser pipe exploded in the 36thfloor offices of General Public Utilities Corporation at 80 Pine Street, a 12yearold building in the heart of the fi nancial district.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: ATLANTA, May 3 (UPI) Representative Patsy Mink of Hawaii, a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomi nation, charged last night that United States foreign policy was influenced by a smug sense of superior ity.

title: Red Cross Urges Curbs on Bombing
description: GENEVA, May 3The all Swiss International Committee of the Red Cross proposed to day that severe restrictions on the bombardment of civilians be added to the four Geneva conventions of 1949 for the protection of war victims.

title: $2.9Billion DayCare Bill Approved by Senate Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP) The Senate Labor Committee approved today a $2.95billion child development bill that would set up a huge Federal daycare program.

title: TRIAL OPENS HERE IN KLIEGER CASE
description: Civil Court Judge Bernard Klieger of Brooklyn went on trial in Federal Court here yes terday on charges of perjury and conspiracy involving politi cal contributions to the 1965 mayoral campaign of City Con troller Abraham D. Beanie.

title: BUSING BAN GOES TO ROCKEFELLER
description: ALBANY, May 3The Senate voted final approval by a wide margin tonight of a bill to im pose a moratorium on the com pulsory assignment of school children for the sake of racial balance.

title: U.S. HOUSING PLAN SAID TO BE ABUSED
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  A New York banker told a Senate subcommittee today that a large mortgage concern active in placing federally ?? loans on homes bought by low income families in Brooklyn and Queens was staffed with employes engaged in a variety of conflictofinterest deals with realestate brokers.

title: PRICES OFF AGAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: There was another drop in prices of stocks on the Ameri can Stock Exchange yesterday, taking the index down 14 points to 27.49. Most of the declines were fractional but they in volved a broad spectrum of is sues.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Assembly Approves Bill To Set Up Drug Controls
description: ALBANY, May 3The As seinbly today passed a bill establishing strict controls over the manufacture and distribu tion of amphetamines, barbitu rates, narcotics and other dan gerous drugs. It, would also require doctors to issue pre scriptions for dangerous drugs in triplicate, with one copy go ing to the state for availability to check on abusers.

title: Brazilian, 23, in Hiding Alter Winning $2Million
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 3 A 23yearold Brazilian tex tilefactory worker who won the world's biggest soccer pool prize this week still had not emerged from hiding to day.

title: Zaire Says Troops Will Help Burundi Put Down Disorders
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 3 (Reuters)The Government an nounced today it was sending troops to neighboring Burundi at the invitation of President Michel Micombero to help sta bilize the central African coun try.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WorkRelief Law Is Found To Have Only Slight Effect
description: A joint stateFederal study issued yesterday indicated that the effect on the state's mas sive welfare rolls of last year's new workrelief requirements Was slight and that a far smaller percentage of employ ables were on relief than had previously been estimated.

title: Mets Defeat Giants, 8 to 5, To Sweep 3Game Series
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 3 Not even the return of Willie Mays to the lineup could spare the San Francisco Giants from dropping their third straight decision to the New York Mets today, an 85 defeat that marked the Giants' 11th loss in their last 13 starts.

title: Los Angeles Official Says City May Close Its Airport
description: LOS ANGELES, May 3 (UPI) The Los Angeles Interna tional Airport may have to be closed because of a ruling by the State Supreme Court, City Attorney Roger Arnebergh said yesterday.

title: Rangers Believe It's Their Turn Tonight
description: If there is any justice, the Rangers will win tomorrow, said Emile Francis yesterday.

title: General Dynamics
description: CLAYTON, Mo., May 3 (AP) General Dynamics Corporation today reported its fifth con secutive profitable quarter at an annual meeting of share holders here.

title: TakeOvers in Canada
description: Canada has projected a surprisingly modest first step toward greater control of its own economy by means of Government procedures for screening foreign bids to take over Canadian businesses. The limited nature of the move reflects Canada's sharp debate about foreign invest ment and the Liberal Government's cautious approach to legislation on this subject.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Sid Davidoff, who resigned as a $30,000ayear ad ministrative assistant to Mayor Lindsay last December to work for the Lindsay 72 Committee in the Mayor's bid for the Presidency, is rejoining the City Hall staff.

title: Rain Prevents Yank Game Against Ryan and Angels
description: Rain washed out yesterday's game between the California Angels and the Yankees and spoiled an outing for about 7,000 New Jersey school safety, patrols.

title: Queens Study Finds Disparities In Prices of Prescription Drugs
description: A survey of Queens pharma cists by 50 St. John's Uni versity students shows a wide range in prices for the same prescription drugs, with the prices much higher in poorer areas than in middleincome or highincome neighborhoods.

title: NIXON NAMES AIDE AS CHIEF OF F.B.I UNTIL ELECTIONS
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  President Nixon today ap pointed L. Patrick Gray 3d, an Assistant Attorney General and longtime personal friend, as acting director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation.

title: CONFESSION GIVEN IN YABLONSKI CASE
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., May 3 Silous Huddleston, a Tennes see local president of the United Mine Workers of Amer ica, confessed today that he had directed, and handled the payoff for, the murder of Joseph A. Yablonksi with what I believe was union money.

title: Virgin Islands Bill Voted
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (AP) The Senate passed today a bill to reduce the minimum age for membership in the Virgin Islands Legislature to 21 years from 25. The bill by Senator Quentin N. Burdick. Democrat of North Dakota, wass substi tuted for a Housepassed bill to let the Legislature fix the minimum age. The bill now goes back to the House.

title: INQUIRY IN UGANDA TOLD OF DEATHS
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, May 3 (Reuters)A commission of in quiry received testimony from a Uganda Army deserter here today that he had helped to dispose of the bodies of two Americans allegedly killed by troops in southwest Uganda last summer.

title: Pnompenh Roads Opened
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 3 (Agence FrancePresse) Government forces have re opened two major roads into Pnompenh in the past 24 hours, ending the capital's weeklong state of virtual isolation.

title: Faint Praise in Ottawa
description: OTTAWA, May 3Most business leaders, including heads of United Statescon trolled branch establishments, reacted favorably today to the Federal Government's propos als to oversee future foreign takeovers of sizable Canadian business.

title: U.S. Reported to Apologize For Bombing of Tass Office
description: MOSCOW, May 3 (UPI)The Soviet Union has protested to the United States over yester day's firebombing of the Tass press agency's office in Wash ington and has received an apology, Tass said today.

title: DAVIS TRIAL TOLD OF BORROWED CAR
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 3 The Aagela Davis murdercon spiracy trial heard today from a prosecution witness who said that Jonathan Jackson borrow ed her car three days before the attempted breakout at the Marin County Courthouse on Aug. 7, 1970, in which Jackson and three others were killed in a gun battle.

title: Lawn Bowling or Croquet? Sticky Wicket in the Park
description: There is a ferocious battle going on between lawn bowl ers and croquet players over Central Park land, and not since Henry VIII, placed a ban on bowls because of gambling have bowlers been so disheartened.

title: I.B.E.C. Elects Officer
description: Francis W. Lee has been elected vice president in charge of finance of the International Basic Economy Corporation, it was announced yesterday by Rodman C. Rockefeller, pres ident. Mr. Lee was previously treasurer of the J. Walter Thompson Company.

title: Atlantic Richfield Halting ServiceStation Price Props
description: The Atlantic Richfield Com pany announced yesterday that it was withdrawing all price assistance on wholesale gaso line to its service station dealers and distributors nationwide.

title: GMan
description: For nearly a half century J. Edgar Hoover and the Federal Bureau of Investigation were indistinguishable. That was at once his strength and its weakness. The extraordinaryand extraordinarily valuableinstitution that he created became so identified with his person ality and his character that, long before the end, Mr. Hoover had become an institution in himself, increas ingly and unfortunately remote from the mainstream of American life and thought.

title: U.S. Riders Leave for Europe Today
description: GLADSTONE, N.J., May 3 The United States Equestrian Team's Prix des Nations (jump ing) squad leaves for a pre Olympic tour of major Euro pean horse shows tomorrow night and Bert de Nemethy, coach for the last 17 years, is taking a cautious attitude to ward the Games In Munich.

title: SUIT IS FILED TO BAR TWO MEAT ADDITIVES
description: A suit was filed yesterday in the Federal District Court at Washington, D.C., seeking to prohibit the use of nitrates and nitrites as coloring agents in cured meat products, such as hot dogs, sausages and bacon.

title: OTB'S DERBY BETS WILL START TODAY
description: Horse shops around the city looked like a cross between usedcar lots and icecream par lors yesterday as the Offtrack Betting Corporation prepared for today's opening of its sec ond Kentucky Derby Special.

title: CEASEFIRE DENIAL STEMS STOCK RISE
description: State Department denials of reports of an agreement for a ceasefire in Vietnam tore apart a strong rally in the stock mar ket yesterday.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Five Firms Oppose PBW's Backing Of Institution Role
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 3 (AP)  Five major Philadelphia in vestment firms went on record today against Elkins Wetherill, president of the Philadelphia BaltimoreWashington Stock Exchange, on the question of institutional membership on the exchange.

title: News Analysis
description: Last February the Federal Trade Commission, in com ments, filed with the Federal Communications Commission, proposed tighter controls over advertising in commercial broadcasting. Life for most broadcasting ex ecutives hasn't been the same since.

title: Princeton Retains Track Title
description: TEANECK, N.J., May 3Carl Barisich, a junior, won the shot put and the discus throw for the second year and led Prince ton to its second straight New Jersey track title at Fairleigh Dickinson University today.

title: Counter Protest Held
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 (UPI) Antiwar protesters, maintaining a 36hour vigil on the Capi tol steps, were demonstrated against tonight by young sup porters of President Nixon's Vietnam policies.

title: Key to the Mint to Run? Derby Status Due Today
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 3  Key to the Mint remains a doubtful starter for Saturday's, $125,000  added Kentucky Derby, even though he win big in yesterday's Derby Trial.

title: FischerDieskau Sings at Walter Memorial Concert
description: There used to be available an illuminating recording in which Bruno Walter could be heard rehearsing a Mozart symphony, fervently and con tinually pleading with his orchestra to Sing! Sing! That mellifluent voice sud denly came flooding back into one's memory at Tues day night's New York Phil harmonic concert while Die trich FischerDieskau was singing one of half a dozen Mozart arias with consum mate taste and intelligence.

title: Theater: God Bless Coney to Music
description: Bill Hinnant was the epit ome of Snoopy in You're a Good Man, Charlie Brown sprawled on top of his dog house dreaming about sup pertime. In God Bless Coney he sits on top of a lifeguard stand dreaming about sui cide. The actor is as disarm ing as ever, but this time his position is extremely pre carious.

title: Chrysler Recalling 80 Cars
description: DETROIT, May 3 (UPI)The Chrysler Corporation today began recalling eighty 1972 model cars that may have a defect preventing the automatic transmission from shifting gears. Only about 12 of the Plymouth Fury, Dodge Polare and Monaco cars are believed to have the defect. No accidents have been attributed to it, a company spokesman said.

title: State High Court Says Towns Have Right to Regulate Growth
description: ALBANY, May 3  The state's highest court today up held the right of suburban towns to freeze development of vacant land for up to a gen eration, until town officials are prepared to provide schools, sewers and other services.

title: News Analysis
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 3 The Saigon Govern ment's replacement of its sen ior commander in the northern military region and the initia tion of courtmartial proceed ings against a key division commander are the first offi cial admissions of a general failure of leadership that iswidely seen as the root of the South Vietnamese de feats in battles.
