Though the Gov ernment has takenwhat can only be regarded as late and probably insufficient measures to try to start anew on the northern front, the same problems of leadership have led to disasters of almost equal magnitude in the Central High lands, where another division has also been all but destroyed by casualties and desertions in the last two weeks.

title: Proxmire Says Connally Insults Congress on the Lockheed Loan
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  Senator William Proxmire charged today that John B. Connally, the Secretary of the Treasury, had deliberately in sulted Congress by refusing to testify on the administration of the Government's $250million loan guarantee to the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Soviet Revives Journal on Asia Focusing on Chinese Questions
description: MOSCOW, May 3After more than a decade, the So viet Union today resumed publication of a specialized academic journal of Far East ern studies focusing on the politics, economics and cul ture of China, its antagonist on the Asian continent.

title: General Says Men Disobeyed Orders
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, May 3The newly replaced commander of the northern military region of South Viet name said tonight that his troops had disobeyed his orders to stand and protect Quangtri and that some highranking officers would be brought be fore a tribunal.

title: PRICE PANEL BARS 1,500 COMPANIES FROM ANY RISES
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  The Price Commission an nounced today that it was suspending all price increases for about 1,500 major corpora tions that had failed to sub mit required profit margin re ports on time.

title: ROBERT MURRAY, 83, RIVERDALE TEACHER
description: Robert Cornelius Murray, for 40 years an instructor in his tory at the Riverdale Country School and for 29 years the school's senior master, died Tuesday after a long illness in a nursing home in the River dale section of the Bronx. He was 83 years old.

title: ASSEMBLY IN CHILE URGES SOCIALISM
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 3 An interAmerican assembly of Christians for socialism led by leftwing Roman Catholic priests endorsed today a stra tegic alliance with Marxists to achieve socialism in Latin America.

title: Divorce Bill Bids Defeated
description: BOSTON, May 3 (AP)Two attempts to revive bills to lib eralize Massachusetts divorce laws were overwhelmingly de feated on rollcall votes today by the State House of Repre sentatives.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 3  Most candidates committed to the Rev. Walter H. Faun troy maintained huge leads today over their opponents for delegates to the Demo cratic convention and seats on the Democratic Central Committee of the District of Columbia. The district's 20 delegates will cast 15 votes at the convention.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT.

title: Hijackers Bid Turkey Free 3 Guerrillas
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, May 3 (UPI) Four Turkish students armed with hand grenades hijacked a Turkish airliner to Bulgaria today and threatened to blow up the plane and its passengers unless Turkey freed three condemned guerrillas, Bulgarian authorities said.

title: Inmont Director Resigns
description: The Inmont Corporation an nounced yesterday that Ben W. Heineman had resigned from its board of directors. Mr. Heineman, president and chief executive of Northwest Indus tries, Inc., had served on the Inmont board since April, 1970. Northwest Industries held slightly less than 10 per cent of Inmont's outstanding com mon shares as of the record date of Inmont's annual meet ing Feb. 28.

title: EXAIDE OF L.I. DAIRY IS CLEARED IN FRAUD
description: Charges against James W. Feeney, a former sales man ager of the now defunct W. M. Evans Dairy Company of Long Island, that he participated in a bankruptcy fraud conspiracy were dismissed yesterday.

title: TAXEXEMPT UNITS GAIN ON LOBBYING
description: WASHINGTON, May 3 The Nixon Administration endorsed today the basic objectives of a bill to permit publicly sup ported charitable organizations to spend at least a portion of their funds on lobbying activi ties without loss of their tax exempt status.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: NeoFascists Confident of Voting Gains in Sicily This Weekend
description: PALERMO, Sicily, May 1 Giorgio Almirante, the suave rightist who wants Italians to choose neoFascism in a democratic election, returned here this week and declared: In Sicily, we are at home.

title: MANSFIELD, SCOTT END VISIT TO CHINA
description: HONG KONG, May 3Sen ators Mike Mansfield and Hugh Scott, Democratic and Repub lican leaders of the Senate, arrived here from Canton today and disclosed that they had discussed the Indochina ques tion and other matters with Premier Chou Enlai for eight hours during their 16day visit to China.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond markets backed and filled yesterday as traders responded to poor underwriting results for Tuesday's principal financings and to rumors, sub sequently denied, of progress toward a truce in Vietnam.

title: Jamimma to Be Staged
description: Jamimma, a new play by Martie EvansCharles, will open at the New Federal Theater, 240 East Third Street, May 15. It is being produced by Henry Street Settlement's New Fed eral Theater. Shauneille Perry is directing. The cast includes Marcella Lowery and Dick Williams.

title: MONROE H. LONG
description: PLAINFIELD, N.J., May 3 Monroe H. Long, retired board chairman of the Branham Com pany, predecessor to Branham Moloney, Inc., New York, a national newspaper advertising firm, died yesterday, in a nurs ing home in Scotch Plains. He was 85 years old and lived here.

title: William P. Rousseau, 57, Radio and TV Producer
description: William P. Rousseau, a radio and television director and pro ducer, died Tuesday in St. Jo seph's Hospital, Burbank, Calif., after a heart attack at his home in North Hollywood. He was 57 years old.

title: Armco Criticizes Move
description: MIDDLETOWN, Ohio, May 3 A spokesman for Armco said here today, We believe it is most unfortunate that an over eight in filing a form should result in such an order.

title: Market Place:
description: We've mentioned several times that one good way to invest is to avoid the hurly burly of the stock market its ups and downs, its bull and bear phases. Buy qual ity growth stocks and put them awayforget them. Col lect your rewards later.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BIRMINGHAM, May 3Gov. George C. Wallace has dashed the hopes of insurgent Demo crats in Alabama to embarrass him at home while he ranges over the rest of the country in search of votes to bolster his national political ambi tions.

title: Both Extremes Shunned
description: ROME, May 3Premier Giu lio Andreotti said today that his Christian. Democratic party would never collaborate with either the Communists or the neoFascists.

title: 4 U.S. Makers Report a 9% IncreaseForeign Producers Show Drop
description: DETROIT, May 3Sales of new cars soared to a record for the final third of April and for the full month, evidence that Detroit is basking in a spring boom.

title: John Marion Named Head of ParkeBernet
description: John Marion, whose auc tion gavel has signaled the sale of more than $200mil lion of art and other valua bles, yesterday was named president of the ParkeBer net Galleries.

title: Metropolitan Briefs.
description: ExPolice Officer Gets 3 Years

title: Eleanor Packard, War Reporter And Rome Correspondent, Dies
description: ROME, May 4 (UPI) Mrs. Eleanor Packard, a longtime correspondent for The New York Daily News and onetime war correspondent for The United Press, died early today in a Rome hospital. She had been ill for several years and entered the hospital three weeks ago. She was 67 years old.

title: Brooke Joins Democrats in Urging a Speedy Rise in Social Security Benefits
description: WASHINGTON, May 4Bi partisan support began appear ing in Congress today for prompt increase in Social Security benefits for 27 million Americans.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates on taxexempt securities rose sharply yester day as about $79million of unsold Pennsylvania bonds were left to find their free market level, about 1520 basis points higher than when the $100million offering reached the market Tuesday.

title: Economic Analysis
description: With three weeks down and two to go in the annual stock holder meeting season, it seems clear that attempts by church and consumer groups to alter the social consciences and practices of major corporations through stockholder proxy pro posals have once more been resoundingly defeated.

title: 21 Girls Drown Off Crete
description: CANEA, Crete, May 4 (AP) Twentyone girls on an after noon sea outing of this port city in western Crete drowned today when a sudden storm overturned their small fishing boat. The girls, 16 to 18 years old, were from a high school near here. Six girls and the skipper bf the vessel were res cued by fishing boats.

title: DOW IN FIRST GAIN SINCE FRIDAY RISE
description: Stock prices held steady yes terday, despite investor con cern over the military situa tion in South Vietnam, where the Communist forces have made spectacular gains this week.

title: DR. KENDALL DIES; NOBEL LAUREATE
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 4 Dr. Edward C. Kendall, winner of the Nobel Prize in medicine and physiology in 1950 and a pioneer in the discovery of cortisone, died today in Rah way, Hospital. He was 86 years old and lived at Queenston Place in Princeton.

title: NO FAULT ACTION PUT OFF IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 4while doz ens of lobbying lawyers swarmed through the Senate antechamber, buttonholing lawmakers to express their op position to no fault automo bile insurance, the Senate to day postponed scheduled debate on two conflicting bills that deal with the controversial is sue.

title: Chickencoop Chinaman Due
description: The American Place Theater, 111 West 46th Street, will of fer The Chickencoop China man, a play by Frank Chin, from May 27 through June 24as its fourth and final play of the current season. Jack Gelber is directing. The playwright, who is a writer of fiction and films, is teaching at the Uni versity of California at Berke ley.

title: PRICES ON AMEX SHOW STABILITY
description: After three trading days of sharply declining prices this week, the American Stock Ex change shares showed stability yesterday. As measured by the index the prices were down only 0.01 to 27.48, on a turn over of only 3.8 million shares.

title: Turkish Forces on Alert
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 4 The armed forces were put on a state of general alert today and a sixhour curfew was imposed after a resurgence of terrorist activity in Turkey.

title: Dr. Judd L. Teller
description: Dr. Judd L. Teller, writer and long an adviser to national Jewish groups, died Wednesday in University Hospital after a brief illness. He was 59 years old and lived at 201 East 21st Street.

title: 37 in Mexico City Are Dead in Storm; 100,000 Homeless
description: MEXICO CITY, May 4 (Reu ters)A thunderstorm killed 37 people in Mexico City yes terday. About 70 people were injured and some 100,000 were left homeless.

title: Russians Accept Reykjavik For All 24 Chess Games
description: MOSCOW, May 4 (UPI)The Soviet Chess Federation today accepted Reykjavik, Iceland, asthe site of the entire 24game world chess championship match, Tass, the Soviet news agency, said.

title: Harbor Improvement Plan
description: WALTHAM, Mass., May 4 (AP)The Army Corps of En gineers said today that it would recommend expenditure of $3.6million by the Federal Government to improve the harbor at Jonesport, Me., and protect the town's commercial fishing fleet.

title: Advertising:
description: Yesterday was the day that both Young & Rubicam and DancerFitzgeraldSample got into the restaurant business.

title: Addict Treatment Plan
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 4 (UPI) Hahnemann Hospital has ap plied etto the Institute of Men tal Health for a $1.2million Federal grant to resume its car bon dioxide drug treatment pro gram. The hospital promised more intensive patient care and greater safety precautions in order to regain the program it lost March 10 after the second of two heroin addicts died dur ing reatment.

title: Notes on People
description: So that he'll be wellrested for the occasion, the Duke of Windsoi has dropped all social engagements prior to the time his niece, Queen Elizabeth II, calls on him at his Paris, home during her state visit to France begin ning May 16.

title: Mrs. Meir, in Bucharest, Meets Rumanian Leaders
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, May 4  Premier Golda Meir of Is rael opened three days of talks with the Rumanian Government today, aimed at tightening the tenuous and controversial re lations between Israel and her only friend in the Communist world.

title: Statements and Comments by U.S. and Communist Delegates at the Session of the Paris Talks on Vietnam
description: PARIS, May 4Following are the texts of a statement at the Vietnam peace talks today by William J. Porter of the United States and of his comment to the press after the session, and of a similar comment by Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh of the Com munist side, as well as ex cerpts from Mrs. Binh's state ment during the meeting. Mrs. Binh's statement was sup plied in English by the Viet cong delegation; her comment to the press was translated from the French by The New York Times.

title: AlleghenyLudlum Changes Price for Stainless Steel
description: AlleghenyLudlum Industries, Inc., announced yesterday that it was replacing discounted prices on stainless cold rolled sheet with a lower published price.

title: Laird Praises Chafee, Leaving His Navy Post
description: WASHINGTON, MAY 4 (UPI)John H. Chafee re tired as Secretary of the Navy today and received a farewell from Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird that virtually amounted to a kick off for a Chafee campaign for the Senate.

title: MAURICE SAMUEL, JEWISH WRITER
description: Maurice Samuel, author of The World of Sholom Alelchem, died yesterday at Beth Israel Hospital after a long illness. He was 77 years old and lived at 515 West End Avenue.

title: Fish Kill in L. I. Sound Laid To PowerPlant Discharge
description: WATERFORD, Conn., May 4 The fish kill that destroyed more than 10,000 menhaden here this week was caused by warm water discharged from an atomic power plant, state officials said today.

title: Thorpe Leads by Shot on 66 at Houston
description: HOUSTON, May 4 (UPI) Chuck Thorpe, the son of a Roxboro, N. C., greenskeeper and one of the few blacks on the pro tour, hitting super drives and accurate iron shots, carded a sixunderpar 66 to day for the firstround lead of the $125,000 Houston open.

title: News Analysis
description: NASHVILLE, May 4Once again this week, the striking figures in the Democratic Presidential race were the two Georges  Senator McGovern, the prairie populist from South Dakota, and Governor Wallace, the Southern segregationist from Alabama. And not just because they stand at theparty's extremes, while Senator Hu bert H. Humphrey of Minnesota walks what used to be called themiddle of the road. Senator McGovern did not quite bring off the upset in Ohio that he had hoped for, losing to Sen ator Humphrey by about 25,000 votes. But if there is such a thing as an index of disappointment, Mr. Humphrey must have scored higher.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: State Cable TV Regulation Approved by the Assembly
description: ALBANY, May 4Creation of a state commission to regu late the burgeoning field of cable television was approved today in the Assembly.

title: Soviet Submarine With Missiles Reported in Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  A Soviet submarine carrying three ballistic missiles recently entered a port on Cuba's north coast, the Defense Department announced today.

title: Index of Commodity Prices Advanced to 118.1 in Week
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 118.1 from 115.7 last week.

title: WASHINGOTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 4There has usually been a difference in American politics between the strategy for win ning the primaries and the strategy for winning the Presidency, and George McGovern is rapidly reaching the point where he will have to choose between the two.

title: Books of The Times
description: EXISTENTIAL ERRANDS. By Norman Mailer. 365 pages. Little, Brown. $7.95.

title: British Soldier Wounded
description: BELFAST, May 4 (UPI) Gunmen shot and critically wounded a soldier in the Catho lic Andersonstown district of Belfast, an army spokesman said today.

title: SOVIET REPORTS ON SOIL OF MOON
description: MOSCOW, May 4The So viet Union published today a detailed report on its latest lunar soil sample, brought back to earth in February, confirm ing the existence of two basic geological subdivisions on the moon, the lowlying seas and the socalled Continental High lands.

title: Mayor Rehires 2 Who Quit To Aid His Presidential Bid
description: Mayor Lindsay announced yesterday that he had restored to the city's payroll two offi cials who quit five months ago to work on his unsuccessful campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Brooklyn Union Gas Plans to Seek Rise In Rates This Year
description: The Brooklyn Union Gas Company intends to ask the New York State Public Service Commission for a rate increase sometime this year, John E. Heyke Jr., chairman, said yes terday at the annual meeting at 185 Montague Street.

title: Canada Cautioned on U.S. Trade Pattern
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) The United States cautioned Canada today against moving to distort normal trade pat terns with her proposal to screen foreign takeovers of Canadian businesses.

title: Rogers Says U.S. Will Counter Hanoi
description: LONDON, May 4  Secre tary of State William P. Rogers vowed today that the United States would not allow North Vietnam to conquer South Viet nam.

title: Mabel Mercer's Songs Transform St. Regis Room
description: New York is a better place to be this week than it was last because Mabel Mercer is back in town and in a room she has immediately made her own.

title: 55 SCHOOLS SHARE $2.5MILLION FUND
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 4The Independence Foundation, a charitable trust with headquar ters in Philadelphia, announced today that it had given $2.5 million to 55 boarding and day schools in 20 states and the District of Columbia.

title: POTATO FUTURES CONTINUE TO Fall
description: Continuing a price decline that began two and a half weeks ago, the May contract, the most actively traded of the Maine potato futures on the New York Mercantile Ex change, closed at $2.22 per 100 pounds yesterday, down 17 cents from Wednesday.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 4 while Gov. George C. Wallace continues to run up big votes in his race for President, his troubles in Alabama refuse to go away.

title: Legal Aid, Citing Budget Needs, Threatens to Curtail Services
description: The Legal Aid Society threatened yesterday to shut down its Criminal Courts opera tionand stop defending about 190,000 indigents a year  unless the city increases its pro posed budget allocation for the coming fiscal year by $1.4 million.

title: Inquiry on Steam Blast to Open Today
description: A fourman board of in quiry from the Fire and Buildings Departments will meet today to start investi gating the highpressure steam explosion that killed seven persons Wednesday on the 36th floor at 80 Pine Street.

title: Humphrey Victor in Ohio Vote; Wallace Wins Tennessee Race
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 4 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota emerged today with a slender victory in Ohio's Democratic Presidential pri mary, but just how much he had won was still not clear.

title: Conscience on Rhodesia
description: Actions are now under way in both the Senate and Federal District Court aimed at restoring United States adherence to the sanctions twice invoked against Rho desia's white minority Government by the United Nations Security Council. Both moves seek to nullify an amend ment to the Military Procurement Act of 1971 that placed this country in violation of the sanctions and the U.N. Charter by allowing importation of Rhodesian chrome.

title: EUROPEANS AGREE TO CURB ON STEEL
description: PARIS, May 4Western Eu rope's major steelmakers, under strong pressure from Washing ton, have agreed to limit their sales growth in the United States market to 2 per cent a year over the next three years to forestall protectionist moves by the United States.

title: 16 in Derby Field
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 4 Everybody was satisfied with the draw today for the Ken tucky Derby. The famed 1 mile race for 3yearolds will have its 98th consecutive run ning at Churchill Downs on Saturday, and 16 names were sent through the entry box this morning, on payment of $1,000 each.

title: Breakdown in Paris
description: The indefinite suspension of the renewed public peace talks in Paris by the United States and South Vietnam deals an ominous blow to what may be the last chance for quickly ending the bloodshed in Indochina and for extricating American fighting men and prisoners in safety and honor.

title: Students Patrol Campus
description: ALFRED, N. Y. (AP)A 20 member student security force went into operation recently at Alfred University. Robert E. Heywood, vice president for business and finance, said the security force would deal with increased incidence of vandal ism and acts against personal safety.

title: Dublin to Study Union
description: DUBLIN, May 4 (UPI)The Republic of Ireland took its first tentative step today toward amending the Constitu tion to make unity with North ern Ireland more feasible.

title: EARL A. LONG
description: Earl A. Long, a dress stylist and manufacturer, died yester day in Mount Sinai Hospital after a short illness. He was 52 years old and lived in Hewlett, L.I.

title: West Point Honors Graham
description: WEST POINT, N. Y., May 4 (UPI)  The evangelist Billy Graham was presented with the Sylvanus Thayer Award at the United States Military Academy tonight for outstanding service to the nation. The award, pre sented annually by the Associa tion of Graduates at West Point, is presented to a person whose ideals and accomplish ments in the national interest exemplify devotion to the aca demy motto: Duty, Honor, Country.

title: NETS TOP SQUIRES BY 9488 TO TAKE A.B.A. EAST TITLE
description: NORFOLK, Va., May 4  Breaking away from an 8888 tie with 3 minutes 20 seconds to play and holding the opposi tion scoreless the remainder of the game, the New York Nets captured the Eastern Division championship of the American Basketball Association tonight by downing the Virginia Squires, 9488, at the Scope.

title: A Dish to Cook for the Derby
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Suspect in Slaying Of Gallo Arrested
description: Philip Gambino, one of the five men an alleged Mafia in formant, Joseph Luparelli, has said participated in the killing of Joseph Gallo, has been ar rested, but not in connection with the Gallo murder.

title: MISS DAVIS LINKED TO SHOOTOUT SITE
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 4 The prosecution in the Angela Davis trial called its 76th wit ness today, a husky gas station operator who said the defend ant was at the Marin County Civic Center the day before the escape attempt she is accused of helping to plot.

title: Harvard Club to Remain a Male Enclave
description: The Harvard Club, the last of the city's traditional all male Ivy League university clubs, voted last night to stay just that waya 107 yearold monument to male exclusivity.

title: Still the Forgotten
description: The Labor Department report on the miscarriage of Federal manpower reforms to protect migrant farm work ers is another dismal chapter in along history of frustra tion for the most exploited group in American labor.

title: HANOI COMPLAINT ON P.O.W.'S CITED
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  Harold Gibbons, vice president of the International Brother hood of Teamsters, said today that North Vietnamese leaders had told him during a recent visit to Hanoi that releases of American prisoners had been stopped because three service men who had been released were used for propaganda.

title: Screen: About Women
description: Of the three movies by men about women that opened at the Whitney Museum yester day, only one, Walter Gut man's Circus Girls, really succeeds in uniting film image and personal vision into a satisfactoryand im mensely satisfyingwhole.

title: COPPER WORKERS STRIKE IN CHILE
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 4A costly and politically embar rassing strike by cooper work ers today paralyzed the Chuqui camata mine, the largest na tionalized copper enterprise in Chile.

title: 4 Turkish Hijackers, in Sofia, Drop Demand and Free Prisoners
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, May 4 (UPI) Four Turkish hijackers today gave up efforts to force Turkey to free three condemned guer rillas and released the pas sengers and crew of the plane they hijacked yesterday and had threatened to blow up with all aboard. No one was hurt.

title: N.B.C. Petition on TV Access Filed, Goodman Says
description: Julian Goodman, president of the National Broadcasting Com pany, told the network's annual affiliates meeting in Los Angeles yesterday that N.B.C. had peti tioned the Federal Communica tions Commission to rescind its primetime access rule limiting stations in the 50 major markets to three hours a night of net work programing.

title: PROTESTS ON WAR ARE FEW AND MILD
description: The antiwar demonstrations called for across the nation yes terday as a memorial to the Kent State Four were few, and those few were poorly at tended.

title: The 1968 Understanding
description: WASHINGTON  When the heavy fighting resumed in South Vietnam several weeks ago, the Administration began harping on the allegation that the North Vietnamese had violated the understanding they had entered into with the United States in Oetober 1968. The clear Implication has been that the United States has kept its word while Hanoi has not. The facts are that it was President Nixon who first repudiated and breached the un derstanding.

title: Finley of A's Hospitalized
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 4 (AP) Charles O. Finley, owner of the Oakland Athletics, has been hospitalized for observation of mild discomfort in the chest. Dr. Charles Hudson said, There has been no pain and there has been no medication.

title: Sixth Carrier in War Zone
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The Nixon Administration ordered more than 50 additional fighter bombers to the Vietnam theater today and decided that, for the first time in the war, six air craft carriers would operate off Vietnam. This will increase the American air strength in Indo china to nearly 1,000 combat aircraft.

title: Women Runners on a Collision Course
description: QUANTICO, Va., May 4  Fred Thompson says putting Cheryl Toussaint and Mrs. Madeline Manning Jackson on the same track for an 880yard race is the women's equivalent of a Marty LiquoriJim Ryun mile showdown.

title: LEBANON EXTENDS MARTIAL LAW ORDER
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 4 (UPI)The Government today extended an order authorizing soldiers to shoot armed men on sight throughout the nation after the killing Tuesday of three policemen.

title: Woody Allen's Play It Again, Sam
description: At the beginning of Play It Again, Sam, Allan (Woody Allen), self described as one of the last of the great watchers (of old movies, dental hygiene tech nicians, anything), is in a terrible state.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: The Record on Abortions
description: As members of the State Assembly consider a bill repeal New York State's model abortion reform law today, they would do well to give weight to the statistical record on the estimated 350,000 abortions performed in this city since enactment of abortion law reform. The record fully substantiates the benefits of reform.

title: Company's Conduct in Africa Cited
description: American Metal Climax, Inc., remains confident that the business turnaround that it felt in last year's final quarter will continue through the balance of this year.

title: 600 Guardsmen Enforce Curfew at U. of Maryland
description: COLLEGE PARK, Md., May 4 (AP)The Maryland Nation al Guard moved onto the Uni versity of Maryland campus tonight after a renewal of dis turbances resulted in an im mediate curfew.

title: PAY BOARD DELAYS DOCK WAGE ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The Pay Board suddenly canceled today a scheduled announce ment of its decision on the wage contracts of East and Gulf Coast longshoremen.

title: Knicks Out to Tie Lakers Tonight
description: A lastditch situation for the New York Knicks, a golden opportunity for the Los An geles Lakers: those are the two views of tonight's. National Basketball Association playoff game at Madison Square Gar den. Tapoff is scheduled for 8:40 and a nationwide tele vision audience will be watch ing (Channel 7 here).

title: Theater: Suggs, Comic Confession of a Romantic
description: Suggs, a wryly observant new play by David Wiltse, which last night began a twoweek run at the Forum Theater in Lincoln Center is the comic confession of George Suggs, an emigrant from Kansas to New York. Suggs is a curable romantic and what cures him is the city.

title: Reds Down Cards, 95
description: ST. LOUIS, May 4 (AP) Dave Concepcion singled home two runs in the eighth inning, today and Bobby Tolan tripled, for three more to give the Cin cinnati Reds a 95 victory over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Yugoslav Gets 2Set Lead In a Davis Cup Elimination
description: WARSAW, May 4 (UPI) nor Jovanovic of Yugolsav won the first two sets, 63, 64, against Wieslaw Gasiorek of Poland today, but the Davis Cup elimination tennis match was interrupted in the third set because of heavy rain. The match will be resumed tomor row.

title: A Democratic Battle in Queens
description: Across the Queensboro Bridge from Manhattan, the Ninth Congressional District coils through the industrial wasteland of Long Island City and the vast cemeteries and melancholy row houses of Maspeth, Ridgewood, Glen dale and Woodhaven.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Yogi Berra's Brother Dies
description: NUTLEY, N.J. May 4John Berra, a brother of Yogi Berra, the manager of the New York Mete, died of cancer today at his home, 135 Beech Street. He was 50 years old. Mr. Berra had managed the Bowlo, mat, a bowling alley, in Pa ramus, owned by his brother.

title: Robert Rowan Is Elected As President of Fruehauf
description: Robert D. Rowan has been elected president and chief op erating officer of the Fruehauf Corporation. He was executive vice presidentfinance. William E. Grace, president, has been elected chairman, continuing as chief executive.

title: ELECTRONICS EXPERT WANTED HERE IS HELD
description: LONDON, May 4The Home Office disclosed today that Theodore Ratnoff, a New York wiretapping and bugging ex pert, was arrested here Mon day, pending proceedings for his extradition to the United State's.

title: Friends Say Gen. Minh Is Willing to Take Over
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 4Associates of Gen. Duong Van Minh, President Nguyen Van Thieu's most respected political rival, said today that in the present crisis of leader ship, General Minh stood more ready than ever to accept the reins of this country.

title: NOVEL IS LIKENED TO GREENE'S BOOK
description: LONDON, May 4Two pages from a prizewinning novel by a West African writer, Yambo Ouologuem, were shown today to bear a striking resemblance to a passage in one of Graham Greene's earliest books.

title: Ohio Trying to Unravel Voting Tangle
description: CLEVELAND, May 4Two days after the Presidential primaries in Ohio, the Cuya hoga County Board of Elec tions here was simultaneous ly trying to find misplaced returns from 92 precincts, begin an official count before completing the unofficial count of the results, conduct a semiofficial search for mis takes in the tally and pre pare to hold the election in 16 locations where the polls never did open on Tuesday.

title: Captain Dies and 4 Are Injured in the Seaway as 2 Blasts Rip Tanker
description: OGDENSBURG, N. Y., May 4The captain of a gasoline tanker was killed and four crewmen were injured in two explosions in the St. Law rence Seaway early today.

title: Mrs. Lindsay Urges Retention of Abortion Law
description: ALBANY, May 4Mrs. John V. Lindsay, the wife of New York City's Mayor, and 500 oth er women urged wavering leg islators today to stand firm in the face of efforts to repeal the state's twayearold liber alized abortion law.

title: Pimlico Plans a Race In Honor of Hoover
description: BALTIMORE, May 4 (UPI)  Pimlico Race Course an nounced today that it would name a handicap or stakes race during the 1973 season in honor of J. Edgar Hoover, the late director of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation.

title: Cambodia Reports 96% Favor New Constitution
description: PNOMPENH Cambodia, May 4 (UPI)The Cambo dian Government today pub lished provisional results of its first referendum showing that of the more than 1.5 million people who voted, 96 per cent favored the coun try's new republican Consti tution.

title: U.S. Directors Are Stars Of Cannes Film Festival
description: CANNES, France, May 4 The 26th Cannes Interna tional Film Festival opened here tonight with massive American participation. But while in former years the United States was represent ed by standard, bigbudget Hollywood films, which pro vided much of the traditional festival glitter, what the Cannes officials and Euro pean cinema circles seem to want from America these days is the counterculture.

title: WarCurb Vote Delayed As Senate Doves Retreat
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  Senate doves, thrown on the defensive by the military crisis in Vietnam, began retreating today from another attempt to push through an endthewar amendment.

title: Aiding Church Schools
description: The nonpublic schoolsparticularly the parochial schoolsare in serious financial difficulty, a condition they share with the public schools. This newspaper has consistently held to the view that fiscal considerations must not be permitted to breach the wall of separation between church and state, and has therefore opposed any legislation which would have the effect of using public funds to subsidize religious education.

title: SPECIFIC ARMS BAN IS ASKED IN GENEVA
description: GENEVA, May 3  A Swe dish Government expert de manded today the inclusion of a specific ban on area bomb ing, napalm and other horror weapons in proposed supple ments to the Geneva Conven tions of 1949.

title: Autobiography Won't Run In Grey Lag Tomorrow
description: Some of the glamour was re moved from tomorrow's $75, 000 added Grey Lag Handicap at Aqueduct when Frank (Pan cho) Martin, the trainer of Sig mund Sommer's Autobiography, said the outstanding 4yearold would not be a starter.

title: Abbott Ruskin's Piano Recital Proves His FirstRate Ability
description: A year ago, Abbott Ruskin made his New York debut as an adult musicianhe had played here several times as a child prodigyand showed that he had bridged the age gap successfully. On Wednesday night, the pianist returned to Tully Hall for a second recital, further solidifying his position as a firstrate artist.

title: Forest Hills Project Is Upheld on Appeal
description: The Appellate Division ruled unanimously yesterday that work on the controversial low income city housing project in Forest Hills, Queens could be carried to completion.

title: Death Toll Is Now 32 in Silver Mine Fire
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, May 4 Eight more bodies were discov ered today in the smoke choked tunnels of the nation's largest silver mine, raising the death toll to 32. The search continued for 50 more miners trapped about a mile beneath the surface since a disastrous fire Tuesday.

title: Bobby Jones Eulogized At Scene of Triumphs
description: ST. ANDREWS, Scotland, May 4 (AP)Golfers from both sides of the Atlantic at tended a memorial service today for the date Bobby Jones.

title: God Bless Coney Closing
description: God Bless Coney, a musi cal by John Glines, which opened Wednesday at the Or pheum Theater, 126 Second Avenue, will close after the Sunday afternoon performance. The show was presented by Paul B. Reynolds. The cast in cludes Bill Hinnant, Ann Hodapp, Johnny La Motta and Marcia Lewis.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: ROMEItaly approaches its most crucial election in a quarter of a cen tury with curious insistence on re peating past events, slightly off beat. Perhaps the only comparable vote in the relatively short history of the Italian republic Wad that of 1948:

title: Fingerprinting of Marble: A New Tool for Archeology
description: A professor and his wife at the University of California have developed a method to identifyunambiguously, they believethe quarry from which marble in ancient Greek statues and monuments was obtained.

title: BREAK INDEFINITE
description: PARIS, May 4The United States and South Vietnam de clared an indefinite halt in the Paris peace conference today.

title: 2 YABLONSKI SONS MAP U.M.W. DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, May 4Two sons of Joseph A. Yablonski, the reform union leader who lost a bid for the presi dency of the United Mine Workers of America in Decem ber of 1969 and was murdered a few weeks later, announced plans today for a new reform drive.

title: News Analysis
description: When the McKay Commis sion opened its public hearings on the uprising last September at the Attica Correctional Facility, Walter N. Rothschild, chairman of the New York Urban Coalition and one of the panel's nine commissioners, re marked in questioning a wit ness, We may never knowwho were the good guys and who were the bad guys. After three weeks in which inmates, guards state troopers, state officials and civilian observers all told of their involvement and per ceptions of the five days last September when the prison was in turmoil, Mr. Roths child's prediction is holding up.

title: Brandt and Rival Agree to Start Debate on Treaties Next Week
description: BONN, May 4The path to a parliamentary compromise on West Germany's contro versial treaties with the Soviet bloc opened up here today. Chancellor Willy Brandt and the. Opposition agreed to start the crucial debate on ratifica tion Tuesday and to vote Wednesday.

title: Connecticut Assembly Adjourns Its Session With a Record That Stirs Praise and Rebuke
description: HARTFORD, May 4  The General Assembly adjourned last night in a mixed shower of brickbats and bouquets.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Italy Cites New Terrorist Threat to Executives
description: ROME, May 4Police sources said today that special protection was being given to at least 15 politicians and busi ness executives believed desig nated as targets for terrorist action by an ultraleftist un derground network.

title: SOME HIGH NOTES OPEN MONTICELLO
description: MONTICELLO, N.Y., May 4 Harry James, who helped bring fame to the trumpet, was given top billing over the standard breds tonight, as the 15th year of harness racing got rolling at Monticello Raceway.

title: Racing Experts See Derby as a ThreeHorse Battle
description: A professional selector, a racing secretary and a jockey's agent agreed yes terday that the 98th Ken tucky Derby shapes up as a threehorse battle among Riva Ridge, Hold Your Peace and No Le Hace.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Lots of fashion designers start from scratch every six months or so, moving with the trends. Not Bonnie Cashin. Every season she adds a little to what has gone beforesome new colors, an experi mental shape. Nothing in validates her previous sea son's clothes.

title: Some Acquisitions Cleared For Multiple Savings Units
description: The Federal Home Loan Bank Board ruled yesterday that multiple savings and loan holding companies  that is, those that own more than one associationmay acquire mort gage banking companies.

title: Two Held in Robberies
description: Two men were seized on the West Side last night and charged with having committed 13 armed stickups in the area between March 3 and April 29. Edward Suarez, 20 years old, and Albert Colon, 24, both of 230 West 76th Street, were charged with robbery after de tectives spotted them on the street, brought them in to the West 82d Street Station, and had victims identify them in a lineup.

title: Daroff's Creditors Ready to Assist It
description: The creditors of H. Daroff & Sons, Inc., expressed will ingness yesterday to help the company meet its orders for men's clothing for the fall sea son.

title: Lindsay Calls for Program To Fight School Violence
description: Mayor Lindsay told School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner and the Board of Education yesterday to come up with plan to combat violence in the public schools.

title: Books of The Times
description: BEFORE THE DELUGE. A Portrait of Berlin in the 1920's. By Otto Friedrich. 418 pages. Illustrated. Harper & Row. $10.

title: Walsh, Assailing Move to Split The H. D. A., Asks More. Power
description: Albert A. Walsh, head of the City Housing and Development Administration, castigated the City Council yesterday for its pending proposal to dismantle his agency. He proposed in stead that his powers be in creased.

title: CRIME GROUP ASKS BAN ON NEW JAILS
description: The National Council on Crime and Delinquency called yesterday for a nationwide halt in construction of new jails and detention centers until maximum use was made of services outside of prisons.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President delivered the eulogy at the funeral of J. Edgar Hoover. He appointed John Eisen hower, former Ambassador to Belgium, as his personal representative to the inaugu ration of Chiang Kaishek for a new term as President of the Republic of China. He met with the new acting di rector of the F.B.I., L. Pat rick Gray, 3d. He also con ferred with Teamsters Union President Frank Fitzsimmons and three of the union's vice presidents.

title: Sports of The Times
description: PARIS, Ky., May 4The maternity ward where the Kentucky Derby favorite was born is a black barn with a red roof that stands on a knoll overlooking the sweet green acres of Claiborne Farm. It happened during a visit by Iberia, a mare Christopher Chenery had bought in 1955 from Larry MacPhail, the baseball dervish who had turned to breeding horses and cows after selling his share of the New York Yankees. Chris Chenery's stallion, Sir Gaylord, maintains a love nest here, and in 1969 Iberia came outfrom Virginia to keep a date with him. She was in foal to Chenery's First Landing, and on April 13, before her tryst with Sir Gay lord, she bore a bay son. They named the little fellow Riva Ridge, where Chenery's soninlaw, John B. Tweedy, fought during World War II after the 10th Mountain Division's first landing in Italy.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Shades of Morality
description: Dr. Martin Sweig, who had been an assistant to former House Speaker John W. McCormack, was sentenced last March to three years imprisonment for bribery and the use of his employer's political office for personal gain. He was sent to jail shortly afterwards.

title: AGE18 MAJORITY GAINS IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, May 4The As sembly voted overwhelmingly today to lower the legal age of majority in New Jersey from 21 years to 18.

title: Hogan's Home Is Picketed By Homosexual Protesters
description: A dozen members of homo sexual groups picketed quietly yesterday at the apartment house of District Attorney Frank S. Hogan, 404 Riverside Drive, at 112th Street, to protest his failure to prosecute Michael T. Maye, president of the Uni formed Firefighters Association.

title: CLIBURN STARTLES RECITAL AUDIENCE
description: It took a while for Van Cli burn and his audience to settle down at his Carnegie Hall re cital Wednesday night.

title: Getting the Free World Together
description: LONDONNo foreign policy should come to any great harm if it is based on reality. Diplomacy's principal task is to sift the evidence and establish that reality. This is the test which we should apply to the suggestion advo cated by the Kremlin that there should be a European security conference.

title: RailFreight Traffic Off
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 Freight traffic on United States railroads during the week ended April 29 totaled an esti mated 15.7 billion tonmiles, down 0.2 per cent from the yearearlier level. Carloadings totaled 527,904, down 2.5 per cent.

title: New Torture Inquiry Is Set in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 4  New allegations of torture of Roman Catholics by security officials have stirred the minority community and provoked an investigation by William Whitelaw, Secretary of State for Northern Ireland.

title: Rangers Triumph, 52, And Trail Bruins by 21
description: Responding to a steady screeching that transformed Madison Square Garden into a Reman arena last night the Rangers, withstood eight Bos ton Bruins' powerplay at tempts, played most of the final period while two defense men were on the way to the hospital, and kept their heads to score a deciiive 52 victory.

title: Dr. Ernest Simmons Dies at 68; Backed Wider Russian Studies
description: Dr. Ernest J. Simmons, an author and educator who was a prominent force in Russian studies in this country, died Wednesday in Boston Deacon ess Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in Dublin, N. H.

title: Industry Vows Fight
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (UPI) Drug industry sources today promised a court fight to pre vent adoption of the new rules. Bruce Brennan, general counsel for the Pharmaceutical Manu facturers Association, told a recent convention that the rules were on the way and would be battled in court.

title: 2 ExDetectives Indicted in Inquiry on Prosecution of '70 Murder
description: Two retired city detectives were indicted yesterday on charges of lying to a grand jury investigating alleged attempts by policemen, several crime fig ures and their attorneys  in cluding one former assistant dis trict attorney  to interfere with the prosecution of a mur der suspect.

title: The Vietcong's Broadcast
description: WASHINGTON, May 4Following is the text of a broadcast in Vietnamese by the Vietcong's clandestine radio of the order issued today by the Quangtri city revolutionary committee. It was monitored and trans lated here by the Foreign Broadcast Information Service of the Central intelligence Agency. The newly established Quangtri Provincial Capital Provisional People's Revolu tionary Committee has just issued the following com muniqu:

title: Wood, Field and. Stream: On Pigeons
description: Only 100 yards away when we first saw it, the lovely bird, came slicing through the bright spring sky, low over the rooftops and the delicate green of newleaving trees, to land on Sam Lavelli's loft in Bayside, Queens.

title: KLIEGER ROUTING OF BILLS RELATED
description: A printing company owner testified yesterday that he had submitted fictitious bills to sev eral corporations at the direc tion of Civil Court Judge Ber nard Klieger during the mayoral campaign of City Controller Abraham D. Beame in 1965.

title: City College Cites 15 On 125th Anniversary
description: City College observed its 125th anniversary yesterday by presenting medals for outstanding service to free higher education to 15 per sons, including Mayor Lind say and former Mayor Robert F. Wagner.

title: Saigon and U.S. Commands Report Drop in Casualties
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 4 (AP)The South Viet namese and United States com mands reported today a de crease in their casualty tolls during the fourth week of the North Vietnamese offensive. Saigon headquarters said that the number of enemy soldiers killed last week increased.

title: ABRAHAM D. KOMITO
description: Abraham D. Komito, a retired civil engineer who was em ployed for 20 years in the office of the Borough President of Brooklyn until his retirement in 1955, died yesterday at New York Hospital after a long ill ness. He was 70 years old and lived at 315 East 65th Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Tax Relief Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (AP) Two House members introduced today legislation aimed at ex tending tax relief, particularly to the poor, for victims of crime. The two are Claude Pepper, Democrat of Florida, chairman of the House Select Committee on Crime, and Les ter L. Wolff, Democrat of New York.

title: G.O.P. Panel Recommends Shift of Convention
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The arrangements committee of the Republican National Committee unanimously recommended to day that the Republican Na tional Convention be moved from San Diego to Miami Beach Aug. 2123.

title: Raids on North Planned
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Fri day, May 5American military commanders and senior civilian officials here are preparing plans for drastically intensified bombing of North Vietnam if enemy forces continue their push on the city of Hue, ac cording to authoritative in formants.

title: PAYMENTS SURPLUS OF GERMANY DROPS
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany, (Reuters)  West Germany's basic balance of payments in March showed a provisional surplus of 2.06 billion marks, down from a revised surplus of 2.19 billion marks in February but higher than the March, 1971, surpus of 851 million marks, the Bundesbank said today. (The German mark is currently quoted at 31.0318 cents.)

title: PESSIMISM SHOWN AT OIL MEETINGS
description: Oil executives were busy yesterday at annual meetings and seminars across the coun try and in Europe.

title: MAYOR WAGERS $2 ON OTB FAVORITE
description: Mayor Lindsay bet $2 on Riva Ridge yesterday to win tomorrow's Kentucky Derby, and superstitious horseplayers immediately crossed the favor ite off their lists.

title: Arrival in Brussels
description: BRUSSELS, May 4Secre tary Rogers arrived here tonight for talks tomorrow with Bel gian officials and representa tives of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization and the Common Market.

title: MORTGAGE BANKER REFUSES TO TALK
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  Stanley Sirote, president of a company that makes and sells mortgage loans, refused here today to answer questions of a Senate subcommittee about the operation of his business.

title: STUDY FINDS CLUES TO SCHIZOPHRENIA
description: DALLAS, May 4A team of Detroit researchers says that schizophrenia may be caused by the lack of a certain regula tor chemical in the brain.

title: Neruda's Comment's
description: Neruda's Comments

title: TROY UNIT TABLES FURLOUGH PLANS
description: The State Legislation Commit tee of the City Council yester day tabled a homerule message asking the State Legislature to authorize Mayor Lindsay to place some employes on invol untary furlough as an economy measure.

title: WISEMAN SIGNS FOR WNET SHOWS
description: Frederick Wiseman, producer of such widely praised but con troversial documentaries as Titicut Follies, Hospital and Law and Order, has been signed by WNET/13, the na tional programing division of Channel 13 here, to produce one documentary a year for the next five years for public television.

title: WALLACE IS VICTOR IN TENNESSEE VOTE
description: NASHVILLE, May 4Gov. George C. Wallace won his sec ond Democratic Presidential primary here today, aided by an absence of organized oppo sition and by an overwhelming sentiment against federally or dered school busing to achieve integration.

title: CUBS WIN, 8 TO 0, SWEEPING BRAVES
description: CHICAGO, May 4 (AP)  Milt Pappas supplied the pitch ing and Rick Monday, Jose Car denal and Jim Hickman the of fense as the Chicago Cubs de feated the Atlanta Braves, 80, today for a sweep of their threegame series.

title: War's Turning Point Is Due In 10 Days, Goldwater Says
description: Senator Barry M. Goldwater declared here yesterday that on the basis of what he said were Japanese intelligence reports to the United States Government, he foresaw a turning point in the war in Vietnam within a week or 10 days.

title: Rare Operation a Success
description: DETROIT, May 14 (UPI) Gregory Jones, the second hemophiliac to undergo open heart surgery, went home yes terday. A spokesman for Chil dren's Hospital where the sur gery was performed April 11, said that the operation had been a complete success and that the 20yearold student would have the energy and stamina now that he hasn't had in years.

title: Dr. Wendell Scott Dies at 66; Led American Cancer Society
description: ST. LOUIS, May 4  Dr. Wendell G. Scott, a past presi dent of the American Cancer Society and editor since 1964 of Cancer, the society's monthly scientific journal, died today of cancer in Barnes Hospital.

title: Merger News
description: Warner Communications, Inc., announced yesterday that it had reached a verbal agree ment in principle to acquire the Cypress Communications Corporation, operators of cable television systems, for stock valued at $58.5million. Steven J. Ross, president of Warner, said the value of the transaction was based on the closing price of Warner Wednesday at 42 on the New York Stock Exchange. The stock yesterday rose a point to 43 in active trading.

title: NERVE TREATMENT CALLED EFFECTIVE
description: LDOPA, a drug first de scribed five years ago as pos sibly revolutionizing the treat ment of Parkinson's disease, has stood the test of time, Dr. Mel vin Yahr, medical director of the Parkinson's Disease Foun dation, reported yesterday.

title: Use of Paper Ballots Slated by Rhode Island
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 4 (AP)Plans to use paper ballots instead of votiing ma chines for Rhode Island's Presidential primary were an nounced today by the State Board of Elections.

title: Paris Talk Leaves U.S. Feeling Misled
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 United States officials made a point of suggesting today that they felt they had been misled about Hanoi's purported readiness to engage in seri ous peace talks.

title: Port Notes
description: The independent stevedor ing cbmpanies here are hop ing that productivity gains will help them absorb some of the costs of the new long shoremen's wage agreement, but they have also put an anchor to the windward in the form of a petition to the Cost of Living Council. Thestevedores, who run most of the port's piers, are asking the council for an exemption freeing them frontthe need to run the rate in creases they intend to pass on to their customersthe steamship linesthrough the regulatory gantlet of the Fed eral Price Commission.

title: Stronger Voice Urged for Publishers
description: TUCKER'S TOWN, Bermuda, May 4A meeting of America's major book publishers ended here today with calls for a stronger industry voice on is sues of intellectual freedom and for more newspaper and tele vision space for book reviews.

title: State's Antibusing Bill Scored By Four CivilRights Activists
description: The socalled antibusing bill passed by the State Legislature and now awaiting action by Governor Rockefeller was de nounced yesterday as racially restrictive and regressive by four civilrights activists.

title: Executive Changes
description: Samuel A. Angotti has been elected president and chief executive officer of RJR Foods, Inc.

title: Market Place: Small Investors Costly to Broker
description: We've often railed about the fact that individual in vestors are paying higher commissions at a time when institutional customers are paying less.

title: U.S. Defers Announcement
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  A State Department official said today that the agreements could not be formally confirmed but that an announcement would be made, probably by the White House, soon.

title: Gray Discusses Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  L. Patrick Gray 3d, named yester day acting director of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation, said today that he had been in structed by President Nixon to operate the F.B.I. in a totally nonpolitical way.

title: METS AND YANKS SWITCH COASTS
description: New York's baseball teams switched coasts last night, with the Yankees flying out to start a threegame series in. Oakland and the Mets flying in to face the San Diego Padres in a threegame series at Shea Stadium.

title: HOLEINONE AIDS BETTY BURFEINDT
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 4 (AP)  Betty Burfeindt hit a windblown No. 8 iron shot for a holeinone on the 16th hole today and shot a sixunderpar 67 for a threestroke lead in the Ladies Professional Golfi Association $50,000 Sealy Clas sic.

title: President Lauds Hoover
description: WASHINGTON, May 4  President Nixon paid the na tion's final tribute to J. Edgar Hoover today, calling him a giant, a legend during much of his long life and an Ameri can institution.

title: Claire Carnegie, Stylist In HighFashion Millinery, 61
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 4 Claire Carnegie, a wellknown stylist in the highfashion mil linery field, died today of can cer in the Norwalk Hospital. She was 61 years old and lived at 225 Bayberry Lane.

title: M'GOVERN'S DRIVE GAINING IN STATE
description: With much of his opposition in New, York State collapsing and Senator Hubert H. Hum phrey's campaign in the state barely off the ground, Senator George McGovern is position ing himself for a decisive vic tory in the June 20 Democratic primary, the last of the Pres idential primaries.

title: Bridge: Negative Double Allows User To Describe Hand Accurately
description: A majority of experts now use the negative double that was introduced by Alvin Roth of New York some 15 years ago. By giving up some chances to penalize the op ponents, a partnership is enabled to solve some diffi cult problems in competitive bidding situations.

title: 5 Killed in Maryland When Bus Overturns
description: MARLOW HEIGHTS, Md., May 4 (AP)Five persons were killed and 37 injured today when a Greyhound bus overturned on a rain slick road near this suburban Washington community.

title: C. J. Elkus Marries Mrs. Duryea
description: Mrs. Gretchen Miller Duryea, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. G. Montagu Miller of Oyster Bay, L. I., was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to Christopher James Elkus, son of Mrs. James H. Elkus of Pittsburgh and Ligonier, Pa., and the late Mr. Elkus. The ceremony in the Dana Chapel at the Madison Ave nue Presbyterian Church was performed by the Rev. Dr. David H. C. Read and fol lowed by a small reception at the Colony Club.

title: U.S. JURY INDICTS 7 IN ATLANTIC CITY
description: NEWARK, May 4  Seven present and former Atlantic City officials were indicted to day by a Federal grand jury on charges of conspiracy, extor tion and bribery.

title: Thieu Confers With Hue Commander
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 4 South Vietnam's President, Nguyen Van Thieu, made a hurried trip to the shattered northern front today, as his Government seemed to be mak ing hectic efforts to keep the situation from crumbling fur ther.

title: Early Easter Cut Rise
description: The earlier Easter this year curbed sales gains in April at several of the country's larg est merchandising chains, ac cording to reports issued yes terday. However, sales results for the first fiscal quarter ended April 29 showed substantial gains over the 1971 period.

title: Advertising:
description: The young man who has an important role in the cur rent counteradvertising revo lution believes that his type of publicservice messages will ultimately not only im prove advertising but also the quality of television.

title: Upstate Sailor Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, May 4 (UPI) The Defense Department to day announced the names of seven casualties in the South west Asian conflict. They in cluded a Navy man, Seaman Michael D. Baker of Port Henry, N.Y.

title: Freedoms Foundation Presents Patriotism Awards to 25 Here
description: The Freedoms Foundation honored 25 organizations and individuals yesterday for pro moting patriotism.

title: Power Play, Defense Rangers' Forte
description: Emile Francis, the coach and general manager of the New York Rangers, has been emphasizing the power play and penalty killing all season long.

title: BROADCAST BY FOE
description: WASHINGTON, May 4The Vietcong announced the estab lishment of a provisional rev olutionary administration in Quangtri city today, three days after the capture of that South Vietnamese provincial capital by North Vietnamese forces.

title: LAG IS INDICATED IN MONEY GROWTH
description: Monetary expansion, which in recent weeks has been pro ceeding at progressively more rapid, rates, may have slowed a bit in the last few weeks, the Federal Reserve reported yes terday.

title: Young Women Who Prefer Gridiron to the Steam Iron
description: There are Phillies (a team of men who play baseball of varying quality in the City of Brotherly Love) and there are fillies (female horses who run races and give birth to colts) and now there are the New York Fillies.

title: Relief for Older Retirees
description: To the Editor:

title: DiningPretension and High Prices
description: Restaurants reviewed on this page on Fridays are rated both for their food (four stars to none) and for their atmosphere, service and decor (four triangles to none).

title: FROEHLING OUSTS ASHE IN TWO SETS
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 4 (UPI)Unseeded Frank Froeh fing upset fifthseeded Arthur Ashe, 76, 63, tonight in the second round of the $50,000 World Championship Tennis tournament.

title: Theater: Tough to Get Help at Royale
description: Steve Gordon's play Tough to Get Help, which opened at the Royale Theater, tries so hard to be funny that it ought to have succeeded bet ter than it did.

title: F.D.A. ACTS TO END POLICY OF SECRECY AND OPEN ITS FILES
description: WASHINGTON, May 4Re versing longstanding policy, the Food and Drug Adminis tration announced plans today to make available to the public most of its voluminous data, which have always been held confidential.

title: Alice L. Stein Bride Of Norman Klasield
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., May 4 Miss Alice Lynn Stein and Norman Klasfeld were mar ried here this evening at the Old Oaks Country Club by Rabbi Norton D. Shargel.

title: McGovern Opens Drive For Nebraska Delegates
description: OMAHA, May 4Senator George McGovern opened his campaign for Nebraska's 22 Democratic convention dele gates today with a series of plant visits that emphasized his increasing interest in winning a larger share of the labor vote.

title: Vermont Banks Set Merger
description: The Vermont Bank and Trust Company, Brattleboro, Vt., and the Peoples National Bank, Barre, Vt., announced yester day that they were planning to merge, subject to approval by stockholders and regulatory au thorities. The combined bank would have assets of $130mil lion. The terms were not dis closed.

title: Woman on Board of Cosmetics Maker
description: Revlon, Inc., recorded an in crease of 8 per cent in earnings on a sales gain of 11.7 per cent in the first quarter this year, both setting records for the period, Charles Revson, chair man, told about 150 stock holders at yesterday's annual meeting in the Essex House here.

title: Refugees Choking Danang As Threat to Hue Mounts
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, May 4Thousands of refugees continued to pour into this bedraggled port city today as fears of an allout attack on the former imperial capital of Hue mounted.

title: OPERATIONS HALT Al UNIVERSAL AIR
description: Universal Airlines of Oak land, Calif., one of six Ameri can nonscheduled airlines cer tified to fly transAtlantic char ter flights, announced yester day that it was suspending op erations immediately.

title: YABLONSKI FIGURE ACCUSED IN COURT
description: WASHINGTON, Pa., May 5 William J. Prater, a United Mine Workers of America field representative from LaFollette, Tenn., was identified in court here today as a coconspirator in the 1969 murder of Joseph A. Yablonski, the reform union leader.

title: Legislature Urged To Authorize Suits Over Environment
description: Spokesmen for environmen tal groups and an assistant state attorney general urged the Legislature yesterday to act fa vorably on several environ mental bills before it ad journed.

title: Production of Cars Advanced in Week; Overtime Planned
Dance: Fonteyn's Odette
description: Dame Margot Fonteyn has not been seen in New York in Swan Lake for two years. On Wednesday night with the Royal Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House her Odette/Odile returned to us, luminous and passionate. Dame Margot has danced Odette/Odile longer and more often than any other ballerina has ever danced or probably ever will.

title: S.E.C. Revokes Registration Of Johnston Associates
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it had revoked the broker dealer registration of J.B. John ston Associates, Marlton, N.J., on charges of violating Federal security laws.

title: ALCOA PLANNING CUT IN ITS OUTPUT
description: The aluminumindustry scene became more clouded yesterday as the Aluminum Company of America announced plans for a production cutback at a Texas plant.

title: 66Day Jersey Bus Strike Is Settled, Subject to Vote
description: A tentative agreement was reached yesterday in New Jer sey's 66day bus strike, the longest transit tieup in the state's history.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1 No Title

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: Mountain States Telephone & Telegraph Co., a subsidiary of American Telephone & Tele graph Co., yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission 9,868,554 capital shares in connection with a rights offering to shareholders. The company, which has 49, 342,772 common shares out standing, said the proceeds will be used to repay debts consist ing of advances from its par eat company and notes payable including bank loans and com mercial paper.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: P.B.A. Delegates Accept Pact Offer
description: Delegates of the Patrolmen's Benevolent Association accept ed the city's latest offer yes terday, an offer that was little changed from previous propos als. It was the third time the delegates had met to weigh a contract offer by the city.

title: A.E.C. Notes Declassifying Over 650,000 Documents
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) The keepers of America's atomic secrets said today that they had declassified well over 650,000 documents.

title: Castro Visits East Guinea
description: DAKAR, Senegal, May 5 (Agence FrancePresse)  Pre mier Fidel Castro of Cuba vis ited three towns in Eastern Guinea yesterday with Guinea's President Skou Tour, the Conakry radio reported last night. Mr. Castro is making a twoweek visit to Guinea.

title: On McGovern and Goldwater
description: News Analysis

title: U.S. Dismisses Soviet Rumors
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (Reu ters)The United States Treas ury dismissed today as self serving and without founda tion European rumors that the Soviet Union planned to urge Piesident Nixon to further raise the official price of gold dining this month's Moscow summit meeting.

title: I.L.A. Chief Is Heartened By Delay in Wage Ruling
description: Thomas W. Gleason, presi dent of the International Long shoremen's Association, said yesterday that he thought the Federal Pay Board's decision to delay announcement of a rul ing on the union's new wage contract was a good sign.

title: BETTY BURFEINDT GAINS 8SHOT LEAD
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 5 (AP)Betty Burfeindt shot a steady threeunderpar 70 today and stretched her lead to eight strokes in the $50,000 Sealy Ladies Professional Golf Asso ciation tournament.

title: INJURED DEMARCO OUT OF PLAYOFFS
description: Still more obstacles were placed in the Rangers' path to the Stanley Cup yesterday, a route as tortuous as any they have faced.

title: North Vietnam Charges U.S. Bombs Hit 3 Provinces
description: TOKYO, May 5 (AP) North Vietnam charged today that United States planes bombed populated areas Wednesday in the three southernmost prov inces of North Vietnam, killing many civilians, including 10 children. It charged that war ships shelled a number of coast al villages the same day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: DOLLAR DEVALUED BY U.S. FORMALLY
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) The United States formally devalued the dollar today after Congress cleared an appropria tions bill that had held up the declaration.

title: Art: A Decade of California Prints
description: As everyone knows by now, the West Coast is creep ing up on New York as an art activity sceneand this has occurred no less in the area of prints than of paint ings and sculpture. Los An geles, in fact, has given birth to not one but two major printmaking facilitiesTam arind and Geminiwhich have lured painters and sculptors, as opposed to pure printmakers, into the field and helped them achieve in novative ways of translating their styles into unaccus tomed media.

title: 4 FearPervaded Hours Described by Passenger
description: The following dispatch was written by a New York Times sports reporter who was aboard the Eastern Air lines jet that was hijacked yesterday.

title: Bucharest Jews Greet Israel's Premier in Synagogue
description: BUCHAREST, Rumania, May 5Rumanian Jews greeted Pre mier Golda Meir of Israel to night at a solemn Sabbath ser vice in the city's historic Choral Synagogue, at the end of her day of intensive political dis cussions with President Nicolae Ceausescu.

title: For the Record: Day's Activities in Washington
S.E.C. Suspends the Trading In Stock of Mortgage Banker
description: WASHINGTON, May 5The ?? and Exchange Com mission suspended trading to day in stock of the InterIsland Mortgagee Corporation whose president Stanley Sirote, re fused yesterday to answer ques tions of a Senate subcommittee.

title: 168 Telegraph Circuits
description: Patents of the Week

title: CARL A. FRANZMANN, ECONOMIST FOR PORT
description: Carl A. Franzmann, an econ omist who headed the regional studies unit of the Port of New York Authority, died Wednes day at the age of 63. He lived in East Meadow, L. I.

title: Fairchild Camera Planning A Public Stock Offering
description: The Fairchild Camera and Instrument Corporation an nounced yesterday plans for a public offeringg of up to 750, 000 shares of its common stock. The company now has 4,390,620 shares outstanding.

title: The Poor Can Wait
description: Slow motion, always a deadly weapon on Capitol Hill in an election year, seems to be paying off for Chairman Long of the Senate Finance Committee in his determina tion to kill President Nixon's welfare reform program.

title: NIXON AIDE SCORES TV NEWS PRACTICE
description: WASHINGTON, May 5A White House speechwriter, Patrick J. Buchanan, created a stir here today with a sugges tion that the Nixon Adminis tration consider antitrust legis lation against the three tele vision networks because of what he called their monop oly on news presentation.

title: 64% OF COMPANIES SUPPORT CONTROLS
description: Wage and price controls were seen as a positive fac tor in the outlook for the na tional economy by 64 per cent of the industrial companies re sponding to a survey conduct ed by the National Association of Manufacturers.

title: Graebner and Rahim Gain
description: KANSAS CITY, May 5 (AP) Clark Graebner of New York defeated Torn Edlefsen of Los Angeles, 36, 63, 63, today and advanced to the semi finals of the Glenwood Manor invitation tennis tournament.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: SWEDEN LEADS, 20, IN DAVIS CUP PLAY
description: Bjoern Borg, who at 15 years of age is the youngest Davis Cup player on record, upset Onny Parun, 46, 3.6, 6.3, 64, 6.4, yesterday and led Swe den to a 20 lead over New Zealand in their Davis Cup ten nis competition.

title: Graft on the Boardwalk
description: The indictment of the Mayor, a former Mayor and five other Atlantic City officials on Federal charges of con spiracy, extortion and bribery does more than raise fears of a return to the freebooting that prevailed in that seaside resort in the heyday of political boss Enoch L. (Nucky) Johnson 35 years ago.

title: Senate Votes Nets Day
description: ALBANY, May 5 (AP)The state Senate approved a resolu tion today that would declare Friday, May 12 New York Nets Day.

title: Choice Words From G. B. Shaw
description: A Shavian feast will be served up on Tuesday after noon at Sotheby, Parke Bernet auction house in what is said to be the largest pub lic offering of George Ber nard Shaw material in 40 years.

title: Mrs. Emma R. H. Jentzer, Early Federal Agent, Dies
description: Mrs. Emma R. Hotchkiss Jentzer, the first woman special agent of the Bureau of Investi gation, predecessor of the Fed eral Bureau of Investigation, died Thursday at her home, 1014 East 10th Street, Brook lyn. She was 88 years old and was the widow of Harry R. Jentzer, the bureau's first agent.

title: 115 Feared Dead In Italian Jet Crash
description: PALERMO, Sicily, Saturday, May 6All 115 people aboard an Alitalia DC8 jetliner were believed killed when it slammed into a mountainside late last night and exploded into flames as it was about to land at Pa lermo's airport.

title: New Cancer Director Dr. Frank Joseph Rauscher Jr.
description: Man in the News

title: More Vietnam Myths
description: LONDON, May 5One of the night mare aspects of Vietnam for Ameri cans these days is the sense of dja vu. We have been through it all be fore: the domino talk, the Presidential heroism, the reliance on American air power to replace a South Vietnamese will to fight.

title: $12Million Prison Fund Is Approved by Assembly
description: ALBANY, May 5The Assem bly today approved $12million for reforms and improve ments in the state prison sys tem sought by Governor Rocke feller in the aftermath of the revolt at the Attica Correction al Facility last September.

title: Dr. Hetty Goldman of Institute For Advanced Study Dies at 90
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 5 Dr. Hetty Goldman, an archeol ogist and the only woman professor at the Institute for Advanced Study, died at her Princeton home yesterday at the age of 90. She was a pro fessor emeritus at her death.

title: Union Carbide Raises Price
description: The Union Carbide Corpora tion said yesterday that it had increased the price of Flexol plasticizer EP8 by 1 cent a pound to 26 cents a pound in in bulk shipments of 40,000 pounds or more. Truckload shipments in drums were raised to 30 cents a pound. The mate rial is used as a plasticizer stabilizer for polyvinyl chloride applications.

title: AMEX RISES A BIT IN LIGHT TRADING
description: In light trading, stocks on the American Stock Exchange man aged yesterday to show slight gains in price. The index was 27.53, up 0.05 on the day, but it was the slowest trading ses sion since last November. Only 3.47 million shares changed hands.

title: Italian Democracy at Bay
description: Tomorrow and Monday, Italy's democratic system will be put to its most critical electoral test since estab lishment of the Republic in 1946. The most important immediate question to be decided in elections for the Senate and Chamber of Deputies is whether the neo Fascist Italian Social Movement will register dramatic gains at the expense of the Christian Democratic party, which has led every postwar Government.

title: 6 MONTHS GIVEN IN JUDGESHIP SALE
description: Frederick R. Fellman, former Republican chairman of the Town of Babylon, L. I., was sentenced in Federal Court in Brooklyn yesterday to six months in prison for accepting $50,000 to insure the nomina tion of Joseph P. Pfingst to the State Supreme Court bench.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Cerro Corporation has named H. Danforth Starr, chairman of the board, Alan Wolfley, senior vice president finance and administration, and Paul J. Bennett, vice president and controller.

title: Antiques: Piano Cases
description: Finding an old piano can be fun for the antiques buff who is looking for a large piece of furniture that has some style.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CLEVELAND, May 5 (UPI) A Federal judge, John J. Bat tisti, expanded from 16 to 35 today the number of metro politan Cleveland precincts that will hold a special election next Tuesday because of voting machine problems that kept thousands from voting in Tues day's Ohio primary election.

title: KLIERGER QUOTED ON BILL SCHEME
description: A professional fundraiser testified in Federal court here yesterday that he had heard Bernard Klieger tell Martin Tananbaum that some corpora tions would have to pay cam paign bills in the 1965 Demo cratic race for Mayor.

title: 2 Accused of Murder
description: ALDERSHOT, England, May 5 (UPI)  Two men were charged with murder today in the bombing by the Irish Republican Army of a British Army post here 10 weeks ago.

title: Muskie Pledges Tax Fight
description: WASHINGTON, May 5 (AP) Senator Edmund S. Muskie announced today that he would continue his campaign for tax reform by holding a hearing Tuesday on what he called un fair tax breaks for big business es. The hearing will be held by the Senate subcommittee on in tergovernmental relations, of which Mr. Muskie is chairman.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: COTTON FUTURES SHOW PRICE RISE
description: Prices of cotton futures No. 2 rose as much as $1.75 a bale yesterday on the New York Cotton Exchange, and the May and July contracts established a 21year high for cotton fu tures.

title: There Was a Silk Shirt for Only $2,329
description: LONDON  A girl in a white leather miniskirt scru tinized an enormous wooden doll with a curly brown wig. A man in a bowler hat and a threepiece pinstriped suit bent over to examine a pre war Louis Vuitton trunk. A straightbacked matron took an hour to sift through a box of lace.

title: MADELEINE BOYD, 86, A LITERARY AGENT
description: Madeleine Boyd, a literary agent who placed Look Home ward, Angel and Of Time and the River for Thomas Wolfe, died Wednesday at her home, 242 East 50th Street. She was 86 years old.

title: PRESIDENT BARS BIRTH CURB PLANS
description: WASHINGTON, May 5  President Nixon rejected today two recommendations from his own Commission on Population Growth.

title: DR. JULIUS FOX, 57, A DENTIST, IS DEAD
description: Dr. Julius Fox, an authority on endodontics, died of cancer yesterday at Long Island Jew ish Medical Center, New Hyde Park, L. I. He was 57 years old and lived at 11811 84th Avenue, Kew Gardens, Queens.

title: Rose's Work Makes a Refreshing Show
description: The delicate balance that Herman Rose, the veteran painter, maintains between the claims of the medium and the charms of his sub jectmatterstill lifes, land scapes, figure studiesis one of the most rewarding quali ties of his work. Judging from his current show at the Zabriskie Gallery, 29 West 57th Street, he is a prolific artist.

title: SCRIBNER UPHOLDS ROLE IN VIOLENCE
description: School Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner defended his handling of the problem of violence in the schools at a City Council hearing yesterday during which he came under strong criticism from some members of the Council and other speakers.

title: Soviet Shows Model of Airbus, A 350Seater Due in 3 Years
