description: TALLADEGA, Ala., May 7 David Pearson, who is making a strong comeback after two lean seasons, today won the Winston 500, a stockcar race that was marred by a contro versy at the end, eight yellow caution periods and two inter ruptions for rain.

title: ABORTION DISPUTE INSTATE ACCENTED BY NIXON'S LETTER
description: Leaders of the two sides in the renewed abortion law con troversy agreed yesterday that the repeal campaign was with in a few votes of success in the Assembly, and that Presi dent Nixon's intervention had intensified the issue consider ably.

title: Study Here Suggests Police Rookies With Poor Ratings Should Be Dismissed
description: A study that examined the careers of about 2,000 New York City policemen has found that many of those who re ceived bad ratings during their, probationary period later were accused of being corrupt, abus ing citizens and breaking de partmental rules.

title: Singles Seek Better Life in the Suburbs
description: SCHAUMBURG, Ill., May 7 Substantial numbers of the nation's young singles, those lively swingers who tra ditionally flock to the central cities for fame, fortune and frolic, are on the move to the suburbs.

title: DISSIDENT MINERS ASK CURB ON BOYLE
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 7More than 100 representa tives of the dissident, reform movement in the troubled United Mine Workers of Amer ica agreed here today to seek an immediate financial monitor ship over the U.M.W. president, W. A. Boyle, under an order that is to be drawn up by the United States District Court in Washington.

title: Son of Sgt. York Shot Dead
description: JAMESTOWN, Tenn., May 7 (AP)Tom York, 34 years old, a constable and the youngest son of Sgt. Alvin York, the World War I hero, was found shot to death early today be side the body of a man he had arrested and was taking to jail, the authorities reported. They said that Tom York had died of a single shot in the head from a 38caliber derringer. The other man, who had been involved in a car accident and was to be charged with drunk enness, was struck twice in the arm and once in the chest by three shots from Mr. York's service revolver.

title: CHARLES B. BULL, 76; ENGINEER FOR CITY
description: Charles Beekman Bull, a retired engineer in the Depart ment of Water Supply, Gas and Electricity, who served in the Army in both World Wars and who was active in patriotic so cieties, died Saturday in New York Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 205 East 69th Street.

title: CATHOLICS MEET OLD FOE IN DEBATE
description: I heard all about Paul Blan shard years ago at a Catholic women's college, said Dorothy Dohen. But the nuns never told us what a charming devil you are.

title: Sizsan Loel Richardson Married To Robert M. Vare, a Reporter
description: Miss Susan Loel Richard son, daughter of the Rev. and Mrs. L. A. Richardson of Lake Charles, La., was mar ried here yesterday afternoon to Robert Mitchell Vare, son of Mr. and Mrs. Arthur Vare of New York. Civil Court Judge Leonard H. Sandler performed the ceremony at the Friends Meeting House on Rutherford Place.

title: As the Parties Decline
description: WASHINGTONThe spreading es trangement of millions of Americans from the two traditional political parties makes increasingly relevant the possibility of a significant new national political base developingnot just a passing prctest vote but an important mainstream development.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: REV. GARY DAVIS, 76, BLIND GOSPEL SINGER
description: The Rev. Gary Davis, a blind gospel singer and ragtime guitarist whose blues  tinted style influenced many younger performers, died Friday of a heart attack in Kessler Memo rial Hospital, Hammonton, N. J. He was 76 years old and lived at 10942 174th Street, Jamaica, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Sisters of Charity: Ways Change With Habits
description: A caller telephoned the New York Roman Catholic Archdiocese chancery last week and asked where to find members of the Sisters of Charity of New York. An official replied, Have you looked on the floor of St. Patrick's Cathedral?

title: ALVIN GOLDSTEIN SR., PULITZER REPORTER
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., May 7 (AP)Alvin Goldstein Sr., who at 22 won a Pulitzer Prize for reporting that helped solve the Leopold  Loeb murder kidnap case, died yesterday at a San Rafael hospital. He was 70 years old.

title: Ballet: Robbins's Latest, Watermill
description: A ballet company can con sider itself fortunate if it has one creative genius attached to it at any one time. The New York City Ballet has twoGeorge Balanchine, still the supreme master, and his great and very different dis ciple, Jerome Robbins. These men are so different, except in their stature, that they are ideally suited to create a joint repertory.

title: Bridge: Inventor of Suit Preference Was Prolific, Unsung Theorist
description: The most important single contribution to the theory of defensive play was made by a man who made no claim to eminence as a player Hy Lavinthal of Trenton, who invented the suitprefer ence signal in 1933.

title: Car Crash Kills L. I. Man
description: MILLER PLACE, L. I., May 7 Robert Burns, 51 years old, of North County Road here was killed early today in an auto mobile accident on Route 25A. The police said his car had veered off the highway and overturned in a field at about 2:15 A.M.

title: Decentralization of Schools Fails, Kenneth Clark Says
description: Dr. Kenneth B. Clark, a mem ber of the State Board of Re gents, charged yesterday that school decentralization in the city was failing to improve edu cation because local boards were more interested in power than in better schools.

title: Dahomey Transfers Power Peacefully
description: COTONOU, Dahomey, May 7 This volatile country acquired a new head of state today and, contrary to general expectation, the transfer of power took place in an orderly manner.

title: 3d Quintuplet Dies in England
description: NORTHAMPTON, England, May 7 (AP)A third quintuplet born here yesterday to the Fur low family died tonight and the two surviving babies were on the critical list.

title: DUTCH IMMIGRANT WINS JUMP TITLE
description: MIDDLE ISLAND, L. I., May 7  Hollandia Farm's Dutch Immigrant won the intermedi ate juniper championship with ease today at the Rice Farms Horse Show.

title: INTERFAITH GAIN IS NOTED BY JEWS
description: The American Jewish Com mitee released yesterday an ex tensive analysis of cur rent Christian pronouncements that, it said, demonstrated steadily improving Jewish Christian relations.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NEWCOMBE TAKES LAS VEGAS TENNIS
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 7 (AP)John Newcombe of Aus tralia won the $50,000 Alan King tennis tournament today by defeating Cliff Drysdale of South Africa, 63, 64.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: For the Lovers of French Wines, an Expensive Future Looms
description: In March, 1971, a West Side wine lover invested in two oases of 1970 Chteau LeovilleLasCases at his reg ular wine merchant's store. He paid $42.25 a case, with the wine promised for delivery in mid1973.

title: Mr. Nixon's Intervention
description: President Nixon's dismaying interference in the legis lative process of this state in an effort to force repeal of the abortion reform law was a blatant misuse of his high position. Perhaps the subject of that law should be a Federal concern, but in the President's own words, this is a matter for state decision outside Federal jurisdiction. Yet he has proclaimed his strong opposition to the law at the very moment when the question of its retention or repeal is before the State Legislature.

title: Trawlers Rescuing Crew Of Ship Off Newfoundland
description: ST. JOHN'S, Newfoundland, May 7 (Reuters)Two British trawlers were reported tonight to be picking up members of the crew of the 191foot Dan ish fishing vessel Thunderbird, which sank 375 miles east northeast of St. John's about 5:30 P.M.

title: Chess: W. German Player's Success In Tourney Sparks Discussion
description: When the young West German player, Robert Hub ner, then unknown outside the borders of his own coun try, finished in a tie for sec ond place in the 1970 Inter zonal tournament at Palma de Mallorca, Spain, his un anticipated success provoked discussion that continued for months afterwards.

title: Idle Buses in Jersey Will Start Running Tomorrow
description: IRVINGTON, N. J., May 7 Members of the Amalgamated Transit Union voted overwhelm ingly today to accept a settle ment ending the 68day Trans port of New Jersey bus strike. Service is expected to resume on some lines on Tuesday.

title: Lending Pace Brisk For LatinAid Bank
description: The InterAmerican Develop ment Bank, whose board of governors opens its 13th an nual meeting today, approved loans amounting to $652mil lion in 1971, according to its annual report for 1971.

title: CRITICS REBUFFED ON MOVIE RATINGS
description: A request by the New York Film Critics for drastic re vision or abolition of the pres ent system of, rating movies for audience suitability has drawn a rebuttal from the Motion Picture Association of America. In a statement issued yesterday, Iack Valenti, M.P. A.A. president, declared that the reviewers had aimed at the wrong target.

title: Sports of The Times
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 7A little before the United States got into World War II, a FrenchCanadian jockey named Lucien Laurin grew tired of fighting weight, claimed a couple of lame horses and set out as a trainer on the smaller race tracks in New England. His stock was no poor he had trouble getting stalls, but he patched the critters up and managed to win some races.

title: A New Day For Body Suit
description: Every so often, the more inventive minds behind fash ion come up with an idea that becomes a way of life for most women. Invariably, the successful innovation means either more comfort (low heels, soft bras, easy waistlines), or liberation from several pieces of un derpinnings. The great mile stone of the sixties was panty stockings. Garter belts vanished and girdles nearly did.

title: Study Sees Benefit Plans As 10% of G.N.P. in 1973
description: A business survey says that Federal spending on welfare and incomemaintenance programs will make up more than 10 per cent of the gross national prod tion, United Press International reported yesterday.

title: Ryan Takes Run Title
description: Howie Ryan of the New York Athletic Club, a 27yearold teacher at Alexander Hamilton High School in Elmsford, N.Y., won the Metropolitan Amateur Athletic Union senior 20kilo meter championship yesterday at Central Park.

title: Genesco Faces Power and Policy Battle
description: Genesco, Inc., the country's largest producer and retailer of apparel, has called a special board meeting on Wednesday morning in New York, to re solve a struggle in its top man agement and directors over power and policy.

title: Help for Millions
description: Recently compiled statistics dramatically show the num ber of people that seek aid from agencies affiliated with the United Fund of Great er New York, currently con ducting its fourth annual campaign for contributions.

title: TV: Return to the Bomb's Beginnings
description: The Public Broadcasting Service begins tonight a series of programs called Playhouse New YorkThe '40s. Actually Playhouse New York its a new name for NET Playhouse. And The '40s consists, of four related prograins that will be presen ted on the dramatic series during the next few weeks.

title: INMATE IS A SUICIDE IN RIKERS HOSPITAL
description: A 30yearold inmate hanged himself yesterday in a ward of the hospital at Riker's Island where he had been placed for mental observation.

title: Vidal to Act in His Play
description: Gore Vidal, author and play wright, will make his Broad way acting debut at the Shubert Theater, starting tonight and continuing for a week, in his satirical play, An Evening With Richard Nixon And  He will portray Con, a charac ter said to represent himself, in the prologue to the play. Hum bert Allen Astredo, who created the role, will continue to play It after the prologue.

title: Conferees Strive to Settle Education Bill Differences
description: WASHINGTON, May 7  Seventeen times over the last seven weeks, two or three Sen ators and a dozen or more House members have closed the doors of an outoftheway room in the Capitol and have tried to work out legislation that would set Federal edu cation policy for the next dec ade.

title: Miss Hodes Bride Of Stephen Fields
description: The marriage of Miss Rosalie R. Hodes, daughter of Mrs. Ann Hodes and Abraham Hodes of Union N. J., to Stephen M. Fields took place yesterday at the Park Lane. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Fields of New York. Rabbi Reuven Siegel per formed the ceremony.

title: 3 MIG'S SHOT DOWN
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, Mon day, May 8American planes raided the Hanoi area early to day, firing missiles at targets about six miles north of the city.

title: Susan Peterson Bride of R. D. Goldstein
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., May 7  Miss Susan Kris Peter son, a descendant of W. G. Fargo, a founder of the WellsFargo Express Compa ny, was married here this afternoon to Richard Doug las Goldstein, who expects to receive a degree next month with the first graduat ing class of the University of Connecticut Medical School.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Four unattended children apparently tossing burning paper from the kitchen window of a Bronx apartment building touched off a smoky fire that killed two of them and critically injured the other two, fire officials reported yesterday.

title: South Vietnamese Kill 13 P.O.W.'s in Rioting
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, May 8 (Reuters) South Vietnamese military police opened fire on rioting prisoners of war on Phuquoc Island on Saturday, killing 13 and wounding 56, a Saigon miltary sipokesman said to day.

title: Heirs of Reuther and Wife Sue for $6Million in Crash
description: DETROIT, May 7 (AP)Heirs of Walter P. Reuther and his wife, May, have tiled a $6mil lion suit in United States Dis trict Court charging three com panies and the Federal Govern ment with negligence in the 1970 airplane crash that killed the United Automobile Workers president and his wife.

title: City of Light Fast Becoming City of Height
description: PARIS, May 2The sky line of Paris was jacked up another large notch the other day with the topping off of the tallest office building in Europe.

title: Armenian Chorus Sings With Zest and Color
description: The Armenian Cultural Asso ciation Chorus, under the ener getic direction of Raffi Papken Sevadjian, gave its second Alice Tully Hall concert Sun day afternoon, in what is, it is hoped, becoming an annual springtime event.

title: Marjorie Gengler Upset
description: STAUNTON, Va., May 7 (AP) Thirdranked Kathy Kraft of Vanderbilt upset topseeded Marjorie Gengler of Princeton, 36, 76, 75, today for the singles title in the Middle At lantic Lawn Tennis Associa tion's women's tournament.

title: After Four Years
description: CHARLOTTESVILLE, Va.  Beside me are two sheaves of yellow paper. Onesoaked and covered with notes, fragments, and a few wellturned phrases from memorybores and con fuses me alternately. The second stack is virgin. On its pages I'm supposed to assemble the pieces of my soontoend college career in a way which is both charming and sensible.

title: ECONOMY IN APRIL NOTED AS STEADY
description: The generally improving eco nomic condition, evident since the beginning of the year, pro gressed at about the same rate in April as in the previous month, according to the Na tional Association of Purchas ing Management.

title: SWEDEN'S NETMEN GAIN IN CUP PLAY
description: Sweden, Denmark, France Poland and Czechoslovakia ad vanced to the quarterfinals yesterday in the European Zone Davis Cup tennis compe tition. Meanwhile, the Nether lands, West Germany, Ireland and Italy completed 5.0 sweeps of their matches.

title: Pawel Checinski, Pianist, Makes American Debut
description: Pawel Checinski has had some success in international competitions and has given concerts in England as well as in Eastern Europe. Saturday night, the 26yearold pianist made his American debut at Carnegie Recital Hall in a program sponsored by the Polish Institute of Arts and Sciences in America.

title: Number of Delegates For Democrats Listed
description: WASHINGTON, May 7 Following is the latest New York Times compilation of delegate strength for the Democratic National Conven tion:

title: Suspect Seized After Holdup On Campus at Stony Brook
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., May 7A gunman robbed the man ager of the Student Union of the State University at Stony Brook of $2,000 this morning. He was captured a few min utes later by the Suffolk Coun ty police.

title: J. C. Sommer Weds Ellen R. Kurzberg
description: CLIFTON, N. J., May 7 Miss Ellen Ruth Kurzberg and Judah C. Sommer exec utive assistant to Senator Jacob K. Javits of New York, were married here this after noon. Rabbi Irwin Zimet per formed the ceremony in the Beth Sholom Reform Temple.

title: Student Missing in River
description: HANOVER, N. H., May 7 (AP) A Dartmouth College student, Ignacio Fierro, 20 years old, of Madrid, was missing and be lieved drowned today in the Connecticut River, Mr. Fierro and a companion, Joseph F. Brennan Jr., 18, of Bayamon, P. R., were thrown into the strong currents of the river when a canoe they were pad dling in an aftermidnight out ing capsized. Mr. Brennan man aged to swim to shore.

title: Penn State, on 614 Total, Wins Eastern Golf Title
description: NEW HAVEN, May 7Penn State put together five good 18 hole rounds today to take the 38th annual Eastern Intercol legiate golf championship.

title: Princess Slips Into Spain For AntiFranco Rally
description: ESTELLA, Spain May 7 (UPI)A Spanish princess who was exiled because of her political beliefs slipped back into Spain today to crit icize the Government of Gen eralissime Francisco Franco at a rally of dissent monarch ists in this northern city.

title: U.S. Crime Insurance in Cities Lagging
description: Despite revised premium rates and new publicity efforts, the Government's nine  month  old crime insurance program has failed to attract merchants and residents in the central cities, for whom it is intended.

title: 4 House Chairmen Win Renomination In Texas Primary
description: HOUSTON, May 7  The chairmen of three major House committees won renomination to Congress yesterday and are assured of reelection this fall. They are unopposed.

title: 50,000 Attend Dog Show; Lhasa Apso Trenton Best
description: WASHINGTON CROSSING, N.J., May 7The topwinning Lhasa Apso of 1971, Mrs. Pat ricia Chenoweth's Ch. Chen KorumTi, scored the biggest victory of his career tonight when he was named best of 4,177 dogs at the 43d show of the Trenton Kennel Club at Washington Crossing State Park. This was the largest dog show since 1939, when Morris and Essex drew 4,456 entries. It attracted a crowd of 50,000, also a record for the sponsor ing club.

title: Bhutto Bars Trials in Pakistan Of Bengalis Held for Sabotage
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 7  President Zulfikar Ali Bhutto ruled out tonight hold ing trials in West Pakistan of Bengalis accused of sabotage during the December war. Such trials had been suggested as a possible countermove to keep Sheik Mujibur Rahman, the Prime Minister of Bangladesh, from holding war crimes trials there of captured West Paki stani soldiers and civil servants.

title: S.l. Cricketers Triumph
description: The Staten Island Cricket Club defeated the St. Lucia C.C., 142 runs to 96, yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island.

title: VIOLIN RECITAL GIVEN BY MATITIAHU BRAUN
description: The Saturdayafternoon series of recitals played by members of the New York Philharmonic and the American Symphony Orchestra at Carnegie Recital Hall ended this weekend with the appearance of Matitiahu Braun, a Philharmonic violinist. He was accompanied by Alex ander Farkas, pianist.

title: Federal Agencies Press Inquiry on Housing Frauds in Big Cities
description: WASHINGTON, May 7  Prompted by the disclosure of widespread scandals, the Jus tice Department has begun special coordinated investiga tions of housing frauds in a number of major cities.

title: Edwards Victor, 3 and 1, For NorthSouth Golf Title
description: PINEHURST, N. C., May 7 (AP)Danny Edwards shot a birdie on the first hole of the 36hole final today and kept the upper hand the rest of the way to capture the North and South amateur golf champion ship with a 3and1 victory over the defending champion, Eddie Pearce.

title: Lakers Beat Knicks, 114100, Win Crown
description: The Los Angeles Lakers won their first National Bas ketball Association champion ship last night by defeating the New York Knicks, 114 100, at Los Angeles. The Lakers took the fourof sevengame series, 4 to 1.

title: Pressuring the Pay Board
description: The muchbattered Pay Board established its credibility seven weeks ago when it scaled down the inflationary West Coast longshore agreement. That ruling cost the board four of its five labor members, but it represented convincing notice to all unions and managements that the threat of a crippling strike could not frighten the wage controllers into junking their basic standards.

title: Stamford Crime Fight Enlists Citizens
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 7 In an effort to cut down a rising crime rate, particu larly in the downtown area, this city is seeking to enlist 20,000 residents in a contro versial crime prevention pro gram.

title: GUZZINATI OF ITALY TOP HARNESS DRIVER
description: Giuseppe Guzzinati won the third world harness driving championship over the week end.

title: FOUR ERRORS HELP SINK YANKEES, 75
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 7 The Yankees finally did some strong hitting, at the expense of Denny McLain, but shaky field ing cost them the game today against the Oakland Athletics, 75. Oakland thus gained a sweep of the threegame series here.

title: 5 Honored for Contributions By Albert Einstein College
description: Five men were honored last night by the Albert Einstein College of Medicine for con tributing toward the better ment of life for man on earth.

title: A Vote for Staten Island
description: Having passed the State Senate, Senator John J. Marchi's bill for a South Richmond development author ity is becalmed in the Assembly's rules committee. It is in urgent need of a mighty push to get it out of commit tee and to a vote.

title: Stumbling Block
description: The prospect of further heavy bloodshed in South Vietnam and of a dangerous new escalation of the Indo china conflictincluding the possible reintroduction of some American fighting menplaces a heavy burden on leaders of every nation involved to leave no stone unturned in the effort to achieve a negotiated settlement.

title: MRS. MEIR IS BACK FROM BUCHAREST
description: TEL AVIV, May 7Premier Golda Meir returned home to day from a fourday, mission to Bucharest.

title: Ferrari Clinches AutoRacing Honors
description: FRANCORCHAMPS, Belgium, May 7 (UPI)Brian Redman of England and Arturo Merzario of Italy won the 621mile Spa Francorchamps sports car race today, clinching the world manufacturers title for Ferrari.

title: Transcript of President Nixon's Address to Nation on His Policy in Vietnam War
description: Good evening.

title: Knicks to Get $9,806 As PrizeMoney Share
description: The New York Knicks learned yesterday that a full share of their $152,000 in prize money will amount to $9,806.

title: House Bars Capital Bus Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) The House today killed legislation that would have subsidized bus fares in the District of Columbia. Gerald R. Ford of Michigan, the Republican leader, cited recent census figures showing income gains in 1971 and said: It seems to me that a metropolitan area that has this kind of income increase ought to be able to support its own bus system.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE TERMINAL MAN, By Michael Crichton, 247 pages. Illustrated, Knopf. $6.95.

title: Bob Hilton Scores 2Length Triumph In Pace at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, May 8Bob Hil ton, who in the words of his driver, Herve Fillion, is a cheap horse that cost his owner less than $1,000, I think, won the $25,000 final of the Ed Sullivan pacing series at Yonkers Raceway tonight.

title: Be Patient, Beef Consumers!
description: So you would like more beefand hopefully at somewhat lower pricesl We farmers have to ask you to be a bit patient! Producing beef requires a great deal of patience!

title: Soviet Space Test Hints a Universe of Matter and Antimatter
description: MOSCOW, May 8Soviet scientists hunting for evidence of antimatter in space have reported detecting seven cosmic ray events that they have identified as antiprotons, the antiparticles of protons or hydrogen nuclei.

title: JERSEY BLUE CROSS EXPLAINS RATE PLEA
description: TRENTON, May 8 (AP) The head of New Jersey Blue Cross said today that rising hospital costs accounted for the bulk of the hospital plan's request for a 14.3 per cent increase in rates for individual and smallgroup subscribers.

title: Piggly Wiggly Food Chain Ordered to Cut Its Prices
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The Price Commission ordered Piggly Wiggly Southern, Inc., a Georgiabased food chain, to cut prices today on the ground that it had exceeded allowable profit margins.

title: Amex Prices Drop in Slow Turnover
description: In the slowest trading day this year, prices on the American Stock Exchange declined yesterday, with the index down 0.13 to close at 27.40. There was a mood of wait and see about the Vietnam conflict, with volume totaling only 3.1 million shares.

title: Fortress Courts Rejected In Study as Inappropriate
description: The idea of a courthouse as a., fortresscomplete with armed guards, bulletproof partitions and closedoff courtroomswas rejected as tempting but inappropriate yesterday at the end of a yearlong federally financed study of the security needs of Manhattan's courts.

title: CHARGES DENIED BY JUDGE KLIEGER
description: Civil Court Judge Bernard Klieger testified yesterday that he never had anything to do with illegal political contributions in the 1965 mayoral campaign of City Controller Abraham D. Beame.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: OMAHA, May 8  Senator Hubert H. Humphrey is trying to upset Senator George McGovern in tomorrow's Presidential preference primary in this state.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Bureau of Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended May 2:

title: Making Sure Styles Are One of a Kind
description: WASHINGTON  It's en old story and it seems to happen here frequently.

title: FrazierAli Price War Looms,
description: With a ring that had 20 diamonds flashing on his left pinky, Joe Frazier smiled.

title: Veterans to Get More Job Aid; Unemployment Rate Still High
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 Vietnamera veterans received nearly 25 per cent of all new jobs created in the nation last year, yet their unemployment rate is still well above the national average of 5.6 per cent, the Nixon Administration said today.

title: RODRIGUEZ DEFEATS WESTON AT FORUM
description: Jos Rodriguez of the Bronx jabbed his way to a unanimous 10round decision over Harold Weston Jr. before 2,000 fans in the Felt Forum last night.

title: 2 Women File Suit On WeightLift Test, Charging Job Bias
description: Two women contended in State Supreme Court yesterday that their inability to lift a 25pound barbell above the head with one hand should not prevent them from keeping their jobs as audiovisual technicians at Hunter College.

title: Advertising:
description: Harry C. Thompson, who quit Newsweek after 21 years, three of them as its publisher, was In his new office yesterday morning at Magazine Networks, Inc. He's the president.

title: MILLS CURTAILING WOOLENS OUTPUT
description: A shortage of domestic wool has forced mills to curtail the output of worsted and woolen fabrics for the fall apparel season and has further hastened the trend toward greater use of manmade fibers.

title: Ruling Party Leads In Italian Election; NeoFascists Gain
description: ROME, Tuesday, May 9The governing Christian Democrats achieved a remarkable comeback in Italy's general elections Sunday and yesterday, receiving a clear mandate to continue leading the Government as they have been doing since 1945.

title: Building Where 3 Firemen Died In Newark Was to Be Wrecked
description: NEWARK, May 8The twostory abandoned building in which three city firemen lost their lives last night had been earmarked for demolition in about a week, city officials disclosed today.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Today we let the readers have their say:

title: President Is Elected By Accountants Here
description: The New York State Society of Certified Public Accountants elected Eli Mason as president last night at its annual meeting here at the Hotel New Yorker. His term begins June I.

title: Derby Gains Soccer Crown As Leeds, Liverpool Fail
description: LONDON, May 8 (AP)Derby became the English Soccer League champion tonight when its top challengers, Leeds and Liverpool, both failed to win their final games.

title: California Democrats Increase Their Margin
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Mai 8 (AP)  Registered Democrats outnumber Republicans by more than 1.5 million in California, the biggest margin since 1966.

title: Palermo Quits Pace Post
description: Joe Palermo, the head basketball coach at Pace College, has resigned, the school announced yesterday. His teams had a record of 65 victories and 68 losses.

title: The Habit of Saving
description: Just about everybody would like to save money. The easiest way of doing anything that does not come naturally is to make it a habit. And one of the easiest ways of making a habit of putting some money aside is to do it by payroll deduction to buy United States Sayings Bonds.

title: Dodgers Score Four Runs In 4th and Beat Expos, 52
description: MONTREAL, May 8 (UPI)Steve Garvey hit a tworun homer tonight as the Los Angeles Dodgers scored four runs in the fourth inning and beat the Montreal Expos, 52.

title: Inonu, 88, Faced by Defiance, Yields Helm of Party in Turkey
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 8lsmet Inonu, the veteran politician who has been President or Premier of Turkey for 27 of the republic's 48 years, resigned today as chairman of the Opposition.

title: Car Maker May Lift Prices
description: BONN, May 8Volkswagen's president, Rudolf Leiding, confirmed today that his troubled company, West Germany's largest industrial enterprise, operated at full capacity last year with hardly any profit.

title: Haiphong: Periled Harbor
description: It is Haiphong's status as the principal port of North Vietnam that makes it vital to both sides.

title: No Instant School Cure
description: Decentralization of the city's schools has produced no educational miracles, nor was it expected to. But it certainly has not failed.

title: Senate Approves Malmgren
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) The Senate confirmed the nomination today of Harald Bernard Malmgren of Washington to be deputy special representative for trade negotiations with the rank of ambassador.

title: Bank Acquisition Pushed
description: The Fidelity Union Bancorporation said yesterday in Newark it was seeking to buy Suburban Trust Company of Westfield, N. J., which has deposits of $98.11million.

title: Witness Tells of Seeing Miss Davis With Jackson
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 8The seventh week of testimony in the trial of Angela Davis began today with a former San Quentin convict testifying that the defendant visited the prison with Jonathan Jackson the day before an escape attempt by three convicts aided by the Jackson youth at the Marin County Courthouse.

title: David Trucksess Dies at 67; Led Bell Laboratories Unit
description: SUMMIT, NI., May 8David E. Trucksess, who retired in 1970 as head of the power conversion department at Bell Telephone Laboratories, and a former Mayor of Summit, died today in Overlook Hospital. He was 67 years old and lived at 11 Oaklawn Road.

title: IN THE NATION
description: No One Knows, said the headline in The New York Times, What He Might Do. And indeed, no one, including Secretary of State William Rogers, summoned home from Europe for a National Security Council meeting, could know what President Nixon might decide upon as antidote in the current crisis in South Vietnam. The press has described admiringly the range of explosive options open to him; members of his Administration had been hinting darkly of the terrible vengeance this unchecked Caesar might choose to wreak upon something abstract known only as Hanoi or the enemy; but the decision to mine North Vietnamese harbors was Richard Nixon's and Richard Nixon's alone.

title: DONALD N. PRITZKER
description: CHICAGO, May S (AP)Donald N. Pritzker, president of the Hyatt Corporation, a chain of 27 hotels, died Saturday, apparently of a heart attack, in Honolulu. He was 39 years old. Mr. Pritzker was in Honolulu to attend opening ceremonies of Del Webb's Kuilima hotelresort complex.

title: SENATE IN JERSEY APPROVES BUDGET
description: TRENTON, May 8A $650million borrowing program for New Jersey highways and mass transit, and a $2billion state austerity budget won overwhelming initial legislative approval this evening in the State Senate.

title: Weehawken Seeking.Revival of Shipping to Replace Fruit Line
description: WEEHAWKEN, N.J., May 8There are times when Bill Vaughan, one of the corporal's guard of security men left behind to watch over the immense emptiness of the United Fruit Company banana terminal here, feels, like the lonesomest man in the world.

title: HARVARD'S EIGHT NO. 1 FOR SPRINTS
description: Harvard's unbeaten crew was seeded first yesterday for Saturday's eastern sprint championships at Worcester, Mass., in a selection complicated by the Penn crew's sinking in the Adams Cup race and failure to finish.

title: Executive Changes
description: Paul M. Kuveke Jr., formerly vice president and treasurer, has been elected president and chief operating officer and a director of the Stirling Homex Corporation. He succeeds William G. Stirling, who becomes vice chairman. David Stirling Jr., continues as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: PRESIDENT LEAVES DREXEL FIRESTONE
description: Drexel Firestone, Inc., an oldline investment banking and brokerage house with deep roots in Philadelphia, is undergoing a management restructuring that already has involved the departure of its president, James W. Stratton.

title: Older People Dates Switch
description: The local opening of Older People, the John Ford Noonan play, has been postponed from tomorrow night to Sunday evening at the Anspacher Theater. Joseph Papp and the New York Shakespeare Festival are the producers.

title: Russian and U.S. Experts Hold MoonMapping Parley
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) Soviet and American mapping experts opened today a weeklong conference on lunar charting problems and techniques.

title: PAY BOARD TRIMS EAST COAST RAISE OF LONGSHOREMEN
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Pay Board directed East and Gulf Coast shippers and longshoremen tonight to roll back their agreed wage increase of 70 cents an hour to 55 cents.

title: The Commander in Hue
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, May 8In the five days since Lieut. Gen. Ngo Qang Truong took command in the embattled northern military region of South Vietnam, combat there has gradually renewed. No one says that the 43yearold general will be able to pull together the troops who fled Qangtri and forge them Into a force that can win in what appears to be an imminent battle for the Former imperial capital of Hue.

title: Steel Production Shows 0.3% Drop To 2,708,000 Tons
description: The American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday decline of threetenths of 1 per cent in steel production for the week ended May 6. The trade association placed the week's output at 2,708,000 net tons.

title: Bank of America Review
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 8 (AP)The Bank of America announced today that it had formed a committee to review and monitor the bank's social policy Walter A. Haas Jr., was named chairman of the committee, which is composed of seven Bank of America directors. Mr. Haas also is chairman of the board of Levi Strauss & Co.

title: Applause at Cannes Won By U.S. and British Films
description: CANNES, France, May 8The United States and Britain, Robert Redford and Peter O'Toole were responsible for the first cries of bravo and echoing rounds of applause at the 26th Cannes International Film Festival, which opened Thursday night.

title: AIRLINES. SET TALK ON FARE CHEATING
description: GENEVA. May 8The presidents of the world's airlines will meet here May 25 to cope with socalled cheating on fares and other malpractices besetting the industry, a spokesman for the International Air Transport Association said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I must express my dismay at the consistent advocacy, in the most laudatory terms, which The Times has given to the liberalized abortion law in New York State. Those of us who oppose abortion cannot view it as a problem of conscience to be left to the woman and her doctor, because this simplistically ignores the rights of another human being (at least potential) who is unable to express or defend his right to life.

title: Cambodian Town Falls
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 8 (AP)Government troops today abandoned the town of Tani 58 miles southwest of Pnompenh, reportedly leaving the enemy a corridor more than 20 miles wide from mountain sanctuaries into the Mekong Delta of South Vietnam.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: TOWSON, Md., May 8With political leaders from the Governor on down conceding the popular vote to George C. Wallace in the May 16 Maryland primary, the question now is whether the delegates elected will be legally bound to vote for the Alabama Governor.

title: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN
description: IX BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ ??? ??? ???

title: FRANK TASHLININ, MOVIE DIRECTOR
description: BEVERLY HILLS, Calif., May 8 (AP)  Frank Tashlin, who directed many of Jerry Lewis's movies and other film comedies, died of a heart attack Friday. His age was 59.

title: IRVING W. GOLD
description: Irving W. Gold, a pharmacist and longtime delegate of Local 1199 of the Drug and Hospital Workers Union, died Sunday of a heart attack while visiting relatives in Queens. He was 70 years old and lived at 1811 Quentin Road, Brooklyn.

title: EDMUND F. EBERT OF BANKERS TRUST
description: CHAPPAQUA, N. Y., May 8 Edmund F. Ebert, executive vice president in charge of resources management for the Bankers Trust Company, died yesterday at his home, 15 Bradley Farms. He was 60 years old.

title: HIGH MEAT PRICES LAID TO RACKETS
description: The infiltration of organized crime into key positions in the New York City meat industry has artificially inflated the retail prices for fresh meat in supermarkets by 15 per cent, according to information developed by the Manhattan District Attorney's Office and other lawenforcement agencies here and in Washington.

title: Medical Society in Jersey Backs Elective Abortions
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 8 (UPI)The Medical Society of New Jersey narrowly approved today a resolution favoring legislation to allow elective abortions to be performed in hospitals up to the 16th week of pregnancy, so long as the patient's medical safety is insured.

title: BOMBING DAMAGE SHOWN IN NORTH
description: THANFIHOA, North Vietnam, May 8In the bombscarred provinces of Thanhhba and Naniha, where no military targets could be seen, this correspondent today visited a hospital and a school struck by American bombs.

title: Life in Northern Siberia Is Endless Battle With the Cold
description: YAKUTSK, U.S.S.R From the vast, brooding emptiness of the north Siberian plain came a piercing wind that numbed the cheeks and froze the nostrils as the temperature on an early spring day held, at 13 below.

title: SHOP TALK
description: While her mother had her long brown hair trimmed the other day, Ellen Schinderman, who is three months short of her second birthday, got her first haircut, propped up high in the adjacent chair. During the process, Ellen managed to consume four lollipops and a half dozen Oreo cookies, carefully splitting them to eat the filling first.

title: New Convention Call Due
description: ANKARA, May 8 (Reuters)Ismet Inonu said in his announcement of resignation of his party leadership today that he would call for a new party convention as soon as possible. Under the Republican People's party's regulations, a new party president must be elected within 15 days.

title: Explosions Heard in Hanoi
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 8 (Agence FrancePresse)For 35 minutes today wave after wave of explosions could he heard at fiveminute intervals as United States planes attacked areas near the capital.

title: New Vega Recall
description: The General Motors Corporation yesterday recalled 350,000 of its 1971 and 1972 Vegas to correct a safety defect. It was the second major recall of Vegas in a month. Details on Page 16.

title: Columbia Protesters Stone Bank and Are Dispersed by Police
description: Club  swinging policemen charged twice into the ranks of antiwar demonstrators who had marched down Broadway from Columbia University after President Nixon's speech on Vietnam last night as the protesters hurled stones at a bank and a police car.

title: Reid's Switch Still Making Waves
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 8In the six weeks since he joined the Democratic party, Representative Ogden R. Reid has added a stock phrase to his speeches that never fails to get an appreciative chuckle.

title: Pirates to Get I.D. Cards
description: PITTSBURGH, May 9 (AP)Joe Brown, the Pittsburgh Pirate's general manager, said today he would issue identification cards to players to avoid incidents like one in Cincinnati last Friday. A stadium guard barred Dock Ellis, a pitcher, from entering Riverfront Stadium. In an ensuing argument the guard sprayed Ellis with mace.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Senator George McGovern retained his lead in committed delegates to the Democratic National Convention last week, and Senator Hubert H. Humphrey held on to second place over Gov. George C. Wallace.

title: COACH OF PACERS SEES LONG SERIES
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 8 Despite the commanding manner in which his Indiana Pacers dominated the New York Nets in the second half of a 124103 triumph in the opener of the American Basketball Association championship playoff, Coach Bob Leonard is looking forward to a six or seven game series.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Hayes B. Jacobs [letter May 2] need not worry about the discourteous Penn Central conductor who took four seats and let passengers stand. This week Amtrak altered the timetable (without adequate notice to the public) so that a poor service became very poor and moderately full trains very empty. When the taxpayer revolts against paying the bill, the service will come to an end, but until then there are bound to be plenty of seat, to spare.

title: HANOI AGAIN ASKS END OF BOMBING
description: PARIS, May 8A North Vietnamese official today renewed Hanoi's demand that the United States halt the bombing of all North Vietnam and continued to maintain that the American raidssuch as that today in the Hanoi areawere in violation of the 1968 agreements suspending the bombing and opening the way to peace talks here.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Joseph Gallo, shot to death in a gangland slaying in a Little Italy restaurant on April 7, left personal property worth less than $10,000, according to papers filed yesterday in Manhattan Surrogate Court.Brooklyn District Attorney Eugene Gold has begun investigation of charges that psychiatrists and social workers at Kings County Hospital are being paid for visits to patients not actually made.

title: Buchanan to Fight Here
description: Ken Buchanan of Scotland will defend his world lightweight boxing title against 20yearold Roberto Duran of Panama in a 15round bout on June 26 at Madison Square Garden. Buchanan will receive a flat $125,000 fee, a record for the 137pound division.

title: YANKEES WIN, 53, AND SNAP STREAK OF TWINS AT FIVE
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 8The torrid Minnesota Twins ran into that menacing Yankee runmaking machine, Gene Michael, tonight and emerged with their fivegame winning streak over.

title: $1.19Million in Federal Grants To Aid Preservation of Museums
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 8 (AP)The National Endowment for the Arts made 69 grants totaling $1,190,579 today in an effort to attack problems of museum preservation and conservation.

title: Soviet Press Is Low Key
description: MOSCOW, May 8The Soviet press today reported new American air raids near Hanoi and the meeting of the National Security Council in Washington without giving any indication to readers of an impending showdown that might jeopardize President Nixon's scheduled visit to Moscow on May 22.

title: Pact to Be Signed With Brazil Will Limit U.S Shrimp Boats
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The United States and Brazil plan to sign in Brasilia tomorrow an agreement under which Washington would Impose a voluntary limit on the number of American shrimp boats fishing off the Brazilian coast during 1973.

title: Germans to Seek Resolution on Pacts
description: BONN, Tuesday, May 9Chancellor Willy Brandt and the conservative Opposition leader, Dr. Rainer Barzel, agreed early this morning to try drafting a bipartisan resolution paving the way for parliamentary ratification of West Germany's controversial treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland.

title: BUSINESS MESSAGES SEEN SLOWMOVING
description: DALLAS, May 8 (UPI) Anthony L. Conrad, president of the RCA Corporation, said today that 20th century businesses handled their communications like a horse and buggy system handling transportation to a jetport.

title: HighSpending Ottawa Budget To Create Jobs Is Announced
description: OTTAWA, May 8The Government tonight announced recordhigh expenditures for the coming year to create jobs in what it called a strong but changing economy.

title: SPEAKS TO NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 President Nixon announced tonight that he had ordered the mining of all North Vietnamese ports and other measures to prevent the flow of arms and other military supplies to the enemy.

title: RANGERS, ON BRINK, SEEK 2D TRIUMPH IN SERIES TONIGHT
description: The ability to take advantage of the right bounce at the right time, sometimes known as luck, has propelled the Boston Bruins to a 3.1 edge in their Stanley Cup championship series against the Rangers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I would like to take issue with L. A. Binagi [letter April 22] concerning Portuguese Africa.

title: Black Woman Is Appointed To Board at John Hancock
description: The nation's fifthlargest life insurer, the John Hancock Mutual Life Insurance Company, announced yesterday that it had named its first woman to its board of directors. She is also the first black to be named to the board.

title: U.A.W. Unit Defies Chiefs, Backs Wallace in Michigan
description: YPSILANTI, Mich., May 81 (AP)Local. 735 of the United Automobile Workers, representing employes at the General Motors hydromatic plant, voted yesterday to support Gov. George C. Wallace for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Notes on People
description: While 300 of his friends and admirers honored him at a luncheon in nearby Kansas City, former President Harry S Truman quietly observed his 88th birthday with his wife, Bess, in their Victorian home in Indepenence, Mo.

title: Surgery Set for Bon aven a
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 8 (AP) Oscar Bonavena, the heavyweight boxer, must undergo surgery on his left hand if he is to continue a ring career, his doctor, Roberto Paladino, said today. He set a date of May 16 for the operation to repair damaged cartilage.

title: Nevirberry Sales Off 76%.
description: J. J. Newberry Company reported yesterday a decline in sales of 7.6 per cent for the four weeks ended April 29, with volume totaling $28,299,000, against $30,638,000 a year earlier. The quarter's sales were down 0.3 per cent to $87,883,000, from $88,152,000 in 1971. NewberrY's is in the process of being merged into the McCrory Corporation.

title: Soviet Beats Hungary, 3.2
description: MOSCOW, May 8 (AP)Alex Metreveli defeated Peter Seke, 63, 63, 61, today and gave the Soviet Union a 32 victory over Hungary in the European Zone Davis Cup tennis competition.

title: Rive Ridge at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, May 8  Riva Ridge, the impressive winner of the Kentucky Derby, arrived at Pimlico race course today to prepare to take on new challengers in the 97th running of the $150,000added Preakness May 20.

title: J.D.L. AND AUSTRIANS SCUFFLE AT EMBASSY
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) Members of the Jewish Defense League scuffled with Austrian officials during a brief sitin at the Austrian Embassy today to protest the acquittal last Thursday of a former Austrian Nazi.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES MIXED AT CLOSE
description: With local speculators having trouble assessing the importance of major events and their relationship to commodities, soybean and grain futures closed irregularly on the Chicago Board of Trade yesterday.

title: HANOI SAYS RAIDS STRUCK AT DIKES
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 9United States Navy fighterbombers struck at, North Vietnamese storage facilities, barracks and training facilities in an area about 15 miles west of Hanoi yesterday in the closest strikes to the North Vietnamese capital since April 16, the American command announced.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: How many more extensive studies do we need in this country to appreciate the infectiousness of violence and other public attitudes? A quick perusal of the front page of The Times of April 4 relates to this question.

title: City Drive Stresses Safeguards To End Falls From Windows
description: Falls from open windows result in more injury and death to the city's slum children than lead poisoning and rat bites.

title: STOCKS RETREAT IN SLOW TRAM
description: The stock market retreated yesterday in the slowest trading since the postThanksgiving session of 1971 as uncertainties of the Vietnam war dampened investor sentiment.

title: Mrs. Kenyatta to Visit U.S.
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, May 8 (Agence FrancePresse)  Mrs. Jomo Kenyatta, wife of the President, left today on a tour of Britain, the United States, Japan, Thailand, Hong Kong and India. She will attend the graduation of their daughter, Jane, from Indiana University in Bloomington.

title: 2 Killed as 2 Jets Collide
description: AVON PARK, Fla., May 8 (AP)Two Air Force officers were killed today when two F4 Phantom jets collided in training mission and crashed on the Avon Park gunnery range. Two other crewmen escaped serious injury. A spokesman at Homestead Air Force base, where the planes were stationed, identified the dead men its Maj. Clayton E. Hotchkiss, 40 years old, of Castille, N. Y., and Capt. William Scott Yeager, 23, of Connesville, Pa.

title: Name change Planned
description: Associated Baby Services, Inc., announced yesterday that it planned to change its name to the Blessings Corporation. Morris A. Bonoff, chairman, said the change would reflect the company's diversification into the health services field. Diaper services now account for less than 50 per cent of the company's sales, he said.

title: Plans to Resume Bus Service In Jersey Snagged by Dispute
description: Plans of Transport of New Jersey to resume bus service ran into a snag yesterday as a new dispute erupted over layoffs of some drivers.

title: Wilt's Crowning Touches for Lakers
description: Champions of the National Basketball Association andwith all due deference to the eventual winner of the series between the New York Nets and the Indiana Pacers, and various Olympic teamsthe best basketball team in the world.

title: TIMES AIDE IS SWORN TO CITY LABOR POST
description: John H. Mortimer, a vice president of The New York Times, was sworn in yesterday by Mayor Lindsay? at City Ha as a member of the city's Office of Collective Bargaining.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Nutrition. The President asked Congress to increase budget for the school nutrition program by $44.5milHon in the fiscal year begining July 1. The funds will finance school nutrition expansions announced Friday by Agriculture Secretary Earl L. Butz.

title: Bridge: Teams for World Olympiad Start Final Training Session
description: The World Bridge Team Olympiad in Miami Beach is now exactly a month away, and teams from 40 countries are embarking on their final training programs. One of these is Bermuda, whose Open Team has one player who has played in two Olympiads, Mal Martin; two who have played once, Tracy Denninger and Tony Saunders, and three freshmen internationalists, Malcolm Lewis, H. Brownlow Eve and Ernest Owen.

title: $500,000 G.E. Grant to Fund Music Series on Public TV
description: A grant of $500,000 by the General Electric Company to bring a major series of 12 international music and dance programs to public television was announced yesterday.

title: LEGAL BASIS CITED FOR NIXON ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The legal basis being cited here for President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnam's harbors is the inherent right of collective selfdefense contained in Article 51 of the United biadons Charter.

title: ELWOOD W. FORD
description: BEDMINSTER, N. J., May 8  Elwood W. Ford, former president of Baker & Williams Bonded and Free Warehouses in New York and of the Ware housemen's Association of the Port of New York, died yesterday in a nursing home in Neshanic at the age of 85.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: Hard on the heels of the recent announcement that Denmark had agreed to phase out its controversial high seas fishery for the Atlantic salmon by 1976 comes word that the Canadian Government will severely restrict its commercial harvest of the endangered fish.

title: Deaths
description: ABRAMSON Helen beloved wife of Larry, devoted mother of Evelyn Cohn, Shirley Sonic and Sal, loving grandmother, dear sister of David Feigan. Services Park West, 115 W. 79 St., Wednesday, 10:30 A.M.

title: DAVIS CUP CHANGE IS SOUGHT BY U.S.
description: The prospects for peace in organized tennis produced two more developments geared toward longterm prosperity yesterday.

title: Raymond Humphrey, Dead; Headed Insurance Company
description: JAMESBURG, N. J., May 8Raymond Bourke Humphrey, who retired as chairman of Brown, Crosby & Co., Inc., New York insurance brokers, died yesterday in Princeton Hospital. He was 75 years old and lived in Rossmoor.

title: More Accord on Basic Issues Sought First Reuss Critical
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The United States is consciously refraining from making proposals on the detailed mechanics of world monetary reform until there is more agreement on a number of basic principles, a high Treasury official said today.

title: U.S. Cuts Troop Strength In South Vietnam to 65,000.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 8 (UPI)The United States command said today that 2,700 American troops left South Vietnam last week, bringing the total strength down to 65,000, lowest in nearly seven years. But the combined strength of navy men, airmen and marines in Thailand and off shore was at its highest level of the war.

title: U.S. Orders a Report on Bilingual Studies Here
description: Senator Jacob K. Javits disclosed yesterday that the Federal Secretary of Health, Education and Welfare had ordered a report, by June 1, on whether New York City was violating the 1964 Civil Rights Act by failing to provide sufficient programs for Puerto Rican and other non  English  speaking pupils.

title: Borgias Are Not Villains in This Play
description: The Borgias, as wretched as their reputation is, have not been left without a spokesman in the world.

title: NIXON CRITICIZED ON PENSION PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 Members of Congress voiced a wide range of criticisms today of the Administration's proposed changes in the laws relating to private pension plans.

title: Critical Week in Europe
description: Quite apart from the critical situation in Vietnam, this is one of those rare weeks in history that could alter substantially the political shape of Europe and the course EastWest relations on that continent and beyond. Before it is over we shall know considerably more than we do now about the prospects for maintaining a viable NATO alliance, expanding the European Communities and furthering dtente with the Soviet bloc.

title: FANS HERE CHEER TURCOTTE RETURN
description: Fresh from his Kentucky Derby success aboard Riva Ridge, Ron Turcotte rode back into action at Aqueduct yesterday to the cheers of New York's normally blase horseplayers.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, May 8Earlier this year while Senator George McGovern of South Dakota was complaining of a lack of newspaper and television coverage, his campaign for convention delegates in the 28 states that will not hold primaries seemed to thrive on its obscurity.

title: SUIT IS FILED BY UNIT OF AMERICAN EXPORT
description: American Export International, Inc., yesterday sued to recover $3,555,000 which it asserted had been fraudulently diverted by Swiss financial interests.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 8 (UPI)Senator John J. Sparkman won nomination for a fifth term with 50.25 per cent of the vote in last Tuesday's primary, the official Democratic canvass showed today. The official tabulation gave Mr. Sparkman 331,838 votes to 194,690 for State Auditor Melba Till Allen, his nearest chal lenger.

title: Saving SALT
description: The many dangers that lie ahead in Vietnam are exceeded only by the threat to the peace of the world if President Nixon's move last night to interdict war supplies to North Vietnam undermines the strategic arms limitation accord that has been virtually assured in Helsinki.

title: Giants, Mets Mull Mays Trade
description: Willie Mays slipped into town yesterday, ostensibly to see his dentist, while the owners of the New York Mets and San Francisco Giants confronted each other over his future.

title: Berlinger Seeks to Halt 5 Welf are Rent Repayments
description: State Welfare Inspector George F. Berlinger called yesterday for state withholding of reimbursement for unconscionable rent allowancesas high as $571.37 a month paid, by the city for five welfare familes for the last year. He also referred the situation to District Attorney Frank S. Hogan.

title: A DELAY IS SOUGHT ON I.T.T.'S MEETING
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 8 (UPI) A law student who has filed a $200million suit against the board of directors of International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation asked a Federal judge today to enjoin the concern from holding its annual stockholders meeting Wednesday in Memphis.

title: BRANIFF TO BUY JETS COSTING $80MILLION
description: Braniff International Airways, Inc., announced yesterday it had ordered 10 727200 jetliners with widebody interiors and spare engines and parts from the Boeing Company for $80.75million.

title: Sonneborn Cited for Role In Raising Funds for Israel
description: Rudolf G. Sonneborn, the Manhattan philanthropist and patron of the arts, was honored last night by the American Friends of Hebrew University for helping to organize millions of dollars in aid in the United States for Israel's fight for statehood and the subsequent settlement of her immigrants in the nineteenfifties.

title: McCarthy Asks Drug Easing
description: SANTA BARBARA, Calif., May 8 (UPI)Eugene J. McCarthy told an audience of college students today that the use and possession of marijuana should be made legal as a first step toward a reform of drug laws. The former Senator of Minnesota, who is a candidate for the Democratic Presidential nomination spoke in the free speech area of the University of California campus here. Mr. McCarthy said that rational drug laws should reduce overcrowding'in America's prisons.

title: Metropolitan Museum Plans Layoffs and Cuts in Service
description: In response to one of the most severe financial crises in its history, the Metropolitan Museum of Art announced yesterday a series of staff layoffs and program cuts that it said would reduce its expenditures for fiscal 197273 by nearly$1.4million.

title: Bank's Insurer Bid Blocked
description: The Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday that it had blockedat least temporarilyUnited Jersey Banks, Inc. from going into the insurance business. United Jersey, a $1,3billion bank holding company based in Hackensack, N.J., had proposed to act as broker or agent for the purchase, sale or underwriting of insurance of all kinds, types and coverage.

title: Foundations Find 69 Tax Reform Act Not as Harmful as Feared
description: The Tax Reform Act of 1969 has considerably tightened the way private foundations handle their affairs, removed some of the secrecy often surrounding the philanthropic organizations and cost the formerly exempt foundations millions of dollars in Federal taxes.

title: Devlin's 72 for 278 Wins by 2 Shots
description: HOUSTON, May 8 (UPI)Bruce Devlin, the 34yearold former plumber from Australia, shot a final par 72 on the soaked Westwood Country Club Course today to win the $125,000 Houston open golf tournament by two strokes with a total of 278. First prize was $25,000. The final round was rained out yesterday.

title: Ylvisaker of Princeton Will Be Harvard Dean
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 8 (UPI)Paul N. Ylvisaker, professor of public affairs and urban planning at Princeton University, has been named dean of Harvard University's Graduate School of Education, Derek C. Bok, Harvard president, announced today.

title: Bill Rates in Decline At the Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Johnson to Enter Hospital
description: SAN ANTONIO, Tex., May 8 (UPI)  Former President Lyndon B. Johnson plans to enter Brooke General Hospital for brief time during the next few days for a routine examination, a spokesman said today, adding that the visit would be for follow  up examinations related to his recent heart attack.

title: Unexpected Joys at Keyboard Provided by Hyman at Cookery
description: Dick Hyman, a pianist who is usually heard but not seen (he Is one of the busier recording musicians in town), is making one of his rare public appearances at The Cookery, University Place at Eighth Street, where he is playing on Sunday nights while Eddie Heywood takes over the piano during the rest of the week.

title: Special U.S. Grand Jury Begins an Investigation of Heroin Traffic in 3 Boroughs and L.I.
description: A special Federal grand jury began an investigation yesterday into the heroin traffic in Brooklyn, Queens, Long Island and Staten Island.

title: THE 1972 CAPAIGN
description: FARMINGTON, Mich., May 8 George C. Wallace did not come to this Detroit suburb today.

title: Market Place; How to Press Fight
description: It's easy to be against pollution and in favor of an improved quality of life in this country, but how do you go about getting the job done?

title: U. S Asks for Miners Election This Year
description: WASHINGTON, May 8The Government, in line with a finding by a Federal judge that there had been substantial wrongdoing by the leadership of the United Mine Workers of America in a 1969 election, formally asked today for a new union election this year.

title: Tower Fight May Widen
description: GETTYSBURG, Pa., May 8The Commonwealth of Pennsylvania may receive Federal help in its legal fight to stop construction of a 307foot commercial observation tower overlooking the National Military Park here. The President's Ad visory Council on Historic Preservation today asked the United States Department of Interior to join it and the Commonwealth in negating a rightofway agreement.

title: Merger News
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation signed a formal agreement yesterday to acquire the Tidewater Telephone Company for about $29million in stock.

title: Ballet: Illuminations
description: There are certain ballets in the New York City Ballet repertory that seem to bear the special mark of Lincoln Kirstein's sensibility and taste. It is true that most of the ballets of value can be attributed to George Balanchine or Jerome Robbins but some seem to have been the special brainchildren of Mr. Kirstein.

title: Matthews's Gold Medal Failed to Open Doors
description: All his life, as the fastest kid on the block, Vince Matthews heard people tell him that an Olympic gold medal was something special, that it would open doors of opportunity.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Few basketball fans would have reason to be aware of it, and only historians among the baseball fans would even remember it, but a sports event of almost half a century ago offers a strange parallel of postseason drama that seems worthy of inspection. Back in 1924 the lordly New York Giants met the Washington Senators in the World Series and the Senators were the sentimental favorites.

title: Governor Reported Irked By Nixon's Abortion Views
description: ALBANY, May 8  Governor Rockefeller was reliably reported today to be angered by President Nixon's intervention in the issue of elective abortions, now pending in the Legislature.

title: New Japanese Textbooks Stress National Pride and Responsibility
description: TOKYO, May 8Five million Japanese junior high school students have started their school year this spring with new textbooks and curriculum and teacherguidance manualsand some disquiet surrounding it all.

title: The Wallace Threat
description: Gov. George C. Wallace has been doing well enough in the primaries lately to thrill his admirers, dismay his critics and wholly distort an electoral process that without him would be merely confusing. His considerable successfrom Florida to North Carolina by way of Wisconsin, Pennsylvania and Indiana  indicates that while alarm may be too strong a reaction, complacency is even less warranted.

title: 4 Armed Arab Hijackers Hold Jet and 101 Hostages in Israel
description: TEL AVIV, May 8Despite tipoff and a security search, four armed Arabs hijacked an Israelbound Belgian Sabena jetliner carrying 101 persons today.

title: Verdi Congress Canceled, But Met Festival Is Intact
description: The Metropolitan Opera yesterday withdrew as host and canceled the Third International Verdi Congress, which was to have been held here during the Metropolitan's 1972 Verdi Festival, June 5 to 24.

title: Luxembourg Bank Branch
description: The Philadelphia National Bank announced yesterday that it was planning to open branch in Luxembourg. The new office, which must be approved by the Federal Reserve, would be the bank's first full branch in Europe.

title: President Urges Soviet To Avoid Confrontation
description: WASHINGTON, May 8President Nixon's speech tonight appealed to the Soviet Union not to let its support of Hanoi lead it to a confrontation with the United States over his decision to try to cut off supplies to North Vietnam.

title: The Peasants of Chile Carry Their War Over Farm Ownership to Santiago Area
description: MELIPILLA, Chile, May 8By the glow of campfires, the peasants stand night guard, wrapped in rough ponchos against the cold rain, at the entrance gates to more than 50 farms that have been seized near here.

title: Pentagon Experts Say Mining of Ports Will Have a Gradual Effect on the Foe
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Pentagon analysts say that while the mining of Haiphong and other harbors of North Vietnam, ordered tonight by President Nixon, may have a negligible effect on the war over the short run, its impact will be substantial over the long run.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The career of J. Edgar Hoover demonstrates the need for legislation to curb the powers of the Director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation. It has been shown that it is as important to limit the tenure of that office as to limit the tenure of the President to two terms.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, May (AP)A correspondent of The Observer in London, Martin Meredith, was arrested at the airport here yesterday, according to a traveler who said he witnessed the arrest.

title: Rain Cuts British Tourney
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 8 (AP)Rain curtailed the first day's play in the British hardcourt (clay) tennis championships today. Stan Smith of Pasadena, Calif., and Evonne Goolagong of Australia were the top favorites.

title: Dollar Parity Announced
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (Reuters)The International Monetary Fund formally announced the reduction in the parity of the United States dollar to 0.818513 grams of fine gold from 0.888671 grams effective from noon today.

title: A.T.&T. Assailed as Racist Monopoly
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company was castigated by some of its employes yesterday as a racist monopoly that consciously degraded women and minority workers atd led them to render poor service.

title: Quarter Results at Peak
description: Net earnings of the Beneficial Corporation in the March quarter set a new high for the period, the consumer finance and merchandising company reported yesterday.

title: Highlands Defenders Dig in by Day, Await Death by Night
description: FIRE BASE 42A, South Vietnam, May 8The 200 or 300 South Vietnamese soldiers defending this advanced post between Kontum arid Pleiku make themselves as comfortable as possible by day knowing there is a strong possibility that they will die at night.

title: JACOB R. HARVIN
description: NORTHPORT, L. I., May 8Jacob R. Harvin, who retired in 1958 as vice president, counsel and director of Columbia Gas System, Inc., New York, a holding company for natural gas distributors, died yesterday at his home here. He was 78 years old.

title: Correspondent Is Arrested And Freed in Sierra Leone
description: FREETOWN, Sierra Leone, May 8 (AP)Policemen arrested an Associated Press correspondent, Larry Heinzerling, yesterday while he was reporting a reception here for Fidel Castro, the Cuban premier, and then freed him today.

title: Local School Units Defended by Mayor
description: Mayor Lindsay declared yesterday that the city's decentralized school boards had brought a new vigor to the whole process of achieving quality public education.

title: Microfilm Picture Brightening
description: The microfilm industry promised a boom during the nineteensixties but delivered bust.

title: Petty's 2,953 Points Take First Leg of Winston Cup
description: DAYTONA BEACH, Fla., May 8 (AP)A fifthplace finish in the Winston 500 yesterday at the Alabama International Motor Speedway gave Richard Petty of Randleman, N.C., the first leg of the $20,000 Winston Cup Series, NASCAR officials announced today.

title: Boylston Tompkins, 81, Dead; Former Bankers Trust Official
description: Boylston Adams Tompkins, a former executive vice president of the Bankers Trust Company, who was active in civic and philanthropic projects, died Sunday in Doctors Hospital. He was 81 years old and lived at 770 Park Avenue.

title: $2.5MILLION LIBEL IS LAID TO AHERN
description: The Cleveland Chapter of the Fraternal Order of Police yesterday filed a $2.5million libel suit against James F. Ahern for writing that Cleveland officials said that city's police department was riddled with corruption.

title: Tonkin Copier Crash Kills Admiral
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 8  Rear Adm. Rembrandt C. Robinson, 47 years old, commander of the San Diegobased cruiserdestroyer Flotilla 11, was killed in a helicopter crash in the Tonkin Gulf tonight, the United States command announced.

title: G.M. Recalls 350,000 Vegas to Repair Defect
description: DETROIT, May 8The General Motors Corporation today recalled 350,000 1971 and 1972 Chevrolet Vegas to correct safety problem. It was the second major recall involving Vegas in a month.

title: Rabies Cases Rise, Along With Threat to Humans
description: The Center for Disease. Control announced yesterday an upsurge in reported cases of rabies among wild animals throughout the country, with a resulting increased risk of humans being exposed to this fatal viral disease.

title: NEW BID TO REACH 58 MINERS FAILS
description: KELLOG, Idaho, May 8Rescuers made a futile attempt tonight, to locate 58 miners who have been trapped for almost a week by a fire in the Sunshine Silver Mine.

title: Castro Visits Algeria
description: ALGIERS, May 8 (Reuters)Premier Fidel Castro arrived today for his first visit to an Arab country. President Houarl headed a welcoming party for the Cuban leader.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It should be made known that not all addicts are idiots and bums. I make this statement because a few public officials are doing their best to make us the scapegoats for the rise in crime.

title: Impeachment Asked
description: JUNEAU, Alaska, May 8Former Senator Ernest Gruening called today for President Nixon impeachment.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: William Bolger, a former president of the Northern Lumber Company, was somewhat misleading in his April 19 letter about the Adirondack Preserve. He says that in this particular instance I feel controlled private development is the wisest form of land use.

title: 13 Killed in Philadelphia In a Violent Weekend
description: PHILADELPHIA, May (AP)Thirteen persons were killed here over the weekend in what homicide investigators described as one of the most violent weekends the city has ever had.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the peaceful uses of outer space, scientific and technical subcommittee10 A.M.; working group on remote sensing of the earth by satellite3 P.M.

title: YOUNGBLOODS KEEP TO PROVEN FORMULA
description: The Youngbloods are one of those rock groups that have been around long enough to know exactly what they do best; to their credit, they have not become bored with doing it, and in fact have become one of the most well balanced, entertaining groups on the current pop scene.

title: 37 Ailing Pakistan P.O.W.'s Are Repatriated by Indians
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 8, (Reuters)  Thirtyseven wounded and sick Pakistani prisoners of war, repatriated from India arrived here today aboard a Red. Cross plane.

title: Anger Marks Convention Of InterAmerican Bank
description: QUITO, Ecuador, May 8The 13th annual meeting the InterAmerican Development Bank convened here today in an unusual climate of anger and frustration amid deep concern over the future of the $6billion institution.

title: Miss Schlubach Bride of Marques
description: Miss Barbara Marlene Schlubach was married here yesterday afternoon to the Marques Anthony Alfonso de Portago, son of Mrs. Richard C. Pistell of New York and the late Marques Alfonso de Portago, the international sports car racer. The bride is the daughter of Mrs. Gerald Van der Kemp of Versailles, France, and Henrik SchlubachCarr.

title: Louisiana's Cajuns, a Minority With Power
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 8There's a story here about the reluctance of the otherwise outgoing Cajuns to give much information to strangers until they size them up. It tells about an inquisitive visitor who asks a Cajun how to find a man named No No LeBlanc.

title: ILLUSTRATED WORLD TO EXPLAIN DISPUTE
description: Illustrated World Encyclopedia said yesterday it would mail stockholders an explanation of recent legal proceedings.

title: ADIRONDACK PLAN OFFERED BY STATE
description: The Adirondack Park Agency, in the first draft of its master plan for regulating the development of the sixmillionacre Adirondack State Park, has recommended the rolling back of civilization in more than a million acres of stateowned lands to preserve the wilderness.

title: Henry Raiders Coach
description: Camille (The Eel) Henry, the little man who was always there, is back.

title: Rev. Thomas Carey, 68, Dies; Directed the Blachfriars Guild
description: The Rev. Thomas F. Carey, who as director of the Blackfriars Guild here had led the Blackfriars Theater at 320 West 57th Street from 1941 until it closed this spring, died yesterday in St. Vincent's Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in the priory of the order at 869 Lexington Avenue.

title: TIMBERUNIT SALE SET BY ANACONDA
description: The Anaconda Company has agreed to sell 670,500 acres of timberlands in northwestern Montana and other assets of its forest products division to U. S. PlywoodChampion Papers, Inc., for $117million in cash.

title: Advertising:
description: Notice to Jim Dooley Fans: Don't panic. Eddie Albert, the wellknown actor, may have signed a twoyear contract to promote Tropicana orange juice, but he won't be replacing your beloved Mr. Dooley.

title: A New Political Force?
description: WASHINGTONWhat lies ahead would seem to be a further important weakening of the present twoparty dominance. One or the other of the two parties will win in 1972 and control the structure of government. But the ensuing institutional lag can only contribute further to the spreading dissatisfaction, diffusion, independence, and void in which a major new centrist base could take shape.

title: Reynolds, Alcan and Alcoa Follow Kaiser Price Step
description: Some semblance of pricing stability appeared yesterday in the aluminum industry. The Reynolds Metals Company, Alcan Aluminium, Ltd., and the Aluminum Company of America indicated that they intended to go along with a pricing schedule announced last Thursday by the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Company. Kaiser said it would put the listed price for primary aluminum ingot at 25 cents a pound. The old price had been 29 cents a pound but widespread discounting had made the actual price about 25 cents.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates edged higher in a slow session yesterday as the credit markets pondered the quickening economy and, or more immediate concern, the Vietnam war. The war, a factor in the market's performance since the beginning of the latest North Vietnamese offensive, came to the fore front yesterday and caused traders and investors to move with great caution. Little business was conduct ed after the announcement that President Nixon would address the nation on TV.

title: Cavett Stoically Awaiting Word on Show's Future
description: Dick Cavett does not look like a man on probation. A little tired, perhaps, considering the early hour of an interview, but showing only the slightest evidence of the anxiety one might expect in a performer whose show is under threat of cancellation for low ratings.

title: NOFAULT DILUTED IN ALBANY ACTION
