description: ALBANY, May 3The alreadydiluted nofault automobile insurance bill that is favored by Governor Rockefeller was further weakened today by its sponsor, Senator Bernard C. Gordon, Republican of Peekskill.

title: Increasing Numbers of Students Fail to Repay College Loans, and Lenders and Officials Voice Concern
description: LOS ANGELES  A rising number of young people are failing to pay back the loans they have received to finance their college education.

title: MARY R. MEEHAN
description: Mary R. Meehan, who retired as assistant director of St. Luke's Hospital Center at the end of 1969, died Saturday in its Woman's Hospital, of which she was formerly assistant director. She was 67 years old and lived in Rye, N. Y.

title: For Hundreds of Girls in City, Street Gangs Offer a Way of Life
description: They stand just outside the perimeter of the spotlight that envelops their brothers and boyfriends, the suddenly discovered stars of television newscasts and talk shows and the subjects of press analyses, city Government projects, and police surveillance conducted by special intelligence units.

title: PATIENTS THREATEN QUEENS DETECTIVES
description: Four detectives were threatened yesterday by some of the patients outside Interfaith Hospital in Jamaica, Queens, while entering their car. The detectives were leaving the hospital with records subpoenaed in connection with the investigation of the fatal shooting last Thursday of a former patient by a security guard.

title: Rally Planned in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, May 8Sources in the antiwar movement indicated tonight that they expected to stage a major protest rally here in reaction to the steps announced by President Nixon tonight.

title: State Senate Votes To Liberalize Curbs In Rape Testimony
description: ALBANY, May 8The Senate gave overwhelming approval today to a bill modifying the extent to which a rape victim's testimony must be corroborated to convict an alleged attacker.

title: MUTATION SHOW AWARDED TOP OBIE
description: The Mutation Show, produced by the Open Theater, won the Obie Award and $500 cash prize last night as the best theater piece of the Off Broadway season.

title: SUIT SEEKS TO HALT SALE BY FIRST SURETY
description: The California Department of Savings and Loan filed suit yesterday to block the First Surety Corporation, Burbank, Calif., from carrying out its plan to sell 1 million preferred shares to Harold Drimmer, a New York City businessman and the former board chairman of the DivcoWayne Corporation. DivcoWayne was acquired in 1967 by the BoiseCascade Corporation. The sale would give Mr. Drimmer 40 per cent voting power in First Surety, a savings and loan holding company.

title: Faith Healer Arraigned At Side of Own Sickbed
description: A 69yearold Bronx rabbi, accused of posing as a faith healer to steal money for promised cures, was given a bedside arraignment by a Bronx Supreme Court Justice yesterday when he pleaded that he was too ill to go to court.

title: U.S. SAID TO DISTORT SAIGON CAPABILITIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (UPI) Citing what he said was a memo from the United States military command, a Congressman charged today that American officials in South Vietnam were ordered last fall to distort the truth by developing information to show that the Vietnamization program was doing very well.

title: SELLERS ACCEPTS NOTRE DAME BID
description: Phil Sellers of Thomas Jefferson High School in Brooklyn, the premier schoolboy basketball player in the metropolitan area and an allAmerican, chose yesterday to enter Notre Dame In September.

title: CONGRESS IS SPLIT ON NIXON'S ACTION
description: WASHINGTON, May 8President Nixon was alternately praised tonight by members of Congress for his firm leadership and accused of setting the nation on a dangerous confrontation with the Soviet Union that could lead to world war.

title: Brown's Extradition Asked
description: ELLICOTT CITY, Md., May (UPI)  William M. Kunstler, attorney for H. Rap Brown, today asked a Maryland court to extradite the black militant from New York City to stand trial in Maryland on charges of inciting to riot and arson. Mr. Kunstler said that he wanted to clear up the Maryland indictments before Brown was brought to trial in New York.

title: READING RESULTS IN STUDY HAILED
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 American children, youths and young adults may be able to read better than had been thought, according to what is described as'the nation's first census  like assessment of reading ability.

title: Gold Price, at $52.50, Reaches Postwar Peak Speculation Cited
description: LONDON, May 8The price of gold rose here by more than a dollar today to a new postwar peak of $52.50 an ounce.

title: HAROLD HAFT
description: Harold Haft, sales manager for the women's fashion belts division of Blacher Brothers Sales Corporation, died Saturday at his home, 15 West 72d Street, at the age of 73.

title: Proxmire Criticizes Burns Over Bucher
description: WASHINGTON, May 8 (AP) Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, accused Arthur M. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, today of packing the board with inexperienced amateurs.

title: B. & M. IS ASSAILED BY RAIL PRESIDENT
description: BOSTON, May 8 (AP)  The president of two railroads in upstate New York said today that both might collapse if the Boston & Maine Railroad abandoned its main line across western Massachusetts.

title: Harriet Henders, 68, Soprano At the Met in the 40's, Is Dead
description: CARMEL, N. Y., May 9 Mrs. Harriet Henderson Kojis, former Metropolitan Opera soprano as Harriet Henders, died) last night in Putnam Community Hospital of injuries suffered in an automobile accident last week, She was 68 years old and lived at 12 West Road.

title: Roundup. Indians Rookie Clicks for Second Victory
description: A year ago Dick Tidrow was pitching for Reno in the California League. He appeared in just seven games and finished the season with four victories and no defeats. Last night the 25yearold, right  handed rookie pitched the Cleveland Indians to a 21 victory over Kansas City. He held the Royals to four hits before yielding the mound to Steve Mingori for the final out in the ninth inning.

title: FIRESTONE CONFIRMS BROKERAGE ACTION
description: The Firestone Tire and Rubber Company confirmed yesterday that it had recently exercised its option to obtain a 25 per cent equity interest in Drexel Firestone, Inc., the investment house, which is undergoing management changes.

title: TIMOTHY CARBERRY
description: Timothy Francis Carberry, a general partner in the brokerage firm of Edwards & Hanley and former president of Metal Traders Inc., died Monday at Nassau Hospital in Mineola, L.I. He was 66 years old and lived on Hoaglands Lane in Old Brookville, L.I.

title: Spic & Span and Cascade To Carry Warning Labels
description: WASHINGTON May 9 (UPI) Procter & Gamble bowed reluctantly today to a Food and Drug Administration order requiring warning labels on Spic & Span Cleanser and Cascade dishwashing detergent.

title: MRS. ERNEST ALTENHEIN
description: Mrs. Claire Reckling Altenhein, widow of Ernest F. Altenhein, an engineer and inventor for the Koppers Company in Germany, England and the United States, died yesterday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 92 years old and lived at 215 East 68th Street.

title: Lerner Stores Sales Off 14.7% Front 1971 Level
description: Lerner: Stores Corporation, the country's largest chain of women's apparel shops, said yesterday that its sales for April dropped 14.7 per cent to $30,224,504 frota 05,452,694 in April1971.

title: COMSAT SEES GAIN OF 20% IN TRAFFIC
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The worldwide network of earth stations is expected to exceed 80 antennas at 64 sites by the end of this year, Joseph V. Charyk, president of the Communications Satellite Corporation, said here today. He told about 100 stockholders at the annual meeting that 10 countries, including China, were expected to build 17 new antennas this year.

title: Mondale to Propose Cutoff Of Funds for Space Shuttle
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Senator Walter F. Mondale, Minnesota Democrat, said to day that arguments for a space shuttle had become a classic case of bureaucratic deception and waste.

title: Advertising:
description: Joltin Joe Maggio, the Bronx Bombers star of a quarter century ago, is returning to Yankee Stadium but this time as the star of the Bowery Savings Bank.

title: 19 G.B.S. Love Letters To Nurse Bring $4,250
description: An album containing the love letters of George Bernard Shaw to Miss Alice Lockett, a nurse, were sold at auction here yesterday for $4,250. The 19 letters, as often acerbic as tender in their expressions, were the items of chief interest in the largest public offering of Shaw material since the Archibald Henderson collection was sold in 1933.

title: New Work by Sollberger Offers Tribute to Wolpe
description: Speculum Musicae (that's musical mirror in Latin) is the name of a young group of 20thcentury music specialists that came into being last year. At Alice Tully Hall on Monday night the mirror was adjusted to give images of the recent past, most of the works being either by Igor Stravinsky or Stefan Wolpe, or dedicated to the memory of those composers.

title: MICHAEL EVLANOFF
description: Michael Evlanoff, who wrote la biography of Alfred Nobel, died yesterday in the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home. He was 76 years old.

title: British Profit Upswing Fuels Stock Gains
description: LONDON, May 9Company profits are on the upswing in Britain, with three out of four companies reporting better performances for their most recent accounting periods.

title: PRESIDENT WARNS NATION IS IN PERIL
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 9President. Nguyen Van Thieu tonight asked for emergency powers that would allow him to issue decrees subject to subsequent approval by the National Assembly.

title: City Judge Cleared In Vote Fund Case
description: Civil Court Judge Bernard Klieger won acquittal in Federal Court here yesterday on charges of perjury and conspiracy involving political contributions in the 1965 mayoral campaign.

title: MRS. JOHN S. LINEN
description: Mrs. Mary Barron Linen, wife of John S. Linen, retired vice president of the Chase Manhattan Bank who is president of the West Orange (N.J.) branch of the National Newark and Essex Bank, died yesterday at their home in Mendham, N.J. She was 67 years old.

title: Evelina Pierce, 91, ExHead Of Masters School for Girls
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 9 Evelina Pierce, headmistress of the Masters School for Girls in Dobbs Ferry, N.Y., from 1928 to her retirement in 1945, died here today. She was 91 years old.

title: JOURNALISM AWARDS WON BY 5 MAGAZINES
description: Five magazinesArchitecural Record, The Atlantic, Esquire, Mademoiselle and Philadelphia have won the 1972 national magazine awards sponsored by Columbia University's Graduate School of Journalism, it was announced yesterday.

title: MUSIC HALE STARS AT ITS ROCK SHOW
description: Mark Monday night as yet another potentially historic date in the already symbolismheavy history of rock music. It saw the first rock concert ever at the Radio City Music Hall, a benefit program for the Environmental Policy Center.

title: FOUR ARE SENTENCED IN MEDICAID FRAUDS
description: Joseph Krozak, president of a funding concern, who pleaded guilty to involvement in a scheme defrauding the city of $2million in Medicaid payments, was sentenced yesterday with three others in State Supreme Court in the Bronx.

title: Tanzania Criticizes U. S.
description: DAR ES SALAAM, Tanzania, May 9 (Agence FrancePresse)  Tanzania today criticized President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnamese ports as a threat to the lives of the Indochinese people and to all humanity. A Government statement said the United States actions were leading to an increase in acts of killing and sggression.

title: Executive Changes
description: Wikoff Smith, formerly president, has been elected chairman of the board of the Kewanee Oil Company. James T. Bolan was named president and chief executive officer, while Robert A. Lucht was elected executive vice president.

title: ANTISECRECY BILL CLEARED BY HOUSE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The House passed today an antisecrecy bill aimed at reforming the $75millionayear operations of influential Government advisory, committees.

title: F.A.A. Authorizes Grants
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The Federal Aviation Administration said today that it had authorized planning grants of $66,000 to the MinneapolisSt. Paul Metropolitan Airports Commission and $65,000 to the MidAmerica Regional Council Kansas City, Mo.

title: Rangers Win, 32, Trim Bruin Lead to 32
description: BOSTON, May 9  The Stanley Cup that the Boston Bruins won in today's newspapers, on the radio, and over the television was a bit more elusive to capture on Boston Garden ice tonight.

title: Sports of The Time.
description: In 1958, news of a gold strike at Sutter's Mill reached Horace Stoneham, so he hitched up his Conestoga wagon and hauled the New York Giants out to California. To his astonishment, the welcome accorded Willie Mays was restrained, if not downright cool. Willie played center field, a social error in San Francisco. As far as the resident's of the Bay Area were concerned, that position was the exclusive property of the homegrown demigod, Joseph Paul DiMaggio, and anybody who tried to muscle in was an imposter. Though Willie led the Giants with a batting average of .347 and 29 home runs, the clients voted Orlando Cepeda the team's most valuable player.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) Vice President Agnew rejected today a gift bedspread from Gov. Kenneth M. Curtis of Maine, accusing the Democratic Governor of encouraging an antiwar demonstration that marred his recent visit to the state.

title: VIENNA AND PRAGUE IN DISPUTE ON EMIGRE
description: VIENNA, May 9Austria has declared a virtual diplomatic boycott of neighboring Czechoslovakia in the wake of a bor der incident last week that has led to a sharp exchange of notes.

title: TWINS SET BACK YANKEES, 4 TO 2; PETERSON BOWS
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 9Fritz Peterson had another in his longrunning series of dreams the other day.

title: U.S. Unaware of Attacks
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Defense Department said today that it was unaware of the alleged attacks on Chinese freighters. A Pentagon spokesman said that the only possibility was that the vessels had been caught in the middle of a United States air strike on a North Vietnamese coastal installation, but that we certainly did not target any Chinese ships.

title: NEW SECURITY DRIVE ORDERED IN ATHENS
description: ATHENS, May 9The Government ordered a security crackdown today to stem growing agitation by intellectuals and students for greater freedom.

title: With a Fit Reed, Knicks Would Be 73 Favorite
description: The New York Knicks can't really think about next season until they know more about the condition of Willis Reed, who has an appointment with a specialist in Oklahoma City on May 22, but a few final words about this season are definitely in order. It was a remarkably successful year, and the fact that they were beaten by the Los Angeles Lakers for the National Basketball Association championship, should not obscure the fact. Throughout the league, and especially from the Lakers, the Knicks earned outspoken admiration for the way they played with limited physical resources.

title: Europeans Cool to Nixon Move, But Britain Is Major Exception
description: LONDON, May 9President Nixon's decision to mine ports and bomb rail lines in North Vietnam won little support in Europe today. Most comment, official and unofficial, expressed regret that he had chosen to open a new phase of military action in the war.

title: Anloc Seen From Above: War With Unreal Quality
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 9  C130 transport planes flying at 8,000 feet dropped food and ammunition today to the besieged South Vietnamese troops in Anloc, 60 miles north of Saigon.

title: Cambodian Positions Lost
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 9 (UPI)The military command today announced the fall of two more Government positions in the southern provinces, bringing to six the number lost in three days of fighting.

title: RISKS ARE NOTED
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Nixon Administration acknowledged today that the President's decision to seal off North Vietnam's harbors had caused a serious problem for Soviet policymakers and endangered the course of SovietAmerican relations, but said it still hoped that Mr. Nixon could go ahead with his trip to Moscow, as planned, 13 days from now.

title: Louisiana's New Governor Plays Host to 80,000 at Dinner
description: BATON ROUGE, La., May 9Edwin W. Edwards became Governor of Louisiana today and immediately had 80,000 people out to dinner.

title: Concessionaire Linked to Mob At Detroit Track by House Aide
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) An investigator for a House committee said today there was a link between the biggest national sports concessionaire and what he called a Mafiacontrolled race track near Detroit.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) Further study of a transCanada pipeline to carry oil from Alaska's North Slope was urged today by three environmentalist groups in a report questioning the environmental and economic soundness of a transAlaska route.

title: Ford to. Start New Run
description: DETROIT, May 9 (AP)The Ford Motor Company said today that it would begin producing some 1972 models July 17, just about the same date it got started on the new car run a year ago.

title: Swig of Antifreeze Mistaken For Wine Fatal to Fireman
description: MOUNT VERNON, N. Y., May 9 (AP)James Norberg, a fireman, spotted a wine bottle on April 28 in a neighbor's garage, where, he kept his car, and took a swig from ft.

title: U.S. AND BRAZIL SIGN FISHERY AGREEMENT
description: BRASILIA, May 9  The United States and Brazil signed an agreement here today intended to regulate the operations of United States shrimp boats in the rich waters off the mouth of the Amazon River.

title: WALTER S. SOBOTKA, ARCHITECT, TEACHER
description: Walter S. Sobotka, an architect who had taught at the Carnegie Institute of Technology in Pittsburgh, died of a heart attack on Monday at his home, 412 Cathedral Parkway. He was 83 years old.

title: Lilly Letter on Pain Killer Called Violation by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The Food and Drug Administration said today that the Ell Lilly Company had broken the law by, sending a misleading 'Dear Doctor letter defending its painkiller Darvon after a medical journal said the drug was little more effectivebut vastly more expensivethan aspirin.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your April 10 editorial Energy Crisis Ahead is truly startling. First, in the interests of pressing your view that frivolous energy consumption should be stopped (i.e., some residential use; certainly not power to run presses to produce multihundredpage newspapers on Sundays) you abandon your traditional freetrade position and become concerned with the political dangers of increased reliance on fuel imports.

title: President Took Nearly a Week To Reach His Vietnam Decision
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Even though he began to move nearly a week ago toward his decision to mine the harbors of North Vietnam, President Nixon did not give the final signal to the military to execute the plan until nearly 2 P.M. yesterdayseven hours before his speech to the nation and minutes after a final, sober private talk with the two men who were closest to him during his deliberations.

title: A Message for the Media
description: WESTON, Conn. A modest anniversary falls this spring. Exactly 25 years ago the Commission on Freedom of the Press, under the chairmanship of Robert M. Hutchins, issued a general report on mass communications entitled, A Free and Responsible Press.

title: Mr. Nixon's Brinkmanship
description: In ordering the closing of land and sea supply routes to North Vietnam by American military action, President Nixon is taking a desperate gamble that alters the entire nature of the war, that risks the fundamental security and deepest interests of the United States for dubious and tenuous gains, and that runs counter both to Congressional mandate and to the will and conscience a large segment of the American people.

title: Text of the North Vietnamese Comment on Nixon
description: PARIS, May 9Following, in unofficial translation from the French, is the text of an official commentary made public today by the North Vietnamese delegation to the peace talks here in reply to President Nixon's address last night:

title: Adm. Rembrandt Robinson, 47; Commanded Flotilla in Vietnam
description: Rear Adm. Rembrandt C. Robinson, who was killed Monday in the Tonkin Gulf, was the first officer of flag rank to be killed in Vietnam, according to the Navy.

title: New Maritime Law Head
description: J. Edwin Carey, senior member of the New York law firm of Hill, Rivkins, Warburton, McGowan & Carey, has been named president of the Maritime Law Association of the United States. He succeeds John C. McHose of Los Angeles as head of the association, which is comprised of more than 2,000 admiralty lawyers throughout the country. The group is affiliated with the American Bar Association.

title: DraftWhite Unit Formed
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Formation of a committee to draft Supreme Court Justice Byron R. White as a Democratic Presidential nominee was announced at a news conference today. Charles C. Mottley of Fairfax County, Va, said he would seek the necessary signatures of 50 delegates to the Democratic National Convention to bring Justice White's name before the convention as a nominee.

title: Congress Told That Sanitary Conditions in Food Industry Are Deteriorating
description: The General Accounting Office has warned Congress that sanitary conditions in the United States food industry are deteriorating and that thhe Food and Drug Administration has not been able to provide the assurance of consumer protection required by the law.

title: WALDHEIM SEEKS VIETNAM SESSION
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 9  Secretary General Waldheim said today that the time has now come when the full machinery of the United Nations should be used to end the war in Vietnam.

title: Metropolitan Museum Staff Protests Proposed Cuts
description: With dripping signs that read Save Our Staff and Must We Pay for Hoving's Edifice Complex?, nearly 100 people paraded before the Metropolitan Museum yesterday to protest proposed staff layoffs and progaam cuts.

title: A New Soviet Missile Chief Is Disclosed
description: MOSCOW, May 9The Soviet Union disclosed today that it had summoned a rocket specialist from the Chinese border and made him the new commander of the nation's strategic missile forces.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Nothing more clearly indicates the double standard many otherwise intelligent people apply to the Vietnam war than the reaction to the sad news [April 26] that the Mylai residents who survived the Calley massacre and were rebuilding their lives with American aid have now been overrun and massacred by the Vietcong.

title: Trial Told Miss Davis Rushed to Plane
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 9An airline ticket agent testified today at the murderconspiracy trial of Angela Davis that she saw the defendant rushing to catch a plane shortly after the shootings Aug. 7, 1970, during an attempted breakout at the Marin County Courthouse.

title: View in Paris Is That Deadlock Still Centers on Thiea's Status
description: PARIS, May 9The basic and thus far unnegotiable demand of the North Vietnamese and Vietcong delegations herethat President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam leave officeremains at the center of the deadlock in private and public sessions of the. Paris talks.

title: G.M. Planning to Assemble Diesel Engines in England
description: DETROIT, May 9 (UPI)The General Motors Corporation announced today it will begin assembling Detroit diesel engines in England.

title: Metropolitan A.A.U. Names Liguori Top Area Athlete
description: Marty Liguori, one of the world's fastest mile runners, will be honored tomorrow night by the Metropolitan Amateur. Athletic Union. He will receive the Meritorious Award as the metropolitan area's outstanding amateur athlete at the association's annual dinner at the Downtown Athletic Club.

title: Past Bids to Halt Foe's Supply Failed,
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Attempts to stop the flow of men, weapons and supplies over land routes by the use of air power have uniformly failed throughout the history of the Korea and Vietnam wars.

title: Nets Play 2 Tomorrow, Afternoon and at Night
description: The New York Mets resorted to an unusual splitdoubleheader yesterday in rescheduling last night's game with the Los Angeles Dodgers, which was postponed by rain and wet grounds.

title: Stage: Douglass Opens
description: Born a slave, Frederick Douglass raised himself to change the course of American history. Selfeducated to such an extent that his fellow abolitionists worried that audiences would not believe he had ever been a slave, Douglass stunned America (and England) with his oratory.

title: Italian Vote Results Portend Further Unstable Rule
description: ROME, May 9Final returns for the parliamentary elections held Sunday and yesterday announced this afternoon, appeared to perpetuate the unstable pattern of Italy's democracy.

title: HOPES IN VIETNAM RAISED BY MINING
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 9American military officers and South Vietnamese officials today approved President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnamese harbors, but doubts were expressed that the step would force an early end to the enemy's offensive within South Vietnam.

title: In 5 States, Ombudsmen Spur Aid to Citizens
description: After dozens of birds mysteriously died at the University of Nebraska campus in Lincoln last fall, students accused the school's athletic department of killing them so they would not disturb football fans who gathered at the stadium each Saturday.

title: Dollar Weakens
description: PARIS, May 9  European gold, stock and currency markets reacted sharply today to President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnamese ports.

title: U.S. Charges Exploitation Of Chinese.
description: The Federal Department of Labor accused 52 apparel contracting shops in Chinatown yesterday of repeatedly failing to keep accurate wageandhour records on their employesmainly women who have recently emigrated from Hong Kong and Taiwan.

title: BETTER ENERGY USE URGED BY U.S. AIDE
description: Russell E. Train, chairman of the President's Council on Environmental Quality, said last night that more efficient uses of oil, natural gas and coal should be found.

title: Workers in Quebec Walk Out To Protest Jailing of 3 Leaders
description: MONTREAL, May 9Several thousand workers walked off their jobs today to protest against oneyear prison terms imposed yesterday on three union leaders who defied backtowork court order in a recent strike of public service workers in the province of Quebec.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 9 (AP)The Federal Price Commission will provide a retraction of a charge that the Ohio Farm Bureau Federation did not file a quarterly profit margin report as required, Farm Bureau official said today.

title: Detective and 15 Alleged Gamblers Indicted in Inquiry on Brooklyn Corruption
description: A detective and 15 gamblers were indicted and 12 policemen were suspended yesterday in connection with a corruption investigation that has already led to the indictment of 24 other policemen and the suicide of a police lieutenant.

title: Coast Lawyer Sues Nader; Says He Was Denied Prize
description: LOS ANGELES, May 9 (UPI) A lawyer here is suing Ralph Nader for allegedly concealing facts, withholding funds and engaging in misrepresentations to save money.

title: Unlikely Hero Turns Up for Rangers
description: BOSTON, May 9 Of course, Bobby Rousseau had read about the preparations for the Bruins celebration, and he'd seen the Bruin poster, 1972 Champions, which someone had placed in the Ranger locker room.

title: PREMARITAL SEX BY GIRLS STUDIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Nearly half of all unmarried women have had sexual intercourse by the time they are 19 years old and most of them have run high risks of becoming pregnant, according to a Federal research report published today.

title: FOE'S STATEMENT
description: PARIS, May 9North Vietnam declared today that the Vietnamese people will never accept Mr. Nixon's ultimatum.

title: MOURN VICTOR OVER HUMPHREY IN NEBRASKA VOTE Dakotan's Margin Narrow Minnesotan Easily Tops Wallace in West Virginia
description: OMAHA, Wednesday, May, 10 Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, withstanding a hard 10day campaign challenge from Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota, emerged today as the winner of yesterday's Nebraska Presidential preference primary.

title: $131Million in Contracts Let by Airlift Command
description: The Air Force's Military Airlift Command announced yesterday it has awarded $131.5million in contracts to 17 commercial airlines for international passenger and cargo airlift estimated for the fiscal year 1973. This compares with the estimated 1972 fiscalyear contracts of about $350million.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: STUART F. HEINRITZ
description: GRAFTON, Vt., May 9 Stuart F. Heinritz, editor emeritus of Purchasing, a trade journal, died today in Springfield Hospital. He was 78 years old.

title: Fairman, Head of. Athletics, Retires. From Princeton Job
description: PRINCETON N.J., May 9R. Kenneth Fairman, a driving force in Eastern collegiate athletics for the last four decades, announced his retirement today as Princeton's director of athletics after 35 years at that post.

title: THE 1972 CAMMAIGN
description: CHICAGO, May 9In the nineteenthirties, Ralph H. Metcalfe won an Olympic medal as a sprinter. Then he went home to Chicago and after a time went into Democratic politics.

title: A NOFAULT BILL LOSES IN SENATE
description: ALBANY, May 9The modified no fault autoinsurance bill sought by Governor Rockefeller was defeated in the Senate late tonight after the opposition denounced it as designed more for the insurance industry than for the consumer.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two Bronx high school students were fined $10 each yesterday and ordered by the judge to scrub their markerpen signatures from the walls of a Transit Authority bus.

title: FASHION TALK
description: It isn't the state of the hemline that's agitating designers presenting fall collections this week and retailers viewing them. It's whether women are going to bother wearing dresses at all. Women too young to collect Social Security checks, that is.

title: REVIEW IS ASKED ON DOCK PAY CUT
description: Management and labor in the East and Gulf Coast longshore industry decided yesterday to ask the Pay Board to reconsider its action rolling back negotiated wage increase from 70 cents an hour to 55 cents.

title: Drug Treatment Program Is Abandoned by Hospital
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 9 (AP)  A carbon dioxide treatment program for drug addicts, the center of controversy since a patient died in March, was abandoned today by Hahanemann Hospital.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your April 27 editorial on Senator McGovern puzzles me. On the one hand, McGovern's 52 per cent clear majority30 percentage points ahead of Humphreyand his sweep of the Bay State's 102member delegation is far from conclusive in Massachusetts.

title: Lindsay Terms Gang Situation Well Under Control by Police
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that the police had the volatile situation created by the growing number of youth gangs well in hand and that they would take a no nonsense attitude toward gang members who carried guns or indulged in violence.

title: Exchange Index Drops 0.33, Most Since Last August
description: Concern over Vietnam developments sent stocks down yesterday on the American Stock Exchange. The index fell 0.33 to 27.07. This decline was the biggest since Aug. 3, 1971, when the index dropped 0.35. Yesterday's volume totaled 5,945,835, up from 3,147,410 on Monday, a slow trading day.

title: Decorative Plates Not Fine Art, but They're Good as Gold
description: Cornball they may be. Fine art they are not. But thousands of collectors who buy the limited, and not so limited, editions of decorative plates, could not care less.

title: FUTURES IN GRAIN DECLINE IN PRICE
description: The commodities futures market for the most part proceeded cautiously yesterday following the President's military action in Vietnam. Trading in general was slow.

title: CORE Endorses Wingate In House Race With Rangel
description: The Congress of Racial Equality announced yesterday its endorsement of Livingston L. Wingate for the 19th Congressional District seat held by Charles B. Rangel.

title: STUDY DISCOUNTS MARIJUANA VIEW
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 An experiment in which 20 persons smoked marijuana every day for three weeks indicates that heavy use of the drug may not directly affect motivation, according to a Governmentsponsored report released today.

title: White House Swamped By Calls and Telegrams
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Ronald L. Ziegler, the White House press secretary, said in response to questions today that after President Nixon's speech last night the White House switchboard was jammed by incoming calls to a greater degree than I can recall.

title: Rail Meetings Held
description: The Union Pacific Corporation is moving into the development of foreign crude oil reserves by participation in an exploration group that will be operating by July in the North Sea off Scotland, Frank E. Barnett, chairman, told the annual meeting in Salt Lake City yesterday.

title: 2 EXPENNSY AIDES ACCUSED OF FRAUD
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 9 (AP) Two former Penn Central executives were ordered held for grand jury action today on charges of fraud and conspiracy.

title: REFORM IS ASKED FOR PROPERTY TAX
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, said today that there was no possible alternative source for the $40billion that is raised annually through the property tax and that it must, therefore, be reformed rather than abolished.

title: Coastal States Gas Profit a Record
description: The Coastal States Gas Producing Company reported yesterday record results for the nine months ended March 31, with earnings up 13 per cent from the yearearlier period on a 6 per cent gain in revenues.

title: S.E.C. Clarifies Stand
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The Securities and Exchange Commission warned investment managers today that they must be prepared to prove they had a valid reason for placing securities transactions with brokers with whom they are affiliated, if the affiliated brokers did not offer the best available price.

title: Women's Film Festival Will Begin Here June 5
description: The first international Festival of Women's Films will be held June 5th through June 21 at the Fifth Avenue Cinema, near 12th Street. The schedule is composed of 13 features, 4 documentary features and 13 programs of short subjects.

title: Market Place: An Unusual Way To Raise Money
description: You're a small hightechnology company with a lot of new product ideas. You're already profitable with a line of electronic memorystorage devices and you enjoy a high priceearnings multiple.

title: Screen: Cliff Robertson's 'J. W. Coop':Film's Star Also Wrote, Directed, Produced It
description: "J. W. Coop," written, directed and produced by Cliff Robertson, who also plays its title role, is the story of 10 months in the life of a lonely, slightly overage rodeo circuit rider, photographed almost entirely in and around those small Western rodeos that canif the rider is goodearn a man $60,000 a year, plus another $60,000 in endorsements for things like soft drinks and underwear.When it limits its focus to what J. W. Coop is thinking, or tries to interpret his emotions, the film is unsurprisingly self-conscious, the work of a new filmmaker who is no better or worse than you might expect him to be. When, however, it draws back to see and hear the world around J. W. Coop, which is most of the time, it becomes very fine, almost elegiac, as full of feeling for rootless American lives as any film I've seen since "Derby," which was, after all, a documentary.According to the production notes, Robertson researched his screenplay by following the rodeo circuit and tape-recording conversations, but that cannot, I think, explain the accuracy of so many things in the film not immediately related to professional rodeoing. Overheard at a hamburger stand is a child calling: "When's dinner, Mom?" Answers the impatient mom as she climbs into a Barracuda, or a Galaxy, or a Comet, or some such vehicle: "When I get done bowling!"Robertson's screenplay is no great shakes as narrative, but it takes a certain courage to amble as amiably as it does. The film follows Coop from his release after nine years in prison (for passing a bad check and then beating up a sheriff), through his return to the rodeo circuit and an idealized affair with a funny, ecology-minded, nut-chewing hippie (Christina Ferrare), up through the rodeo championships in Oklahoma City.It includes quite a lot of spectacular rodeo footage, and dramatic things do happen to Coop in and out of the arena, but Robertson wisely allows his character, which he plays with beautifully authentic, small-town Texas accent, to be defined as much by what we see as by what he does. The movie records things that Coop doesn't necessarily noticea Texas bus in which all the blacks sit in the front seats while the whites more or less huddle in the back, a rodeo parade with a huge, flowered float labeled "Church of The Nazarene." When an old cowboy wants to stress a point, he says, "I guaran-damntee!"The language is beautiful and often very funny. This isas far as I can rememberthe first film in which (as reported in dialogue) an airplane has ever been eaten by cows, in which a truck driver talks, with absolute sincerity, about the blessings of Jimmy Hoffa, and in which a farmer philosophizes about labor: "You don't agitate the fruit, and you don't agitate the pickers."There are occasional moments when the movie goes awkwardly sentimental, when it weeps for the passing of the old and the coming of the new, but its point of view is mostly amused and tough, and full of unpatronizing appreciation for its people, the rodeo characters as well as the professional actors. Of the latter, the most noticeable, next to Robertson himself, is Geraldine Page as Coop's addle-brained mother who keeps her radio tuned to cheery revivalists and apparently sleeps with a chicken in her bedroom."J.W. Coop" opened yesterday at the Columbia Theater.

title: Justice White Asks Schools To Help Ease Courts Load
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla., May (UPI)Supreme Court Justice Byron R. White said today that'the nation's courts were in deep trouble because of heavy case loads and he urged law schools to find ways of solving legal disputes out of court.

title: Italian Payments Deficit
description: ROME, May 9 (Reuters) Italy had a balanceofpayments deficit of 66.2billion lire in March, down from February's deficit of 91billion lire, but up from last March's surplus of 13.7billion lire, according to provisional figures issued today by the Bank of Italy.

title: Advertising:
description: Another famous American brand name will slip into the mists of history with the new year as Esso gasoline becomes Exxon and the Humble Oil and Refining Company, which produces it, becomes the Exxon Company.

title: WGOVERN'S AIDES ACCUSE HUMPHREY
description: In the opening round of the New York Presidential primary, leaders of Senator Geroge McGovern's campaign charged that Senator Hubert H. Humphrey was trying to avoid a direct confrontation with Mr. McGovern by dealing with party leaders for national convention delegates.

title: PAY BOARD HEARS PLEA BY ATHLETES
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Representatives of professional baseball, basketball and football players told the Pay Board today that the atheletes should be exempt from the Government's rules for noninflationary salary increases.

title: Jersey System to Rate Statewide Air Pollution
description: TRENTON, May 9 The New Jersey Department of Environmental Protection said today that air quality ratings from its statewide monitoring system would be issued daily to the state's communication media starting next Tuesday.

title: Condemnation in East Bloc
description: LONDON, May 9 (Reuters)Radio stations in Eastern Europe were unanimous today in condemning President Nixon's new moves in Vietnam, and several forecast that they would jeopardize the chances of success of his visit to the Soviet Union this month.

title: Atom Safety Shift Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) Senator Richard S. Schweiker, Republican of Pennsylvania, today proposed taking responsibility for safety from radiation poisoning away from the Atomic Energy Commission and giving it to a new Federal Agency. A builtin conflict of interest now exists in the Atomic Energy Commission between its duties as both promoter and regulator of the peaceful uses of atomic energy, he said.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISItaly may have the most democratic regime in the Mediterranean but it suffers from one disturbing weakness: It doesn't often work. As Bainville said of the Versailles Treaty: It's too hard to be soft and too soft to be hard.

title: Assembly Votes to Repeal Liberalized Abortion Law
description: ALBANY, May 9After nearly six arduous hours of speeches, the Assembly voted tonight, 79 to 68, to repeal the liberalized abortion law it barely passed in agonizing debate two years ago.

title: Airline Seeks Gain
description: William T. Seawell, who took command of troubled Pan American World Airways six weeks ago, told shareholders yesterday that he could not predict when the airline would become profitable again. But he forecast that Pan Am would have a smaller loss this year than last year's deficit of $45.5million. Pan Am has reported a $31million loss for this year's first quarter.

title: U.S. Bars the Reelection Of 3 to I.T.T. Board Today
description: A Federal judge in Philadelphia has ruled that three directors of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation may not stand for reelection at the company's annual meeting in Memphis today.

title: Price Changes
description: Uniroyal, Inc., announced yesterday that it would increase prices by an average of 4 per cent on a number of selected industrial product lines. Covered by the increase, which goes into effect May 15, are conveyor belting, sheet rubber, engineered rubber products and industrial hose. Also on that date, prices of power transmission belting  excluding Vbelts will be raised by an average of 3.5 per cent.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: DANIEL A. COHEN, 51, OF LOEWS THEATERS
description: Daniel A. Cohen vice president and Eastern general manager of Loews Theaters, a division of Loews Corporation, died of a heart attack in Parsons Hospital, Flushing, Queens, on Monday night. He was 51 years old and lived at 23.50 217th Street, Bayside, Queens.

title: Equity on the Docks
description: The Pay Board has coupled firmness with fairness its decision to trim 15 cents an hour off the inflationary wage settlements covering dock workers in Atlantic and Gulf ports.

title: About Motor Sports
description: If there is a Diogenes searching for an honest man in stockcar racing, one possible nominee is Marty Robbins, whose story is a fitting sequel to a study of cheating published here on Sunday. It seems Robbins discovered he was inadvertently cheating in Sunday's Winston 500 at Talladega, Ala., where he finished 18th. Robbins turned himself In, forfeiting the $980 purse and incurring a fine of $250. Most important, Robbins declined to accept the rookieoftherace trophy because, as he said flatly, I was illegal.

title: Talks With Connally Are Being Sought By Canadian Aide
description: MONTREAL, May 9John N. Turner, the Canadian Minister of Finance, this evening called on John B. Connally, the United States Secretary of the Treasury to agree to a meeting between the two of them.

title: WILLIAM H. HOLLINGS
description: RAHWAY, N. J., May 9 William H. Hollings, who retired in 1950 as a branch manager for the Manufacturers Trust Company, died of a heart attack after surgery in Rahway Hospital today. He was 81 years old and lived at 471 Seminary Avenue.

title: State Senate Votes $12Million To Improve and Reform Prisons
description: ALBANY, May 9The Senate approved the appropriation of $12million today for reforms and improvements in the state prison system sought by Governor Rockefeller in the aftermath of the rebellion at the Attica Correctional Facility last September.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: DETROIT, May 9  Gov. George C. Wallace's bid for the Democratic Presidential nomination will include a writein campaign in the California primary next month.

title: Raid Alerts Keep Hanoi Busy; War Called ReAmericanized
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 9 (Agence FrancePresse)The loudspeakers of Hanoi spoke out at 7:50 A.M. today, warning the inhabitants that enemy planes were 32 miles to the southeast.

title: Eastern Gas and Fuel Says It Filed Profit Data Forms
description: BOSTON, May 9 (AP)Eastcm Gas and Fuel Associates said today that it had filed all necessary forms for the Price Commission on March 30.

title: Mrs. Mink, Vying With McGovern, Offers Oregon a Choice
description: PORTLAND, Ore.He was sturdy, athletic young man in sweatshirt, and he shot his question hard across the gymnasium at the diminutive JapaneseAmerican woman standing at the other microphone.

title: Rise in Vietcong Activity Near Saigon Is Reported
description: PHUHOA, South Vietnam, May 9The women and children of this dusty, sunbaked village stood anxiously by the road with bundles of their meager possessions today, waiting for, the bus to Saigon and safety. North. Vietnamese troops attacked Phuhoa last night and promised to return soon.

title: APAWAMIS REACHES GOLF TITLE PLAYOFF
description: The Women's Metropolitan Golf Association's interclub team matches, schedujed to he completed yesterday, were disrupted by rain. The courses around the district of Long Island, Westchester and New Jersey were deemed unplayable with the exception of two.

title: Orantes Ousts McManus
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 9 (UPI)  Topseeded Manuel Orantes of Spain dropped only one game today in routing Jim McManus of Berkeley, Calif., 6.0, 61, and advancing to the round of 16 in the $26,650 Belgian open tennis championships.

title: Judge Denies Federal Plea To Join Detroit School Case
description: DETROIT, May 9 (AP) United States District Judge Stephen J. Roth denied today a Justice Department motion seeking to intervene in the Detroit school integration case.

title: Reprieve for Italy
description: Italy's Christian Democrats have managed to pull themselves together in crisis and hold their ground against strong challenges from left and right in the sixth Parliamentary election since the fall of Fascism. The unexpectedly strong showing by the Catholic party that has led every Government for 26 years helped, contain within manageable bounds a surge toward the neoFascist Italian Social Movement.

title: ANTIWAR PROTESTS ERUPT ACROSS U.S.
description: With mass marches, windowsmashing sprees, silent vigils and trafficblocking sitins, antiwar protesters by the thousands took to the streets yesterday in response to President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnamese ports.

title: Nets Win in Last Minute, 117115
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 9Even though they fell behind after holding a 15point lead with 4 minutes 50 seconds left to play, the New York Nets staggered to a 117115 victory over the Indiana Pacers tonight before an overflow crowd of 10,079 at the Fairgrounds Coliseum.

title: Economic Analysis
description: As Senator George McGovern becomes a more credible contender for the Presidencyespecially if the Vietnam war dragsWall Street and the business community have begun to worry about his populist economic proposals. These include heavier taxation of capital gains; heavier gift and inheritance taxes; closing what he describes as $28billion in tax loopholes far the rich and pow erful; raising the corporate income tax; phasing out oil, gas, mineral and other depletion allowances; and eliminating the recently enacted investment tax credit, accelerated depreciation and deferral of taxes on export earnings through DISCSDomestic International Sales Corporations.

title: He Holds Out Hope That Hanoi Will Consider Terms Acceptable
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Henry A. Kissinger today described the peace proposal outlined by President Nixon last night as a modification of previous American offers and said it would leave the determination of Vietnam's political future to the Vietnamese.

title: STOCKS DECLINE ON NIXON SPEECH
description: The nation's securities and commodities markets weakened yesterday in response to President Nixon's announcement of new military initiatives in North Vietnam.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAING
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va, May 9Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota coasted to an overwhelming victory over Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama tonight in West Virginia's Presidential preference primary.

title: Draft Will Call 9,000 With Numbers 1 to 35
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP)The Selective Service System announced today that it would order about 9,000 young men with lottery number 1 through 35 to report to the Army in June.

title: Poland Officially Silent, But Anxiety Is Voiced
description: WARSAW, May 9 (UPI)The Government of Poland, which is to play host to President Nixon later this month, privately voiced anxiety today over complications caused by the United States decision to blockade North Vietnamese ports.

title: Episcopal Diocese Votes For Women in Priesthood
description: The Episcopal Diocese of New York yesterday endorsed a change in church rules to permit the ordination of women to the priesthood.

title: Suffolk Approves Reorganizing of Police and Moving of Young Officers to Command Posts
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., May 9The Suffolk County Legislature today approved a major reorganization of the 3,000member County Police Department, the creation of a fourth division, the abolishment of the position of chief inspector and the advancement of a number of younger officers into command positions.

title: Stocks Tumble in Heavy Trading
description: Stock prices buckled yesterday in reaction to President Nixon's address Monday night announcing the mining of North Vietnamese ports and other measures taken to prevent the flow of arms and military supplies to the enemy.

title: LEVEL OF CAPACITY FOR OIL DECLINES
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 9 (AP) The nation's crude oil producing capacity was reported today to have dropped to its lowest level in five years.

title: Microfilm Industry Displays Products At Big Show Here
description: The National Microfilm Association yesterday opened the largest convention and exposition in its 21year history.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: During the course of market trading yesterday, it was announced that several stock offerings, originally scheduled to have been made, were postponed. Uncertain market conditions were cited for the postponements of such marketings as Riblet Products, 231,000 common shares; DurrFillauer Medical, Inc., 350,000 shares; Kleinert's, Inc., 350,000 shares; Advanced Computer Supplies, Inc., 110,000 shares; the Mercury General Corporation, 400,000 shares, and the Thermo Electron Corporation, 150,000 shares.

title: Merger News
description: The National Kinney Corporation has agreed to acquire the Holmes Protection Services Corporation, which owns 83.4 per cent of the stock of Holmes Protection, Inc., it was reported to stockholders yesterday by Paul Milstein, president.

title: Democratic Caucus in the Senate Condemns the Escalation in Vietnam by 29 to 14
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Senate Democrats today passed by a vote of 29 to 14 a resolution disapproving the escalation of the war in Vietnam.

title: Hurricane Education Urged
description: MIAMI, May 9 (AP)There is an urgent need for a public education program on hurricanes, and their often devastating consequences, George A. Lincoln, the national director of emergency preparedness, told 350 officials attending a ninestate Hurricane Preparedness Conference in Miami today.

title: Credit Markets
description: The bond market regained yesterday afternoon much of the ground lost earlier in the first reaction to President Nixon's decision to seal off North Vietnamese ports.

title: Bus Mechanics to Return Today; Jersey Service Due by Weekend
description: NEWARK, May 9Another attempt will be made tomorrow to prepare for the resumption of service on some routes of the strikebound Transport of New Jersey Bus Company, by the weekend.

title: Israelis Kill 2 Hijackers And Free 100 on Airliner
description: TEL AVIV, May 9About dozen Israeli paratroops wearing the white overalls of El Al maintenance crews burst into hijacked Belgian airliner parked at Lydda Airport this afternoon and rescued 90 passengers and 10 crewmen.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Ivy League presidents have rendered a great service to higher education in their joint statement of April 19 deploring renewed American bombing of North Vietnam and its civilian population. Making this forthright declaration obviously took tremendous courage.

title: ExRep. William Williams Of Upstate District Dies
description: UTICA, N.Y., May 9 (AP)Former Representative William R. Williams died today in Faxton Hospital. He was 87 years old.

title: Soviet and Chinese Choices Assayed by Pentagon Aides
description: WASHINGTON, May 9American military analysts say that the Soviet Union and China have a number, of options in responding to the mining of the ports of North Vietnam.

title: U.S. IN WIDE RAIDS
description: SAIGON, South Vietnamo Wednesday, May 10Two hundred United States fighterbombers ranged over North Vietnam yesterday from the demilitarized zone to Hanoi in a heavy bombing and minelaying campaign aimed at cutting road and rail links with China and blocking the ports.

title: Mays Will Be Invited to Join GiantsNets Trade Talks
description: The summit meeting on Willie Mays began here yesterday, and Round One ended a few hours later with the San Francisco Giants and New York Mets stalemated over price.

title: F.B.I. HOLDS SUSPECT IN GANG WAR HERE
description: Salvatore Albanese, 37 years old, who had been sought by the police for questioning in connection with the recent Mafia gang war, was arrested yesterday by Federal Bureau of Investigation agents on probation violations.

title: No Mention Made of Trip
description: MOSCOW, May 9Tass, the Soviet press agency, today criticized President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnamese ports as a violation of international law, but gave no indication whether the move would force the cancellation of Mr. Nixon's scheduled trip to Moscow in two weeks.

title: 11 British Soldiers Injured In Londonderry Explosion
description: LONDONDERRY, Northern Ireland, May 9 (AP)  Eleven soldiers were slightly wounded early today after a bomb exploded between two huts of a British Army company headquarters.

title: NASDAQ TO QUOTE LISTED SECURITIES
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May (AP)The National Association of Securities Dealers voted unanimously today to allow quotations on any stockexchange listed security to be displayed on its automatic quotation system for overthecounter securities.

title: Books of The Times
description: ON THE DEMOCRATIC IDEA IN AMERICA. By Irving Kristol. 149 pages. Harper & Row $5

title: Retirement Tax Bill Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The American Bankers Association gave its support today to a House bill permitting individuals to make bigger taxdeductible contributions to approved retirement plans of their own. The association's spokesman appeared before the House Ways and Means Committee.

title: M. B. VER STANDIG
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 M. Belmont Ver Standig, a former advertising agency executive and founder of a chain of jewelry stores, died today of an aneurism at his home here. He was 57 years old.

title: Helsinki Talks Held.
description: HELSINKI; Einiand, May 9President Nixon's decision to nine North Vietnamese ports was not mentioned When United. States and Soviet negotiators met today for an hour at the talks on limitation of strategic arms, a conference source said.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. The President had a breakfast meeting with Senators Mansfield and Scott, to hear their report on their China trip.

title: NORTON SIMON SETS 2FOR1 STOCK SPLIT
description: Norton Simon, Inc., a consumerproducts company, declared yesterday a twoforone stock split and an initial 25cent annual cash dividend payable quarterly following the commonstock distribution.

title: Excerpts From Kissinger News Conference on U.S.North Vietnamese Exchanges
description: WASHINGTON, May 9Following are excerpts from the official transcript of the news conference held today by Henry A. Kissinger, the President's adviser on national security, in the White House. Mr. Kissinger's opening remarks are followed by questions and answers.

title: Little Early Impact in Highlands Is Seen
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, May 9The senior American adviser to Saigon's hardpressed forces in the Central Highlands said today that it would take several months before President Nixon's decision to mine the Haiphong harbor would have any effect on the campaign here.

title: Canonero II Is Pointed for Carter May 20
description: While last Saturday's victory in the Kentucky Derby by Meadow Stable's Riva Ridge was still being discussed yesterday by horsemen at Aqueduct, hope was raised that King Ranch's Canonero II, the surprise 1971 winner of the Run for the Roses, might return to the races in 10 days.

title: Universal Air Gets Respite For Creditor Arrangements
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 9 (UPI)  The Universal Airlines Company, holding company for Universal Airlines, Inc., has won an order from the Federal Bankruptcy Court to give it time to work out arrangements with creditors.

title: State Relief Unit, Expecting Surge of Appeals, Seeks Funds to Enlarge Staff
description: State welfare officials said yesterday that they were seeking a supplemental budget appropriation to add 25 more hearing officers to the present staff of 12 and to provide six supervisors to cope with an expected flood of appeals from relief recipients.

title: Davis, Cellist, Plays Elegantly As Memorialist for Feuermann
description: The Violoncello Society gave its first. Piatigorsky Artist Award to Douglas Davis, in 1961 when he was 20 yeafs old. The organization apparently still thinks highly of him, because it chose him to give a program in Town Hall on Monday night commemorating the 30th anniversary of Emanuel Feuermann's death.

title: STEIN REASSURES NATION ON PROFITS
description: WASHINGTON, May 9The new flurry of enforcement actions by the Price Commission some involving price rollbacks  does not mean any change in the Administration's desire for a good year for profits, the chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers said today.

title: Bernard B. McGinnis Dies; Pennsylvania State Senator
description: PITTSBURGH, May 9Bernard B. McGinnis, a Pennsylvania State Senator for 28 years and chairman of the Allegheny County Democratic Committee from 1939 to 1964, died today in Divine Providence Hospital. He was 93 years old.

title: Paperwork Discussed
description: WASHINGTON, May (AP) The chairman of a stockbrokers association testified today that little hope existed for solving massive, obstructive paperwork problems unless securities transfers could be coordinated.

title: Bonn Compromise on Ratifying Pacts Hits New Snag
description: BONN, May 9A compromise between Chancellor Willy Brandt's governing coalition of Social Democrats and Free Democrats and the conservative Opposition to assume ratification of West Germany's 1970 treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland hit a snag tonight.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In 1857 the U.S. Supreme Court dispatched Dred Scott back into slavery with Chief Justice Taney's illustrious dictum: A black man has no rights white men are bound to respect.

title: Richard Chamberlain, right, and Patrick Hines
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Disappointment is frequently merely the backlash of expectation. I had gone to the Eisenhower Theater at Kennedy Center to see Richard Chamberlain play the title role in Richard II, and had gone expecting a great deal.

title: 2 Miners, Trapped For Week, Rescued; Idaho Toll Now 47
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, May 9Two men returned alive tonight from the fireswept Sunshine Mine, a week after the conflagration broke out.

title: 200 Protesters Disrupt A Job Fair for Veterans
description: CHICAGO, May 9Two hundred men disrupted a twoday Vietnam Veterans job fair shortly after it opened today, chanting We want jobs now and upsetting tables and curtain partitions.

title: Accord Reached on Sale of Time Inc.'s TV Outlets
description: McGrawHill, Inc., and Time Inc. announced yesterday that they had reached agreement with five minority groups that had challenged the sale of five of Time's TV stations to McGraw Hill.

title: U.S. to Finance Program On Criminal Justice Data
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The Federal Government will finance a new program that will ultimately develop comprehensive programs on statistics on criminal justice in all 50 states, it was announced today.

title: Newsman, in Court, Admits He Stole Uganda Phone Book
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, May 9 (Agence FrancePresse)  Martin Meredith, a British newsman who had been held tin jail here since Sunday, pleaded guilty today in a magistrate's court to having stolen a telephone directory valued at the equivalent of 75 cents.

title: District Attorney Asks Consent To Drop WBAI Case as Moot
description: The Manhattan District Attorney's office asked the Appellate Division of State Supreme Court yesterday to forget about its contempt case against radio station WBAI and WBAI's general manager, Edwin A. Goodman.

title: HOUSE UNIT CLEARS MINIMUM WAGE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) A bill that would raise the minimum wage from $1.60 an hour was cleared today for a House vote under a procedure that marked a setback for its supporters.

title: DONALD COATS, 62, CHURCH ORGANIST
description: Donald L. Coats, organist and choirmaster of St. James Episcopal Church here for 18 years until his retirement a year ago because of illness, died of emphysema Thitrsday at his home in Laguna Hills, Calif. He was 62 years old.

title: Data From Study
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 The following table, drawn from a new report to the Commission on Population Growth and the American Future, shows the proportion of young unmarried women who say they have had sexual intercourse by race and successive years of age:

title: Albany Notes
description: ALBANY, May 9  More and more the cricketlike sound of fingerpoppings is heard in the Assembly as bills pass in a first show of votes, then members who see possible political damage quickly signal the clerk to put them down as No, It is a traditional kind of hedging by lawmakers. They pop their fingers intently at the clerk, Donald Campbell, who calmly takes it all in.

title: Four Days of Rain in Chile Leaves 15,000 Homeless
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 9 (UPI)Four days of continuous rain ended today with 15,000 people homeless and railroad service suspended in a disaster area covering a third of Chile.

title: Speno's Son Is Arrested On Narcotics Charge on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L.I., May 9Thomas Speno, a son of the late State Senator Edward J. Speno, pleaded not guilty at his arraignment in First District Court here today on three charges of possession of narcotics.

title: An Indicted Official Among 5 Winners In Atlantic City Vote
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 9Two incumbent City Commissioners, one of whom was indieted last week by a Federal grand jury on shakedown charges, won reelection tonight in a 34candidate scramble for five posts.

title: FLOOD ALARM SET. UP BY WEATHER SERVICE
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) The National Weather Service is setting up automateic alarm systems that it hopes will save lives in the flash floods that are a chronic threat in many parts of the Eastern United States.

title: $ 11Billion, 3Year Housing Bill Is Voted by House Subcommittee
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) An $11billion, threeyear housing bill with new safeguard provisions for home buyers was approved today by a House Banking subcommittee.

title: Sarah Vaughan Is a Hit at Rikers I. Prison
description: They would have been a smash ticket anywhere in town, but Sarah Vaughan and Dizzy Gillespiewho first worked together 30 years ago chose the Correctional Institution for Men on Rikers Island for a joint appearance yesterday.

title: ArrabalA Storm Over the Wounded
description: In 1967 Fernando Arrabal returned for a visit to Spain from his selfexile in Paris. After writing an obscene inscription in a book, he was arrested for blasphemy and calumny. Before he was acquitted, he spent 24 days in jail. His fellow inmates, many of them political prisoners, asked him to speak about them when he was released. This is exactly what I have done in And They Put Handcuffs on the Flowers', said the playwright. The play is his aggrieved testimony, his cry against injustice.

title: Ohio Farm Coop Picketed
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 9 (AP)About 10 supporters of the United Farm Workers Union picketed the Ohio Farm Bureau's cooperative Landmark, Inc., today to protest the bureau's labor policies. The picketers also demanded a United States Senate investigation of the bureau.

title: Assembly Vote on Abortion Law
description: ALBANY, May 9 Fllowing is the rollcall vote in which the Assembly tonight voted to abolish the state's liberalized abortion law and restore the law permitting abortions only when a mother's life was jeopardized:

title: The President's Offer
description: So much has been said about President Nixon's new military moves in Vietnam that his new and more specific peace terms may be overlooked and underestimated. For while he talked in warrior language about the arrogance and insolence of Hanoi, and backed his warnings with a military challenge to the seaborne Soviet arms in Haiphong and the rail supplies from China, he also offered what amounts to a datecertain for the complete withdrawal of all American forces from Vietnam within four months.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May 9  Can George C. Wallace win a Northern industrial state, a state with a liberal voting tradition and a smoothrunning labordominated Democratic political machine?

title: Government Sues Westchester Over Pollution at Croton Point
description: In a civil complaint that United States attorneys described as broad and unusual, the Federal Government yesterday charged Westchester County with being a major polluter of the Hudson River.

title: Queens Woman Explains Lies in Deportation Case
description: A Queens housewife who faces possible deportation for failing to tell immigration authorities she had been convicted of torturing Nazi concentration camp prisoners said yesterday that at the time she considered her denials of her past a truthful answer.

title: Yield for Commitments On Home Mortgages Rise
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (Reuters)The average yield for 120day conventional homemortgage commitments rose at the monthly auction, the Federal National Mortgage Association announced today.

title: Pollock to Leave Textile Workers Union as Old Guard Steps Down
description: The old guard is changing in some of the top clothing and textile unions centered in New York City.

title: Federal Standards Of Road Safety Set For School Buses
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (AP) The Department of Transportation said today that it had adopted new standards of highway safety for the buses that transport almost 20 million children to school.

title: New Politics Challenging the Old in Brooklyn
description: Representative John J. Rooney pressed the heel of his hand against his aching back. He had got it, he said the other day, in the line of duty, sitting in a draft at a luncheon with Abba Eban, the Israeli Foreign Minister, and Itzhak Rabin, the Israeli Ambassador to the United States.

title: Appellate Court Stays Ruling On Abortion Law in Connecticut
description: Connecticut was granted a temporary stay yesterday of a Federal court ruling that held the state's 112yearold abortion control laws unconstitutional.

title: Some Delay Now Expected In GandhiBhutto Meeting
description: NEW DELHI, May 9The meeting between Prime Minister Indira Gandhi and President Zulfikar All Bhutto of Pakistan, tentatively scheduled for late this month or early next, will, have to be postponed at least until late June, informed sources said today.

title: 20 STUDENTS OCCUPY PRATT DEAN'S OFFICE
description: The office of the dean of students at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn was occupied shortly after 9 A.M. yesterday by 20 members of the institute's Black Students Union who charged that the dean, Richard Streiter, was not sensitive to the needs of black students. They demanded his dismissal.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Prof. Edward Early's analogy between American support of South Vietnam and the conduct of an intermeddler who persuades one of a pair of quarrelling spouses to disregard a reconciliation agreement (letter, May 1) is an example of a misconception cornmonly encountered in academic circles.

title: Quarry Wins a Close Decision Over Middleton, Injures Hand
description: LONDON, May 9  Jerry Quarry pounded The Hammer for 10 rounds tonight, evidently when the referee wasn't looking, and nailed clown a close decision at the cost of swollen left hand.

title: Trudeau Refuses to Make A Statement on Minings
description: OTTAWA, May 9  Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau rejected demands by opposition critics today that he make statement on President Nixion's order to mine North Vietnamese harbors.

title: REINDIENST FOES SEEK MORE FACTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 Three membeti of the Senate Judiciary Comniittee who voted not to approve Richard G. Kleindienst's nomination as Attorney General said today that the Senate would become a party to whitewash if it confirmed the nomination without resolving a number of unanswered questions about the International Thlephone and Telegraph Corporation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On your April 3 OpEd page, Prof. Hillier Krieghbaum asks (in a headline) Who Will Keep the Media's Conscience? and proceeds to propose community media review boards to make judgments concerning the probity of newspapers.

title: Nixon's Pax Americana
description: NEW HAVEN, Conn.Outrage over the new American escalation by bombing and mining of North Vietnam has unfortunately inhibited analysis of American strategy. The President's decision to concentrate available air and naval power from all over the world in the vicinity of Vietnam was in all probability made coolly and unemotionally in the White House and not, as some have suggested, as the frustrated response of a man prone to temper tantrums.

title: SMITH, CONNORS STRUGGLE TO WIN
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 9 (AP)Stan Smith, America's hope for the Wimbledon tennis title, struggled to find his form on a slow court today at the start of his British campaign.

title: Busing Bar in Memphis
description: MEMPHIS, Tenn., May 9 (UPI)The Memphis City Council passed today a measure designed to prohibit the use of local funds for busing to achieve a racial balance in schools. The ordinance was passed on its third and final reading over the objection of the three black members of the 13member council.

title: Bridge:
description: The Westchester Double Knockout Team Championship, which began in the fall with an entry of 37 teams, ended last week in a convincing victory for Arch McKellar of Mount Kisco, N.Y.; Ron Gerard of HastingsonHudson, N.Y.; Richard Oshlag of White Plains and Monroe Magnus of Stamford, Conn.

title: Giants Begin Move to Jersey: They'll Train There This Year
description: The New York Giants anInounced yesterday the shift of their preseason training camp o New Jersey from Long Island, The new camp will be at Monmouth College in West Long Branch.

title: Prize to Copy Editor
description: WASHINGTON, May 9 (UPI) Richard H, Gilman of Tucson, a senior at the University of Arizona, was awarded first place Friday in the 12th annual collegiate journalism awards program of the William Randolph Hearst Foundation. Mr. Gilman, a copy editor for The Arizona Daily Star, received a $1,500 scholarship.

title: Hebrew Y Gets $500,000
description: An anonymous donor has granted $500,000 to create an endowment fund to help maintain and expand the diversified services of the Associated Young Women's Hebrew Association of New York, it was announced last night at the group's 14th annual dinner meeting. The affair, which was held in the EmanuEl Midtown Y.M.Y.W. H A. at 344 East 14th Street, also honored Irving Brodsky, the group's chief executive, for 25 years of service.

title: Notes on People
description: The Atomic Energy Commission's annual Enrico Fermi Award went to Dr. Stafford L. Warren and Dr. Shields Warren, who are among the world's leading medical experts on radiation. The Warrens, who are not related, were cited for having helped make possible the early development of atomic energy so as to assure the protection of man and the environment.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, May 9President Nixon's newest tactics in Indochina derive from a recognition that three years of military and diplomatic maneuver against North Vietnam have failed.

title: Banker Criticizes H.U.D. Red Tape
description: The president of the Mortgage Bankers Association yesterday accused the Department of Housing and Urban Development of hiding behind higher and higher mountains of rules and regulations, new certifications and endless paperwork.

title: Democrats on House Unit Favor Pullout
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 Democrats on the House Foreign Affairs Committee voted, 10 to 1, today in favor of a proposal that would require the withdrawal of all American forces from Indochina by Oct. 1 if American prisoners of war are released by North Vietnam.

title: Bank Trust Units Alloived To Hold 5% of. Broadcaster
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (Reuters)The Federal Communications Commission has ruled that bank trust departments may own up to 5 per cent of any radio and television broadcasting company.

title: BROOKLYN LIBRARIES TO SHORTEN HOUR,
description: For the second straight year, the Brooklyn Public Library System will go on a summe: schedule earlier than usual because of a partial jobfreeze, the system announced yesterday.

title: Solomon is Victor
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 10 (UPI)Unseeded Harold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., continued his advance in the $26,650 Belgian open tennis championship with a 75, 86 triumph over Bernard Mignot of Belgium today.

title: 4DAY SYRIAN VISIT BEGUN BY GRECHKO
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, May 10Marshal Andrei A. Grechko, the Soviet Defense Minister, arrived in Damascus today on a fourday visit for talks with Syria's military leaders and an inspection of Syrian defenses on the front with Israel.

title: Big Department Store in Belfast Is Wricked by a Bomb and a Fire
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 10 (AP)A bomb explosion wrecked Belfast's biggest department store today. The blast sent debris and glass flying through crowds of homebound officer workers and started a huge blaze in the city center. At least 19 persons were reported injured.

title: MAGNAVOX UNVEILS. TV GAME SIMULATOR
description: The Magnavox Company introduced yesterday what at described as the most innovative new product line in its history.

title: I Will Stay
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam  I have been here in Saigon for more than three year's except for a trip to the States to wind up my affairs there.

title: Varied Sentiments Expressed On Prisons at Attica Hearings
description: The McKay Commission investigating the events surrounding last September's uprising at the Attica Correctional Facility heard yesterday from citizens who asked to address the panel after the conclusion two weeks ago of 13 days of public hearings.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May 10Labor, the biggest political force in Michigan, is holding back, not making a major effort in next Tuesday's primary but hoarding its resources for November's Presidential election.

title: A Top F.B.I. Aide, 66, Quits After 38 Years
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)The Federal Bureau of Investigation announced today the retirement of Alex Rosen, 66yearold assistant to the director who had been with the agency 38 years.

title: Brown Trial Move Denied
description: ELLICOTT CITY, Md., May 10 (UPI)A judge denied yesterday ti motion to have H. Rap Brown, the black militant, returned to Maryland to stand trial on riot and arson charges. Judge James MacGill in denying the motion, said the New York police would not surrender Brown until charges of armed robbery and attempted murder against him were resolved there. He is scheduled to go on trial in New York on Sept. 6.

title: Merger News
description: The Quaker Oats Company, known for its cereals, plans to expand its toy operations with a proposed cash acquisition, of Louis Marx & Co. of New York. Quaker Oats is also acquiring the Needlecraft Corporation of America, Chicago, for Quaker common shares.

title: Rgimd Table, Guerin and Nerud Join Racing's Hall of Fame in August
description: Round Table, Eric Guerin and. Johnny Nerud have been elected to the Racing Hall of Fame, Gerard S. Smith, president of the National Museum of Racing at Saratoga, announced yesterday. The newcomers will be installed in a ceremony in August during the race meeting there.

title: Deaths
description: ALTENHEINClaire, on May 9, 1972. Wife of the late Ernest F. Altenheln. Devoted mother of Dr. Margarete R. Altenheln. Reposing at Frank E. Campbell, Madison Ave. at 81 Street, Thursday, 9 A.M.10 P.M. Service Friday 1:15 P.M. Interment private.

title: STOCKS RECOVER AS TRADING DIPS
description: The stock market made a big turnabout yesterday with, advances outnumbering declines by about a twotoone ratio in much slower trading.

title: Soviet Submarine Quits Cuba
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI)  A Soviet submarine that had been visiting Cubathe first such vessel equipped with ballistic missiles to call there  has sailed back out to the Atlantic, according to the Pentagon.
