The submarine was reported to be accompanied by a tanker and a guidedmissile destroyer.

title: Whitehall St. Induction Center Is Moving to New Headquarters
description: The building at 39 Whitehall Street where thousands of young men got their first taste of military service will close its doors next Wednesday.

title: 1972 Junior Miss Named
description: MOBILE, Ala., May 10 (UPI) Lydia Hodson, 17 years old, a Lexington, Ky., high school senior who wants to be a sociologisl, was chosen last night as America's 1972 Junior Miss. She wan $14,500 in scholarships.

title: Outdoor Entertainments Get a Brassy SendOff
description: The Seuffert Band piped rousing rhythms on the promenade of the New York Public Library's main branch yesterday. A high school brass ensemble filled the air with Music in front of Borough Hall in Brooklyn. And in Bryant Park, Mark Van Doren, the poet, read selections from his works.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN SEARCH OF NIXON. A psychohistorical Inquiry. By Bruce Mulish. 187 pages, Illustrated. Basic Books. $6.95.

title: Tainted Meat
description: Inflation is not the only factor pushing up meat prices in the metropolitan area. Lawenforcement officials assert that racketeers selling labor peace to supermarket chains and wholesale meat suppliers raise the butcher bills New Yorkers pay by more than a million dollars a week.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: THE PRESIDENT Students. The President announced the selection of 10 high school seniors to attend a science school for high school students to be held in Sydney, Australia, Aug. 28Sept. 8. The Presidential scholars, selected through a nationwide talent search conducted by the National Science Foundation and the National Merit Scholarship Corporation, will join students from Britain, Japan, Australia and New Zealand in attending the annual school under a program begun in 1967.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: There are many obvious objections to the bill, already passed by the State Assembly, that mandates countywide referendums on public housing projects. It threatens to cripple the entire public housing program in the state; it raises innumerable problems, both practical and constitutional, and one of its provisions is simply specialinterest legislation drafted in response to the Forest Hills situation.

title: DECLINE IS SHOWN IN RETAIL SALES
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 Retails sales slipped back in April from the record March level but remained higher than any month prior to March, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Hunter Studies Protesters Hold Board Chief Captive 4 Hours
description: The chairman of the Board of Higher Education, Luis QueroChiesa, was held and prevented from leaving for nearly four hours in a conference room at the board's headquarters last night by a largely Puerto Rican group of students and faculty members from Hunter College.

title: LEEMATT TAKES TOBOGGAN SPRINT
description: A gray, Maryland bred colt, C. Oliver Goldsmith's Leematt, registered his third straight victory, in the $26,975 Toboggan Handicap at Aqueduct yesterday.

title: Vatican Weekly Says Church in U. S. Is Near Collapse
description: ROME, May 10A Vatican weekly said today that the Roman Catholic Ohurch in the United States was being shaken by a tremendous earthquake and seemed on the verge of collapse, but it voiced the hope that it would be saved by its silent majority.

title: C.B.S. APPEALS CASE RULED FOR CABLE TV
description: The Columbia Broadcasting System said yesterday that it would appeal the decision last week by Judge Constance Baker Motley in Federal District Court here upholding the Teleprompter Corporation's transmission of C.B.S. shows and movies to its cable TV subscribers without payment of copyright.

title: Jackson State Memorial
description: JACKSON, Miss, May 10 (UPI)  Students at Jackson State College opened a week of memorial observances today for Philip Gibbs and James Earl Green, two black youths slain during campus violence two years ago.

title: Business Writers Elect
description: DETROIT, May 10 (AP)Dave Smith of Ward's Auto World was elected today as president of the Society of American Business Writers, succeeding Al Altwegg of The Dallas Morning News. Other new officers elected were: vice president, Hobart Rowen, Washington (D. C.) Post; treasurer, Don Campbell, Arizona Republic, Phoenix, and secretary, Ralph Weiskittel, Cincinnati (Ohio) Enquirer.

title: Family Planning Hub Begun
description: MANILA (UPI)  President Ferdinand E. Marcos laid the cornerstone here for a $3.1 million population center that will cordinate efforts to subdue the Philippines gigantic and complex problem of overpopulation.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Nothing could have indicated more clearly and convincingly the complete bankruptcy of the foreign policy of the present Administration than President Nixon's throwing caution to the winds by mining Haiphong harbor and thus, in effect, blockading it in violation of a longestablished and unin versally recognized principle of international law, namely, that ports may be legally blockaded only during an officially declared war and after due warning has been given to neutral nations.

title: ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League and Two Leaders Indicted
description: A Federal grand jury charged yesterday that the ItalianAmerican Civil Rights League and two of its officers fraudulently obtained a $6,000 bank loan by swearing that the league had no outstanding debts.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) President Nixon relaxed tonight with a Potomac River cruise aboard the Navy yacht Sequoia. According to the President's deputy press secretary, Gerald L. Warren, Mr. Nixon's only companion was his wife.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: We desperately need traffic police in New York City. Witness a comment by the City Environmental Protection Administration on one of their radio spot announcements:  Are particles of lead damaging your liver or kidneys? Is nitrogen dioxide causing you shortness of breath? Almost three million pounds of these toxic pollutants are deposited in our city air yearly by cars and other motor vehicles. What are you really suffering from? Carsickness? Cars kill two ways: rapidly and slowly.

title: SMITH AVENGES LOSS TO ROUYER
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 10 (AP)Stan Smith mastered a damp court, gusty winds and Jean Loup Rouyer of France to move into the quarterfinals of the $39,000 British hard court (clay) tennis championships today with two other Americans, Jimmy Connors and Sharon Walsh.

title: Track Official, Testifies
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) One of the witnesses who did testify at the House crime hearings today was Lester Smith, former vice president of Hazel Park. He said he had been removed from his $19,000 post after he had testified for the Government in the trial of Zerilli and Bellanca.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: EAST HADDAM, Conn.An accounting of the continuing effort to restore the Connecticut River's oncemagnificent runs of anadromous fish was given to members and guests at the 20th annual meeting of the Connecticut River Watershed Council last weekend.

title: OLIVER S. PLANTINGA, BANDAGE EXPERT, 65
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 10Dr. Oliver S. Plantinga, who retired in January as technical expert on surgical dressings and their sterilization for Johnson & Johnson, the surgical goods manufacturer, died on Monday at the Princeton Medical Center. He was 65 years old and had made his home here for the last 15 years.

title: U.S. Is Looking Into How the City Housing Authority Selects Its Tenants
description: The City Housing Authority has come under a Federal investigation  sought by the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of New, Yorkon the way it has been Selecting tenants for the Seward Park Extension project on the Lower East Side.

title: C.C.N.Y. Gets $100,000 Gift To Establish Film Institute
description: Arnold Picker, chairman of the executive committee, of United Artists and a 1.935 alumnus of City College, has donated $100,000 to the college for the estabishrnent of the Celia and David V. Picker Film Institute. The institute, named in memory of Mr. Picker's parents, eventually will be part of the college's planned Leonard Davis Center for the Performing Arts.

title: Lobbying for the Public
description: Ever since the Internal Revenue Service deprived the Sierra Club of its taxexempt status for sponsoring newspaper advertisements on the Redwoods National, Park bill five years ago, other publicinterest groups have been uncertain as to how far they could go in efforts to influence legislation without meeting a similar fate.

title: Offshore Fishing Limit
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (At)Representative James J. Howard, Democrat of New Jersey, introduced legislation today to prohibit fishing by foreign vessels within 200 miles of the United States coast. The present limit is three miles.

title: SHOP TALK
description: The Paper Moon is a small shop, but it does have a large selection of basketware American Indian baskets, baskets from Ethiopia, Upper Volta, Hungary, Poland, Italy, Ireland and Colombia.

title: Heavy CrossFire Reported
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI) Pentagon sources said today that at least one Soviet ship in Haiphong Harbor and possibly more, might have been caught in crossfire between United States minelaying planes and North Vietnamese shore batteries.

title: Choir Fuses Spirit and Energy As Black on Black Series Ends
description: The fourth and final concert in the Black on Black series at Carnegie Recital Hall was called A Joyous Noise. And that is exactly what was heard on Monday evening, provided primarily by the Community Ensemble Gospel Choir of Mount Vernon.

title: British Ship Leaves Haiphong
description: HONG KONG, Thursday, May 11 (UPI)A Londonregistered freighter with a crew of 40 has left the minethreatened North Vietnamese port of Haiphong, a marine department spokesman said today.

title: Driver of School Bus Is Indicted In Congers Accident Fatal to 5
description: NEW CITY, N. Y., May 10The driver of the school bus that collided with a freight train last March 24 in nearby Congers, killing five Nyack High School students, was indicted here today on five counts of criminally negligent homicide.

title: ABORTION REPEAL PASSED BY SENATE, SENT TO GOVERNOR
description: ALBANY, May 10By a vote of 30 to 27 the Senate gave final legislative approval to a bill repealing New York's twoyearold liberalized abortion law and reinstating the old statute permitting abortions only to save the life of the woman.

title: Notes on People
description: Romulo Betancourt, the former President of Venezuela, ended eight years of voluntary exile in Europe and headed home. The 63yearold Mr. Betancourt, who relinquished the presidency in 1964, left Bern, Switzerland, for Genoa, by car, anal planned to board a ship there for Latin America.

title: Chess: Americans Off to Good Start In Blind Event in Yugoslavia
description: The United States got off to a good start in the fourth Blind Chess Team Olympiad in Pula, Yugoslavia. The Americans drew a bye in the first round and then downed Denmark, 31.

title: Rangers Try to Keep Up Heroics Tonight and Tie Cup Series
description: The Rangers were hit harder by 500 fans early yesterday than they were by the Bruins at Boston just a few hours before.

title: Dealing With Moscow
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.The President will have an opportunity in Moscow, if he goes, to break through the impasse in SovietAmerican trade relations, but to do so would require a high degree of imagination and statesmanship.

title: U.S. Economic Tie To Latins Stressed
description: QUITO, Ecuador, May 10The United States will rely more on profitandloss statements than on the big stick in forinulating future foreign policy. That is the message being conveyed by the beleagtiered Washington delegation at the 13th annual meeting of the InterAmerican Developinent Bank here this week.

title: He Sees Small Investor Being Squeezed Out of the Market
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 10William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, charged today that unrestricted membership on the nation's stock exchanges by institutions would impair the, fairness of the stock market.

title: ProAbortion Policy Of Population Panel Opposed 51 in Mail
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI) Mail received by the Commission on Population Growth and the American Future is running 5 to 1 against a proabortion policy recommended by, the panel but assailed by President Nixon.

title: Astronaut Conrad Bails Out As His Jet Crashes in Texas
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 10 (UPI) Capt. Charles Conrad Jr., the astronaut, bailed out of a damaged trainer jet over an Air Force base in central Texas tonight and parachuted to safety within 100 yards of the base operation office.

title: Dance: Sleeping Beauty
description: Of all the old fairytale ballets, The Sleeping Beauty is probably the least mysterious but the most satisfying. It is a myth about providence and virginity deriving from a time when virginity was not a myth and providence a possibility. It is a myth, incidentally, that is rather successfully caught by the Royal Ballet's latest production of the ballet, seen gorgeously for the first time at the Metropolitan Opera House on Tuesday night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Ironically, The New York Times and those who waged the successful fight for community participation in education and the advocates of neighborhood government plans now oppose the MillerFlack public housing countywide referendum bill, which gives the people of a community a voice in the decisionmaking process affecting the community's future development.

title: Goodrich Philippine Venture
description: CLEVELAND, May 10 (UPI)  The B. F. Goodrich Chemical Company, said today it had entered into an investment agreement with Philippine interests that will lead to the construction of a polyvinyl chloride production operation near Manila. The facility scheduled to come on stream in 1974, will have an initial design capacity of approximately 20,000 metric tons a year of suspension type PVC resin.

title: SUGAR CONTRACTS DECLINE IN PRICE
description: World No. 11 sugar futures closed 13 to 26 points lower yesterday on the New York Coffee and Sugar Exchange. Sales totaled 3,551 contracts.

title: Dodgers Beaten By Mets in 14th
description: Willie Mays was not on the premises and it was probably just as well for him that he wasn't, because the New York Mets and Los Angeles Dodgers struggled for 14 innings last night before the Mets squeezed out a 43 victory.

title: AMEX SHARES UP IN SLOW TRADING
description: Bargain hunters dominated trading on the American Stock Exchange yesterday. As a result, the index closed at 27.20, up 0.13 in slow volume.

title: Goodyear Lifts Prices
description: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company announced yesterday that it would increase prices on all replacement tires and tubes by 1.5 per cent to 2.5 per cent, effective June 1.

title: Royal DutchShell Posts Sharp Drop For First Quarter
description: Net income of the Royal DutchShell Group of companies, the world's largest nonAmericanowned private enterprise, fell sharply in the first quarter of 1972.

title: 6 WITNESSES TRACE MISS DAVIS'S FLIGHT
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 10 (UPI)  Nearing the end of its case against Angela Davis, the prosecution started introducing testimony today on her whereabouts after the Aug. 7, 1970, Marin County Courthouse shooting until her arrest three months later.

title: Waldheim MeetS for Hour With Chinese on Vietnam.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. y., May 10Huang Hua, chief representative of China here, conferred for an hour today with Secretary General Waldheim on the war in Vietnam. Mr. Huang refused to comment on the prospects of calling a meeting of the Security Council to deal with the matter.

title: MRS. BINH CAUSTIC
description: PARIS, May 10  Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, head of the Viettaing delegation to the Paris peaces: talks today denounced President Nixon's address on, Vietnam Monday as a speech of war and categorically rajected his new proposal.

title: Conservative Group Gives Prizes to Senator Byrd and William Loeb
description: To the lilt of waltz music and the roll of rightist oratory, prominent conservatives gathered here last night at a dinner given by the National. Economic Council, a nonprofit corporation whose purpose is to oppose all government encroachment upon the personal freedom of the citizenry.

title: Hue Is Bracing and Rearming For Assault Expected in Week
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 10  As South Vietnamese commanders continued their hectic attempts to rebuild the weakened defenses of Hue, an American military official predicted today that the North Vietnamese would begin their assault on this crucial city within week, and perhaps in the next few days.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 10  The stripmining industry in this coalproducing state suffered a stunning setback in the primary election yesterday.

title: MARIJUANA'S IMPACT ON SEX HELD VARIED
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)Marijuana is not an aphrodisiac, and it does not heighten sexual enjoyment for all users, the National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse reported today.

title: U.S. Intelligence Was Surprised By Enemy's Drive, Aides Assert
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Evidence has begun to emerge here that United States intelligence was caught by surprise by the direction, timing and power of the North. Vietnamese offensive in South Vietnam.

title: DEADLINE CLUB GIVES JOURNALISM AWARDS
description: Seven awards for excellence in differentfields of journalism were bestowed last night by the Deadline Club, the New York professional chapter of Sigma Delta Chi, the national journalism society, at the Americana Hotel.

title: Hanoi and Haiphong Hit; 10 MIG's Reported Down
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Thursday, May 11United States planes bombed targets in Hanoi and Haiphong yesterday and also struck at the rail lines leading from China in a continued effort to seal off North Vietnam from its sources of military supplies.

title: Candidates Day
description: BALTIMORE, May 10Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota campaigned through the fish stalls and vegetable stands of the Lexington Market here today, then flew to New York for secret meetings with past and potential financial backers.

title: EGG TRADER PLEADS GUILTY ON FALSITY
description: The president of a New York exportimport concern, John P. Bauer, pleaded guilty yesterday to a Federal charge of having delivered a false report about egg futures to news outlets.

title: Church Disrupters Jailed
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10 (UPI)  Four persons began jail terms today for disrupting a midnight mass on Christmas Eve, 1969, in St. Basil's Roman Catholic Church. The four, Duana K. Doherty, 35 years old, a former nun; Richard A. Martinez, 28; Anthony R. Salazar, 29, and Richard V. Cruz, 38, were ordered jailed yesterday when they exhausted avenues of appeal. Cruz is serving a 60day sentence, the others 90 days.

title: FIVE POET FRIENDS HONOR BERRYMAN
description: Five poet friends of John Berryman, who died Jan. 7, gathered Tuesday evening at the Donnell Library to read from his work and to reminisce a little about the man.

title: Standard Is Suggested for Fees on Funds and Variable Annuities
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The National Association of Securities Dealers said today that two management consulting firms had recommended that the sales charges on mutual funds and variable annuities be based, in part, on the costs that an investor would incur if he tried to purchase his own diversified portfolio of stocks.

title: Population Rebuff
description: Three years ago in a bold message to Congress, President Nixon called for the expansion of family planning services in the United States and for the creation a commission to study the impact of population growth on the nation.

title: Suntan Lotion Recalled
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI)  The Food and Drug Administration announced today the recall of Tanya Hawaiian Suntan, Lotion because of bacterial contaminants but said that the contaminants were unlikely to harm users. An agency spokesman said that the BristolMyers Company, which maritets the lotion, had discovered the contamination, brought it to the agency's attention and initiated the recall.

title: N.B.C. Makes Major Changes In News and Programing Staff
description: The National Broadcasting Company announced major changes yesterday, in the television network's programing and news management, effective June 1. The changes, designed to bring forward yrounger men in the network hierarchy, Were announced here by Don Durgin, president of N.B.C.TV.

title: JULIE BUDD, 18, ADDS POISE TO COPA DEBUT
description: For an 18yearold singer, Julie Budd has an amazing amount of poise and assurance. She is currently at the Copacabana, making her first appearanceher first possible appearancein a New York club because no one under 18 can work in a place where liquor is served. And Miss Budd opened at the Copa on her 18th birthday last week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Tahseen M. Bashir's recent OpEd article, And Now a Time for Peace, ignores several facts.

title: PERRY OF TWINS BEATS YANKS, 20, FOR THIRD VICTORY
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 10  Although the Yankees didn't score any runs against Jim Perry and Wayne Granger tonight, their hitting nevertheless provided one of only two interesting aspects of Minnesota's 2.0 victory.

title: CHINA DENOUNCES U.S. PROVOCATION
description: HONG KONG, May 11China today branded President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnam harbors as a dangerous move and a flagrant provocation against the people of Vietnam and the world over.

title: Jets Release 72 Schedule Of Six Exhibition Gams
description: The New York Jets completed their preseason schedule yesterday by signing to play the Pittsburgh Steelers on Aug. 12 at the University of Washington Stadium in Seattle. The game will start at 4 P.M., Pacific Coast Time.

title: MOSCOW Still Delays
description: MOSCOW, May 10The delay in official Soviet reaction to President Nixon's decision to mine harbors in North Vietnam was interpreted by Western diplomats today as a sign of difficulty in the, Kremlin over how to cope with the American move.

title: South Asian Priorities
description: Hopeful prospects for peace in South Asia have been threatened by a flareup of fighting between Indian and Pakistani troops along their Kashmir ceasefireline and by indications that the leaders of both countries are failing to give planned negotiations the priority they deserve.

title: Head of I.T.U. and Local Here In Rift Over Extension of Strike
description: A rift has developed between the head of New York Typographical Local 6 and the union's international president over the local's proposed extension of The Morning Telegraph strike to The Daily Racing Form, which is published in New Jersey.

title: SWAN LAKE GIVEN A BLUEBLOOD AIR
description: The New York City Ballet presented its usual if schematic oneact version of Swan Lake Tuesday night for the first time this season at the State Theater. This was also the first time that Melissa Hayden and. Peter Martins had appeared together as the principals, Odette and Siegfried.

title: Thieu Orders Martial Law; Ousts an Area Commander
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 10President Nguyen Van Thieu imposed martial law on South Vietnam tonight.

title: Direct Payment of Welfare Rent In City Proposed by State Aide
description: State Welfare Inspector General George F. Berlinger proposed yesterday that the city be required to pay, welfare recipients rents and security deposits directly to landlords, instead of giving rent checks to the clients.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space10 A.M.; scientific and technical subcommittee as a whole3 P.M.

title: 4H Brings a Fresh Country Touch to the Slums
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Jimmy Padgett, 27 years old, a tall, husky figure in a red and yellow pied shirt, strode down a narrow street between rows of tenements here the other afternoon preceded by a big dog named King and circled by a constantly changing cartwheel of boys clamoring for his attention.

title: Designers Put It All Together In a Medley of Sports Clothes
description: About the only complaint people are able to muster about the burgeoning of sports clothes in the fall collections now being shown on Seventh Avenue is over the amount of time it takes to assemble all the parts every morning. Life is easier for the woman who just has to zip herself into i, dress, they say.

title: A. T. & T. Woman Employe Says Her Transfer Bid Was Ridiculed
description: A young woman employe of the New York Telephone Company testified yesterday that her superiors laughed off her requests for a job as a telephone repairman or an installor until she asked for time off to testify at a bearing into charges of sexual, ethnic and racial discrimination against the American Telephone and Telegraph Company and its Subsidiaries.

title: 9 Thais Killed by Grenade
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 10 (Reuters)  Nine people were killed and 10 injured yesterday when a man hurled a hand grenade onto an openair dancing stage in northern Thailand. Police sources said the man had apparently been involved in a fight over a dance with girl. He was arrested while trying to cross the border into Laos shortly after the blast.

title: May Is Many Things
description: The month of May is a serenade of tree frogs and persistent spring peepers, and it is a time of dandelions, still More skunk cabbage, and dogwoods and lilacs in bloom. It is the slap of paint brushes in the boatyards and rakes scratching in suburban gardens. It is thunder and lightning and downpours but it is also young lovers whispering under a big moon that makes a glittering path on pond, river, lake and sea.

title: SOPRANO'S SINGING SECURE FOR DEBUT
description: Kathleen Kinander, the soprano who made her debut at Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night, may very well have grown up singing. Her father, Robert Kinander, is a voice teacher and she studies with him.

title: The End of a Myth
description: Only two months ago Washington presented the Saigon Army one of the best in the world and Vietnamization as a great success making gigantic progress. The Government In the South was asserting that only an infinitely small minority of the population was not under its control. In short, some 13 or 14 million tons of bombs and other munitions, chemical spraying of a seventh of South Vietnam's territory, the influx of dollars and military equipment and the repression of legal opposition had at last defeated Communism and at last the theory of two Vietnams would be vindicated.

title: Printing of Pentagon Papers Wins Honor for The Times
description: The Center for Journalism of Ball State University in Muncie, Ind., has presented its National Journalism Award for 1972 to The New York Times for publication of the Pentagon papers.

title: Boy, 8, Finds Mother And His Brother, 9, Stabbed to Death
description: A woman and her 9yearold son were stabbed to death last night in their Lower East Side apartment, the police said. The multiple murders were discovered and reported by the woman's 8year7old son.

title: Hanoi Lists 32 Civilians Killed
description: TOKYO, May 10 (UPI) I North Vietnam's press agency said today that 32 civilians, mostly women and children, were killed in Hanoi's suburban district of Gialam during the American bombing raids.

title: State Senate Vote on NoFault Bills
description: ALBANY, May 10Following is the Senate rollcall vote in which a nofault auto insurance bill sponsored by Senator Bernard G. Gordon was defeated last night by a vote of 33 to 22 and a rival bill sponsored by Senator Thomas Laverne was approved, 44 to 13.

title: SHARMAN SQUEEZED, BUT HE GETS A SHARE
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10 (AP) Everyone agreed that the Los Angeles Laker coach, Bill Sharman, deserved a full share of the Lakers playoff winnings, but there were differences as to how that money should be paid.

title: Candidates Day
description: ESCANABA, Mich., May 10 Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama took his Presidential campaign into Michigan's northern reaches today with speeches to large crowds here and in Marquette.

title: Thirty Minutes in Hanoi: A Sky Alive With Planes
description: HANOI, North. Vietnam, May 10The sounds of jets and bombing began at 9:50 A.M. today, and smoke could be seen rising several miles west of Hanoi.

title: Taxpayer Concern Spurs Cutin School Staffs on L.I.
description: MINEOLA, L, I., May 10In drastic efforts to cut costs, many public school districts on Long Island are reducing teaching and administrative staffs, increasing class sizes, eliminating special programs and, in a few cases, closing elementary schools.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 10 (AP)  Kathleen Kennedy, daughter of the late Senator Robert F. Kennedy, officially opened tonight Senator George McGovern's downtown campaign headquarters for the Presidential primary May 23.

title: Face Cream Manufacturer Agrees to Discontinue Ads
description: State Attorney General Louis S. Lefkowitz, contending that a vitamin E face cream does not do wonders for wrinkles, aging skin and surface scars, has won a promise from the cream's manufacturer and advertising agency to discontinue a series of magazine ads.

title: News Analysis
description: OMAHA, May 10After next Tuesday, Senators Hubert H. Humphrey and George McGovern plan to spend almost full time on the West Coast, chiefly in California. The reason is plain: Nothing that happened in yesterday's primaries in West Virginia and here in Nebraska and nothing that is likely to happen in next Tuesday's balloting in Maryland and Michiganwill tellyery much about who is go ing to win the Democratic Presidential nomination. And California's June 6 will, because 271 delegates will go to the winner.

title: News of Dogs
description: James A. Farrell Jr., a member bf the Westminster Kennel Club since 1944; provided some backstage anecdotes from his long association with the organization at yesterday's luncheon of the Dog Fanciers Club in the McAlpin Hotel.

title: Plan to Give Heroin To Addicts Detailed
description: The Vera Institute of Justice yesterday released the full details of its controversial troposal for an experiment in shortterm heroin maintenance for addicts who have failed on methadone maintenance.

title: Mystery of La Tour on Display in Paris
description: PARIS, May 10For the first and probably last time, all but one of the paintings by Georges de La Tour known to date have been brought together at the Musee de l'Orangerie in Paris. Thirty one originals, plus 31 canvases labeled as copies, make up the year's most important exhibition.

title: Break in Main on East 80th Street Floods Stores and a Nursing Home
description: A 48inch water main burst early yesterday morning on the Upper East Side, cascading into 80th Street between Second and Third Avenues.

title: Balloting in Cleveland Again Marred by Error
description: CLEVELAND, May 10 (AP) Despite the Cuyahoga County Ele'tion Board's most careful efforts to hold a perfect special election yesterday to compensate for monstrous voting problem May 2, a minor error occurred.

title: Report by a City Unit Opposes LondonStyle Reorganization
description: Despite Governor Rockefeller's recommendation that New York City be reorganized the way London was, the city's Commission on StateCity Relations said yesterday that such a reorganization would do little to improve the city's functioning.

title: MIKHAIL G. LYSENKO
description: MOSCOW, May 10  Mikhail G. Lysenko, Ukrainian sculptor, died yesterday in Kiev at the age of 65.

title: DILUTED NOFAULT IS FACING A VETO
description: ALBANY, May 10Governor Rockefeller was reported today to be prepared to veto the drastically modified no fault automobile accident insurance bill that was approved by the Senate yesterday.

title: SUSPECT IN ROBBERY HELD IN $150,000 BAIL
description: A 28yearold Bronx man was held in $150,000 bail yesterday on two indictments arising from the holdup of one bank and the attempted holdup of another on the same day last month.

title: Advertising.
description: PepsiCola, an advertiser in the $30million class, confirmed yesterday that it was close to a new campaign that could replace You've got a lot to live and Pepsi's got a lot to give.

title: No Peril Seen for U.S.Soviet Accords
description: WASHINGTON, May 10A senior official said today that the Administration believed agreements would eventually be reached on strategicarms limitation, an expansion in trade and other matters now under negotiation with the Soviet Union even if th' President's trip to Moscow is called off by Soviet leaders.

title: Bridge. Queens Woman Attains Rank Of Lite Master in Two Years
description: The rank of life master is not nowadays the mark of distinction that it once was. Ten topranked players, of whom nine were from the New York area, were awarded that rank in 1936, and 12 years later there were exactly 100 life masters. Today there are some 17,000 nationwide, and the Greater New York Bridge Association alone has 710.

title: 4 WITNESSES BALK INQUIRY ON SPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI) Three alleged Mafia figures and a former Detroit race track official invoked the Fifth Amendment today and refused to answer questions of the House Select Committee on Crime, which is investigating gangland influence on professional sports and horse racing.

title: Executive Changes
description: Thomas A. Martin has been elected president of the Anchor Corporation, succeeding Edward Burr, who was named vice chairman.

title: Youths Get Voice, but No Vote, At Meeting of Jewish Congress
description: CLEVELAND, May 10 More than 30 youths of college age arrived here today to talk back to their elders. All were accredited delegates, with a voice but no vote, at the national biennial convention of the American Jewish Congress.

title: Dollar Is Weaker In Trades Abroad; Rise in Gold Halted
description: PARIS, May 10The dollar came under selling pressure again today, but the recent spectacular advance in gold was halted as nervousness over intensification of hostilities in Vietnam continued to dominate sentiment in the European market centers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: On March 29 and 30, The Times published two editorials taking the New York State legislative leadership to task for its refusal to act on series of excellent nonmoney bills and, in particular, worthwhile election reform legislation.

title: College Sports Notes
description: UNIVERSITY PARK, Pa., May 10Greg Ducatte grew up in Plattsburgh, N. Y., becoming a high school quarterback good enough to attract numerous college football recruiters. Like any other premier player he hoped to do well also on a successful college team. He achieved half of that wish, since he plays for Penn State, currently the top college team in the East. He is not the quarterback, but the safetyman, the spot he held when Penn State beat Texas in the Cotton Bowl last winter after the Lions 101 wonlost season.

title: SIMPSON FACING A BUSY WEEKEND
description: YONKERS, May 10  John Simpson Jr, has had only two driving assignments at the current Yonkers, Raceway meeting and he finished out of the money both times.

title: India Condemns U.S. Move
description: NEW DELHI, May 10Foreign Miniiter Swaran Singh said in Parliament today that India condemned the latest escalation by the United States of the Vietnam war. He spoke after the Cabinet had discussed the American mining of North Vietnamese harbors.

title: 4 More Bodies Found in Mine; Toll Now 51, With 40 Missing
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, May 10The bodies of four more men trapped in the Sunshine Silver Mine after a fire there May were found tonight by searchers descending a shaft toward the bottom of the miledeep mine.

title: 2d Annual Bronx Day Is Celebrated With Parade
description: More than 100,000 enthusiastic residents of the Bronx lined the Grand Concourse yesterday to watch a mammoth borough parade and celebrate the second annual Bronx Day in modern timea.

title: Bausch Says New Soflens Finds Rising Acceptance
description: ROCHESTER, May 10Bausch & Lomb, Inc., described in glowing general terms the acceptance of its softcontact lens here today, but turned aside all questions seeking specific figures as to consumer rejections of the new product or the fitting rate experienced by the ophthalmic profession.

title: New Offtrack Bill Is Called a Right Step
description: Albany's photofinish passage of new offtrackbetting legislation has placated most of the groups concerned without really pleasing anybody.

title: Rosewall Beats Lutz
description: DALLAS, May 10 (AP)Ken Rosewall opened the defense of his World Championship Tennis title tonight with a threehour, fiveset victory over Bob Lutz.

title: Excerpts From Secretary Laird's News Conference on the New U.S. Military Measures in North Vietnam
description: I want to make five points before taking your questions this morning.

title: MURRAY SELTZER
description: Murray Seltzer, a handbag manufacturer who was founder and a president of the National Handbag Association, a trade group, died on Tuesday in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived at 124 East 24th Street.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With bigotry a source of good humored acceptancewitness the Archie Bunker showthere should be little wonder that Gov. George Wallace is sweeping the country in his bid for the Presidential nomination. But what an indictment these not altogether unrelated events are!

title: Protestant Youth Gangs Are Powerful Force in Belfast
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 6Davey, a 16yearold milkman, stands on bleak Caslereagh Road each evening. I don't trust the Catholics, he said. I don't like them, never have and never will. That's why I'm, a Tartan.

title: Depository Bill Is Backed
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) A New York Stock. Exchange officer said today that the exchauge supported with qualifications legislation giving the Securities and Exchange Coinmission prim ry regulatory powers over a national system of securities depositories.

title: COMEDY BY MDR SET FOR BROADWAY
description: Paul Zindel, the Pulitzer Prizewinning playwright, has written a new comedy, The Secret Affairs of Mildred Wild, which will star Maureen Stapleton on Broadway In November.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 10 California delegates now thihk they can crown their party's nominee for President in a winhertakeall271tlelegates primary four weeks hence, and in tones of disbelief, they are saying that Senator George McGovern is becoming the frontrunner in the race.

title: Man in the News
description: The chief architect of a heroinmaintenance program unveiled yesterday performed one of his typically delicate catalytic missions over dinner at the Harvard Club one night last summer.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 10President Nixon finished his somewhat scary speech on Vietnam Monday night with an appeal for the support of the people. He deserves it. He is in a most difficult position, and he is, as Presidents have become fond of reminding us, the only, President we have.

title: Bonn Delays Treaty Vote for a Week
description: BONN, May 10Leaders of all four parties in the West German Bundestag, the lower house of Parliament, agreed this evening to postpone for a week a vote on ratification of treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland.

title: JOHN F. FOLINSBEE, LANDSCAPE ARTIST
description: NEW HOPE, PA., May 10John F. Folinsbee, a landscape and portrait artist, died at his home here today. He was 80 years old.

title: Roundup: Broberg Loses TwoHitter on Error, 1 0
description: It pays to be lucky as well as good, and last night in Baltimore Dave McNally, who won 21 games last year despite a sore arm, had the luck while Pete Broberg of the Rangers had the misfortune.

title: Critic of Athens Regime Is Arrested and Banished
description: ATHENS, May 10  Prof. John Pesmazoglu, an economist and a leading critic of the Greek Government was arrested at this home today and banished to a village in northern Greece as a security risk.

title: Genesco Reports Decline In 3d Quarter Earnings
description: Genesco, Inc., the nation's largesf apparel producer and retailer, yesterday reported sharply reduced earnings for the third quarter of its fiscal year and also announced reshuffling of some top management responsibilities.

title: PERMANENT ICE CAP FOUND AT MARS POLE
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 10 (AP)Scientists who studied closeup photographs of Mars reported today the discovery of a 200milewide permanent ice cap at the planet's south pole.

title: Assembly Approves Sale Of N.Y.U. Bronx Campus
description: ALBANY, May 10  The Assembly today approved a proposal to have the City University buy the New York University Heights campus in the Bronx and to authorize the merger of the N.Y.U. Engineering School into the Polytechnic Institute of Brooklyn.

title: Richardson Golf to Begin Today With a Field of 126
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L.L, May 10Dick Siderowf, Canadian amaateur golf champion, is the favorite in a field of 126 as the Long Island amateur season opens tomorrow in the William D. Richardson Memorial tourney. The competition is an annual fixture at the Seawane Club.

title: Antiwar Protests Rise Here and Across the Country
description: Protests mounted yesterday against President Nixon's new Vietnam actions, with demonstrations in city streets and on campuses across the country.

title: HOUSE WEIGHS RISE IN MINIMUM WAGE
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 The House of Representatives began debate today on legislation that would increase the Federal minimum wage for most nonagricultural workers from $1.60 to $2 an hour.

title: Bay State Pay Rise Backed
description: BOSTON, May 10 (AP)The Massachusetts House overwhelmingly approved today a 4.3 per cent cost of living pay rise for state employes retroactive to Dec. 26, 1971, rejecting Gov. Francis W. Sargent's recommendation that the raise be postponed for one year.

title: BIG AIRLINES ASK AID IN HIJACKINGS
description: The presidents of 11 major airlines sent the Nixon Administration an urgent message yesterday urging, lkrge additions to Federal forces assigned to airports to prevent hijacking and sabotage of aircraft.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Long Island Lighting Company yesterday filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission (S.E.C.) 2,022,000 common shares in connection with a rights offering whereby shareholders may subscribe to one common share for each ten shares held of record May 31. The offer will expire June 16. The company's stock, actively traded yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange closed at 21, down .

title: U.S. Reaps Big Profits In Silver Dollar Sales
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (Reuters)  Treasury Secretary John 13. Connally, who is leading the Government drive on high profits, said today that the Government was reaping huge profits on sales of Eisenhower silver dollars.

title: City to Pay $400,000 in Consultant Fees
description: The City Council voted 29 to 7 yesterday to ask the state for permission to pay $400,000 to consultants for advice on investing money for the city's pensionfund investments.

title: Skaters Sign Pro Contracts
description: LOS ANGELES, May 10 (AP) Jo Starbuck and Ken Shelley, America's leading amateur figureskating pair, signed threeyear contracts with Ice Capades today.

title: W.H.O. Assembly Expels Taipei and Seats Peking
description: GENEVA, May 10  The World Health Organization withdrew China's seat in this United Nations agency from the Nationalist Government in Taipei today and gave it to Peking.

title: Hundreds Are Arrested in Antiwar Demonstrations
description: For the second consecutive day, antiwar protests convulsed cities and college campuses across the country yesterday as demonstrators blocked highways, occupied buildings, and at nightfought against clubwielding policemen under clouds of tear gas.

title: EXPORT INSURANCE ISSUED TO CHRYSLER
description: A comprehensive export credit insurance policy covering up to $250million annually of foreign sales was issued yesterday to the Chrysler Corporation by the ExportImport Bank of the United States and the Foreign Credit Insuranbe Association

title: Stockholders Assail I.T.T. Role
description: MEMPHIS, May 10Harold S. Geneen, chairman and president of the International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation, was sharply criticized today by a succession of stockholders over the company's role as a supplier of war equipment.

title: Conoco Asks Court Relief As Demand for Gas Grows
description: The Continental Oil Company filed suit yesterday in Federal District Court in Houston for relief from longterm gas delivery contracts. The case could set a precedent in view of a possible emerging national energy crisis.

title: Irish Vote on a Common Market Link
description: DUBLIN, May 10The Irish voted in large numbers today to determine whether they will go it alone in impoverished independence or take a chance On a more prosperous future as members of the enlarged European Economic Community.

title: CONNALLY SCANS ECONOMIC TOPICS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally said today that he thought the European Common Market would be inwardlooking for the rest of this decade and expressed doubts that Canada and Japan would change their economic policies in directions desired by the United States.

title: HUMPHREY LEADS IN DELEGATE RACE IN NEBRASKA, 1210
description: OMAHA, May 10Senator George McGovern of South Dakota won a solid victory yesterday in Nebraska's Presidential preference primary, but his chief rival, Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota, held a narrow and uncertain lead today in delegate strength in the state.

title: Advertising.
description: The militance of the Federal Trade Commission has awakened a militance in the Television Bureau iof Advertising, for 16 years the silent selling service of the medium.

title: Cahill Expresses Reservations Concerning Tocks Island Project
description: WASHINGTON, May 10The fate of the proposed Tocks Island dam and recreation area on the Delaware River between New Jersey and Pennsylvania became more clouded today when Gov. William T. Cahill of New Jersey for the first time expressed reservations about the project.

title: Saigon Replaces Highlands Commander
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, May 10The Saigon Government today ordered an immediate change in the military command in the Central Highlands, where enemy pressure has been steadily mounting.

title: Laird Pats Point Over With, Sports Phrases
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird, perhaps influenced by the sportsmindedness of President Nixon, twice turned to sporting expressions at his news conference today to describe military activities in Vietnam.

title: 7 RIGHTS LAWYERS QUIT JUSTICE UNIT
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) Seven, attorneys in the Justice Department's Civil Rights Division have resigned in a dispute over Nixon Administration policies and will join the campaign of Senator George McGovern of South Dakota for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Albany Vote on Abortion
description: ALBANY, May 10Following are the rollcall votes by which the Assembly and the State Senate voted to abolish the state's liberalized abortion law and restore the old law permitting abortions only when a woman's life is jeopardized:

title: Agriculture Aides Expect Food Prices to Rise Anew
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (UPI) Food prices have eased recently but may rise again this summer under pressure from tightened pork supplies, expanding consumer buying power and continued increases in food marketing costs, Government economists said today.

title: Catholic Girl Tarred
description: BELFAST, May 10A 15yearold Roman Catholic schoolgirl was tarred and feathered by the I.R.A. in Belfast tonight after being held prisoner for five nights and beaten, spokesman for the Royal Ulster Constabulary said.

title: When Freshness Counts the Most: A Seafood Guide
description: It is 5 in the morning and the city sleeps. Or most of it. The Fulton Fish Market is running full tiltand for excellent reason. This is where buyers for serious Manhattan restaurants haggle with wholesalers and decide what will turn up on plates all over the island that day.

title: Large Group of Icebergs a Peril To Shipping in North Atlantic
description: The largest group of icebergs to drift south of Newfoundland in nearly 30 years has pa the Coast Guard and North Atlantic shipping on the alert.

title: Credit Markets
description: Bond prices staged a general, though restrained, advance yesterday that left most interest rates at about the levels that prevailed before President Nixon announced his new Vietnam strategy Monday night.

title: BOYLE TELLS JURY OF U.M.W. FUND
description: PITTSBURGH, May 10W. A. Boyle, president of the United Mine Workers of America, testified before a Federal grand jury today about the origin and purpose of a special union fund that the Government says is connected with the murder of Joseph A. Yablonski.

title: Nixon Aides Explain Aims Of Letter on Abortion Law
description: WASHINGTON, May 10A high White House official said today that President Nixon had not intendedintentionally or accidentallyto embarrass Governor Rockefeller by voicing his support for efforts to repeal New York's liberal abortion law.

title: HOUSE GALLERIES SHUT FOR 3 HOURS
description: WASHINGTON, May 10Visitors were barred for three hours this afternoon from the galleries of the House of Representatives to prevent a recurrence of yesterday's disruptions in which 40 antiwar protesters were ejected.

title: Market Place: The Bottoin Line And Subjectivity
description: In Wall Street there is feeling that the earningspershare figure posted by a corporation is almost holy. And if a growing corporation falters, posting a decline in earnings in a given quarter, the market may react violently and the shares may never recover fully.

title: Buckling at Albany
description: The State Legislature at Albany has proved itself a patsy for the most vocal pressure groups. Votes in both the State Senate and Assembly on separate but controversial issues followed the sentiment of the crowds in the galleries rather than the larger public interest. In one vote, the Assembly first and then the Senate approved repeal of abortion law reform; in another, the Senate buckled to the bidding of the triallawyer lobby and rejected genuine nofault automobile insurance.

title: SECRETARY IS FIRM
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird said today that we will take those actions that are necessary to stop the supplies of equipment to North Vietnam, whether by airlift or by any ships that might evade American mines.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY EMBORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINEVADVT.

title: Schweitzer Asks Change In Position of the Dollar
description: MONTREAL, May 10PierrePaul Schweitzer, the managing director of the International Monetary Fund, outlined here today the views of the 120nar tion body on longrange reform of the international financial system.

title: Personal Finance
description: Physicians, lawyers, architects and other professionals who band together in socalled professional corporations are able to take advantage of the same tax angles long available to other corporations.

title: Pomfret's Girl Crew Wins
description: WORCESTER, Mass, May 10 In the first interscholastic crew event for girls held by the schools, Pomfret (Conn.) School's first fouroared shell with coxswain defeated the Pomfret seconds by six lengths today. The Worcester Tech girls freshmen were third.

title: Music: A Debut Cheered
description: If Fujikawa sounds to you like the name of a Japanese mountain, you could scarcely be more wrong, but in a way you would be getting near the truth, too. Mayumi Fujikawa is a tiny young violinist who would have trouble seeing over a molehill, but her New York debut Tuesday night with the Philadelphia Orchestra at Philharmonic Hall left this listener persuaded that her talent represents one of the notable peaks of a Japanese generation that is producing fine string, players in astonishing numbers.

title: Gimbel Division Will Open Jersey Furniture Center
description: The Gimbels New York division of. Gimbels Brothers, Inc., will open its first furniture clearance center this morning in Bergen County, N.J. It will be the first of a number of similar retail home furnishing units presently under consideration, according to Paul A. Salomone, president of Gimbels New York.

title: SUPER VALU STORES TOLD TO CUT PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP)  The Price Commission today ordered rollbacks by Super Valu Stores, Inc., a 20state super market chain with nearly $1billion in annual sales.

title: IN THE NATION
description: A questioner at Henry Kissinger's news conference recalled that, for ten years and through three Administrations, mining the North Vietnamese harbors had been considered to pose an unacceptable risk of confrontation with the Soviet Union. Can you tell us, what has changed to make that risk now acceptable? he asked.

title: Kehoe World Cup Coach
description: ST. LOUIS, May 10 (AP)Bob Kehoe, former coach of the St. Louis Stars, has been named coach of the 1974 United States World Cup soccer team, the United States Soccer Football Association said today. Kehoe was the playing captain of the 1965 World Cup team.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A Government survey released yesterday reported an increase of 57,000 jobs last March in the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area, but the increase was said to be below the season expectation for the month.

title: The Screen:'They Call Me Trinity' Relies on Humor
description: Whoever E. B. Clucher isand he is credited as writer-director of yesterday's new movie, "They Call Me Trinity"he has a sense of humor. So do Terence Hill and Bud Spencer, who have the leads in what begins as another of those spaghetti-Western bloodbaths. It starts with a grizzled derelict (Hill) entering a grimy cafe and minutes later gunning down two hombres without even aiming.But before long, as this derelict and his sheriff brother (Spencer) tangle with some mean landgrabbers and religious pioneers, the dialogue gets more scathingly funny. Indeed, toward the end, the cast seem hard put to keep straight faces.We'll buy this little Western from Italy, which amounts to nothing, simply for its carbolic impudence and scarcity of gore. And nobody strains at it. The two leads, young Hill and Spencer, a grizzled bear of a man, couldn't be more likable, nor the film more inconsequential. It's at the Astor and other showcases.

title: Iran Leads Egypt, 20
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 10 (AP)Iran took a 20 lead over Egypt in the Davis Cup today by winning both singles. Taghi Akbari beat Ebrahim Mahmoud, 61, 64, 108, and Hussein Akbari, his brother, downed Ali Davoudi, 63, 63, 64.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Those lammisters of yesteryear, the Dodgers and the Giants, follow each other into Shea Stadium for the next few days and they always create excitement in our village whenever they return. If there is an extra smidgeon excitement right now, it has been caused by the possibility that the Giants might be ready to hand back to New York fans their onetime idol, Willie Mays.

title: S.E.C. Orders Suspension
description: WASHINGTON, May 10 (AP) The Securities and Exchange Commission ordered a tenday suspension today in overthecounter trading tin the stock of the First World Corporation of Hasbrouck Heights, N. J. The S.E.C. said it acted because of the absence of correct information on the company, its operations and financial condition.

title: SAMUEL P. ORLANDO, LAWYER, 72, IS DEAD
description: HADDONFIELD, N. J., May 10 (AP)Samuel P. Orlando, a lawyer who served as Superior Court judge in 195758, died today at his home here. He was 72 years old.

title: Loren Graham of Pace Is Dead; A Retired Academic Dean, 66
description: Loren Graham, associate dean for academic standards at Pace College in New York from 1966 to his retirement in 1970, died Tuesday evening in his sleep of a cardiac arrest at the Burke Rehabilitation Center in White Plains. He was 66 years old and lived at 147 East 60th Street.

title: Savings Banks Deposits Show Increase for April
description: Deposits in the nation's mutual savings banks grew by $450million in Aprila. $280million inflow, of new deposits plus. $170million of interest payments, the National Association of Mutual Savings Banks reported yesterday.

title: Minority Group's Significance in TV Deal
description: Instead of purchasing all five of the television stations licensed to TimeLife Inc., McGrawHill, Inc., will be acquiring only four. The fifth, a very high frequency (VHF) Station in Grand Rapids, Mich will be retained by TimeLife.

title: CLAUDE PATTERSON
description: ST. LOUIS, May 10 (UPI) Claude (Pat) Patterson, a former member of the pro bowling tour and a nominee to the American Bowling Congress Hall of Fame, died yesterday in St. Mary's Hospital here. He was 46 years old.

title: A Piratic Act
description: HONG KONG, May 10. the first press comment from Hanoi on President Nixon's deicision to mine North Vietnamese ports, Nhan Dan, theCommunist party organ, described it today as a pratice act that was pregnant with, dangerous consequences for the U. S.

title: RANGEL DENOUNCES CRITICISM BY CORE
description: Representative Charles B. Rangel, Democrat of Harlem, rejected yesterday the recent criticism of his record by the Congress of Racial Equality and urged his opponent for his 19th Congressional District seat, Livingston L. Wingate, to reject the endorsement of the civil rights group.

title: Tower's Headquarters Burn
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 10 (UPI) A fire, possibly the work of an arsonist, destroyed the twostory state campaign headquarters of Senator John G. Tower early today. The Republican Senator said the blaze destroyed his campaign records and hurt his chances for reelection.

title: NOW ADVANTAGE GOES TO THE NETS
description: Coach Lou Carnesecca of the Nets was obviously delighted, as he has been many times in the past month, following his team's 117115 triumph over the Indiana Pacers on Tuesday night in Indianapolis.

title: SteppedUp Research on Coal Energy Is Urged
description: WASHINGTON, May 10William T. Pecora, the Under Secretary of the Interior, told Congress today that it would be asked for more money to finance research into new ways of harnessing the energy of coal, the nation's most abundant conventional fuel.

title: NOVELTY ENRICHES PIANISTS PROGRAM
description: Programs off the beaten path have become standard with the twopiano team of Robert Phillips and Franco Renzulli. In fact, in their concert in Tully Hall on Tuesday night, two of the works presented were not even for two pianos. Mr. Renzulli turned accompanist for his own Three Songs on Poems of Emily Dickinson, sung by Jeannette Walters, soprano. And Mr. Phillips turned conductor for his Fantasia intima, which is scored for violin, five winds and percussion.

title: George W. Trendle Dies at 87; Creator of The Lone Ranger
description: GROSSE POINTE, Mich., May 11 (UPI)George W. Trendle, a former radio executive who created The Lone Ranger, Sgt. Preston of the Yukon The Green Hornet, died yesterday of a heart attack at the age of 87.

title: Text of Soviet Statement on Vietnam
description: MOSCOW, May 11Following, as translated by The New Yorlz Times, is the text of a statement on Vietnam by the Soviet Government, as distributed today by Tass, the official press agency:

title: Amherst President Among 500 Arrested
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., May 11John William Ward, president of Amherst College, and his wife were arrested today for their part in an early morning antiwar demonstration that blocked the entrance to the Westover. Air Force Base near here.

title: Wood, Field and Stream: New Jersey Trout Crisis
description: New Jersey's Council of Trout Unlimited has called upon the state's Fish Game and Shellfisheries Division to adopt a bold, new approach in its trout management program.

title: Advertising:
description: The East New York Savings Bank will soon be able to tell us how many people in this town really believe that it's more blessed to give than to receive.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In answer to Melvin A. Goodman's letter of March 27 commenting on Arthur Krock's article on U.S.U.S.S.R. recognition (OpEd March 27), I feel that I should reply, since Arthur Krock used my paper on the subject as the source for part of his article. After checking my sources and confirming my facts from new sources, I must differ in most respects from the facts and implications of Mr. Goodman's letter, namely!

title: Roundup: Wobbly Giants Put Expos Away Quickly
description: The San Francisco Giants, struggling to get out of the National League's Western Division cellar, exploded for six runs on 10 hits in the first three innings to trample the Montreal Expos, 62, last night in Jerry Park.

title: Pope Asks Big Powers To Shun a Showdown
description: ROME, May 11Pope Paul VI appealed today for the avoidance of a bigpower challenge over Vietnam and in the Middle East at all costs.

title: Britain Dismisses Charge It Attacked Southern Yemen
description: LONDON, May 11 (AP)Britain today denied charges that her planes and warships had attacked Southern Yemen in support of a conspiracy by conservative Arab neighbors to overthrow the Marxist regime.

title: A Show With Words and Music And a Noted Cast of Characters
description: ALBANY, May., 11Lieut. Gov. Malcolm Wilson, the Legislature's master of parliamentary legerdemain and elocutionist of Latin, and Latinisms, has drawn the increasing admiration of his less glib colleagues as the 1972, legislative Session wanes.

title: STOCK IS OFFERED BY EASTERN AIR
description: Eastern Air. Lines is raising more than $50million by selling 2 million shares of common stock at $27.125 through a syndicate of investment banking firms headed by Kuhn, Loeb & Co. and Smith, Barney & Co.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE, NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH. DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Painter & Lord, Ltd., Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: Assembly Approves $47Million In Funds for Parochial Schools
description: ALBANY, May 11The Assembly gave final legislative approval today to an amended parochialschool aid bill that could provide as much as $47million in state funds for nonpublic schools across the state.

title: DEFENDING ANLOC: South Vietnamese soldiers with antitank guns ready. At rear is wreck, of Sovietmade tank.
description: MYCHANH, South Vietnam, May 11  As the locusts screeched from the tamarind trees in the heavy heat, South Vietnamese marines dozed in their hammocks, played Chinese chess or, strumming guitars, sang sentimental popular songs.

title: Summit at Moscow?
description: Moscow may yet change its mind; but meanwhile there is welcome evidence of restrained reaction to the challenge President Nixon posed to the Soviet Union with his risky decision Monday to mine the harbors North Vietnam. The threat of confrontation is by no means dissipated; but at least there were encouraging signs yesterday suggesting that the Presidential visit to the Soviet capital may take place as scheduled.

title: Ford Says Company Profit Is Its Social Responsibility
description: DETROIT, May 11Henry Ford 2d said today at the Ford Motor Company's annual meeting that the business of business still was  despite social responsibility  largely btisiness.

title: Executive Changes
description: American District Telegraph Company has named Raymond B. Carey Jr., president, to the additional post of chief executive officer. Lawrence J. O'Brien will continue as chairman.

title: Reshevsky Draws As Chess National Nears Last Round
description: The 12th and nexttolast round in the 21st National Annual Chess Championship, held Wednesday at the Group Health Building at 230 West 41st Street, resulted in competition that was sharp and profound among the players vying for first place.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Senator George McGovern of South Dakota established himself as the frontrunner in the June 20 Presidential primary in New York yesterday by filing delegate slates in 37 of the state's 39 Congressional districts while his opposition fragmented.

title: Stage: Porter's Du Barry Was a Lady
description: Cole Porter is not cooling it, not this year. Night spot minstrels are performing him with renewed vigor. A big, elegant volume, Cole, crammed with memorabilia of Broadway's late tunesmith, is thriving across the counters. Anything Goes, given a nifty revival off Broadway, some years ago, is heading back to Broadway this fall.

title: Letters, to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your April 27 lead editorial says: Although the Democratic party is a house of many mansions, it contains only two seats of power  the trade unions [and] the intellectuals and students  and their middleclass allies.

title: United Press International
description: The Tien Chee, left, and the Royston Grange locked together and burning at entrance to River Plate channel.

title: CATTLE FUTURES CONTINUE TO RISE
description: Prices of beef cattle and hog futures on the Chicago Mercantile Exchange are the highest they have been for several months.

title: State Seizes Banned Pesticides Here
description: State inspectors began staging raids yesterday on New York City stores that have persiated in selling illegal pesticides and in at least two Brooklyn confrontations, drew angry reactions from storeowners who called the city police.

title: Father of Masked Rider
description: It was the fall of 1932 and things had not been going well for radio station WXYZ in Detroit. Three years earlier Mr. Trendle and his partner, John H. King, had sold a chain of movie theaters for $6million to buy the station, shifting their interests to broadcasting.

title: CHEM NOTCHES 5 RIDING VICTORIES
description: Angel Cordero came through with another one of his multiplevictory days yesterday at Aqueduct. The cheerful Puerto Rican jockey registered five triumphs, including one on the Buckland Farm's Sea Saga in the feature race on the program.

title: Irish Yes for Europe
description: We are not lost in the mists of a Celtic twilight, said Premier Jack Lynch in predicting that the Republic of Ireland would vote decisively to join the European Common Market. And so it turned out. The overwhelming approval of Irish voters helps maintain momentum for the expansion of the European Community to ten nations and improves prospects for favorable outcomes in similar referendums on entry this fall in Denmark and Norway.

title: MERRILL CLOUGH, COWES OFFICIAL
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., May 11 Merrill H. Clough, who recently retired as controller and treasurer of Cowles Communications, died today at his home, 148 Maple Hill Road, after a long illness. He was 53 years old.

title: Candidates Day
description: FLINT, Mich., May 11Senator George McGovern sought today to drive the school busing issue out of the forefront of the Michigan primary race and replace it with concern over the Vietnam war.

title: For Eager Harlem Writer, a Schulberg Workshop
description: A collection of what may be some of the city's future top flight writing talents were sitting around a table Wednesday night in a smoky room of the Salem Methodist Church's community house.

title: 20 Revenue Agents Reported Checking Into Hughes Empire
description: LOS ANGELES, May 11 (UPI) An elite team of about 20 Internal Revenue Service investigators has been assembled in Las Vegas with orders to concentrate exclusively on the multimillion dollar empire of Howard Hughes, The Los Angeles Times said today.

title: RUSSELL CROTHERS
description: Russell Preston Crothers, who had, been in the, oilrefining equipment field until his retirement three years ago, died Wednesday at his home, 151 East 83d Street. He was 76 years old.

title: Boston Wins Cup
description: The Boston Bruins captured the National Hockey League's Stanley Cup, 4 victories to 2, last night by defeating the New York Rangers, 30, at Madison Square Garden. Details on Page 33.

title: NoFault Insurance Hope Buried in State Assembly
description: ALBANY, May 11No fault automobile accident insurance, considered by Governor Rockefeller to be the primary consumer issue before the 1972 Legislature, was officially interred in the Assembly today.

title: Funds for Drug Treatment
description: WASHINGTON, May 11 (UPI) The Office of Economic Opportunity announced today that it would spend $4million in 16 cities to expand and improve methadone and other treatment programs for drug addicts.

title: SelfEffacing Air Marks Canton Fair
description: CANTON, China, Friday, May 12On the seventh floor of the Canton Fair building a young girl in a lavender shirt and pigtails was running briskly through the statistics of agricultural progress in a dry and windy region of Hopei province not far from Peking.

title: Jane Mitchell, W. T. Ylvisaker Wed in London
description: Miss Jane Penelope Mitchell was married yesterday to William Townend Ylvisaker, president and chief executive officer of Gould Inc. of Chicago, manufacturers of batteries, engine parts and electronic devices. The ceremony was performed at the Chelsea Registry in London.

title: FASHION TALK
description: The sportswear avalanche goes rolling along. After a week of fall showings on Seventh Avenue, the sweater has definitely achieved high fashion status. Better still, two sweaters. One is a pullover, the other a cardigan which, likely as not, is tied around the neck by the sleeves.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In recent years an increasing number of mothers who had given up their babies for adoption have, after the lapse of some years, demanded the return of the child on the ground that they were the child's natural mother. Biological affinity is not a just ground for such a claim.

title: HOUSE BACKS RISE IN MINIMUM WAGE TO $2 NEXT YEAR
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The House of Representatives passed a Republicansponsored bill today that would raise the minimum wage for most nonagricultural workers from $1.60 an hour to $1.80 this year and $2 next year.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: CHARLESTON, W. Va., May 11In West Virginia, where ballots from Tuesday's primary were still being counted yesterday, Senator Humphrey appeared likely to win 17 of the state's 35 delegates to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Mays Back in Town and Mets Have Him
description: Willie Mays, a $165,000aYear folkhero at the age of 41, was traded to the New York Mets yesterday by the San Francisco Giants after one Of the most complex series of negotiations in baseball history. The deal was made after 10 years of preliminaries, One Month of bartering and four clays of intensive talks. And when it was finally completed, it returned Mays to the New York baseball scene where he had started his career 21 years and 646 home runs ago.

title: REALTY BROKERS FACE CRACKDOWN
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 11A crackdown on mortgage sharks who allegedy victimize financially distressed Long Island homeowners was announced today by the New York Secretary of State, John P. Lomenzo.

title: Apt First at Freehold
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., May 11 (AP)Apt won the $4,000 Landisville pace by a nose at Freehold Raceway today to pay $7.40, $4.80 and $3.60 for $2 across the board. Featherstep finished second, a nose in front of Camden Doctor.

title: March inventories In Sluggish Rise; Business Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Total business inventories continued to rise at a very sluggish pace in March, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Wednesday's Fights
description: Rimini, Italy Tommaso Galli, Italy, knocked out Luis Aisa Marln, Spain, 9 rounds, junior lightweights; Galli retained European title.

title: U.S. Helped Finance Relief Housing Here For Speculators, Senate Panel Discovers
description: Governmentinsured mortgages were used to finance the purchase by speculators of hundreds of buildings in Brooklyn and Queens that were then filled with welfare families for which the city paid finder's tees and broker's fees as well as rents, a Senate subcommittee has learned.

title: Hospital in Hanoi Bears Scars From the Air War
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 11The SovietVietnamese Friendship Hospital and its grounds had a surrealistic appearance today, with roofs, masonry, trees and vehicles twisted and riddled with shrapnel.

title: Letters, to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The TelAviv University offered a position as Professor of Chemistry to Prof. Veniamin G. Levich after learning of his desire to leave the U.S.S.R. and to emigrate to Israel. Although he never received the offer sent by telegram, he accepted this post by telephone.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Mayor Lindsay said yesterday that Increased police protection and better street lighting and sanitation had helped improve the Times Square area.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: COLUMBIA, Ohio, May 11 (UP)Senator Hubert H. Humphrey won 75 delegates in the May 2 Ohio Presidential primary and Senator George McGovern won 65, according to final unofficial figures released today. This represents a onedelegate gain for Mr. Humphrey over Mr. McGovern from the previous unofficial figures. Secretary of State Ted Brown gave the final tabulation.

title: 2 Foreman Works For Dance Prove ThoughtProvoking
description: The two collage works that made up Laura Foreman's thought  provoking concert Wednesday evening at Judson Memorial Church show her skill almost more as a director than as a choreographer. She is one of the new strain of creative talents, nurtured in dance, who takes bits of motion where they find it to make their own kinetic assemblages without feeling the necessity to invent every step.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISUnable to square the Vietnames circle, President Nixon apparentiy, hopes to triangulate it. Addressing himself particularly to Russia and China, Hanoi's great power backers, he opened wider the doors marked war and peace and seemed to suggest a choice. Judging by their actions, not their protestations, the Communist behemoths have so far chosen peace.

title: Cup Lost, Rangers Not At Loss for Words
description: Outside the Ranger dressing room, Emile Francis, who already had consoled his players after their Stanley Cup loss last night, motioned to two blueuniformed Madison Square Garden policemen who were guarding the door.

title: Price Panel Names Companies That Met Rules on Profit Reports
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Price Commission issued today a list of companies that were identified last week as having failed to file required profitmargin reports but that were since found to have filed properly or determined not to have to file separate reports. The list includes the following companies, all of which filed properly under their own names, or otherwise as noted:

title: Parley Is Shown How an Immunologic Delense Against Cancer Can Be Stimulated
description: GATLINBURG, Tenn., May 11  A physician used dramatic beforeandafter pictures of a breast cancer patient here totalay to show how povverfully the body's natural defenses can sometimes be stimulated to counterattack a tumor that has grown beyond control.

title: Moscow Envoy Also Joins Meeting at White House
description: WASHINGTON, May 11A highranking Soviet official conferred with President Nixon about trade matters today and said later that there was no reason to doubt that Mr. Nixon's trip to Moscow would take place as planned, 11 days from now.

title: Setback for Strip Miners
description: When West Virginia Democrats went to the primary polls Tuesday in the lovely mountain springtime, many of them passed the sickening scars left by stripmininga spreading technique for extracting coal cheaply by stripping trees and topsoil from mountain tops and valleys to get at the state's rich seams of black gold.

title: JEWISH CONGRESS KEEPS KAHANE OUT
description: CLEVELAND, May 11Rabbi Meir Kahane, president of the Jewish Defense League, was barred today from the biennial meeting of the American Jewish Congress.

title: MORTON APPROVES ALASKA PIPELINE; COURT FIGHT SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, May 11Secretary of the Interior Rogers C. B. Morton approved today construction of the controversial transAlaska oil pipeline. He said the action was in the national interest to gain needed energy supplies.

title: Books of The Times
description: The argument in Martin Green's book grew out of a personal, dilemma. British by birth, educated here and in England, a literary critic and cultural histbrian, he felt more and more that he was failing his students. They were unhappy with what they were receiving, he was not overly confident in what he was giving them. The traditional history of English literature and its arrangement into courses of study, and imparting the knowledge of clear English prose and the ability to use it, had become bankrupt endeavors.

title: Fete for ExAssemblyman
description: A testimonial dinner in honor of former Assemblyman Samuel Weisman will be held by the Bronx Division of the Hebrew Home for the Aged tomorrow night at the Roosevelt Hotel, Madison Avenue and 45th Street. Bronx District Attorney Burton B. Roberts is chairman.

title: Rights Suit Is Filed At Container Corp. By Federal Agency
description: WASHINGTON, May 11The Equal Employment Opportunity Commission filed suit today aginst the Container Corporation of America and four unions and their locals to end alleged job discrimination against wome and black people.

title: Scribner's Choice for Examiners Board Allegedly Harassed Union Teachers
description: A former Harlem principal who was once charged by state committee with harassing union teachers has been nominated by Chancellor Harvey B. Scribner to serve on the Board of Examiners, in a move that evoked concern from three members of the city board of education.

title: It Isn't the Cuban Missile Crisis
description: The Naval quarantine proclaimed by President Kennedy during the Cuban missile crisis of 1962 was, like President Nixon's mining of North Vietnamese harbors, an interdiction of Soviet shipping that risked the nightmare of nuclear war. There all resemblance ends.

title: Notes on People
description: Premier Golda Meir gave an official dinner in honor of Capt. Reginald Levy and other members, of the hijacked Sabena Belgian airliner freed in Tel Aviv three days ago by Israeli paratroops.
