title: When It Was All Over the Big Difference Was Orr
description: The Rangers and their fans were left with a curious mixture of pride and dejection yesterday in the wake of Thursday's night 30 loss to the Bruins that gave the Bostonians the Stanley Cup and denied the New Yorkers the champagne for the 32d straight year.ed and some fans were trampled.

title: White Motor Files an Offer Covering 1,283,000 Shares
description: The White Motor Corporation filed a registration statement yesterday with the Securities and Exchange Commission covering an offering of 1,283,000 common shares to be sold by an underwriting group comanaged by Lehman Brothers aid Lazard Freres & Co.

title: DR. EMIL V. RIEU, 85; NOTED FOR CLASSICS
description: LONDON, May 12Dr. Emil Victor Rieu, who brought classical literature in paperback to the masses, died here yesterday. He Was 85 years old.

title: F. J. SWAYZE 2D, 61, AIRLINEEXECUTIVE
description: Francis Joseph. Swayze 2d, a former officer of Pan American Airways who helped build airline systems, for developing countries, died Thursday of cancer in Roosevelt Hospital. He was 61 in old and formerly lived n New York.

title: CITY IS ASSAILED ON ITS PHONE BILL
description: The city was criticized in the City Council yesterday for its failure to control the use of office telephones and official automobiles for private purposes by employes.

title: NADER UNIT BACKED IN LICENSE DISPUTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Three Senators and 18 Representatives have joined a Ralph Nader organization in appealing for a reversal of a decision by the Department of Agriculture granting two companies exclusive licenses on Governmentowned patents.

title: India Match Postponed
description: BANGALORE, India, May 12 (AP)The first match of the Davis Cup Eastern Zone Tennis finals between India and Australia was postponed today because of wet grounds.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The April 15 OpEd article by Secretary of Agriculture Earl Butz heartened me as a transplanted farm girl from Minnesota, showing to city people the reality of the farm situation during a period of high food prices. But. I find myself unconvinced of the Secretary's sincerity in helping the entire farm populace. By this I mean the little man working his quarter or halfsection of land by himself sunup to sundown seven days a week.

title: Tighter Steel Quotas
description: The art of political euphemism achieves golden heights whenever the Government proclaims new barriers to foreign trade. Now it is President Nixon declaring his pleasure in announcing that the steel producers Japan, the European Community and the United Kingdom have expressed their intention to restrain on a voluntary basis their exports of steel mill products to the United States during the next three years. This voluntary agreement, he says, represents a substantial improvement over the arrangements of the last three years and will enable domestic steel producers to make their plans with confidence that imports will not be disruptive.

title: Notes On Metropolitan Congressmen
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Efforts to maintain some semblance or party unity in the Democratic Congressional delegation from. New York have been postponed because of the primary election.

title: MRS. MEYER ZINMAN
description: Mrs. Florence Handler Zinman, a retired elementary school teacher and widow of Meyer. E. Zinman, former chairman of secretarial studies at Theodore Roosevelt High School, the Bronx, died Wednesday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 81 years old and lived at 215 West 91st Street.

title: MRS. STUART W. WEBB
description: STONINGTON, Conn., May 12 Mrs. Marcia Sewell Webb, widow of Stuart Weston Webb, banker and industrialist, died today at her home here. Her age was 84.

title: 84 DEAD IN COLLISION OFF URUGUAY COAST
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 12  A maritime collission near here yesterday that set afire the Royston Grange, a British cargo ship, and the Tien Chee, a Liberianflag tanker, has taken 84 lives, according to Uruguayan authorities.

title: Newton Denies Charges
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 12 (AP)The Black Panther leader Huey P. Newton and his bodyguard pleaded not guilty today to misdemeanor charges in the beating of a disk jockey in an Oakland bar. Newton and Robert L. Bay were arrested April 27 on battery complaints filed by Alonzo Miller, 29, years old, who uses the: name Marlon Scott as a disk jockey for KDIA, Oakland.

title: Canada to Protest to U.S. About Higher Tire Duties
description: OTTAWA, May 12 (AP)Trade Minister JeanLuc Pepin said today that the Canadian Government would make representations to the United States Treasury about its proposals to put higher duties on Michelin tires, manufactured in Nova Scotia.

title: Four Note Opera Clever and Funny
description: Opera is so often a parody of itself that when people try to satirize it, the material gets out of hand and becomes tiresome. Tom Johnson has come up with a fresh dissection of the form, called The Four Note Opera, It was given its premiere at the Cubiculo Theater Thursday night, and it was clever and funny.

title: OUTLOOK CHEERS BUSINESS COUNCIL
description: HOT SPRINGS, Va., May 12  Leaders of the Business Council struck a cheery note about the economic outlook today but complained about the Nixon Administration's pricecontrol program.

title: OTB Bill Exempts Suffolk
description: ALBANY, May 12 (UPI)The bill providing a oneyear moratorium on new offtrack betting operations was amended further today in the State Assembly to allow Western New York and Suffolk County to be exempted from the freeze. The moratorium earlier had exempted the city of Schenectady and Nassau and Orange Counties.

title: League of Women Voters Looks to Young
description: The problem that the League of Women Voters of New York City faces, of course, is to project its relevancy in a time of women's liberation, says the president, Nicky (Leave out Mrs. Arnold Hellerthe whole emphasis is women running on their own steam) Heller.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: DENVER, May 12 (AP) Richard C. LaPoint, 23 years old, a confessed airplane hijacker from Revere, Mass., was sentenced to 40 years in Federal prison today by Federal District Court Judge Alfred A. Arraj.

title: Solomon Gains in Belgium
description: BRUSSELS, May 12 (UPI)Unseeded Harold Solomon of Silver Springs, Md., advanced to the final round of the Belgian open tennis championships today by beating Juan Gisbert of Spain, 8.6, 62. He will next meet secondseeded Andres Gimeno of Spain, who struggled to a 75, 36, 64 victory over Patrick Hombergen of Belgium.

title: ACCORD REACHED ON STOCK QUOTES
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va.; May 12Members of the Securities Industry Association have reached agreement that a sophisticated twolevel market information system should be created to link the nation's stock exchanges in a new national stock market that is being created.

title: Turk to Form Government
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 12 (UPI)  Premierdesignate Suat Hayri Urguplu has won support from Turkey's six parties to form a new government. Mr. Urguplu was named Premier by President Cevdet Sunay on April 29 after the resignation of Dr. Nihat Erim.

title: Zurich Bank Fights Suit
description: Cambio & Valorenbank, a Zurich bank named as a defendant in a $3.5million lawsuit by American Export International, Inc., said this week that the suit, which also named Frederic Schoni, Kurt Schmon, Werner Mischler and Adrian Hinderling, was without merit insofar as these defendants are concerned. The announcement was made here through Theodore S. Jaf fin of 430 Park Avenue, attorney for the five defendants.

title: MESKILL SEEKING LAW ON ABORTION
description: HARTFORD, May 12  Gov. Thomas J. Meskill summoned the General Assembly today to a special session, beginning next Tuesday, to write an abortion law to replace the old one that has been struck down as unconstitutional.

title: Court Reform Is Rejected As Legislature Adjourns
description: ALBANY, May 12The 195th session of the New York State Legislature came to a close shortly after 10 tonight, after the lawmakers handed a major setback to Governor Rockefeller in his attempts to overhaul the state's court system.

title: U.S. WELFARE BILL BARS INELIGIBLES
description: U.S. WELFARE BILL BARS INELIGIBLES

title: PHILIP MOSER
description: Philip Moser, president of Hirschberger & Co., a department store in Luxembourg, died Wednesday in Memorial Hospital. He was 78 years old and lived in Luxembourg and at 240 Central Park South.

title: U.S. FUNDS APPROVED FOR ARREARS TO I.L.O.
description: WASHINGTON, May 12House and Senate conferees approved today the appropriation of funds to pay part of the dues the United States has owed to the International Labor Organization since 1970.

title: Outlook for 1985
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va., May 12 (AP)  The president of the Securities Industry Association predicted today that by 1985 brokerage firms are going to be selling financial services; not stocks and bonds.

title: Blacks and Latins Relinquish Hall at Columbia After 17 Days
description: Lewisohn Hall, the longest occupied btillding on the Columbia University campus, was peacefully vacated yesterday by the black and Latin students who had held it for 17 days.

title: Witness Ties Proposed Move Of Bell System Offices to Bias
description: An urbanplanning specialist asserted yesterday that the planned relocation of the Bell System's operational and engineering divisions from 195 Broatiway in lower Manhattan to Bernards Township, N. J., was part of a pattern of discrimination by the giant telephone system and its subsidiaries against black, Spanishspeaking and women employes.

title: COURT DISMISSES ATTACK ON RIKERS
description: A State Supreme Court Justice here has thrown out the Legal Aid Society's broad attack on the Rikers Island Reformatory, ruling that it is not up to the courts to decide whether or not the facility's rehabilitation programs do any good.

title: Two Germanys Initial Their Traffic Pact
description: BONN, May 12  East and West Germany today initialed their first state treatydealing with all kinds of transportation and declared jointly that it was a big step toward an accord normalizing relations between them.

title: I.R.S. Employe's Dismissal Overturned by U. S. Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) The United States Court of Claims said today that an Internal Revenue Service employe had been discharged for supposedly associating vial an alleged underworld figure in Newark.

title: Patents of the Week
description: WASHINGTON, May 12Equipment that was patented this week automatically spots a truck that is too noisy, records the sound and photographs the vehicle and its front license plate. The apparatus was invented at C.B.S. Laboratories, Stamford, Conn., for authori ties to use in enforcing any state or local regulations lirniting vehicle noise. Benjamin B. Bauer, vice president of the, laboratories in charge of acoustics and magnetics, and two of his associatesRichard G. Allen and Emil L. Torickwere granted Patent 3,661,224. It is assigned to the parent company, the Columbia Broadcasting System, Inc.

title: Deaths
description: BARUCHEvelyn D., beloved wife of Raymond, loving mother of Sheldon, cherished grandmother of Ronny and Steven, dear sister of Lilly Schwartz and Sid Tovin, Services Sunday, May 14, 12 noon at The Riverside, Bronx, 179th St. and Grand Concourse.

title: YANKS GET WORD FROM HOUK: WIN
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 12Deciding the time had come to remind his players that the object of the game is winning and not losing, Manager Ralph Houk held a team meeting tonight, after which the Yankees defeated the California Angels, 63.

title: Mets Top Giantson Grote's Hitin 9th, 21
description: With Willie Mays in the home dugout and, the largest crowd of the season in the stands, the New York Mets scored one run in the eighth inning last night to tie the San Francisco Giants and another in the ninth to beat them, 21.

title: MRS. GEORGE B. PI DOT
description: Mrs. Virginia Ulrich Pidot, wife of George B. Pidot, a partner in the law firm of Shearman & Sterling, 53 Wall Street, died Thursday in Memorial Hospital. She was 59 years old and lived on Piping Rock Road in Locust Valley, L. I.

title: Market Place:
description: Remember the man who bought Johnson & Johnson for the wrong reasons and made a bundle? Well, the story didn't sit well with a lot of registered representatives who describe themselves as conscientiousindeed, many of them are.

title: DuPonts Toast a New Museum
description: GREENVILLE, Del., May 12 The place to find the duPonts last night was between the snow geese and Mount Kenya.

title: Music: Maazel's Mahler
description: It might seem strange until you think about it a moment, but the more complex a new piece of music is, the faster it has to be played to make sense, both to listeners and performers. That is why Isilendelssohn advised conductors who did not fully grasp a work to take fast tempos, to get over the ground.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May, 12There is a primary election in Michigan Tuesday, and from time to time a Presidential candidate ventures into the state, Nothing, however, seems to enliven the leaden political atmosphere.

title: DR. OTTO ISAKOWER
description: Dr. Otto Isakower, a psychoanalyst, died on Wednesday at his nome, 1148 Fifth Avenue. He was 72 years old.

title: Soviet Union and China Could Keep North Vietnam Supplied by Rail, U.S. Specialists Say
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) After some adjustments, the Soviet Union and China could get enough war matriel and food into North Vietnam by rail to make up for seaborne supplies cut off by the mining of North Vietnamese ports, United States military and civilian specialists believe.

title: ReaganRockefeller Parley Is Picketed
description: Antiwar demonstrators fought with the police yesterday outside a San Francisco hotel where President Nixon's California campaign for reelection was being opened by. Gov. Ronald Reagan and New York's Governor Rockefeller.

title: Washington to Provide All Reports on Mining
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 12 (UPI)  The United States command announced today that it would no longer provide information about the mining of seven North. Vietnamese ports. It said that such information would be available only in Washington.

title: Obituary: Motherhood
description: OBITUARY: MOTHERHOOD. Died, as a symbol, a life role, a sacred institution, sometime in the early nineteenseventies. Causes of death: concern for overpopulation; and the desire of many to live as free individuals, not nurturers of young.

title: Loss at British Ford
description: LONDON, May 12Ford of Britain lost $44.2million in 1971, the first unprofitable year the company has had since it began operations 39 years ago.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Though he insists his fall dress collection was planned not to look like sportswear, Malcolm Starr protests a bit too much. His waistlength, dolman sleeve, tieon jackets aren't so different from the sweaters other people are showing with pants, even though they're in satin or lame. And his cardigans are the same shape Chanel made famous and everybody's integrating with pullovers in twin sweater sets.

title: The Talk of Blackwell, Okla.
description: BLACKWELL, Okla. These days the clouds, blueblack with rain, charge across the field of green winter wheat, bullying the earth with thick raindrops, hail and lightning.

title: Construction Pay Rises Found Curbed
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Construction Industry Stabilization Committee said today that it has sharply reduced the rate of increase in construction wages this year.

title: DEATH IS DEMANDED IN HIJACKING CASES
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 (AP) The Federal Aviation Administrator, John H. Shaffer, called upon the courts today to impose death sentence upon convicted airline hijackers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Several persons have sent me copies of a letter to the editor published April 18 which carried the headline Drugs: Dangerous Generic Equivalency. The letter [by H. B. Kostenbauder, president of the Academy of Pharmaceutical Sciences] is antisocial and cruel because it attempts through fear, innuendo and halftruths to mislead old and poor people to spend their incomes irrationally for needed prescription medicines.

title: Exchange Is Asked For Puts and Calls
description: WASHINGTON, May, 12 the Securities and Exchange Commission announced today that it had received a preliminary application from a group of businessmen who want to establish a new securities exchange on which putandcall options on stocks would be traded. No such organized market for putandcall options exists now.

title: CURBS TO CONTINUE ON CONTROLS ABROAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 12The Commerce Department announced today that the program of controls over direct corporate investment abroad would continue in 1972 without major change from 1971.

title: ALFRED G. OEHLER
description: Alfred G. Oehler, retired electrical editor of Railway Age, Railway Engineer and Railway Locomotives and Cars, all SimmonsBoardman publications, died yesterday at his home in Surrey, England. He was 83 years old.

title: Yale Students Feast on Rare Comic Books Under Glass
description: NEW HAVEN, May 12The display or an extensive collection of comic books from the nineteenthirties through the fifties has unexpectedly proved to be the most popular exhibition within recent memory at Yale University.

title: Executive Changes
description: L. C. Ackerman has been named chairman of the Newport News Shipbuilding and Dry Dock Company and continues as chief executive officer. He suceeds N. W. Freeman, who remains executive committee chairman john P. Diesel succeeds Mr. Ackerman as chairman.

title: PACERS SET BACK NETS, 114 TO 108, AND GAIN 21 LEAD
description: UNIONDALE, L., I., May 12 George McGinnis, the Indiana fast break and the control of the boards were too much for the New York Nets tonight. The Pacers put those ingredients together, especially in the second half, to break up a close game and defeat the Nets, 114108, in the third game of the American Basketball. Association championship playoff at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: 2 INDUSTRY CHIEFS ATTACK PENTAGON
description: WASHINGTON, May 12 Officials of two aerospace companies complained to Senators today that faulty management and an excess of control from the Pentagon was helping to drive up weapon costs.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The United States Administration's claim that the dispatch of the aircraft carrier Enterprise to the Indian Ocean toward the end of the IndiaBangladeshPakistan war prevented a major Indian thrust into West Pakistan has been repeated by Eugene Rostow (OpEd April 6] and C. L. Sulzberger (April 21 column].

title: Address by Burns on Monetary Reforms
description: MONTREAL, May 12Following is the, text of a speech here today at an American Bankers Association, conference by Dr. Arthur F. Burns, chairman of the Federal Reserve Board:

title: Anloc Still Holds After Enemy's Fiercest Shelling
description: LAIKHE, South Vietnam, May 12A gigantic crush of firepower has fallen on the town of Anloc in the rubber plantation country 60 miles north of Saigon, where the remnants of eight battalions of South Vietnamese troops are surrounded.

title: SPOTLIGHT
description: BOSTON  On a recent afternoon, the Brahmin Marcuse of the Harvard Business School  as he has been called when he is not being labeled a pinko, a subversive, a provocateur, a radical and a liberal of various derogatory shadessprinted up the steps of a lecture hall and fled to his office. Moments before, 162 middleaged btisinessmen had given him a standing ovation.

title: PENNKEEPS TITLE IN HEPTAGONALS
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13Sometime soon, Bruce Cllins may get an opportunity to run his specialty, the intermediate hurdles, free from other track and field commitments.

title: Law
description: For the crimes of robbery and assault and fraud and countless more, the victim's word is enoughenough for the prosecutor to make out a prima facie case, enough to take to a jury. But with the crime of rape, it is not enough at all.

title: WET TRACK HALTS INDY 600 TRIALS
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 13Rain disrputed today the first qualifying session for the 56th running of the Indianapolis 500.

title: Chusid, Job Counselor, Agrees Not to Promise Client Success
description: The city's Department of Consumer Affairs announced yesterday that it had negotiated a settlement with a leading executivecounseling service, Frederick Chusid & Co., which had been sued for alleged multiple violations of the consumerprotection law.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Randa Khalidi Fattal's nostalgic April 29 OpEd piece, Why Were We Leaving Jerusalem?, omits one significant fact. Our Lord and His Blessed Mother belong as much to the Jewish people from whom they sprang as to converted Arabs or other gentiles.

title: Dance Mailbag; Same Old Royal Warhorses?
description: THE present visit of the Royal Ballet to New York raises some questions about Sol Hurok'' presentation of this great company.

title: ChinaPakistan Trade Over Silk Route Is Set
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 13China and Pakistan will exchange goods valued at $320,000 over the next 12 months under terms of trade agreement signed by the two countries at Gilgit in northeast Pakistan.

title: Suzanne M. Kumler Betrothed To John Kemmerer 3d on Coast
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13The engagement of Miss Suzanne Marie Kumler to John Leisenring Kemmerer 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Kemmerer Jr. of Short Hills, N. J., and Sun Valley, Idaho, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. William Lawrence Kumler of Los Angeles and Palm Springs.

title: A Man Who Keeps Faith in BedStuy
description: As a boy Franklin A. Thomas liked to stand at the window of the Sheffield Farms bottling plant in Brooklyn's BedfordStuyvesant and watch the freshly sterilized bottles moving along in uniform chains and filled with milk.

title: MARY E. HUGHES
description: Mary E. Hughes, a former publications counselor who headed the women's division of the National Recovery Administration in the 1930's and directed the American Mothers Committee in the 1950's, died Friday in St. Clare's Hospital. She was 83 years old and lived at 601 West End Avenue.

title: Harris Poll Finds 59% Backed Harbor Mining
description: A Harris poll says that 59 per cent of the American people supported President Nixon's decision to mine North Vietnam's harbors, it was reported yesterday.

title: Then I got epilepsy, and the Dark came to me
description: Taboo, my dictionary says, is Tongan for exceedingly marked or marked as sacred, but only the first sense fits Western civilization's taboo concerning afflicted or, as they are more commonly known, handicapped children. Marked, they are found painful to witness. Absolute beginners, restricted as often as not (if they survive) to nothing but beginning, they catch up with other children only a lifetime later, when their veteran oddities overlap with those of senescence. They begin life in virtual second childhood that lasts until it should traditionally begin. And the general public, prompted more by aversion to what is freakish than by atavistic awe of someone so frightfully elected, prefers the victim out of sight, perhaps even out of mind.

title: Dispute Over the OceanDumping of Wastes Further Muddies the Waters
description: NEW BRUNSWICK  For 14 years, residents of this moderatesized college town have been flushing their sewer pipes down the Raritan River valley to Raritan Bay and the Atlantic Ocean.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONThe grand strategy to Vietnamize the South was supplanted last week by the frantic effort to ostracize the North to cut oft Hanoi's supplies by sea and land and sever it psychologically from its Soviet and Chinese allies.

title: Rasmussen Is Acclaimed
description: Dick Rasmussen of Sheboygan, Wis., a star football and baseball player and a dean's list chemistry student, has received the Louis A. Alexander Award as the University of Rochester student contributing most to athletics and student life.

title: West, Chosen for N. B. A. AllStar Team for Ninth Time, Gets Most Votes
description: Jerry West of the Los Angeles Lakers was leading vote getter on the National Basketball Association AllStar team that was announced yesterday. West, who played on a championship team for the first time since he joined the N.B.A. for the 196061 season, was a near unanimous choice of the sports writers and broadcasters in the 17 league cities. Each city received a full vote. West's total was 16.737 points.

title: THE WEEK IN FINANCE
description: INTERNATIONAL problemsin the Vietnam situation and in the continuing debate over world monetary reform weighed down heavily on the financial markets last week and dampened sentiment throughout the business and economic communities.

title: Millionaires
description: Great idea this. Exmillionaire tries to recoup his fortune by masterminding a superrobbery at a Florida hideaway inhabited solely by millionaires. The idea worksuntil Mr. Kastle gets so wrapped up in the sadomasoponto diversions of the robbed and robbers that suspense takes a back seat to voyeurism. Seems a pity, at a time when suspense is in shorter supply than erotica. However, if you haven't enjoyed a riding  crop  thrashing lately, there's one for your collection in this prurient panorama.

title: Vagaries of Atlantic City Politics
description: ATLANTIC CITY  Political observers are, scratching their heads trying to find meaning in last Tuesday's municipal elections here, which saw a selfpioclaimed one honest man and another whose honesty has been severely challenged by Federal authorities, lead the field for five commissionerships.

title: Melissa Wentworth Engaged To Corey Atterbury Steadman
description: HARDING TOWNSHIP, N.J., May 13Mr. and Mrs. Philip Henry Wentworth of New Vernon have announced the engagement of Mr. Wentworth's daughter, Miss Melissa Wentworth, to Corey Atterbury Steadman, son of Dr. and Mrs. Thomas Ree Steadman of Convent Station. The wedding is planned for July 15.

title: India's Big Export Earner
description: NEW DELHI, May 13 (Reuters)  Engineering products were India's third largest source of export earnings during 197172, according to the annual report of the Foreign Trade Ministry. The total was $112million, an increase of $20million over 197071.

title: Stamps
description: CANADA on Wednesday will postally commemorate the 300th anniversary of the appointment of Louis de Buade, Compte de Frontenac et de Palluau, as Governor of Louis XIV's New France, the French colony in America.

title: Drug Panel Says Youths Avoid Use of Marijuana
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI) The National Commission on Marijuana and Drug Abuse said yesterday a survey showed that about threefourths of the young people who had never tried marijuana would not use it even if it, was legalized.

title: Volunteer Work: A Broader Appeal
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I.Volunteer work, once the domain of the upperclass lady bountiful, is being taken over by a multitude of othersfrom teenagers to old people, from the middle class and, occasionally, the lower class. The volunteer may even be someone who, in former years, would have received help from volunteers.

title: Eerie Soliloquy
description: Because my own recollection of Diem remains so much the same 10 years later, I should like to quote a paragraph from my 1965 book, The Lost Revolution, describing my meeting with him in 1962:

title: News of Dots
description: James A. Farrell Jr. of Darien, Conn., a member of the Westminster Kennel Club since 1944, is the new presi dent of the organization.

title: Nonkosher Cake Brings Fine
description: MIAMI, May 13 (UPI)A Miami appeals court has upheld a $500 fine against the operators of Blackstone Retirement Residence for possession of 160 pounds of nonkosher sponge cake during Passover. The residence assures its tenants that its food is kosher.

title: Soviet Gives Little News To People on Nixon Trip
description: MOSCOW, May 13Days before President Nixon's scheduled arrival in Moscow, Yuri Zhukov, the prominent Pravda commentator, answered listeners questions on foreign affairs on a television program without once mentioning the forthcoming trip.

title: MARICHAL VICTIM
description: On the second day of the era of Willie Mays, the New York Mets defeated the San Francisco Giants again yesterday, 10, and for the second straight day Willie Mays watched from the bench.

title: FRESH AIR FUND LAUNCHES DRIVE
description: Mrs. Margaret Anderson of Olean, N.Y., has a favorite story about a little New York City girl sent to the country by the Fresh Air Fund who discovered a case of milk bottles behind an outbuilding.

title: U.S. FAULTS ATHENS ON ARREST OF CRITIC
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The Slate Department has criticized the Greek Government for the recent arrest of John Pezmazoglu, a prominent economist and critic of the Government, because of his political views.

title: Three Novels: Comic, Cute, Cool
description: For long stretches the writing in The Bride Wore the Traditional Gold is very labored but still somehow diffuse. And a little too cute. There is an unbelievable scene, for instance, where the narrator, Jason Chambert, is bitten in the leg by pig (a real pig) while trapped under a fallen branch during an Iowa thunderstorm. Of course pigs have been known to bite people and in Erskine Caldwell they once ate off someone's face, but still  Charnbert's grandfather, a druggist, served Hitler cherry coke. When Chambert is especially distraught he is known to call John Wayne, yes, John Wayne. A bit of the bizarre here but scarcely as in Barthelme.

title: Music
description: WHEN we first started talking about the Promenades, we tried to formulate something that was not being done in other cities. We felt it should take a new course. Also, it was coming at the end of May and beginning of June. Following so much glorious music during the main part of the season, could we find programs to attract an audience? Did think at the time that we would go on after the first year? I remember having great confidence in it. Now, I would say yes. However, we had to prove ourselves.

title: JETS SUMMER CAMP RETURNS TO HOFSTRA
description: The New York Jets football team will again hold its summer training camp at Hofstra University in Hempstead, L. I. This will be the fifth consecutive year for the Jets at the Long Island, institution.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: The ragtime revival, which has been gathering momentum during the last season, will hit what could be a climactic moment (for this year, at least) at Brooklyn College next Friday.

title: Two Women Win in Sailboat Races
description: RYE, N. Y., May 13Olympic pennants were flying on the Sound today as the American Yacht Club held its regatta for five of the six sailboat classes that are eligible to race in the games at Kiel, Germany, this year.

title: SEX BIAS CHARGED IN SCHOOL SYSTEM
description: The State Board of Regents, which consists of 14 men and one woman, has charged that the educational system was clearly responsible for perpetuating discriminatory attitudes towards women.

title: Youth In Ambulance Corps
description: NEW MILFORDWhen an accident victim here is surprised by being helped by a teenaged ambulance corpsman, he shouldn't be.

title: Radical Liver Technique Idea of Wife
description: SAN ANTONIO, Texas, May 13It was a medical researcher's wifea historian, not a physicianwho made the suggestion that led Air Force doctors to devise a radical new experimental technique to treat patients dying from liver coma, a condition that kills thousands of Americans every year.

title: DR. CHARLES S. ROGERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Dr. Charles S. Rogers, a former surgeon at Lincoln Hospital in the Bronx, died today of heart failure in the Washington Hospital Center. He was 77 years old.

title: Tuning In Tomorrow
description: The one subject of most concern to all sports fans  what, sports they will be able to see on television, when and howis now being examined behind the scenes in four related areas and decisions affecting the longrange availability of traditional events will be taken in the coming months.

title: GILLIGAN'S ISLAND GAINS TOP PRIZE
description: LUDWIGS CORNER, Pa., May 13Ch. Lakeside's Gilligan's Island, a German shepherd owned by Helene Klotzman, of Baltimore, took bestinshow honors today in a field of 1,531 dogs at the 29th annual Chester Valley Kennel Club show.

title: World News Briefs
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar May 13President Philibert Tsiranana declared a state of emergency In Madagascar today after clashes between security forces and students in which about 20 persons were killed and some 400 wounded.

title: The Nation
description: The big circus is over, From here on out it's all sideshows.

title: Gator Bowl Pairings Set
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., May 13 (AP)Jacksonville University will meet Miami of Ohio and Florida will face Rutgers in opening round games of the Gator Bowl basketball tournament next Dec. 26.

title: Magee Trial Shift Granted
description: SAN RAFAEL, Calif., May 13 (UPI)A visiting country judge granted a change of venue yesterday to Ruchell Magee, 30 years old, a codefendant of Angela Davis. Magee and Miss Davis were charged with murder, kidnapping and conspiracy as a result of a shootout in the Marin County Civic Center where four persons died on Aug. 7, 1970. Magee said adverse publicity surrounding the gunbattle prejudiced his case in San Rafal. A date and site for his trial will be selected rater.

title: Fillies Beaten by Cowgirls, 280, In Debut of Women's Football
description: New York's first professional football game of the year was played last night at Downing Stadium on Randalls Island. The participants were womena team from New York, the Fillies, and one from Detroit, the Midwestern Cowgirls. Approximately 700 fans turned out to watch the game, won by the Cowgirls, 280.

title: Jane Horton Wed to William Cantlin,
description: GUILFORD, Conn., May 13 Miss Jane Fowler Horton and William Wesley Cantlin were married here this afternoon at Headlands at Sachem's Head, the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. William Hanson Horton. The Rev. Richard Jordan of St. John's Episcopal Church in North Guilford performed the ceremony.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Listening to comments from adversaries of President Nixon's latest move in Indochina over the media, I am amazed at the reactions, which are so obvious, and exactly what the President hoped to generate, as they will make his victory more dramatic.

title: Quake Rocks Chile
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 13 (AP).A strong earth tremor, long but slow, rocked central Chile this morning. There were no reports of damage or casualties.

title: Criminals At Large
description: Here's this Greek billionaire (are there any other Greeks in mystery fiction these days?) who is threatenedor thinks he is threatenedwith assassination. So the group around him takes steps to prevent trouble. In the group is James Pibble, late of Scotland Yard. Any book in which James Pibble appears is, ipso facto, going to be a good book, and so it is in Peter Dickinson's THE LIZARD IN THE CUP (Harper and Row, $5.95).

title: 8 Killed in Thailand
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, May 13 (Reuters)  Five Communist guerrillas and three Government Militiamen were killed in a gunbattle in southern Thailand, police sources said today.

title: DOROTHY ARDEN
description: Mrs. Dorothy Arnoff Posner, who as Dorothy Arden designed dresses for Arbe Imports, Inc., of which she was co owner with her husband, Bernard Posner, died yesterday at her home here. She was 61 years old and lived at 435 East 57th Street.

title: Music
description: PHYLLIS CURTIN is distressingly energetic at 9 o'clock in the morning in her apartment high above the Hudson. Elegantly attired in a floorlength, pleated, plaid skirt and offwhite blouse, her graying hair upswept, the soprano has rings on her fingers and bells in her voice as she chatters compulsively in a chirpy schoolmarm tone and spontaneously combustive manner. Miss Curtin is demonstratively gracious and ingratiatingall smiles and good cheerand brimming over with cockeyed optimism. The Pollyanna pose is rather startling considering some of the lurid tales she has to tell.

title: Retired Employes to Meet
description: BRANT BEACHThe New Jersey chapters of the National Association of Retired Federal Employes, representing 6,000 members in the state, will hold their 11th annual convention May 16 and 17 in the new St. Francis Community Center here.

title: 14 Die on Bus in Taiwan
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 13 (Reuters)Fourteen persons were killed today when a bus carrying a group of schoolgirls plunged dnto a ravine outside Taipei, the police reported.

title: Patchwork in Old Tappan
description: OLD TAPPANThat revered old American craftpatchwork quiltshas new life. When the Whitney Museum exhibited them, the cognoscenti applauded, esoterica in private homes is taking second place to patchwork, and the avantgarde are creating their own.

title: Television
description: CHANNEL 13, the public television station, experimenting with new approaches in presenting the news. I have a proposal for an entirely new kind of television news program.

title: U.S. Aide on Okinawa Stresses Ongoing Ties
description: NAHA, Okinawa, May 13The United States High Commissioner for Okinawa said today that the return of the island to Japanese administration would neither affect the size of the American military population on the island nor reduce its military value to the United States.

title: Ornithologist Breeds 3 More Falcons in Captivity
description: A New York State ornithologist who succeeded last year in breeding a peregrine falcon in captivity has bred three new falcon chicks this spring and has a second clutch awaiting hatching.

title: FINALISTA WINS MILE ON COAST IN 1:33
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 13 (AP)  Finalista, the evenmoney favorite, won the $55,150 Caballero Stakes for 3yearolds at Hollywood Park today in easy fashion, going the mile in 1:33 45.

title: ALERT IS ISSUED ON BIRD DISEASE
description: A highly virulent and extremely contagious outbreak of Newcastle disease in birds in scattered areas of this country and abroad has resulted in the issuance of special alerts by Federal and state officials here.

title: The Nation
description: From South Dakota and Texas and Washington the meat comes east. Steers and lambs pass from the rancher to the feeder who fattens themthen on to the slaughter house where they are cleaned and dressed and dehided, to the wholesaler, to the retailer, to the dinner table.

title: The Nation
description: About 20 million American school children ride to class in 256,000 school buses every day. There have been frequent charges that many of the buses are unsafe, and the drivers illtrained. The response has been minimal. Then, seven weeks ago, a school bus collided with a freight train in New York's Rockland County. The toll: five students killed, the bus driver and 43 students injured. Last week there were these developments:

title: GOVERNOR VETOES ABORTION REPEAL AS NOT JUSTIFIED
description: ALBANY, May 13  In a strong denunciation of the personal vilification and political coercion that surrounded the issue, Governor Rockefeller fulfilled a pledge today and vetoed the Legislature's repeal of the state's liberalized abortion law.

title: Coins
description: THE winners of the competitions held to select suitable designs for the official American Revolution Bicentennial medals of New York State and New York City have been announced by John H. G. Pell and Thomas Hoving, chairmen. The contests, open only to state residents, were conducted separately and prizes for the winning artists and the runnersup totaled $6,000.

title: New Gym Perks Up OldGrads
description: HIGHTSTOWN, N.J., May 13  Ever since the faculty of the Peddle School started welcoming back alumni more than century ago to its treeshaded campus, the scheme of things on Alumni Day has been to stage an important game, or at least a modest surprise.

title: HEARD CARDS 202 FOR 3SHOT LEAD
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 13 Jerry Heard, gunning for his second tour victory Of the year, shot a 3underpar 67 today and pulled away to a threestroke lead in the third round of the $125,000 Cononial National invitation golf tournament.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Shift of Poet's Statue Sought to Aid Traffic
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 13 (AP)  For 84 years Henry. Wadsworth Longfellow  in bronzehas sat in an uptown Portland square.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon's decision to mine the harbors of North Vietnam and curb Hanoi's ability to wage aggressive war is a courageous one. It also marks a historic turning point. No longer need there be fear of America's retreat from responsibility and greatness.

title: Patterson Goes 3 Rounds To Aid 12YearOld Friend
description: NEW PALTZ, N.Y., May 13 (AP)Floyd Patterson, former world heavyweight boxing champion, dazzled a capacity crowd of more than 3,000 fans last night in a threeround exhibition with Charlie (Emperor) Harris.

title: National Hurdle Race Goes To Jive by Half a Length
description: FAIR HILL, Md., May 13 (AP) Jive won the featured national hurdle race at Fair Hill today by half a length from Sharneca.

title: 11 ARE ARRESTED IN NARCOTICS RAID
description: The police announced yesterday the arrest of 11 people allegedly involved in a big Harlem narcotics ring whose operations included a factory packaging up to 12 kilograms, about 26 pounds of heroin week and three grocery stores to serve as retail outlets.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: We would like to know whether Joyce Maynard is the code name for a computer program which drags together every pseudo  sociological cliche from every magazine article written on youth in the past 18 years.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 13If there is any redeeming quality about this goofy nuclear age, it is that Moscow and Washington seem to know when to hold back when one of them risks a major collision with the other. They, both go crazy from time to time, but not together.

title: Letters
description: This has been one of the few articles in your magazine I have ever read completely at one sitting and the only one I can remember where I've wanted more at the end. This probably goes to prove Ms. Maynard's statement that we're all just interested in ourselves, because I saw me all over this one.

title: Susan Rita Cullman Is Married To John D. Sicher Jr., Lawyer
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 13 Miss Susan Rita Cullman was married here this evening to John David Sither Jr., a lawyer with the New York law firm of Paul, Weiss, Rifkind. Wharton & Garrison.

title: Veterans Bonus Approved
description: BOSTON, May 13 (AP)A bill adding $10million to the Vietnam veterans bonus program, on which $40million has already been spent, received final approval this week.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 13 (AP) Iran completed a 41 victory over Egypt in the European Zone Davis Cup today when Hussein Akhari defeated Ibrahim Mahmoud, 46, 75, 6.3, 60. Iran next meets Rumania.

title: Role of U.S. Navy Base in Spain Expands as soviet Fleet Grows
description: ROTA, Spain, May 8The United States Navy operates one of the most advanced and diversified naval stations in the world on this coast from which Columbus and Magellan sailed.

title: John Small and Linda Stein Plan Nuptials
description: Miss Linda Stein plans to be married June 1 to John M. Small in Forest Hills, Queens.

title: A New Use for a Stable, a (Sporting) Art Show
description: GLADSTONEAn art show in a stable?

title: A City Aide Authorizes Eviction of Convict's Parents
description: A hearing officer for the city's Housing Authority has authorized the eviction of a couple from a Harlem project because their 21yearold son was convicted and sent to prison for robbery.

title: Space Plans Frustrate the HaveNots
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 13In jest, an Italian space expert asked the other day if scientists from smaller countries would be allowed to stand in line and buy tickets to boad a Soviet or United States manned space laboratory.

title: Miss Pamela Post Griswold Is Engaged to Langdon Clarke
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 13Miss Pamela Post Griswold and Langdon Payne Clarke, both of Greenwich, plan to be married Sept. 9 at the Round Hill Community Church here, where the couple's parents also were married.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The tone and content of your May editorial Politics and F.B.I. suggest the conclusion that any appointee who enjoyed the personal trust and confidence of the President would be prima facie suspect in the eyes of The Times, regardless of his qualifications.

title: Planting Fields Reopening
description: Planting Fields Arboretum in Oyster Bay, the 409acre estate of the late William Robertson Coe, reopens to the public today after 10 months of fiscal uncertainty. For the first time, an admission fee of $1.50 will be Charged to persons over 12 years of age.

title: 200 Picket BOAC Office
description: About 200 people calling chemselves the Anti  Internment Coalition and demanding the withdrawal of British croops from Northern Ireland, bicketed yesterday afternoon at the Britigh Overseas Airways Corporation at 44th street and Fifth Avenue. The group had gathered at Columbus Circle and marched to the offices carrying banners and bosters. A number of speakers addressed the crowd and no incidents occurred.

title: Miriam Howell 18991972
description: THE phone rings. A friend's voice tells you, Miriam died, you know. You think back. You're a young actor, arrogant and insecure, confident and afraid. You're involved in the tryout of a new play in summer stock, in what is supposed to be your big break, because you've been given the plum comedy part. You're so bad in rehearsal that for two weeks the famous author hasn't said even Good morning to you, and it is common knowledge that the famous producer has instructed his famous casting adviser to look for a suitable replacement for you.

title: Girl Canoeists Struggle In Last, Win Cheers From Rival Male Crews Affer 16Mile Race
description: Eight girls used a war canoe to fight the battle of the sexes on the Hudson River yesterday in a 16mile race against nine male crews.

title: State Night School Joins Day College
description: MONTCLAIR  Another timehonored educational tradition will fade away, like the McGuffey reader, in the 197273 academic year: Night school, at slate supported campuses in New Jersey, with day and evening divisions merging.

title: Susan Carolyn Huff Is Married
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., May 13Miss Susan Carolyn Huff was married here at noon today to Michael Joseph Okola Jr. Msgr. Vincent Jeffers performed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Church of Our Lady of Perpetual Help. The Rev. William C. Schram of the Huguenot Memorial Presbyterian Church assisted.

title: Art
description: JO BAER'S new show, deployed in the cavernous space of the downtown LoGiudice Gallery, Is made up of just five paintings. Three of them are horizontal rectangles 8 feet long, 22 inches high and 4 inches thick, hung  startlingly within a whisker of the floor. The other two are vertical rectangles of about the same size, displayed at a more conventional height. Taken together, they comprise a show as big in its effects as it is sparse in components and give evidence that Baer, an abstractionist of limited reputation for some years now, is possessed of one of the nicest sensibilities ('nice in both senses) on the New York scene.

title: Indians Triumph Over Rangers, by Scoring Six Runs in Third Inning
description: CLEVELAND, May 13 (AP)Alex Johnson walloped a threerun homer as the Cleveland Indians scored six times in the third inning today and trimmed the Texas Rangers, 73.

title: Lefkowitz Is Investigating L.I.R.R.'s Refund Policy
description: The Long Island Rail Road's policy on refunds of the unused portions of weekly and monthly commutation tickets is being investigated by the State Attorney General's office.

title: Priests Renew Charge of Racism Against Archdiocese
description: NEWARK  Three and a half years ago, 20 Roman Catholic priests of the Newark Archdiocese called a news conference at which they publicly accused the administration of the Most Rev. Thomas A. Boland, the Newark Archbishop, of white racism.

title: Home Improvement
description: GOOD quality outdoor furniture is designed to withstand the effects of being exposed to the weather, and should be capable of taking the hard wear to which this type of furniture is normally subjected. However, even the bestmade pieces will start to show signs of wear after a year or twobut in most cases a few hours spent in making simple repairs (before they become major breakdowns) as well as in cleaning, polishing and refinishing where necessary, will restore the furniture to an almostnew condition, and will help to lengthen its life.

title: Religion
description: Paul David Cooke was born into what he calls an intellectual Jewish home and had a bar mitzvah because I wanted roots in some tradition. Two years ago he switched signals, joined a radical branch of the Jesus People movement and committed himself to serving Jesus with everything I have.

title: Leslie Nee Bride of Samuel R. Mathes Jr.
description: WESTPORT, Conn., May 13 Miss Leslie Nee, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Francis Nee, was married here this afternoon to Samuel Rhea Mathes Jr., son of Mrs. Mathes of Pensacola, Fla., and the late Mr. Mathes. The Rev. Theodore G. Hoskins performed the ceremony in the garden of the Saugatuck Congregational Church.

title: HUMANE SOCIETIES SCORE STEEL TRAPS
description: NAPLES, Fla., May 13Although use of steel leg hold traps with teeth was banned at a recent meeting of the Florida Game and Fresh Water Fish Commission, this does not satisfy the Florida Federation of Humane Societies who are insisting all steel leg hold traps be banned.

title: Why did Leopold Bloom eat a gorgonzola sandwich?
description: No one can altogether ignore the elements of myth in Ulysses, but most ordinary readers, as opposed to professional Joyceans, are probably content to take the book fairly straight, as a slice of life with mythological trimmings. And small wonder if they turn for guidance to what looks like the obvious startingpoint, the quasiofficial commentary by Stuart Gilbert. Amid the immense literature which has grown up around the novel, Gilbert's exposition stands out as something of an embarrassment. It was supervised as well as authorized by Joyce himself; under the circumstances, even the most dogged opponent of the International Fallacy would surely hesitate to set it aside. Yet what it reveals is uninspiring, and on the whole uninspired: a mechanical masterplan, with each episode allotted its presiding symbols like so many signs of the zodiac, and with the various underlying analogiesHomeric, physiological, et cetera  worked out in minute and often grotesque detail. An indispensable work of reference, perhaps, but also an interpretation of Ulysses which many admirers would be only too relieved to diswith if they could.

title: WALL STREET
description: WHITE SULPHUR SPRINGS, W. Va.  Robert W. Haack, president of the New York Stock Exchange, leaned back in his chair at lunch and fielded Inquiries about his future and the Big Board.

title: Movies
description: SADA THOMPSON may have won a Tony for her tour de force in Twigs, but somebody else is going to try for a Twigs Oscar. That somebody else is twotime Oscar winner Elizabeth Taylor, who has agreed to star in the film of George Furth's episodic comedy about three sisters and their mother for producer Frederick Brisson. Production is expected to begin next spring in Hollywood after Miss Taylor has finished playing the Joan Hackett role in the screen version of Broadway's Night Watch.

title: Muskie Delegates in Illinois To Back Him on First Ballot
description: CHICAGO, May 13A majority of the 59 Muskie delegates elected in the Illinois primary voted today to support the Maine Senator through the first ballot at the Democratic National Convention in Miami Beach.

title: East St. Louis: Urban Bankruptcy
description: EAST ST. LOUIS, Ill.The city virtually bankrupt.

title: WORK SHOP AKS. AID TO CHICANOS
description: LAS CRUCES, N. M., May 13 The Spanishspeaking student who enters public schools in the Southwest immediately gives up his native tongue and learns English so fast that he is placed at a disadvantage, recent workshop concluded here.

title: A Garden Blooms in the Ramapos
description: RINGWOOD STATE PARK In 1967, when the State of New Jersey announced its purchase, for recreation, of the nowdefunct Shelton Coller in the Ramapo mountains close to the New York border, hardpressed taxpayen grumbled.

title: World News Briefs
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, May 13 President Zulfikar All Bhutto said today that he had replied to Prime Minister Indira Gandhi suggesting a date in June for their meeting.

title: Michele Menzella Wed
description: PALISADES PARK, N. J., May 13 Miss Michele Madeline Menzella, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Michael Joseph Menzella of Mantoloking, was married here this afternoon to Roger D. Muratore, son of Mr. and Mrs. Adolph Muratore of New Milford. The Rev. John Basil performed the ceremony in St. Michael's Roman Catholic Church. Miss Elaine Menzella was her sister's maid of honor. Byron Brisbee was best man.

title: If?
description: Addicts of latenight, allnight radio talk shows on the righthand side of the U. S. map know The Magnificent Lester del Rey  articulate, opinionated and extraordinarily generous with his ideas. There are themes, he said offhandedly a few years ago, legitimate to science fiction which haven't even been touched yet. He then proceeded to reel off a baker's dozen of them as if he were reading a shopping list  enough material to keep a whole convention of writers busy for life. This sort of thing is only part of what makes the advent of PSTALEMATE (Putnam's, $4.95) something of an event. The one packable nita feeling that all the characters, including the narrator, are speaking in the same voice and idiomis modified because they are, after all, the del Rey voice. The book is about psi powers primarily telepathy and pre: cognition  but along with it engineering, ecology, cytobiology, theories of mutation, psychiatry and a couple of important kinds of love. It's a highly original yarn well yarned.

title: COAST GUARD WINS DAD PAIL REGATTA
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13An unbeaten United States Coast Guard Academy eight from New London, Conn., demonstrated that its surprising successes this season were no fluke by winning the varsity event in the annual Dad Vail Regatta with ease today.

title: For the Young An Old Land
description: As in many aspects of American life today, medicine, fashion, food and politics, China is making an impact on our teenage population. In contrast to the universities, where, for several years, research centers and scholars have turned out their inevitable books for colleagues and college students, little information or misinformation has been offered to high school and junior high students. Now that defect is being remedied with the publication of colorful, concise and varied books on China.

title: Long Election Count Not Over in Cuyahoga
description: CLEVELAND, May 13 The long election count in Cuyahoga County is still not complete.

title: SAC Changes Command
description: BELLEVUE, Neb., May 13 (UPI)The Strategic Air Command headquarters at Offutt Air Force Base announced toiay that Maj. Gen. Warren D. Johnson would be the new chief of staff for the headquarters. He replaces Maj. Gen. Timothy T. Dacey Jr., who is retiring. The change is effective June 1.

title: Navigator in Love With Curves and Graphs
description: LARCHMONT, N. Y., May 13  Navigators are a funny breed. Perspicacious and calculating, too, and worth their weight in helmsmen and foredeck crews.

title: CITIES DISSECTED AT A SYMPOSIUM
description: A number of professors and urban experts appear to have academically speaking. But they conceded that the solutions, politically speaking, were long way off.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: I suppose that one should, from the vantage point of 34yearold, say something profound about Miss Maynard's review of her life and her generation. It is not a comforting picture, but it is, for someone who has learned to celebrate small victories, a great comfort to know that she is with us.

title: S. I. Cricket Team Loses
description: Guyana, with 219 runs for five wickets declared, defeated Staten Island, 82 for eight, in cricket yesterday at Walker Park, Staten Island.

title: Mayor Named for Court
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) Mayor Frank H. Freedman of Springfield, Mass., has been recommended by Senator Edward A. Brooke, Massachusetts Republican, for nomination to fill an impending vacancy on the United States District Court bench in Massachusetts.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor: As the attorney for the defendants in the marine toilet holding tank case, and as president of the Federated Boatmen of New York, Inc., I must respectfully disagree with much of the content of the letter you published on Sunday, May 7, from Assistant Attorney General Philip Weinberg. While he is not responsible for the adoption of Navigation Law 33C, he is responsible for the accuracy of his statements.

title: Red Sox Down A's
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 13 (AP)Reggie Smith's tworun home run put Boston ahead and John Kennedy added a threerun homer later in the game to pace the Red Sox to a 9.6 victory today over the Oakland Athletics.

title: A Nobel Prize for Religion Set Up by Philanthropist
description: LONDON, May 13 (AP)An American financier and philanthropist has announced the creation of a Noble prize for religion worth $88,400.

title: Stuart Mitchell Ladd Is Fiance Of Miss Judith Baird Shinkle
description: ST. LOUIS, May 13The engagement of Miss Judith Baird Shinkle to Stuart Mitchell Ladd, son of Mrs. Alice W. Ladd of Mendham, N. J., and the late William S. Ladd, Jr. of New York, has been announced by the future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Jackson Johnson Shinkle of St. Louis.

title: Tourists Absorb Indian Culture In Visits to Homes in 7 Pueblos
description: SANTA FE, N.M., Max 13Ten tourists, including six Japanese and a woman from Lapland, took part this week in the first of a series of visits to homes in seven northern New Mexico pueblos, designed to give a firsthand insight Into Pueblo culture and way of life.

title: Sclerosis Society To Cite Parseghian At Hilton Dinner
description: Ara Parseghian, one of college football's most successful coaches, will receive the first champions award of the New York County Chapter of the National Multiple Sclerosis Society for his efforts againstthe crippling neurological disease.

title: Travel Notes:
description: WILL the nation's tourist industry go the way two Maine hotels are going? Don't bet on it. Item: The communityowned 80room Northeastland Hotel in Presque Isle, Me., will celebrate its 40th anniversary on June 16 and 17 by rolling back prices to 1932 levels. For the occasion a single room will be $3, a double will be $4, and a special menu will offer full meals from soup to dessert for 50 cents. (Singles normally go for $11.55, doubles for $17.85, and a meal of the 50cent type would regularly be about $2.50.) There will also be a dance (admission 15 cents), and other activities will include a bazaar, kiddie carnival, chicken barbeque and honkytonk entertainment  all in the style of the 1932 era. For further information, write the Presque Isle Chamber of Commerce, 342 Maine Street, P.O. Box 672, Presque Isle, Me. 04769 or phone (207) 7646561.

title: CUTOFF OF JUNE FOR OPEN TICKETS
description: The United States Golf Association has set June 1 as the cutoff date for purchase of season tickets for its fourday Open championship, which starts June 15 at Pebble Beach, Calif.

title: Paramus Ponders Patriotism or Profit For Its Stores on Major U.S. Holidays
description: PARAMUS  Putting patriotism back into national holidays is the thinking behind a proposed ordinance introduced in the Paramus Borough Council that would force the closing of most commercial businesses in this Bergen County community on Memorial Day, July 4 and Thanksgiving.

title: RAYMOND C. CHAPIN
description: HARTFORD, May 13 Raymond C. Chapin, who retired five years ago as a vice president of Guy Carpenter & Co., insurance brokers of New York, died today in Hartford Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived in West Hartford.

title: Pioneer 10 in Key Region
description: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., May 13 (UPI)The Jupiterbound Pioneer 10 craft has entered a region tin space known as the Great Galactic Ghoul, the Ames Research Center reported today. Scientists said the area contained unusually high amounts of meteoroids, and cosmic dust.

title: Funds Cut Likely for Amtrak
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The conflict between what a Government agency wants and what the Office of Management and Budget says it can get is exemplified in the battle over the financing of Amtrak.

title: COLUMBIA CAMPUS CALM IN PROTEST
description: Although six buildings had been occupied and more than 50 students arrested in the course of nearly four weeks of antiwar demonstrations at Columbia University, the campus remained relatively quiet last week in the wake of President Nixon's announcement of the mining of North Vietnam's harbors.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: A majority of the Democratic county chairmen in the nation who were canvassed by the Gallup Poll have expressed less confidence at present than last June that the party's nominee would defeat President Nixon on Election Day.

title: What's Best for Homeless Children? Small Group Homes May Be Answer
description: A Federal commission recently reported that a typical American family spends $35,000 to raise a child to the Age of 18.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Writing from Yale is apparently improving. I spent as much time on Joyce Mayn ard's essay (An 18YearOld Looks Back on Life, April 23), as I. did reading Mr. Segal's triumph. This time, I found more substance, more human truth and more genuine entertainment. Right on, Ms. Maynard!

title: L.I. Rail Crossing Funds Approved
description: BELLMORE, L. L  The project to eliminate dangerous grade crossings here and in Merrick, which has been stalled more times than a Long Island Rail Road train in a blizzard, is once again on the move.

title: Sports Editor's Mailbox
description: To the Editor: I am sorry, Sir, that I must refute the statement [in The Times April 28] that the proposed ladies golf course at Savannah, Ga., is the first in the world.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR: Joyce Maynard very humorously touched on one specific dilemma that has long needed articulation. She states, She is surrounded by knowledgeable, sexually experienced girls and if she isn't willing to sleep with her boyfriend, somebody else will. It's peergroup pressure, 1972 stylethe embarrassment of virginity.

title: Environmental Action Taken by Oyster Bay
description: OYSTER, BAY, L.I.An Environmental Control Commission has been established here to help preserve and improve the town's natural and manmade environment.

title: 14 Die in Tennessee Bus Truck Crash
description: BEAN STATION, Tenn. May 13 (UPI)A doubledeck Greyhound bus struck a tractortrailer about dawn today on a mountain highway in East Tennessee, killing 14 persons and destroying the two vehicles.

title: LETTERS
description: Having just spent the better part of two weeks in a futile search for a dressdress, I laughed out loud at the article Women Shun the DressDress  (April 23). Women aren't buying such dresses because there are none to be found.

title: RICHARD GEHMAN, AUTHOR, 50, DEAD
description: LANCASTER, Pa., May 13 (AP)Richard Gehman, author of 19 books and contributor to Cosmopolitan and The New Yorker, died today in Lancaster General Hospital. He was 50 years old.

title: 3 New Yorkers Arrested In Hashish Raid in Ontario
description: LONDON, Ontario, May 13 (AP)The police arrested three New Yorkers at gunpoint yesterday in a motel raid and confiscated between 60 and 70 pounds of hashish.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: BANGALORE, India, May 13 (AP)The opening matches of the East Zone Davis Cup final between India and Australia were postponed again today because of rain.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I want to tell you what a very fine trip I had on the Broadway Limited to and from Chicago and the SuperChief from Chicago to Flagstaff and back. Fine service, clean rooms and the trains were on timein fact, the Broadway Limited got into New York five minutes early. The food was excellent too and the passengers were thrilled to be on a train.

title: Is It Time for the Audience to Shout Back?
description: THERE is a line in the Bible which may be regarded as the very foundation stone of Catholic Christianity: This is my body, take, eat,  It has turned up at least three times in the, avantgarde theater of recent years, and every time it referred to fellatio.

title: SHOP TALK
description: GREAT NECK, L. 1.,The Village of Great Neck is going to be celebrating its golden jubilee on June 4, and many of the 11,000 residents will be taking part in the festivities  listening to two bands playing music of the nineteentwenties pitching horseshoes, running threelegged races on the Village Green and digging into the refreshments.

title: Music
description: A MUSICIAN, says John McLaughlin, is like an ear for humanity, just as a painter is like an eye for humanity. The sounds somehow exist in a different sphere, the musician listens, and brings them out for the world. There's the mystery: that someone can hear something that is essentially soundless and make it into sound.

title: Just a stable in a Paris court yard
description: Just a stable in a Paris court yard

title: The Peace Front
description: The public rejection by the Vietcong of President Nixon's latest peace proposal was to be expected at a moment when blockade and air attack are intensifying the American war against North Vietnam. But Moscow, reacting relatively moderately to the war's escalation, has urged resumption of negotiations while refraining, so far, from canceling the NixonBrezhnev summit. North Vietnam's chief secret negotiator, Politburo member Le Duc Tho, remains in Paris, having sent Minister Xuan Thuy instead to Hanoi for consultations. Another round In the Paris peace talks undoubtedly lies ahead and the latest American offer could become the opening for a settlement.

title: Ellyn Harris, Stephen Rudolf Plan Marriage
description: Miss Ellyn Harris and. Stephen Rudolf of London and Philadelphia plan to be married Aug. 27 at the Plaza. The future bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Victor A. Harris of New York, have announced the engagement. The prospective bridegroom is a son, of Mrs. Ellis Kay of Philadelphia and the late Simon Rudolf, owner of Reputable Engineer, Ltd., in London.

title: Three Novels: Comic, Cute, Cool
description: There is a fascinating sense of nonspecific agony in John Hopkins's Tangier Buzzless Flies. And this feeling of generalized dread is never to be resolved or even quite located. The North African landscape is the hero of the novel, the being whose overwhelming presence is on every page, oddly cold and foreboding, changing everything but never changed. The characters are to be regarded as weird nullities whose lives are bound to the verities of the landscape. The ostensible hero, Joseph Cabell, is an oil geologist working for the Spanish Government. We are rather modishly told nothing of his past.

title: Uphill Battle For Veterans
description: Michael Mayhew of Brooklyn is 22 years old, black, untrained, a veteran of the Vietnam Warand looking for a job.

title: Then the European Trip Is Over, What Impression Have Americans Left Behind?
description: The stories American tourists tell about being cajoled, baited, swindled and patronized in foreign countries have become familiar stereotyped preconceptions carried abroad like runners batons by succeeding generations of travelers. But what does the American tourist look like to the man on the receiving side of the taxi meter? In Rome three men who have constant contact with tourists sat around a table at the Restaurant Da Mario to discuss their observations with freelance writer Stuart Troup. They were Valerio Checcarelli, 47, a taxi driver; Giorgio Galiena, 28, the concierge at the mediumpriced Hotel Madrid, and Mario Mariani, 47, ownerwaiter at Da Mario, a restaurant popular with tourists and Italians alike.

title: Pirates Defeat Astros
description: HOUSTON, May 13 (UPI)Roberto Clemente's tworun triple and a runscoring single by Al Oliver highlighted a fiverun 12th inning tonight and led the Pittsburgh Pirates to a 61 victory over the Houston Astros.

title: A Debut for a Yiddish Troupe
description: The Jewish State Theater of Bucharest will make its American debut next fall at the Brooklyn Academy of Music.

title: Barbara Cochran Cited By Eastern Ski Group
description: Barbara Cochran, the first American skier to win an Olympic gold medal in 20 United States Eastern Amateur Ski Association this week at the Concord Hotel at Kiamesha Lake, N. Y.

title: The New Plays
description: THAT CHAMPIONSHIP SEASON, a play by Jason Miller, got nine favorable reviews (Barnes, Times; Watt, News; Gottfried, Women's Wear; Wallach, Newsday; Raidy, Newhouse Newspapers; Glover, AP; Harris, CBSTV; Klein, WNEW TV; Bookspan, WPIX) and two mixed reviews (Watts, Post; Gayer, UPI).

title: War Protests
description: Peaceful antiwar marches and rallies were held in New York, Washington and other cities across the country yesterday. At the same tinte, disorders subsided on some college campuses that have been the scene of studentpolice clashes the past few days. Details, Page 30.

title: Law
description: The fivemonth trial of the Chicago Seven in the winter of 196970 was an often raucous and bizarre shouting match between the defendants and their lawyers and Federal Judge Julius J. Hoffman. Almost daily, Judge Hoffman threatened to hand down contempt citations, and once the trial, growing out of the riots at the 1968 Democratic convention, was over he was as good as his word. The contempt sentences ranged from more than four years for defense counsel William Kunstler to more than two months for defendant Lee Weiner.

title: Dr. Sankey Williams to Marry Constance B. Hess Next Month
description: Leon Hess, chairman of the executive committee of the Amerada Hess Corporation, and Mrs. Hess of New York and Deal, N. J., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Constance Beth Hess, to Dr. Sankey Vaughan Williams, son of Dr. James Sankey Williams of Nicholasville, Ky., and the late Mrs. Williams.

title: John Phillips Jr. Weds Miss Millar
description: SUDBURY, Mass., May 13  Miss Gwendolen (Wendy) McLaren Millar, a paralegal assistant in the probate department of the Boston law firm of Bingham, Dana & Gould, was married here this afternoon to John David Phillips Jr., an industry analyst at the State Street Research and Management Company in Boston. The Rev. Dr. Otis Maxfield, a Congregational minister, performed the ceremony in the Martha Mary Chapel.

title: ONESTROKE LEAD FOR MISS BLALOCK
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 13 (UPI)  Facing a twostroke penalty for slow play, Jane Blalock managed to keep her concentration and shot a twounderpar 70 for a 37hole total of 138 to lead the second round of the $42,000 Suzuki women's golf tournament.

title: S. M. Levy Fiance Of Marjorie Karin
description: David Karin of Brooklyn has announced the engagement of his daughter, Miss Marjorie L. Karin, to Stephen M. Levy son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Levy of Syracuse. An August wedding is planned.

title: U.S. Picks Delegates To U.N. Conference On the Environment
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (AP) Secretary of State William P. Rogers has named the members of the United States delegation to the United Nations Conference on Human Environment in Stockholm June 5 to 16.

title: MRS. MORTIMER HYAMS
description: Mrs. Sylvia Gelb Hyams, the widow of Dr. Mortimer N. Hyams, a gynecologist who died in 1964, died yesterday at her home, 1095 Park Avenue. She was 71 years old.

title: Enemy Shells Pnompenh For the 5th Time Inc 8 Days
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Sunday, May 14 (UPI)  At least five Sovietmade 122mm rockets crashed into the Cambodian capital late last night and allied helicopter gunships were dispatched tb search out Communist launching sibes just northwest of the city.

title: Redskins Get 49ers Taylor
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 131 (AP)The San Francisco 49ers sent Roosevelt Taylor, a 33yearold defensive back, to the Washington Redskins yesterday in a trade for a future draft choice. The Redskins gave up a pick from an undisclosed round in a future National Football League draft.

title: Doris Day Is Sued by Son
description: LOS ANGELES, May 13 (AP) Doris Day, the actress, has been sued by her son, Terry Melcher, who wants to find out his mother's earnings since 1955. The probate action filed yesterday concerns a contract between Miss Day and her late husband, Martin Melcher, who also was her agent and was to have received 25 per cent of her salary. He died in 1968. The younger Melcher is executor of his father's estate.

title: Poly Prep Wins Ivy Crown, Finishing First in 3 Events
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 13 Poly Prep took first place in three events and scored in the other 13 to win the Ivy Prep School League track and field championship today at Hofstra University. Poly scored 81 points, 3 more than Stony Brook, the runnerup.

title: THOMPSON BLENDS PIANO JAZZ STYLES
description: Eddie Thompson, the British jazz pianist who induces some commuters to get home a little later than usual with his cocktailhour playing in the Rough Rider Room of the Roosevelt Hotel, transferred his activities on Friday night to Carnegie Recital Hall, where he gave concert accompanied by Lyn Christie, bass.

title: TideDamaged Hall to Be Restored
description: ASBURY PARKA major restoration program to combat severe tidal erosion at Convention Hall is getting under way here.

title: Mrs. Marlys Ferguson Wed to a Cleric
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 13 Mrs. Marlys Ryberg Ferguson, widow of the Rev. Dr. Robert R. Ferguson, was married here this afternoon to the Rev. Dr. George T. Petters, a widower, of Larchmont, N. Y. The Rev. Dr. James I. McCord, president of the Princeton Theological Seminary performed the Presbyterian ceremony In the Princeton University Chapel. He was assisted by the Rev. Carl D. Reimers.

title: C.A.B. WANTS COURT TO BAR AIR CONCERN
description: The Civil Aeronautics Board has asked for a Federal court injunction requiring immediate cessation of charter flights by Donaldson Line, Ltd., a British carrier.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: The employes of Mohawk Airlines were a tightly knit, fiercely loyal group who, fully realizing the company's equipment problems, always tried to make it up to the passengers with extra kindness and consideration. The Slowhawk of your article (Travel section, April 16) was better than Nohawk at all.

title: Navy Nine Beats N.Y.U., 80
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 13 (AP)  Bruce Auldand hit a fourrun home run today as Navy's baseball team defeated New York University, 30.

title: Busing of Pupils Sways Votes in Town Election
description: MONTCLAIR  In a municipal election widely regarded here not as a popularity contest but rather as a referendum on school busing, this Essex County town, which has a black population of more than 20 per cent, appeared to reject the integration concept. The final count in last Tuesday's election  the first in the state in which the busing issue was directly tested  shows that the five town commissioners elected from the field of 14 candidates all favored neighborhood schools and opposed busing.

title: Are Bird Populations Changing?
description: HAVE you been tempted to say, There seem to be fewer birds than when I was younger? Certainly a true statement for many species.

title: The Nation
description: BALITMOREThese are halcyon days for George Corley Wallace sunshine hours fairly dripping with the honey of success, brimming with victory's nectar.

title: Thoroughbred Racing Shifts to Belmont Tomorrow for 30Day Spring Meeting
description: The 30day spring meeting at Belmont Park gets under way tomorrow and the highlight of the meeting will be the 104th running of the $125,000 added Belmont Stakes. This event is the third oldest and the lonost race in the Triple Crown for 3yearolds. It will be run on June 10 at the distance of oneandahalf miles.

title: Bronx Supermarket Chain Gives 5% Cuts to DayCdre Families
description: The Agency for Child Development has inaugurated a program in a Bronx supermarket chain under which the stores offer a 5 per cent discount on breakfast foods to 200 teachermothers affiliated with four family daycare centers.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: Some time ago, in a letter (Travel section, May 10, 1970), I offered free accommodations in my home to any American visiting Ceylon. Since then we have had a number of American guests. I should be grateful if you could point out that my wife and I and our six children have now changed our address, having bought a house near Kandy. However, we are still continuing with our friendship project, and we can help travelers get in touch with members in several other countries, including Norway, West Germany, India and Australia.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Blacks and Puerto Ricans continue to find the route to buildingtrades jobs difficult to traverse and beset by obstacles. But voluntary hiring plans in some cities and Federal contract compliance regulations for Government construction have helped to open doors to some of the highly skilled and strongly organized building trades for limited numbers of minority workers.

title: Miss Cheryl L. Young Is Bride of Johan Uiling
description: The West End Collegiate Church, Dutch Reformed, was the setting here yesterday for the marriage of Miss Cheryl Lesley Young and Johan Uiling of the Netherlands. The Rev. Kenneth Gorsuch performed the ceremony, after which a reception was held at the Cosmopolitan Club, followed by a family supper at the New York University Faculty Club.

title: Padres Beat Expos, 50
