description: MONTREAL, May 13 (UPI) Nate Colbert capped a fourrun eighth inning with his ninth homer of the season tonight and Fred Norman allowed only four hits as the San Diego Padres beat the Montreal Expos, 50.

title: The Ninth Marquess
description: Harry Aidan, a Tory politician who plays the title role, is a habitual survivor. He survives World War II, the blowing up of the King David Hotel, a Mau Mau ambush, an aerial hijacking to Iraq, and a nasty fall from a horse. But he doesn't have a heart  and this, as his creator sees it, is a fatal deficiency in one who aspires to high political office. Hmmm. AnyhowHarry's rise and fall are a fine excuse for Jon Cleary to add yet another wrapup of our times to a growing bibliography.

title: Leaders of Organized Labor Remain Largely Hostile to McGovern's Candidacy
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Although Senator George McGovern of South Dakota is beginning to pick up scraps of support among trade union officials in his bid for the Democratic Presidential nomination, the leadership of organized labor across the country remains largely hostile.

title: LETTERS
description: I was intrigued by the article F.H.A.From Suburb to Ghetto (May 7).

title: Artist James Rosenquist Replies
description: To THE EDITOR: Some weeks ago Ada Louise Huxtable commented on the fact that the new concert hall in Helsinki is so much better designed and constructed and should serve as a model for our architects, considering the job they did on the Kennedy Center for the Arts in Washington.

title: Artist James Rosenquist Replies
description: To THE EDITOR: That was a reprehensible review that Peter Schjeldahl wrote of the Susan Crile show. It was full of the snottiest kind of innuendo. He whispered away nastily, like a girl in the chorus bitched off because a chum has been given lines, clucking over Crile's motivation, questioning her choice of material.

title: Wheaton Given $1Million
description: NORTON, Mass., May 13 (AP)  Wheaton College has received an anonymous gift of $1million, the college announced this week.

title: Students Taught in Wilderness Hikes
description: BOSTON, May 13When Robert H. Gillette reports back to school this September he will be in a somewhat unusual position for a teacher. He will have $100,000 to do with almost whatever he wants.

title: The Nation
description: KELLOGG, Idaho  They seen his body. He's dead. The young woman was talking quietly to a friend as they waited last week in the grimy yard of the Sunshine Silver Mine. A mile below them, rescue crews worked desperately to reach 93 miners trapped by a lethal combination of smoke and carbon monoxide.

title: STRIKE PREVENTS CLASSES AT PRATT
description: Although classes at Pratt Institute in Brooklyn ended officially on Friday, course work for a large number of the school's 4,600 students terminated three days earlier because of a studentfaculty strike and the takeover of two buildings by dissident students.

title: Faith Tracts Are With It
description: ORADELLIt would be appreciated if you cats would send me some a that literature floating around these days. I'd like to know more.

title: Bomb Hoax at Birthplace
description: YORBA LINDA, Calif., May 13A bomb hoax this week caused a hurried evacuation of the house where President Nixon was born, while antiwar demonstrators shouted slogans outside and a Vietcong flag was run up a memorial flag pole on the lawn.

title: Hunters Defended as Conservationists
description: The nation's biggame hunters, who have faced lions, leopards, rhinos and elephants in the wilds, are now facing a new, tougher adversary.

title: Stamps
description: CONSERVATION of the environment is a universal effort. In June, there will be a United Nations Conference on the Human Environment in Stockholm. To commemorate the conference, and to propagandize the preservation of the environment, the United Naeons Postai Administration on June 5 will issue four singlecolor stamps designed by Robert Perrot of France that will utilize the Human Environment symbol for its vignette.

title: 2 Key European Aides at Odds Over Continued Economic Growth
description: PARIS, May 13Two Dutchmen who head the leading international economic institutions in Europethe Common Market Commission and the secretariat of the Organization for Economic Cooperation and Developmenthave taken conflicting positions in a lively debate raging over economic growth rates.

title: The Nation; Auto Exhausts:
description: Breathable air by 1975. That was the goal of the Clean Air Act of 1970. And one of the ways Congress envisioned that goal would be achieved was by cleaning up the emissions of hydrocarbons and carbon monoxide from automobile exhausts.

title: JAMES GANG PLAYS SO LOUD IT HURTS
description: Politicians are not the only ones who are corrupted by the blandishments of excess power. More and more rock groups are discovering that the magical dials on their sound systems can be pushed higher and higher, increasing the volume of their music to the point where a disturbing, but obviously effective, sadomasochistic relationship is established between performers and audience. The James Gang, playing at Carnegie Hall Friday night, was a perfect example.

title: Chess:
description: The first Soviet Union ches olympiad was, without doubt, the most elaborate chess event ever held.

title: MIAMI BEACH STIRS FEUD WITH MEDIA
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 13Efforts are under way to avoid a confrontation between the news media and Miami Beach, which has demanded rent payments for the equipment to be left by the media at the convention hall between the Democratic and the Republican, conventions.

title: Death Toll in Flash Flood In Texas City Rises to 15
description: NEW BRAUNFELS. Tex., May 13 (AP)The death toll from a flash flood in this city in the hill country rose to 15 today as residents downstream awaited possible new flooding of the swollen Guadalupe River.

title: LETTERS
description: I protest the comments of the designers, store presidents and dress company officers in the article Women Shun the DressDress.

title: U.S. Aide Leaves Europe
description: MADRID, May 13 (Reuters) Martin J. Hillenbrand, United States Assistant Secretary of State for European Affairs, left here by air yesterday for New York at the end of a series of consultations with European Governments on President Nixon's planned visit to Moscow.

title: TV Mailbag
description: According to Stephanie Harrington's article, Captain Kangaroo is disturbed by Sesame Street and Electric Company because they 'chip away at a child's sensitivity when they use the blaring techniques of the commercial to sell their young viewers numbers or letters of the alphabet.

title: C. C. Mountain Weds Miss Willets
description: ESSEX, Conn., May 13Miss Katherine Willets and Charles Child Mountain were married here this afternoon.

title: Gimeno Tops Solomon
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 13 (AP)  Andres Gimeno and Manuel Orantes of Spain moved into the final of the $26,000 Belgian tennis tournament today.

title: Last of 91 Bodies Removed From Silver Mine in Idaho
description: KELLOGG, Idaho, May 13 (UPI)  Rescue crews today brought out the last bodies of the 91 victims of the Sunshine silver mine disaster, leaving the survivors with their grief and the prospect of weeks or months without pay checks.

title: Keystone Hilliard Captures $25,000 Trot as Fresh Yankee Finishes Third
description: YONKERS, May 13Perhaps Joe O'Brien, wherever he was, had a premonition that all would not go well with Fresh Yankee, so the master reinsman missed tonight's $25,000 Volomite trot at Yonkers raceway.

title: Towns Need Funds For Health Service
description: TRENTONA bill to bring minimum public health services within the reach of every person in New Jersey died in the state Senate last week amid objections that it would infringe on home rule and drive up local taxes. The bill fell far short of the vote required for floor action.

title: Ryan, ExMet, Following Familiar Script as Angel
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 13 Nolan Ryan, the wild fireballing exMet, is off to a familiar start as a California Angeltwo brilliant shutouts, two dismaying walkathons, and one pulled groin muscle.

title: 9 U.S. Junior Wrestlers Gain in Italian Tourney
description: TRIESTE, Italy, May 13 (AP) Nine of 10 Americans, led by Bob Dieli and Greg Harmer, each of whom won two matches, advanced to the semifinals today of the eightnation International junior wrestling tournament.

title: The World
description: WASHINGTONThe scenario was hauntingly familiar. Once again the President appeared on nationwide television to announce a major escalation of the Vietnam war, and once again his words triggered the predictable sequence of events that have become a fixture of American life.

title: Recordings
description: WHEN Antal Dorati and the Philharmonia Hungarica set out on an announced journey nearly three years ago to record all the Haydn symphonies, the prospects did not seem bright. The conductor, though respected in certain literature, had not impressed one on records as the kind of scholar or enthusiast of the 18th century who might be expected to carry through such a massive project successfully. Nor did the Hungarica seem quite the group for the job, off previous experience of its work.

title: Rebecca Harris Wed
description: CHAPEL HILL, N.C., May 13  Miss Rebecca Karen Harris and Wentworth Lawrence Durgin of New York were married at noon today in the Wesley Foundation Chapel on the campus of the University of North Carolina, The bridegroom's father, the Rev. Dr. Lawrence L. Durgin, minister of the Broadway United Church of Christ in New York, performed the ceremony. Mr. and Mrs. James O. Harris of Cliffside are the bride's parents. Her father is with the Duke Power Company in Shelby. The bridegroom is the son also of Mrs. Durgin of New York.

title: TWINS WIN IN 16 AFTER LOSS IN 22
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., May 13 (AP)  Mike Ferraro's ranscoring single with two out in the 22d inning gave the Millwaukee Brewers a 43 victory over the Minnesota Twins today in the completion of a game suspended last night after 21 innings.

title: The World
description: SAIGON  Our objective is to have an impact on the battle in the country as fast as possible, a senior American officer said the other day, explaining what President Nixon had in mind when he ordered the mining of the seven North Vietnamese ports and extensive bombing of supply lines north of the demilitarized zone (DMZ).

title: Thefts of Dogs Reported Rising in U.S.
description: His name was Teddy, and he was just a sweet, friendly dog, Eva Gist murmured'Whenever you talked to him he'd wag his tail a lot.

title: Stottlemyre Earns No. 3 With 5Hitter on Coast
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 13With Mel Stottlemyre pitching his second shutout against California in 12 days, the Yankees defeated the Angels, 30, tonight and gained their first twogame winning streak since the third and fourth games of the season. Stottlemyre allowed only five hits in posting his third victory against three defeats. He has beaten the Angels nine straight times in a 163 wonlost career record, last losing to them June 30, 1967.

title: Nuptials for Carolyn E. Malkowski
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 13The Manning Chapel at Brown University here was the setting at noon for the wedding of Miss Carolyn Elizabeth Malkowski of Boston and James Michael Rusiackas of New York.

title: Before Bidding, Set a Dollar Limit
description: LEONIA  Confirmed auctiongoers can rely on five cardinal rules the next time they plan to bid for some item:

title: Jewish School Quits the Lower East Side as Perilous
description: Fear for the safety of its pupils on the Lower East Side has forced the Rabbi Jacob Joseph School to abandon the neighborhood and set up a new building for the school in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: The People's Republic of China is emerging as an important world supplier of textiles, according to an analysis by the American Textile Manufacturers Institute, the principal textile trade association in this country.

title: Joan Wheeler Is Wed to John Redington
description: CARSON CITY, Nev., May 13Miss Joan Charon Wheeler, daughter of Mrs. James H. S. Ellis of Reno and Hot Springs, Va., and the late Dr. William L. Wheeler Jr. of New York, was married here this afternoon to John Redington, a stockbroker with Hallgarten & Co. in San Francisco. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. C. Harold Van Zee.

title: BRYKALSKI TALLEST ON ALLSTAR QUINTET
description: Bob Brykalski of Lincoln High School in Canton, Ohio, who will be the tallest player to participate in the second annual B'nai Brith AllAmerican High School game, to be played Sunday, May 28 at Kutsher's Country Club in Monticello, N. Y., stands 6 feet 10 inches and weighs 260 pounds and has signed a letter of intent for the University of Tennessee.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANYThey're trying to sell a slogan, said Democratic Senator Jeremiah Bloom as he sipped his coffee and looked out the train window on his weekly Monday morning trip along the calm waters of the Hudson River to Albany. For years, the Brooklyn lawyer said, the insurance people have been pushing for this thing, but now they come up with a gimmick phrase: no fault. So all of a sudden there's a rush to pass the slogan. I think we'll beat it.

title: CITY ACTS TO EASE LABOR IMPASSES
description: Proposed revisions of the consolidated rules of the Office of Collective Bargaining, including procedures for final and binding determinations in impasses involving city employes have been completed and are scheduled for public hearing on May 22.

title: She Follows A Life Style All Her Own
description: When Alice Ormsby Gore shows up in town, it's usually an event.

title: A Child Will Thank You
description: Heat and humidity are not far off, and many city families are already busily planning their escape. Children are ticking off the weeks until vacation, time and the flight to camp or countryside. For countless city youngsters, however, the only prospect of relief is the spray the uncapped hydrant and the sunsoftened asphalt of streets and crowded playgrounds. Rural America for them will remain a picture on the television screen.

title: JOHN S. WILSON'S Music
description: LONG VALLEYFor eight consecutive years, The Fastest Washboard in the East has rapped out his call to celebrate the memory of Bix Beiderbecke, the legendary jazz cornetist who died in 1931 at the age of 28. And next Saturday, the faithful will respond, pouring into Long Valley in cars decorated with Bix Liver bumper stickers, prepared to exchange myths and memories on Mr. Belderbecke and to listen to some of the music associates with him.

title: Mr. Catbird
description: Robins sing sweet songs; orioles and tanagers are brightly colored; chickadees are friendly as puppies. People like them, want to listen to them, watch them, be flattered by their friendliness. But unless one has a sense of humor and an appreciation of the absurd one can't really appreciate the catbird.

title: Steam Line Blast Kills 3 At Georgia Power Plant
description: CARTERSVILLE, Ga., May 13 (UPI)  An explosion in steam line rocked a giant power  generating plant today, killing at least three men, injuring three others and leaving one person missing.

title: $1Million in Cans Replaced
description: RICHMOND, Va., May 13 (UPI)Reynolds Metals Company said Thursday it had paid more than $1million so far this year to persons returning aluminum cans to its recycling plants in 32 states. A spokesman said the company has recycled more than 232 million cans into new products.

title: New Dean Appointed at Yale
description: NEW HAVEN, May 13Dr. Lewis Thomas, chairman of the department of pathology at Yale and former dean of the New York University School of Medicine, has been appointed dean of the Yale School of Medicine, effective July 1, Dr. Thomas, 59 years old, who was selected to the National Academy of Sciences earlier this month will become the 11th dean of the school, which was founded in 1810.

title: Foe Said to Use Tanks Badly but They Are Seen as Threat to Pleiku
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, May 13United States commanders here say that North Vietnam has repeatedly blundered in its use of tanks during the current offensive, but at least some American field advisers feel the enemy may have learned enough to pose a grave threat to Pleiku and other cities of the Central Highlands.

title: Power Boats in 225Mile Race Today
description: Those archrivals of the outboard engine world, Outboard Marine Corporation and Mercury Motors, will meet for the first time this season in today's Morgan City (La.) 225 race.

title: Cane Pace Slated Friday at Yonkers
description: YONKERS, May 13 Now that the vulnerability of Strike Out, last season's 2yearold champion, has been brought to lightthe colt wound up fourth behind Silent Majority, Entrepreneur and Tarport Adios in race at Rockingham Park last weekhe may be opposed by eight, nine or even 10 rivals in Friday night's $100,000 Cane Pace at Yonkers Raceway.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Well over a year has passed since Congress directed the Securities and Exchange Commission to steam full speed ahead in protecting the funds and securities of brokeragehouse customers.

title: Movies
description: ILOVED sinking my head into Cary Grant's chest, Jean Arthur sighs, dreamily reminiscing about her dashing leading man in the 1939 movie, Only Angels Have Wings.

title: Art
description: THE claims made for the art of Winslow Homer are no longer as modest or as equivocal as they once were. Homer is nowadays acclaimed as a national classicindeed, kind of national treasureand no encomium, as we know, is deemed too excessive or absurd for an artist whose reputation has soared into that particular stratosphere. Thus, in the latest historical survey that has come to handProf. Matthew Baigell's A History of American Painting (Praeger) Homer is not only upheld as one of the country's most profound artists, but as something even more singular than that: His achievement, sustained over a halfcentury period, Professor Baigell assures us, has never been equaled in the history of American art.

title: Women's Ordination Voted
description: WOLFEBORO, N. H., May 13 (AP)Some 250 delegates attending the convention of the Episcopal Diocese of New Hampshire voted 2 to 1 today to approve the ordination of women to the priesthood.

title: David Brinkley to Wed Mrs. Adolph on June 10
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Mrs. Susan Adolph of Washington and David Brinkley, the National Broadcasting Company news correspondent, plan to be married on June 10 in Carter's Grove Plantation, an 18thcentury mansion that is part of the Colonial Williamsburg Foundation, located six miles east of Williamsburg, Va. Mr. Brinkley is a member of the board of trustees of Williamsburg.

title: The Nation
description: ALBANYLow politics and high emotions comingled in the Legislature last week on the highly volatile issue of abolishing the state's liberalized abortion law.

title: State Suit: 10Years $500,000 Later
description: FRANKLIN LAKES  Two weeks ago, Attorney General George F. Kugler recommended in a report to the New Jersey Legislature that portions of the state's traditional immunity from damage suits be abolished. Except in specific instances involving governmental policy, citizens would be permitted, if the recommendations become law, to sue the state.

title: Reid Wins Award at Bentley
description: Jim Reid of Taunton, Mass., captain and catcher for the baseball team, has been awarded the Edward J. Powers Award as the outstanding scholarathlete at Bentley College.

title: JAKARTA 77 A NEW EXTERIOR
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 13 (Reuters)An attempt by the Governor of Jakarta to modernize the city's image, mainly by clearing out its slums, has led to strong criticism from people who dislike his methods.

title: NIXON. AIDE PLEDGES CHECK ON INFLATION
description: HOT SRINGS, Va., May 13Dr. Herbert Stein, chairman of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers, assured the Business Council today that the Government budget would be closely monitored in the coming 12 months to avoid an inflationary effect on the economy.

title: Currency Futures Due
description: A unit of the Chicago Mercantile Exchange is about to offer futures contracts in what many consider the basic commoditycurrency.

title: The Taste Of Defeat
description: THEY had gone through most of the beer and two choruses of Hail, Hail, the Gang's All Here by the time Ed Muskie shouldered his way through the 400 or so members of the gang at the S.P.A. Hall on Milwaukee's South Side the night before Wisconsin's April 4 primary. The first PolishAmerican candidate for President drank some of the beer, happily smacking his lips, while Mayor Roman Gribbs of Detroit led the crowd in toasting him with the melodic chant Sto LatMay You Live a Hundred Years. He repeated some phrases in Polish (in which he is not fluent), whispered to him by Mayor Gribbs. It was a Polish night in a Polish neighborhood, but once he got into it the speech Muskie gave was the same one he had given everywhere else, including the refrain that had come to epitomize his candidacy:

title: Meteorite Gouges Huge Crater On Moon Near Site of Apollo 14
description: HOUSTON, May 13 (Reuters) A meteorite smashed into the moon close to the Apollo 14 landing site today, providing scientists their biggest bonus since the Apollo explorations began nearly three years ago.

title: Coney Hospital Trains Volunteer Reading Tutors
description: Donny cannot read. He is 8 years old and in the second grade. Already left back one year, he is a withdrawn child who does not speak freely to teachers or other children.

title: Police Here List Sensitive Spots; Mosque Is Cited
description: The disturbance at a Harlem mosque last month that led to the death of a New York policeman has prompted the Police Department to prepare written regulations governing how patrolmen will respond to calls for assistance at 17 sensitive locations in the city.

title: STAKES MARK SET
description: Susan's Girl ran with the robustness of a champion in taking the $56,200 Acorn at Aqueduct yesterday. Fred Hooper's star filly contributed a recordbreaking stakes performance in winning the mile event for 3yearolds by 2 lengths over the Niblick Stable's Wanda. Stacey d'Ette was next in the field of seven.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: BALTIMORE, May 13Maryland's Presidential primary on Tuesday, which had been heavily overshadowed by the one in Michigan, has become a real battleground for the Democratic rivals.

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: A freightcar shortage, the most severe the nation has experienced since 1958, could well plague the railroads this summer and fall.

title: Kentucky's OutofState Native Son
description: BARDSTOWN, Ky.Stephen Foster was a Pittsburgh boy who hardly ever set foot in the Souththere is only one documented river trip to New Orleans to show he had been there at allbut he wrote Southern songs, and the South has rewarded him richly by making him one of their own. Nobody cared that he had never seen the Swanee (actually, the Suwannee) River when his famous song about it first came out over a century ago (he was going to call it Way Down Upon the Yazoo River but his brother found the better sounding river in an atlas) and nobody cares now, either. Virginians run Camptown races in his honor every spring on a farm near Ashland, even though the original ones were held up in Pennsylvania, and Kentucky does even better by him by turning over a whole town to his memory.

title: ADVERTISING POINT OF VIEW
description: So you stand in front of the chairman  or presidentand in less than 10 minutes you're fired! Budget cuts; conglomeritisbig guy taking over little guy (what ever happened to the middle guy?); political maneuveringand a hundred other reasons we've all gagged over.

title: Miss Douglas Wed To A. H. Lupton 4th
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 13Miss Christine Hutchison Douglas and Alfred Holmes Lupton 4th were married here this afternoon by the Rev. Bradford Hastings, an Episcopal priest, at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence H. Douglas, father and stepmother of the bride.

title: Mrs. Lipman Has Son
description: A son was born to Mr. and Mrs. Melvin Lipman of New York on April 21 in the Lying1n Hospital. Mrs. Lipman is the former Miss Myra Ann Rosenthal of New York. The child, the couple's fifth and their fourth son, has been named Jacob Lowell.

title: Mines Said to Hold Device for Shutoff Bef ore Nixon Trip
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The mines recently sown by United States aircraft in Haiphong and six other North Vietnamese ports are designed to deactivate themselves before President Nixon's planned trip to Moscow on May 22, responsible informants said today.

title: 5 Are Killed in Gun Battles in Ulster
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 13Three civilians and soldier were killed in Belfast tonight in gun battles that followed an explosion outside pub on the edge of the Roman Catholic area of Ballymurphy in which 44 persons, some of them children, were injured.

title: Israelis Debating the Propriety. Of Performing Christian Music
description: JERUSALEM, May 13 A scholarly and legal debate is being joined in Israel over the propriety of classical church musicsuch as the masses or oratorios of Bach or Handelin the cultural life of this nation.

title: RIGA PIANIST, GIVES GENEROUS PROGRAM
description: Commemorating the 15th anniversary of his New York debut, Amiram Rigai presented a program of generous proportions in Carnegie Recital Hall Thursday night. In the first half the pianist tended to the three B's: Bach's Chromatic Fantasy and Fugue, Beethoven's Pathetique Sonata and Brahms's Sonata in F minor.

title: Columnist Retires to the Vineyard
description: HACKENSACKWilliam A. Caldwell, a journalist whose name is a living legend to a segment of the North Jersey populace and who has won the Pulitzer Prize, is retiring.

title: Rockefeller Vetoes a Bill To Kill Forest Hills Plan
description: ALBANY, May 13Governor Rockefeller today vetoed a bill that would have killed the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills.

title: C.C.N.Y. Student, 23, Stabs Assailant in Campus Holdup
description: William Gerbazia, the 23yearold son of a retired city policeman, subdued one of two young men who attempted to rob him at knife point last night on the campus of City College, where Mr. Gerbazia is a graduate chemistry student.

title: Joan Montgomery Plans Nuptials
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., May 13Miss Joan Montgomery, a granddaughter of James A. Farley, former Postmaster General, a leader in Democratic politics and board chairman of the CocaCola Export Corporation, plans to be married in September to William David Murphy.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The Voice of the Glen was sometimes ridiculed because it spoke in a flat monotone and because its owner had great difficulty pronouncing the names of forign drivers and cars. But no one could criticize John Duvall's devotion to racing at Watkins Glen. Without help, Duvall announced every race at Watkins Glen from 1951 to 1969, when another announcer was brought in. And there was the CanAm of 1970, when someone had forgotten to send the recording of The Star Spangled Banner to the announcing, booth. To Duvall, it was unthinkable to start a race without the National Anthem, so he sang it over the publicaddress systemsolo, in that croaky voice of his, and without accompaniment. The musicianship was far from perfect, but many had to admire, with a catch in the throat, the spirit of that old man, who was close to 80 years old.

title: Port Hearing Slated
description: PORTLAND, Me, May 13 (AP)The first of eight public hearings on whether there is a need for another deepwater port on the East Coast between Maine and Virginia will be held in Portland May 23. If the hearings establish the need for such a port, a study authorized by Congress will, be undertaken to find the best location.

title: Mycophiles and Mycophages Roam the State to Scan Duff
description: MENDHAM  Mysterious bands of knifecarrying hunters are sneaking around in New Jersey woodlands these days, lurking near trees and old stumps.

title: Women Are Rebelling in East Germany With the Encouragement of the Communist Government
description: BERLIN, May 13A rebellion is under way in East Germany against the stereotyped sexual rolesmale supremacy and female subservience.

title: ROBINSON LEAPS 268, TOPS IN 72
description: FRESNO, Calif., May 13. (UPI) Arnie Robinson leaped 26 feet 8 inches, the world's best long jump this year, and Al Feuerbach,. still in search of Randy Matson's shotput record, hurled the 16pound ball 69 feet today in the bombthreatened West Coast relays.

title: COLUMBIA'S GYM IS DELAYED AGAIN
description: The timetable for the renovation and expansion of Coluihbia University's gymnasium has again been set back. A delay of at least three months is expected because of difficulties in writing an antidiscrimination clause, which must be included in all the university's construction contracts.

title: Enemy Begins the Battle For Kontum in Highlands
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Sunday, May 14The battle for Kontum began today with combined tank and infantry assault on the Central Highlands city by North Vietnamese forces. But according to initial reports the first attack was beaten back with heavy enemy losses.

title: Spirituous lobster
description: The French like to prepare lobster with alcoholic flavorings in the sauce. Recipes exist that call for cognac, whisky and port. Lobster Marseillaise is a variation that capitalizes on the anise flavor of Pernod or Ricardthe favorite aperitifs of the great Mediterranean port of Marseilles. The dish is somewhat less raffine than some of its brothersinspirit, but it is definitely superior in force and character.

title: An L.I. Migrant Worker Called Hero at Memorial
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 13In the small, dark chapel of funeral home north of the railroad tracks here last night, 15 clergymen and representatives of the migrant community of this eastern Long Island town gathered to pay tribute to Pedro Fuente.

title: Wallace Campaign Is Expected to Peak In Tuesday's Races
description: CAMBRIDGE, Md., May 13The climax of Gov. George C. Wallace's powerful insurgent campaign for the Democratic Presidential nomination appears likely to come next Tuesday in the Michigan and Maryland primaries.

title: Golden Gate Bridge Suicide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13 (UPI)A 24yearold woman has become the 451st known suicide from the Golden Gate Bridge. The victim, identified yesterday as Mrs. Cynthia Lee Daner of Cupertino, leaped from the bridge's south tower on Thursday afternoon. Her body was recovered by the Coast Guard.

title: ItalianAmerican Congress Honors Executive Director
description: More than 600 members of the Congress of ItalianAmerican Organizations attended a dinner last night at the Commodore Hotel honoring Mary C. Sansone, executive director of the socialaction group.

title: ROSCOE C. MARTIN OF SYRACUSE U., 68
description: SYRACUSE, May 13  Dr. Roscoe C. Martin, Maxwell Professor of Political Science at Syracuse University, died yesterday at a retirement dinner for him and seven other faculty members from Syracuse. He was 68 years old.

title: WELLS Li STANDOUT IN TRACK FOR BLIND
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13 Eddie Wells won three events and placed second in one today as he led the Overbrook School for the Blind to victory in the annual track and field championships of the Eastern Athletic Association for the Blind.

title: Portland State Picks Coach
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 13 (AP)Portland State University announced the annointment today of Ken Edwards, an assistant coach at Los Angeles State, as head basketball coach.

title: Letters
description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Duffey, a Mashie Aide, Switches to McGovern
description: HARTFORD, May 13The Rev. Joseph D. Duffey of Hartford, national cochairman of the Citizens For Muskie, announced today he was supporting Senator George McGovern of South Dakota for the Democratic nomination for President.

title: Education
description: One of the principal concerns of many educators over the past few years has, been that Johnny can't read as well as he should. But maybe he's not doing so poorly after all. This was the conclusion drawn from results made public last week of reading tests given American children, teenagers and young adults.

title: Lila Cummings, Chaplin Barnes Married on L. I.
description: COLD SPRING HARBOR, L. I., May 13Miss Lila Cummings, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Lincoln Cummings of Laurel Hollow, was married this afternoon to Chaplin Bradford Barnes, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irston Roberts Barnes of Wallingford, Conn. The ceremony was performed in St. John's Episcopal Church of Cold Spring Harbor by the Rev. T. Carleton Lee, the rector. A reception was held at the home of the bride's parents.

title: Huntington Weighing Decision On LILCO
description: NORTFIPORT, L. I.  The Huntington Town Board will rule within four to six weeks on whether the Long Island Lighting Company can add fourth generating unit to its plant here.

title: The Ecologist Plea: Save Sunfish Pond
description: TRENTONEvery spring, the oaks and laurel running up the steep slopes of the Kittatinny Ridge in northwestern New Jersey form a deep emerald setting for Sunfish Pond on the ridgeline on top, creating the impression from the air above that the pond is a glittering crystal gem set apart in the wild greenery of the Appalachian Mountains.

title: The Nation
description: It turns out to be something less than a virgin spring. Last week many a parent's head was spinning over new evidence of the sexual revolution: a Federal study indicating that nearly half of America's unwed daughters have had sexual intercourse by age 19and most of them haven't bothered with contraceptives.

title: State to Let Us Know State of Our Air Each Day
description: TRENTON  A statewide airmonitoring system, described by state officials as the most sophisticated air index in the nation, will begin operating in New Jersey, next Tuesday.

title: An Auction Helps Open Art Festival
description: TRENTON  A porcelain elephant, 27 inches long and valued by collectors at $10,000, will be auctioned at a champagne buffet dinner next Friday night at the New Jersey State Museum in Trenton, as part of the opening of the state's weeklong Festival 72: Focus on the Arts.

title: Javans Sue Over Treasure
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, May 13 (Reuters)  Villagers in West lava have filed suit against the Indonesian Government over the disappearance of an ancient Chinese jar containing diamonds and gold worth about $15million. The villagers said they had found it.

title: Restive Quebec Workers Using Strike as Way of  Pushing Back
description: SAINT JEROME, Quebec, May 12Jean Labelle stopped scrubbing his shiny Chevrolet, for a moment and thoughtfully repeated the question he had been asked:

title: Janet Quinn Married
description: MANHASSET, LI., May 13Miss Janet Anne Quinn and Second Lieut. Byron Wallace Cartozian, U.S.A., who were graduated in April from the University of Dayton with B.A. degrees, were married this morning at a nuptial mass in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church here. The Rev. Robert L. Brown, the pastor, performed the ceremony, assisted by the Rev. Thomas Devoy, a cousin of the bride. The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. James Robert Quinn of Plandome Manor. Mr. Cartozian is the son of Mrs. Dorothy Cartozian of White Plains and W. Wallace Cartozian of Seattle.

title: Tigers Subdue Royals
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo. May 13 (UPI)Bill Freehan drove in the Detroit runs with a single and tworun homer today to pace the Tigers to a 31 victory over the Kansas City Royals as Mickey Lolich registhred his sixth triumph with a fivehitter.

title: Workers Take Pay Cats To Save Michigan Jobs
description: BATTLE CREEK, Mich., May 13 (AP)Workers at the American Biscuit Company plant, at Battle Creek, faced with a loss of jobs, have agreed to cuts in wages and fringe benefits.

title: Sheet Metal Union And the Railroads Agree on Contract
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP) The railroads and the sheet metal workers union agreed on a new contract today, a railroad spokesman announced, averting the threat of a strike May 31.

title: Job Doors Opend For Active Women
description: EDISON  How does a housewife get back into the job market?

title: W. Germany, Belgium Gain Soccer Semifinals
description: BERLIN, May 13 (AP)West Germany moved into the semifinals of the European soccer championships today by playing a scoreless tie with England before 80,000 in West Berlin's Olympic Stadium.

title: 8002553050: Hot Line For Foreign Visitors
description: THE woman calling from Boston and speaking rapid French sounded frightened. The switchboard operator 1,300 miles away did not speak French, but in front of her were cards giving phonetic translations of one moment, please in four languages. She read out uh moemah, see voo play to the distressed caller and switched her to an interpreter sitting a few feet away. The caller, a French tourist, explained to the interpreter that she had been involved in an accident and was apprehensive about the sign language a man was giving her. Then the man came on the line, speaking in English. In a few moments the problem was solved. The interpreter spoke to the Frenchwoman again and assured her that the man was a physician and simply wanted to examine her.

title: Sports of The Times
description: When Horace Stoneham tossed aside his birthright and uprooted his New York Giants to seek his fortune in, the Golden West, he left a lot of broken hearts behind him. But he also took one broken heart to San Francisco with him. It belonged to Willie Mays, whose army of worshippers in our village stretched froth Wall Street to Harlem and far, far beyond. Willie loved New York and New York loved Williel. Fourteen years have elapsed since the enforced separation. But if the ardor was suppressed during the interval, it did not diminish. Now there has been a remarriage and Willie has returned as a member, of the Mets. He and the fans are overjoyed.

title: Needlework Cuddles TV Space Cameras
description: PRINCETON  It takes giant rockets to fly Apollo 16 to the moon today. But once it gets there, it takes Mrs. Ann Nieroda's needlework to protect the TV color camera that shows earthbound viewers the exploits of the astronauts aboard their lunar rover.

title: Peking Says Supplies Move Despite Bombing
description: TOKYO, Sunday, May 14 (AP)Peking reported today that the people and the armed forces of North Vietnam were able to maintain smooth traffic in transportation despite wanton bombing by the United States.

title: Carol Ann Von Elm Bride in Queens
description: Miss Carol Ann Von Elm, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles A. Von Elm of Forest Hills Gardens, Queens, was married yesterday afternoon to Thomas Edward McDonnell, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Francis McDonnell of Davenport, Iowa.

title: BENGALIS MARK BIRTH OF TAGORE
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, May 13 Music and poetry readings throughout Bangladesh this week marked the 111th anniversary of the birth of the Nobel Prizewinning poet Rabindranath Tagore, a Hindu, who wrote the song chosen for the national anthem of this Moslem nation.

title: Mississippi Requests More Time to Find Black Recruits for Highway Patrol
description: JACKSON, Miss., May 13Mississippi, under a Federal Court order to integrate its State Highway Patrol, asked yesterday for 10 more days to seek black applicants for a recruit school that is to begin next month.

title: Robin Brown Is the Fiancee Of C. T. Linen
description: MILL NECK, L. I., May 13Mr. and Mrs. Charles R. Brown have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Robin Elizabeth Brown, to Christopher Tuthill Linen, son of Mr. and Mrs. James A. Linen of Greenwich, Conn. Mr. Linen is chairman of the executive committee of Time Inc.

title: Carlini. Henke To Be a Bride
description: CLATONIA, Nell, May 13  Miss Carlin Irene Henke and Louis Fabian Bachrach 3d, who expect to graduate next year from the University of Nebraska, plan to be married.

title: PROTESTERS SAIL NEAR NIXON VILLA
description: MIAMI, May 13A small flotilla of antiwar demonstrators dropped balloons into Biscayne Bay off President Nixon's Key Biscayne compound today as a symbolic protest against the United States mining of North Vietnamese waters.

title: Dutch Liner is Refloated After Grounding Near Rome
description: CIVITAVECCHIA, Italy, May 13 (AP)The Dutch motorship Statendam, carrying 650 tourists on a Mediterranean cruise that started in New York on April 28, ran aground at low tide today in shallow waters off this port city 45 miles north of Rome. No one was reported injured.

title: Married Priests Form Club
description: Thirteen priests of the Roman Catholic Diocese of Brooklyn who left the active ministry to get married have formed with their wives an unusual club for couples.

title: Miss Tuero in Final
description: STUTTGART, Germany, May 13 (UPI)Linda Tuero of Metaire, La., winner of the Italian open, reached the final of an international tennis tournament here by downing Edith Winkins of Germany, 64, 63, today.

title: JENKINS SAYS POLICY OF NIXON IS TRAGIC
description: LONDON, May 13Roy Jenkins, former deputy leader of the Labor party, deplored today what he called the tragic misdirection of effort of President Nixon's policy in Vietnam. Saying he spoke as a friend and not as a natural critic of the United States, he said:

title: Rain Puts Off Braves Camel
description: ATLANTA, May 13 (UPI)A drenching rain washed out an Atlanta BravesChicago Cubs game today and a Braves spokesman said the game would be made up later in the season.

title: HUNGARY PRESSES SOVIET ON TRADE
description: MOSCOW, May 13Premier Jeno Fock of Hungary called on the Soviet Union today to agree to longterm commitments to supply Hungary with raw materials well into the nineteeneighties.

title: South Street Seaport Lists Busy Season
description: A weeklong observance, of National Maritime Sea Day startstomorrow at South Street Seaport Museum, Fulton., Street at East River. Cosponsorea by the Offshore Sailing 5chool; free learntosail demonstrations will be given each day, starting at 11:45 A.M.

title: Nick, Huck, Rip and other wounded Americans
description: Soon after hearing that Ernest Hemingway had killed himselfit was a Sunday, July 2, 1961a number of excited people got in touch with Philip Young, a professor of English at Penn State University. He wryly describes their more or less common message (you called it, Young!) as belonging to a rare species of the genus Congratulation. In truth the occasion was bizarre, even a bit ghoulish and, so far as I know, wholly without precedent in the annals of literary criticism. Whatever his other pretensions, your professorial Critic is one student of human behavior who does not try to rival the natural scientists reputation for magical powers of prediction. In this case, however, Young had succeededor so thought his excited communicants on that melancholy Sunday in 1961.

title: Underwater Garage Will Open in Geneva
description: GENEVA, May 13 The world's first underwater parking garage, built beneath Lake Geneva because there is no land available in the center of this thriving city, is to go into service May 25.

title: The Nation
description: The only way killers should come out of prison is in a box. That's the view of State Senator Joseph Azzolina, a Republican who is leading a drive to restore the death penalty to New Jersey.

title: Handicapping the OTB Parlors in Queens
description: The subway literati who pore over horse lore these days en route to Aqueduct are engaged in an exact science compared to the handicapping by the masterminds of the city's Offtrack Betting Corporation who pick storefronts in Queens.

title: For L.I. Libraries, More Than Just Books
description: The new $800,000 South Huntington Public Library has a main reading room two floors high that vanishes from time to time.

title: F.A.A. Is Asked to Set Air Taxi Standards
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (AP)The National Transportation Safety Board asked the Federal Aviation Administration today to set up a central clearing house for information on air taxi accidents and on safety violations by air tax operators.

title: MarieCaroline Masson Fiancee of A.D. Russell
description: Miss MarieCaroline Masson, a cartographer with degrees from the University of Paris, plans to be married June 16 in Paris to Archibald Douglas Russell, board chairman of Cays Development Co., Ltd., in the Turks and Caicos Islands of the West Indies.

title: Peaceful Antiwar Protests Held Here And in Other Cities Across the Nation
description: Protesters against the increased action by the United States in the Vietnam war gave up sitins and street battles for speeches under sunny skies yesterday, as peaceful marches and rallies were held in a dozen cities across the country.

title: Legislative Notes: Do, Re, Mi, Fa.
description: TRENTON  If New Jersey and California have anything in common, it is that each morning at dawning, birdies sing and everything. And while no one ever confuses the state with Oldahome, there are places in New Jersey, where, on a summer's eve, you can sit around and talk, and watch a hawk making lazy circles in the sky.

title: Miss Goolagong and Hewitt Triumph in. F117 of British ClayCourt Tennis
description: BOURNEMOUTH, England, May 13 (Reuters)  EvanGoolagong, Australia's 20yearold Wimbledon champion, overcame Mrs. Helga Masthoff of West Germany, 60, 6.4, in the final of the $30,000 British hardcourt (clay) tennis championship today.

title: LETTERS
description: The bewilderment really should not be so startling. This is the year of makedo. It includes not only persons of limited means, such as myself, but also the young women who are flocking lunch hours to Singer Sewing Shops, Bloomingdale's yard goods department, etc.

title: Quota Trend Troubles Jewish Group
description: CLEVELAND, May 13  The American Jewish Congress said today that it was deeply troutiled by what it saw as a growing acceptance of the idea that jobs, promotions and college admissions should be decided by mathematical formulas eased on the proportion of various groups in the community instead of on merit.

title: DOLE SCORES MEDIA FOR WAR SABOTAGE
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13 (UPI)The Republican National Chairman, Senator Robert Dole of Kansas, denounced today what he called an attempted media sabotage of President Nixon's Vietnam policies and said it could cost the lives of American soldiers.

title: Laver vs Rosewall Today
description: DALLAS, May 13 (UPI)Ken Rosewall and Rod Laver meet for the second straight year in the final of the $100,000 World Championship Tennis event today, with the winner getting $50,000.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 13Two of us, man and boy, drove to Baltimore the other evening to see a baseball game. There is, supposed to be something American an oldfashioned way about going to baseball games. You know. Boys, romping in the cow pasture, the Babe hitting one for little Jimmy dying of something hopeless in the hospital, a simpler day when folks took life easier, and all that.

title: SOVIET DENOUNCES HISTORICAL STUDY
description: MOSCOW, May 13An unorthodox historical study, glorifying the independent and antiBolshevik state of Georgia before it was absorbed into the Soviet Union, has stirred a political scandal in Georgia by its bold challenge to the Kremlin's policy on national minorities.

title: Reds Vanquish Cards, 11 2, as Simpson Posts First Triumph. Since His Recall
description: CINCINNATI, May 13 (UPI) Tony Perez homered with two men on base in a fiverun third inning today as the Cincinnati Reds beat the St. Louis Cardinals, 112, to give Wayne Simpson his first victory of the season.

title: WESTPHAL COCKER TAKES 141 BEST
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mags., May 13A spirited, crowdpleasing cocker spaniel, Ch. Sagamore Toccoa, continues to set a winning pace in dog show rings. The 3yearold was named best in show today at the 50th anniversary fixture of the Springfield Kennel Club, which drew 1,744 dogs to the Better Living Centeer Building on the Eastern State's Exposition grounds.

title: SharetheBoat Plan Has Appeal for the Less Affluent
description: Once it was said: If you have to ask how much a boat costs, then you can't afford one. That's all changed now, according to a new company called Eight Shares.

title: Sports of The Times
description: In two decades, things change. When the D train rattles into the station now, the shiny orange, black and white tiles announce 155th St8th Ave but above each sign are four small empty holes where a wooden Polo Grounds sign once was attached. Upstairs, in the valley below Coogan's Bluff, the apartments of the Polo Grounds Project rise where the ballpark used to be. Between the redbrick, towers and the Tappan School, about where center field was, is an asphalt playground. In one corner is a homeplate area, with wire overhang for foul balls. Spaced along the outfield fence are six basketball backboards.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The notorious State Senate may have shown contempt for youth (Editorial April 25) by barring mandatory studentactivities fees, but its contempt is exceeded by that of the corrupt student governments catering only to their own narrow tastes in spending the monies.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May 13Dewey Burton is going to vote for George C. Wallace for President in the Michigan primary on Tuesday.

title: Son for the Feinbergs
description: A son was born last Monday to Mr. and Mrs. Gerald Feinberg of East 86th Street in Beth Israel Hospital. Mrs. Feinberg, an adjunct assistant professor of political science at Hunter College, is the former Baitara Silberdick.

title: Two Environmental Suits Filed A gainst Montana Resort Project
description: WASHINGTON, May 13The development of the $20million Big Sky golf and ski resort in the Gallatin Valley in Montana will be further delayed by two environmental suits filed in the Federal District Court in Butte.

title: HUMPHREY AIDES ASSAIL M'GOYERN
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 13With the polls showing a neckandneck fight for the California Democratic primary, the managers of Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's campaign have begun to try to tarnish Senator George McGovern's shining image.

title: Piping Rock Women Reach Golf Final
description: The Women's. Metropolitan Golf Association's interclub team: matches were finally completed last Friday. On that day, Piping Rock, representing Long Island, joined Montclair, for New Jersey, and Apawamis, for Westchester, as winners of the district titles. A conflict of dates had the Garden State Women's Golf Association and the New Jersey Women's Association holding a oneday tournament the same day, on. Friday.

title: McCarey Wins Mile and 2Mile. In Westchester School Track
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 13In contrast to last year's meet which was run in a steady downpour, the fifth annual Glenn Loucks Interscholastic Track and Field Gaines today were run under clear, sunny skies and the athletes responded with outstanding competitive performances.

title: Photography
description: T HE Metropolitan Museum's current exhibition of 35 photographs by Edward Weston, through June 7, leaves no doubt that Weston is a great photographer worthy of inclusion in a great museum's collection and worthy of being shown there. It is good to see these pictures once again and good to know that the Metropolitan has such a fine selection.

title: Maryland Wins in Lacrosse
description: BALTIMORE, May 13, (AP) Maryland's lacrosse team reeled off six consecutive goals after trailing by 107 in the third period and upset Johns Hopkins 13.12, today before 8,000 fans.

title: Behind The Horns Of an Elk In Elmhurst
description: Well, I finally got to see the back of the Elk that's been staring at me rather blankly over the years as I drove by him on Queens Boulevard in Elmhurst. He stands rather proudly beneath the neon sign that proclaims B.P.O.E. 878.

title: Free Transportation for Elderly Is Proposed to City by Rep. Wolff
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 13Free transportation on buses and subways for residents older than 65 in New York City and on the Long Island Rail Road for Long Island residents was proposed this week by Rep. Lester L. Wolff.

title: If you have a farm in Vietnam and a house in hell, sell the farm and go home
description: Not since the Civil War has any American war inspired so much impassioned poetry as the struggle in Vietnam, much of it (like armaments) produced by civilians, the most of whom have assumed the spreaddove or cruciform position of the rampant pacifist, hurling non serviam into the slack jaws of palefaced bureaucrats. For a while there, to Write Against the War was rather expected of a poet, a sort of metrical means of putting yourself on the line. WestCoast Poet Laureate and EastCoast Poet Laureate did it quite regularly for a period, but they don't do it much anymore. Nor were these war poems, however wellmeant, particularly memorable. A sort of violent occasional verse, most war poetry like most speeches seems to suffer rapid rigor mortis, assuming the stiff postures and bloated quality of all dead verse. No need to name names here.

title: Letters:
description: To THE EDITOR: I would not describe the Roman amphitheater at El Djem, Tunisia, mentioned in If You Like Your History B.C., These Are the Places to See (Travel section, April 16), as the best preserved. It served as a quarry for other constructions. Among the amphitheaters in good condition are those at Arles and Nimes (France), Verona and Pompeii (Italy), Pula (Yugoslavia) and Leptis Magna (Libya). I would not go to the Temple of Jupiter in Baalbek, Lebanon, to see the tallest stone columns but rather to the Temple of Amon at Karnak in Thebes, Egypt.

title: Ryun, N. C. Central Four Head Field Today
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 13In what seems symbolic irony, Jim Ryun returns to the scene of one of his finest races tomorrow for another significant step on his road to the Munich Olympics.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: Local Hearings on Master Plan Ended
description: Local public hearings on the proposed Master Plan for New York City ended last week as members of Community Board 12 told the Planning Commission what it had heard at many of the 61 previous hearingsthat most community residents were disenchanted with the plan because they felt it did not meet their needs in health, housing, recreation and transportation.

title: NATO Exercise in Greece
description: NAPLES, Italy, May 13 (UPI) United States, British and Greek marines landed in southern Greece today and engaged mock aggressor troops in the final stage of an exercise testing North Atlantic Treaty Organization defense in the Mediterranean. More than 80 warships and 300 aircraft from eight nations will have participated in the annual exercise when it ends tomorrow.

title: John G. Steele 3d Marries Carmen Lucas
description: In the Episcopal Church of the Holy Trinity here last evening Miss Carmen Clarice Lucas was married to John G. Steele 3d, an assistant commissioner of the New York City Department of Ports and Terminals. The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Andrew Mullins, assisted by the Rev. Philip Culbertson.

title: Trinidad Carnival Drops Ads for Contraceptives
description: PORT OF SPAIN, Trinidad, May 13 (Reuters)A proposal to enter a band advertising contraceptive methods in Trinidad's annual carnival has been dropped after an outburst of public criticism.

title: BUSKIN, FOLK SINGER, IS ONE TO REMEMBER
description: The revival of folk singersongwriters that began with James Taylor is beginning to look like a fullfledged pop music movement, New performersgood new performersare arriving with such frequency that it is becoming difficult to keep up with names and faces.

title: CATHY BABY WINS BY SIX LENGTHS
description: CHERRY HILL, N.J., May 13 Helen B. Sharp's Cathy Baby won her first stakes race today when she took the $29,725 Cherry Hill Handicap by six lengths at Garden State Park.

title: Audubon Weekend Ahead
description: CAPE MAYThe New Jersey Audubon Society is holding its annual Spring Cape May Nature Weekend here for three days beginning next Friday, The event will include a naturalhistory motionpicture lectures on Friday and Saturday evenings, and field trips, including bird walks, on Saturday and Sunday.

title: Soviet Aerospace Doctors Exchange Data in Houston
description: HOUSTON, May 13 (AP)Seven Soviet specialists in aerospace medicine exchanged data with their American counterparts today in the second such meeting between the two groups. The first meeting occurred in Moscow last October.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Passage of an effective endthewar amendment in the Senate looked possible earlier this week; and after President Nixon's announcement that he had mined the North Vietnamese harbors, even the Democrats on the House Foreign Affairs Committeenot a citadel of dovesvoted for a withdrawal resolution.

title: Antiques Now Her Thing
description: WHITEHOUSEWhy would the successful industrial relations and personnel director of a multimilliondollar Fifth Avenue, New York, beautyaids concern suddenly quit her job to buy and operate an antiques emporium and miniature golf course in this rural Hunterdon County community where horses outnumber people?

title: Russian Defects in Australia
description: CANBERRA, Australia, May 13, (Reuters)An electrician aboard the 20,000 ton Soviet liner Shota Rustaveli has jumped ship and sought political asylum in Australia.

title: Headliners
description: Barbara Lynn Herwig, a pretty, 27yearold lawyer, became a symbol last week of what is expected to be a new Federal Bureau of Investigation. In the long reign of J. Edgar Hoover as Director of the F. B. I., regulations said that all specialagent applicants had to be among other things: United States citizens, aged between 23 and 41, at least feet 7 inches tall, able to see and hear clearly, andmale. But Mr. Hoover has died and things are changing. The new acting director, L. Patrick Gray 3d, announced last week that he intends to seek more blacks, Spanishspeaking Americans and American Indians, andif certain institutional factors can be resolvedwomen as agents. As first step, the new chief brought with him, as his special assistant, Miss Herwig, the first woman to play a major role in the agency's 50year history. It may take a bit of getting used to, said Miss Herwig, but I try to act like a professional and I hope I will be accepted as one. Then she added: I'd better be.

title: New Novel
description: Bruno is an orphan, raised by his big sisters to be a loser. What fate begins, Bruno finishes. Thrown over by his nutty girl friend, he relinquishes college deferment and enlists in the Army. Sent to O.C.S., he plays psycho and is shipped to Korea as a G.I. Here, he befriends an appealing orphan of 12 or so, hopes eventually to adopt him, flubs this relationship tooand is left looking off into the middle distance, feeling very sorry for himself. Mr. Spacks, an engaging writer, makes his nebbish hero as interesting as Bruno's disabilities will allow.

title: If you have a farm in Vietnam and a house in hell, sell the farm and go home
description: A few years ago, at a university conference portentously titled Poetry and the National Conscience, one of the middleaging poets on the panel announced that, as a subject for poems, the Vietnam War was dead. All of us were veterans of many a Reading Against the War, and who wasn't weary of civilian rhetoric and accusatory bombast? Our moral indignation seems as impotent as a spent shell; the war drags on like a congenital disease. But the troops were yet to be heard from.

title: Nine years after a fateful assassination
description: AMONG the everincreasing scores of graves in Mac Dinh Chi cemetery, the oldest and most prestigious one in Saigon, now spread across several blocks near the American Embassy in the downtown area, are two unmarked slabs of marble around which miscellaneous mourners occasionally place wreaths or scatter a few flowers. Each week fresh pots of blooming plants are set on the tombstones by the gravekeepers, who are paid by members of the family of President Ngo Dinh Diem of South Vietnam and his Rasputinlike brother and closest advisor, Ngo Dinh Nhu, both of whom were murdered in midmorning of Nov. 2, 1963, approximately 20 hours after the start of the military coup that overthrew them.

title: Education
description: An official from the United States Office of Education recently saw group of fiveyearolds emerging from a public school in Brooklyn's BedfordStyvesant section. Each youngster carried a sheet of paper, and the educator asked a little girl what she was going to do with hers. Help my brother with his reading, she said. Asked how old her brother was, she said he was in second grade.

title: Border Troubles Reflect IranIraq Power Struggle
description: NAFTISHAH, Iran, May 13Along this hot and dusty stretch of the border can be seen signs of the deepening struggle between Iran and Iraq for dominance of the Persian Gulf.

title: At Magill House, the Elderly Find No Time for Boredom
description: Most people know what it can be like to grow oldthe boredom, the loneliness, the apathy, the sense of uselessness and waste and the trying to survive at a time of expensive aches and painfully small Social Security checks.

title: AROUND THE Garden
description: The ground is warming, but not warm enough for seeding zinnias, marigolds, beans, okra and other warm weather plants; wait another week or so. Spray with Bt biological control for gypsy moth. Keep up fruit tree spray program. Feed roses and peonies.

title: TAX REFORM ASKED IN HARTFORD SUIT
description: HARTFORD, May 13In the continuing disquiet in Connecticut over taxes, the General Assembly has been accused of succumbing to midnight madness in taxing residents on dividends they earn and gains they realize on their capital.

title: DISPUTE RESOLVED ON HARLEM PLAN
description: Dr. William J. McGill has, resolved a twomonthold dispute by granting more funds and, greater community control for Columbia University's Community Educational Exchange Program which provides compensatory education for Harlem residents.

title: C. W. POST TAKES MET. TRACK TITLE
description: C. W. Post, running for the first time in the Metropolitan Intercollegiate outdoor track and: field meet; made its debut a convincingly successful one yesterday at St. John's Alumni Field in Jamaica, Queens. The Pioneers finished first with 74 points, 19 more than the host Redmen in the field of 11 teams.

title: The Twilight's Last Gleaming
description: My ticklerfile of burning questions tells me it's again time to ask What Has Happened to Humor, to wonder why square comedy has slowed down to a trickle and why black humor is a fading stain. Mr. Arden tries to fill the breach with a farce pegged on social protest, but his indignation outstrips his wit and his sense of form. So  the story of one woman's struggle against the System and ecological blight fizzles out in an elephantine caper.

title: The Nation
description: The Nation

title: 59,215 Died Last Year In Transit Accidents
description: WASHINGTON, May 13 (UPI)The National Transportation Safety Board has estimated that 59,215 persons lost their lives in transportation accidents in 1971, 55,000 of them in automobile accidents.

title: JUMPING IS WON BY PAGE'S MOUNT
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., May 13Mother Goose, an aged bay mare who was almost rejected until last winter, won the open jumper fault and out class in her first start in a major event today at the Children's Services horse show.

title: College Sports Notes
description: SYRACUSE, May 13Full use a something old (the unbalanced line) and a sprinkling of something new (the wishbone backfield) have marked spring football practice at Syracuse University. The new item is in the experimental stage.

title: FishEating Gulls Beat MosquitoEating Fish
description: DEL. MAR, Calif., May 13 (AP)Operators of the Del Mar Race Track, hoping to reduce distractions for their bettors, stocked the track ponds with mosquitoeating fish.

title: A San Diego Empire
description: SAN DIEGO  For more than 25 years while C. Arnholt Smith has been putting together a billiondollar business empire he has been giving generously of his wealth and influence to promote the political fortunes of Richard M. Nixon.

title: Siderowf Wins Richardsim Golf 4th Time, Beating Furst, 3 and 2
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. I., May 13  Dick Siderowf, a proved internationalist, turned back a surprising 19yearold challenger, Farrel Furst, by and 2 in the final of the William D. Richardson Metarial golf tournament today.

title: A Park, Atop Interstate 287
description: MORRISTOWNToday this town concludes a week of events celebrating National Parks Centennial Week.

title: Mary J. Wolf And John Wolf Plan Nuptials
description: PORTLAND, Me., May 13  The Right Rev, Frederick B. Wolf, Bishop of the Episcopal Diocese of Maine, and Mrs. Wolf of Portland and Heath, Mass., have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mary Juliette Wolf, to John de Nervaud Wolf. He is the son of the Rev. Dr. and Mrs. William J. Wolf of Cambridge and Heath, Mass. The two families are not related.

title: Bergen's Little Gem of a Museum Worth a Visit
description: PARAMUS  When people come in they: ask Why haven't we heard of the Museum before? We live only a few blocks away.

title: Study Urges Wider Use Of Islip Airport
description: ISLIP, L.I.  The Long Island Association of Commerce and Industry has released a study that indicates a potential need for 32 to 48 flights a day at IslipMacArthur Airport.

title: Better Water Is On Tap For Woodhaven Area
description: More than 150,000 residents of Woodhaven and surrounding sections of Queens are now receiving water from the city, a service that stems from their complaints about the poor quality of water supplied by a private company.

title: The
description: Almost a year ago in this space Walter Clemons dissected the Pulitzer NonPrize for Fiction so gracefully that any encore is a sort of vulgarization. There was no Pulitzer Prize awarded for fiction last year because the Advisory Board and the trustees of Columbia University agreed that no book qualified under the standard for a distinguished work of fiction by an American author published in 1970. Saul Bellow, Eudora Welty, John Updike, Joyce Carol Oates, Donald Barthelme, Joan Didion, Harvey Swados and Paula Fox had wasted their time, unlike Ernest Poole (1919), Margaret Wilson (1924), Marget Ayer Barnes (1931), Caroline Miller (1934) and Martin Flavin (1944).

title: Dede Is A Lady Editor
description: WHEN Jerry Greenberg's success as the film editor of The French Connection was acknowledged last month with an Oscar, the person possibly most pleased, next to Greenberg himself, was Bede Allen, the New York film editor whose credits include, in addition to Woman from The Year 2000, such films as Robert Wise's Odds Against Tomorrow, Robert Rossen's The Hustler, Elia Kazan's America, America, Arthur Penn's Bonnie and Clyde, Alice's Restaurant and Little Big Man, Paul Newman's Rachel, Rachel, and George Roy Hill's SlaughterhouseFive.

title: Ceylon Faces Fiscal Crisis, Its Finance Minister Warns
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 13Dr. N. M. Perera, Ceylon's Finance Minister, has warned that before long no country would lend money to Ceylon because Ceylon's repayment capacity was in doubt.

title: If you have a farm in Vietnam and a house in hell, sell the farm and go home
description: Since the United States is presumed to act in harmony with its national values, Americans have difficulty believing that we are committed to a counterrevolution that sustains an oligarchy in power by making war on the rural people of Vietnam.

title: Editorial Article 1  No Title
description: Editorial Article 1  No Title

title: Lindsay Administration Begins Cultivating Various Ethnic Communities Here
description: It starts with Polish Constitution Day on May 3 and ends May 30 with Czechoslovak Day.

title: COLLISION MARS SAIL RACE START
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., May 13A collision which disabled a Cal33 sloop on her maiden voyage marred the start tonight of the New York Athletic Club's 63d annual distance race, the customary opening of the cruising yacht season on Long Island Sound.

title: Young Fans Enthusiasm for Nets Causing a Run on Piggy Banks
description: UNIONDALE, LI., May 13 The New York Net fans are Gregory and Jeff Monastra, 10yearold twins from Westbury  Howard Cohen of Bayside, Queens, who purchased tickets for his youngsters after they were unable to buy Knick tickets  John Montalbano of East Meadow, who takes almost half of the $30 he earns each month delivering advertising throwaways and uses it to buy tickets  Adrienne Schotland of Yonkers, who attends C.W. Post College in nearby Brookville.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May 13  Michigan's Democratic leaders appear resigned this weekend to watching a Southern conservative win the Presidential primary in their Northern, industrial, traditionally liberal state on Tuesday.

title: Cynthia Higgins Married. On L.I. to Joseph Roby 3d
description: ROSLYN, L. I., May 13Miss Cynthia Hartwell Higgins, a freelance writer, and Joseph Roby 3d of San Francisco, an assistant vice president of the international division of the First National City Bank there, were married here this afternoon in St. Mary's Roman Catholic Church. The Rev. Thomas Minoque, pastor, and the Rev. Charles 0. Moore of Northbrook, Ill., a friend of the bridegroom, officiated. A reception was held at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Decatur Sawyer Higgins, in Locust Valley.

title: Table Tennis Champion Plays at Forum Friday
description: Stellan Bengtsson, the 19yearold world table tennis champion, will appear with Kjell Johansson, a world doubles champion in 1969, in an exhibition in Madison Square Garden's Felt Forum starting at S o'clock on Friday night.

title: Dandelions Often Are Not So Dandy
description: Just as Long Islanders have adjusted to tax hikes, fare increases, job cuts, the pollution menace and the population explosion still another threat to domestic tranquility is blossoming on the greensward. It is an outbreak if not an outright epidemic  of Taraxacum Officiale, sometimes known as the dandelion.

title: GIFTED DAVID BUSKIN SINGS FOLK PROGRAM
description: The earlyseventies revival of folk singer/song writers that began with James Taylor is beginning to look like a fullfledged pop music movement. New Performers  good new performersare arriving with such frequency that it is becoming difficult to keep up with names and faces.

title: L.I. Welfare Cases Rise, Putting Poverty Pockets Near Affluence
description: Pockets of poverty in the midst of suburban affluence in Nassau and Suffolk Counties keep expanding, as shown by a rapid increase in the number of welfare clients.

title: Boats Float in Show
description: POINT PLEASANT  A boat show in which prospective buyers were able to board boats in the water rather than in a showroom was held here recently. There were 40 boats in the water and more on shore and at indoor exhibits in the Kings Grant Inn.

title: Science
description: Twice in the last year there have been reports of new planets discovered within the solar system.

title: All Is Not of ReRuns If You Take the Trouble Look
description: IF the world of the original presentations sometimes seemed like an unpleasant dream, the world of the reruns can often become a nightmare. That's the way it is, increasingly, in television these days. The season for most series lasts about six months, and is followed by six months of reruns. In some cases, a new 13week series has been followed immediately by a repeat of the same 13 episodes.

title: Too Mach Moonlight Burns a Track Coach
description: BUFFALO, May 13 (AP)Emery J. Fisher resigned today as track coach at Buffalo State University under pressure from the city of Buffalo, his primary employer.

title: It's Rough All Over
description: Long before anybody ever thought of legalizing offtrack betting, New York race tracks were required by law to charge $8 for a ticket to the clubhouse.

title: The Brass Quintet Covers Wide Range In Music by Knight
description: Music composed by Morris Knight was played at Town Hall on Thursday night by the New York Brass Quintet. Mr. Knight teaches at Ball State University in Muncie, Ind., and is especially interested in the composition of works for brass instruments.

title: She Reports East Brunswick News and Loves
description: EAST BRUNSWICKI live my job and love it.

title: Mrs. Gandhi May Go to Talks
description: NEW DELHI, May 13 (Reuters)  Prime Minister Indira Gandhi has drawn up a tentative plan to attend the United Nations environment conference due to open in Stockholm June 5, an official spokesman reports.

title: CHORAL SOCIETY VARIES TARMINA
description: Chances are that a sizable portion of the large audience that went to the New York Choral Society concert at Philharmonic Hall on Friday night was attracted by the opportunity to hear Carl Orff's Carmin Burana. This is certainly not the best of 20thcentury choral works, but it may well be the most popular, and it lures the public in any version offered.

title: Court Bids Alabama Seek U.S. Approval on Delegates
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala May 13 (AP)A threejudge Federal court ruled today that Democratic and Republican officials in Alabama were required by Federal law to seek Justice Department approval of changes made in the method of electing national convention delegates in the May 2 primaries.

title: Virginia Is Lacrosse Victor
description: LEXINGTON, Va., May 13 (AP)Virginia scored six straight goals in the second half and held off a late Washington and Lee rally today to gain a 109 lacrosse victory.

title: ACTOR AT CANNES SCATHES HIS FILM
description: CANNES, France, May 13Just about everyone at the 26th film festival cheered and applauded the first of the three French entries, Nous Ne Vieillirons Pas Ensemble (whose English title is BreakUp) except for its principal actor, Jean Yanne.

title: Zoning Attacked In Outer Suburbs
description: TRENTONJust like thousands and thousands of other exurbanit's, Vince D'Angelo fled from the grime and crime of big cities such as New York and Newark and escaped to such unknown places in remote regions of western New Jersey as Sparta, Readington and Vernon Township.

title: V.I.P Tours For Defense
description: FORT BENNING, Ga. Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird had to cancel his luncheon address here last Wednesday but the 20 DOCA's carried on, undaunted and with their usual good humor.

title: KILLEN, ROUTS WIN ELITE PAIRS
description: PELHAM MANOR, N. Y., May 13Sandy Killen of John Jay College teamed with Istvan Leovits, a former European champion, in the elite pairs to upset the New, York A.C. pair of Pete Virsis and Nick von Baillou in the feature race today of the Father Knickerbocker Regatta on the Orchard Beach Lagoon.

title: Music
description: LIKE the man at the party who says goodbye and tries to exit by way of the closet door, Goeran Gentele is smiling and putting the best possible face on the matter. It is nonetheless plain that he has suffered his first major defeat since being chosen general manager of the Metropolitan Opera. How he reacts to having his nose bloodied so soon (he doesn't even take office officially until the end of next month) could provide clues to the future of his regime.

title: Bridge
description: THE weirdest method of hand valuation ever proposed has never been put to a practical test, and no doubt never will be. In the novel Yarborough by B. H. Friedman, two imaginative teenagers decide to assign pointcount values to every card, starting with one point for a deuce and ending with 13 for an ace.

title: The Ersatz Powwow Is Real to the Indians
description: THERE are few positive ways to measure the disordered, illfitting existence of the remnants of America's once great Indian tribes; the indices are mostly negative the degree of poverty, not wealth; the clash with the dominant white culture, not the integration.

title: Suit Against Dog Pound Is Dismissed
description: FREEHOLDAn effort by the New Jersey Humane Society to halt what it alleged were inhumane activities by a commercial dog pound has pointed up the inadequacy of the state's 95yearold anticruelty law.

title: Ella Hardcastle Dies at 106
description: Ella Hardcastle, who formerly had a literary career here as secretary to Mary Mapes Dodge, author of Hans Brinker or the Silver Skates, as assistant to the editor of St. Nicholas Magazine and as a manuscript reader for Dodd, Mead & Co., died Friday in Forest City, Fla. She was 106 years old and lived in Winter Park, Fla.

title: Horse Show News
description: Primrose Farms in Somers, N. Y., will stage the first all Class B horse show on Saturday since the sprawling complex was erected six years ago.

title: The State Barge Canal System Will Go Into Full Operation Starting Tomorrow
description: WATERFORD, N. Y., May 13The 524milelong New York State Barge Canal System will be in full operation on Monday, a little later than usual because of unusual high spring water runoffs.

title: SOUTH VIETNAMESE board a copter for Quangtri as
description: DANANG, South Vietnam Sunday, May 14 About 1,000 South Vietnamese Marines made a surprise attack yesterday in enemyheld territory southeast of Quangtri city, which the North Vietnamese captured 14 days ago.

title: Dartmouth Tops Brown, 30, After Taking 41 Defeat
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 13 Dartmouth remained in contention for the Eastern Intercollegiate Baseball League title today by splitting a doubleheader with Brown University.

title: Dance: What Happened to MacMillan?
description: NEW YORK has traditionally been regarded by Britain's Royal Ballet as its home away from home. Since its very first visit in 1949 it has always returned with pleasure. Interestingly enough, the company dances better in New York than it does in London. The excitement of the trip, the stimulation of the audiences and the concentration of performances (it only appears three or four times a week in London) all seem to exert their spell.

title: 4 Arrested in Narcotics Raid
description: Four men were arrested at 2 A.M. yesterday by Federal agents in connection with the seizure of 25 pounds of marijuana and an unknown quantity of cocaine at the Emery Air Freight Corporation warehouse in Building 88 at Kennedy International Airport. The men were identified by the police as Julius Edwards, 44 years old, of 626 Riverside Drive; Jose Padilla, 37, of 880 New Lots Avenue, Brooklyn; Jose Padilla Jr., 18, the same Brooklyn address, and Ron DeBerry, of 250 West 131 Street.

title: Ohio TB Post Filled
