description: ALBANY, May 14Following are the major actions taken by the Legislature during the regular 1972 session, which ended Friday night, and during two special sessions last December:

title: Test on Antiwar Measure Set in Senate Tomorrow
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The Congressional debate over endthewar legislation is turning into a dispute over whether an internationally supervised ceasefiresuch as proposed by President Nixonshould be made a condition for withdrawal of American forces from Vietnam.

title: HEARD IS VICTOR. IN COLONIAL GOLF
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 14 (AP)Jerry Heard rolled in a birdie putt on the final hole today and scored his second professional golf victory of the year by winning the Colonial National Invitation Tournament.

title: U.S. TRADE ACCORD WITH SOVIET SEEN
description: WASHINGTON, May 14 The United States and the Soviet Union have made substantial progress toward a comprehensive trade agreement, the first between the two countries since the early years of the cold war, senior Administration officials said today.

title: Jeni Kenyatta Graduates
description: BLOOMINGTON, Ind., May 14 (AP)Jeni Wambui Kenyatta, daughter of Jomo Kenyatta, president of Kenya, was among 5,350 Indiana University seniors who completed their college careers here today. Miss Kenyatta, 24 years old, majored in psychology. She plans to return to the East African country to aid children.

title: Israel's Union Chief Resigns, Charging Interference by State
description: TEL AVIV, May 14Isreal's trade union leader, Yitzhak BenAharon, who ran afoul of Government leaders by balking at backing their economic policies, resigned today as Secretary General of Histadrut, the general federation of labor.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The State Environmental Conservation Department will propose state restrictions on gasoline lead content in the New York City area that would be more stringent than the proposed Federal guidelines, according to Commissioner Henry L. Diamond. The Commissioner said yesterday that levels of airborne lead in the New York area were regularly so high as to pose a risk to public health.

title: U.S. Soccer Team Wins To Gain Olympic Berth
description: The United States Olympic soccer team beat Jamaica, 21, yesterday to gain a berth in the Olympic Games in Munich for the first time since 1956.

title: 29 ARE ARRESTED IN CORNELL MELEE
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 14An unauthorized block party on the weekend before final examinations at Cornell University turned into a melee involving several hundred students and more than 50 policemen and sheriff's deputies last night and early this morning.

title: Brian's Song, Glenda Jackson Win Top Emmys
description: Brian's Song, a poignant dramatic adaptation of Gale Sayers account of his friendship with a teammate on the Chicago Bears who died of cancer, won the television Emmy award last night for the best program of the year.

title: 5Pound Pomeranian Is Chosen Best oil 523 Dogs at Willimantic
description: WILLIMANTIC, Conn., May 14  A fivepound Pomeranian, Ch. Sheeba's Little Dragonfly, the smallest dog in the final at the Windham County Kennel Club show, scored the bigbest victory of his career today when he was named best in a field of 1,523 at Recreation Park today.

title: Search for Missing Correspondents
description: Two years ago this month Cambodia was being torn apart by war. It still is Soldiers were dying and Cambodian families were fleeing battle areas. They still are.

title: Dan Blocker of TV's Bonanza Dead
description: INGLEWOOD, Calif., May 14 (AP)Dan Blocker, the amiable giant who created the role of Hoss Cartwright on the Bonanza television series, died yesterday afternoon at Daniel Freeman Hospital. He was 43 years old.

title: FINE FETTLE SHOWN BY ELLA FITZGERALD
description: The years go by but Ella Fitzgerald's voice continues to be a remarkable instrument for projecting a warm, gentle interpretation of a pop ballad, filled with subtle colors and accents. Miss Fitzgerald and her voice were in fine fettle Saturday night at Carnegie Hall, where she was accompanied by the Tommy Flanagan trio.

title: Pakistan, After Defeat, Is Regaining Vitality
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 14The sting of defeat has eased and the Crush India billboards, hastily erected during the twoweek war last December, are slowly coming down. The economy is still largely stagnant, but workers are once again laying bricks on unfinished buildings, exercising polo ponies and planting spring flowers.

title: Bridge:
description: A large number of bridge players who travel abroad seek out opportunities to play, thus obtaining not only recreation but also opportunities for social contacts.

title: Many Changes Due for Okinawa
description: TOKYO, May 14The transfer of the RyukyuDaito island chain  Okinawa for short from American to Japanese rule will bring vast changes in an archipelago stretching for 400 miles across the western Pacific below the southern tip of Kyushu.

title: Officials Say Goal Is in Sight in Drive to Stop Pollution by Government Facilities
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Seven years after the White House first called on Federal installations across the country to stop polluting, Federal officials feel that the corrective program is within sight of its goal.

title: Stage: Last Outcry of a Sequined Soul
description: There have been quite a few, productions of Tom Eyen's The White Whore and the Bit Player since it emerged at the experimental Cafe La Mama back in 1964. One viewer, who never saw it before, finds it hard to believe that any of them, including, the orieinal, surpassed the current impact of a Spanishlanguage troupe in a small midtown showcase.

title: Double Bill for the Cocteau
description: A double bill consisting of a onewoman show with Cindy Ames and a oneman presentation with John Guerrasio will be presented at the Jean Cocteau Theater, 43 Bond Street, May 28. Miss Ames will be seen in her dramatization of the Molly Bloom chapter from Joyce's Ulysses. Mr. Guerrasio will appear in a dramatization of the works of Henry Miller.

title: Miss Blalock Triumphs
description: PASADENA, Calif., May 14 (UPI)Jane Blalock shot a 2underpar 70 today for a 54hole total of 208 to win the $42,000 Suzuki international golf tournament by one shot.

title: Fake Fur Is Shown At the Zoo
description: Fashions, like food, look better in the open air. That was the consensus as the fall fashion scene shifted momentarily last week from the confines of Seventh Avenue to the beer garden behind the cafeteria at the Central Park Zoo. Stan Herman had invited store buyers to see his new collection of fake furs for lifestyle 70's in the open air.

title: OSAKA MAN IS HELD IN FIRE FATAL TO 116
description: OSAKA, Japan, May 14 (UPI) An electrican was arrested today by policemen who said he might have been the accidental cause of the fire that killed 116 people in a penthouse nightclub last night.

title: Nathan Sonnenblick, Chairman Of Mortgage Concern, Is Dead
description: Nathan J. Snnnenblick, chairman of the SonnenblickGoldman Corporation, 100 East 42d Street, one of the nation's foremost mortgage brokers, died Saturday in Hollywood, Fla., where he was living. He was 75 years old.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: DETROIT, May 14  Hubert H. Humphrey has been saying for months that none of the Democratic Presidential candidates stand to win a firstballot nomination.

title: Hard to Beat Wins
description: PARIS, May 14Serge Sokolow's Englishbred colt, Hard to Beat, won the $235,000 Prix Lupin today at Longchamp, the last of the big European stakes races leading to the Epsom and Chantilly Derby contests.

title: Wendy Joy Golding Is Married To Dr. Jonathan Zizmor Here
description: Miss Wendy Joy Golding and Dr. Jonathan Zizmor were married here yesterday afternoon in the Lincoln Square Synagogue by Rabbi Steven Riskin. Rabbis Leo Jung and Norman Lamm assisted.

title: Nureyev and Park In Giselle Make It A Modern Classic
description: There is no point in doing the great 19thcentury ballet classics today unless the dancers believe in the works themselves. Saturday night at the Metropolitan Opera House, outstanding performances by Merle Park and Rudolf Nureyev in the Royal Ballet's new production of Giselle provided the very model of how a 20thcentury interpretation can make a classic communicate itself powerfully to a modern public.

title: JOHN S. COOK
description: John S. Cook, vice chairman of the board of directors of the Companion Life Insurance Company, a subsidiary of Mutual of Omaha, died Saturday at Mountainside Hospital, Montclair, N. J. His age was 64. He lived at 21 Brainard Street in Upper Montclair.

title: GOVERNOR VETOES ANTIBUSING BILL; CITES 1970 RULING
description: ALBANY, May 14Governor Rockefeller today vetoed a bill, passed by wide margins in both houses of the Legislature, that would have imposed a moratorium on the compulsory assignment of schoolchildren for the sake of racial balance.

title: Young Peoples Orchestra Plays to Restless Audience
description: Perhaps it was the warm spring weather outside Philharmonic Hall or perhaps it was the program itself. In any event, the Cosmopolitan Young Peoples Orchestra on Saturday played to an exceedingly restless, talkative young audience.

title: A POLICEMAN KILLS ASSAILANT IN BRONX
description: A Transit Authority patrolman shot and killed one of two young men who had attacked him yesterday morning on the IRT elevated subway station at East 177th Street and Simpson Avenue, the Bronx, the authority police reported.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: A Times frontpage story on April 17 annbunced the critical reexamination of Lincoln Center's performing arts program for young people. The center's education division discovered that young people are reluctant and infrequent visitors to their great edifice. To get this information, the theater paid over $79,000 for a study which might have been obtained more easily and inexpensively from a boxoffice clerk.

title: GROUP QUESTIONS PARENTHOOD GOAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 14The most common assumption among married people is that they should have children. The next most common assumption seems to be that children increase the happiness of a given marriage. There seems to be little evidence to support either of these assumptions. Albert Ellis, the clinical psychologist.

title: La Salle Wins in Track
description: PARAMUS, N. J., May 14La Salle Academy of New York won its second straight Brothers of Christian Schools track title here today with 90 points. The host school, Paramus Catholic, was second with 64.

title: Mrs. Cavett Comes Out of the Shadow
description: Behind every successful man there is supposed to be a woman, and behind Dickl Cavett there has been a mystery woman  a woman he rarely talks about, a woman he has never asked to appear on his late night television show, a woman who happens to be his wife.

title: College Gives a New Meaning to Adult Education
description: BRONXVILLE, N. Y., May 14  Ten years ago, when Sarah Lawrence College opened its Center for Continuing Education, the idea of a special degree program for women who had dropped out of college years earlier was greeted in many academic circles with disdain.

title: Theodor Blank, Bonn Defense Minister
description: BONN, May 14 (UPI)Theodor Blank, West Germany's first postwar Defense Minister, died in a hospital today after a short illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Berrigan Reversal Sought
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 14 (UPI)The Rev. Philip F. Berrigan, the antiwar priest, and Sister Elizabeth McAlister make a final attempt in Federal court tomorrow to reverse their conviction for smuggling letters into and out of prison. Father Berrigan and Sister Elizabeth were found guilty April 5 of illegally smuggling letters in and out of the Federal prison at Lewisburg, Pa., in 1970.

title: Mets Win on Mays's Horner, 54
description: In a farfetched soap opera cheered by 35,505 fans in Shea Stadium, Willie Mays not only made his playing debut as a member of the Mets yesterday but also hit a fifthinning home run that defeated the San Francisco Giants, 54.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: That elections are in the offing is now painfully clear; in many neighborhoods, to the cacophony of the city have now been added the incomprehensible sounds of loudspeaker trucks touting the merits of candidates for public office.

title: Mills Bookings Off
description: PITTSBURGH, May 14Demand for steel appeared to be easing last week.

title: Gonzales Is Victor
description: LOS ANGELES, May 14 (UPI)Pancho Gonzales turned back Alex Olmedo, 6.3, 62, today to capture, the Southern California sectional tennis title for the second straight year. The 44yearold Gonzales had little trouble against his 36yearold rival.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The Pulitzer journalistic prizes have been dealt the ultimate obscenity by the recent award to The New York Times of the gold medal for public service and the award to Jack Anderson of the prize for national reporting. They earned these prizes by collaborating with the purloiners of government documents. The extent of the moral decadence of journalism in the United States should now be obvious to everyone.

title: Stage: Compassionate Older People
description: Love, sexuality and survival are the themes played upon in John Ford Noonan's oddly compassionate new play, Older People, which arrived last night at the Anspacher Theater in Joseph Papp's Lafayette Street complex laughingly known as the New York Shakespeare Festival Public Theater. Mr. Noonan can write and write very well.

title: OBERG BECOMES OLYMPIC QUALIFIER
description: RYE, N. Y., May 14A couple of Comet Class boatbuilders from Westmont, N. J., went to the head of the Star Class today, defeating 37 other skippers in an Olympic qualifying regatta at the American Yacht Club.

title: BLACK JOURNALISTS FEAR COURT RULING
description: Black journalists will be forced to seriously reconsider developing sensitive racial news sources if the United States Supreme Court rules that Earl Caldwell must testify to grand jury about an article on the Black Panthers he wrote in The New York Times, a conference of black journalists resolved yesterday.

title: Immunology: A Code Spelling Life or Death
description: WASHINGTON, May 14Inside the human body, cells talk to one another continually in a conversation that makes the difference between health and illness, life and death.

title: More U.S. Companies Reducing Boredom of Workers
description: OAK BROOK, 111.Sharon Bush threw on an old blouse, slacks and loafers to go to work at the headquarters here of the McDonald's hamburger chain:

title: Books of The Times
description: You might think that by this time the Howard HughesClifford Irving Affair has had itthat nothing more could possibly be added to newspaper and magazine accounts that have already detailed the book swindle all the way down to the organic prune that danced in the imagination of coconspirator Richard Suskind, or the police memorabilia that adorned the walls of Irving's childhood home. So you might be inclined to conclude That Hoax, an account of the caper by three young reporters from The Sunday Times of London, is simply not worth bothering withthat enough is enough.

title: One of Rodino's 3 Black Rivals Offers to Quit Congress Race
description: NEWARK, May 14  One of three black candidates for Congress in the new 10th District offered to withdraw today if either of the others made a definite commitment to the issues affecting the predominantly black district.

title: SEMINARIAN SLAIN; ANOTHER IS HELD
description: WARREN, N.Y., Monday, May 15A 27yearold seminarian was fatally stabbed yesterday, the police said, at the secluded Holy Trinity Orthodox Seminary in the Herkimer County community 65 miles west of Albany.

title: Weekend Toll in Ulster Rises to 9 Dead
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 14A teenage girl was shot dead here tonight, the ninth person killed in the worst weekend of shooting, bombing and arson in Belfast in the last nine months.

title: Mexico Defeats Canada
description: VANCOUVER, British Columbia, May 14 (UPI)  Joaquin LoyoMayo gave Mexico an insurmountable 3.1 lead over Canada in the North American Zone Davis Cup tennis series today with an 8.6, 64, 64 victory over Tony Bardsley.

title: ALBERT M'CLEERY, TV PRODUCER, DIES
description: Albert McCleery, the producer whose innovative and pioneering work in the early days of television widely influenced the medium, collapsed and died last night at the Actors Studio, 432 West 44th Street. He was 60 years old.

title: U.S. Stars Due in Soviet At Same Time as Nixon
description: At the same time that President Nixon is scheduled to be in Moscow, two other AmericansVan Cliburn and Roberta Peterswill be there performing for Russian audiences.

title: Seale to Run for Mayor
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 14 Bobby G. Seale, Black Panther party chairman, yesterday announced his candidacy for Mayor in Oakland's city elections next year. He is running on a platform that calls for community control of the police and for rent ceilings.

title: Lee Savold, Onetime Heavyweight Fighter, Dies
description: Lee Savold, who held the British Empire and European heavyweight championship during a ring career that included fights with Joe Louis and Billy Conn, died yesterday in Neptune, N.J. He was 58 years old.

title: Bridge:
description: Two major events make this charity bridge week in New York. The Alvin Landy Memorial game, honoring one of the great figures in bridge history, will be played tonight at 14 clubs in New York City and Long Island. And a twosession Swiss team championship will be played Sunday at the New York Hilton, sponsored jointly by the Greater New York Bridge Association and the American Bridge Association's Metropolitan Bridge Unit.

title: PRICE COMMISSION MAKES AN APOLOGY
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI) The Price Commission apologized today to 10 more companies it had charged with failing to file required profit reports.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: GROSSE POINTE PARK, Mich., May 15  The Democratic Presidential primary campaign in Michigan ended tonight, overshadowed by the shooting this afternoon of Gov. George C. Wallace in Laurel, Md.

title: Dr. Sandor Rado Dies at 82; An Original Disciple of Freud
description: Dr. Sandor Rado, an original disciple of Freud who founded the first school of psychoanalysis at an American university and who for many years was a leader in the psychoanalytic movement, died late Sunday at New York Hospital. He was 82 years old.

title: G.I. Insurance Liberalized And Extended by the House
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)  The House passed and sent to the Senate today bills that would liberalize the insurance program and extend fulltime coverage to National Guard and military reserve members.

title: Mets Turn Back Expos, 53, On Fregosi's 3Run Homer
description: We've got 25 pretty good players now, Yogi Berra was saying last night, reflecting on the fate that made him manager of the Mets five weeks ago. We may not be hitting exactly the way we should, but we're hitting at the right time.

title: Frail ExQueen ue, Lives in Past and in Fear
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 13She is a part of Vietnam's past, though probably not its future.

title: RiotControl Gun Company Is Damaged by a Bomb
description: MENLO PARK, Calif., May 15 (AP)A pipe bomb ripped a building housing the company that manufactures nonlethal police stun guns used in riot control, the police reported today.

title: Nets Rally to Top Pacers And Knot Playoff at 22
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 15Ollie Taylor, John Baum and Rick Barry perked a slumping offense tonight and the New York Nets surged to a 110105 victory over the Indiana Pacers. The triumph evened the fourofseven game championship series of the American Basketball Association at two games each.

title: GLAMOUR ISSUES LEAD MARKET RISE
description: Glamour issues led the stock market higher yesterday as cautious optimism percolated in Wall Street amid the absence of any new Vietnam tensions.

title: Shooting Is the Sixth of a Violent Decade
description: In less than a decade, starting with the murder of President Kennedy on Nov. 22, 1963, the faith of many Americans, in the reasonableness of their country's politics has been shattered by assassins bullets six times, the latest victim being Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama yesterday.

title: Suburban Growth and Antique Financing Threaten German Cities With Bankruptcy
description: LUDWIGSHAFEN, West Germany The enormous growth of suburbia, an antiquated financing system and an avalanche of costly task and burdens have pushed most West German city governments to the brink of bankruptcy.

title: Uranium Oxide Accord Set
description: Federal  American Partners reached an agreement yesterday for a proposed 12year lease to the Carolina Power & Light Company for production of up to 12 million pounds of uranium oxide from mineral lands in the Gas Hills area of Wyoming. FederalAmerican is owned 60 per cent by Federal. Resources Corporation, which serves as operator, and 40 per cent by the American Nuclear Corporation of Laramie, Wyo.

title: Chou Croute Lifts Streak To 10 on Belmont Victory
description: Chou Croute, the 4yearold daughter of Lt. Stevens who has been visiting the winner's circle at an assortment of tracks for the last year as if it were home, scored her 10th straight victory yesterday as thoroughbred racing made its 1972 debut at Belmont Park.

title: Olympic Team Trainer Picked
description: CHAPEL HILL, N. C., May 15 (AP)  The University of North Carolina trainor, John Lacey, has been named head trainer for the 1972 United States Olympic team that will compete in Munich this summer. He will head a nineman staff.

title: Corporate Profits Called Stable Despite Controls
description: Citing a series of figures to Indicate that inflation has been contained by the Nixon economic program, the Deputy Director of the Office of Management and Budget told a meeting of planning executives here yesterday that corporate profits have not been affected by the antiinflation policy.

title: OBSERVER
description: The President will soon go to Moscow for a visit. He will meet Leonid Brezhnev. Why, you may ask, does he waste his time meeting Leonid Brezhnev, who is only a party boss? For the same reason Presidents waste their time meeting Mayor Daley. When there is only one party the party boss is Mr. Big, to use a term that was popular many years ago, in the time when Truman was President and Stalin was the party boss. Stalin was very sparticular abotit whom he met and probably would not have met just any President. It is not at all certain, for instance, that he would have met Calvin Coolidge.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Choate School Opens Arts Center
description: WALLINGFORD, Conn., May 15  Old grads and parents headed home today after a fourday gala weekend celebrating the opening of a spectacular $6million arts center at the Choate School for boys and the dedication of an equally expensive sevenbuilding campus for Rosemary Hall, the prestigious girls school which moved here last September from Greenwich to be where the boys are.

title: IndiaAustralia Off
description: BANGALORE, India, May 15 (AP)Rain again postponed the Eastern Zone Davis Cup tennis final between India and Australia today.

title: Must Recognize Existing Union
description: WASHINGTON, May 15In a 5to4 decision, the Supreme Court ruled today that a subcontractor that took over a prior subcontractor's work and hired a majority of its workers must recognize and bargain with the union that formerly represented the workers.

title: Court Exempts the Amish From Going to High School
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Supreme Court ruled 7 to 0 today that the Amish religious sect is exempt from state compulsory education laws that require children to attend school beyond the eighth grade.

title: Swift Passage of Strict Abortion Curb Seen as Legislators Gather in Hartford
description: HARTFORD, May 15On the eve of a special session of the Connecticut General Assembly, a move to pass a law that would again put abortions under the strictest control seemed headed for swift approval.

title: USE OF METHADONE SCORED AT PARLEY
description: BALTIMORE, May 14Medical and poliical arguments were presented here over the weekend at the first national conference of opponents of the use of methadone in treatment programs for heroin addicts.

title: Kennedy Guarded By Secret Service
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Shortly after Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama was shot today, President Nixon ordered Secret Service protection for Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts, Representative Shirley Chisholm of Brooklyn and Representative Wilbur D. Mills of Arkansas.

title: Choke to Oppose Pell In Rhode Island Race
description: PROVIDENCE, R.I., May. 15 (AP)Former Navy Secretary John M. Chafee, a Republican, said today that he would challenge Senator Claiborne Pell, a Democrat, in the November election.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates tended to move down in a slow trading session yesterday, but investors balked at purchasing new issues that offered returns lower than those that prevailed late last week. The credit markets seemed increasingly confident that the Administration's latest Vietnam moves would not lead to a confrontation with Communist powers. As a result bidding was aggressive for the moderate amount of fresh financing sought. The shooting of George C. Wallace, Alabama's Governor and a Presidential candidate, came after much of the market had closed, Little impact on prices of fixedincome securities was reported in late transactions.

title: Six Young Lawyers Are Named Advisers to Police
description: In an effort to bring the law a little closer to the station house, the Police Department put six young lawyers to work yesterday  not as policemen, but as civilian advisers who will tell policemen such things as when an arrest is legal.

title: Tufts Retains Recruiting
description: MEDFORD, Mass., May 15 (AP)  Trustees of Tufts University voted 11 to 5 today to retain military recruiting on campus. The vote supported the stand of the president, Burton C. Hallowell, who defended military recruiting in a statement last month.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: James A. Loudon's March 28 letter mentioned that my Feb. 16 OpEd article, Do We Really Want a Space Shuttle?, contained a number of errors. This is simply not true.

title: Davis Backers Sentenced
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 15 (AP)  Twentytwo supporters of Angela Davis were given suspended 30day county jail terms and placed on six months probation today for illegally demonstrating outside the courthouse where she is on trial. Municipal Court Judge Wayne M. Kanemoto also ordered the 22 persons not to engage in any further illegal picketing.

title: Residents on S.I. Fee 1 Threatened by Urban Development
description: California is closer than you think.

title: Denny McLain Optioned To Minors by Athletics
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 15 (AP)Onetime 31game winner Denny McLain was optioned to the minor leagues today by the Oakland Athletics.

title: Carrier Reports Record 3Month Profit
description: The Carrier Corporation achieved record sales and earnings in the quarter ended April 30, the manufacturer of air conditioning, refrigeration and heating equipment reported yesterday.

title: IN THE NATION
description: Never mind what George Wallace stands for. The attempt to assassinate him was a foul and terrible act, incomprehensible in its motivation unlessas may bethe attempted assassin was deranged.

title: BLUEGRASS MUSIC A BIT DIFFERENT
description: Bluegrass music, which has been gaining a foothold in New York in the concert presentations of Izzy Young at the Washington Square Methodist Church, of Bernie Klay at the McBurney Y.M.C.A. and of Doug Tuchman's Bluegrass Club, has now moved into a club, Max's Kansas City, Park Avenue South at 17th Street, where the Country Gentlemen performed last weekend.

title: President Concerned Over Shooting
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Immediately after hearing of the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace, President Nixon today called Mrs. Wallace at her husband's and told her that she had he hopes and prayers of himself and Mrs. Nixon for the Governor's recovery.

title: House Unit Votes $29.8Million Slash In U.N. Contribution
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The House Apppropriations Committee, reflecting widespread Congressional resentment over the share of United Nations costs borne by the United States, voted today in favor of a $29.8million reduction in American contributions.

title: Con Ed Is Hopeful on Power This Summer
description: The Consolidated Edison Company of New. York, Inc., yesterday gave its millions of customers some good news and some bad news.

title: Air Taxi Safety Problem Linked At U.S. Inquiry to Lack of Funds
description: WASHINGTON, May 15  A Federal investigative board was told today that many of the nation's air taxi companies are so pinched financially that they make their pilots fly long hours with little rest and cut corners on maintenance and other safety standards.

title: Hogan Drops Jay Kriegel Case; Reports He Can't Prove Perjury
description: The question of whether one of Mayor Lindsay's closest aides, Jay L. Kriegel, committed perjury during his testimony before the Knapp Commission will not be presented to a grand jury, District Attorney Frank S. Hogan announced yesterday.

title: Volunteers Flown Into Base,
description: FIRE, BASE AND.0, South Vietnam, May 157Allied officers at this artillery base eight miles west of Hue pointed this afternoon to a ragged strip of churned orange clay, six miles to the south where artillery shells were exploding.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation has promoted David Adams 4th as vice president, finance and Richard M. Smith, treasurer, effective July 1. They will succeed James H. Walker and Edward W. Morris, who are retiring.

title: Bodyguard a Wallace Volunteer And U. S. Secret Agent Also Shot
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Three other persons were injured by the bullets aimed at Gov. George C. Wallace today.

title: BERRIGAN'S REQUEST DENIED BY U.S. JUDGE
description: HARRISBURG, Pa. May 15 (UPI)A Federal judge denied today a request byattorneys for the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan to question the prosecutors who headed the Government's case against the socalled Harrisburg Seven.

title: Aleksandr Y. Korneichuk Dies; Leading Soviet Playwright, 66
description: MOSCOW, May 15Aleksandr Y. Korneichuk, a prominent Soviet playwright and party official, died yesterday in Kiev after a long illness. He was 66 years old.

title: Philippines Supports Use Of Bases for War Supplies
description: MANILA, May 15A large group of Government and legislative officials who met with President Ferdinand E. Marcos at the Presidential Palace today supported the use of American bases in the Philippines to supply allied operations in South Vietnam.

title: U.S. Sending a 7th Carrier
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The Pentagon disclosed today that a seventh aircraft carrier and at least six warships of the destroyer type were being sent to Vietnam in a continuation of the heavy naval buildup in the Gulf of Tonkin. The Ticonderoga, an antisubmarine carrier, is scheduled to sail from San Diego soon, possibly tomorrow, officials said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Esposito, in Slap at Lindsay, Bids Parities Join in Campaign to Elect Fusion Mayor
description: In an obvious slap at Mayor Lindsay, Meade H. Esposito, the Brooklyn Democratic leader, called yesterday for Democratic and Republican leaders to unite behind a oneterm fusion mayoral candidate to save the city.

title: PARIS LISTS SURPLUS IN TRADE FOR APRIL
description: PARIS, May 15 (UPI)France had a $247million foreign trade surplus in April, the Finance Ministry said today. Seasonally adjusted, exports were valued at $2.13billion, imports totaled $1.89billion.

title: G.O.P. Assails Media on War Photos
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI) The Republican National Committee has assailed United Press International and the National Broadcasting Company for transmitting photos and films supplied by North Vietnam without considering first whbther they were in the national interest.

title: Advertising:
description: Paul S. Fields of Grey Advertising, Inc., and James Charlesworth of Needham, Harper & Steers, Inc., are going to Washington, D.C. for the same reason. Their agendies are opening new offices in the D.C. area, and. Mr. Fields and Mr. Charlesworth have been named managers.

title: Saigon's Forces Reoccupy Bastogne Base Near Hue
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 16  South Vietnamese troops, led by a platoon of 30 soldiers flown in by helicopters, reoccupied Fire Base Bastogne yesterday on the southwesterly approaches to Hue.

title: Chess:
description: Although not many people remember it now, a Hungarian grandmaster, Laszlo Szabo, was once a serious contender for the world championship. About the time of the Candidates Tournament of 1950, held in Budapest, one could make a plausible argument that he was one of the 10 best players in the world.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: STUTTGART, Germany, May 15 (AP)  Linda Tuero of Metairie, La., won an international tennis tournament yesterday, defeating Mrs. Alena PalmeovaWest, the former Czech champion now living in West Germany, 61, 6.4, in the final.

title: $145Million Tax Package Gains Approval in Jersey
description: TRENTON, May 15A $145million package of increased taxes, including an immediate increase of 5 cents a pack on cigarettes and a 1centagallon increase in gasoline, received final legislative approval today in the State Senate.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 Common Cause, the reformist citizens lobby, went into Federal court here today in an attempt to gain compliance, through a civil suit, with littleknown and confusing criminal provisions of the new campaign spending act.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: ADMIRALTY

title: U.S. GIVES CAMRANH TO SOUTH VIETNAM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 15The United States tufned otrer its huge Camranh Bay air base to the South Vietnamese today.

title: Widows of Police and FiremenThey Say Nobody Cares
description: They call themselves New York's forgotten women. They break into tears easily, they proudly wear their husbands medals of bravery pinned to their dresses, and they receive a pension check once a montha check they feel is not nearly enough for the family of a man who gave his life protecting the residents of New York City.

title: DOCKERS ACCEPT PAY BOARD'S CUT
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 15The International Longshoremen and Warehousemen's Union accepted today a Pay Board cutback in its new wage rates, ending a threat that the West Coast dock strike would be renewed.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The bare skeleton of what may become the Platform Committee of the Democratic National Convention began hearings on issues today under a process that has been so democratized by the party's reforms that nobody knows where it is going.

title: White House Accepts 2 I.C.C. Resignations
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP)The White House said today that President Nixon had accepted the resignation of two members of the 11member Interstate commerce Commission  Laurence K. Walrath and Donald L. Jackson.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED. FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Bureau of. Labor Statistics reported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended May 9 follows:

title: WALTER J. SMITH, 45, STOCKBROKER, DEAD
description: Walter J. Smith, a member of the New York Stock Exchange and a grandson of former Gov. Alfred E. Smith, died yesterday at Albert Einstein Medical Center, after a brief illness. He was 45 years old and lived at 2 Glendale Road, Rye, N.Y.

title: CENTRAL DEPOSITORY GETS FUND'S SHARES
description: The New York Stock Exchange's Central Certificate Service yesterday announced jointly with the State Street Bank and Trust Company of Boston that $170million worth of shares held by the bank in custody for a mutual fund were being placed in the stock depository.

title: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAHAEINE7ADVT.
description: DO YOU KNOW ANY IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAHAEINE7ADVT.

title: It's No Secret, It;s On
description: WASHINGTON, May 15There were fresh indications here today that president Nix Ore's trip to Moscow would take place as planned.

title: Ecuador's Economy: From Bananas to Oil
description: QUITO, Ecuador, May 15Within two or three months, someone will wave the magic wand and Ecuador will be transformed from a banana economy into the second biggest petroleum producer in Latin America.

title: Slumping Yanks Fail to Shake Houk's Belief They'll Do Better
description: CLEVELAND, May 15 Ralph Houk is the True Believer, the Eternal Optimist and the Beautiful Dreamer rolled into one.

title: STUDENT ENSEMBLE GIVES CONCERT HERE
description: Despite its rather formidable title, the Baroque Ensemble of the Sarah Lawrence Collegium Musicum is a likable ensemble of students who not only practice what their instructors preach, but publicly play what they practice. Late Sunday afternoon, the seven Sarah Lawrence undergraduates, along with their faculty director, Joel Spiegelman, came down from their Bronxville campus to present a substantial concert at Carnegie Recital Hall.

title: Aircraft Insurance Concern
description: The Beech Aircraft Corporation yesterday formed a Bermudabased aircraft insurance company to be known as Travel Air Insurance Company, Ltd. Primarily a self insurer to supplement private insurance, the company later on will also consider insuring others.

title: Cambodians Report Clashes
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 15 (UPI)Cambodian and Communist troops clashed at four places today near the market town of Kompong Trabek, 47 miles southeast of Pnompenh on Route 1, the military, command said.

title: The War Power
description: The Congressional showdown on the President's war policy, which may come today in the Senate, involves far more than the immediate issue of Mr. Nixon's continuation and escalation of American involvement in the Indochina conflict. Underlying the proposals to invoke Congress power of the purse to end United States participation in the war promptly, conditional only on the release of American war prisoners, is a fundamental constitutional prerogativethe essential responsibility of Congress to decide whether to commit the armed forces of this country to a foreign war.

title: RADCLIFFE NAMES A NEW PRESIDENT
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 15 Dr. Matina Souretia Homer, a psychologist best known for her investigations of why women avoid success, was named president of Radcliffe College today at 32 years of age.

title: Price Changes
description: The Goodyear Tire & Rubber Company and the Firestone Tire & Rubber Company increased prices yesterday on industrial rubber products.

title: BERINBAUM ET AL PLAY BACH ET AL,
description: Martin Berinbaum, trumpet and friends were on hand at Carnegie Recial Hall Sunday night for their third annual session of mostly,; baroque musicmaking. The concert was a predictably excellent one, for Mr. Berinbaum is a very fine trtunpeter and he has the best of friends  most particularly Johannes Somary, Who led a crack string ensembl with smart precision.

title: A Gift That Lasts
description: No child  not even a newborn infant  is too young to appreciate the gift of a bond from a loving parent or relative because that infant will be almost 6 years old when a Series E bond first matures.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: King to see how completely this high mountain valley at an altitude of 7,800 feet is an integral part of Sequoia National Park rather than of Sequoia National Forest, which now proposes to permit its development. Any largescale map shows Mineral King as a tiny national forest enclave virtually surrounded by the park. The only direct access to Mineral King from Sequoia National Forest is on the south, by a horse and foot trail, over Farewell Gap at an altitude of 10,500 feet. The nearest roadhead is many miles away.

title: PRICES ON AMEX CONTINUE TO GAIN
description: The American Stock Exchange continued its upward progress yesterday, adding 0.12 to clime at 27.60 yesterday, as measured by the index. This was well above the slump level last week following President Nixon's announcement of firmer Vietnam policy when the index dropped to 26.88.

title: Italy's Bishops Assail Pressure of Liberal Critics
description: ROME, May 15Italy's Roman Catholic hierarchy, clearly speaking on behalf of Pope Paul VI, warned dissenters sternly today that pressure tactics were illicit in the church.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A former supervising agent of the Federal Bureau Narcotics has sued the author of The French Connection and the producer and distributor of the film version for $1million, charging invasion of privacy and defamation of character.

title: DOCTOR PREDICTS A GOOD RECOVERY
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., Tuesday, May 16One of Gov. George C. Wallace's physicians said today that the Governor was expected to make a good recovery after an operation that was completed late last night.

title: Anarchy Once Again
description: The shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace is a staggering blow to the morale of a country already badly shaken by intrusions of violence on its political system. Public men can no longer feel, that the slow and often painful processes of democracy will be allowed to work themselves out at the pollsthat a campaign or a career will not be wiped out in a moment by the swift and dreadful shortcut of the bullet.

title: John B. Beltz, Manager Of Oldsmobile Division, 46
description: LANSING, Mich., May 15 (AP)  John B. Beltz, general manager of the General Motors Oldsmobile Division since 1969, died yesterday at his home in East Lansing. He was 46 years old.

title: Nixon Answers Moscow
description: By mining Haiphong and extending air attacks in the North, President Nixon is giving the proper answer to Russia's challenge in Vietnam. North Vietnam's latest invasion of the South with her entire regular army is the clearest conceivable case of flagrant aggression. It could not have been executed, or even conceived in the blitzkrieg form entirely new to the Indochina struggle, without massive Russian aid in weapons, training and planning. Its aim was to stir up again a horrible war, to halt the remarkable progress of Mr. Nixon's policy of peace and withdrawal, to humiliate America and discredit her as an ally throughout the world and to establish Russia on China's doorstep as the dominant power in Indochina.

title: BELGIAN NET TITLE GOES TO ORANTES
description: BRUSSELS, Belgium, May 15 (UN)  Manuel Orantes completed a victory over his Spanish compatriot, Andres Gimeno, today in the final of the $26,650 Belgian open tennis championship.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Bill Blass showed a navy blue sweater with a big, billowing yellow satin floorlength skirt. Oscar de la Renta in his boutique collection showed mohair cardigans over myriad satin dresses, short and long. Not since Mainbother decorated some cashmeres as an austerity measure during World War II has the lowly sweater, erstwhile chill chaser, achieved such status.

title: The U.S. Must Not Leave Europe
description: STUTTGART, Germany  In the reflected glow of good feeling cast by West Berliners being temporarily reunited with families and friends in the eastern part of the city behind the Wall, it is worth looking at the reasons why reunion has been permitted to happen after six years of isolation and to determine the place Berlin occupies in today's world. By doing so, we may see why a city so far away is important to Americans.

title: W. B. SHUBRICK CLYMER
description: HARRISVILLE, N. H., May 15W. B. Shubrick Clymer, former personnel manager of the Pratt & Whitney Aircraft Company in Hartford, died at his home here today. He was 66 years old.

title: CocaCola Company, Sued By Atlas Syrup Concern
description: A suit has been filed in United States District Court, Eastern District, by the Atlas Syrup Company, Inc., of Bayonne, N.J. against the CocaCola Company, for violation of antitrust laws in the sale of fountain syrups.

title: MILWAUKEE MAN HELD AS SUSPECT
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The young white man arrested as suspect today in the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace is a 21yearold resident of Milwaukee who pasted Wallace bumper stickers on his car and his apartment door and was exuberantly cheering the Democratic Presidential candidate only moments before the shots rang out.

title: Elizabeth S. Magee, 82, Consumers League Aide
description: CLEVELAND, May 15Elizabeth S. Magee, general secretary of the National Consumers League from 1943 to 1958 and executive secretary of the Consumers League of Ohio from 1925 to 1966, died yesterday at the age of 82.

title: The Unworldly Amish Greet Victory Quietly
description: NEW GLARUS, Wis., May 15Among the Amish farms that dot the hillsides outside this picturesque community, word of the United States Supreme Court's decision to exempt Amish children from public education beyond the eighth grade spread today with the unhurried pace of a casual horseandbuggy ride.

title: GUNMAN'S ATTACK CLOUDS CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The bullets that felled George C. Wallace on the eve of his greatest achievements in national politics will also upset both the conduct and the calculitions of the 1972 Presidential campaign.

title: Urban and Urgent
description: The Gateway National Recreation Area is a step closer to reality with informal agreement by the House subcommittee considering legislation to create the proposed park in New York Harbor. The. House version, introduced and earnestly pursued by Representative Ryan of New York, adds several areas to those included in the bill already passed by the Senate. The inclusion of Fort Wadsworth on Staten Island, due to be declared surplus property; Hoffman and Swinburne Islands, to be taken over from the city, and some beaches on the northern edge of Jamaica Bayall would enhance the park's possibilities.

title: Court Study Hails 10% Cask Bail Plan Without Bondsmen
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 (AP)A partial court survey indicates that a 10 per cent cash bail program adopted here in February is proving to be successful.

title: China Fills 7 New Posts In the Foreign Ministry
description: HONG KONG, May 15China has appointed five new deputy foreign ministers and two assistant foreign ministers to help direct her increasing activity in international affairs.

title: Candidate Has Raised $150,000 for His Race
description: Stanley Arnold, a 56yearold Manhattan businessman, said yesterday that he had spent about $85,000 for a series of television commercials and newspaper ads announcing his candidacy for the Democratic Vice Presidential nomination.

title: Shooting Suspect Shouted: Hey, George! Over Here!
description: LAUREL, Md., May 15 George C. Wallace was shot while standing at the new crossroads of middle America today; between the drivein bank and variety store of a suburban shopping center.

title: Prisoner Strike Is Planned
description: The National Prisoners Alliance said yesterday that it would hold a midJune conference of prisoners, former prisoners and sympathizers in Portland, Ore., to set a date for a nationwide prisoner sitdown strike, The Associated Press reported. Richard Shobald, national coordinator of the alliance and a parolee from an Oregon state penitentiary, said the strike would protest what he termed prisoners isolation from visitors and the low wages paid to prison inmates.

title: U.S. Steel Loses Bid to Bar Trial On Trust Charge
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The United States Steel Corporation and a subsidiary failed in the Supreme Court today to head off a new trial on charges by a Kentucky company that it was forced to buy defective prefabricated houses at artificially high prices.

title: FEDERAL REPORT ALLEGES RACE FIX
description: Daniel P. Hollman, who resigned recently as head of the Federal Strike Task Force that has been investigating a highly suspicious exacta race at. Yonkers Raceway on June 7, 1971, confirmed last night that the Federal report would show the race was fixed.

title: Market Place: Investing Goals Queries Clarify
description: We talked to a professional money manager yesterday to find out what kind of questions you ought to be asking yourself from time to time about your stock market investments.

title: 4 TEAMS SEEDED IN LACROSSE TEST
description: Eight teams have been selected by the National Collegiate Rules and Tournament Committee to participate in the second annual national lacrosse championship tournament.

title: Bruins Will Keep Johnson As Coach for Third Season
description: BOSTON, May 15 (AP)The Boston Bruins ended weeks of speculation today by announcing that Tom Johnson would return next season as coach of the National Hockey League's Stanley Cup champions.

title: Cornell and Harvard Nines To Meet in Title Playoff
description: Cornell and Harvard, which tied for first place in the Eastern Intercollegiate Baseball League with 104 wonlost records, will meet in a playoff game to determine the 1972 champion, Kenneth. G. Germann, director of athletics at Columbia and league president, announced yesterday. The date and site will be determined today.

title: PLATINUM PRICES SHOW ADVANCE
description: Platinum futures advanced $1.20 to $1.70 an ounce yesterday on the New York Mercantile Exchange here on the sale of 509 lots.

title: Quiet Day in Okinawa
description: NAHA, Okinawa, May 15Price markups and conversion of the currency from dollars to yen inaugurated Okinawa's new status as a Japanese prefecture today.

title: Two Wallace Daughters Quickly Learn Details
description: BIRMINGHAM, Ala., May 15 (AP)One of Gov. George C. Wallace's two grown daughters learned he had been shot while she was at home tending his only grandchild. The other found out about the attack while attending a college course.

title: Gaeckler, 31, Is Appointed Hofstra Basketball Coach
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., May 15  D. Roger Gaeckler, who in two years built the basketball team at Lebanon Valley College into the fifthranked small college club in the nation, was appointed today as head coach at Hofstra University.

title: Fed Is Narrowing Target For Its Operating Policy
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee refined further its operating target for monetary policya target centering on the reserves of the nation's banksin its meeting of Feb. 15 this year, it was dislosed today.

title: Roundup: Clemente's Bat Booms
description: Roberto Clemente and Bob Gibson, both of whom experienced April slumps, are traveling in opposite directions in May.

title: Uruguay Extends Measure
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 15 (Reuters)Uruguay's Par ment voted 68 to 56 today to extend the monthold state of internal war against the leftwing Tupamaro urban guerrillas for 45 days.

title: Repairs Will Divert Traffic On F.D.R. Drive 2, Weeks
description: Northbound traffic on the Franklin D. Roosevelt. Drive will be diverted on week nights for two weeks to permit repairs and resurfacing of the northbound roadway in two stages between 49th and 96th Streets, the Highways Department announced yesterday.

title: Congressman's Office Burns
description: ROYAL OAK, Mich., May 15 (AP)The office of Representative William S. Broomfield, Republican of Michigan, was destroyed early today by a firebomb, the police reported.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Mrs. Tobias Kronengold, wife of a diamond merchant, was busy sweeping out the store. It wasn't her husband's place of business, though. It was a food store at 466 Amsterdam Avenue (beween 82d and 83d Streets) which is devoted to organically grown foods and is called Greenhouse Association.

title: Miss Hogan Struggles
description: GUILDFORD, England, May 15 (Reuters)Patti Hogan, member of the United States Wightman Cup team, had to struggle to win her opening match in a Rothman's tennis tournament today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am a former F.B.I. agent. J. Edgar Hoover served as Director of the F.B.I. for 48 years, but he had been with the Department of Justice since 191755 years service in the same department.

title: Drive for Books Opens Here
description: The American Merchant Marine Library Association began its 28th annual spring book drive yesterday with ceremonies at Rockefeller Center. A lifeboat served as the depository for book donations which may be made until Friday at the Atlas Court, on Fifth Avenue, between 8 A.M. and 4 P.M.

title: SEARS PROFIT UP 14.6% IN QUARTER
description: DALLAS, May 15Increased spending among consumers reflecting restored confidence in the economy produced record sales and income for the first quarter of 1972, the chairman of Sears, Roebuck & Co., Gordon M. Metcalf, said today at the company's annual meeting. He added that the remainder of the year looked especially promising for the company.

title: A Moscow Pause
description: Although preparations for the NixonBrezhnev meeting in Moscow are still going forward, there remains no certainty that it will take place. In 1960, both President Eisenhower and Premier Khrushchev journeyed to Paris in the wake of the U2 incident for a previously scheduled fourpower summit, but the conference never met. Mr. Khrushchev, backing out at the last moment, preferred to use the opportunity for a propaganda blast at the United States, undoubtedly to appease hardliners in the Soviet hierarchy at home.

title: FRED D. HESLEY
description: Fred D. Hesley, retired vice (president and director of Todd (Shipyards Corporation, died Sunday night at the Palm Crest Convalescent Center, Long Beach, Calif., after a long illness. His age was 82.

title: Steel Union Aide Assails Company in Idaho Mine Fire
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI) A steelworkers union official accused the Sunshine Mining Company today of callous disregard for the safety of workers at the company's mine at Kellogg, Idaho.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: I.C.C. The White House announced that President Nixon had accepted the resignation of two members of the Interstate Commerce Commission Laurence K. Walrath and Donald L. Jackson. Both cited personal reasons in their letters of resignation. The White House said their successors had not been chosen.

title: JULIUS HALPERN, PHYSICIST, WAS 60
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15 Dr. Julius Halpern, professor of physics at the University of Pennsylvania and an internationally known physicist, died Saturday of a heart attack in the university hospital. His age was 60.

title: Lawyer's Lobbying Tactics Against No  Fault Insurance Bill Surprised Legislators
description: ALBANY, May 13  The Governor wanted it, the insurance industry wanted it, the Nixon Administration has endorsed it and every consumer group was for it. But nofault automobile insurance died in the State Legislature here last week.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: StudebakerWorthington, Inc., yesterday said it was accepting one million of some 1,250,000 shares of its common stock tendered pursuant to an offer made by the company on April 26. The purchase price, the company said, is $45.00 a share, net to the seller. The stock closed on the New York Stock Exchange at 44, up .

title: TV: The Emmy Show
description: The Emmy Awards went on live. Sunday night. They went on and on, beginning at 10 P.M. on the Columbia Broadcasting System and ending around 12:15 in the morning. Johnny Carson finally had to tell the audience in the Hollywood Palladium: Please keep your seats. The waiters will be around soon, with breakfast.

title: For Want at Competition Ryun Failed Again
description: The day before his Dream Mile became a nightmare in Philadelphia last weekend, Jim Ryan appeared calm and confident.

title: Singapore Merchant Bank
description: The Bank of America announced yesterday its intention to participate in a proposed new merchant bank in Singapore. Other banks slated to join in the venture are Union Bank of Switzerland; Kleinwort, Benson, Ltd., London; Banque de Paris et de PaysBas, Paris, and the Overseas Union Bank, Singapore. The new bank, as yet unnamed, would have initial capital of $10.7million.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Maryland and Michigan Conduct primary elections today, the 15th and 16th of 23 that will have a bearing on the Presidential nominations.

title: Theater: Rock Musical
description: It was time the Old Testament got further into the act. There have been quite a number of New Testament musicals  Jesus Christ, Superstar, Godspell and Handel's Messiah, to name but a few but the old Testament has perhaps had less of a chance to make good in show business. It probably isn't really trendy enough. But now some justice has been done. Last night at the Edison Theater we had Torn Martel's new rock musical, Hard Job Being God. I can hardly wait for someone to cash in on the Holy Ghost.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: MARTHA'S VINEYARD, Mass.Three hours of reading two environmental textbooks that were justifiably freighted with incipient ecological disasters sent me on a drive upisland to Alley's General Store, where I can usually find the country talk that reaffirms my hope for this troubled planet.

title: Arthur Daley
description: The Yankees discovered him originally in Coney Island on a semipro team that was known as Nathan's Famous Hot Dogs. This label does not exactly evoke instant images of baseball glamour and maybe someone Was trying to tell the Bronx Bombers something from the very beginning. But they paid no attention and signed Joe Pepitone anyway. The dreamers in the Yankee front office had been spoiled by their succession of superstar attractionsBabe Ruth, Joe DiMaggio and Mickey Mantle. They of 31 and asked to be placed on the voluntary retired list.

title: Soviet Indicates It waits. Nixon's Arrival on Monday
description: MOSCOW, May 15The Soviet Union today gave its most positive public signal that it expects to receive President Nixon: next Monday despite tensions,. over, the mining of North Vietnamese ports.

title: Kodes Heads French Seeding
description: PARIS, May 15 (AP)Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia and Evonne Goolagong of Australia, the defending champions, were topseeded today for the French international tennis championships starting next Monday.

title: In de Rivera's Sculpture, Inner Space
description: Jose de Rivera, whose incredibly graceful, curvilinear sculptures of polished metal have won him many honors, Ras been making art for four decades and no one's ever pinned a label on him. The 68yearold sculptor, who started out as a machinist, likes it that way.

title: Frazier Opens Final Drills
description: OMAHA, Neb., May 15 (AP) Joe Frazier arrived here today to begin final preparations for his May 25 heavyweight championship fight with Ron Stander of Council Bluffs, Iowa.

title: High French Aide Quits in a Building Scandal
description: PARIS, May 15 (Reuters)A French secretary of state, Phillips Dechartre, found by a court to have been involved in a building scandal resigned from the Government today. Informed sources believe that President Pompidou had intervened personally to persuade Mr. Dechartre to resign.

title: 3 MORE WOUNDED
description: LAUREL, Md., Tuesday, May 16Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, seemingly on the verge of his greatest electoral triumphs, was shot and gravely wounded yesterday afternoon as he campaigned for President at a shopping center in this suburb of Washington as Gov. Wallace began mingling with the crowd. In the young man's hand was a pistol. His arm was struck by the Governor's security detail, but he managed to get off several quick shots at pointblank range.

title: Measuring City Gaps
description: Only a few weeks ago Deputy Mayor Edward Hamilton was estimating New York City's projected budget gap at an immodest $1 billion in a total budget of just under $10 billion, up 15 per cent from this year. To the extent that this gap now disappearsor withers away in the City Hall phrasea lingering credibility gap yawns ever wider. Once again this year, as last year and the year before, Lindsay administration estimates of financial assistance needed from the State Legislature at Albany are proving grossly exaggerated.

title: BRITISH HOUSE BACKS NIXON BY 23 VOTES
description: LONDON, May 15  The British Government mounted a strong defense of President Nixon's Vietnam policies today in a spirited, threehour debate in the House of Commons.

title: Robbins's Dances Given Added Glow By the City Ballet
description: Jerome Robbins's Dances at a Gathering is a wonderfully light and lifeaffirming ballet. It has its own internal glow, and the New York City Ballet's performance Sunday afternoon was infused with its Companionate joy.

title: STATE RESTS CASE OF ANGELA DAVIS
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 15The state rested its case against Angela Davis today, moments after the prosecutor read to the jury portions of what the defense said was Miss Davis's personal diary.

title: Japanese Celebrate the Return of Okinawa
description: TOKYO, May 15The return of the Ryukyu Islands, with their one million people, to Japanese rule was marked today with a ceremony in Tokyo attended by high Japanese and American officials and with other festive observances throughout the country.

title: City Officials Move to Rescind a WeekOld Rule Easing Tenant Evictions
description: City officials are planning to rescind a meekold regulation that was designed to expand the right of landlords to evict tenants of rentcontrolled apartments but that, experts now say, could virtually end rent control in five years.

title: Second Customer Turns in Ticket On Big Superfecta
description: YONKERS, N. Y., May 15A 28yearold Queens man, who wished that his name be withheld, cashed the second $111,912 superfecta at Yonkers $111,912 superfecta at Yangers Raceway after waiting 24 days.

title: Welfare Worker Is Accused of Stealing $42,000
description: A suspended Department of Social Services caseworker was arrested yesterday and charged With stealing $42,00 from the city in three months through the preparation and issuance of fraudulent relief checke. He is alleged to have used part of the money to buy a $10,000 Cadillac for himself and a $2,500 Ford for his girlfriend.

title: Serve Wider Public, Accountants Urged
description: A witness representing a Ralph Nader organization told the accounting profession yesterday that it must broaden its responsibilities and serve not only executives and investors but also many other groups.

title: Merger News
description: The St. Joe Minerals Corporation, the nation's leading producer of lead, said yesterday it was entering the oil and gas field through the proposed acquisition of 93.6 per cent of the outstanding stock of CanDel Ohio, Ltd., a Canadian subsidiary of the Sohio Petroleum Company. The transaction involves about $47million. CanDel (formerly Canadian Delhi Oil, Ltd.) is a Calgarybased company engaged in the acquisition, exploration and development of oil and gas properties in Western Canada, including the northwest territories and the Yukon. It also produces oil and gas in Canada.

title: Waldheim Presses for Action on Vietnam
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 15  Secretary General Waldheim today sharply increased his pressure, to have the Vietnam issue brought before the United Nations by making public a strongly worded letter he wrote last week to the President of the Security Council.

title: OTB Will Accept Wagers On Preakness Thursday
description: New York City's 76 offtrack betting offices will begin accepting bets on Saturday's 97th running of the Preakness Stakes at 2 P.M. on Thursday.

title: SENATE UNIT HOLDS FINANCE HEARINGS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Senate Banking Committee opened hearings today on a proposed new Federal Financing Bank and other bills that could deeply affect the markets for securities of the Federal Government, its semiindependent agencies, and the securities of state and local governments.

title: Rev. H. Frank Swartz, 100, Led Coast Religious School
description: The Rev. Dr. H. Frank Swartz, president of the Pacific School of Religion in Berkeley, Calif., from 1923 to 1938, died Wednesday in Santa Barbara, Calif., at the age of 100.

title: Prayers and Tears in Alabama Capital
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 15When the word reached Montgomery today that Gov. George C. Wallace had been shot in Maryland, the news cut through the hazy May day like a cold rain.

title: State Completed 1973 Plan For Alcoholism Treatment
description: The State Department of Mental Hygiene has completed its plan for alcoholism treatment and control for fiscal 1973, Commissioner Alan D. Miller announced yesterday.

title: JERSEY ASSEMBLY BACKS NO FAULT
description: TRENTON, May 15  The State Assembly today passed a modified nofault automobile insurance plan that would mandate a minimum 15 per cent reduction in personalinjury insurance premiums and prevent insurance companies from canceling or refusing to renew policies without the permission of the State Insurance Commissioner.

title: Saigon Police Arrest Head Of American Legion Club
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 15 (UPI)The manager of the American Legion Club here has been arrested on charges of possession of illegal weapons and currency and importing violations and jailed without bail, the legion commander here said today.

title: SOME TRAIN FARES TO BE CUT IN EAST
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Many conventional intercity train fares in the Eastern United States will drop between 10 and 25 per cent soon, but those in the West and on the New York  Washington Metroliners will rise about 10 per cent, Amtrak announced today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: W. Averell Harriman trots out every argument that the Russians have been using in their frantic efforts to influence the ratification of the infamous BonnMoscow Treaty. [OpEd May 2.] Nowhere does one find the cogent arguments against the treaty that are being raised by millions of Germans.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: MADAGASCAR PLEDGE OF REFORM REPORTED
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, May 15 (Reuters)About 100,000 students, workers and civil servants marched on the Presidential Palace here today, demanding the release of student leaders arrested in three days of violence that has resulted in at least 25 deaths.

title: Mitchell Cards 78 to Win Westchester Seniors Golf
description: HARRISON, N. Y., May 15Dr. Abner P. Mitchell of Innis Arden won the 38th annual spring tournament of the Westchester Seniors Golf Association today by scoring a 39, 3978 on the west course at Westchester Country Club.

title: Canada Lifts Korea Quota
description: SEOUL, May 15 (UPI)Canada has agreed to a 5 to 10 per cent increase in its quota on imported South Korean textile goods, it was announced today. The agreement, reached this past weekend, did not include quota restrictions on acrylic yarn and double and warp fabric.

title: Upstate Officer Killed
description: WASHINGTON, Mity 15 (UPI)  The Defense Department announced today that Maj. George W. Carter of the Army, from Guilderland, N. Y., had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on PeaceKeeping3 P.M.

title: DONALD P. TAYLOR
description: RAHWAY, N. J., May 15Donald P. Taylor of 439 Central Avenue, a former attorney for Merck & Co., died yesterday at Rahway Hospital. His age was 68.

title: QUARTER TRADE LOSS REPORTED BY CANADA
description: OTTAWA, May 15 (Canadian Press)Canada had a curent account deficit of $532million in its dealings with other countries for the first three months of this year, Statistics Canada reported today. There was a $78million surplus in the first quarter of last year.

title: House Unit Apologizes For Its Secret Session
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)A House subcommittee battling secrecy in government apologetically told a witness today it would have to go into secret session to hear his testimony because the State Department had designated it classified.

title: Matsu and Quemoy, Battles Long Past, Keep Their Unending Watch on China
description: MATSU, May 15 (AP)The landing ship lay nosed into the sand, her bow doors gaping like the jaws of a beached whale, as Chinese Nationalist soldiers trooped aboard.

title: Catonsville Nine Begins Run as Film
description: On Oct. 9, 1968, the Rev. Daniel Berrigan, the Rev. Philip F. Berrigan and seven other Roman Catholic antiwar activists, including two women, were found guilty in a Baltimore Federal court of having destroyed United States property when, on May 17, they raided the offices of the draft board in Cantonsville, Md. In the course of the raid, they had removed 378 Selective Service files to the backyard where the files were burned, using what the defendants described as homemade napalm, concocted with Ivory Soap chips.

title: Notes on People
description: A 101gun salute greeted Queen Elizabeth II when she arrived in France for a fiveday state visit, symbolizing the new entente cordiale between the two countries as Britain prepares, in less than seven months, to join the Common Market.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (AP) The Senate majority leader, Mike Mansfield, said today that Richard G. Kleindienst's nomination to be Attorney General would be taken up in the Senate when action on a State Department financing bill was completed. Senator Mansfield, Democrat of Montana, said he did not know when that bill would be disposed of but he expressed doubt that it would be this week.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Regarding your April 14 editorial New York Hit Parade, I believe there is much merit to your views. However, although I am not one of your informed observers who were queried about the crime scene, I am somewhat acquainted with the U. S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York. My husband, along with 95 other lawyers, is en assistant U. S. attorney there.

title: SADAT AND GRECHKO CONFER A 2D TIME
description: CAIRO, May 15 (UPI)President Anwar elSadat conferred again today with the Soviet Defense Minister, Marshal Andrei A. Grechko, whose second visit in four months was believed to be linked with supplies of new weapons to the Egyptians.

title: Fanny May Says 25% of Its Federal Mortgages Are in Arrear
description: WASHINGTON, May 15An executive of the Federal National Mortgage Association told a Senate subcommittee today that about 25 per cent of the Governmentinsured mortgages for one  family, to fourfamily houses in New York City held by his company were in arrears.

title: BOARD ASKS MAYOR TO REDRAFT BUDGET
description: After reviewing Mayor Lindsay's $9.988  billion expense budget, with its potential deficit of $530million, the Board of Estimate asked the Mayor yesterday to submit a revised budget.

title: Books of The Times
description: PROJECT FOR A REVOLUTION IN NEW YORK, by Alain RobbeGrillet, translated from the French by Richard Howard. 183 pages. Grove Press. $5.95.

title: Two Plays Are Slated At Pace College in June
description: The American Academy of Dramatic Arts and Pace College will collaborate in the presentation of two plays next month at the college's Schimmel Center for the Arts.

title: FOLK SONGS ENLIVEN MISS SIRBU'S DEBUT
description: Sylvia Sirbu, a soprano from Bucharest, made her New York, debut at Carnegie Recital Hall. Sunday afternoon, her standard program of arias and art songs attractively enhanced by a colorful group of Rumanian folklore pieces.

title: Liquor Industry Is Urged To Aid Alcoholism Fight
description: The director of the National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism appealed here yesterday to the liquor industry for help in combating alcoholism. Dr. Morris E. Chafetz asked for aid in promoting the fundamentals of the responsible use of alcohol, the avoidance of drunkenness and the elimination of the use of alcohol as a problemsolver.

title: French Scientist in Cave Is Proving Man Is Moody
description: DEL RIO, Tex., May 15 (UPI) Michel Siffre, the French Scientist, who has been living alone in an underground cave since February, apparently has proved only that without companionship a man gets moody.

title: War Protests Result in Group Arrests
description: Scattered antiwar protests in college towns and elsewhere Yesterday brought group arrests in Princeton, N.J., and Lebanon and Portsmouth, N.H., and a 15minute sitin on the West Side Highway here during rushhour traffic.

title: Lawyer Is Rejected
description: BALTIMORE, May 15 (AP)Mr. Bremer declined a courtappointed attorney at his hearing. He said that he wished to be represented by the American Civil Liberties Union.

title: Advertising:
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Senator Frank E. Moss, who supports the Federal Trade Commission's controversial proposal that the television airwaves be open to counteradvertising, today accused the White House of attempting to redefine the First Amendment by opposing the proposal.

title: Agnew to Visit Saigon
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 16 (UPI)Vice President Agnew, who is in Tokyo, will make a quick trip to Saigon on Wednesday for discussions with Vietnamese and American leaders on the war situation, Government sources said today.

title: WINDSOR LEWIS, 53, BROADWAY DIRECTOR
description: Windsor Lewis, a. Broadway and Off Broadway director for many years, and the husband of Barbara Bel Geddess the stage star, died yesterday at New York Hospital after a long illness. He was 53 years old and lived with his wife at Putnam Valley, N.Y.

title: U.S. Discloses Mining of Canals in North
description: WASHINGTON, May 15The Pentagon discloged today that the mined waterways in North, Vietnam included rivers and canals.

title: HIGH COURT AFFIRMS FREEING OF MINORS
description: WASHINGTON, May 15 (UPI)The Supreme Court affirmed today a ruling that set aside the conviction of 200 persons classified as wayward minors in New York State. A lower court had held the law under which they were punished to be unconstitutionally vague.

title: Music: Computer's Role
description: Are you ready for the computer as artistic coordinator? On Sunday night's Gallery of New Music in Our Time program at the 92d Street Y.M.Y.W.H.A., a music, dance and light composition that had been generated by a computer at the Bell Telephone Laboratories had its first performance. That may sound repulsive, but it all worked out quite beautifully.

title: HIGH COURT REJECTS HANRAHAN'S APPEAL
description: WASHINGTON, May 15(AP) The Supreme Court rejected today an appeal by Edward V. Hanrahan and 10 police officers facing trial resulting from the slaying of two Black Panther leaders, Fred Hampton and Mark Clark, in a 1969 raid.

title: Knapp Witness on Corruption Accuses Hogan of Persecution
description: Patrolman William R. Phillips testified in Federal Court here yestetday that he was being persecuted by the Manhattan District Attorney's office because of his Knapp Commission disclosures about police corruption.

title: Hostility Toward Jews Decried At Emergency Conference Here
description: I don't like what's happening to me, Elie Weisel, the author, told 1,200 people last night at an Emergency Conference on the New York Jewish Community.

title: Foundations Scored on Lack of Staffs
description: The vast Majority of America's 26,000 foundations have no staffs and distribute funds along the most conventional lines without much effort to respond to society'e urgent, changing needs.

title: To Most Americans, Wallace Is Symbol of Defiance
description: His admirers have called him an indomitable fighter for the best of American tradition. His enemies have labeled him a stubborn opportunist calling up the darkest impulses of the American spirit.

title: U. of Pennsylvania Shortens Name of Wharton School
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 15The University of Pennsylvania has changed the name of its business school and appointed two new deans.

title: AUTO SALES ROSE IN 10DAY PERIOD
description: DETROIT, May 15  The spring carsales boom continued in the first third of May with the four auto manufacturers reporting 254,010 deliveries of United States models, up from 217,619 the year before.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your May 1 editorial To End I.R.A. Terror clearly misses the cause of the present tragedy in Northern Ireland. The Irish people voted in 1912 for a united Ireland, The present partition is at best a bowing to the Westminster economic interests and designed to impoverish the people of Ireland. At worst, it is an acknowledgment that Christians cannot live together as in other Western civilizations.

title: Rogers Attacks Democrats on Mining
description: WASHINGTON, May 15Secretary of State William P. Rogers, his voice rising in anger, today defended the mining of North Vietnam's harbors and said that if the Johnson Administration had taken the step earlier, the war might have ended long ago.

title: PRESSURE GROUPS ANGER ROCKEFELLER
description: ALBANY, May 15Governor Rockefeller charged today that inordinate pressures placed on legislators by judges and lawyers had blocked two of his. vital programscourt reform and nofault insurancein the. 1972 Legislature.

title: U.S. Group Assails Naming Of General's Aide in Paris
description: PARIS, May 15A group of Americans in France protested today the appointment of Brig. Gen. John W. Donaldson as defense attach at the United States Embassy in Paris.

title: Antonioni in Peking
description: PEKING, May 16 (AgenceFrancePresse)The Italian film makei Michelangelo Antonioni arrived here Sunday with an Italian television camera's crew to make a documentary film, it was learned today.

title: Texas Flood Toll at 16
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 16 (AP)The number of known dead in the Gdadalupe River flood increased to, today with the discovery of a rnan's body south of Seguin.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Secretary of the Treasury John Connally suddenly, emerged last week as the new big insider at the White House, and then before you could say oil depletion allowance, he was out. It was all a little odd: they didn't even hold the announcement long enough to give poor George Wallace his day of tragic glory.

title: F.D.I.C. Head Backs Lifting Interest Lid
