description: ATLANTA, May 16 (AP)The chairman of the Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation, Frank Wille, endorsed today the removal of interest ceilings on deposits. He said it would force banks to compete with the rates available through direct market investments.

title: Dr. Reuben Finkelstein Dead; A Gastroenterologist Here, 88
description: Dr. Reuben Finkelstein, a gastroenterologist who had practiced for 65 years and was a consultant to the Metropolitan Jewish Geriatric Center, the Kingsbrook Jewish Medical Center and the Brookdale Hospital Center, died of heart failure yesterday at the Brookdale Hospital. He was 88 years old and lived at 41 Eastern Parkway, Brooklyn.

title: SPIRITS ARE GOOD
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., May 16Gov. George C. Wallace was removed from the critical list today, but two Alabama doctors treating him at a hospital here said he would require additional surgery for the removal of a bullet lodged against his spine and apparently causing paralysis from his hips down.

title: Texas Again Sets Oil Output at 100%
description: AUSTIN, Tex., May 16Texas oil wells will continue in June to produce as much as they can without causing waste or the threat of saltwater pollution.

title: BURGER SUGGESTS JUSTICE INSTITUTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Chief Justice Warren E. Burger said today that consideration should be given to the creation of a national institute of justice, patterned after the National Institutes of Health, to help solve Federal and state judicial problems.

title: Laker General Manager Will Replace King in Basketball Post
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (AP)  Fred Schaus, who helped build the Los Angeles Lakers into champions of the National Basketball Association, said today he was returning to college coaching with Purdue University.

title: Air Force Relieved Its Vietnam Chief For Irregularities
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters)The commander of the United States Seventh Air Force in Vietnam was relieved of his post because of irregularities in the conduct of his command responsibilities, it was announced here today.

title: Woman Named to Price Unit
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Dr. Mary Hamilton, an associate professor of finance at Loyola University in Chicago, was sworn in today as the lone woman on the sevenmember Price COmmission.

title: Moscow Soccer Team Plays Cosmos in Visit Here June 10
description: After long negotiations, Moscow Dynamo, 10 times the soccer champion of the Soviet Union, has agreed to play the New York Cosmos Saturday night, June 10, at Hofstra field in Hempstead, L. I.

title: Fillmore Film Delayed As 12 Rating Is Appealed
description: The opening here today of Fillmore, a documentary film about the West Coast rock showcase and its impresario, Bill Graham, has been canceled by 20th CenturyFox, the distributors, pending an appeal of its R rating.

title: Wallace's Rivals Set To Resume Campaign
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Taking their cue from the attitude of their wounded rival, Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, the other candidates for the Democratic Presidential nomination prepared tonight to resume active campaigning.

title: 120 War Protesters Are Seized Over SitIn at Capitol's Rotunda
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 With the sounds of antiwar and religious songs echoing through the Rotunda, about 120 persons were arrested here today when they refused to end a sitin in the Capitol.

title: Senate Panel Votes Bucher 14Year Term on Reserve
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) The Senate Banking Committee today approved 131, the nomination of Jeffrey M. Bucher. Los Angeles banker, to serve a 14year term on the Federal Reserve Board.

title: Police Suspect Governor Was Stalked
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 Federal agents and the local police were investigating today the possibility that the 21yearold suspect arrested yesterday in the shooting of George C. Wallace had stalked the Alabama Governor for at least several days.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISThe distant and exotic island republic of Madagascar seems to be in the throes of some kind of revolution and while most Americans know little of that distant land and it ranks very low in the world power hierarchy, what happens there is important.

title: Paultz Provides High Points for the Nets
description: UNIONDALE, L. I., May 16 Billy Paultz is a 6foot11inch 240pounder. Ever shim he left St. John's University with a season of, eligibility remaining to sign with the New York Nets, there was no doubt he was big enough to play tenter in the American Basketball Association.

title: South Africa Sees No Need To Sell Full Output of Gold
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Africa, May 16South Africa's balanceofpayments position is now so good that the country no longer needs to sell her full gold production on the free market, the governor of the reserve bank, Dr. Theunis de Jongh, said here today.

title: Mets Seaver Beats Expos, 73; Yanks 31 Victors Over Indians
description: The New York Mets made it five in a row last night by defeating the Montreal Expos, 73, in another galloping performance at Shea Stadium.

title: Soviet Unit of 8 Warships Is Reported Off Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON. May 16 Two Soviet flotillas comprising eight naval vessels have joined forces 200 miles east of the Vietnamese coast Administration officials disclosed today.

title: Bernhard Gristede Dead; Grocery Chain Executive
description: Bernhard Gristede, who retired as treasurer of the Gristede Brothers grocery chain in 1961, died Monday night in New Rochelle (N. Y.) Hospital. Mr. Gristede, who lived at 172 Rose Hill Avenue in New Rochelle, was 69 years old.

title: U.S. SAYS PLANES CUT BIG FUEL LINE TO FOE IN SOUTH
description: SAIGON; South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 17The United States command said yesterday that air strikes over the last five days had cut North Vietnam's main fuel pipeline to the South by destroying all its pumping stations in the southern panhandle.

title: Connecticut Assembly Weighs Strict Abortion Bill
description: HARTFORD, May 16  The Connecticut General Assembly, summoned today to a special session to pass a bill on abortion, was handed one that would make abortion illegal except to save the mother's life.

title: Country Belle Takes Mile
description: Picking her way cleverly through a cluster in front of her in the stretch drive, Country Belle of the Calumet Farm won the feature race at, Belmont Park yesterday. Angel Cordero steered the daughter of Herbager to a 1length triumph over Kings Peace in the onemile test for 3yearold fillies.

title: Two in Carolina Jail Are Sought For Questioning in Police Deaths
description: Local and Federal authorlties said yesterday that a black couple arrested May 5 in Columbia, S. C., and charged with the illegal possession of firearms were also wanted for questioning in connection with the murder of two policemen in the East Village earlier this year.

title: Japan Payments Surplus Up
description: TOKYO, May 16 (AP)Japan had an estimated balanceofpayments surplus of $160million in April, up from a $118million net inflow in March but sharply lower than the $421million surplus recorded in the yearearlier month, the Finance Ministry said today.

title: Wallace's Wife Remains SelfPossessed
description: WASHINGTON, May 16From the moment George C. Wallace was gunned down and gravely wounded yesterday in a Maryland shopping center, his striking, blackhaired wife, Cornelia, has displayed courage, selfpossession and an instinct to protect her husband.

title: BuildingTrades Talks Falter As Agreements Here. Near End
description: Buildingtrades unions representing 255,000 workers in the metropolitan area are seeking higher wages and shorter contracts in critical negotiations that are expected to reach a climax by the time current contracts expire on June 30.

title: M'Govern Leads in Utah and Colorado
description: DENVER, May 16With a sweep of precinct caucus meetings in Colorado and Utah, Senator George McGovern seemed assured today of the lion's share of the 55 delegate votes of the two states at the Democratic National Convention.

title: Payments Deficit Narrows in Quarter
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The United States balance of international payments, by two of the four measures used, showed a marked improvement in the first quarter of this year but remained in substantial deficit, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: WALLACE OFF THE CRITICAL LIST; SWEEPS PRIMARY IN MICHIGAN AND WINS HANDILY IN MARYLAND
description: DETROIT, May 16George C. Wallace won his first election in the North tonight, sweeping the Michigan Democratic Presidential primary with massive support from Republican and independent voters.

title: Zaire Leader Ends Fight With Church; Cardinal to Return
description: KINSHASA, Zaire, May 16 (Agence FrancePresse)President Mobutu Sese Seko ended a fourmonth conflict with the Roman Catholic Church yesterday wilen he authorized the Archbishop of Kinshasa to return from Rome.

title: Cards trade Guzman
description: ST. LOUIS, May 16 (AP)The St. Louis Cardinals today traded a pitcher, Santiago Guzman, to the Chicago White Sox farm club at Tucson for Lowell Palmer, also a pitcher. Palmer was assigned to Tulsa.

title: Federal Judge Rules That State Must Allow Prisoner Interviews
description: BUFFALO, May 16Federal Judge. John T. Curtin ruled today that state correction officials must permit newsmen to interview willing inmates unless there was a clear and present danger of the breech of the security or orderly administration of the facility.

title: 2 Parks Closed to Cars Some Weekday Nights
description: With the advent of warm weather bringing bicyclists and strollers to the parks later at night, the Parks Department announced yesterday that automobile traffic in Central and Prospect Parks would be banned on certain weekday evenings.

title: N.A.A.C.P. Aide Found Slain in Bronx Apartment
description: Frederick D. Jones, president of Eduforce, Inc., and New York City regional director of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People, was found dead in his apartment yesterday apparently a stabbing victim.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Committee on Colonialism 3 P.M.; subcommittee on Pacific Ocean territoriesupon adjournment of committee as a whole.

title: N.A.A.C.P. LEAVES NEW BLACK GROUP
description: The National Association for the Advancement of Colored People announced yesterday that it had withdrawn from involvement and association with the National Black Political Convention because of a difference in ideology.

title: Jockeys, Drivers Face BreathAnalysis Tests
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (AP)Jockeys and harnesshorse drivers on Illinois tracks may soon be required to take breathanalysis tests for intoxication, similar to those given motorists suspected of drunkenness.

title: Cookbook With Musical Beat Is Served Up by Bennington
description: Music From Bennington, the program at Carnegie Recital Hall on Monday night, had the informal agreeable atmosphere of a family gathering. Faculty and students from Bennington College in Vermont mingled as composers and performers, with the teachers bearing their responsibilities like true amateurs, in love with their work.

title: City Master Plan Denounced By Rickles as No Plan at All
description: The city's Master Plan is illegal and will be challenged in the court on environmental grounds, Robert N. Rickles, the city's former Air Pollution Control Commissioner, told the City Planning Commission last night.

title: Frenchmen Go on Trial Here On DrugSmuggling Charges
description: Two Frenchmen, their extradition from Italy ruled legal, went on trial here yesterday, accused of being members of 3293million heroinsmuggling ring.

title: Children Thrown to Freeway
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (AP) A woman threw her sons, ages 9 and 5, from an overpass onto the crowded lanes of the Harbor Freeway and then jumped after them, police said. The authorities said Anna L. Johnson, 32 years old, and her son, Daniel, 9, were seriously injured and John, 5, was Critically injured.

title: Soviet Vessels Visited
description: CAIRO, May 16 (Reuters)The official Middle East News Agency reported that Marshal Grechko and the Egyptian War Minister, Gen. Mohammed Sadek, inspected Soviet submarines and warships at Alexandria today.

title: Wallice Suspect's Brother Reported Named in Fraud
description: TULSA, Okla., May 16 The Federal authorities here, today identified William Allen Bremer, brother of Arthur H. Bremer, the suspect in the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, as the operator of an alleged reducing salon swindle.

title: LEONARD VICTOR
description: SELDEN, L. I., May 16Leonard Victor, a reporterphotographer for The Long Island Press, died in his sleep today at his home, 11 Laurel Drive. He was 55 years old.

title: CORNELIUS A. WOOD, BANKER, 78, IS DEAD
description: Cornelius Ayer Wood, a banker and realty executive who earlier had served as vice president of the American Woolen Company, the corporation founded by his father, William M. Wood, died Saturday of a heart attack at the family estate, Arden, in Andover, Mass. He was 78 years old.

title: Agnew Arrives in Saigon For Meeting With Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 17 (Reuters) Vice President Agnew anrived in Saigon today for brief talks with President Nguyen Van Thieu of South Vietnam and American commanders.

title: Prices on Amex Decline Late in Session
description: Stock prices eased yesterday on the American Stock Exchange.

title: GALBRAITH MAY RUN FOR BROOKE'S SEAT
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., May 16 (UPI)John Kenneth Galbraith, the Harvard economist, has confirmed that he would run for the Senate against Senator Edward W. Brooke, Reiniblican of Massachusetts, under certain conditions.

title: Gen. Walker Leads Vigil For Wallace
description: DALLAS, May 16 (UPI)Police arrested retired Maj. Gen. Edwin A. Walker in a park early today for violating a curfew by holding a prayer vigil for Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama.

title: Report of Fixed Exacta Disputed by Trot Sleuth
description: Harness racing's top investigator took issue yesterday with published statements that an exacta race at Yonkers Raceway last June 7 was fixed.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I take it from your story of April 18 and from other developments that the National Park Service as we have known It is doomed to virtual extinction and that we might as well from now on forget the basic law which, established our National Park System.

title: Safe and Sane Campaigns
description: The appalling attack on Gov. George C. Wallace already evoking a flood of sociological comment, some of it probably valid, but most of it too abstract to serve the overriding need of the moment. That need is to make it physically safe for men to campaign for high office and to govern when they attain itin short, to carry on the processes of democratic government. The situation calls less for theorizing than for a hard look some pertinent aspects of recent assaults on public figures and some decisive steps to prevent their repetition.

title: SMOKE VIOLATIONS LAID TO CON EDISON
description: Fred C. Hart, the city's Air Resources Commissioner, said yesterday that his agency had served Consolidated Edison with violation notices for not moving quickly enough to install smoke monitoring devices an 27 boilers and stacks.

title: Senate Republicans Push Kleindienst's Nomination
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Senate Republicans adopted a resolution today asking that the nomination of Richard G. Kleindienst to be Attorney General be brought up for action at the earliest possible time.

title: Sketch Depicts Suspect in Slaying
description: A Police Department artist's sketch of a man wanted for the slaying last Saturday of the wife of a Brooklyn textile executive was circulated yesterday.

title: ADDICTS SHUNNING ROCKLAND CENTER
description: POMONA, N. Y., May 16Summit House is a ninemonthold therapeutic community for the young drug addicts of Rockland County. Its spotless rooms are bright and sunny. It has color television and stereo and acres of grounds. Its residents proclaim its success with the fervor of the saved.

title: FUTURES PRICES ON SILVER CLIMB
description: Supported mainly by commission house and local short covering, which was brought about by the higher prices on the London market and the strength in gold, silver futures finished only slightly off their highs yesterday on the Commodity Exchange here.

title: Top Israel Labor Figure Rescinds His Resignation
description: TEL AVIV, May 16Yitzhak BenAharon, who resigned Sunday as Secretary General of Israel's powerful General Federation of Labor, announced tonight that he was resuming office.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Pierre Cardin provided the derringdo while Donald Brooks and Mollie Parnis supplied the elegance in the latest round of fall fashion openings on Seventh Avenue.

title: Bonwit Teller Will Honor American Express Cards
description: The American Express Money Card will be honored in all the Bonwit Teller stores as a result of an agreement reached by Bonwit, a subsidiary of Genesco, Inc and the American Express Company.

title: Protests at Seminary Here
description: About 15 students from Union Theological Seminary staged a sitin the offices of the Episcopal Military Bishop yesterday at the Episcopal Church Center, 815 Second Avenue.

title: Mills Sees Possible Trim Of $13Billion in U.S. Deficit
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) This year's Federal deficit may turn out $13billion less than anticipated, Representative Wilbur D. Mills, chairman of the House Ways and Means Committee, testified today.

title: Workfare Mirage
description: One of the hardiest illusions in legislative halls that the mountainous burden of public welfare would melt to anthill proportions if relief recipients could only be made to work. Fresh doubt is cast on that theory's validity by the microscopic impact of the law New York State adopted a year ago requiring ablebodied persons On welfare to pick up their relief checks at state employment centers and to take available jobs or training.

title: G. LANSING FARRINGTON
description: G. Lansing Farrington, a retired food broker here, died Monday night in Southside Hospital, Bay Shore, L. I., after a long illness. He was 86 years old. His wife, the former Adele DeWitt Clinton, died in 1963.

title: BEACH WILL STAR IN PARK HAMLET
description: Stacy Keach, Colleen Dewhunt and James Earl Jones will costar in the New York Shakespeare Festival production of Hamlet, which will be offered free at the Delacorte Theater in Central Park for three and half weeks starting June 28.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: As the military debacle accelerates in Vietnam, desperate elements among the top military brass intensify their efforts to convince Americans that the war could have been won were it not for the defeatist influences of an assortment of unpatriotic activists. This is the Pentagon's equivalent of the stabintheback myth so artfully manipulated by the German General Staff to the ultimate advantage of German fascism.

title: Association of Professors Request Kent State Inquiry
description: KENT, Ohio, May 16 (UPI)The American Association of University Professors has asked President Nixon to call for a federal grand jury investigation into the killing of four Kent State university students by National Guard troops on May 4, 1970.

title: The Stage: Van Peebles
description: Melvin Van Peebles, actor, singer, film director, writer, lyricist; composer, theater director and publicist supreme, is continuing the Blacking of Broadway. Last night, at the Ethel Barrymore Theater, his new comedy musical, Dont Play Us Cheap, arrived with the joyous air of a Saturday night block party.

title: Yugoslav Train Crash Kills 7
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, May 16 (UPI)A passenger train derailed and collided with a freight train today, killing seven persons and injuring scores of others, the Yugoslac, press agency Tanjug reported.

title: Vote by 76 Panel Perils a U.S. Expo
description: BOSTON, May 16Prospects for a 1976 world's fair in the United States were all but buried today.

title: Federal Grand Jury Set to Investigate Penn Central Road
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16 (UPI)A Federal grand jury will begin an investigation tomorrow into the collapse of the Penn Central Railroad.

title: Chicago Tribune Seeks to Bar Subpoenaing of Reporters
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (UPI)Lawyers for The Chicago Tribune have attempted to quash grand jury subpeonas served on six Tribune reporters for their investigative series on voter fraud.

title: ARTHUR F. G. RAIKES
description: Arthur F. G. Raikes, who retired in 1962 as a vice president of the Bemis Company, which manufactures plastics and paper products, died Monday at New York Hospital. He was 74 years old and lived at 325 East 72d Street.

title: Wallace Opponents and Supporters Denounce His Shooting and Deplore Violence
description: Opponents and supporters of Gov. George C. Wallace joined yesterday to condemn the shooting of the Alabamian and to deplore the growing tendency toward violence In American politics.

title: Bonn Opposition Splits 3 Ways On Soviet and Polish Treaties
description: BONN, May 16  On the eve of the scheduled vote in the West German lower house on ratification of friendship treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland, the conservative opposition split today into three groups over the issue.

title: CHESTER T. MINKLER, DEVISED NAVY BOMB
description: NEWPORT, R. I., May 16 (AP)Chester T. Minkler, inventor of a depth bomb used against German submarines in World War I, died today. He was 89 years old.

title: Suspect, to Neighbors, Was Withdrawn Loner
description: MILWAUKEE, May 16Cheer up, Oswald white collar conservative, middle class Republican suburbanite robot  a thunder of hooves and out of the western sky comes the colored man.

title: Anger and Remorse Subside in the South
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 16Today was just an average day in Alabama, and for that matter in the rest of the South.

title: You Don't Have to Be a Man To Learn Art of Wine Tasting
description: Beaujolais, said Paul Kovi, is like a pretty young girl; lovely hair, beautiful features, bright smilebut no sex.

title: INDUSTRY OUTPUT IN NATION SURGES
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Industrial production rose strongly in April, and the increase was the biggest for any month in the brisk expansion that began last September, the Federal Reserve Board reported today.

title: Sports of The Times.
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 16The Phillies are running second in the National League East, and while this may not be quite so hard to credit as the performance of the San Diego Padres, it is not the sort of thing that happens every spring. For the benefit of clients who have been living in a cave, it should be mentioned that the Padres, who consolidated their position as the worst team in baseball by losing 309 games in their first three years, have won oftener this season than the Giants, Braves, Cardinals, Cubs, Yankees, Red Sox, Angels, Royals, Rangers or Brewers, and just as often as the Pirates, Orioles or Reds. The big story in this town, though, is the Phillies, and one of the biggest things about them is a young stranger named Gerg Luzinski, who hates late hours.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: Israeli Withdrawal Asked
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 16 (Reuters)The United Nations third Conference on Trade and Development tonight approved a resolution, 70 to 0 with 37 abstentions, saying that Israeli withdrawal from occupied Arab territories was a prerequisite for the reopening of the Suez Canal.

title: Argentine Concerns Accept Voluntary Price Controls
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 16The Government unveiled a plan today to protect wage earners from soaring inflation through voluntary price controls by business.

title: Earnings of Penney Rose 19% in First Period
description: Stockholders of the J. C. Penney Company were told at the annual meeting in Atlanta yesterday that net income in the first quarter, ended April 29, rose 19:2 per cent to $19,786,312; or 35 cents a share, from $16,600,833, or 31 cents, in the corresponding quarter of 1971. Sales, as previously reported; increased to $1;106,028,888) from $967,616,973; William M. Batten, chairman, said the most significant factor in the earnings growth was the leverage provided by increased sales volume coupled with strict expense control.

title: DIRECTED ACQUITTAL URGED IN DAVIS TRIAL
description: SAN 30SE, Calif., May 16 Judge Richard E. Arneson was asked today to direct a verdict of acquittal in the murder, kidnapping and conspiracy trial of Angela Davis.

title: APAWAIES TAKES DITERCLUB CROWN
description: WHITE PLAINS, May 16Apawamis Club of Westchester won the Women's Metropolitan Golf. Association intersectional team matches today by defeating Piping Rock of Long Island and Montclair of New Jersey.

title: I.T.T. Denies in Chile Plot to Block Allende
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 16 (UPI)The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation denied today for the first time in Chile that it plotted to prevent the inauguration of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: 20% RISE FEARED IN CARBON DIOXIDE
description: UPTON, L. I.; May 16The continuecluse of fossil fuels at projected levels will mean a 20 per Cent increase in the amount of carbon dioxide in the earth's atmosphere by the year 2000, a leading meteorologist predicied today.

title: Daley Asks Handgun Curb
description: CHICAGO, May 16 (UPI)Mayor Richard J. Daley urged today that Congress do some soul searching on legislation to outlaw handguns in the wake of the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama. Describing the shooting as a tragedy in American society, Mr. Daley said, I would hope this would be the opportunity to do some soul searching by the Congress to pass legislation to outlaw handguns.

title: WIDER SCHOOL SUIT SOUGHT BY BOSTON
description: BOSTON, May 16 (AP)The Boston School Committe has directed its counsel to ask the United States District Court to include 65 cities and towns within a 35mile radius of Boston as codefendants with the committee in a school desegregation suit.

title: U.S. REBUFFS REDS ON PARIS MEETING
description: PARIS, May 16The Vietnamese Communists proposed today that the Paris peace conference resume on Thursday. The United States promptly refused to attend.

title: New Yorker Dies in Vietnam
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)The Defense Department today identified a serviceman from. New York state who died in Vietnam last week as a result of hostile action. He was Harold J. Faldemeyer, an Army captain from Stony Point.

title: STOCK PRICES DIP IN QUIET TRADING
description: The stock market finished slightly lower from Monday's close in continued quiet trading yesterday.

title: McGovern Now Leads In a New York TV Poll
description: Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, who trailed Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota in a simiar April poll, has taken a clear lead over him in a poll of New York State Democrats this month, WCBSTV News said yesterday.

title: Church Seeks $10Million
description: The 114 Presbyterian churches in New York City announced yesterday a drive to raise $10million for churchoperated social service projects. Of the total, $4million is to be raised in the next three years from the churches 40,000 members. Horace. B. B. Robinson, chairman of the steering committee for the fund, said that the Mission for the 70's was the first citywide project to be undertaken by the entire Presbytery of New York City.

title: Bridge:
description: The fourth World Team Olympiad, which begins in three weeks in Miami Beach, will offer the United States a good chance of winning two major world titles for the first time. the open title has been won once by France and twice by the Italian Blue Team, and the Italians will no doubt start as favorites.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Having returned recently from the Southern Sudan, I should like to add a postscript to the news report [March 24] that told of the ending of hostilities between the Government forces and the AnyaNya [the Southern Sudanese guerrilla forces].

title: 3 Safe in Copter Crash
description: HANOVER, N. H., May 16 (Reuters)Three men escaped serious injury today when their National Guard helicopter crashed into a power line and fell into the Connecticut River while searching for a missing Dartmouth College student. The airmen were looking for the body of Ignatio Flerro, 18 years old, of Madrid, Spain. He disappeared May 8 when his canoe overturned.

title: Dead in Idaho Mine Called Industrial Murder Victims
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) Representative Ken Hechler, charged today that the 91 men who died in the Sunshine silver mine disaster in Idaho had been victims of industrial murder, and that the Bureau of Mines had maintained a cozy relationship with the industry which dictates that profits are more important than the lives and safety of the men.

title: STRIKE OUT PICK IN STAKE FRIDAY
description: YONKERS, May 16Who's afraid of Strike Out? might have been this morning's battle call of 10 trainers and drivers as they dropped. $2,000 checks into the entry box to cover the starting fees for their charges in Friday night's Cane Pace, the first leg in the series for the triple crown of pacing.

title: The Southeast Asian Connection
description: BANGKOK, ThailandThe world's attention in recent months has been turned toward the MideastTurkey, principallyas the source of illicit supplies of heroin. But the fact is that the fabled Fertile Triangle of Southeast Asia  Thailand, Burma and Laoscontinues to produce twothirds of the world's known supply of opium, from which heroin is derived.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH. DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 80.0 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord. Ltd., Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: Fanny May Lists Drop In 4Month Commitments
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (Reuters)Bids for fourmonth commitments of Federal Housing Association and Veterans Administration home mortgages declined at the May 15 auction, while the average yield remained unchanged, the Federal National Mortgage Association announced today.

title: Australia Leads India, 2.0, In RainDelayed Cup Tennis
description: BANGLAORE India, May 16 (AP)Australia took a 20 lead over India at the raindelayed start of the Eastern Zone Davis Cup tennis final today.

title: Occidental Petroleum
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (AP)  The Occidental Petroleum Corporation reported today lower earnings for the first quarter of 1972 and said it had developed a battery that could power a mediumsmall car for 100 miles without recharging.

title: Peggy Wood Wins A Strawhat Award. For Theater Work
description: Peggy. Wood, who recently celebrated her 80th birthday as well as more than 60 years in the legitimate theater, was the, recipient yesterday, of the third annual Strawhat Achievement Award. It was presented by the Council of Stock Theaters, comprising major summer theaters in the country, in association with Faberge, Inc., the cosmetic concern.

title: Presbyterians Elect Rutgers Professor as. Moderator
description: DENVER, May 16C. WilHard Heckel, a professor and former dean of the Rutgers University Law School was elected today to be Moderator of the 184th General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A.

title: Ezinicki in Trio With 68's In Opener of Dodge Golf
description: DENVILLE, N. J., May 16Bill Ezinicki of Topsfield, Mass., Babe Lichardus of Shackamax on and Emery Thomas of Green Brook fired 35, 3368's today to share the lead after the opening round of the $25,000 Dodge open at the Rockaway River Country Club.

title: N.Y.U. Heights Faculty Chafes at Sale of Campus
description: Students and faculty members at New York University's School of Engineering and Science are angry and worried over the State Legislature's au thorizing Bronx Community College to buy N.Y.U.'s University Heights campus in the Bronx.

title: A Rare New Work Played by Quartet
description: If an unsuspecting listener had strayed into Alice Tully Hall Monday night during the second piece on the Concord String Quartet's program he might have been startled to hear what sounded like a lost work of Mahler. Or Beethoven. Or Ives. Or Bartok. Or Stravinsky. Or, rather, all of them rolled together.

title: National and Local Programing To Be Reorganized at WNET
description: WNET/Channel 13 plans to announce a major reorganization of its national and local programing units later this week. Staff reductions are also expected.

title: Miami Mayor Confident
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 16 (Reuters)Miami Beach's Mayor Chuck Hall said today that the assassination attempt on Gov. George C. Walace would have no effect on security for the two major party conventions this summer. Mayor Hall emphasized that, he wanted people to be able to exercise their right to dissent. I think there should be demonstrations, as long as there's no violence, he said. If they get out of hand, I'll sit on them personally.

title: Governor Signs Bill to Spur Sex Equality in Schools
description: ALBANY, May 16 Governor Ro.ckefeller today signed into law, a bill designed to promote sex equality in public schools, including the increased mixing of girls and boys in sports.

title: Major Field Hit
description: SAIGON, May 16 (AP)The United States command, in its summary of the results of a week of air strikes, said Air Force F4 jets had attacked No'th Vietnam's main air defense complex at Bachmal airfield three miles south of Hanol destroying several structures.

title: Polluted Town Doesn't Want to Move
description: EL PASO, May 16The school bus stops across the highway from the towering 828foothigh smokestack of the American Smelting and Refining Company plant. Out rush the children of Smeltertown, an 85yearold community of adobe homes of some 120 poor MexicanAmerican families. The children run down the dirt streets, playing like healthy kids anywhere.

title: Murcer Breaks Hitless Spell With Single
description: CLEVELAND, May 16After 22 times at bat without a hit, Bobby Murcer singled in the fifth inning tonight and started a threerun uprising that carried the New York Yankees to a 31 victory over the Cleveland Indians before a customary meager crowd of 6,377.

title: Confidence on Kontum
description: PLEIKU, South Vietnam, May 16Allied officers feel increasingly confident that it is possible that the city of Kontum in the Central Highlands can be held against an expected assault by the North Vietnamese Army.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Chairman Arthur F. Burns of the Federal Reserve Board, in his Montreal speech of last Friday, laid down 10 essentials of international monetary reform. But John B. Connally who resigned yesterday as Secretary of the Treasury, did not regard Dr. Burns's principles as being in quite the same class as the 10 Commandments that Moses brought down from Mount Sinai the Treasury view was that, Dr. Burns's Montreal speech was a succession of platitudes. The, Burnsian, decalogue, enjoins the, United States, the European Common Market countries, Britain and Japan, as follows:

title: Man in the News
description: George Pratt Shultz, the man named yesterday by President Nixon to succeed John B. Connally as Secretary of the Treasury, is now back where he started financially when he came to Washington in 1969  but far ahead in prestige.

title: Jean Stapleton Hopes Most Wives Aren't Like Edith
description: Mrs. Archie Bunker, better known as Edith, is probably America's most famous housewife. She is also the antithesis of women's liberation, a slowwitted, oppressed dingbat who lives in a working class neighborhood in Queens.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Treasury. President Nixon announced the resignation of Secretary of the Treasury John B. Connally, who will return to private life. The President nominated the director of the Office of Management and Budget, George P. Shultz, to succeed him.

title: State Mediation Chief Quits To Enter Private Practice
description: Meyer Drucker, 54yearold director of mediation for the State Mediation Board, has resigned and joined the law firm of Howard F. Cerny, 345 Park Avenue, with offices in Washington and London.

title: News Analysis
description: In the final hours of the 1972 session last week the State Legislature passed, without debate or publicity, a measure that could have some important implications for New York straphangers.

title: Max M. Zimmerman, an Expert On Supermarkets, Is Dead at 82
description: Max M. Zimmerman, an expert on supermarkets, died yesterday morning at his home, 88 Central Park West, after a long illness. He was 82 years old.

title: Five Die as Home Burns
description: NEWTON, Mass., May 16 (AP)  A father and four children died early today when fire swept their twostory brick home. Those killed were Francis Tesoro Sr., 42 years did, his sons Vincent, 17, and Francis Jr., 6, and two daughters, Maria, 14, and Frances, 10. Mr. Tesoro's wife, Marie, and another son, Michael, 15, escaped.

title: Einstein College Names Jaffe
description: Dr. Ernst R. Jaffe, professor of medicine and head of the division of hematology at the Albert Einstein College of Medicine, has been named acting dean of the Medical School, Dr. Samuel Belkin, president of Yeshiva University, announced yesterday. Dr. Jaffe has served Einstein College since its inception in 1955.

title: The Gate's D'Lugoff Holds BenefitFor Himself
description: There was especially sweet Music from Art D'Lugoff's place on Monday night. It was another benefit evening at the Village Pate, his Bleecker Street night spot, but a unique one: a $25ahead affair for the benefit of Mr. D'Lugoff himself.

title: Twentieth CenturyFox
description: LOS ANGELES, May 16 (Reuters)The Twentieth CenturyFox Film Corporation's banks have extended the company's $80million loan agreement concluded last October to five years from three years and reduced the interest rate by onequarter of a percentage point, Dennis Stanfil, chairman, told the annual meeting today.

title: MORE U.S.O. DEALINGS IN VIETNAM CHARGED
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Representative Leslie Aspin, Democrat of Wisconsin, read into the Congressional Record today what he said was the last of his four interviews with former United Service Organizations employes, which purported to detail fraud and other abuses by U. S. 0. personnel in South Vietnam.

title: Drop Is Reported in Thefts of Cargo at Kennedy
description: A Treasury Department official said yesterday that the tide is turning in the fight against cargo thefts in international commerce.

title: Polish Church's Feud With State Shows No Letup
description: WARSAW, May 16One of the most enduring issues of postwar Polish life has been the struggle between the Communist Government and the Roman Catholic Church. Lately it has appeared as if this struggle might endure well beyond a negotiated accord.

title: Mr. Connally Resigns
description: As Secretary of the Treasury, John B. Connally stood out in a rather drab Cabinet for his flair, drive and lack of reverence for ideology. President Nixon, whose running mate he may now become, credits him with having been chief architect of his New Economic Policythe dramatic turnabout which caused a reluctant Administration to embrace wageprice controls, cut the dollar loose from gold and slash taxes, especially on business.

title: Shootout at Lydda
description: Israel cheered last week when Israeli paratroopers, disguised as mechanics, burst into a captured Belgian airliner at Lydda Airport to free ninety passengers and ten crew members who had been held hostage for 23 hours. In a short but wild gun battle, the tough paratroopers killed two Palestisian guerrilla gunmen and captured two female accomplices, wounding one.

title: About Motor Sports
description: The average speed for the first 12 qualifiers for this year's Indianapolis 500 is 183.980 miles an hour for the required 10mile run, which is a thumping 10.869 m.p.h. faster than the average for the 12 fastest starters of 1971. Bobby Unser's record 195.940 m.p.h. for those four laps around the 2 mile speedwayis an incredible 17.244 m.p.h. faster than the previous rec ord of 178,696. Eleven of the 12 drivers who made the field Sunday broke the old qualifying record and at least 10 more should beat it again when time trials are resumed next weekend. Where has all this new speed come from in just one year? Carbuilders drivers and Indy railbirds agree on three sources: sleeker aerodynamics, more horsepower and the new treadless tire.

title: Murphy Says He Was Appalled By Police Graft He Found in 70
description: In an extraordinary private memorandum, Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy has said that when he was appointed Police Commissioner in 1970, he was astonished and appalled by the corruption and lack of discipline he found in the department.

title: Human Error Studied as a Factor in Blast Fatal to
description: Human error in gauging steam pressure is one of several possible factors being studied by a board investigating the explosion that killed seven persons May 3 at 80 Pine Street, Joseph Stem, commissioner of Buildings, said yesterday.

title: President Signs Legislation On Sickle Cell Anemia Aid
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) President Nixon signed today legislation intensifying efforts to find a cure for sickle cell anemia and providing new assistance for its victims.

title: $5,000 in Meat Hijacked
description: A refrigerated trailertruck containing meat products worth $5,000 was hijacked early yesterday in downtown Manhattan, the police reported. The unidentified driver of the trailertruck was taken to a panel truck by three of five men who had confronted him and was driven to Linden Boulevard and Sheffield Avenue on the East New York section of Brooklyn. He was released, unharmed.

title: URUGUAYANS EXTEND WAR ON GUERRILLAS
description: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 16 (AP)President Juan M. Bordaberry signed a declaration today extending Uruguay's internal war against the leftist Tupamaro guerrillas four 45 days.

title: OZITE LIFTS PRICES FOR CARPET ITEMS
description: The Ozite Corporation announced yesterday that it would raise prices on many carpet products. They will go into effect on May 26, and will range from 1 per cent to 7.5 per cent.

title: UNESCO Chief Is Rebuked On Decision to Oust Czech
description: GENEVA, May 16Rene Maheu, the Director General of the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization, has been rebuked by an international administrative tribunal for refusing to renew the contract of a Czechoslovak member of the agency's staff.

title: Adertising:
description: On the eve of its annual meeting the J. Walter Thompson Company, largest advertising agency both worldwide and domestically, announced the election of Dan Seymour as chairman and of Henry M. Schachte as president and chief operating officer.

title: DR. DEAN BRIMHALL, ROCK ART EXPERT, 85
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 16Dr. Dean R. Brimhall, a selftaught expert on the prehistoric rock art of the Southwest, died on Sunday at the age of 85.

title: Premier's Presence Blankets Pyongyang
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea, May 16In the entrance hall to Pyongyang's Kim Il Sung University there is a large statue of Korea's leader. On the second floor there is a sequence of 10 separate rooms, each devoted to a phase of the Premier's life and achievements, particularly those pertaining to the university. And the visitor is informed that the university was founded personally by the Premier on Oct. 3, 1946.

title: BEANIE ESTIMATES LOANABUSE COST
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame said yesterday that landlords and developers using the scandalridden Municipal Loan Program owed the city more than $3.7million in mortgage payments and had defaulted on loans totaling $25.4million.

title: NEWSWEEK CHARGED WITH SEX BIAS BY SO
description: Fifty women editorial employes at Newsweek magazine filed a complaint yesterday with the Federal Equal Employment Opportunity, Commission charging the magazine with job discrimination against women.

title: Jack Anderson Is Honored By Bill of Rights Foundation
description: Jack Anderson, the syndicated columnist, was honored last evening at a testimonial dinner at the New York Hilton Hotel by the Bill of Rights Foundation.

title: Senator Jordan Seeks North Carolina Runoff
description: RALEIGH, N. C., May 16Senator B. Everett Jordan formally called today for a runoff Democratic primary June 3 against Representative Nick Galifianakis, who came within 1 per cent of a majority in the first primary May 6.

title: F.T.C. is Attacked
description: WASHINGTON, May 16Dr. Yale Brozen, who has recently been the most outspoken critic of the Federal. Trade Commission as well as a consultant to one of its targets, launched another attack here today before a sympathetic audiencerepresentatives of the advertising industry.

title: Cary Grant and Baroness Get $70,000 for Car Crash
description: Cary Grant and Baroness Gratia von Furstenberg won $70,000 settlement in their suit for damages arising out of an accident on the Long Island Expressway in March, 1968.

title: DAY'S TRADING BRISK ON MONETARY BOARD
description: Trading opened yesterday on the International Monetary Marketthe new currency futures trading facility sponsored by the Chicago Mercantile Exchangewith a brisk volume of activity, according to promoters of the market.

title: 31 Songwriters Inducted Into Music's Hallof Fame
description: Some of America's leading songwriters got a chance to say, They're playing our song Monday evening in the Grand Ballroom of the Americana Hotel. Thirtyone songwriters who were being inducted into the Songwriter Hall of Fame not only heard their songs played but several also seized the opportunity to sing some of their hits.

title: F.T.C. Finds Most Ad Data Doubtful or Too Technical
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 About 60 per cent of the material that 32 companies have filed with the Federal Trade Commission to substantiate advertising claims is either of doubtful adequacy or too technical, according to staff study.

title: CABINET JOB IS GIVEN UP BY CONNALLY
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 President Nixon announced today the resignation of John B. Connally as Secretary of the Treasury and said he would nominate George P. Shultz, director of the Office of Management and Budget, as his successor.

title: Publisher of Gallic Weekly Here Leaving to Serve in Fiench Senate
description: Jacques Habert is resigning as publisher of the New Yorkbased French weekly FranceAmerlque after 19 years, three months and 1,000 issues of publication.

title: Submarine's Name Changed
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI)  The Navy's projected new nuclear submarine and missile, known until now es Ulms, has been renamed the Trident, Ulms stood for undersea longrange missile system. Mr. Laird said. Henceforth, the Ulms will be known as the Trident, an historic symbol of sea power, he said. The Trident is the threepointed spear held aloft as a symbol of authority by Neptune, the mythological king of the, sea.

title: Seoul Reaffirms Its Readiness To Cooperate With Red Nations
description: SEOUL, South Korea, May 16 President Park Chung Hee reaffirmed today South Korea's readiness to cooperate with any countries, including Communist nations, for world peace as long as they did not commit hostile acts against his country.

title: Taunton Gazette Sold
description: TAUNTON, Mass., May 16 (AP)The Taunton Gazette was sold today by the William Reed and Sons Co. to Thomson Newspapers, Inc., of Des Plaines, Ill. William R. Reed, publisher of The Gazette, and K. R. Thomson, president of the Illinois newspaper group, made the announcement.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A public offering of two mil lion shares of PPG Industries, Inc. common at $45 a share was announced yesterday by the First Boston Corporation as manager of an underwriting group handling the sale of the shares which were offered, accoring to the underwriters, by the Pitcairn Company, a per sonal holding company. According to the announcement PPG, which closed yesterday on the New York Stock Exchange at 45, up  on a volume of 12,800 shares, will receive none of the proceeds of the sale.

title: Terence P. Bresnahan, 64, Judge at Dog Shows, Dead
description: PORTSMOUTH, R. I., May 16 Terence P. Bresnahan, a longtime breeder of fox terriers and other dogs, an exhibitor and a judge at dog shows, died yesterday in Newport. He was 64 years old.

title: Shorter Campaign Is Urged
description: WEST LONG BRANCH, N. J. (AP)  Senator Barry Goldwater, the 1964 Republican candidate for President, said today that a shorter election campaign and a oneday national primary election might reduce the violence plaguing American politics. The Arizona Republican spoke at a news conference prior to his address at Monmouth College here.

title: Ransom at 84: New Book, Old Times
description: GAMBIER, OhioGambier is a small town some 50 miles northeast of Columbus, surrounded by undulating fields touched by the spring green. It is the home of Kenyon College, a moderately sized liberal arts school recently gone coed. The town does not so much house the college as run conterminous with it. A visitor, looking down the one broad street with its village inn (restaurant only), the college bookstore and a bank whose fortresslike exterior proclaims the absolute safety of its deposits, asks where the town is and is told, This is it.

title: A $75,000 Star May Be About to Fall on Alabama
description: Denny McLain's situation, in being farmed out by the Oakland Athletics, touches on several aspects of baseball regulations.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Foster Wheeler Corporation has elected William D. Stevens as senior vice president. He will be responsible for the overall activities of the company's equipment division.

title: Merola Urges Raising Estimate Of OTB Revenue to $70Million
description: Mario Merola, head of the City Council's Finance Committee, said yesterday he would recommend that Mayor Lindsay raise the anticipated revenue from offtrack betting from $43million to $70million for the fiscal year beginning July 1.

title: Sites of Penetrations by Bullets
description: Doctors treating Gov. George C. Wallace said he was struck by four and possibly five bullets. The areas shown in the accompanying diagram indicate the approximate locations of the bullet penetrations.

title: STATE WILL CHECK RELIEF ELIGIBILITY
description: The state announced yesterday that it would take over from local agencies in New York City and throughout the state the responsibility for checking on the eligibility of people on the welfare rolls.

title: Westmoreland Optimistic On NoDraft Goal in 73
description: MACDILL AIR FORCE BASE, Fla., May 16 (AP)Gen. William C. Westmoreland, Army Chief of Staff, said today that we are cautiously optimistic that we will achieve or come close to the objective of an allvolunteer Army by July 1, 1973.

title: Transplant Patient Dies
description: PHOENIX, Ariz., May 16 (UPI)William C. Carroll, the secondlongest surviving heart transplant patient, is dead from cardiac failure after insisting he leave the hospital to be home for Mother's Day. Mr. Carroll, 54 years old, was the world's 36th heart transplant patient. He lived 44 months with a second heart until his death Sunday evening. The longestsurviving heart transplant patient is Louis B. Russell Jr., 46, of Indianapolis, who received a new heart Aug. 24, 1968.

title: Sports Today
description: Meta vs. Montreal. Expos, at Shea Stadium, Roosevelt Avenue and 126th Street, Flushing Meadow, Queens, 8 P.M.

title: Lily Pons to Sing May 31
description: Lily Pons, the former Metropolitan Opera soprano, will sing in public in New York for the first time since 1960 in an appearance as special guest artist with the New York Philharmonic in the Tonight We Dance Promenade at Philharmonic Hall May 31. Miss Pons will sing two arias from Donizetti's The Daughter of the Regiment, as well as Rachmaninoff's Here Beauty Dwells and Ponce's Estrellita.

title: Consolidated Natural Gas
description: Gas sales of the Consolidated Natural Gas Company this year are expected to be about 4 per cent higher than in 1971, Robert E. Seymour, president, said at the annual meeting in Hollywood, Fla., yesterday.

title: More Mining, Hanoi Says
description: Saigon, South Vietnam, May 16 (UPI)The Hanoi radio said United States planes had planted more mines at Haiphong and several other harbors yesterday, possibly to replace those that had drifted out to sea since they were planted last week.

title: Credit Markets
description: Interest rates moved indecisively yesterday as the credit markets remained in their basically trendless pattern of recent weeks. Nothing in the news or technical situation was sufficient to get the market off dead center, although specialists reported some pickup in demand for corporate and taxexempt securities late in the day.

title: Michigan Campaigning, Student Style
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., May 16  Up and down Elysium and Strawberry Fields  the dormitory floors have names herea young man knocked at the doors and grinned as pretty girls opened them or shouted Come in.

title: U.S. ORDERS A STUDY OF PASSPORT SYSTEM
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (AP) Frances G. Knight, director Of the United States Passport Office, announced today a $150,000, oneyear research award td determine what passport improvements might be made in these days of growing travel abroad.

title: Survey Ties Issues, Not Shooting, to Wallace Victory
description: Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama won the Michigan primary yesterday largely because of his opposition to busing, welfare and taxes and not because of a sudden sympathy vote after the attempt on his life Monday.

title: Sailor Beware!
description: The sea is the most, persistently awesome primal force in nature: Its stornis, its deeps, its tides and swells are a constant reminder of the overriding power that submerges man in time.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two explosions apparently caused by a buildup of carbon monoxide gas rocked the basement of a financial district office building last night, damaging a bank vault and a Japanese restaurant. There were no reports of injuries.

title: A.B.C. Presents an Optimistic Forecast
description: The American Broadcasting Companies, Inc., presented an optimistic forecast of operations this year for some. 250 stockholders who attended its hourlong annual meeting in a company studio here yesterday.

title: Connally's Record Gets Mixed Reviews
description: John. B. Connally's 15month performance as Secretary of the Treasury drew mixed but generally favorable reviews yesterday from businessmen, bankers and economists.

title: Coleman Company
description: Secondquarter sales and earnings of the Coleman Company are expected to be above those of the first quarter, when the company cleared $1,869,000, or 26 cents a share, on sales of $41,566,000 Sheldon Coleman, chairman, said yesterday at the annual meeting in Wichita, Kan.

title: STAGGERS CONDEMNS F.C.C. FOR A WIRETAP
description: WASHINGTON (UPI) Rep. Harley O. Staggers, Democrat at West Virginia, told officials of the Federal Communications Commission today that they were assuming a bigbrother attitude in tapping the telephone of an F.C.C. employe suspected of leaking confidential information.

title: Lehman College Graduates Its First 4Year Class
description: Most of the mothers in the commencement audience of 4,000 wore corsages. Fathers and other relatives carried cameras, and youngsters played tag on the freshly cut grass as the college president led the academic procession across the campus with its flowering dogwood and azalea and budding oaks.

title: Shooting of Wallace Spurs a New Effort to Tighten Gun Controls
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The attempted assassination of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama with an Americanmade, $80 bargain revolver of a type that has been barred as an import since 1968 spurred anew here today the periodic and usually unsuccessful efforts of gun law reformers to tighten Federal firearms legislation.

title: Alcoa Sees Industry in Balance
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa, May 16 The aluminum industry now operating just about on balance, John D. Harper, chairman of the Aluminum Company, of America, said today.

title: MORE DATA SECURITY SET IN I.B.M. OUTLAY
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 16 (AP) The International Business Machines Corporation plans to spend an estimated $40million in the next five years on data security, it was announced here today.

title: Reducing Pills Took the Pep Out of McLain
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 16 (AP)Denny McLain took pills to lose weight but lost his strength, his fastball and his job with the Oakland Athletics.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: No one is heartened by the situation in Indochina, least of all the President.

title: 2 KnickNet Contests Planned for October
description: Two preseason games between the New York Knicks of the National Basketball Association and the New York Nets of the American Basketball Association are under discussion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: In the name of the employes of the Veterans Administration's New York Regional Office, most of them veterans themselves and some Vietnam veterans, I take exception to the April 9 news story in The Times, where a veteran was quoted as saying V.A. employes are cold toward new Vietnam veterans struggling their way back to civilian life.

title: George (Punch) Imlich
description: BUFFALO, May 16 (UPI)George (Punch) Imlach ended a 13year National Hockey League coaching career today when he relinquished his coaching duties with the Buffalo Sabres. Imlach said he would remain with the Sabres as general manager.

title: Wait Till Next Year
description: BOSTON, May 16 (UPI)The Massachusetts House proclaimed the City of Boston and the Commonwealth the hockey capital of North America today in honor of the Bruins, who won the Stanley Cup, the Braves, who won the Eastern Division crown in the American League and Boston University, which took the National Collegiate title.

title: The Detroit Names Ceccato As its Principal Conductor
description: Aldb Ceccato, a 38yearold Italian conductor, has been appointed principal conductor of the Detroit Symphony Orchestra. The Iwoyear contract will htecorne effective with the beginning, of the 197374 season.

title: Hanoi Aides Say They Expect Heavier Bombing
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 16North Vietnamese officials are telling diplomats and journalists that they expect heavier American bombing and other attacks before long and are prepared, to meet them.

title: Israel Reports 2 MIG's Over the Sinai
description: TEL AVIV, May 16 (UPI)Military spokesmen said that two Soviet made MIG23 jet interceptors violated airspace over the Israelioacupled Sinal Peninsula today on a reconnaissance mission for Egypt.

title: Bill for 21 New judgeships Its Found Deficient and Returned by Governor
description: ALBANY, May 17Legislation creating 21 new judgeships in the state appeared headed for oblivion tonight as Governor Rockefeller's office returned the bill to the adjourned Assembly because of a technical deficiency.

title: Communists Deny Seeking Full Political Controlin South Vieipam
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 16A representative of the Communists Provisional Revolutionary Government for South Vietnam claimed great military success for his side today but insisted that it did not seek complete political control.

title: Clinton High, at 75, Maintains Its Tradition
description: Once last year, some students from the allgirl Walton High School west to their nearby Bronx neighbor, the allboy DeWitt Clinton High School, and tried to get the Clinton boys to desert their classes and join them in a walkout over a nowforgotten issue.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Grateful
description: WASHINGTON, May 16 (UPI) Representative Shirley Chisholm, Democrat of Brooklyn, expressed appreciation today for the Secret Service protection extended to her as a Presidential candidate after the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace. She called on Congress to stand firm and act swiftly to approve more comprehensive and farreaching firearms legislation.

title: Gil Evans, Jazz Pianist, Marks Birthday by Leading Big Band
description: Gil Evans, the jazz pianist, composer, arranger and conductor who has provided Miles Davis with some of his most viable settings, celebrated his 60th birthday last weekend with his large band at the Westbeth Cabaret, 155 Bank Street, where the group is playing every Saturday and Sunday.

title: Leak Causes Evacuation
description: NEWCOMERSTOWN, Ohio, May 16 (AP)  Schoolchildren were sent home early and ailing residents of this Eastern Ohio village evacuated today as a burning tank car from a freight train derailment continued to leak toxic fumes. The tank car containing phosphate pentasulfide caught fire late yesterday. It was involved in a 32car Penn Central derailment on Sunday.

title: U.S. Health Institutes Give Up Hope on Common Cold Vaccine
description: The National Institutes of Health has largely given up hope of finding a vaccine against the common cold.

title: ROCK CATCHES ON AT PERSIAN ROOM
description: Kenny Rogers and the First Edition started out as a mildly interesting rock group whose principal attribute was a wellblended vocal ensemble sound. As the stars of their own syndicated television show, they have, of necessity, become something more than good singersa slick, polished act that has mastered the hip humor, the, impersonations and the visually colorful pranks that most executive brass seem to feel are requisite to success in the television industry.

title: Senate, 4743, Adds CeaseFire To Amendment to Halt the War
description: WASHINGTON, May 16The Senate accepted today, by a vote of 47 to 43, an Administration proposal that withdrawal of American forces from Vietnam be conditioned upon an internationally supervised ceasefire.

title: Saigon's Marines, Facing Test at Hue, Are Willingto Die but Reject Capture
description: DUCPHO, South Vietnam, May 13Every member of the South Vietnamese Marines, when he enlists, must send letter to his family saying that he accepts the probability of his death and that they must accept it, too.

title: Market Place: Morgan Trust Allows a Peek
description: The Morgan Guaranty Trust Company, whose $22.6billion trust and investment division is the largest of any American bank, is giving the public a Peek at its holdings for the first time in its 108year history.

title: SWAMPS 2 RIVALS IN BORDER STATE
description: BALTIMORE, May 16  Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, recovering in a Silver Spring hospital from a gunman's bullets, scored an impressive victory in the Maryland primary today.

title: Manhattan Industries
description: Sales and earning of Manhattan Industries, Inc., are expected to reach record levels In the fiscal year ending next Jan. 31, Robert L. Leeds Jr., chairman of the apparel menufactuter and retailer, said yesterday at the annual meeting here. Mr. Leeds said sales for the year are expected to be about $210million to $215million. In fiscal 1972, the company had net income of $4.2million on sales of $182million.

title: Books of The Times
description: ULYSSES ON THE LIFFEY. By Richard Elimann. 208 pages. Illustrated. Oxford. $8.95.

title: BURNS PROPOSALS REREAD IN EUROPE
description: PARIS, May 16  With the resignation, of John B. Connally as Secretary of the Treasury, European economic officials are rereading with intense interest the proposals of the Federal Reserve Board chairman, Dr. Arthur F. Burns, for monetary overhaul made last Friday in Montreal.

title: Soviet Giving Rationale for Nixon Visit
description: MOSCOW, May 16  The Soviet Union opened a publicity campaign today to justify its scheduled talks with President Nixon next week against the background of the mining of North Vietnamese ports.

title: Banker Tells Senate Unit of Bias by F. H. A. Here
description: WASHINGTON, May 16A Brooklyn banker told a Senate subcommittee here today that local Federal Housing Administration officials had discriminated against his bank and in favor of mortgagebanking concerns and that kickbacks and payoffs were very widespread in our metropolitan area.

title: Wallace's Doctors Will Remove Bullet From Back When His Condition Stabilizes
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., May 16Doctors caring for Gov. George C. Wallace said today that he would need further surgery to remove from his back a bullet that is apparently causing paralysis of his legs.

title: Roundup: Monday Hits 3. Home Runs
description: It wasn't a case of try, try again to succeed as far as Rick Monday was concerned last night in Philadelphia, where the Cubs beat the Phillies, 81.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MONTEVIDEO, May 16 (Reutets)Tupamaro urban guerrillas today freed a police photographer kidnapped last February, parliamentary sources said.

title: Gordon's Choreography Blends Btoadway and Japanese Stage
description: Lonny Joseph Gordon is a choreographer of mixed enthushiqms. At one moment he is enthralled, with the Japanese sense of theater and creates a piece to illustrate it and at another he is beguiled with Broadway. He even paints and uses slides of his canvases as decor for dance but at no time does he exert a strong indivilual creative voice. His concert at Japan House Monday evening was painfully diffused.

title: GRUMMAN TO OMIT QUARTERLY DIVIDEND
description: The Grumman Corporation announced yesterday that its directors had voted to omit the quarterly dividend normally paid at this time. The Bethpage, L. I., aircraft and aerospace concern had been paying quarterly dividends of 25 cents share.

title: Merger News; I. T. T INAUGURATES DIVESTITURE PLAN
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation has completed the first major divestiture under a Justice Department consent decree enabling I.T.T. to keep the Hartford Fire Insurance Company, it was learned yesterday.

title: 95 Seized at Westover
description: WESTOVER, Mass., May 16 (UPI)Ninetyfive antiwar protesters, most of them students from nearby colleges, were arrested today on charges of disturbing the peace while blocking two gates at Westover Air Force base.

title: ORVILLE T. WARING
description: Orville Theodore Waring, for 26 years superintendent of the Atlantic Coast Line Railway, died Monday night at the Deerfield Episcopal Home in Asheville, N. C. He was 91 years old.

title: CITY ASKS A LAW ON DOG LITTERING
description: The city proposed legislation yesterday requiring owners to clean up immediately any mess, their pets make in the streets.

title: 50MILLION PLOT ON HEROIN FOILED
description: Five men were arrested here and two were arrested in Paris yesterday as international narcotics agents blocked an attempt to smuggle $50million worth of heroin264 poundsinto New York City.

title: CORRUPTION TAPE PLAYED AT TRIAL
description: A taperecorded conversation containing numerous references to police corruption was played yesterday as the key evidence in the perjury trial of a suspended police lieutenant.

title: Controversial Rezoning Plan Is Approved by Freeport Trustees
description: FREEPORT, L, L, May 16A controversial plan to rezone both sides of deteriorating North Main Street here was approved today by the Village Trustees.

title: Roserharyn Hall Architect
description: The name of James Stewart Polshek, the architect who designed a group of seven buildings comprising the new campus of Rosemary Hall in Wallingford, Conn., was inadvertently omitted from an article in yesterday's New York Times describing dedication ceremonies for the campus. Mr. Polshek was recently named dean of Columbia University's School of Architecture.

title: Nixon at Camp David
description: THURMONT, Md., May 16 (UPI)President Nixon flew to his mountain retreat at Camp David this evening to prepare fo' next week's summit meeting in the Soviet Union.

title: WILLIAM RUBIN OF TOOTSIE ROLL
description: William B. Rubin, honorary chairman of the board of Tootsie Roll Industries and a former president of the company, died Monday night at Hampshire House, his residence in Manhattan. He was 77 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Your May 2 editorial Abusing the Diploma displays an unwarranted contempt for both the legislative and educational processes.

title: Bonn: Treaties at Last?
description: West Germany's friendship treaties with Russia and Poland now seem certain of ratification by the end of the weeknot with the solid Bundestag majority Chancellor Brandt had anticipated but by default of the Christian Union opposition. Unable to agree on any other strategy, the opposition decided to abstain on the critical vote yesterday. As a result, the treaties were approved with 248 Votes, exactly half the Bundestag membership.

title: The Gun Menace
description: The criminal assault on Governor Wallace has once again spotlighted the nation's hideous crime against itselfits refusal to take effective measures to control the manufacture, sale and ownership of guns. The depressing aspect of recurrent flurries of public interest and Congressional response is that these all quickly evaporate in surrender to the gun lobby's powerful propaganda machine.

title: News of Dogs
description: Obedience training devotees agree that high scores are attained as a result of a team operation between the dog and his master or mistress. One must be patient and firm with the dog, not cruel, said Carlyle and Gabrielle Fabian of Voorhees, N.J. You start working from 20 minutes to a halfhour a day with the basic training and strive to establish good habits with the dog right from the start, always trying for perfection.

title: Agnew, Visiting Saigon, Holds Talks With Thieu
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 17  Vice President Agnew spent three hours in Saigon today and conferred with President Nguyen Van Thieu and American officials here.

title: JUDGESHIP DEFEAT CONFUSES ALBANY
description: ALBANY, May 17Governor Rockefeller's rejection of a bill passed by the Legislature to create new judgeships stirred confusion and speculation today among political leaders in the state.

title: 'The Legend of Nigger Charley'
description: For all the feverish activity, there has yet to be a film of rounded meritone of skill, imagination and impactabout the black man and the Old West. Sadly, "The Legend of Nigger Charley" is fair. Fair only.In the first chapter of this drama, three plucky slaves flee a Virginia plantation and a mean, near-psychopathic new master. They then appear in a tiny frontier town, where a quaking white resident tells them (and us) that the fugitive trio's leader is "already a legend." After a saloon shoot-up, felling a slave-hunter, still another half-cracked white, the trio rides on.Finally, in the best part of the film, the three men shield a poor white farmer and his half-caste wife from some vicious townspeople, led by an outright lunatic. One quiet dinner scene, as the visitors and the couple await attack, conveys more about racial hatred, cruelty and blindness, than the rest of the picture.But generally it rambles and dawdles, resolving tensions with conventional shootouts, like any standard Western. Another thinghow on earth did the three slaves get from Old Virginny to the snowcapped frontier peaks? What about encounters and dangers along the way? How about that for drama? And what has a blaring, jazzy rock 'n'roll sound-track got to do with the Old West or old anything?As Charley, a former athlete named Fred Williamson shows definite acting flair. Of the others, I especially like D'Urville Martin, Tricia O'Neil and Doug Rowe. If they deserved better, so does the themestill.

title: Personal Finance
description: Pennsylvania's crusading insurance commissioner, Herbert S. Denenberg, who not long ago published a list of life insurance companies together with the prices they charge, has come, out with a new list.

title: U.S. Denies Port Traffic
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Administration officials said categorically today that no ships had entered or left Haiphong harbor since President Nixon ordered it mined. They also said that reconnaissance showed no minesweeping activity at Haiphong or other North Vietnamese ports.

title: U.S. Is Told of Decision
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (Reuters)  The State Department acknowledged today that the United States has been informed of Egypt's decision to reduce her staff here to 10five diplomatic and five administrative personnel.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: I strongly endorse your May 10 editorial Mr. Nixon's Brinkmanship.

title: Germany, Poland and Russia: Cooperation and Conflict
description: 1762 Russia's Peter III makes peace with Frederick II. 1772 First partition of Poland by Russia, Austria and Prussia. Further partitions made in 1793 and 1795.

title: Studies Find No Safety Problem At New Con Edison Atomic Plant
description: CROTONONHUDSON, May 17A subcontractor who last March charged that there were serious problems of plant safety at Consolidated Edison's new Indian Point nuclear generating plant said today that my concern about the safety of the plant has been eliminated.

title: U.M.W. Voids Boyle Election But Balks at Treasurer Vote
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 (UPI)ThpUniied Mine Workers has agreed to most requests sought by the Labor Depart Ment in conducting a new election this year, but has balked at including its secretarytreasurer, John Owens, in the election.

title: 17 POLICEMEN HERE TO GET HIGH HONOR
description: Seventeen New York policemen will, receive, eight of them posthumously, the department's highest award, the Medal of Honor. The eight were killed in the line of duty.

title: To China and Back  A Shopping Trip Leads to Treasure
description: They sound more like children, suddenly let loose Santa's workshop than the sophisticated store executives, merchants and importers they actually are. Francine Farkas, vice president of fashion for Alexander's, Robert Meyers, vice president of home furnishings for Bloomingdale's, Eleanor Lambert, fashion publicist, and Wallace Chavkin, president of the Biddle Sawyer importecport company and the newly formed U.S.China Trade Corporation; all veterans of foreign commerce, were among the many who just returned from the Canton Trade Fair bubbling with enthusiasm for everything from acupuncture to the quality of silk. And Dr. David Buxbaum, head of the May Lee Import Corporation, who is still in China, was equally impressed, according to phone conversations he had from Peking with his office here.

title: American Airlines
description: FORT WORTH, Tex., May 17 (UPI)The president of Spater, told stockholders at the annual meeting today that a per cent fare increase last May and another 3 per cent fare increase this year are not enough and further increases will be required.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Mrs. Coretta Scott King, the widow of the Rev. Dr. Martin Luther King Jr., reportedly will announce tomorrow in Los Angeles that she is supporting Senator George McGovern's candidacy for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: LENNON MAKES PLEA AT CLOSE OF HEARING
description: Deportation hearings for John Lennon and his wife Yoko Ono, closediesterday with the British musician telling the Immigration Service inquiry of finer: I don't know if there's any mercy to plead for because this isn't a Federal Court. But if there is, I'd like please.

title: Atlantic Richfield Finds Oil And Gas Offshore Indonesia
description: The Atlantic Richfield Company announced yesterday the discovery of oil and gas in two separate zones of an exploratory well in waters off Indonesia. The well, 16 miles west of the previously discovered Ardjuna field, tested oil at two different zones.

title: Koosman Is Called Naive In Inquiry on Trot Exacta
description: Jerry Koosman, who had accepted $500 as a remuneration for appearing at Leonard Schindler's clothing store in Brooklyn last summer, was given a vote of confidence by the New York Mets in a clubhouse meeting befdre last night's game with Montreal.

title: Martinis ls Asked to Withdraw in Harlem 4 Case
description: Supreme Court Justice Joseph A. Martinis was asktcl to disqualify himself from the Harlem Four case yesterday by the defense, which said he had concealed information and, in effect, deceived the defense, in the, public about a crucial event in the case.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Security. President Nixon announced the appointment of John S. D. Eisenhower as a chairman of the Interagency Classification Review Committee, The committee will oversee the impletrientation and operation of the new system for classification and declassification of Government documents established by the President. Also on the committee will be senior representatives of the Departments of Defense, State and Justice, the Central Intelligence Agency and the Atomic Energy Commission.

title: Senate Panel Votes Curb On Sales of Small Pistols
description: WASHINGTON, May 17 Spurred by the attempt to assassinate Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, a Senate subcommittee voted today to bar the sale of most snubnosed pistols.

title: AMEX'S INDEX UP BY 0.03 TO 27.61
description: Shares on the American Stock Exchange ended mixed yesterday. The exchange's index managed to edge upward by 0.03 to close at 27.61, continuing a slow uptrend.

title: Zen, American Style
description: Since I came to live in America, one of the things that has struck me most is the number of socalled Eastern cults. It seems that anything from the East acquires an almost magic power as it moves westward.

title: U.S. Conducts Atom Test
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., May 17 (AP)The second underground nuclear detonation of 1972 was conducted today at the Nevada Test Site, the Atomic Energy Commission said. The test was described as weapons related and was in the yield range of under 20 kilotons, which is equivalent to the detonation of 20,000 tons of TNT.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: Special Committee on Colonialism10:30 A.M.; subcommittee on Pacific Ocean territories3 P.M.

title: Greek Sues U.S. Agency Over Unwanted Mailings
description: ATHENS, May 17A magazine pdblisher has sued officials of the United States Information Service in Athens for invading his privacy by mailing unwanted propaganda material to his home.

title: Bridge: Duplicate Enthusiasts Have Options Limited by Numbers
description: Duplicate bridge enthusiasts who wish to play at home have the following options if they have two tables: a match between two teams, a contest between four pairs, which amounts to three short matches, and an individual contest, which is like playing seven brief matches with a different partner and a different assortment of teammates each time. All these are best scored by international match points.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
