description: Thomas Kiernan, a partner in the law firm of White & Case, was reelected president of the New York County Lawyers( Association last night at the annual meeting or the association at its headquartett, 14 Vesey Street.

title: SILVER FUTURES DECLINE IN PRICE
description: Silver futures dropped yesterday.

title: COMPANY PROFITS UP 6.570 TO A PEAK
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Corporate profits before taxes rose by $5.6billion, or 6.5 per cent, in the first quarter to a record annual rate of $91.6billion, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Robert Kleiman's column, Taiwan Without Tears (May 8), gave the impression that because of the current economic boom and the rising per capita of G.N.P. in Taiwan, Taiwanese are turning away from their independence goal. He also reported that according to some analysts, the chief casualty of the NixonChou communiqu is the small Taiwan Independence Movement, which is said to be more a state of mind than an organized force. This was all very misleading.

title: Dining: Bit of Spain In Jackson Heights
description: *  El Inca,8501 Roosevelt. Avenue, Jackson Heights, Queens, 6727756.

title: Sulphur Company Acquired by Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, May 18The Mexican Government has announced the Mexicanization of the country's sulphur industry with the acquisition of Azufrera Panamericana, a company that is 34 per cent owned by Pan American Sulphur Company, a United States concern.

title: Rail and Truck Activity Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The Association of American Railroads reported freight traffic on United States railroads during the week end May 13 totaled an estimated 15.6 billion tonmiles, 0.9 per cent above the corresponding week last year. Carloadings in the same week totaled 523,253, down 1.6 per cent from last year. The American Trucking Associations, Inc., reported intercity truck tonnage was 2.8 per cent above the corresponding week last year.

title: RATE OF GROWTH SLOWS FOR MONEY
description: Monetary expansion, which earlier in the year had quickened at a rate that some economists regarded as excessive, has subsided somewhat in recent weeks, Federal Reserve figures indicated yesterday.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A team of doctors from New York Medical College announced yesterday that they had found a way to prolong the effectiveness of naloxonein antagonist drug that blocks the euphoric effects of heroinfrom three four hours to two to three days.

title: Law Group Keeps a Lunch Tradition
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The National Conference of. Judicial Councils, an organization, that exists for the sole purppse of having lunch once a year with the members of the Supreme Court in the Supreme Court Building, proved again today that it is one of the most viable organizations of the legal profession.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Detour Set
description: The Manhattanbound roadway of the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed tomorrow from 6 to 10 A.M. to allow the in stallation of four signs in the westbound lanes, Highways Commissioner Vincent J. Gibney announced yesterday. Motorists are advised to use the Manhattan Bridge or the BrooklynBattery Tunnel during the four hours.

title: Memo to the President
description: Like every other occupant of the modern, monarchical Presidency, you are now a King and you live in splendid Court, surrounded by an aura of majesty. Every Moment of every day you are compensated in ways large and small for the hard knocks and disappointments you encountered on the road to the White House.

title: Black Coalition Reaches Accord on TV Programing
description: A coalition of black community organizations announced yesterday that it had reached agreements with two of the three networkowned New York stations for a voice in management, planning, and production of blackoriented programs.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Detour Set
description: The Manhattanbound roadway of the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed tomorrow from 6 to 10 A.M. to allow the in stallation of four signs in the westbound lanes, Highways Commissioner Vincent J. Gibney announced yesterday. Motorists are advised to use the Manhattan Bridge or the BrooklynBattery Tunnel during the four hours.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: A nonregistered secondary offering of 362,252 common shares of the Fluor Corporation was priced yesterday by Salomon Brothers at $19.75 a share. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange, closed at that price, up  for the day.

title: South Africa Pact Scored
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Representative Henry S. Reuss demanded today the immediate termination of the agreement that allows South Africa under certain conditions to sell gold to the International Monetary Fund.

title: British Aide Says I. R. A.'s Aim Is Protestant Backlash in Ulster
description: LONDON, May 18William Whitelaw, the British official who administers Northern Ireland, charged here today that the Irish Republican Army was seeking to provoke a Protestant backlash that could plunge the province into new sectarian strife.

title: Investigators Say Bremer Was at End of His Rope
description: BALTIMORE, May 18Arthur Herman Bremer, the 21yearold former Milwaukee busboy who is accused of shooting Gov. George C. Wallace, was portrayed today as tired, hungry and down to his last $2 by the time he reached the Maryland shopping center where the Governor was struck down Monday afternoon.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 18Senator George McGovern was scheduled to check his Democratic Presidential campaign into the Benson Hotel here tonight, but he wound up instead in the Sheraton Motor Inn. The shift was occasioned by the discovery, to the dismay of campaign aides, that the Benson, unlike the Sheraton, had nonunion help.

title: News Analysis
description: TRENTON, May 18  For many New Jersey political leaders it didn't seem to make any sense. Here was a Republican Governor urging a Legislature controlled by Republicans to approve the most progressive, urbanoriented, socially conscious taxreform program ever proposed in the state's history. Appearing before a joint legislative session in the crowded Assembly chamber this afternoon, Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill recommended $2billion tax program that included a graduated state income tax and a statewide property tax of $1 on every $100 of true value.

title: PRICE COMMISSION CUTS SOME RENTS ON YEARLY LEASES
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 The Price Commission announced today new rent rules that will have the effect of lowering some rents under oneyear leases signed since the beginning of the year and of keeping, rent increases under new oneyear leases to a maimum of 8 per cent.

title: VINCENT E. SMITH, SOCIAL SCIENTIST
description: Dr. Vincent E. Smith, a professor of social sciences for the last three years at Queensborough Community College, Bayside, Queens, died at Polyclinic Hospital yesterday as ali result of injuries sustained as a hitandrun victim. He was 56 years old and lived at 179.05 Croydon Road, Jamaica, Queens.

title: Giap's Offensive
description: Satan: Giap began [the offensive in South Vietnam] too late. He did not move quickly enough. May 15 is the beginning of the monsoon season. And, if he does not win by then, it will be put off till later.

title: and the College Crisis
description: The omnibus higher education bill is far more than emergency first aid. Its aim is to establish a new pattern of Federal support without allowing the Government to interfere with the universities independence.

title: Sauce for the Goose
description: Whether one likes or deplores the results of the Democratic primaries in Michigan and Maryland, they were perfectly clear: Gov. George C. Wallace won in both states by substantial margins. Their delegations to the Democratic Presidential convention in Miami Beach should fully reflect those margins, but they won't do anything of the sort. Most unfairly, neither one will be more than nominally a Wallace delegation:

title: Two Buildings Win Design Awards
description: The City Club of New York, which has been calling attention to the city's design quality or lack of it for the last decadein particular by withholding the awards of its Bard Awards programhas announced two prizewinning buildings this year.

title: Miss Ella Farnsworth Bride Of Eric Bradford Paul in Utah
description: SALT LAKE CITY, May 18 Miss Ella Dene Farnsworth was married here this afternoon to Eric Bradford Paul. Elder Marion G. Romney, a member of the Quorum of Twelve Apostles of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latterday Saints, performed the ceremony in the Salt Lake Temple (Mormon).

title: Dorothy Day and Movement Resist U.S. Tax Claim
description: Dorothy Day, cofounder of the Catholic Worker movement and 1972 recipient of the University of Notre Dame's Laetare Medal for comforting the afflicted  virtually all her life, has been served with a Federal Government claim for $296,359 in back taxes and penalties because she refuses, on principle to give funds to the Government.

title: Cunard Ready With $350,000 Ransom
description: Cunard Line officials here stood ready last night to meet the demands of an anonymous caller who had said bombs would be detonated on board the Queen Elizabeth 2 unless he received $350,000.

title: Bengali Backlash
description: Reports from Dacca tell of murder, rape and other acts of violence and intimidation painfully reminiscent of the Pakistani rqpression last year that led to the Indian invasion of East Bengal and the formation of the new nation of Bangladesh. This time, however, it is not Pakistani soldiers committing the atrocities, but the Bengalis themselves who appear to be taking a terrible vengeance on the Bihari minorityUrduspeaking Moslems who settled in East Bengal after the partition of India in 1947.

title: SAMUELS LEAVING, STATE DEPARTMENT
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 President Nixon has accepted the resignation of Nathaniel Samuels of New York as the fourthranking official of the State Department and praised him for distinguished service during the past three years.

title: A.E.C. PLANS TO KEEP WASTES ON SURFACE
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP) The Atomic Energy. Commission announced plans today to build huge, heavily guarded steel and concrete storage vaults on or just below the earth's surface where potentially dangerous radioactive wastes of an everexpanding nuclear industry can be safely isolated for centuries if necessary.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: James Reston, in a burst of morality(column May 12), calls the Russian diplomatic note on the new Vietnam crisis a masterpiece of hypocrisy.

title: Red Detachment Opens
description: Red Detachment of Women, a color filming of the ballet that President and Mrs. Nixon saw in Peking and subsequently was shown as a television special, opened yesterday as 104minute movie feature at the Orleans Theater, the Cine Malibu and the Cinema Village. Described as a modern revolutionary dance drama and danced by the China Ballet Troupe, the work deals with a runaway peasant girl who joins the Red Army during the Civil War of 1927 to 1937.

title: Unit to Coordinate Job and Training Needs Is Urged
description: A major overall personnel agency that would act as a coordinator to fill the fateful gap between the clerical manpower needs of industry and the manpower simply in schools and training programs was, proposed yesterday by George Champion, former chairman of the board of the Chase Manhattan Bank.

title: A PRENATAL TEST FINDS AN AILMENT
description: A California medical research team reported yesterday that it had developed a quick, inexpensive and simple test to determine before birth whether a baby was likely to fall victim to a respiratory disease that takes the lives of 25,000 newborns in this country each year.

title: International Harvester Lists 45% Rise in Quarter Earnings
description: The International Harvester Company reported yesterday that its net income in the quarter ended April 30 was 45 per cent higher than in the corresponding period last year; when operations were affected by a strike. Sales of the producer of trucks, farm equipment and construction equipment rose 14 per cent.

title: 4 Experts Parachute After Ransom Call
description: LONDON, Friday, May 19Four bomb  disposal experts parachuted into the midAtlantic, from a Royal Air Force plane yesterday and boarded the Queen Elizabeth 2 after an anonymous caller threatened to blow up the luxury liner unless a ransom was paid.

title: A Brooklyn Poem Proves Inspiration For Musical Work
description: Imagine, it you can, a peaceful primeval Brooklyn, the air suffused with mysterious melo(Hods notes creating a pervasive spiritual serenity until we came, and drove it away. Such is the wistful atmosphere conjured up in 15yearold Theresa Schoenacher's the Place. The poem was awarded first prize in the recent Brooklyn Poetry Competition and provided the inspiration for Stephen Chamber's musical evocation entitled reflections on the Fifth Ray, both of which were heard at the Brooklyn Center Chamber Orchestra concert Wednesday night at Long Island University.

title: DR. THOMAS A. ROSSANO
description: Dr. Thomas A. Rossano, who had been a general practitioner in the Bronx for more than 40 years, died yesterday at his home, 4246 Barnes Avenue, the Bronx. He was 72 years old.

title: Advertising:
description: While other crafts have their Oscars, Tonys, Emmys and Clios, the opinion moldersthe public relations folk have their Silver Anvil awards.

title: U.S.Japan Talks Set
description: TOKYO, May 18 (Reuters)The United States and Japan today agreed to resume negotiations on correcting an imbalance in trade now running heavily in Japan's favor.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: LOS ANGELES, May 18 Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota opened what he said would be a rugged, hardhitting California primary campaign by challengtng his principal opponent, Senator George McGovern of South Dakota, to a series of televised debates, The offer was quickly accepted, at least in principle, by the McGovern command.

title: A.E.C. Aide Blames Con Ed for Delays In Licensing Plant
description: CRUGERS, N. Y., May 18 (AP)  The chairman of an Atomic Energy Commission panel blamed Consolidated Edison today for delays in the licensing process involving the utility's second nuclear power plant.

title: ALEXANDER SOBEL, BRIDGE ORGANIZER
description: Alexander M. Sobel, one of the world's leading bridge personalities, died of cancer yesterday in Memorial Hospital. He was 71 years old and resided at 41 West 72d Street.

title: Hanoi Reports Heavy Raids
description: SAIGON, Friday, May 19 (AP) The Hanoi radio said that large numbers of United States aircraft attacked North Vietnam yesterday.

title: New Yorkers Win 6 of 10 Bouts Spoiling Irish Team's U. S. Debut
description: Group of boxers representing New York City prevented it from being a great night for the Irish last night in the Felt Forum by defeating the Irish Olympic team, 6 bouts to 4.

title: Gen. Lansdale's Wife Dies
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., May 18 Mrs. Helen Batcheller Lansdale, the wife of Maj: Gen. Edward G. Lansdale, U.S.A.F., retired, the counterinsurgency expert of the war in Vietnam, died on Sunday at her home here. She was 71 years old. In addition to her husband, she leaves two sons, Peter C. and Edward R.

title: Film: Ann Arbor's Fete:Short Works From 10th Festival Open in Second Program at Whitney
description: The Whitney Museum's second program of the 10th Ann Arbor Film Festival highlights, which opened yesterday, might better be called slim pickings; for the most part an artistically meager collection of safe, technically derivative short movies that explore, but don't discover much about the options currently popular in independent filmmaking. If they really were among the best films from Ann Arbor, then Ann Arbor this year has fallen to a fairly low level of generally academic production.They include a line-drawing cartoon (Mary Beams's "Tub Film"), an open-ended impressionistic documentary (Jonathan Else's "You Don't Die Here"), a women's lib parable (Llanne Brandon's "Anything You Want to Be"), a gentle personal reverie (David Devensky's "Homecall"), a hard-hitting national reverie ("Goodbye Billie, America Goes to War 1917-18," by Patric Griffin, R. C. Raack, and William Malloch), a humorous sources-of-film study ("Three Colloquies" by Will Baker), and an animated painting ("Animated Painting," by Jeff Wein).That's it, except for Dave McCullough's "Particle Removal Series," which I can't categorize and which I rather liked. Since it deals wholly and precisely with how to rid yourself of wooden slivers, fingernail dirt, etc., perhaps it can be classified as a specialized-taste movie.I see no reason why any of the other filmmakers should not make good movies. But I don't see that any of them has as yet. Their films at the Whitney, Madison Avenue and 75th Street, represent exercises in established formspersonally educational I hope, but not usefully up for review.

title: Boy Scouts Reorect Head
description: LOS ANGELES, May 18 (UPI) Norton Clapp of Seattle, chairman of the Weyerhauser Company, was reelected president of the Boy Scouts of America.

title: Last 2 Soviet Ships Bound for Haiphong Said to Veer Away
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The last two Soviet freighters reported approaching Haiphong have been diverted to other ports, Administration officials said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Anthony Eden, Earl of Avon, opened his May 5 OpEd essay Getting the Free World Together with an eminently sound proposition: a foreign policy based on reality should come to no great harm. He later named four countries which he thought could become associated with the four Western European powers in a broader free world organization.

title: MASSENGALE TAKES DODGE GOLF ON 282
description: DENVILLE, N.J., May 18Don Massengale of Elmwood, N.Y., a former touring pro, finished strongly today and won the $25,000 Dodge open golf tournament at the Rockaway River Country Club.

title: F.H.A. Bypassed, Title Insurer Says
description: WASHINGTON, May 18Information that could alert the Federal Housing Administration to conditions that lead to foreclosures in New York City is ??? supplied to others, but not to the F.H.A., an official of a title insurance company told a Senate subcommittee here today.

title: FASHION TALK
description: Fall fashion openings are reaching a crescendo, with lots of new directions, plenty of opulence and an undercurrent of sanity. Among the guidelines:

title: The Talk of Mangum, Okla.
description: MANGUM, Okla., May 16 It rained; here last Thursday night. That event, probably even more than last weekend's 63d annual high school reunion, was the most celebrated happening in Greer County. Mangum is the center of the Dilst Bowl of the nineteenthirties, the place the Okies left for California when a prolonged drought and a scorching sun turned the sandy plains into a plaything for the winds. Nothing grew here in 1936 except the grapes of wrath.

title: Surgeon at Lincoln Hospital Charges Intruders Terrorize Patients and Staff
description: Lincoln Hospital's acting chief of surgery, in a confidential memorandum to the hospital's director, has protested that his staff must work literally barricaded behind locked doors because street gangs roam the corridors at will, terrdrizing staff members and patients.

title: School Lunch Limit Raised
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI) The Agriculture Department announced a $170 increase today in the national minimum poverty guideline that is used to decide which children are eligible for free or tokenpriced school lunches and breakfasts. Officials said the family income ceiling for the 197273 school year would be $4,110 for children from a family of four.

title: Executive Changes
description: Norton Simon, Inc., in a major organizational change, has named E. Garrett Bewkes Jr., and Joseph H. Grunache to the new post of senior vice president.

title: False Face
description: After the French pulled out of Indochina, it seemed a legitimate concern of the United States that Communism not be allowed to take Vietnam by default. There was ample and convincing ideological momentum to impel Washington to forestall any real or imagined thrust by Peking to assert hegemony over Southeast Asia.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Letters to the Editor

title: U.S. and Soviet Expected To Form New Trade Unit
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 President Nixon and Soviet leaders are expected to announce in Moscow next week the formation of a SovietAmerican commission to coordinate trade and economic policies, Administration sources said today.

title: One Fear or Women in 60'sTo Wake up With Nothing to do
description: She yearns for letters and phone calls from her children; she knows that it is more important to spend time with her husband then to wax the, kitchen floor; she passes the whitehaired women on the benches in Central Park and can't b'lieve she's one of them; she fears widowhood She is the woman in her 60's. In recent interviews with a number of women aged 6069, they discussed what life is like at their age. There was unanimous agreement that their happiness is Measured according to the amount of Meaningful activity in their lives. Those who were most active seemed to feel least aware of their age and relatively free from the emotional complications that are associated with agingennui, aimlessness, estrangement from youthful society.

title: Nathan's Employes End Their Strike; Agree to Arbitrate
description: Some 500 employes of Nathan's Famous, Inc., ended a 44day strike yesterday with the settlement of some issues and an agreement to go to arbitration over issues still unresolved, including wages.

title: ExStony Brook State U. Aide Indicted in ResearchFund Theft
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 18The former coordinator of research contracts at the State University of New York at Stony Brook was indicted today on 59 charges of forgery and grand larceny in connection with thefts of research funds from the university and bilking the predominantly black Wyandanch School District out of funds in connection with an alleged collegelevel research project.

title: ACF Industries, Inc.
description: ACF Industries, Inc., expects 1972 earnings to increase by 10 to 20 per cent over last year's $15,792,000 or $2.82 share, John F. Burditt, chairman, told some 150 shareholders at yesterday's 90minute annual meeting in the Roosevelt Hotel here.

title: BOISE CASCADE UNIT IN GUATEMALA SOLD
description: The Boise Cascade, Corporation announced yesterday sale of its 96 per cent interest in Empresa Electrica de Guatemala, S: A., to the Government of Guatemala for $18million cash, free of Guatemala taxes.

title: Robert Conway, Correspondent For Daily News, Is Dead at 72
description: WESTON, Conn., May 18Robert John Conway, a reporter and foreign correspondent for The Daily News for 37 years, who served as president of the Newspaper Guild of New York in 1942, died yesterday or a heart attack at his home Newtown Turnpike. His age was 72.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: Confidence in President Nixon's handling of Vietnam has sagged notably in recent weeks among those who voted in Michigan's Democratic primary this week, according to a New York Times survey.

title: Manuel Prenner Lawyer, Was a Writer and Editor
description: Manuel Prenner, a lawyer who was an editor for the American Law Book Company from 1927 to 1967 and who wrote many legal articles, died Wednesday at his home, 10240 67th Road, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Bridge: Sobers Death Removes Man Of Many Talents From Game
description: The world of bridge lost one of its most colorful and dynamic citizens when Al Sobel died in Memorial Hospital here yesterday after a long illness. He was a man of many talents, and he played many roles in the course of a long and full life.

title: News Analysis
description: WASHINGTON, May 18With President Nixon's departure for Moscow less than two days away, Washington seems relatively unexcited about his summit session, which may prove the most fruitful of all the postwar Soviet American meetings.

title: PLAY BY MILLER DUE ON BROADWAY
description: Barbara Harris, Hal Holbrook, Bob Dishy, Stephen Elliot and Barry Primus have been signed to costar in Arthur Miller's latest work, The Creation of the World and Other Business, which Robert Whitehead will bring to Broadway Nov. 16.

title: Patti Hogan Eliminated  in Tears
description: GUILDFORD, England, May 18 (Reuters)Patti Hogan of La Jolla, Calif., reported to the chief referee yesterday for misbehavior, had another temper tantrum today and left the court in tears after being eliminated from the Rothman's hardcourt tennis tournament.

title: SIDNEY CARLYSLE
description: MIAMI, May 18 (AP)Sidney Walter Carlysle, a dispatch courier for Lawrence of Arabia during World War I, died of heart attack on Tuesday. He was 80 years old.

title: 70 JAIL RIOTS HERE CALLED JUSTIFIED
description: The riots at the Manhattan House of Detention for Men in October, 1970, were justified, the lawyers for three prisoners said yesterday, because the inmates had no other means to protect themselves from official murder, beatiings, fear, pain and general degradation. This position emerged as the surprise defense of the three prisoners, who were indicated as a result of those riots.

title: Advertising:
description: In the midst of a trade press controversy over the efficiency of advertising in black media, an ad agency President has pledged $5,000 seed money for much needed, long ignored indepth research in the black consumer market.

title: HEARING DIVIDED ON ZONING BONUS
description: The issue of whether the city should offer a temporary zoning bonus to owners of certain tracts of land in Manhattan to encourage the building of highdensity apartment projects was debated before the City Planning Commission yesterday.

title: News Analysis
description: TRENTON, May 18  For many New Jersey political leaders it didn't seem to make any sense. Here was a Republican Governor urging a Legislature controlled by Republicans to approve the most progressive, urbanoriented, socially conscious taxreform program ever proposed in the state's history. Appearing before a joint legislative session in the crowded Assembly chamber this afternoon, Gov. Wil liam T. Cahill recommended $2billion tax program that included a graduated state income tax and a statewide property tax of $1 on every $100 of true value.

title: Rounseville's Mother Dies
description: Mrs. Kathleen Robinson Rounseville, mother of Robert Rounseville, the Broadway and opera tenor, died at Faulkner Hospital in Boston on Tuesday. She was 90 years old. Mrs. Rounseville, the widow of Dr. Wilfred E. Rounseville, lived in Attleboro, Mass. Her survivors include three other sons, Ellsworth Rounseville of Yarmouth, Mass.; Dr. Wilfred V. Rounseville of Newton Centre, Mass., and Dr. David Rounseville of Weehawken, N.J.

title: RESERVE AIDE BACKS JERSEY BANKING BILL
description: The Federal Reserve Bank of New York endorsed yesterday legislation to authorize statewide branch banking in New Jersey. A bill that would do this is currently pending in the Legislature in Trenton.

title: $50,000 in Ransom Paid In West Coast Kidnapping
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., May 18 (UPI)Two men, including one who pretended to be a stockbroker, kidnapped the wife of a bank manager and left her in an orange crate after picking up $50,000 in ransom money, the police reported today.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 86.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord, Ltd., Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: Kenny Admits U. S. Tax Evasion And Will Be Sentenced Tuesday
description: NEWARK, May 18John V. Kenny, the socalled little leader of Hudson County Democratic politics for more than two decades, pleaded guilty in Federal Court here today to six counts of income tax evasion.

title: Jersey Standard Chief Cites Oil Units Power in the Middle East
description: HOUSTON, May 18  The weight of power is in the hands of the Middle East oilproducing countries in their efforts to join the international oil companies in the operation of concessions, J. K. Jamieson, chairman of the board of the Standard Oil Company (New Jersey), reported to shareholders today at their annual meeting.

title: Lacotian Town Overrun
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, May 18 (Reuters)Commuhist troops have overrun Khong Sedone, a provincial capital in southern Laos, American sources said today.

title: Blast Occurs in Pentagon in the Air Force Section
description: WASHINGTON, Friday, May 19An explosion occurred early today in a section of the Pentagon, Government officials said. There was no explanation, nor a report of damages.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your [May 12] editorial supporting the recent action by the House of Representatives in adopting the Nixon Administration's substitute proposal to increase the minimum wage to $1.80 an hour and then $2 per hour over a twoyear period appears to fly in the face of your known commitment to social progress as well as historic economic fact.

title: Mets Score, 21, For 7th in Row
description: The New York Mets fielded a secondstring lineup yesterday to give their frontrunners a rest but lost absolutely no momentum as they completed a fourgame sweep of the Montreal Expos for their seventh straight victory.

title: Madagascar's President Yields Power to General
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, May 18 (AP)President Philibert Tsiranana, the uncontested ruler of Madagascar since independence from France in 1960, turned over full powers today to Gen. Gabriel Ramanantsoa, the army chief of staff, after six days of antiGovernment riots, strikes and demonstrations.

title: PACER COMEBACK TOPS NETS, 10099, BUILDS 32 LEAD
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 18The booing for Freddie Lewis, the often maligned Indiana Pacer guard, turned to cheers tonight. The little guard scored two free throws with nine seconds to play and gave the Pacers a 10099 comeback victory over the New York Nets before'a sellout crowd of 10,079 at the Indiana State Fairgrounds Coliseum.

title: BRANDT PREPARING BID FOR ELECTIONS
description: BONN, May 18With completion of parliamentary approval of West Germany's treaties with the Soviet Union and Poland virtually guaranteed tomorrow in the Bundesrat, or upper house, Chancellor Willy Brandt and Foreign Minister Walter Scheel prepared tonight to challenge the conservative Opposition to new elections.

title: Store Sales Rose in Week
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 The Department of Commerce reported today that departmentstore sales last week were an estimated $874million, 17 per cent above the year earlier $747million. Total retailstore sales last week were about $8.716billion, 11 per cent above the $7.858billion reported last year.

title: Reputed Gambler Arrested lot L.I For Tax Evasion
description: A reputed gambler, loan shark and organizedcrime figure in Brooklyn and Long Is land  Paul Vario of Island Park, L. I.was arrested yesterday, on charges of conspiring to evade Federal income taxes on money pocketed from his gambling enterprises.

title: Price Changes
description: The Inmont Corporation yesterday announced plans to increase prices of many printing inks by 5 to 10 per cent soon. Inmont is the world's largest producer of inks for the printing, publishing and packaging markets.

title: Fanny May
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (Reuters)The Federal National Mortgage Association earnings in 1972 should stabilize in comparison with the dramatic increase in 1971, Oakley Hunter, president and chairman, told the annual meeting today.

title: The Stage: Mutilation
description: With its abrupt changes of mood and jarring imagery, Walter Hadler's Mutilation is very much in the Theater Genesis tradition, But where Genesis's foremost playwright, Sam Shepard, is able to create a context in which the most outrageous absurdity seems natural and even necessary, Hadler, in this play, is offhanded to the point of lassitude.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Can Senator George McGovern, whose political base is a state with only 1,844 blacks, whose personal style is the very antithesis of soul, sell himself to the black electorate?

title: Prof. Wallace Sayre, 66, Dies; Authority on City Government
description: Prof. Wallace S. Sayre of Columbia University, a leading authority on city aovernment, collapsed and cited yesterday morning while talking with Mayor Lindsay at City Hall. He was 66 year sold.

title: French Troops Will Pull Out Of Chad, Commander Says
description: FORTLAMY, Chad, May 18 (Agence France  Presse) French troops have completed their mission in Chad and will begin pulling out of the country at the beginning of June, it was announced here today.

title: House, in 202156 Vote, U pholds $28.8Million Cut in U. N. Funds
description: WASHINGTON, May 18The House of Representatives, ignoring lastminute appeals by the White House and State Department, voted today to cut United States payments to the United Nations and eight of its agencies by $28.8million.

title: Wallace Receives Physical Therapy
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., May 18Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, still paralyzed from his hips down, began a program of physical therapy today but there was no decision on when and where a bullet in his spinal canal would be removed.

title: Man in the News
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, May 15Early, in 1942, a group of newly arrived black lieutenants assembled at Fort Benning, Ga., to be addressed by a senior lieutenant colonel. The colonel's first words were a warning that the blacks were not to use the officers club. The colonel's name was Omar Nelson Bradley, who became a General of the Army. One of the lieutenants was Frederic Ellis Davison, who is about to assume command of the Eighth Infantry Division at Bad Kreuznach, Germany, the first black officer to command a division of the U. S. Army.

title: Opera in Pyongyang Is Revolutionizing Experience
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea, May 18A night at the opera in Pyongyang is a revolutionlzing experience. At least that is the intention of the Korean People's Army Art Troupe, whose production of A True Daughter of the Party was seen here.

title: ANTITRUST CASE FILED AGAINST G.E.
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI) The Justice Department sued General Electric today, charging the major electrical manufacturer with violating antitrust laws since at least 1965.

title: 2 Shoot a Museum Guard and Flee With 4 Paintings
description: WORCESTER, Mass., May 18 Two robbers stole four paintings valued at more than $1million from the Worcester Art. Museum yesterday, and fled after shooting a guard Who tried to question them.

title: A Toast Drunk in Tea, and Dacca Has a U.S. Embassy
description: DACCA., Bangladesh, May 18 In a ceremony attended by the clinking of teacups instead of the usual champagne glasses, the United States diplomatic representation id Dacca  formerly called missionofficially became an embassy today.

title: Clifford Says Nixon Moves Prolong War
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Former Defense Secretary Clark M. Clifford charged today that President Nixon's military actions against North Vietnam were prolonging the war and raising the risk of a major confrontation with the Soviet Union.

title: McLain Begins New Life In Minors With Birmingham
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 18 (UPI)Denny McLain, the former major league star, began his new life in the minor leagues today, arriving here in a cramped bus for a fourgame stand.

title: A Fear of Violence Cancels City Salute To Armed Forces
description: The 23d annual Armed Forces Day Parade, which had been scheduled to start Saturday at 2:30 P.M. on upper Fifth Avenue, was canceled yesterday because of the possibility of violence.

title: A NO FAULT BILL VOTED IN JERSEY
description: TRENTON, May 18  The New Jersey Senate today gave final legislative passage to a modified no fault automobile insurance bill that is expected to be signed by Gov. William T. Cahill and become law Jan. 1.

title: Dressing Up That Flounder
description: In the menu below, the dish marked with an asterisk is followed by a recipe.

title: Obituary 1  No Title
description: Obituary 1  No Title

title: GOLD PRICES OFF ON FREE MARKET
description: PARIS, May 18The price of gold weakened today in London and Zurich after the rush this week that saw the metal change hands at more than $58 an ounce. Today's closing in London was $56.90.

title: EASED LAW URGED ON MARIJUANA USE
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Three national organizations petitioned the Bureau of Narcotics and Dangerous Drugs today to decriminalize marijuana, reducing penalties for use or sale of the drug from felonies to misdemeanors.

title: Reactivating of Warship Discounted by Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 (UPI)Pentagon officials discounted the idea today that the Navy might put one of its mothballed battleships back into action off Vietnam.

title: B.A.S.F. Plans Payout Cut
description: LUDWIGSHAFEN, West Germany, May 18Prof. Bernhard Timm, chairman, of the Badische Aniline and Soda Factory, announced this week that the company would propose a dividend cut for 1971 from 11 marks to 7.5 marks, about $3.75 to $2.37, per 50 marks, about $15.16, of nominal B.A.S.F. stock.

title: Pammy Lobell First in Bronx Filly Pace
description: YONKERS, May 18  With Romalie Hanover, the 12 favorite from the No. 7 post slowed by traffic problems, top honors in the 16th annual Bronx Filly Pace tonight went to the Billy Haughtondriven Pammy Lobell at Yonkers Raceway.

title: 9 Entered in Preakness
description: BALTIMORE, May 18  The draw for post positions for Saturday's 97th running of the Preakness took place today at Pimlico Race Course with the expected nine names entered.

title: Mood Was Cheerful, Passenger Says
description: The following dispatch was received by telephone from a passenger, Leon M. Siler, who covers Asheville, N. C., for The New York Times:ABOARD THE QUEEN ELIZABETH 2, in the Atlantic, May 18 One of the ship's launches had been lowered and was waiting for the bomb experts when they hit the water. You could see everything. They landed about 300 feet off the bow.

title: Rumania Takes 2 Singles For 20 Lead Over Iran
description: BUCHAREST, May 18 (AP) Ilie Nastase and Ion Tiriac scored singles victories today to give Rumania a 20 lead over Iran in the second round of European Zone Davis Cup tennis competition. Nastase downed Taghi Akhbari, 61, 61, 63. Tiriac beat Hossein Akhbari, 62, 63, 63.

title: Nixon Expected to Discuss Soviet Jews At His Meetings With Moscow Leaders
description: MOSCOW, May 18President Nixon's talks with Soviet leaders next week are expected to touch on the situation of Soviet Jews, which has been source of friction between the two governments in the past.

title: Jim Malloy, Driver, Dies; Hurt in Practice for 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 18 (AP)  Jim Malloy of Denver died today of multiple injuries suffered last Sunday in a fiery crash at the Indianapolis Motor Speedway.

title: EAST SIDE BUILDING RAVAGED BY FIRE
description: A smoky fire engulfed a sixstory commercial building on Manhattan's East Side early today as 160 firemen battled to contain it No injuries were reported.

title: LAWYER ON TRIAL IN SLAYING ON L.I
description: RIVERHEAD, L.I., May 18The murder and conspiracy trial of a Suffolk County lawyer, John 0. Hughes, got under way today, with Assistant District Attorney Patrick Henry telling the allmale jury that Mr. Hughes was the innevator, the director and producerthe mastermind of the murder,

title: SWIDLER WARNS ON POWER DELAYS
description: New York City faces a disaster if there are further delays in completing new electric generating facilities, Joseph C. Swidler, the chairman of the state's Public Service Commission said yesterday.

title: Big Board Plans Disciplinary Changes
description: The New York Stock Exchange's board of governors proposed sweeping changes yesterday in the method whereby the exchange tries persons and firms accused of violating its constitution and rules.

title: Bronx Landlords Set Wage Deadline
description: Owners of rentcontrolled apartment houses In the Bronx announced yesterday a move to halt einploye wage increases despite the warning of a strike by Local 82E of the Building Service Employes Union.

title: Three Share Golf Lead With 69's
description: MEMPHIS, May 18 (AP)Billy Maxwell, one of the shortest hitters on the tour, went around the long, tough Colonial Country Club course in a threeunderpar 69 today for a share of the firstround lead in the $175,000 Danny ThomasMemphis open golf tournament.

title: Roundup: Reds Win 8th Straight, 85
description: Sudden Sam McDowell's unbeaten fivegame winning record was suddenly interrupted by the surging Cincinnati Reds yesterday in San Francisco's Candlestick Park.

title: Heads of 2 Teacher Unions on 4,000Mile Merger Quest
description: The twinengine sixpassenger Beechcraft owned by the New York State Teachers Association slipped out of the lowhanging rain clouds and taxied to a stop at the nearly deserted Adirondack Airport at Lake Clear.

title: Laird to Speak at Annapolis
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 18 (AP)Secretary of Defense Melvin R. Laird will address commencement exercises at the United States Naval Academy on June 7.

title: Ronan and Heckscher Quarrel Over Rail Line Through Park
description: Parks Administrator August Heckscher and Dr. William J. Ronan, chairman of the Metropolitan. Transportation, Authority, have clashed again over transit route through a city park, this time over tunneling through Forest Park in Queens.

title: WAGERING HEAVY ON Oa FAVORITE
description: Offtrack betting on the Preakness began here yesterday, and Riva Ridge's admirers immediately made the Kentucky Derby winner an early 110 favorite.

title: Politburo Believed Meeting
description: MOSCOW, May 18The Soviet Union disclosed tonight that regional members of its top leadership had been summoned to Moscow for what appeared to be a full meeting of the Communist party's ruling Politburo, possibly to prepare for President Nixon's visit next week.

title: Kodak Names Fallon as Chief; Zornow Appointed Chairman
description: Walter A. Fallon was yesterday named president and chief executive officer of the Eastman Kodak Company and Gerald B. Zornow was elected chairman as Dr. Louis K. Eilers stepped down as chairman and chief executive officer.

title: Unscratched Pass Catcher Shows the Way
description: Yesterday morning, Eddie Yowell, the trainer of October Farm's prominent Pass Catcher, who was scheduled to start later in the day in the $15,000 Doge at Belmont Park, made out a scratch blank for his 4yearold colt. His request was denied by the stewards.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARIS The Queen of England's unprecedented second state visit here went off well, as these things always do. The French, who make the best bread and circuses, put themselves out to produce a good show including display of English weather.

title: The Busing Sideshow
description: The agreement reached by Senate  House conferees on the socalled public school antibusing amendment should remove the most serious obstacle to enactment of the historic higher education aid bill. It is a compromise that has already drawn fire from Southern segregationists, who wanted to ram an antiintegration rider down the conference committee's throat, and from some civil rights groups, who consider any restriction on busing unacceptable.

title: 200 Troops With Gas and Guns Put Down Riot in Dublin Prison
description: DUBLIN, Friday, May 19More than 200 soldiers armed with CS gas, guns and clubs swept into Mountjoy Prison here last night after prisoners rioted. The troops Inside the jail were backed up by armed soldiers and policemen outside the walls.

title: Promenades Time at the Philharmonic
description: The New York Philharmonic's subscription season ended last Saturday night. As usual, out went the seats on Philharmonic Hall's main floor; in went the special flooring and tables; up went the decorations, inside and out. It was Promenades time again, With the opening concert taking place Wednesday night.

title: Juilliard Dance Troupe Honors Doris Humphrey With 4 Works
description: To open its fourday season through tomorrow night, the Julliard Dance Ensemble presented a concert in memory of Doris Humphrey Wednesday night at the Juilliard Theater.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 17For over a quarter of a century the United States and the Soviet Union have been concentrating on the issues that divided themBerlin, the Middle East, Korea, Vietnam, Cuba and the organization of Western Europebut now, after many savage differences and pointless miseries, their leaders are getting together in Moscow to talk about limited but important areas of cooperation.

title: RISE IN PRICES SHOWN ON AMEX
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange made a significant gain yesterday as measured by the index, which rose 0.14 to close at 27.75. Volume increased to 4.7 million shares from 3.9 million.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: R. H. Hodges contention that the Third Reich  collapsed under the weight of strategic and tactical bombing [letter May 4] is contradicted by P. M. S. Blackett in his Fear, War, and the Bomb (1948).

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Today is the first constructive day I have ever spent in the Army Reserve. Today, instead of my regular Army Reserve meeting, which is characterized by naps, card games, obsolete G.I. training films, lousy food, haiicut inspections and groups of fatigueclad G.I.'s sticking out like sore thumbs in diners and bars, I went into the slums of Asbury Park.

title: ASHTON W. HAWKINS, INVESTMENT BANKER
description: Ashton W. Hawkins, an investment banker associated with the firm of Kidder, Peabody & Co., Inc., brokers, who also served as secretary and a director of Mercantile Stores, Inc., a department store chain, died yesterday at Hilaire Farms Nursing Home in Huntington, L. I. He was 77 years old and lived at Muttontown Road, Syosset, L. I.

title: Books of The Times
description: The single fact that emerges from reading of The Stones of Summer is of Dow Mossman's considerable talent. He comes on in this first novel with the strength and quality one remembers from Malamud's The Natural or Roth's Goodby, Columbus, although he works in an entirely different tradition. He has an endless supply of comic invention, a lyrical and sweet tone as natural to his writing as the song of a bird, and a way to use, manipulate and build on the tall tale that goes to the very heart of American writing. Exaggeration, hyperbole, inflated spoofing are as much part of his substance as they were of the circuit storytellers out of the West in the 19th century  Mark Twain included.

title: ENEMY ASSAULTS ARE BEATEN BACK OUTSIDE KONTUM
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Friday, May 19North Vietnamese troops, supported by tanks, made another series of attacks on Government positions only a mile and a half northwest of Kontum in the Central Highlands early today, but they were beaten back by a combination of American air strikes and resistance on the ground, according to allied reports.

title: Hanoi Getting Around Damage to Roads
description: HANOI, North ietnani, May 18Route 5, the road; linking Hanoi and Haiphong, was cut in the middle on May 11 by the bombing of a bridge at Haiduong Drivers now have to make a detour that involves two river crossings.

title: U.S. Says Flow is Disrupted
description: WASHINGTON, May 18 Jerry W. Friedheim, the Pentagon spokesman, said today that Russian diplomats in various cities had been apparently boasting of a continued flow of material to Noith Vietnam, and we have nothing flew to say about it.

title: WEINBERGER CALLS BUDGET RESTRAINED
description: CHICAGO, May 18  The 197374 Federal budget will reflect more fiscal restraint than budgets immediately preceding, it, Caspar W. Weinberger, new director of the Federal Office of Management and Budget, said here today.

title: Commodity Price Index Up 1.4 From WeekAgo Level
description: The commodity spot market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials rose to 120.0 from 118.6 last week.

title: Boy Killed by Sniper
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 18A 15yearold Protestant boy was shot dead by a sniper here tonight. A police spokesman said the boy was playing in the Protestant Lower Falls area when he was hit by automatic fire from a neighboring. Roman Catholic district.

title: B52 Is Relied On More Than Troops To Blunt Foe's Offensive in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 18  Despite four years of Vietnamization, American and South Vietnamese military commanders here have relied less on the Government's ground troops to stem the current North Vietnamese offensive than on an instrument of massive bombing that only the Americans have  the B52.

title: A Short Story Foretold Queen Elizabeth 2 Plot
description: Federal and local investigators are examining the pos that the anonymous caller who threatened to Blow, up the Queen Elizabeth 2 in the middle of the Atlantic Ocean was inspired by the first draft of a farcical short story read to a creative writing workshop at Hunter College Tuesday, night.

title: Golden Rule of Ecology
description: In the growing response to the environmental crisis it becomes increasingly clear that the first and underlying need is for a total transformation in our thinking and feeling about ourselves and the earth  as a whole. When even critics of a nogrowth society admit the necessity for a shift in our goals, a change of values from quantity to quality, one senses a movement toward such thinking as that of LviStrauss who believes that reestablishing a balance between man and his environment would take a greai spiritual revolution; or that of the historian Lynn White who says that more technology and more science aren't going to get us out of the present crisis until we find a new religion or rethink our old one.

title: Insiders Stockholdings
description: The American Stock Exchange this week issued its latest report on changes in stock ownership by large stockholders, directors and officers of its listed companies. The New York Stock Exchange made no list available.

title: Security Tight in Capital After Blast in Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Federal investigators searched for clues today in the rubble of a Pentagon rest room that was destroyed by an explosion early this morning, touching off tightened security procedures across Washington.

title: Bernstein Mass Held Offensive to Catholics
description: CINCINNATI, May 19The Most Rev. Paul F. Leibold, Roman catholic Archbishop of Cincinnati, has criticized Leonard Bernstein's Mass as offensive and was answered today by Julius Rudel, music director of the Cincinnati May Festival.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The Democratic Reform Commission agreed today that the party should hold a national conference every four years, between Presideatial, elections, to hammer out positions on issues and enhance political solidarity.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 The National Black Political Convention, its leadership divided over school busing and Israel, released today guidelines to be used for black political activity.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It takes a courageous man to admit an error, and such a man is Kenneth Clark. As an ardent proponent of community control of the New York City education system, Dr. Clark must have done some soulsearching before stating that school decentralization is failing to improve education because local boards were more interested in power than in better schools.

title: The Breathless 12, Rockette Alumnae, Kick Up a Storm
description: The twelve faces aren't as young as they used to be. But the 12 pairs of legs are as shapely as ever, and tonight they will be kicking up a storm  for charity, of course.

title: Price Rise 0.2% Here
description: In the New YorkNortheastern New Jersey area, the pace of price increases for goods and services rose twotenths of 1 per cent, in April, Herbert Bienstock, regional director of the Bureau of Labor Statistics, said yesterday.

title: JULIEN J. LEROY
description: Julien J. Leroy, former president of the African Metals Corporation of New York, died yesterday in Bruseels after a brief illness. He was 81 years old.

title: Braves Reed Injured
description: ATLANTA, May 19 (AP)The Atlanta Braves said today that Ron Reed suffered a hairline fracture on the little finger of his left hand Wednesday night in a game at Houston. The Braves said it wasn't known whether Reed would be able to make his next scheduled start at San Francisco Sunday.

title: Jewish Daily Forward to Mark 75th Year
description: In 1938, shortly after the Nazis unleashed their first major assault against Jews in Germany, several sinisterlooking m n appeared at the Jewish Daily Forward and demanded a private meeting with Abraham Cahan, its editor and cofounder.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 19 (UPI) Representative Shirley Chisholm, Democrat of Brooklyn, guarded by five Secret Servicemen, visited the penthouse headquarters of the Black Panther party last night, accepting a campaign contribution and thanking the Panthers for their support of her quest for the Democratic Presidential nomination.

title: Bomb Hoax Recalls Plane
description: CHICAGO, May 19 (AP)A United Air Lines 747 jetliner with 277 persons aboard was recalled in flight today and landed at O'Hare International Airport where a bomb threat proved to be a hoax. A United spokesman said that an anonymous telephone call had been received at a reservations desk that Flight 101 would blow up. No bomb was found aboard and the aircraft departed for Los Angeles about four hours late.

title: Indicted Russian Allowed to Go Home
description: With no objections from the United States, a Soviet citizen indicted on charges of espionage here was permitted last night to return to the Soviet Union by a Federal judge in Brooklyn.

title: AGNEW DISCOUNTS A CONNALLY RACE
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 Vice President Agnew said today that it would be totally unrealistic to expect the Republican National Convention to replace him with John It. Connally, the retiring Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Muscovites Benefit as City Spruces Up for Visitor
description: MOSCOW, May 19But Nixon has to come, objected a Muscovite at a time when the President's visit hung in doubt because of the confrontation over Haiphong. So many people are counting on getting new apartments because of his visit.

title: Search for 8 Called Off
description: BOSTON, May 19 (UPI)The Coast Guard yesterday said it had discontinued a search for eight persons reported to have abandoned a burning cabin cruiser on Tuesday off Martha's Vineyard. Cutters and ships were advised, however, to keep on the alert for the Mary Vee, the craft reported missing, and for a white dinghy in which the eight reportedly escaped.

title: Morrison Concert Of JazzRockFolk Among Year's Best
description: Finally Carnegie. Hall came up with a rock concert that was an absolute joy from start to finish, a prime example of what this music can be when it is at its very best. The person responsible fob it all was Van Morrison, a singersongwriterguitarist.

title: CANE PACE TAKEN BY HILARIOUS WAY
description: YONKERS, May 19It was, a case of like father, like son, tonight at Yonkers. Raceway as John Simpson Jr. drove Hilarious Way to an upset victory over the oddson favorite Strike Out in the.$107,097 Cane Pace, John Simpson Sr. in 1957 and 1958, had steered Nobel Adios and Torpid to victories in this prestigious event.

title: Light on Power
description: Three bills now in Congress give hope that the first elements of coherence may soon be introduced into the country's intensifying energy crisis. The purpose of all threeone introduced by the Administration, one by Representative Macdonald of Massachusetts and one by Representative Eckhardt of Texasis to bring some degree of order into the presently chaotic system of siting and certifying electric power plants.

title: New Orders in April Set Peak for Durable Goods
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 New orders for durable goods rose in April from an upwardrevised March level and reached a record, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Continued Operating Loss Reported by Collins Radio
description: The Collins Radio Company reported yesterday that had an operating loss of $6.5million in the quarter ended April 28, compared with a deficit of $6.6million in the corresponding period last year.

title: Dance: A Particularly Festive Mood
description: New York City Ballet seemed in particulttrly festive mood Thursday night at the New York State Theater, when the program consisted of Donizetti Variations, The Concert and Who Cares?

title: SAIGON'S TROOPS BATTLE THEIRWAY CLOSER TO ANLOC
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Saturday, May 20South Vietnmese troops fought a series of clashes along a 15mile stretch of road yesterday in a fresh atempt to break a monthlong impasse, and relieve the besieged provincial capital of Anloc.

title: Potential Assailants Reported At Two Earlier Wallace Rallies
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., May 19Capt. E. C. Dothard, the Alabama state trooper who was wounded Monday with Gov. George C. Wallace, disclosed today that persons suspected as wouldbe attackers were either arrested or chased away from two earlier political rallies in Maryland.

title: BONN'S UPPER HOUSE APPROVES TREATIES
description: BONN, May 19  The upper house of West Germany's Parliament completed ratification today of the controversial treaties with Moscow and Warsaw by letting them pass uncontested by the conservative Opposition.

title: Nixon Plan to Halt Busing Assailed at Session Here
description: President Nixon's proposed moratorium on busing to achieve racial integration in schools came under attack yesterday at the annual institute of the N.A.A.C.P. Legal Defense and Educational Fund, Inc., in the Americana Hotel.

title: CashIns Of Funds Reach a Peak Level
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Investors cashed in substantially more mutual fund shares during April than they purchased, pushing up netredemption figures to a record level for the month, the Investment Company Institute announced today.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: StudebakerWorthington, Inc., yesterday announced that it was accepting, at $45 a share net to seller, all of the approximately 1,031,000 shares of its common stock tendered in connection with its purchase offer which expired May 12. Last Monday the company announced that it would accept 1 million of some 1,250,000 shares tendered and that proration would be necessary. It was later determined that in excess of 200,000 shares had been improperly tendered. The company's stock, traded on the New York Stock Exchange, was up 2 at 47 at the close yesterday.

title: DAVID FERGUSON, 85, A LAWYER 51 YEARS
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 18 David Ferguson, a retired partner in the law firm of White & Case, died last evening in Mercy Hospital, Rockville Centre. He was 85 years old.

title: Newspaper Strike Is Over In Cleveland After 3 Days
description: CLEVELAND, May 19Negotiators for Cleveland's two daily newspapers and striking newspaper truck drivers reached an agreement today that ended threeday newspaper strike.

title: Wallace Is Visited In Hospital by Nixon
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., May 19Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama got a surprise visit from President Nixon today and then sat for a while in hospital chair and took his first food since he was shot on Monday. Until today he had been fed intravenously.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Supreme Court Justice Joseph A. Martinis refused yesterday to withdraw from the Harlem Four murder case as the defense team urged him to do Wednesday. In a telephone call to the four defense lawyers, the judge said bad denied their motion asking him to step down from the complicated eightyearold case.

title: Stage: Antigorta Perez
description: Only genuine, stirring theater performed in the nave of a huge church, could make you forget the premises.

title: COPPERPRICE DATA SOUGHT BY U.S. JURY
description: A Federal grand jury Investigation into the pricing methods used by domestic copper producers has led to the widespread issuing of subpoenas for corporate records dating back more than a decade.

title: Man in the News
description: DENVER, May 19After his election Tuesday as moderator of the 184th General Assembly, of the United Presbyterian :Church in the U. A., C. Willard Heckel was asked why he thought he had won suCh.a substantial majority on the first ballot. I have to be bon est, replied Mr. Heckel, professor and former dean of the Rutgers University Law School. Perhaps the Assembly appreciated that directness,.that honesty, that frankness.

title: Roundup: Stargell, Moose Spark 80 Pirate Victory
description: Willie Stargell, no strange; er to the hero's role in Pittsburgh's baseball fortunes, combined his bat with the pitching talent of Bob Moose last night and the outcome was an 80 victory over Montreal.

title: Conservative Gets U.S. Post
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (UPI) President Nixon today named Kieran O'Doherty of Hampton Bays, LI., a founder of the Conservative Party in New York, to be a member of the Foreign Claims Settlement Commission. He succeeds Sidney Friedberg. The commission was established in 1954 to determine claims of the United States citizens against foreign I governments.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Four weeks ago when North Vietnam invaded South Vietnam it clearly dispelled any, doubts as to whether the conflict is a civil war or not. The action of the Communists has proved once and for all that it is not a civil war but a coldblooded attempt by a Communist country to forcibly take over a free one.

title: 15 Injured in Hamburg Blasts At Springer's Publishing Plant
description: BONN, May 19The Hamburg headquarters of the huge Axel Springer newspaper and magazine publishing concern was rocked by bomb blasts today in West Germany's fifth major bombing incident since May 11.

title: Soviet Ship Going to Canton
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Qualified diplomatic sources said today that the Chinese Government had agreed to allow the Pevek, a Soviet freighter damaged during a United States bombing attack on Haiphong on April 16, to put in at Canton for repairs.

title: CANONERO II BACK FOR CARTER TODAY
description: Can Carionero II, the South American surprise'colt of 1971, come back?

title: NIXON CONFIDENT ON EVE OF HIS TRIP
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 President Nixon said tonight that the main goal of his trip to the Soviet Union was to establish a different relationship between the two great powers so that they work together rather than against each other.

title: Swedish Team Routs U.S. in Table Tennis
description: Whether or not Sweden's tabletennis team is better than that of the Chinese remains to be determined by a confrontation between the two.

title: NO BOMBS FOUND AS LINER SAILS ON
description: LONDON, May 19A meticulous search of the 13 decks of the Queen Elizabeth 2 failed to uncover any explosives, and the luxury liner continued toward France at normal speed.

title: Castro Sees Sofia Facilities
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, May 19 (UPI)Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba toured scientific institutions today with Premier Todor Zhivkov of Bulgaria.

title: Attack on Kontum Fails
description: KONTUM, South Vietnam, May 19The shelling began at about 1 A.M. today and from 2 to 7 o'clock North Vietnamese ground forces tried to breach the lines of the South Vietnamese 23d Division.

title: Different Times Closing
description: Different Times, a musical with book, lyrics and music by Michael Brown, will end its Broadway run tonight at the ANTA Theater after 24 performances. The show was pro duced by Bowman Productions, Inc., in association with William L. Witt and William Gumperz.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SALEM, Ore., May 19 (UPI) Senator George McGovern, campaigning in Oregon's forests, announced today that he would side against liberal colleagues and support an antibusing compromise in Congress.

title: JACK STAHL
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N. Y., May 19Jack Stahl, a realestate operator and owner of a stable of horses, died in New Rochelle Hospital yesterday after a brief illness. He was 60 years old and lived at 68 Seacord Road.

title: Merger News
description: Cooper Industries, Inc., diversified company based in Houston, announced yesterday a proposal to acquire the Nicholson File Company of East Providence, R.I. The proposal, which was submitted to the management of Nicholson, calls for the issuance of one share of a new Cooper cumulative convertible preferred stock for each share of Nicholson. The new stock will pay an annual dividend of $2.50 a share and will be callable after five years at $57.50 and then will decline to $52.50 after 15 years.

title: COLUMBIA U. WINS ROUND ON REACTOR
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 An Atomic Energy Commission unit has agreed to let Columbia University operate a small nuclear research reactor on Morningside Heights, overruling a decision made last year in a case that has spanned eight years.

title: Merrill Lynch in a LongTerm Move
description: The Thundering Herd is on the move.

title: Oil Spill Soaks Beach, at Lake George
description: LAKE GEORGE, N. Y., May 19  About 5,000 gallons of light oil poured out of an untended valve at a fuelstorage depot here and into scenic Lake George today, killing fish in al small area at the southern tip and soaking a state beach.

title: Nets to Bid for Series Tie. Today
description: On the 50th day since their first American Basketball Association playoff game, the New York Nets will try to prolong their postseason play further this afternoon at the Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I.

title: Officials Are Alarmed
description: TOKYO, May, 19 (AP)Japanese electronics manufacturers and government officials reacted with surprise today to word that the United States Treasury had begun a largescale investigation into possible subsidies accompanying exports of electronics products from Japan.

title: Retail Meat Prices. Stable Here Despite Rises in Wholesale Cost
description: The Nixon Administration's effort to hold down meat prices appears to have had an effect on the New York retail food market, keeping most meat prices stable in the face of wholesale advances and even bringing about slight price declines on a few cuts.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Signings. The President signed three bills today. One would authorize the Secretary of Agriculture to employ volunteers to work without compensation in the forest Service. One bill is a $1.6billion appropriation to maintain the value of the holdings of dollars in the International Monetary Fund. He also signed a resolution deploring the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace.

title: Senate Panel Demurs on Nuclear Plants
description: WASHINGTON, May 19An Administrationbacked bill for the temporary licensing of nuclear power plants met unexpected resistance in the Senate today.

title: Nixon Authorizes Shift of the International Route to Canada
description: WASHINGTON, May 19 (AP)  The Civil Aeronautics Board approved today the merger of Northeast Airlines into Delta Air Lines.

title: ANTHONY J. SCANLON, INVESTIGATION AIDE
description: Anthony J. Scanlon, assistant chief of the New York District Attorney's investigation bureau, died here Thursday night, after a brief illness. He was 70 years old and lived at 225 West 12th Street.

title: LEONARD T. CALVERT
description: GRANBY, Conn., May 19 (UPI)Leonard T. Calvert, who represented this community in the State Legislature in 1959 and 1961, died yesterday. He was 52 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I fully agree with your May 5 editorial The Record on Abortion. I presume that the infant mortality rates refer to 24.4 (1969) and 20.7 (1971) deaths, per 1,000 rather than per 100 births.

title: Drugs Through the Ages: A Smithsonian Perspective
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The season's tourists now beginning to flood into Washington may be puzzled by a special exhibition about drugs that they can hardly avoid.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon, like his predecessor, is loathe to appear in future history books as the first U.S. President to lose a war. That's a modest enough ambition, but let us hope he manages to temper his publicized penchant for tossing off a flamboyant counterpunch when everyone is expecting him to fall on his face.

title: Princeton Disciplines 89 For Taking Over Building
description: PRINCETON, N.J., May 19The judicial committee of Princetoh University today placed 89 students on disciplinary probation for their part in the occupation of the school's main administration building one month ago.

title: The Hague, Peking Raise Ties to Ambasador Level
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May. 19The Netherlands Government has announced here that its diplomatic mission in Peking and China's in The Hague now have the full status of embassies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: With the spring weather coming, my fancy has been turned to bicycles. I've been thinking of cycling to work and therefore took the precaution of asking the security guards in the General Motors Building if bicycles are permitted on the premises.

title: Madagascar Leader Is Urged to Resign
description: TANANARIVE, Madagascar, May 19 (AP)A huge crowd led by students gathered in Tananarive, Madagascar's capital, today and roared demands that President Philibert Tsiranana resign within 24 hou'rs.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SALEM, Ore., May 19Cesar Chavez, the director of the United Farm Workers Organizing Committee and a leader among California's MexicanAmericans, endorsed Senator George McGovern's Presidential candidacy today. The two men will appear together tomorrow in Phoenix.

title: Makolm's Birthday Is Observed Here With Visit to Grave
description: Observances of the birthday of Malcolm X were held yesterday amid a controversy surrounding the first fulllength Hollywood feature film on the life of the slain black leader. He would have been 47 years old yesterday.

title: ARMS PACT LINKED WITH OPEN SKIES
description: WASHINGTON, May 19Administration sources report that the United States and the Soviet Union will pledge not to interfere with each other's reconnaissance satellites as part of the agreements to limit strategic weapons that President Nixon is expected to initial during his talks; Moscow next week.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: A Federal Court judge who had ruled that the present method of selecting the commissioners of the city's Board of Elections was unconstitutional was urged yesterday to permit Mayor Lindsay to appoint them.

title: U.S. Newsman Is Wounded By Shrapnel Near Anloc
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 19 (AP) David DeVoss, a correspondent for TimeLife, was wounded today during North Vietnamese shelling of the Government relief force trying to reach the belaguered provincial capital of Anloc.

title: GUNFIRE IN ULSTER KILLS YOUTH OF 13
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 19 (UPI)A 13yearold boy died of gunshot wounds on the way to a Londonderry hospital Friday night shortly after British troops reported hitting a sniper who had opened fire on their observation post.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: PROVIDENCE, R. L, May 19 Senator Edmund S. Muskie, Democrat of Maine, today laid part of the blame for the attempted assassination of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama at the feet of an unresponsive Government.

title: PhilcoFord Will Phase Out TV Plant in Philadelphia
description: The PhilcoFord Corporation, a subsidiary of the Ford Motor Company, announced that it would phase out its Philadelphia television assembly plant, which employs about 1,600 hourly workers, during 1973 or early 1974.

title: APRIL'S PRICE RISE MODERATE AT 02%; FOOD COST STABLE
description: WASHINGTON, May 19The rise in consumer prices remained moderate April, in good part because of a second month of essentially stable food prices, the Labor Department reported today.

title: GUARD MAY ADMIT MEN FACING DRAFT
description: WASHINGTON May 19 (UPI) To increase depleted ranks of the National Guard and Army Reserves, the Selective Service Systern proposed today that for the first time men who  have already received their induction notices be allowed to enlist in the Guard or reserves.

title: THE 1972 CAMPAIGN
description: SOUTH GATE, Calif., May 19 (UPI)  California Young Americans for Freedom, which backed Republican Presidential nominees, Senator Barry Goldwater in 1964 and Richard M. Nixon in 1968, has endorsed Mr. Nixon's rival, Representative John M. Ashbrook, for the 1972 nomination, it announced today.

title: India Orders Guarding Of Border Airspace
description: NEW DELHI, May 19After new border violations on the IndiaPakistan frontier, the Indian Government announced today that its military commanders in the area had been instructed to shoot down any Pakistani aircraft that crossed the ceasefire line.

title: Soviet Party Is Briefed as Trip Nears
description: MOSCOW, May 19Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet party leader, gave a meeting of the Communist Central Committee a fulldress review of the international situation today in preparation for President Nixon's visit beginning Monday.

title: 3 TOMBS INMATES LOSE DEFENSE BID
description: Three prisoners charged with kidnaping in connection with the 197b rebellion in the Manhattan House of Detention for Men will not be allowed to show their trial jury the prison conditions that they assert justified, the uprising, Supreme Court., Justice Harold Birns ruled, yesterday.

title: The Nixon Doctrine and the Mideast
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  During the Presidential campaign of 1968, candidate Richard Nixon pledged to guarantee Israel a margin of technological and military superiority over the Arab world of more than 100 million people. This pledge marked a dignificant shift in the methods to be used in advancing America's MiddleEast policy.

title: 17 IN WAR PROTEST AT CORNELL FINED
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 19 Seventeen antiwar demonstrators were found guilty of civil contempt here today for their role in the fiveday antiwar occupation of Cornell's Carpenter Hall last month., They were fined $250 each.

title: 2d Blood Washout On Record Saves Pennsylvania Boy, 7
description: SAYRE, Pa., May 19 (UPI)Working from notes taken during a phone call to San Antonio, Tex., doctors at the Robert Packer Hospital here performed the second successful blood washout operation in the last two months. Details of the operation were announced today.

title: A Renoir and 2 Delacroix Stolen From Paris Opera
description: PARIS, May 19A Renoir and two Delacroix paintings of world repute have been stolen from the Paris Opera, it was reported today.

title: FORD FUND SHIFTS PROXY PRACTICES
description: WASHINGTON, May 191 The Ford Foundation disclosed today that it was now reviewing stockholder proposals more closely before deciding how to vote the stock it holds in hundreds of American corporations.

title: Graduates of Sarah Lawrence Honor Their Dance Teacher
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., May 19 Bessie Schonberg, a distinguished teacher of dance and director of the Sarah Lawrence dance department since 1941, was honored last night by former students now active in the professional field.

title: Chapman Takes Medal In Travis Golf With 73
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 19  Reggie Chapman of the Greenwich Country Club beat the rain by about an hour and his closest rival by two strtites today and won the medal in the 62d annual Walter J. Travis Memorial Golf tournament with a per 36, 3773 et the Garden City Golf Club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: The East Harlem Community Corporation finds it difficult to understand your editorial allegations titled School Board Turmoil (April 26). Members of the East Harlem Community Corporation have brazenly intimidated the Community Board [Local School Board District No. 4] during its public meetings.

title: Lincoln's Director Says He Requested 40 More Guards
description: The executive director of Lincoln Hospital, Julio Galarce, said yesterday that he had recommended to the Health and Hospitals Corporation that 40 additional security men be assigned to the hospital and that other steps be taken to improve security there.

title: Books of The Times
description: IT was Vine Deloria, I think, who remarked sardonically that every Indian family has its house anthropologist. Vintent:Crapanzano, who is an anthropologist and who has in The Fifth World of Forster Bennett written about a Navaho family, would understand that remark. For he lilmself comments on the innocence and the arrogance of an AngloEasterner who pushes himself onto an Indian reservation for a short stay was seven weeks) and then Writes a dehumanized brief in the name of science, Where his book differs from thcise of other investigators who have, made the same journey is that in it the theorizing has been reduced to a minimum and no towers of speculation have been erected on a few paltry facts. You would be hard put lo find a single generalization in the text. He is not even always sure of the facts: He can say what he saw and heard and tell what happened, but he is never sure how much is being offered for his benefit. He is very much aware, and he soon, makes the reader aware, that he a disturbing element in the social complex he has come to study and that his presence alters the evidence that he is compiling.

title: STOCK PRICES GAIN ON AMEX AND OTC
description: Optimistic sentiment following through on Thursday's rise took stock prices up again yesterday on the American Stock Exchange. The index closed at 27.86, up 0.11. The close was 0.38 ahead of Friday a week ago.

title: Prisoner of Nazis Says She Believes Queens Woman Was Guard Who Killed Camp Inmate
description: A woman who was once a prisoner in a Nazi concentrathin camp said yesterday that she believed that Mrs. Hermine Ryan was the camp guard who, she said, had killed an inmate and had beaten her and another woman prisoner.

title: Miss Burfeindt, With 68, Sets PAce In Bluegrass Golf
description: LOUISVIR, E, Ky., May 19 (UPI)Betty Burfeindt, a former physical education teacher, rolled in, three straight birdies today en route to a 68, 4under par, and a 2stroke lead in the $25,000 Bluegrass invitation golf tournament.

title: COUNCIL MAY BAR NUISANCE TAXES
description: City Council leaders told Mayor Lindsay yesterday that the $141million package of socalled nuisance taxes he sought to balance the budget was dead.

title: Letters to the Editor
