description: BALTIMORE, May 21 (AP)Bee Bee Bee, the Preakness winner, and two other Preakness finishers remained at Pimlico Race Course today as four horses were venned from Baltimore to Belmont Park in New York for the Belmont Stakes June 10.

title: Kremlin Demotes Shelest, HardLiner Toward West
description: MOSCOW, May 21The Soviet leadership announced today the demotion of a member of the ruling Politburo who is known as an opponent of the Kremlin's policy of accommodation with the Western powers.

title: Qualifying Ends for 500 With Only One Bumping
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 21Qualifying for next Saturday's Indianapolis 500 auto race was completed this afternoon, with the field filled to 33 starters in a lethargic session that was an anticlimax to the previous days.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Nearly four years ago, in its national party platform, the Republican party made the following pledges to the American people:

title: Hue Curator Fears for Art Treasures
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 17 Ung Tuong, the frail curator of the Hue Museum, spoke with urgency. He could not keep his right foot from tapping.

title: Some Delegates Critical of U. S. Approach to U. N. Conference on Ecology
description: WASHINGTON, May 21. Two weeks before the opening of the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment in Stockholm, the State Department, which is responsible for preparing the United States position, finds itself the target of assorted angers, frustrations, resentments and suspicions.

title: Bomb Wrecks Dublin Shop
description: DUBLIN, May 21 (UPI)An incendiary bomb disguised as a pack of cigarettes started a fire today that destroyed a clothing store in downtown Dublin. In 11 other stores, the police found similar devices that had not exploded.

title: KATHY CORNELIUS WINS GOLF EVENT
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky., May 21Mrs. Kathy Cornelius, a 39yearold tour pro, gained her first tournament triumph since 1962 with a suddendeath overtime victory over Gloria Ehret in the Bluegrass invitation golf.

title: Moscow Detains Jewish Activists For Nixon's Visit
description: MOSCOW, May 21The Soviet police today rounded up an undetermined number of Jewish activists, including prominent computer expert, for detention during President Nixon's visit here, which starts tomorrow.

title: The Fashion Show For Big and Small
description: Pity the women who sit through a fashion show and know that they are either too tall, too short, too thin or, maybe most painful of all, too fat to wear any of the clothes.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today May 22, 1972
description: Social Committee10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: Pappian Way Leads to Theater Heights
description: Somewhere, orbiting in the vast interstices between reality and illusion, Joseph Papp has collided with his own star, and the result is a constellation.

title: Miss Linda S. Wachtenheim Is Bride of Robert S. Schwarz
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., May 21 Temple EmanuEl was the setting this evening for the marriage of Miss Linda Susan Wachtenheim, a candidate for a master's degree in speech pathology and audiology at Columbia University, to Robert Steven Schwarz, who is with Zuckerman, Smith & Co., stockbrokers in NeW York. The ceremony was performed by Rabbis Eli A. Bohnen and Joel H. Zaiman, assisted by Cantor Ivan I. Perlman.

title: MERRICK CAPTURES SOLING CLASS TRIAL
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., May 21Sam Merrick of the Severn Sailing Association took first place today in light northerly air and won the Atlantic Coast Olympic trials for Soling Class yachts.

title: Saturn Airways Struck
description: OAKLAND, Calif., May 21 (UPI)Pilots for Saturn Airways, a supplemental airlines that concentrates on the domestic charter market, walked off the job today after contract negotiations broke down.

title: Red Smith
description: BALTIMORE, May 21Glum as the sullen skies, the cavalry dispersed today, leaving a litter of broken records and trampled hopes in the mud of Pimlico Race Course. The records involved money. When the 97th Preakness stakes drew the biggest crowd in Maryland racing history in spite of weather that must have reduced infield picnickers by at least 10,000, the result was the liveliest business ever enjoyed by a gambling joint in this state, where playing the horses has been a way of life since George Washington was losing his frilled shirt at Annapolis. Yesterday's gathering of 48,721, the $3,304,361 bet on nine races and the $821,961 on the Preakness all were new highs.

title: TREVINO IS VICTOR IN MEMPHIS GOLF
description: MEMPHIS, May 21 (AP)Lee Trevino today captured the Danny ThomasMemphis open golf tournament for the second straight year.

title: Protestants in Clash With Police Moving Belfast Barricades
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 21  Protestants in two parts of Belfast clashed today with British troops trying to remove barricades erected along main traffic routes.

title: Not by Bread Alone
description: Education in and for a free society has many goalssome concrete and pragmatic, others intangible and idealistic. Schools cannot ignore the realities of a world in which the capacity to earn a living is not easily divorced from the pursuit of happiness. But it is risk to suggest that it is the mark of educational realism press for a new public school philosophy which seems to say that man does live by bread alone.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: PHUCLOC, North VietnamAt the southern boundary of the city of Haiphong the rice fields begin. The vista of watery green stretches out to the horizon, broken only by the occasional island of a tiny village.

title: KISSINGER ASSERTS WAR WON'T IMPAIR
description: SALZBURG, Austria, May 21 Henry A. Kissinger, President Nixon's adviser for national security, expressed confidence today that the enemy offensive in South Vietnam, and the Administration's responses to it, would not upset efforts to improve SovietAmerican relations.

title: City Official Says State Units Balk Enforcing of Firearms Law
description: Enforcement of the city's firearms law has been damaged effectively by the refusal of two state agencies to cooperate with the city's Firearms Control Board, according to Daniel Greer, director of the city agency.

title: Police on a Stakeout Kill Holdup Suspect in Chelsea
description: An alleged holdup man was shot and killed by two detectives who had staked out a bar and grill in the Chelsea district yesterday evening.

title: U.S. GROUPS FEEL GOLDPRICE RISES
description: Rising gold prices, up about 30 per cent since the beginning of the year, with half that increase coming during the last two weeks, have created a dramatic ripple effect in the United States.

title: Jackson and Muskie Cling To Support in Home States
BOND EN EXPECT PAUSE FOR RATES
description: The bond market last week posted its first gain, though a modest one, since April as corporations and governments continued to make only small demands for capital while fears of high inflation appeared to subside.

title: CONGRESS PANEL ASSAILS CONTROLS
description: WASHINGTON, May 21 The Joint Economic Committee of Congress issued today a report attacking the wage and price control program as ineffective and unfair.

title: Roundup: Lolich Posts 8th Victory, 50
description: Mickey Lolich of the Detroit Tigers, who ran second to Vida Blue in the voting for the American League's Cy Young Award last season despite bettering the Oakland lefthander in most statistical departments, seems determined to capture the award this year.

title: The Gold Bugs
description: The price of gold in several free markets soared above $58 an ounce last week$20 higher than the new official price of $38 which the ten major industrial nations the nonCommunist world agreed to last December.

title: Greek Premier at Church
description: ATHENS, Greece, May 21 (AP)  Premier George Papadopoulos, in his capacity as Regent, led members of his armybacked Government to religious services today marking King Constantine's name day. It was the first time since Premier Papadopoulos assumed full power that he had attended church services on St. Constantine's and St. Helen's Day. King Constantine lives in Rome with his family.

title: Household Finance Lifted Earnings in First Quarter
description: Net income of the Household Finance Corporation rose 14.4 per cent in the first quarter to $22,987,000, or 79 cents a share, from the yearearlier $20,090,000, or 68 cents a share, the company reported this weekend.

title: CHARLES J. SCHULZ
description: RED BANK, N.J., May21Charles J. Schulz, an electrical engineer who was supervisor of systems for Bell Telephone Laboratories, died last night in Riverview Hospital, after a long illness. He was 49 years old and lived at 83 West River Road in Rumson.

title: A RAMPARTS ISSUE HALTED IN DISPUTE
description: BERKELEY, Calif. May 21The June issue of Ramparts magazine h:..s been withdrawn from newsstands in the East and has not been delivered to Western dealers after the Pacific Telephone and Telephone Company threatened to seek criminal prosecution because of the issue.

title: Great Pyrenees Named Long Island K.C. Best
description: GLEN COVE, L.I. May 21A big white shaggy dog, Ch. Karolaska Glacier, rumbled across the sundrenched ring on the beautiful grounds of the Harrison House today and won the approval of Mrs. Nicholas A. Demidoff as the best of all the dogs at the 70th show of the Long Island Kennel Club.

title: State Department's Expert on Europe Martin Joseph Hillenbrand
description: WASHINGTON, May 21At a time when the conduct of foreign affairs is increasingly centered on the White House, Martin J. Hillenbrand stands as a reminder that the department can turn out topflight diplomats who provide the core of what is known as the career foreign service. Marty's success proves that it just is not true that decent guys finish last, a friend said aft er Mr. Hillenbrand, currently the Assistant Secretary of State for European Affairs, was confirmed by the Senate as the next United States Ambassador to West Germany. He plans to move to Bonn soon after he returns from the Soviet Union, wlv!re he is in President Nixon's party.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Two thousand members of Jewish cultural, labor and welfare organizations, men and women whose parents founded The Jewish Daily Forward 75 years ago and who, as some of its readers, help maintain it as a landmark institution of American culture, thronged Philharmonic Hall at Lincoln Center yesterday for the Publication's anniversary celebration.

title: Chicano in His Cabinet Promised by Humphrey
Miss Milstein Married Here
description: Miss Roslyn Milstein was married here last evening to Jerome Harris Meyer by Rabbi Robert Gordis at the Plaza.

title: 20 Are Killed and 3 Survive In Airliner Crash Off Angola
description: LOBITO, Angola, May 21 (UPI) Twenty persons died and three survived today when a twinengined turboprop airliner of Angola Airlines crashed into the sea attempting to land at Lobito airport, the airline announced.

title: Coast Rivals Differ in Approach to Voters
HUNDREDS BATTLE POLICE AT CAPITOL
description: WASHINGTON, May 21As antiwar protesters rallied peacefully on the Capitol grounds, breakaway group of a few hundred youths battled the police today.

title: Women Legislators Start to Challenge Male Colleagues'
description: POCONO MANOR, Pa., May 21Women who serve in state legislatures believe that they are generally more industrious, more informed, more ethical, and more sexually pure and sober than their male colleagues but they still seldom reach leadership positions, according to views expressed at a meeting of women legislators here. They are beginning, however, to challenge their relatively powerless status inside the state houses.

title: Executives Counseling Students
description: Harriet Offutt is a wellgroomed young woman who lives on the East Side. She attended private schools, she is an executive at the Continental Can Company and she has a boyfriend who tells her, teasingly, that anyone who works on the West Side needs a passport to get there.

title: Steady Demand for Steel Is Reported by Producers
description: PITTSBURGH, May 21Steel producers reported steady demand last week. Order rates continued to indicate a relatively shallow dip in July. Shipping statistics suggested the spring peak would not be quite as high as expected.

title: MerzarioMunari, In Ferrari, Capture Targa Florio Race
description: CERDA, Sicily, May 21 (UPI) A Ferrari driven by Arturo Merzario and Sandro Munari of Italy outlasted a starting field of 76 today and won the the Targa Florio, the oldest road race in the world.

title: WESTINGHOUSE CO. TO ERECT HOUSING
description: The Westinghouse Electric Corporation said yesterday it would take part in a $100million joint venture to build 3,500 middleincome housing units on a tract on the Staten Island waterfront just south of the St. George ferry terminal.

title: Franco Marks War Victory
description: MADRID, May 21 (Reuters)  Generalissimo Francisco Franco, the 79yearold Chief of State, who has been ill for the last eight days, today reviewed a military parade marking the 33 danniversary of his victory in the Spanish Civil War. General Franco had been suffering from a gum infection that forced him to call off planned trip and regular audiences last week.

title: People in West, After 27 Years of Peace, Concentrate on Issues Close to Home
description: LONDON, May 21A young Danish soldier said that the Russians were not going to cause any trouble. A West Berlin housewife reported that while she didn't trust the Russians, she didn't expect to see their tanks come rolling in. A grocer in north London said he once worried about the bomb, but no longer, because the Russians and the Americans have come to realize that it means extermination of the world.

title: Politics and the Old Sales Pitch
description: STEVENSON, Md.To sophisticated political observers, Joe Napolitan is probably more famous than Joe Staszak. But, believe it or not, they're both in the same business: the election of political candidates.

title: Indian Death Toll Is 247 In a 2Week Heat Wave
description: NEW DELHI, May 21 (UPI) A heat wave sweeping across northern India has killed 247 persons in the last two weeks, Indian news agencies reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Poor Nations Unhappy as U.N. Talks End
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 21A conference of rich and poor countries on trade and development ended here today after five weeks of largely futile negotiations and debates on key issues.

title: PENTAGON SCORED ON COPTER COSTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 21The Defense Department was accused by Representative Les Aspin today of violating a Congressional directive by ordering the development of two heavylift helicopters instead of one that could be used by alt the armed services.

title: Two Stabs at Kontum
description: KONTUM, South Vietnam, May 21North Vietnamese in, filtration forces twice occupied South Vietnamese trenches, just north of Kontum today.

title: Flyers Hire Farm Coach
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 21 (AP)The Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League have named Larry Wilson as coach of their American Hockey League team at Richmond.

title: Miss Kusner Is Victor
description: WIESBADEN. Germany, May 21 (AP)  Kathy Kusner of Monkton, Md., rode Nirwana to victory today in the Amazon jump at the Wiesbaden international equestrian event. The American horse covered the course faultlessly in 58.5 seconds.

title: Churchill Grandson Says Appeal In Fulton, Mo., Went Unheeded
description: FULTON, Mo., May 21  A quarter of a century after his famous grandfather came to Fulton to warn that a Soviet Iron Curtain was closing on the freedom of Eastern Europe, Winston Churchill 2d said here today that a new balance of world power had, emerged in the Middle East and in Asia.

title: No Postponement
description: William D. Ruckelshaus, Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency, has shown admirable courage in rejecting the automobile industry's request for year's postponement in applying the new pollution control standards.

title: HALEY IS LEAVING IN POLICE DISPUTE
description: Deputy police Commissioner Robert Daley yesterday announced his resignation as the department's spokesman and Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy said later he had sought the resignation.

title: YANKEES DEFEAT RED SOX, 63, 32
description: So many pleasant things happened to the New York Yankees as they swept a doubleheader at Yankee Stadium yesterday that a simple catalogue of satisfactions best suits their story.

title: Sanda Rodgers Wed to Joseph Magnet
description: Miss Sande Lynn Rodgers was married here yesterday afternoon to Joseph Elliot Magnet. Rabbi Byron T. Rubenstein performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Dan Rodgers of 911 Park Avenue. The bridegroom is the son of Dr. and Mrs. Harry Magnet of Fall River, Mass.

title: North Korea Exhibits Farm as a Shining Example of Progress
description: CEIONGSAN, North Korea, May 20The 650 families at the Chongsanri Cooperative Farm, 18 miles west of Pyongyang, represent this country's showcase agricultural enterprise.

title: How to Help Millions
description: Last year, contributions to the United Fund of Greater New York, now conducting its annual campaign, helped 425 community services and Red Cross to meet the many problems that affect all New Yorkers. By pledging to support the aged, blood collection, handicapped, blind and emotionally disturbed, contributors insure that their dollars will quickly go to work to help millions of people.

title: CITY BALLET DOES WORK BY ROBBINS
description: Allegra Kent, who appeared in Jerome Robbin's The Goldberg Variations when the New York City Ballet called it a work in progress at Saratoga in the summer of 1970, appeared in the ballet for the first time here Saturday night at the New York State Theater. It was the ballet's first performance of the season.

title: More Trains Said to Carry Aid
description: PEKING, May 21 (Reuters)Diplomatic sources said today that the Chinese were diverting trains to carry increased aid to North Vietnam in an effort to offset the effects of the American blockade of North Vietnamese ports.

title: Manhattan College Class Urged to Face Issues
description: Commencement exercises were held yesterday by Manhattan College, a Catholic men's institution in the Bronx, and Marymount College, a private women's institution in Tarrytown.

title: New State Law, Ready to Sign, To Give Exporters Tax Relief
description: A state DISC lawa measure to give exporters in New York State a deferment on their state income taxes similar to that provided in new Federal legislation  is awaiting signature by Governor Rockefeller.

title: Old St. Patrick's Cathedral Is Rededicated
description: Old St. Patrick's Cathedral, tucked away in an undistinguished corner of Lower Manhattan and just a few steps from the Bowery and Chinatown, was rededicated yesterday by Cardinal Cooke.

title: R.L. MONTAGUE, 75, MARINE GENERAL
description: URBANNA, Va., May 21Brig. Gen. Robert Latane Montague, U.S.M.C., retired, muchdecorated veteran of both World Wars, died Friday at his home here. He was 75 years old.

title: Stern Shows Fine Form In Hunter Violin Recital
description: Hunter College's prestigious Saturday Evening Concert Series ended for the season this weekend with a recital by Isaac Stern. The violinist drew a full house with extra seats placed on stage and at the sides of the auditorium and all were occupied.

title: Youth's Immolation Said to Stir Rioting In a Lithuanian City
description: MOSCOW, May 21 (AP)Reliable sources said today that several thousand youths battled Soviet policemen and soldiers in the Lithuanian city of Kaunas last week in a riot that developed after a young Roman Catholic publicly burned himself to death for political reasons.

title: Policeman's Shot At Fleeing Driver Kills Bronx Woman
description: A Bronx housewife on her way to a grocery store was shot to death yesterday afternoon by a patrolman who the police said was trying to halt a car whose driver had gone through three red lights.

title: U.S. Aides Call Offensive A Political Move by Hanoi
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 21Highly placed American intelligence sources believe that the North Vietnamese offensive was not intended to be a decisive campaign for total military victory, but an effort to establish a better base for the political struggle in Vietnam and for the negotiations in Paris.

title: Peking Attacks U.S. and Soviet As the World's Archcriminals
description: PEKING, May 21President Nixon's departure for the Soviet Union was marked in Peking yesterday by the pubI lication of the strongest attack China has made on either the United States or the Soviet Union in several months.

title: ELIZABETH TAKES SOCCER CUP FINAL
description: For the sixth year in a row, the United States Challenge Cup, the most coveted prize in American soccer, will remain in the East as Elizabeth of New Jersey defeated the San Pedro (Calif.) Yugoslays, 10, yesterday in the final of the 60yearold national competition.

title: Mayor to Name Aurelio to CharterRevision Panel
description: Mayor Lindsay said last night that he intended to appoint Richard R. Aurelio, the former Deputy Mayor and manager of his defunct Presidential campaign, to serve on the proposed state commission to revise the New York City Charter.

title: Unionism's New Frontier
description: After a full generation of stagnation in unionism's traditional bluecollar strongholds, labor organization is suddenly racing ahead in fields where Samuel Gompers never would have dreamed of finding a union button.

title: Crozier Named Sabres Pilot
description: BUFFALO, May 21 (AP)Joe Crozier, interim coach of the Buffalo Sabres for the last half of the 197172 National Hockey League season, was named the club's permanent coach yesterday. He succeeds Punch Imlach, who remains as general manager.

title: Rift in Federal Reserve: Board vs. the Bank Here
description: A deep policy rift has developed between the Federal Reserve Board in Washington, which controls the formulation of monetary policy, and the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, which implements the policy through daytoday buying and selling of Government securities.

title: Personal Finance: Subletting Plans
description: Some taxsaving opportunities are so commonplace that many persons overlook them. For example, tenants who sublet their apartments can possibly obtain tax advantages.

title: Trade Mission From China Is Paying Visit to Mexico
description: MEXICO CITY, May 21A trade mission from the People's Republic of China  the first ever to visit this countryrelaxed in Acapulco this weekend. They were midway through a visit that was noticeable largely for the lack of attention it was given here.

title: Veteran Housing Is Studied for Forest Hills Project
description: Mario M. Cuomo, the lawyer appointed by Mayor Lindsay to study the controversial lowincome housing project in Forest Hills, Queens, yesterday raised the possibility of setting aside perhaps 15 per cent of the apartments for Vietnam veterans and some for middleincome families.

title: Soviet After Khrushchev: Bourgeois Urges Abound
description: MOSCOW, May 21  The 13 years since Richard M. Nixon's kitchen debate with Premier Nikita S. Khrushchev at the American exhibition in Moscow have brought the Soviet Union a curious combination of economic advancement and political retrenchment.

title: UMass Gains in Lacrosse
description: AMHERST, Mass., May 21 (AP)The University of Massachusetts eliminated Bowling Green, 199, today in the second round of the United States Intercollegiate Lacrosse Association tournament.

title: Edwab Upsets Carrington For East Hardcourt Crown
description: WOODIBURY, L. I, May 21Neal Edwab of Roslyn, tip, East's fifth ranking junior, scored his most notable victory today by upsetting Art Carrington of Elizabeth, N. A., 63, 62, 60, in the final of the Eastern men's hardcourt tennis championship at the Woodbury Country Club.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: PARIS, May 21 (UPI)Jan Kodes of Czechoslovakia headed the list of candidates for the men's singles crown of the French open, which starts at Roland Garros Stadium tomorrow.

title: An Ill Wind Blows Regatta to Standstill
description: SEA CLIFF, LI., May 21 What do you do with regatta trophies when the wind blows you off the course on the first day and a calm cancels the race on the second? Simple: You award them to the first boats to round the first mark no matter how long it takes.

title: Ryun, Collett Turn Corners
description: BAKERSFIELD, Calif., May 21(AP)The Bakersfield Track Classic was used for experimental purposes by Jim Ryun and Wayne Collett last night, and both say the meet could be a turning point for them.,

title: Sy Oliver Proves Adept at Ellington Style
description: Sy Oliver, who is known for the distinctive flair of the arrangements he created for the Jimmie Lunceford and Tommy Dorsey bands, showed that he was equally adept at reworking Duke Ellington's music when his orchestra played the 12th annual concert of the Duke Ellington Society at the New School yesterday afternoon.

title: Wallace Still Stable
description: SILVER SPRING, Md., May 21 (AP)Physicians at Holy Cross Hospital reported today that the condition of Gov. George C. Wallace remained stable and that his temperature ranges were near normal.

title: Russo Takes Final
description: Unseeded Lou Russo of the host club captured the third annual New York Athletic Club invitation fourwall handball singles tournament yesterday by topping Pat Kirby of Brooklyn, the fourthseeded player, in the final, 2118,. 2118.

title: Stuart Defeats Humm on 20th And Takes Travis Golf Honors
description: GARDEN CITY, L, I., May 21  Bob Stuart, a 24yearold member of a family of fine golfers kept the Walter J. Travis invitation tournament winner's silverware in the Stuart trophy case today. He defeated John Humm on the 20th hole in the final round at the Garden City Golf Club.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Say Wall Street and you think of brokers, bankers, bulls, bears and bondstraditionally a man's world. But plenty of women work in the financial district and the narrow, winding streets down there abound with shops catering to them. During the lunchhour rush from noon to 2 they are packed, but at other times so nearly deserted that sales personnel have lots of time to devote to customers.

title: ENEMY ASSAULTS MARINE POSITIONS 18 MILES FROM HUE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Monday, May 22A North Vietnamese force of unreported size attacked South Vietnamese defensive positions on the Mychanh River about 18 miles northwest of Hue this morning. At last report, the attack was continuing.

title: JOHN HAHN
description: CRESTWOOD, N.Y., May 21 John Hahn, a vice president of HelmsleySpear, Inc., who had been active in real estate management for more than 50 years, died Friday of a heart attack in Lawrence Hospital, Bronxville. He was 73 years old and lived at 211 Chittenden Avenue, here.

title: Moscow's Man in Street Is Curious and Expectant
description: MOSCOW. May 21Why do we help Nixon win his election?

title: Bernstein's Mass Greeted By Applause in Cincinnati
description: CINCINNATI, May 21 (AP)  An eightminute standing ovation followed the performance of Leonard Bernstein's Mass at the Cincinnati May Festival today.

title: Italy, Czechoslovakia Gain at Net
description: Italy and Czechoslovakia joined Rumania, Spain and the Soviet Union yesterday in group semifinals of the European Zone Davis Cup tennis competition, Reuters reported.

title: Morse, 71, Again Seeking Oregon Votes Tomorrow
Mets Capture 11th Straight, 43, On Mays's 2Run Homer in 8th
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 21Willie Mays almost singlehandedly carried the New York Mets to a 43 victory over the Philadelphia Phillies today, getting the Mets first hit of the game in the sixth inning and then crashing a Iworun homer in the eighth that provided the winning margin.

title: Women's Mark Bettered
description: BERLIN, May 21 (AP)Burglinde Pollak of East Germany bettered the world record in the women's modern pentathlon today by scoring 4,677 points at Potsdam Stadium, the official East Berlin press agency, ADN, reported.

title: A POLITICAL BODY SET UP BY BLACKS
description: Determined to carry out the program of the National Black Agenda, New York State's delegates to the black convention in Gary, Ind., last March formed a nonpartisan political statewide organization yesterday.

title: Colts Sign Wichard
description: BALTIMORE, May 21 (AP)The Baltimore Colts today signed Gary Wichard of C. W. Post. Wichard, a quarterback, was the Colts 16round pick.

title: How Mailman's Family Almost Manages on His Pay
description: Joseph Leal, a 31yearold Manhattan letter carrier with three children, a parrot named Sam, and $21.22 in the savings bank, considers himself a lucky man. He is happily married, likes his lob. has an adequate apartment and eats well.

title: Pieta Damaged in Hammer Attack
description: ROME, MAY 21Michelangelo's Pieta, one of the world's most celebrated sculptures, was severely damaged today when a man attacked it with a hammer in St. Peter's Basilica.

title: Better Business Bureaus Seek to Counter Criticism
description: CHICAGO, May 21Despite an intensive and wellfunded oneyear effort to improve the image of the nation's Better Business Bureaus, they are still widely regarded by some consumer groups as ineffectual, misleading and anticonsumer.

title: Thalia Zetlin Married to Mitchell Beer
description: ROSLYN, L. I.,. May 21Miss. Thalia Zetlin and Mitchell J. Beer were married here this evening at the Shelter Rock Temple by Rabbi Myron Fenster.

title: 2 Projects At Yale Get $14Million
description: NEW HAVEN, May 21 Yale University has received a gift of $14million from trust funds provided by. the late Frederick W. Beinecke, one of three brothers who made fortunes in Green Stamps and have been among the university's biggest and most faithful benefactors.

title: ERMA PROPOSES LARGER CLASSES
description: The City Council's finance chairman, Mario Merola, proposed yesterday that the Board of Education increase class sizes in schools with high absenteeism, as one way to help cope with the current city budget squeeze.

title: IRISH SONG SCORES IN JUMPING EVENT
description: PORT CHESTER, N. Y., May 21Irish Song, owned and ridden by a 13yearold, George D'Amhrosio of Mount Kisco, N. Y., won the open juniper championship today at the Stratford Stables horse show.

title: TWO MORE ARRESTED IN MUSEUM ROBBERY
description: WORCESTER, Mass., May 21 (AP)Two men were arrested here today on armed robbery and assault charges stemming from the theft of more than $1million in paintings last Wednesday at the Worcester Art Museum.

title: E. Gabriel Perle Weds Mrs. Lerner
description: Mrs. Ruth Friedberg Lerner of New York, vice president and senior editor of New Dimensions in Education of Plainview, L. I., was married yesterday afternoon to E. Gabriel Perle of New York, Publishing Counsel of Time Inc.

title: XEROX IS WOOING GREENWICH, CONN.
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 21In an effort to overcome local opposition to its plans for a new company headquarters in Greenwich, the Xerox Corporation has mounted costly public relations campaign here, including the distribution of a $250,000 planning study recommending that the town's northwest section make room for business offices.

title: Activities Are Listed For City Parks Week
description: Today  Mayor Lindsay opens celebration with Greening of Bloomingdale's event, 59th Street between Lexington and Third Avenues, noon. Neighborhood Environmental Action Team begins cleanup and treeplanting campaign, Verdi Square, Broadway, 72d73d Streets, 35 P.M.

title: Role of State Training Schools Questioned
description: Truancy rates at high schools serving lowincome neighborhoods now rival attendance rates; drug abuse by adolescents is said to be starting earlier and spreading further than ever; census and welfare statistics show the number of children growing up here in situations of stress and poverty to be steadily on the rise.

title: ZHAMSARANGIIN SAMBU
description: MOSCOW, May 21  President Zhamsarangiin Sambu of Mongolia died last night in Ulan Bator, the Mongolian capital, after a long illness. He was 76 years old.

title: East Hopes Talks Will Open Things Up With More Goods and Freer Travel
description: WARSAW, May 21  There are many moods in Eastern Europe on the eve of President Nixon's visit, but the most common may have been expressed last week by a Polish student:

title: Oil Imports Climbing With No End in Sight
description: WASHINGTON, May 21Despite 13 years of efforts by four Presidents to keep a lid on oil imports, protect the domestic industry and make the United States selfsufficient, oil imports have been rising.

title: FISCAL HYPOCRISY IS LAID TO MAYOR
description: City Controller Abraham D. Beame charred Mayor Lindsay's administration yesterday with fiscal hypocrisy in the Mayor's new order to halt the increase in the city's relief rolls by a new drive against ineligible recipients and cases of fraud.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:. Now I know how the herons must have felt at Runnymede.

title: Whalers Sign Landon
description: BOSTON, May 21 (AP)The New England Whalers of the World Hockey Association announced today the signing of Bruce Landon, a goalie with the Springfield Kings, to a twoyear contract.

title: The President as Diplomat
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  Administrations vary greatly. One administration may be remembered for the romance generated, more for its glamour than its accomplishments. It may have great emotional appeal, and may be remembered best for its ability to stir people, and for its grandiloquent articulation of great dreams. Another administration might be remembered for the sense of urgency generated. It may be noted for its voluminous legislation and apparent generosity, for its constant preoccupation with the exercise of power and the accompanying tense confrontations, exhortations and historic miscalculations.

title: Onassis and Wife in Iran
description: TEHERAN, Iran, May 21 (AP) Mr. and Mrs. Aristotle Onassis arrived here today for week of sightseeing. They are scheduled to visit the cities of Isfahan and Shiraz and tour the ruins of Persepolis.

title: Hug Leads Gymnasts
description: BERKELEY, Calif., May 21 (UPI)A Stanford sophomore, Steve Hug, led 12 qualifiers yesterday into the finals of the gymnastic trials for the United States Olympic team, Southern Connecticut State's John Crosby finished second.

title: Allison Wins in Mustang
description: ONA, W. Va., May 21 (AP)Bobby Allison drove his 1970 Mustang to a Grand National victory today in the Mountaineer 300. Allison covered the 131. 25mile race with an average speed of 68.417 miles an hour.

title: Oregon Man, 80, Is Held In Threat to Nixon's Life
description: REDMOND. Ore., May 21 (UPI)  A husky 80yearold man was arrested today for allegedly threatening the life of President Nixon during an airport rally for Senator George McGovern.

title: Carol Green Is Wed
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 21 Miss Carol Hope Green, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Green of East Meadow, was married here this afternoon to Jack Goldberg. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Isidore Goldberg of Brooklyn and Ellenville, N. Y. Rabbi Solomon Shapiro performed the ceremony at the Tivoli Terrace, caterers.

title: Books of The Times
description: You ought to be warned right away that simply reading this book may be enough to age you. Miss Beauvoir loads us with so many depressing examplesfrom primitive, historical and presentday societyof the predicament of old age that we cannot help cringing a bit under their burden. She has an ax to grind and society is her whetstone. Her writing has an abrasive quality not only for this reason, but also because Miss Beauvoir seems by temperament to he a professional pessimist and tragedian. As if this were not enough, she applies to the already bowed shoulders of the aged some of JeanPaul Sartre's more obscure existential strictures on the human estate.

title: Ottinger Wins Car Race
description: BRISTOL, Tenn., May 21 (AP)L. D. Ottinger of Newport, Tenn., posted a onelap victory in the Permatex 400 for late model sportsman cars today at Bristol International Speedway.

title: Parks Deteriorating For Lack of Upkeep
description: Starting today, the city wilt pay presummer tribute to its precious park space and, while celebrators this week fly kites at the Battery and plant trees in midtown, the troubled parks system will lose seven more maintenance workers.

title: Now, Arthur Bremer Is Known
description: WASHINGTON, May 21People know now who Arthur Herman Bremer is.

title: Drifting Island
description: Staten Island's backwardlooking Conservative party has emerged as a formidable foe of sound planning South Richmond. Its influence over the island's Republican Assemblymen apparently sufficed to keep State Senator John J. Marchl's bill for a South Richmond development corporation from ever getting nut of the Rules Committee this year.

title: Algeria Is Negotiating Sale Of Gas to European Group
description: WASHINGTON. May 21Algeria has quietly opened negotiations with a Western European consortium for sales in Europe of her liquefied natural gas as a possible alternative to exports to the United States.

title: Miss Loewus Bride Of Harvey Melnick
description: CROTON ON HUDSON, N. Y., May 21Miss Barbara Ellen Loewus and Harvey Melnick, students at the State University College at Buffalo, were married here this afternoon.

title: Silent Majority Triumphs
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 21 (AP)Silent Majority, driven by Stanley Dancer, became the country's fastest 3yearold pacer of 1972 by winning today's $10,000 race at Brandywine Racetrack. The son of Henry I. Adios triumphed by 2 lengths in 1:59.2 to clip threefifths of a second off the best previous national time held by Strike Out.

title: NORRIS, TEACHER, TAKES MARATHON
description: SYRACUSE, May 21 (AP)Ed Norris, a Brockton, Mass., schoolteacher who had never run more than 18 miles before, won the 48th Amateur Athletic Union marathon of 26 miles 385 yards today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In making the point that the wallaby and kangaroo of Australia are being sharply depleted, Derryn Hinch's recent article is essentially correct but either deliberately or out of ignorance misses utterly the basic reason for their sad state.

title: SAIGON'S FORCES REPEL 2D ATTACK NORTH OF HUE LINE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 23  South Vietnamese forces, supported by waves of American fighterbombers, yesterday turned back for the second consecutive day a sizable enemy attack on their forward positions northwest of Hue.

title: PENNSY IS UPHELD IN SUPREME COURT
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)  The Supreme Court refused today to hear appeals in two cases involving the Penn Central Transportation Company, turning petitions down in both cases without comment.

title: Bomb Injures 60
description: BELFAST, May 22 (UPI)A bomb explosion at an industrial complex in a Protestant area of Belfast today injured at least 60 persons, and gunmen killed one man and seriously wounded three other persons as they stood talking to a Roman Catholic priest on his doorstep.

title: U.S. and Soviet Scientists Draft New Space Accord
description: MADRID, May 22 (Reuters) Soviet and United States scientists drafted an agreement here today for closer corporation in space exploraion.

title: Advertising:
description: Ted Bates & Co., the largest agency in Times Square, has just been named to handle two products of the Calgon Consumer Products Company, a subsidiary of Merck & Co

title: U.S. Denies Ship Crossed Mines
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The Defense Department denied today that the Soviet cargo ship Zeya had crossed the minefield in Haiphong Harbor.

title: Ship at Danang Attacked
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, May 22 (AP)Enemy frogmen slipped in yesterday and blew a hole in an American munitions ship, the 7,643ton Jefferson City Victory, military informants reported today. The sources said one frogman was killed by guards. The damage to the ship, registered in New York and owned by Victory Carriers, Inc., was not given.

title: Court in Pennsylvania Observes 250th Year
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22The Supreme Court of Pennsylvania, oldest in the country, sat in its former home in Independence Hall today to observe the court's 250th anniversary.

title: Executive Changes
description: Bache & Co., Inc., has elected William M. Marlin as executive vice president; Jack R. Ackerman and Peter A. Bernard as senior vice presidents; and Bruno G. Dinette as treasurer. Mr. Dinette is also first vice president in charge of the accounting division.

title: Gottfried Wins in French Tennis
description: PARIS, May 22 (AP)  The $100,000 French open tennis championships, one of the Big Four world tournaments, got off to a lowkey start today under a new formula that left the 48 top players on the sidelines until the third round.

title: EUROPEANS INVEST IN BIGBOARD FIRM
description: Model, Roland & Co., Inc., a member of the New York Stock Exchange, announced yesterday an agreement in principle for an increase of its capital from $8million to $14million.

title: Foreign Markets Closed
description: Banks, businesses and stock exchanges were closed yesterday in most nations on the European Continent in observance of Whitmonday. In Canada, which observed Victoria Day, securities and commodities markets, banks and other financial institutions were also closed.

title: HINTON TO START IF RAIN JINX ENDS
description: Rich Hinton has pitched so little this season that the next time he is sent into a game someone might have to give him a road map with directions showing him the way to the mound.

title: Says Separation of Research Makes No Sense at All
description: William J. Casey, chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission, rejected yesterday the concept of unbundling brokerage commissions in the evolving era of competitive rates.

title: State Agency Begins Selling Power to Con Edison
description: ALBANY, May 22  The State Tower Authority began supplying electricity today to the Consolidated Edision Company. under the terms of a contract approved by the Governor on Saturday.

title: House Briefly Disrupted
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UN) A small group of protesters, shouting Stop the air war, briefly disrupted a session of the House today with a tape recording of an aircraftlike noise.

title: 3 Candidates Announced For Cambodian Elections
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 22 (Reuters)The Ministry for Home Affairs announced today that three candidates would run in the Cambodian presidential election early next month.

title: Second Generation SST In U.S. Seen by Advocate
description: William G. Magruder, a special consultant on technology to President Nixon, said yesterday that the Unired States had lost any chance competing for initial airline supersonic transport orders. But he predicted it would probably produce a second generation SST that would begin hauling passengers a decade or so from now.

title: Court Refuses to Hear Appeal on TV Station
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) An appeal by WHDH, Inc., to reopen Federal Communications Commission consideration of ownership of Boston's Channel 5 was rejected today by the Supreme Court.

title: Theater: Hark!, a Today Musical
description: A new musical, Hark!, opened last night at the Mercer Arts Center, that sweet concatenation of theaters close by Washington Square. It has life and liveliness; it swings with the pulse of today.

title: Paisley Shows Bullet Hole
description: LONDON, May 22A school jacket with a bullet hole in it was displayed in the House of Commons today by the Rev. Ian Paisley.

title: Hanoi Surgical Chief Is Busy and Hopeful
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 22A Soviet stewardess who North Vietnamese sources say was badly wounded when her ship was bombed at Haiphong May 9 left on an Aeroflot commercial flight for Moscow today.

title: Critics Vote 2 Papp Shows Best of Year
description: The New York Drama Critics Circle yesterday selected Sticks and Bones as the best play and Two Gentlemen of Verona as the best musical of the 197172 season.

title: EGYPTIAN CONFLICT WITH SUDAN ARISES
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon. May 22 A silent conflict between the Sudanese regime and Egypt has come into the open for the first time in a strong attack by Lebanon's proEgyptian press against President Gaafar alNimeiry of the Sudan.

title: TwoDay Schedule Of Nixons in Soviet
description: TODAY Mrs. Nixon will visit Moscow secondary school in the morning.

title: BLACK MEMBER FIRM HONORED AT DINNER
description: Daniels & Bell, Inc., the first blackowned member firm of the New York Stock Exchange, was honored last night at a testimonial dinner at the New York Hilton. The dinner was cosponsored by the securities industry and the MidManhattan Branch of the National Association for the Advancement of Colored People.

title: Badillo Asks Prison School Aid And Union Rights for Convicts
description: Representative Herman Badillo proposed yesterday that the state establish a separate school district for its prison system to qualify for a vast array of federal funds we don't receive now. He also proposed that prisoners be allowed to join labor unions.

title: Dow Chemical Lifts Prices
description: The Dow Chemical Company said yesterday that it was raising its bulk chlorine prices by $6 a ton, effective immediately on spot sales, and July 1 on contract sales or in accordance with contract terms.

title: 3 Interviews on TV Set With Humphrey, McGovern in West
description: Senators Hubert H. Humphrey and George McGovern, two leading contenders in the California Democratic primary June 6, will be interviewed together on special programs on all three major networks.

title: Market Place: Municipal Bonds  For Individuals
QueroChiesa Reelected
description: The Board of Higher Education last night reelected Luis QueroChiesa in a full twoyear term as its chairman. Mr. QueroChiesa, a 61yearold artist and writer, was born In Puerto Rico. He has served as president of the board since last November, filling the unexpired term of the former chairman, Frederick Burkhardt.

title: 5Day Cleanup Starts On Part of West Side
description: A fiveday community cleanup of the West Side between 60th and 73d Streets was begun yesterday by the Neighborhood Environmental Action Team, starting at Verdi Square.

title: DINNER IN KREMLIN
description: MOSCOW, May 22Richard M. Nixon arrived here today, the first American President to visit the Soviet capital.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Host Begins to Prepare His Excuses After Promising Guest Good Fishing
description: COrner a fishing columnist in his backyard and you will discover that he is prone to all the doubletalk and vague promises that he laughed at in ybu when he was your guest.

title: Mayor and Key Board Members Reach Accord on Welfare Cuts
description: Mayor Lindsay and key Board of Estimate members appeared in agreement yesterday on slashes in estimated welfare casts. The Mayor estimated that his new order to halt the growth in welfare rolls would cut needed city tax funds by $40million to $45million.

title: Summit Realism: U.S. and Soviet Seek to Ease Conflicts and Reach Practical Accords
description: MOSCOW, May 22 President Nixon was given a correct dose of pomp today and was put. up in the imperial quarters of the Kremlin.

title: Dinner in the Kremlin: Caviar to Ice Cream
description: MOSCOW, May 22 (AP)This was the menu for the official dinner tonight in the Great Kremlin Palace in honor of President and Mrs. Nixon:

title: City Will Restrict Dogs'
description: The Parks Administration announced yesterday the immediate start of a new campaign to keep dogs from fouling the city's parks.

title: METS NEED Na 12 FOR THE RECORD
description: CHICAGO, May 22  The Mets took a day off today, their first since their 11day winning streak began.

title: Park Yes, Dam No
description: It is ten years since Congress authorized Tocks Island Damthat elaborate project for creating a 37milelong reservoir in the heart of the lovely Delaware River Valley for the triple purpose of water conservation, flood control and recreation. Doubts, originally confined to few premature environmentalists, have now penetrated deep into the Delaware River Basin Commission. As consequence, the valley appears to have close to a fiftyfifty chance of surviving in its natural and tranquil form.

title: Student Group Visits Hanoi
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The National Student Association said today that a delegation of four persons from the association flew to Hanoi during the weekend at the invitation of the North Vietnamese Government. The association said that the delegation was composed of Margery Tabankin, association president; the Rev. Bob Leacky, editor of the magazine American Report; Bill Zimmerman of the Medical Aid Committee for Indochina, and the Rev. Paul Mayer of the Harrisburg Defense Committee.

title: FRANCIS BOYER, DRUG EXECUTIVE
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 22Francis Boyer, former chairman of Smith Kline & French Laboratories, died yesterday at his lame. He was 78 years old and lived in Ardmore.

title: Geoffrion Back in Coaching
description: ATLANTA, May 22 (AP) Bernie (Boom Boom) Geoffrion, one of the National Hockey League's top scorers during a 14season career with the Montreal Canadiens, was named the head coach of Atlanta's expansion team today.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Western Company of North America, Fort Worth yesterday filed a registration statement with the Securities and Exchange Commission for the sale of 360,000 shares of common stock, 300,000 shares of which are to be sold by the company and 60,000 shares by H. E. Chiles, president and chairman.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: DO YOU KNOW ANT IMPORTANT MAN IN BUSINESS WHO DOES NOT READ FORBES MAGAZINE?ADVT.

title: BEL CANTO OPERA PRESENTS KATYA
description: Like most of the offoff Lincoln Center opera groups about town, the Bel Canto Opera does what it can with very littlein terms of money and facilities, that is. Productions are staged in the parish room of the Madison Avenue Baptist Church with piano accompaniment and a minimum of scenery, but the talent and spirit of these young professionals quite often transcend the imposed limitations to a surprising degree.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Bob Griese of the Dolphins, Bob Lilly of the Cowboys and other wellstructured, finely conditioned heroes were applauded at the Hotel Americana last night at the annual eating, drinking and talking contest of the New York chapter of the Professional Football Writers Association. The gridiron gentry went at the groceries with the rapacity of locusts and all did an admirable job of polishing their plates.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: President Nixon's newest peace offer to North Vietnam is as generous as possible, short of U.S. surrender and the delivery of South Vietnam to the Communists. It is disturbing then to read only of the President's escalatory actionsthe stick of his addressand very little of the large carrot settlement offer the President made. If nothing else, the President's new offer will at least put to rest forever the doves contention that just a bit more U.S. compromise will win the peace. President Nixon has gone the limit; it is Hanoi that refuses to allow the war to end.

title: BELMONT FEATURE TO MINDY MALONE
description: Under a welljudged ride by Marco Castaneda, Jack Lieberman's Mindy Malone won the feature event at Belmont Park yesterday. Rallying in the stretch turn, Mindy Malone assumed the lead and built up just enough margin to offset the strong closing rush of the Buckland Farm's Structural, whom she beat by a neck. The race, at 1 116 miles for 3yearold fillies had only five starters and the crowd of 21 097 backed the winner so confidently that she paid $3.80 for $2 straight. Her time, under 112 pounds, was 1:42 15. Finishing third, 1% lengths behind Structural, was Fernande, who was the early pacesetter.

title: NORDHEIMER WINNER OF TOBENKIN AWARD
description: Jon Nordheimer, an Atlantabased reporter for The New York Times, was named yesterday as the winner of Columbia University's 1972 Paul Tobenkin Memorial Award for his account of the life and death of a black Congressional Medal of Honor winner who was shot to death while trying to hold up grocery store in Detroit.

title: Coon Rapids: Unchanged Since Khrushchev
description: COON RAPIDS, Iowa Thin trails of soft dust rise slowly into the warming air here these days behind the red and green and tan tractors that grind their way across the rolling miles of open earth, delicately dropping one corn seed every eight inches. Just as they have done every year at this time for decades. The redwinged black birds are back too, like always, sunning themselves on the quiet roadways. In town, business has fallen off again, as it usually does in May when everyone but the shopkeepers is out in the fields.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: High Court Widens Power To Make Witnesses Talk
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The Supreme Court ruled to 2 today that witnesses can be compelled to testify before grand juries and other governmental panels, even though they may later be convicted on the basis of other evidence for committing the crimes they are forced to discuss.

title: Lynch to Act on I.R.A.
description: DUBLIN, May 22  Prime Minister John Lynch said tonight that he would ask the Government to strengthen laws against illegal organizations such as the Irish Republican Army.

title: A Part of the Thirties
description: In an essay written for this newspaper on the occasion of the 100th anniversary of the death of William Wordsworth, C. Day Lewis remarked that as a man who had been begulled by the utopian promise, of the Russian Revolution and then disillusioned by it, he could understand the psychological situation of the earlier poet equally attracted by the hope of the French Revolution and then repelled by it.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Tenants in rentcontrolled apartments who receive notices of rent increases, most of which are retroactive to last Jan. 1, need not pay the entire retroactive increase in a lump sum, the city's Department of Rent and Housing Maintenance said yesterday.

title: White House Aide Says Morale Is Low in Hanoi
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) A White House official said today that North Vietnam was showing serious strains in its homefront morale and political structure as well as on the battlefield because of United States military actions.

title: Westbury Is Now Seen Joining OTB in Fight for TV Races
description: Roosevelt Raceway is expected to join the Offtrack Betting Corporation in seeking the right to telecast its harness races when the Westbury, L. I., track opens Thursday night. An announcement to this effect was expected at a news conferencce scheduled today.

title: GONZALEZ SPOTS CASSIDY 4 YEARS
description: Bobby Cassidy and Jose Gonzalez, the principals in the 10round lightheavyweight fight at the Felt Forum tomorrow night, are only four years apart in age.

title: Rockefeller Gets Bill on Art Contest Control
description: A bill dealing with the promotion and operation of art contests where prizes are offered as an inducement has passed both houses of the State legislature and is now before Governor Rockefeller for signature.

title: CLOSING OF PORTS CONCEDED IN HANOI
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, May 22 The consensus of foreign observers here now is that American mining has effectively closed North Vietnam's ports.

title: Nixon Adviser Sees Need for Controls Ending in a Year
description: Ezra Solomon, a member_ of President Nixon's Council of Economic Advisers, predicted yesterday that wage and price controls could be lifted from the economy within a yearin large part as a consequence of a sharp acceleration in economic expansion.

title: Harlem Museum a Center for Literati
description: Sandwiched in a loft be,ween a luncheonette, a liqt'or store and a supermarket below, and two dress factories and two churches above, is the Studio Museum in Harlem currently, the community's foremost intellectual nook.

title: Franklin Will Name An Operating Chief
description: The Franklin New York Corporation, which has been under fire from Arthur T. Roth, its former chairman, for a sharp drop in profitability, will name a new president and chief administrative officer within the next few days.

title: C.A.B. Examiner Opposes NorthwestNational Plan
description: Denial of the proposed merger of Northwest Airlines and National Airlines was recommended yesterday by Robert L. Park, an examiner of the Civil Aeronautics Board.

title: The President's Prospects in Moscow
description: The Nixon Administration early proclaimed that the world was emerging from the era of confrontation and entering upon an era of negotiations. Underlying this thought was the concept that the United States would maneuver adeptly among the major states to establish and maintain balance of power offering more safety than the former bipolar nuclear terror.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: We, as students, recognize the legitimate complaint of lenders whose contracts are not being met (Student Defaults on College Loans Rising, news story May 9), but how can students as graduates be expected to repay loans if there arc no jobs to be found? The alternative is Just as frustrating: to return to school in an advanceddegree program, if one is lucky enough to get in. But, of course, he will probably need to finance his advanced study with a loan.

title: Nixon, in Effect, Repaying Khrushchev's Call on U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, May 22President Nixon's arrival in Moscow today was, in a sense, repayment for the colorful, often contentious twoweek trip around the United States by Nikita S. Khrushchev in 1959.

title: A Broken Pieta
description: A great work of art like Michelangelo's Pieta is supreme human response to the anguish, terror and mad frenzy of life as well as an affirmation of joy, hope and serene rationality. Only an artist who could look imaginatively into the depths of the human spirit could capture in marble the profound sorrow of the Madonna as she holds in her arms the body of her Son crucified by ignorant soldiers and an impassioned mob.

title: Cambodian Gain Reported
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Tuesday, May 23 (UPI)  Cambodian troops backed by artillery and air strikes early today reportedly reoccupied a tourist hotel on the outskirts of the fabled Angkor Wat complex built by the ninthcentury Khmer civilization.

title: Kessler Named Adelphi Pilot
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., May 22 Mary Kessler, who has been the basketball coach at Martin Van Buren High School in Queens for the last nine years, was named to the same position today at Adelphi University.

title: Chairman and President Of Dominick Quits Posts
description: Myron A. Wick Jr. resigned; late yesterday as the chairman] and president of Dominick & Dominick. Inc. The resignation: Was announced by Bayard Dominick, chairman of the executive committee, following a board meeting. Mr. Dominick could not be reached for comment after the meeting.

title: Music: Burkhart Debut
description: Ralph Burkhart's New York recital debut at Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday evening had its ups and downs, but the ups were plentiful enough to suggest that the young pianist will be an interesting artist when he has matured a bit more. Mr. Burkhart, who is a graduate student at the Manhattan School, played an uneven program in which recital nervousness seemed to be cutting down his efficiency at times, most notably in the last movement of Grieg's Sonata in E minor, when memory faltered.

title: $2Billion in Real Estate Now Controlled by Arlen
description: The Arlen Realty and Development Corporation, which last week became managing trustee of USIF Real Estate, an offshore real estate fund, an, nounced yesterday that the total real estate portfolio it now controls amounts to $2billion, one of the largestsuch portfolios in the world.

title: Mortgage Rates Dipped For Conventional Loans
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)  The Federal Home Loan Bank Board reported today a slight decline in interest rates on home mortgages not backed by the Government.

title: TWO MEN RELEASED IN RACEFIXING CASE
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., May 22 Two of five men who were arrested for allegedly attempting to fix the superfecta race on May 11 at Monticello Raceway were released tonight after a preliminary hearing behind closed doors.

title: Bronx Man Found Slain
description: A 30yearold man, his hands tied behind his back, was found dead yesterday morning in a side courtyard of St. Mary Protectress Ukrainian Catholic Church at 1745 Washington Avenue in the Bronx. The victim was identified as Ureal Ramos, of 1699 Washington Avenue, the Bronx. A preliminary investigation showed that he died of blows to the head, but it was uncertain how he had been struck, the police said.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Having once again threatened and in some measure diminished the life, liberty and property of each of us, our legislators now depart their princely palladium on Albany's Mall. In what must rank as supreme irony, they will proceed to campaign for our consent to two more years of like mayhem and pillage.

title: Chess: A Spanish Grandmaster Fills Tal's Shoes at Dutch Tourney
description: The 1972 Hoogoven Tournament of Beverwijk, the Netherlands, began with misgivings when Mikhail Tal, the former world champion from the Soviet Union, could not compete because of illness.

title: Indictment Request Today
description: BALTIMORE, May 22 (AP)The United States Attorney for Maryland said today that he would ask a Federal grand jury tomorrow to indict Arthur Herman Bremer in the May 15 shooting of Governor Wallace.

title: NUNN A FAVORITE IN KENTUCKY RACE
New Member of Rail Panel
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)  President Nixon has appointed Louis W. Menk of St. Paul as a member of the Railroad Retirement Commission, the White House announced today. Mr. Menk is chairman of the Burlington Northern, Inc., and succeeds John P. Hiltz Jr. on the fiveman commission.

title: MEDICAL PROJECT FACES FUND LOSS
description: Four years ago, Margaret (Dolly) Pearson could not walk more than half a block without gasping for breath. She could not play games with other 4yearoldsshe just sat and colored, or watched television or slept. A victim of cystic fibrosis, she was, according to her mother, the most miserable child.

title: COTTON FUTURES SHOW DECLINES;Slow Demand and Reports on Crops Spur Selling
description: A combination of favorable crop reports and a continued slow demand for spot cotton touched off a wave of selling on the cotton futures market yesterday.

title: BOND PRICES POST MODEST ADVANCE
description: Bond prices posted another broad, though modest, advance yesterday as the week's mostimportant new corporate issue came to market and dealers in taxexempts marked up bonds in anticipation of strong bids for a number of new offerings today.

title: Roundup: Dierker 4Hitter Keeps Astros Flying High
description: Harry Walker, manager of the Houston Astros, is a changed man these days. He doesn't talk as much as he used to. His club, which has been bolstered by many offseason acquisitions, is doing the talking for him.

title: ROCKEFELLER SEEKS TIME TO CLEAN AIR
description: Governor Rockefeller has requested a twoyear extension of the deadline for meeting the Federal cleanair standards, citing difficulties in reducing key pollutants in such areas as New York City and the Niagara Frontier.

title: Minister Sees Early Drop in Surpluses
description: TOKYO, May 22Kakuei Tanaka, Japan's Minister for International Trade and Industry, declared flatly today that there would be no further revaluation of the yen and pledged his personal political future on making the Government's new economic program work without revaluation.

title: Matthews Wins 400 Dash
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, May 22 (AP)Vince Mathews, of New York, one of the United States top hopes for the Olympic games, posted an easy victory in the rain in the 400meter dash at a meet last night. He was clocked in 46 seconds.

title: Task Force Bids N.Y.U Discard Some Programs and Cut Faculty
description: A major retrenchment in educational programs and faculty at New York University, including the closing of the Graduate School of Social Work and a substantial reduction in the number of professors, has been recommended by a task force studying the, acute financial emergency at N.Y.U.

title: All of Politburo at Dinner Except Secret Police Head
description: MOSCOW. may 22All the Moscow members of the Soviet Union's ruling Politburo, except Yuri V. Andropov, the head of the secret police, were present at the state dinner given tonight for President and Mrs. Nixon.

title: 6 Indicted in Nassau on Charges Of Luring Boys Into Sex Club
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 22Five men, including an Adeiphi University professor, and one woman were indicted by a Nassau County grand jury today in connection with a loosely organized international club in which welltodo men recruited and trained young boys for deviant sexual behavior.

title: City's Spending Tripled In Decade, Study Finds
description: A new study said yesterday that the New York iCty government's spending for all expenses, including construction, had more than tripled in a decade, while residents personal income from private activities rose only 56.4 pet cent.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Hailed By U.C.L.A. Students
Mr. Shelest's Demotion
description: Western speculation about a struggle between hawks and doves in the Kremlin leadership was dramatically confirmed on the very eve of President Nixon's arrival in Moscow. Yesterday morning Pravda carried a short announcement that Politburo member Pyotr Y. Shelest had been named a Deputy Premier of the Soviet Union, implying that he had been removed from his much more powerful position as First Secretary of the Ukrainian Communist party.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: An obscure item in your May 14 issue reminds us that taxexempt status for those organizations engaged in charitable or educational activities is dependent on a finding that no part of the organization's activities consists of carrying on propaganda or otherwise attempting to influence legislation.

title: Negotiators at Arms Talks Working Out Final Issues
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 22 United States and Soviet negotiators today began a final attempt to resolve the remaining issues before sending to the Moscow summit meeting the drafts they have worked out on proposals to limit strategic nuclear arms.

title: F.P.C AIDE BACKS ALGERIA GAS PLAN
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The United States took the first major step today toward approval of a $1.5billion contract for the import of liquefied natural gas from Ageria when the Federal Power Commission's presiding examiner issued a conditional authorization for the project.

title: CONNECTICUT BAN ON ABORTION GAINS
description: HARTFORD, May 22  The Connecticut Senate approved bill tonight that would make abortion illegal except to save the life of the mother or in cases where pregnancy follows rape or incest. The vote was 21 to 14.

title: Frederic Coudert Jr., 74, Dead; Represented East Side in House
U.S. IS CHALLENGED ON LOAN HELP HERE
description: Councilman Carter Burden, charged yesterday that an $11million Federal mortgage guarantee granted to Charles E. Sigety, proprietor of the Florence Nightingale Nursing Home at 175 East 96th Street, might have involved a conflict of interest.

title: RAYMOND W. SAXON
description: Raymond W. Saxon, retired vice president of consumer product services of the RCA Corporation, died yesterday in Indianapolis, where he had lived since the headquarters of the company's services division was moved there in 1961. He was 67 years old.

title: George Rentschler, 79, Retired Industrialist, Dies
description: George A. Rentschler, former chairman of the BaldwinLimaHamilton Corporation, producers of locomotives and other heavy machinery, died yesterday at his home here. He was 79 years old and lived at 1 Sutton Place South and in East Hampton, L. I.

title: Jersey Legislature Faces Redistricting
description: TRENTON, May 22  The New Jersey Supreme Court to day declared unconstitutional the state's legislative election districts and directed that county lines be crossed to achieve population equality among the districts.

title: House Votes Bill to Set Auto Bumper Standards
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The House passed a bill today that would require manufacturers to equip automobiles with bumpers that provide the maximum feasible protection against damage to the cars. The vote was 254 to 38.

title: Test Mailings Find Some Improvement In Postal Service
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) Two nationwide tests over 15 months have disclosed some improvement in mail service within cities, little change over long distances and continued spotty deliveriessome prompt, some tardy.

title: IN THE NATION
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind.Any astute commencement speaker knows that he Or she cannot expect today's college seniors to sit still for the oldfashioned inspirational bilge that used to be pumped from every graduation platform in the land, Yet, at the University of Notre Dame's commencement exercises Sunday, the seniors gave a standing ovation to their valedictorian, William G. McElroy Jr., of Silver Spring, Md., when he said that he had a feeling of hope that he and his classmates would find in the search for honor a spark in our lives and in the struggle against evil a profound duty.

title: Day In, Day Out, North Korea Assails U.S. Aggressor
description: PYONGYANG, North Korea, May 22Americans and all other foreign visitors to this country are subjected to a vigorous, allpervasive propaganda line from their moment of entry into the country through each day.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Let all the cabs be gypsy cabs! They pick you up at your door. They charge less. They go anywhere.

title: Looking Ahead
description: Nobody can plan ahead for every emergency. Every road has its unexpected pitfalls poor health, unemployment, the sudden demands that turn up in everyone's life. The purchaser of United States Savings Bonds can face these prospects with greater confidence. His money is secure; since the first Series E bonds were introduced in 1941 the interest yield has been raised seven times and never reduced.

title: Yorty's California Drive Fails to Gain Headway
Kathy Kusner Triumphs In German Horse Show
description: WIESBADEN, Germany, May 22 (AP)Kathy Kusner of the United States rode Triple Crown to victory today in the Grand Prix of the Wiesbaden international equestrian tournament.

title: $100,000 Is Asked in Italian Liner Bomb Threat
description: The Itdlian Line received a threat yesterday that its luxury cruise ship Leonardo da Vinci would be bombed unless $100,1000 in small bills was placed at an address in Manhattan at al specified time. The ship is due to dock in Lisbon today.

title: Kiley to ReCreate Role In Man of La Mancha
description: Man of La Mancha, the prizewinning musical, will begin a summer engagement at Lincoln Center's Vivian Beaumont Theater on June 21.

title: BIG BOARD PLANS DATA EXPANSION
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday a plan for a comprehensive market information system that would make available to the public lastsale data on all transactions in listed stocks in all markets across the country.

title: F.B.I. Leaders to Meet
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The acting F.B.I. director, L. Patrick Gray 3d, will hold twoday meeting tomorrow and Wednesday with the top 15 bureau executives who served the late J. Edgar Hoover. The sessions will be held at. the Federal Bureau of Investigation Academy at Quantico, Va.

title: Ghost Candidates A Factor in Oregon
Daniels on A. B.A. Team
description: UNIONDALE, L.I., May 22 (AP)Mel Daniels of the Indiana Pacers was named today to complete the American Basketball Association squad for the league's exhibition allstar game against the National Basketball Association on Thursday night at the Nassau Coliseum.

title: STUDY DISCOUNTS GAINS ON BUSING
description: BOSTON, May 22An analysis of the effects of busing in six Northern cities suggests that school integration has neither raised the academic achievements, aspirations and selfesteem of black children nor improved race relations.

title: DAVIS CUP MOVES INTO SEMIFINALS
description: The semifinal lineup for the two European sections of the Davis Cup tennis competition was completed yesterday when West Germany, Monaco and Poland won secondround contests, Reuters reported.

title: Texts of the Toasts Delivered by Presidents Podgorny and Nixon at State Dinner in Moscow Last Night
description: Esteemed Mr. President, esteemed Mrs. Nixon, ladies and gentlemen, comrades.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I don't like to tattle, but there are some employes on your newspaper who aren't paying attention. I'm referring to the men in charge of filling in the numbers at the bottom of each article where it says Continued on Page, Column.

title: Funds and Help Offered For Surgery on Child
description: Offers of help and money have come in from all over the country for 2yearold Tammy Keast, who needs expensive openheart surgery, following reports that milions of empty cigarette packs had been collected on her behalf in the mistaken belief that they could be redeemed for money.

title: FREDERICK MAYO, 65, SHIPPING LINE AIDE
description: Frederick J. Mayo, recently retired senior vice president of American ExportIsbrandtsen, Inc., the shipping line, died Saturday of a heart attack in Hawaii. He was 65 years old. A former resident of Westport, Conn., he had moved to Puako early this year. after retiring. While with American ExportIsbrandtsen, Mr. Mayo was in charge of its European operations.

title: Fordham's Philippe Is Gaining On Goal as Olympic HallMiler
description: Marcel Philippe checked out of his dorm at Fordham University yesterday, with the hope that he will be checking in kite for the fall term.

title: Cardinal Cooke at U.N.
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 22Cardinal Cooke visited Secretary General Waldheim today and remarked later that the United Nations should intervene to end the Vietnam war if the stalemate in the Paris talks continues. The Cardinal was returning a visit by Mr. Waldheim several weeks ago.

title: Angry Belfast Protestants Dismantle the Barricades
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 22Along the Shankill Road, Protestants today slowly dismantled the barricades of burned buses and stolen trucks. Their fury remains.

title: 4 Large Retailers Post Mixed Trends In Quarter Profits
DR.W.O.CARRINGTON, PASTOR IN BROOKLYN
description: The Rev. Dr. William O. Carrington, minister of the First A.M,E. Zion Church of Brooklyn from 1936 to 1964, died Sunday at Long Island College Hospital. He was 92 years old and lived at 1239 Carroll Street, Brooklyn.

title: FASHION TALK
description: It was inevitable that the famous Porthault prints, which have been used for everything from bed and table linens to linings for animal baskets and covers for hot water bottles, would one day be made up into women's fashions.

title: FOOTBALL OWNERS AND GARVEY TALK
description: Bob Lilly and Bob Griese, one a winner and the other a loser in the last Super Bowl game, were spotlighted last night at the annual dinner of the New York Chapter of the Pro Football Writers of America at the Hotel Americana.

title: AIR ARMS SENSORS SPURRED IN HOUSE
description: The House Appropriations Committee approved yesterday the addition of $2million to next year's. transportation budget to buy 800 additional weapons detectors to help end the wave of airline hijackings and sabotage.

title: WIFE IN MURDER PLOT ACCUSES DEFENDANT
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 22Mrs. Constance A. Bilodeau, who has conofessed to conspiring to murder her husband for $200,000 in insurance money later found to be nonexistent, testified today that John O. Hughes, alleged mastermind of the murder, who is on trial here, had beaten her and twice threatened to kill her after the murder took place.

title: Times Names President For Microfilm Subsidiary
description: The New York Times Company has appointed Karl Horwitz president of the Microfilming Corporation of America, a wholly owned subsidiary, it was announced yesterday by Sydney Gruson, the parent company's senior vice president and chairman of Microfilming's board.

title: 3Party Turkish Cabinet Named by New Premier
description: ANKARA, Turkey, May 22Premier Ferit Melen tonight named a 24member Cabinet drawn from three political parties.

title: School Board Member to Remain in Post
description: Acceding to the request of Mayor Lindsay and others, Dr. Seymour P. Lachman has decided to remain a member of the city Board of Education and not go through with his announced intention to resign at the end of June.

title: Books of The Times
description: What has Richard J. Whalen been doing since he published his bestselling biography of Joseph P. Kennedy, The Founding Father (besides publishing his notsobestselling but provocative study of New York, A City Destroying Itself)? As he explains in his Catch the Falling Flag: A Republican's Challenge to His Party: In the fall of 1967, despite earlier doubts about Richard M. Nixon's chances for comeback, Mr. Whalen became convinced by a series of interviews with the former Vice President that a Nixon candidacy held out the only hope for a revitalization of the Republican party, which Mr. Whalen deemed essential for the future of the country. So he accepted Mr. Nixon's invitation to become a key speech writer and took his place on the team of whiz kids that helped to convince some observers that the 1968 Nixon was indeed a brandnew model.

title: Gilmour Planning Slower Pace As 40th Birthday Approaches
description: YONKERS, May 22 The way William (Buddy) Gilmour sees it, life really will begin at 40 for the Canadianborn harness horseman, who was born at Lucan, Ontario, on July 23 1932.

title: WRIGHT, ON 134, TOPS QUALIFYING
description: EAST WILLISTON, L. I., May 22  Where did you play today? Jimmy Wright was asked after he led the Long Island qualifiers today in the United States Open local trials by nine strokes. Most of the contestants in the field of 103 were surprised that anyone could have such an edge.

title: Adirondacks Development Stirs Major Ecology Fight
