description: COLTON, N.Y., May 22The Horizon Corporation, one of the major land developers of the Southwest. is now attempting to move into one of the largest tracts of undeveloped land east of the Mississippi  the Adirondack Park.

title: BLUE CHIPS PACE MARKET ADVANCE
description: The bluechip and glamour issues paced the way yesterday for the stock market's third consecutive advance although trading slackened considerably.

title: Convicts Injure 7 Connecticut Guards
description: SOMERS, Conn., May 22 Inmates about to watch fellow prisoners play baseball at the Connecticut Correctional Insti tution here early tonight flocked into the recreation yard, seized several baseball bats, and injured seven guards, two seriously.

title: Good Beginning
description: President Nixon is off to a good beginning for what could be historic and productive negotiations with Soviet leaders.

title: Crowds on N Route Kept Subdued
description: MOSCOW, May 22  Moscow was a city eager for glimpse of its first visiting American President today, but many of those who ventured forth were dispersed, diverted, discouraged and disappointed.

title: C. Day Lewis Dies at 68; Poet Laureate of Britain
description: LONDON, May 22  Cecil Day Lewis, Poet Laureate of Britain, died today at the age of 68. He had been ill with cancer for a year.

title: WarWeary People of Saigon Found to Fear Enemy Victory
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 22The people of Saigon are exhausted with the war and with worrying over their men who are fighting it. They are frightened at the possibility that the battle may reach Saigon, where so many came first to escape the Communists and later the fighting.

title: MRS. DENTON D. HALL
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 22 Mrs. Frances Purcell Hall, wife of Denton D. Hall, an investment banker, died today in Greenwich Hospital. She was 64 years old and lived on Dairy Road.

title: Chinese Is a Snap When You're 5
description: Timothy, Danny, Meghan, Gayle and Heather sat around a low table in the nursery school room the other morning.

title: Two Political Leaders: A Study in Contrasts
description: WASHINGTONWhen a Democrat meets a Republican on a TV talk show, what's the subject of the hour? Well, they're male, they start in on the issues, but if they're female, they are probably asked to discuss women in politics.

title: Maye Is Held as Harasser In Gay Alliance Outbreak
description: A Manhattan grand jury yesterday charged Michael J. Maye, president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association, with harassment, saying that he struck, shoved and kicked a member of the Gay Activists Alliance outside the grand ballroom of the New York Hilton last April.

title: Number of Puerto Ricans InU.S.Up 55% in Decade
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)The number of citizens of Puerto Rican birth or parentage living on the mainland rose by 55 per cent over the last decade, the Commerce Department said today.

title: Msgr. Edmund Fitzgerald, L.I. Pastor, Is Dead at 79
description: MINEOLA, L. I., May 22Msgr. Edmund A. Fitzgerald, pastor of the Roman Catholic Church of Corpus Christi here from 1933 to 1971, when he became pastor emeritus, died today in Nassau Hospital. His age was 79.

title: Nixon Visit Won't Solve War, Mrs. Binh Says
description: PARIS, May 22 (UPI) Mrs. Nguyen Thi Binh, head of the Vietcong delegation to the Paris peace talks, said today that President Nixon would not end the Vietnam war through any maneuver in Moscow.

title: TEST FAULT PERILS SALE OF 73 FORDS
description: DETROIT, May 22The Ford Motor Company was reported today to have conducted faulty antipollution tests that raised the possibility it might be barred from selling its 1973 cars as scheduled.

title: SENATOR SAYS MINE HAD I ESCAPE ROUTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP) The chairman of a Senate investigating committee said today that its findings indicated that miners killed in the Sunshine Mine fire had only one real escape route, in violation of regulations.

title: State College in Purchase Will Focus on the Arts
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., May 22The first new buildings rising on the imaginatively designed campus of the State University of New York College at Purchase are not yet ready for occupancy, but the newest and freshest institution in the system has already acquired a guest home and conference center.

title: Toasts With Brandy
description: MOSCOW, May 22 (AP)When President Nixon's limousine pulled up behind the red brick walls of the Kremlin today, he stepped out with a slight smile. Together with Premier Kosygin and Mr. Podgorny, he walked up a broad staircase in the Great Kremlin Palace to a reception room, where the Soviet hosts passed around small glasses of brandy. There were toasts to one am other's health and to a successful visit, said one American who was present.

title: MORALES PINS FOE BEFORE 19,367 FANS
description: Pedro Morales extended his long winning streak at Madison Square Garden last night when he pinned Pampero Firpo at 15 minutes 21 seconds in the featured professional wrestling exhibition. Morales's successes are probably due more to fan appeal than wrestling skill.

title: LindsayEsposito Split Appears Wider
description: The breach between Mayor Lindsay and _Meade H. Esposito, theBrooklyn Democratic leader, widened last night when the Mayor changed his plans and did not attend the annual Brooklyn Democratic dinner.

title: Hawaii Hotel Chain Sued for $109,500 On Price Violations
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (UPI) The Cost of Living Council said today that the Government had filed the largest suit yet under the Economic Stabilization Act, charging AMFAC, Inc., of Honolulu, with nearly 1,500 separate violations of price control regulations.

title: Justices, 54, Bar Lawsuit by Trustee Of Webb &
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (AP)A divided Supreme Court said today that the trustee of a bankrupt concern does not have the tight to sue a third party for damages that would go to the concern's creditors.

title: Ford Says 32Acre Development In Detroit Will Start in the Fall
description: DETROIT, May 22  Henry Ford 2d said today that a massive redevelopment that he is promoting for Detroit's downtown is no longer an exciting proposalit is now a reality.

title: Back on Familiar Beat Richard Kellerman
description: Richard Kellerman is no stranger to the midnight telphone call, nor to the insistent tones of the reporter or Police Commissioner or Mayor on the line who wants to knowright awayexactly what the police are doing, and why. From July, 1969, to May, 1970, as the Police Department's Deputy Commissioner for Press Relations, he received many such pres surecooker calls.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: MULLAN, Idaho, May 22 (UPI) Mine workers at the Lucky Friday Mine east of here walked off the job today for what they called unsafe working conditions at the silver mine.

title: Priest to Head Delegation
description: FRAMINGHAM, Mass., May 22 (UPI)Representative Robert F. Drinan, the liberal antiwar priest serving his first term in Congress, was chosen during the weekend as chairman of the Massachusetts delegation to the Democratic National Convention.

title: Margaret Rutherford, 80, Fey Comedienne, Is Dead
description: LONDON, May 22  Dame Margaret Rutherford, the actress whose comedy roles delighted audiences for more than 40 years, died today at her (home in Chalfont St. Peter, Buckinghamshire. She was 80 years old.

title: Supreme Court's Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: Waldheim to Visit Moscow
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., May 22  Secretary General Waldheim wil make an official visit of several days to the.Soviet Union beginning July 17. The Secretary General also is expected to make a separate trip to Peking but final arrangements have not been completed. Mr. Waldheim is going to Canada Wednesday for talks with Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau.

title: Sammy Davis and His Bum Trip
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Sammy Davis Jr. told the House Select Committee on Crime today that he had nearly become an unknowing front for a mobaffiliated New Jersey horse farm.

title: Columbia Hopes to Continue Its Pharmaceutical College
description: A lawyer for Columbia University predicted yesterday that the College of Pharmaceutical Sciences, which is threatened with closing. because of fiscal problems, would probably be able to continue for four more years under a tentative arrangement being worked out with the university and the Gustavus and Louise Pfeiffer Research Foundation,

title: Soviet Ship Said to Have Sailed
description: SINGAPORE, May 22 (UPI). A Soviet cargo ship left Haiphong Harbor and sailed unmolested through the United States blockade of the port, according to the skipper and local shipping agents.

title: With Dan Berrigan
description: STOCKHOLMI meet Daniel Berrigan in New York and we spend a long evening together, eating, drinking, strolling about the city. Last summer I took a yellow flower from his friends on Block Island to the prison at Danbury. He was then surrounded by fellow prisoners, visitors and jailers in the big noisy visiting room. Now he is free, but not allowed to leave the city without police permission.

title: PennsylvaniaYouths Can Bet
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 22 (AP)Betting at thoroughbred race tracks has been extended to 18yearolds under a bill signed today by Gov. Milton Shapp. It also allows youths between 10 and 18 years old to go to the races, if accompanied by an adult.

title: Murphy Names Kellerman to Daley Post
description: Police Commissioner Patrick V. Murphy asserted yesterday that the department's spokesman for the last 11 monthsDeputy Commissioner Robert Daleyhad misunderstood his basic responsibilities and the proper way to discharge them.

title: Bridge: Swiss Team Play Here Proves A Triple Success and a Tie
description: The special Swiss team championship played Sunday at the New York Hilton under the joint auspices of the Greater New York Bridge Association and the American Bridge Association's Metropolitan Bridge Unit proved to be a double triple.

title: Frank Powers Retires From ScrippsHoward
description: Frank B. Powers, a vice president and director of the E. W. Scripps Company and a former general business manager of its ScrippsHoward Newspapers, has decided to take early retirement.

title: ADVANCES POSTED ON AMEX AND OTC
description: After a show of strength yesterday morning, stock prices retreated in the afternoon on the American Stock Exchange. The exchange's index closed at 27.87, up 0.01 point.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: As a participant and observer of years of protest, including civil disobedience, I cannot help but question the efficacy of protest tactics used today. It seems as if all our work to educate public opinion about the Vietnam war is put to naught by a single broadcast of the President.

title: New Japanese Steps Hailed by Clausen
description: TOKYO, May 22  A. W. Clausen, president of the Bank of America, today applauded measures taken by the Japanese Government over the weekend to reduce Japan's trade and payments surpluses. He expressed the belief that these steps, combined with earlier Japanese and international moves, would eventually bring a better balance into United StatesJapanese economic relations.

title: Bay State Pay Rise Vetoed
description: BOSTON, May 22 (AF)Gov. Francis W. Sargent vetoed today a bill providing a 4.3 per cent raise for state employes, retroactive to last Jan. 1. The legislature is expected to override the Governor's veto.

title: Witnesses Dispute Testimony Linking Angela Davis to Shootings
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 22 The defense in the murder, kidnapping and conspiracy trial of Angela Davis opened today with a string of witnesses who disputed virtually all of the testimony that tended, to. connect the defendant the 1970 shootings at the Marin County Civic Center.

title: Ceylon Becomes the Socialist Republic of Sri Lanka
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, May 22 (Reuters)Ceylon today became the independent socialist Republic of Sri Lanka in a colorful ceremony that broke a 157yearlink between the island and the British crown.

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rose at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Yields on United States Treasury bills rose, in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Harvard 2Run Rally in 9th Tops Cornell in Playoff, 32
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 22Harvard rallied for two runs in the top of the ninth inning today and gained a 32 victory over Cornell in a playoff for the Eastern Intercollegiate Baseball League championship.

title: Discounters'
description: ATLANTA, May 22A New York attorney told a discounter's convention here today that about 510billion would pass hands this year between suppliers and retailers in a wave of payoffs and instances of conflict of interest.

title: FortressLike Kremlin an Ancient Symbol of Russian Power
description: MOSCOW, May 22 The flag of the United States today waved over the Kremlin for the first time as President Nixon moved into the living quarters where he and Mrs. Nixon will be staying during their weeklong visit to the Soviet capital.

title: Workers Free Boy Trapped 4 Hours In an Elevator Cab
description: Rescue workers struggled for more than four hours last night in an elevator shaft on the 18th floor of a Brooklyn housing project to free a sevenyearold boy whose right leg had been caught between the cab and the side of the shaft.

title: CADENCE INDUSTRIES SETS TENDER OFFER
description: Sheldon Feinberg, chairman and president of the Cadence Industries Corporation, which is active in film processing and publishing, announced yesterday a tender offer for the company's 5 per cent convertible subordinated notes due 1988.1 Holders of some $9.5million of these notes have already agreed to the tender in exchange for 371,735 shares of common.

title: HOOVER'S ESTATE IS LEFT TO TOLSON
description: WASHINGTON, May 22 (Reuters)J. Edgar Hoover, the director of the Federal Bureau of Investigation for 48 years, left almost his entire estate of $551,500 to his longtime friend and colleague, Clyde A. Tolson.

title: Vatican Expert Foresees a Perfect Restoration of the Pieta
description: ROME, May 22  The chief of the Vatican art collections announced today that work to repair Michelangelo's Pieta, severely damaged by hammer blows by a Hungarianborn Australian yesterday, would start at once.

title: 7 Guards Hurt in Maryland
description: JESSUP, Md., May 22 (UPI) Three guards were stabbed, one seriously, and four others were beaten today by inmates at the Patuxent State Prison in two separate incidents of violence at the maximum security institution. Forest Calhoun. superintendent of the prison, said he had no idea what caused the disturbances.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Centennial. The White House announced that President Nixon informed Congress today that plans for an international exposition in Philadelphia in 1976 had been canceled. The President acted on the recommendation of the American Revolution Bicentennial Commission. Among the reasons cited were the large costs to the Federal Government, the question of whether it was still appropriate to hold such a large exposition in one city and the question of whether sufficient time remained to make all necessary arrangements.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 22All right, so everybody now knows that tough, dynamic, plainspeaking, abrasive, rich, powerful, charming, smart, fascinating, hardworking, ambitious John Connally has resigned from President Nixon's Cabinet. Who knows who the other members of the Cabinet are? This columnist, that's who.

title: Demonstrators'
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 22 (AP) The Miami Snowplow Company, a coalition formed to help manage thousands of demonstrators expected in Miami Beach this summer, disbanded today, governmental agencis of indifference.

title: Doctors Find Signs of Feeling in Wallace's Legs
description: WASHINGTON, May 22Gov. George C. Wallace's doctors reported today encouraging evidence that some sensation and involuntary muscular activity were returning to their patient's paralyzed legs.

title: Pietro Bonatti, Caretaker Of Sistine Chapel, Is Dead
description: ROME, May 22Pietro Bonatti, caretaker of the Vatican's Sistine Chapel and of the Pontifical Sacristy, died of a lung ailment in his Vatican apartment this morning. He was 83 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: For those of us who believe in the future of New York City, the Manhattan Landing project proposed for the East River is a most imaginative plan with a definite bearing on the future growth and economic development of the entire city.

title: PENTAGON POLICE ROUT PROTESTERS
description: WASHINGTON, May 22More than 220 antiwar protest era were arrested today during a noisy, onehour clash at the mall entrance of the Pentagon

title: 5TH FREE ORFEO IS ELOQUENT HERE
description: One of the most unusual and most welcome anniversaries of this season was marked last Saturday When, for the ,fifth consecutive season, Charlotte Bergen presented a free concert performance of Monteverdi's Orfeo for all who wanted to hear it.

title: 600 More G.I.'s Out of War. 400 Marine Airmen Sent In
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 22 (UPI)The United States command withdrew 600 American servicemen from Vietnam last week, but 400 more Marine fliers entered the war zone, military spokesmen said today.

title: BENEFIT FOOTBALL IS SLATED NOV. 18
description: NEWARK, May 22 Checks totaling $28,000 were presented to the 1971 beneficiaries today, at a luncheon to promote the second annual Urban Classic Football game between Morgan State and Rutgers, which is scheduled Nov. 18 at Rutgers.

title: Justices Back State Court Convictions Without Unanimous Verdicts by Juries
description: WASHINGTON, May 22The Supreme Court held 5 to 4 today that unanimous jury verdicts are not required for convictions in state criminal courts.

title: The Backs of the Poor
description: Having proposed massive borrowing and the extensive shifting of recurring expenses to the capital budget, both highly objectionable fiscal practices, Mayor Lindsay has now come up with perhaps the most reprehensible scheme of all for closing the city's projected budgetary gap. He urges balancing the budget on the backs of the poor by holding welfare rolls to zero growth.

title: Advertising:
description: About a month from now in homes scattered around the country housewives will be sitting down after meals to record in their diaries just who ate what and how it was prepared.

title: STEEL PRODUCTION FALLS 0.4% IN WEEK
description: The American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday decline of 0.4 per cent in steel production for the week ended May 20. The trade association placed the week's output at 2,703,000 net tons.

title: Roundup: Niekro's Homer Is as Handy as Knuckleball
description: Phil Niekro not only displayed his knuckleball last night but also hit one of his infrequent home runs in a 21 victory over the Reds in Cincinnati.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Catalogue Stores Stir Discounters'
description: ATLANTA, May 23At a time when a new generation is emerging that never knew when discount stores did not exist, the discount store is meeting a new form of competitionthe catalogue discounter.

title: Mock Assault Staged on a Rome Statue
description: ROME, May 23In the wake of the hammer attack Sunday on Michelangelo's Pieta increasing fears are being expressed about the dangers to other works of art and now mock assault has been staged on another Michelangelo masterpiece to prove the point.

title: Scheuer Walks Out of Planning Hearing
description: Representative James H. Scheuer denounced the City Planning Commission and then walked out of its hearing last night when the commission chairman, Donald H. Elliott, suggested that the denunciation had been motivated by Mr. Scheuer's primary fight.

title: PRICES ARE DOWN IN AMEX TRADING
description: After four days last week of rising prices and a day of hesitation on Monday, shares on the American Stock Exchange yesterday registered a decline. The exchange index measured the drop at 0.05 for a closing figure of 27.83.

title: CHARLES S. PACK, 82, OF DIECASTING FIRM
description: Charles S. Pack who helped develop modern diecasting technology died Sunday in Mi. ami Beach Fla. He was 82 years old.

title: South Carolina Districting Approved by Federal Court
description: COLUMBIA, S. C., May 23A threejudge Federal Court upheld today a state Senate reapportionment plan permuted by the South Carolina Legislature.

title: Dr. S. Joseph Bregstein, 72, Brooklyn Dentist 50 Years
description: Dr. S. Joseph Bregstein, a dentist in Brooklyn for more than half a century until his retirement a year ago, died of i coronary attack In Overlook Hospital, Summit, N. J., on Monday. He was 72 years old and lived in Florida.

title: F.D.I.C. Urges High Court To Rule on Bank Competition
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation urged the Supreme Court today to make clear, in a forthcoming case, that elimination of potential competition was a valid reason for prohibiting bank mergers.

title: Clearing Mines, Tho Says
description: PARIS, May 23Le Due Tho, the North Vietnamese Politburo member who is directing his country's delegation to the peace talks here, said today that American.mines are being cleared from Haiphong harbor and that our supplies will continue to come In.

title: TV: Stokesand U dell, the New News Teamin Town
description: The set is miserable. The small talk is embarrassing. The vibrations are still generating too much static. And when WNBCTV's slickly publicized news team of Carl B. Stokes and Paul Udell made its debut last week, it ran smack into the major breaking story of an assassination attempt on Gov. George C. Wallace. After that baptism by bulletin fire, the team had nowhere to go but up.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Every time George McGovern wins another state primary election, the Republican political leaders are delighted. As they see it, he is a political accident, whose radical policies and energetic amateur doorbellringers were Successful in the confusing scrimmage of the state preliminaries, but will be a Democratic party disaster in a straight test with President Nixon in the national election.

title: CHANGES ALLOWED IN DRUG CARE BILL
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The House Rules Committee agreed today to permit amendments on the floor of the House to the Administration's military drug addiction treatment bill.

title: LongerTerm Bond Rates Continue a Broad Declinei
description: Longterm interest rates continued to decline across a broad front yesterday, with the taxexempt sector of the market taking the spotlight with a host of new, highpriced issues.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WILLIAM OLMSTEAD JR.
description: William W. Olmstead Jr., a horse racing handicapper for The New York Post and a sports copy desk editor successively on the old New York American, JournalAmerican, and WorldJournalTribune, died Monday night of a heart attack at his home, 5106 Marathon Parkway, LittleNeck, Queens. He was 66 years old.

title: Sickle Cell Funds Asked
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) Senator John V. Tunney, Democrat of California, asked Congress today to add at least $10million to the $15million requested by the Administration for research on sickle cell anemia and help for its victims. Senator Tunney said the additional funds were needed to implement the national sickle cell anemia control act, which he introduced. It was passed unanimously by both the House and the Senate.

title: Chicago School Strike Vote
description: CHICAGO, May 23 (AP)The Chicago Teachers Union has voted by a narrow margin to authorize a strike against the city's school system Thursday. The union president, John Desmond, yesterday announced the vote 10,391 for the strike and 10,193 against.

title: 122 LOCALITIES GET ES. MEDICAL AIDES
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The National Health Service Corps, the new Federal organization created to place medical personnel in areas short of health services, made its first major assignments today288 medical professionals to 122 communities throughout the country.

title: Mrs. Gross Is Married To Harry L. Denburg
description: EAST ORANGE, N. J., May 23  Mrs. Nathalie Bass Gross, widow of Meyer P. Gross, was married here this evening to Harry L. Denburg, also of East Orange, a widower. Rabbi Joachim Prinz performed the ceremony in the Meyer P. Gross Chapel of Temple Israel of the Oranges and Maplewood, named for the bride's first husband, a past president of the temple.

title: REPORTER RECALLS NOTES ON BREMER
description: ATLANTA, May 23Arthur Herman Bremer apparently attended election night activities at Gov. George C. Wallace's Wisconsin headquarters the evening of that state's Democratic primary balloting, April 4.

title: V.A. Hospital Chief Resigns
description: Dr. Abraham Kleiman has resigned as director of the Bronx VVeterans Administration Hospital after 15 years as chief, it was announced yesterday. Dr. Kleiman, 65 years old, submitted his resignation last week. It became effective Monday, hospital spokesman said.

title: COLLINS, RARICK LEAD QUALIFYING
description: Two professionals from the Brae Burn Country Club, Bill Collins and Rick Rarick, made a family affair of Westchester's qualifying trials for the United States Open golf championship by finishing as coleaders yesterday.

title: A Big Wine Bottle and Price
description: A Manhattan liquor retailer paid $9,200 for a bottle of French wine yesterday but said later he was a bit upset: he had planned to pay only $7,500 Industry sources said the price was a record for a singlethough oversizedbottle of wine.

title: 11Game Victory Run Is Ended By Jenkins
description: CHICAGO, May 23 The New York Mets 11game winning streak came to an end in Wrigley Field today when Fer guson Jenkins pitched the Chicago Cubs to a 21 victory that was decided in the last half of the eighth inning.

title: Judge Rules Inadmissible as Evidence a Statement by a New Witness in the Harlem Four Slaying Case
description: State Supreme Court Justice Joseph A. Martinis said yesterday that he would not permit the statement of a new witness in the Harlem Four casea statement that allegedly characterizes some of the prosecution's evidence as untrueto be presented to the jury at the defendants scheduled fourth trial. It is inadmissible as evidence, the judge said.

title: Front Page 2  No Title
description: A NEW KIND OF GUIDEBOOK FOR YOUNG PEOPLEFODOR'S EUROPE UNDER 25. $3.9S. McKayADVT.

title: BIRTH RATE DROP IS ACCELERATING
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The national birth rate, which dropped sharply in 1971, plunged even faster during the first three months of 1972, according to new Federal statistics.

title: Prison Reform Measures Are Signed by Rockefeller
description: ALBANY, May 23Governor Rockefeller's office announced today that the Governor had signed a package of prison reform bills designed to meet the legitimate needs of the inmates and the community.

title: Front Page 1  No Title
description: SOVIET Jews are being rounded up again. We must Free them Now Cable Ambasnador Beam, U.S Embassy. Moscow. and Leonid timbBrezhnev. Kremlin, Mnseow, Greater N.Y. Cont. on Soviet Jewry 2123541316Advt.

title: Hanoi Reports Downing 8
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, May 24 (AP)The Hanoi radio said that eight United States planes were shot down over North Vietnam yesterday.

title: BristolMyers
description: WILMINGTON, Del., May 23 The BristolMyers Company expects secondquarter earnings to be 5 per cent to 8 per cent higher than in the 1971 quarter, Richard L. Gelb, president, told the annual meeting here today. Firstqua?? profits of the pharmaceutical and toiletries concern were down 33 per cent from a year ago.

title: Moscow's First Fruits
description: The atmosphere was noticeably warmer in Moscow yesterday than it had been on the first day of President Nixon's summit visit. In public view, Leonid I. Brezhnev at one point demonstratively clinked champagne glasses with Mr. Nixon and threw his arm around the President. Strong indications developed that a strategic arms limitation treaty will be signed this week despite earlier reports of technical snags. Both sides seemed to be making an effort to send out optimistic signals while keeping the substance of summit negotiations secret.

title: Director of New Health Agency Hubert McDonald Rimple
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Hubert McDonald Rimple, appointed today as director of the new National Health Service Corps, has spent all his 15 years as a doctor serving in the Federal medical bureaucracy, including stints in New York City. A career officer in the United

title: Brooklyn Car's Wrong Turn Results in Injuries to 14
description: At least 14 persons, most of them pedestrians, were injured yesterday when an automobile making an improper turn on a downtown Brooklyn street truck another car and caused collisions involving a city bus and a parked truck.

title: Notes on People
description: Mrs. Jane Briggs Hart wife of Senator Philip A. Hart, of Michigan, has told the Internal Revenue Service she has ceased paying her income taxes as a protest against the war in Vietnam.

title: EUROPEANS IN NATO PLAN RESEARCH TIES
description: BRUSSELS, May 23The defense ministers of 10 European Governments agreed today to intensify cooperation in research, development, production and purchase of defense equipment.

title: MRS. ROBERT RYAN
description: Mrs. Jessica Cadwalader Ryan, an author and the wife of Robert Ryan, the actor, died of cancer Monday in their home, The Dakota, 1 West 72d Street. She was 57 years old.

title: U.S. Welcomes Health Accord
description: WASHINGTON, May 23In a briefing at the White House, the health agreement signed today in Moscow was described as a new and important step in cooperation between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Advertising:
description: When it comes to pens any writer worth his salt knows immediately what a quill, fountain pen or a ballpoint is. But what do you call that new categoryfelt tip, fine line marker or porous point? Apparently there is no generic name.

title: Books of The Times
description: The short story today seems to be caught up in a competition of subtlety. Who can weave a web of the thinnest materials? Who is most cunning in avoiding the vulgarity of action? Even the characters, the uneliminable element in stories, are muted down to the point where they are just barely there. In fact, one might call such stories existential or ontological, for it is the characters being there"the dasein of Heideggerthat is their sole drama. For the existentialist, being there is the essence of man's condition, and there are authors who are content to illustrate this.

title: Robbery Suspect Is Slain By an OffDuty Patrolman
description: An offduty patrolman shot and killed a 29yearold man early yesterday who, the patrolman told the police, attempted to rob him with knife.

title: Ellender Faces Challenge In Louisiana's Primary
description: NEW Orleans, May 23Former State Senator J. Bennett Johnston, 39 years old, of Shreveport, announced yesterday that he would oppose Senator Allen J. Ellender, 81, in the Louisiana Democratic primary Aug. 19.

title: Mitchell and Irwin, Moon Explorers, To Quit Astronauts
description: HOUSTON, May 23 (AP)Capt. Edgar D. Mitchell of the Navy and Col. James B. Irwin of the Air Force, both moon explorers, announced plans today to retire from both as astronauts and from the armed forces, the space agency said.

title: SAMUEL J. POLAY
description: NORTH PLAINFIELD N. J., May 23Samuel J. Polay, president of the Aladdin Leather Products Company 36 East 12th Street New York died yesterday in SloanKettering Memorial Hospital New York. He was 56 years old and lived at 91 Willow Avenue.

title: AbdulJabbar Shuns AllStar Contest
description: Kareem AbdulJabbar, the 7foot2inch center who was the leading scorer and the most valuable player in the National Basketball Association last season, will not take part tomorrow night in the allstar game between leading players of the N. B. A. and the American Basketball Association at Nassau Coliseum in Uniondale, L. I.

title: Washington: For the Record May 23, 1972
description: Activities. The President was in Moscow, meeting with Leonid I. Brezhnev, the Soviet Communist party leader.

title: Aid for Handicapped
description: Today an estimated total of 500,000 Americans and their families need help.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: OTTAWA, May 23 (Reuters) A spokesman said Prime Minister Trudeau was delighted at the invitation from Dr. Allende but had not yet replied to it.

title: Blast Test on MoonIndicates Topsoil Is Extremely Deep
description: HOUSTON, May 23 (Reuters)Scientists detonated three small explosions on the moon today and produced a surprise finding.

title: Bill Allowing Newsgirls Signed by Rockefeller
description: ALBANY, May 23The women's liberation movement, junior division, invaded another formerly allmale area when Governor Rockefeller signed into law a bill permitting girls to serve as newspaper carriers.

title: OTB, ROOSEVELT SIGN VIDEO PACT
description: Subject to the approval of the New York State Harness Racing Commission, Roosevelt Raceway and New York City's Offtrack Betting Corporation agreed yesterday to televise races from 11 to 11:30 P.M. The telecast will run nightly from May 25 through July 22, with Ken Rabat calling the race over WORTV (Channel, 9).

title: Senate Panel Cuts Military Aid and Adds Mansfield Antiwar Amendment to Bill
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Senate Foreign Relations Committee voted today to cut the Administration's military aid program by $550million and to impose new restrictions on the executive branch's authority to make agreements on foreign military bases without the consent of Congress.

title: One OTB Shop Starts Week With Minus Pool
description: The Preakness paid off handsomely for burglars who looted an Offtrack Betting Corporation shop of about $40,000 at 180 Montague Street in Brooklyn, the police reported yesterday.

title: Damage in Pentagon Blast Is Estimated at $75,000
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Defense Department officials estimated today that the damage caused by an explosion in a Pentagon lavatory last Friday totaled $75,000 to $85,000.

title: No Deal on Rhodesia
description: Britain has honorably accepted the Pearce Commission's verdict that Rhodesia's black majority emphatically rejects the proposed settlement worked out by British negotiators with the white minority Government in Salisbury last November. This means that Britain will continue to maintain the mandatory sanctions invoked against Rhodesia by the United Nations Security Council.

title: NIXON,BREZHNEV CONFER 5 HOURS; ARMS PACT SEEN
description: MOSCOW, May 23President Nixon and Leonid I. Brezhnev the Soviet Communist party leader, held five hours of intensive personal talks today amid mounting indications that an agreement to curb the strategic arms race would be ready for final approval by the week's end.

title: That Young Russian at Talks Is Old Translator
description: MOSCOW, May 23 When any of the top Kremlin leaders meets with Americans, a suavelooking young man, dressed in a wellcut dark suit, is likely to sit at the head of the customary long conference table.

title: Film Murders Thin Out 1930's Family of The Other
Profile of the Nixon Court Now Discernible
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The shape of the Nixon Court has begun to emerge, in a, form that appears to resemble the lawandorder institution that President Nixon promised to create by nominating judicial conservatives to the Supreme Court. In a fundraising leaflet circulated recently by

title: Chrysler Raises Prices; Makes Extras Standard
description: DETROIT, May 23 (AP)The Chrysler Corporation disclosed today that it had raised prices on most of its automobiles $17 to $113 by making heretofore optional equipment standard.

title: N.Y.U. as Symbol
description: The task force report on the desperate financial condition of New York University dramatically spells out the greater threat to American higher education. When one of the nation's largest independent universities is in danger of collapse, it would be the height of irresponsibility to treat it as either a local or an isolated calamity. It is, rather, an indication of the nationwide depression endangering the existence of many colleges and universities and the quality of most. The report should give a new sense of urgency to the debate over the higher education aid bill in Washington.

title: Jewish Theological Leader Resigns as Seminary Chief
description: The resignation of Rabbi Bernard Mandelbaum as president of the Jewish Theological Seminary of America was accepted yesterday with regret by the institution's board of directors.

title: P.T.A Convention Approves Busing Resolution by 6 Votes
description: The National Congress of Parents and Teachers approved yesterday by a narrow margin a resolution favoring busing to reduce racial isolation.

title: More Bombings Strike Belfast; Catholics Distressed at I.R.A.
description: BELFAST, May 23  Amid growing Roman Catholic unease about the tactics of the Irish Republican Army, a wave of bombings and terror struck Belfast today.

title: Federal Productivity Up, Its First Gauging Shows
description: Secretary of Labor James D. Hodgson announced yesterday that the first measurement of Government productivity showed that the rate of increase in the last four years was higher than in the private nonfarm sector.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Americans are by nature impatient and by training perfectionist. So we look at the current primary contests, and because they are not immediately and incontrovertibly decisive, we say, Get rid of them. Those same reformers who once argued for state primaries over backroom caucuses are now arguing against state primaries and for regional or national primaries. Surely, once instituted, these will also prove imperfect.

title: The Budget Mystique
description: I've been here for almost two years, and I'm just learning where they hide the money, Allen Claxton. an assistant budget director, commented recently. It's all coded.

title: Bremer Is Indicted by Two Grand Juries
description: BALTIMORE, May 23 Arthur Herman Bremer was indicted by Federal and state grand juries today for the shooting of Gov. George C. Wallace of. Alabama and three other persons at a political rally eight days ago.

title: D. N. Pritt, British Lawyer, Dies; Defended Ho ChiMinh, Kenyatta
description: LONDON, May 23  D. N. Pritt, whose espousal of leftwing causes and defense in court of those he believed to be oppressed kept him in the forefront of politics for half a century, died today at his home in Hampshire. His age was 84.

title: Village Evacuated
description: HOME. Pa., May 23 (AP)The state police evacuated a part of this Indiana County village yesterday after a tanker truck carrying 6,000 gallons of flammable solvent upset along U. S. 119 and began leaking. Firemen stood by for several hours while another tanker was brought in and the liquid was transferred.

title: MARKET DECLINES ON PROFIT TAKING
description: The stock market's recent advance ran into a roadblock yesterday as profit taking brought to a halt the upswing of the prior three sessions.

title: Looking Back at Mc Cardell: It's a Lot Like Looking at Today
description: The Paris fashion world has Chanel as its monument. New York has Claire McCardell. Both women, though deceased, have influenced the current casual mood of fashion. Chanel invented the sweater McCardell invented the American Look.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: State Supreme Court Justice Samuel A. Spiegel and two opposing lawyers ate lunch at the New Pine Garden restaurant at 9 Chatham Square in Chinatown yesterday to help conclude a $11million damage suit filed Saturday by the Chinese American Restaurant Association of Greater New York against The Village Voice, charging defamation of reputation and vast financial losses.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It is ironical that Julius Epstein should rebuke Pablo Neruda for a comment that the visiting Chilean poet and Ambassador made here when he was questioned about the Solzhenitsyn case [letters May 5]. Noting that Neruda had referred to conflicts between writers and their governments in capitalist countries, Mr. Epstein asserted that any such conflicts are trivial compared with the mistreatment of Solzhenitsyn by his Government.

title: Bettor Stays Honest, Returns Overpayment
description: BALTIMORE, May 23 (AP) Herman Pendyck stepped up to the $10 mutuel window at Pimlico race course yesterday and handed the cashier more than $1,000.

title: Imagination, Please
description: Amy Lowell, when asked how she could write poems about poverty when she had never experienced it, replied, Imagination, man Imagination!

title: Bangladesh Students Shift to the Left
description: DACCA, Bangladesh, May 23 The moderately leftist leadership of Bangladesh has suffered a sharp setback at the hands of radical youth factions in elections at the leading universities, historically the seedbed of political trends here.

title: Miss Kuflik Bride Of Robert Kimball
description: Miss Abigail Kuflik who reports on music and drama in New York for Newsweek magazine, was married here last evening to Robert Kimball, author of Cole, the book about Cole Porter. Rabbi Bernhard Cohn performed the ceremony in the apartment where the couple will reside.

title: U.S. Adding Targets
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Defense Department said today that more industrial sites in North Vietnam would be added to the target lists of American planes.

title: JERRY MITCHELL, 67, POST SPORTSWRITER
description: Jerry Mitchell, a sportswriter on The New York Post for 38 years, died Monday night at Holy Name Hospital in Teaneck, N. J. He was 67 years old and lived at 3041 Edwin Avenue, Fort Lee, N. J.

title: CZAR IS SUGGESTED Al RACING INQUIRY
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Congressional investigators took a look at a new batch of horse racing's dirty linen today and began wondering out loud if the sport needed some kind of national drycleaning service.

title: Compromise Produces City's Budget
description: The city budget agreement announced yesterday was produced at a midnighttodawn conference at Gracie Mansion at which all the major factions of city government yielded and carefully balanced the responsibility for what they agreed was a distasteful compromise.

title: Barbara Harris On Role Playing
description: Starring Barbara Harris, read the marquees. Next week she opens at Radio City Music Hall in The War Between Men and Women, and next fall she will be back on Broadway playing Eve in Arthur Miller's new catastrophic comedy, The Creation of the World and Other Business.

title: Air Bag Fails Again to Inflate During a Safety Test
description: DETOIT, May 23An air bag designed to protect automobile passengers in crashes failed a second test today.

title: CONNECTICUT GETS STRICT ABORTION
description: HARTFORD, May 23 Gov. Thomas S. Meskill signed tonight into law a measure passed earlier by the General Assembly that would allow an abortion only when the life of the expectant mother was threatened.

title: U.S. Museums Are Tightening Security to Curb Thefts
description: Although museum directors across the country are reluctant to acknowledge it, increased security measures are being implemented to check growing problems of vandalism and theft.

title: Ranks of General Practitioners Growing in the U.S.
description: FLEMINGTON, N.J., May 23 Three years ago, Samuel Warburton graduated. from the University of Pennsylvania School of Medicine with an ambition to be what was considered a vanishing speciesa family doctor.

title: GOTTFRIED GAINS 3D ROUND IN PARIS
description: PARIS, May 23 (UPI)Brian Gottfried of Fort Lauderdaled Fla., advanced to the third round of the $100,000 French open tennis championships today by defeating JeanPaul Meyer of France, 62, 64, 64.

title: STRAVINSKY'S MUSIC HEARD AT FAREWELL
description: The New Amsterdam Ense1mble includes several members of the New York City Opera Orchestra. One such player is Ryohei Nakagawa, Japanese bassoonist, who is leaving to join the San Francisco Symphony. His colleagues decided to give him a farewell concert, and the program turned into A Stravinsky Celebration, held in Tully Hall Monday night.

title: Southern Railway
description: Stockholders of the Southern Railway Company approved a twoforone split of common and preferred stock at the annual meeting yesterday in Richmond. The split, also approved by the Interstate Commerce Commission, is payable July 7 to stock of record June 5. It will double the authorized common to 30 million shares and the authorized preferred to million shares.

title: Smith Attacks Report
description: SALISBURY, Rhodesia, May 23Prime Minister Ian D. Smith angrily accused the Pearce commission tonight of naivet and ineptness.

title: 17th Flood Victim Found
description: NEW BRAUNFELS, Tex., May 23 (UPI)Authorities found today the body of Mrs. Melvin Nolte, 17th victim of the flash flood that struck New Braunfels May 14.

title: Japanese Will Use Reserves for Loans
description: TOKYO, May 23The Japanese Government will utilize $3billion of its huge $16.5billion of foreign exchange reserves as loans at 3 per cent interest through financial institutions to Japanese enterprises for developing oil and other natural resources useful to Japan.

title: ExJudge Charles A. Waters Of Philadelphia Court Dead
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 23 (AP)  Charles A. Waters, retired Philadelphia Common Pleas Court judge and a former state official, died today at his home in Margate, N. J. He was 80 years old.

title: Bombing of North Termed Highly Effective by U.S.
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Wednesday, May 24For four days American bombers have reportedly struck North Vietnam with great intensity and apparently unusual effectiveness.

title: Toasters or Books?
description: Not since the Depression years, when movie theaters augmented their triple features with giveaway offerings of breakfast dishes and cutlery, have so many household, goods been held out to lure potential patrons as the savings banks are now offering. A refreshing twist in this safedeposit merchandising pattern is the offer. of, the East New York Savings Bank to turn the proferred giveaways into extra funds for the New York Public Library.

title: 2 AntiDiscrimination Bills
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) Representative Bella S. Abzug, Democrat of Manhattan, today introduced bills that would prohibit sex discrimination in the credit and loan policies of federally insured finance institutions.

title: DANCE ATTEMPTS THE DUNCAN STYLE
description: The temptation to create dances in the style of Isadora Duncan is made nearly irresistible by her fabulous legend. But it is a seduction to be avoided.

title: SAUL M. SILVERSTEIN
description: Saul M. Silverstein, a chemical engineer who had been chairman of the Rogers Corporation until his retirement last year, died May 15 in Tanzania while on a roundtheworld trip. He was 71 years old and lived in Columbia, Conn.

title: PHILIPPE CAPTURES PARKS 880 IN 1:51.9
description: Marcel Philippe of Fordham took the 880yard run in 1 minute 51.9 seconds yesterday in the Parks CouncilMetropolitan Amateur Athletic Union invitation track and field meet ?? Downing Stadium, Randalls Island.

title: PRICE PANEL SCANS INCREASES AT EDIE
description: WASHINGTON, May 23A Price Commission spokesman acknowledged today that the comission staff was examining price increases by Lionel D. Edie, a subsidiary of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., to determine if it was in violation of price regulations. The spokesman said a decision might be announced tomorrow.

title: Power Failure in Queens
description: Two 4,000volt Consolidated Edison feeder lines at 100th Drive and 222d Street in Queens Village broke and left 2,360 customers without light and power yesterday afternoon for nearly three hours.

title: INSURER HOLDS ANNUAL MEETING
description: FRAZER, Pa., May 23 The nation's largest mail order health insurer, the National Liberty Corporation, reported at its annual meeting here today that it hoped to sell more individual health and life insurance this year than any other company in the country.

title: A TwoParty Republic
description: DALLASThe future of our Republic, which was designed to endure as a nation of states, is best safeguarded if each of the states provides a strong twoparty system. Strong twoparty states will cause a strong twoparty nation, with the philosophies of each party well defined. A study of the history of governments should convince everyone that only the twoparty system affords both stability and constructive progress.

title: Stage:
description: Should one know what a play is all about? Certainly I have very little idea of what Murray Mednick's The Hunter is concerned with. It opened last night at the Public Theater Annex and it is one of the more puzzling plays that I have seenand I am an expert at being puzzled. I caught the play at a press preview over the weekend, and despite my efforts to reason out some kind of method to its madness, am still almost totaly at a loss.

title: Firestone DragRace Chief Is Killed in Street Crash
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 23 (AP) William J. Abraham Jr., 30yearold manager of Firestone's dragracing division, was killed here today when his car went out of control on a city street.

title: Lord &
description: A group of new officers and appointments was announced yesterday by Lord & Taylor in conjunction with the reorganization of its merchandising division, effective June 1.

title: Lieut. Col. William L. Rich, Served the Board of Trade
description: Lieut. Col. William L. Rich, an engineer who was executive secretary of the New York Board of Trade at his retirement in 1958, died yesterday in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 82 years old and lived at 45 East End Avenue.

title: Bremer's Brother Faces Miami Extradition Charge
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., May 23 (Reuters)  An interstate extradition hearing on fraud charges in Florida against William Bremer, brother of Arthur Bremer, the alleged asiailant of Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama was postponed here today until June.16.

title: Heated Meeting at Liberty Leasing
description: CHICAGO, May 23  The management of the Liberty Leasing Company, Inc., said today that it had turned back an attempt by two former top officers of the company to regain control. After the annual meeting, a lawyer for the company said the management held about 535,000 shareholder proxies, more than half of the 1,019,000 voting shares outstanding. Not all the eligible shares are expected to be voted. however, and the lawyer said that even with revisions it was not likely that a reversal could

title: YONKERS DECLINES IN CROWD, HANDLE
description: YONKERS, May 23  The 73d and final card of the first half of Yonkers Raceway's harness season will end tomorrow night with the lameduck ownership and management, soon to be replaced by the five Rooney brothers of Pittsburgh, hardly elated over the figures.

title: Accord Expected to Offset Missile Totals and Power
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The United States and the Soviet Union have all but concluded agreements to limit some strategic nuclear arms that would give the Russians a possible numerical edge in the number of landbased and seabased missiles, Congressional and Administration officials said today.

title: Allende Invites Trudeau, Who Says He's Delighted
description: SANTIAGO, Chile, May 23 (Reuters)Prime Minister Pierre Elliott Trudeau has received an invitation from President Salvador Allende Gossens to visit Chile, the Foreign Ministry said today.

title: ARCH C. GERLACH, 61, A GEOGRAPHER, DEAD
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Dr. Arch C. Gerlach, chief geographer of the United States Geological Survey and president of the Pan American Institute of Geography and History, died of cancer here on Saturday in Sibley Hospital. He was 61 years old.

title: Vietnam's Exiles Are Discussing Coalition
description: PARIS, May 17The Vietnamese expatriate community here, reacting to North Vietnam's initial successes in its current offensive, has begun to broaden contacts with the VietIcong delegation; apparently in the expectation that a coalition government will be formed in the future. ,

title: Treasury Bill Rates Rise at Monthly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Government's monthly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: John. Roeburt, Author, Is Dead; Wrote Radio and TV Dramas
description: John Roeburt, author of detective and suspense novels and radio and television dramas, died of, a heart, attack Monday at his summer home on Fire Island. He was 63 years old and lived at 6828 Clyde Street, Forest Hills, Queens.

title: Letters to the Editor;... A Giant Step for Unisex
description: To the Editor:

title: FORUM DISCUSSED FOR TRADE GROUP
description: PARIS, May 23High economic officials from 23 Western nations arrived here today for a series of discussions designed to decide the shape of the forum for new world monetary and trade reform negotiations.

title: RABBI JOSEPH. LIEF
description: Rabbi Joseph H. Lief, chaplain at Northport (L. I) Veterans Hospital and national and New York department chaplain of the Jewish War Veterans, died Sunday in Athens, where he was vacationing. He was 62 years old and lived at 105 Dumbarton Drive in Huntington, L. I.

title: Accurate Smart Bombs Guided To Objectives by TV or Laser
description: They are variously referred to as smart bombs or guided bombs or hobos, short for homing bombs.

title: BritishRhodesian Agreement Collapses
description: LONDON, May 23The effort to end the sixyear dispute between Britain and her breakaway colony of Rhodesia collapsed today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Drama Critics'
description: The New York Drama Critics Circle erred on Monday in adding up the votes for the best play of the 197172 season.

title: TRIAL HEARS NEWS UPSET MISS DAVIS
description: SAN JOSE, Calif., May 23A young social worker testified today that Angela Davis was a dinner guest at her home in Los Angeles when Miss Davis first learned of the escape attempt at the Marin County Civic Center that she is accused of helping to plot.

title: McGovern Sweeps Races In Oregon, Rhode Island
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 23Voters of this placid state supported the critics of the estiblished order today as Senator George McGovern of South Dakota easily won the 34 delegates to the Democratic National Convention and Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama finished second in the Presidential primary.

title: Presbyterians Urge War's End And an Escalation of Protest
description: DENVER, May 23The General Assembly of the United Presbyterian Church in the U.S.A. has called for an immediate halt to all military involvement in Indochina.

title: GARRISON WITNESS CHARGES LIES BY U.S.
description: NEW ORLEANS, May 23 (UPI)The Government's key, witness against District Attorney Jim Garrison says he worked undercover to help make a bribery and gambling case against Mr. Garrison only after the Justice Department used threats, bribes and lies as inducements.

title: Frazier's Foe Has 2 Goals: Win Title and Fight Ali
description: OMAHA, May 23 Behind the Foxhole Bar, an old stairway led down to a shabby basement, the Foxhole Gym, where about 25 persons had gathered today. On the open gray wooden door was stapled a white placard, announcing This Is Stander Country, an,d near the small ring Ron Stander was bandaging his hands.

title: Controller Clears Purchase By Crocker of Coast Bank
description: The Controller of the Currency approved last Friday the formal application of the Crocker National Bank, San Francisco, to purchase the First National Bank of Upland, Calif., it was disclosed yesterday in Washington. In granting permission for the acquisition, Justin T. Watson, Acting Controller of the Currency, said the Controller's office had found that an emergency existed and that action had to be taken to prevent the probable failure of the First National and to protect its depositors, creditors and shareholders.

title: MRS. H. M. ROBERTS
description: Mrs. Hazel Bliss Roberts, widow of Harold M. Roberts who was a construction engineer and former business manager of The New York American, died Monday in the Mary Manning Walsh Nursing Home. She was 84 years old and lived at 1349 Lexington Avenue.

title: Kenny Sentence Off Until Today As Political Dynasty Is Studied,
description: NEWARK, May 23  John V. Kenny, the 79yearold ailing political boss of Hudson County, was pictured today as alert and interested enough in politics to submit the names of two men for judicial posts last fall and to have them nominated by Gov. William T. Cahill and confirmed by the State Senate.

title: SHUTDOWN SCORED BY DEAN AT N.Y.U.
description: A proposal that New York University's Graduate School of Social Work be closed as part of a deeper retrenchment at N.Y.U. was assailed by the school's dean yesterday as pennywise and societyfoolish.

title: BUSING CURB WINS A TEST IN SENATE
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The HouseSenate conference agreement on legislation reforming Federal aid to higher education and setting compromise limits on courtordered busing passed its first test in the Senate today.

title: Admitted SS Man Tells of War Days In Brazilian Paper
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, May 23The newspaper O. Estado de sao Paulo published the first installment today of a series of interviews with a GermanBolivian who identified himself as chief of a German SS unit charged with breaking the French Resistance in World War II.

title: SUFFOLK INDICTS 4 IN LOANSHARK CASE
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 23Four men, three of them alleged Mafia members, were indicted today on loanshark and conspiracy charges by a Suffolk County grand jury.

title: Hanoi Denounces Trip As One of Nixon Tricks
description: HONG KONG, May 23 (AP) A North Vietnamese broadcast today attacked President Nixon's trip to Moscow as a dark and despicable politicaldiplomatic attempt to undermine the solidarity of those who support the Vietnamese in their struggle against U.S. imperialist aggression.

title: GERMAN PRESIDENT SIGNS TREATIES BILL
description: BONN, May 23 (UPI)President Gustav Heinemann today signed the parliamentary bill ratifying West Germany's nonaggression threaties with the Soviet Union and Poland.

title: Rhode Island Voting Swept by McGovern
Report Questioning Claims for Drugs Released by F.D.A.
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (UPI) The Food and Drug Administration released previously secret scientific reports yesterday questioning claims made for Many nonprescription drugs, ointments and vitamin preparations.

title: Judge Forbids Preference For Jews in City Housing
description: A Federal judge ruled here yesterday that the city had violated the constitutional rights of blacks and others by giving preference to Jews seeking to move into a new public housing project on the Lower East Side.

title: 2 UNIVERSITY HEADS WARN HOUSE PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The presidents of Princeton University and the University of Minnesota told the House Foreign Affairs Committee today that Congressional action to end the Vietnam war was becoming of critical importance in restoring the faith of a disillusioned generation of students in the American, system of government.

title: Bridg: Tilles to Retire as Manager Of Greater New York Group
description: Tournament players in New York tend to take for granted the smooth running of events sponsored by the Greater New York Bridge Association.

title: Views Differ on ExConvicts'
description: The City Commission on Human Rights yesterday heard a series of witnesses contradict statements by city and state Civil Service officials that criminal conviction did not automatically bar applicants from Civil Service jobs.

title: Santa Fe Industries
description: CHICAGO, May 23  Officials of Santa Fe Industries, Inc., parent of the Atchison, Topeka & Santa Fe Railway and other companies, told today of sharply increased earnings in the first four months this year and expressed confidence the re mainder of the year will bel good, despite uncertainties.

title: Con Ed Plans an Offering Of New Shares to Public
description: The Consolidated Edison Company announced yesterday that its board had approved in principle the sale of not more than five million additional shares of common stock.

title: RULE CHANGE SET FOR U.S. DEPOSITS
description: The Treasury Department announced yesterday that effective June 20 it would change the rules governing the management of the huge deposits that it maintains in banks across the country. On May 16, the latest date for which data were immediately available yesterday, these balances came to $8.9billion.

title: McGovern Discounts A Deal With Kennedy
Jellied Eels and Sawdust Pies
description: For many otherwise tolerant and sensible people, food is the only certainty. Even those who will admit the possibility of their being mistaken about life, love or liberty are completely dogmatic when it comes to eating. It is not merely that they know what they like but they know what everybody else should like.

title: A New Stock Tape Within a Year Seen
description: Paul Kolton, president of the American Stock Exchange, predicted yesterday that a new composite tape supplying data on all listed stocks would be in operation within a year.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I have just become an enthusiast for banning motor vehicle traffic from the streets of Manhattan.

title: MISS MEISTER JOINS MARTORI IN CONCERT
description: Barbara Meister and Frank Martori have given a number of solo concerts here since their Town Hall debuts (his in 1953, hers in 1964), and both appear to be proficient if unexceptional, pianists. It takes more than proficiency to make a fine team, however and their duo performances at Carnegie Recital Hall Monday night were too often in search of poise and precision.

title: 8 Killed in Philippines Blast
description: MANILA, May 23 (UPI) An explosion believed to have been a hand grenade killed eight members of a family and wounded five others in a village in La Union Province today, the Philippine News Service said.

title: Bar Group Votes, 13666, Resolution Opposing the War
description: Members of the Association of the Bar of the City of New York voted 136 to 66 at their annual meeting last evening in favor of a resolution condemning continued American involvement in the war in Indochina as the gravest current threat to the rule of law at home and abroad.

title: SOYBEAN PRICES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Prices of all three commodities in the soybean complex dropped again yesterday on the Chicago Board of Trade.

title: 10 STUDENTS HURT IN SCHOOL PROTEST
description: Ten students were slightly injured yesterday morning as the police moved to disperse 250 Stuyvesant High School pupils who were blocking entrances to the school in a protest against the suspension of two juniors.

title: Peking and Moscow Said to Join in Mounting an Intense Effort to Supply Hanoi
description: PEKING, May 23As President Nixon continues his talks with Soviet leaders in Moscow, there are growing indications here that China and the Soviet Union have embarked on an extensive if not entirely harmonious effort to thwart the President's effort to cut off supplies to North Vietnam.

title: $9.5Billion City Budget Drawn; Council Objects to Tax Increases
description: A new city budget calling for nearly $9.5billion was agreed on early yesterday by Board of Estimate members and Council leaders, but then ran into opposition among Councilmen because of its heavy impact on homeowners.

title: Action by Ohio
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 23 (AP)Health insurance advertisements. featuring Mr. Linkletter have been banned in Ohlo at least for the time being, Ohio Insurance Director Kenneth E. Deshetler said today.

title: DR. ABRAHAM BRODSKY
description: Dr. Abraham I. Brodsky a dentist in Auburndale Queens died yesterday of a heart attack at his home, 19122 39th Avenue Flushing, Queens. He was 56 years old.

title: Northern Ireland Defeats England in Soccer by 10
description: LONDON, May 23 (AP)Northern Ireland defeated England, 10, in the British international soccer tournament tonight at Wembly Stadium.

title: 2 U.S. Planes Downed
description: SAIGON, Wednesday, May 24 (Reuters)The United States command announced today that two American planes had been downed over North Vietnam in the last two days. One of them was shot down by North Vietnamese MIG, the command said.

title: Market Place: Building Profits The Evans Way
description: When Monford Orloff took over the Evans Products Company 10 years ago, it was a plodding, modestly profitable corporation involved in damagecontrol devices for boxcars and in the lumber industry through a plywood concern purchased from Mr. Orloff.

title: Apollo 16 Photographs Detect 2 Glowing Earth Belts
description: Photographs of the earth, taken from the moon last month by the Apollo 16 astronauts, have recorded at ultraviolet wave lengths two glowing belts that may be caused by electric currents flowing high in the night sky of this planet.

title: Maye Asserts Gay Activists Intentionally Set Up Incident
description: Michael J. Maye president of the Uniformed Firefighters Association said yesterday that a disturbance in which he and members of the Gay Activists Alliance were involved was intentionally set up by the militant homosexuals so that they could capture it with cameras and recording equipment.

title: BRAXTON PERFORMS ON ALTO SAXOPHONE
description: Anthony Braxton who has been a prominent member of Chicago's jazz avantgarde played at Town Hall Monday night with an assortment of friends.

title: PENNSY'S APRIL LOSS CUT TO $14.5MILLION
description: The Penn Central Transportation Company, reported yesterday that it had operated at a net loss of $14.5million last month and had a net loss of $79.7million in the first four months of this year. In both cases the results were after making provision for certain taxes, rents, interest payments and other fixed charges that are not being paid currently, but remain obligations of the trusteeship that will have to be satisfied when the company finally emerges from trusteeship.

title: WILLIAM J. M'MASTER
description: William J. McMaster, an executive of Texaco, Inc., died on Monday in the company's offices at 135 East 42d Street. He was 55 years old and lived in Darien, Conn.

title: Redskins Fined and Allen Disciplined
description: The Washington Redskins were fined a sum believed to be $5,000 yesterday by the National Football League because George Allen, their coach and general manager, traded bogus draft choices last year to the Los Angeles Rams and San Diego Chargers. Commissioner Pete Rozelle said Allen had been disciplined in an executive session here of the league's owners. Rozelle did not disclose the amount of the fine but said it was a major one. The maximum fine under league rules is $5,000.

title: Denial by the Pentagon
description: WASHINGTON, May 23The Defense Department said again today that there was no evidence that the minefields in North Vietnamese waters were being cleared. The statement was made by Jerry W. Friedheim, the Assistant Secretary of Defense for Public Affairs.

title: Mrs. Nixon Tours With Soviet Wives
description: MOSCOW, May 23  Mrs. Richard M. Nixon joined the wives of three of the Soviet Union's highest officials today for an unusual visit to a secondary school and a tour of Moscow's subway system.

title: 2 POLEVAULTERS SET WORLD MARK, CLEARING 184
description: EL PASO, Tex., May 23 (UPI)  Bob Seagren of the Southern California Striders and Kjell Isaksson of Sweden shattered the world polevault record by clearing 18 feet 41/4 inches tonight.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: PARISPeking's American option is just as important to China's relations with Russia and to Chou Enlai's political future as Washington's Chinese option is to U.S. relations with China and to President Nixon's reelection prospects.

title: Applause Closes Saturday
description: Applause, the musical based on the film, All About Eve, will give its final performance, the 896th, at the Palace Theater on Saturday night, it was announced by Joseph Kipness and Lawrence Kasha, its producers.

title: Britain's Railways $40Million in Red And More Expected
description: LONDON, May 23Britain's nationalized railroads lost $40million last year and the prospects are that they will have continuing deficits this year and in 1973.

title: CHANGES PLANNED FOR FUND SHARING
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Leaders of the House of Representatives decided today that they would have to change the revenuesharing bill, in a way that the nation's Mayors and Governors will dislike, if they are going to be able to pass it at all.

title: HALT IN PROJECT SOUGHT IN QUEENS
description: Leaders of groups representing a substantial percentage of the Jews in Queens called yesterday for a halt in the construction of the lowincome housing project in Forest Hills pending the efforts of Mario M. Cuomo to seek a compromise in the bitter fight.

title: Woman Dies in Fire
description: BERLIN, N. H., May 23 (UPI) One death was reported today from an early morning fire that destroyed four large apartment houses and left 25 families homeless. The police said the body of Mrs. Doris Guerard, 45 years old, was found as firefighters sifted through the ruins. Six injuries were reported.

title: U.S. Backs Ore Ban
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The State Department threw its support today behind a Senate move to repeal existing legislation that permits imports of chrome and other strategic minerals from Rhodesia in violation of United Nations sanctions.

title: Executive Changes
description: The New York Life Insurance Company has promoted John F. Gleason to executive vice president.

title: JAMES E. CAREY JR.
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 23 James E. Carey Jr., administrative assistant to the director of passenger service in New England for the Penn Central Railroad, died yesterday at New Haven Hospital after being stricken at his office in New Haven. He was 55 years old and lived at 16 Cowing Terrace, Glenbrook.

title: Red Smith
description: For a few hours this week, New York rejoiced in the presence of professional football's man of the year, Joe Robbie; the National Football League's coach of the year, Don Shula. and the American Football Conference's player of the year, Bob Griese, all of the Miami Dolphins. By noon yesterday Griese had returned to Florida, but the Dolphins managing general partner and vice presidenthead coach were still around helping their lodge brothers shake down the thunder from the skies. (At the annual spring meetings,

title: Edward S. Donnell Named President
description: CHICAGO, May 23Marcor, Inc., at its annual meeting today, reported improved earnings and sales for the first quarter ended April 30.

title: NEW GAUGE IS SET ON STEEL IMPORTS
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 The Treasury has established al detailed new monitoring system, using the Customs Bureau, to make sure that the new voluntary agreement limiting steel imports from Western Europe and Japan works out as planned.

title: Medical Complex Details Expansion
description: New York Hospital, the Cornell University Medical College, Rockefeller University and the Hospital for Special Surgery announced detailed architectural plans yesterday for the 1$300million expansion they want to build.

title: Mrs. Chisholm Finds District Leaders in Opposing Camp
description: While Representative Shirley Chisholm picks her lonely and stubborn way along the Presidential campaign trail, trouble is bubbling in her home district in Brooklyn.

title: BUILDING COLLAPSES; A BOY 11, IS RESCUED
description: An 11yearold boy was pulled alive from the debris of an abandoned building that collapsed on him in the Brownsville section of Brooklyn last night. He suffered a broken leg but was otherwise reported in fair condition at Brookdale Hospital.

title: Mrs. DeWitt Wallace Donates $5Million to Juilliard
THRIFT UNITS GET HOMELOAN LEEWAY
description: WASHINGTON, May 23. (AP) The Federal Horne Loan Bank Board decided today to increase the amountof money that home buyers can borrow from Federal savings and loan associations on singlefamily dwellings.

title: Push Into Delta by Fresh Enemy Division Worries U.S. Officers
description: CANTHO, South Vietnam, May 23A fresh North Vietnamese division has invaded South Vietnam in the lower Mekong Delta, American officers in the region reported today. They said that the new division posed a grave threat to an area from which most regular Government troops had been withdrawn to aid in the fighting north of Saigon.

title: DR. STUART CRAIG, SURGEON, WAS 87
description: Dr. Stuart Lessley Craig, a director and advisory surgeon of the New York Eye and Ear Infirmary, which he joined as a resident physician in 1912, died Monday night in St. Luke's Hospital. He was 87 years old, still in active practice, and lived at 200 East 66th Street.

title: Treasury Aide Norminated
description: WASHINGTON, May 23 (Reuters)  Assistant Secretary of the Treasury Edwin S. Cohen has been nominated to be an Under Secretary of the Treasury, the White House announced today. A White House spokesman said Mr. Cohen would replace Charts Walker, who has been nominated to be Deputy Secretary of the Treasury.

title: Presbyterians Pick Headquarters Here
description: DENVER, May 23 (AP)The United Presbyterians picked New York tonight as the location for their new centralized headquarters after a floor debate at the church's governing assembly.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Computer Exhibit Opens in Moscow Park
description: MOSCOW, May 23 (Reuters) An exhibition of United States computers opened today in the same Moscow park where in 1959 Richard M. Nixon, then Vice President, held what has come to be known as the kitchen debate with Nikita S. Khrushchev, then Premier.

title: FORD REASSIGNS 4 IN FAULTY TESTS
description: DETROIT, May 23The Ford Motor Company said tonight that it had reassigned four supervisory employes responsible for making unauthorized maintenance on test cars so that they would pass the Government's antipollution tests. Ford also implied tonight that it hoped to be able to come close to making its original production schedule for its 1973 automobiles, avoiding mass layoffs because its new cars had not passed the antipollution tests.

title: Company Sets Expansion
description: Combustion Engineering, Inc., said yesterday that it planned to spend $25million in the next three years for a major expansion of its glassprocessing and manufacturing operations

title: 4Week Fete of Black Culture Is Planned by Nigeria for 1974
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 23Chief Anthony Enahoro of Nigeria says his govermnent was taking two years to prepare for the second world black festival of arts and culture in 1974 because it wanted to be ready for any emergency.

title: Dick Fowler, Who Pitched For Old Athletics, Is Dead
description: ONEONTA, N. Y., May 23 (UPI)  Dick Fowler, who pitched for the old Philadelphia Athletics, died yesterday at Fox Hospital here. He was 50 years old.

title: Front Page 3  No Title
description: IF YOU'RE NOT DRINKING WILLIAM LAWSON'S SCOTCH, DRINK DEWAR'S William Lawson's 85.8 Proof Blended Scotch Whiskies. Imported by Palmer & Lord. Ltd.. Syosset, N. Y.Advt.

title: LEGAL DEFINITION OF DEATH UPHELD
description: RICHMOND, May 23 (AP)A judge ruled here today in a damage suit involving a heart transplant that the lawbook definition of death must take precedent over medical opinion.

title: Round Hill Team Captures BetterBall Golf by 7 Shots
description: RYE, N.Y., May 23Mrs. O. Waring Mellick and Mrs. Carl T. Chadsey Jr. of Round Hill, who held a onestroke lead after the opening round yesterday, won the Women's WestchesterandFairfield Golf Association betterball tournament at The Apawamis Club today by following their 78 with 75 for 153 and a sevenstroke victory on the 5,779yard, par37, 3774 course.

title: Helsinki Talks Go On
description: HELSINKI, Finland, May 23The United StatesSoviet strategic arms talks, which have been kept going this week in an attempt to resolve deadlocked issues here without referring them to the summit meeting in Moscow, said reported to have made progress today.

title: A Boston Woman Pays 15,000 in Ohio For Antiwar Ads
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, May 23 A 47yearold suburban Boston sculptress and mother of five has paid out $15,000 of her own money to start a flood of stopthebombing mail rolling toward the White House from Middle America.

title: Con Ed Fined $1.6Million For Fish Kill at Atom Plant
description: The state has levied $1,638,160 in fines against Consolidated Edison for an alleged massive killing of fish at the company's No. 2 nuclearpower plant at Indian Point on the Hudson River.

title: RIGHTS UNITS SEE INTEGRATION LAG
description: WASHINGTON, May 23Six civil rights organizations said today that, despite widespread school integration in recent years, at least a dozen major school systems in the urban South are operating under shockingly inadequate and outdated court orders and desegregation plans.

title: Gold's Luster Endures
description: No other inanimate object has the power to inspire so much passion is goldboth among its friends and its foes. But despite its ups and downsand gold has had plenty of

title: Mrs. Henderson Wed to Legislator
description: LORTON, Va., May 23The marriage of Mrs. Nancy Hand Henderson to State Senator Omer L. Hirst took place at Gunston Hall here this evening. The Rev. Melvin L. Stedman, cousin of the bridegroom and pastor of the Dun Loring United Methodist Church, performed the ceremony in the drawing room of the landmark mansion, formerly the home of George Mason, American statesman.

title: JOHN DE C. VAN ETTEN
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., May 23 John de Camp Van Etten, a retired manufacturer of pigments and chemicals for the rubber industry, died today in a nursing home in Cresskill. He was 91 years old and lived at 115 Palisade Avenue.

title: 2 SHIP LINES HALT FAREWELL PARTIES
description: The Cunard Line and the Italian Line yesterday cancelled all bon voyage parties and announced that, because of bomb threats, no visitors would be allowed aboard their vesssels. At the same time, Cunard revealed details of its dealings with the extortionist who threatened to blow up the Queen Elizabeth 2 last week. A similar bomb threat against the liner Leonardo da Vinci was received by the Italian Line Monday.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today May 24, 1972
description: Committee on Apartheid10:30 A.M.
