description: The 44th session of the world's oldest contract bridge tournament begins today at the New York Hilton Hotel.

title: Red Smith
description: The thermometer registered 100 degrees when the calf roping started, and spectators were clustered in the shade of live oaks on the slopes that form three sides of a natural amphitheater in Woodlake, Calif. The first calf came tearing out of the chute with Bob Wiley riding hard at his heels, lariat whistling overhead. In a single unbroken flow of movement, Wiley threw his loop and pitched the slack, came out of the saddle on a dead run, flipped the calf, tied three legs and flung both hands aloft for the timer. From chute to finish, the operation consumed 10.6 seconds.

title: Reports Hint Bremer Stalked Others
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 Substantial evidence has been uncovered in recent days that Arthur Herman Bremer, who is accused of shooting Gov. George C. Wallace of Alabama, was also tracking President Nixon and Senator Hubert H. Humphrey. Federal sources said today.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: BRIONNE, FranceFew people have had the opportunity to participate in destroying three empires, an opportunity handed by fate to Marshal Tito of Yugoslavia who became eighty years old today (Thursday, May 25).

title: Offer Is $1.17Billion
description: LONDON, May 25The Rank Organization today jumped into the battle to capture Watney Mann, Ltd., the multinational) brewing, distilling and pub empire, with a takeover bid of $1.17billion for the $155million Watney Mann common; shares.

title: Antiwar Teacher Savors Vindication
description: ELMIRA, N. Y., May 25 Charles James, the Quaker teacher who was discharged two and a half years ago from Addison Central High School near Elmira for wearing a black armband to class In protest against the war in Vietnam, today savored his vindication by the United States Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit.

title: Commodity Price Index Drops to 119.9 From 120.0
description: The commodity spot Market price index of foodstuff and industrial materials slipped to 119.9 from 120.0 last week.

title: PIONEER 10 PASSES MARS ORBIT PATH
description: The unmanned Pioneer 10 spacecraft crosecd the orbital path of Mars yesterday entering hitherto unexplored space on its way toward a planned rendezvous with the giant planet Jupiter.

title: Mays's Single in 14th Defeats Cubs, 32
description: CHICAGO, May 25 Willie Mays struck another blow for the aging today when he singled home the winning run in the 14th inning as the New York Mets defeated the Chicago Cubs, 32.

title: R. B. M'COLL, LED LOCOMOTIVE FIRM
description: SCHENECTADY, N, Y. May 25Robert Boyd McColl, president of the former American Locomotive Company from 1945 until his retirement in 1950, died Tuesday. He was 90 years old and lived here.

title: Roundup: Cards Win, 42, For Gibson's First Victory
description: Bob Gibson's fivegame losing streak and the Pittsburgh Pirates ninegame winning streak ended yesterday in St. Louis.

title: GEORGE SCHLENKER
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., My 25George Schlenker, a painting and decorating contrctor credited with designing the familiar ESSO sign, died yesterday here. He was 78 years old and lived here.

title: Briarcliff Awards Degrees To 182 at Commencement
description: BRIARCLIFF MANOR, N. Y. May 25Commencement exercises were held today at Briarcliff College, a private women's institution in this Westchester County community.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: The Police Department's motorcycle is going the way of its horseonly fasterunder a new system of highway patrols that will depend largely on squad cars.

title: Attacks in Barcelona
description: BARCELONA, Spain, May 25 (UPI)Pan American's office here was the target of a firebombing today in protest against the Vietnam war.

title: RAIDERS SIGN FIVE, THREE FROM N.H.L.
description: The New York Raiders lived up to their World Hockey Association nickname yesterday, when they announced the signing of five players, three of whom jumped from the National Hockey League.

title: For the City's Best In Chinese Cuisine
description: **** Hunam, 845 2d Avenue (near 45th Street), MU 77471.

title: Local 1501 Reaches Accord On Aquarium at Coney Is.
description: A tentative settlement in a strike at the New York Aquarium at Coney Island was announced yesterday by Dr. James A. Oliver, the director.

title: Freelance Musicians Sign Pact and Avert a Strike
description: A strike of 8,000 freelance musicians, who play for weddings, bar mitzvahs and other private parties, was averted early today when a threeyear union contract was signed to replace one that expired at March 25.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your May 17 editorial Shootout at Lydda was predictable but not convincing. If I read you correctly, it is your belief that Israel should not have reacted to the hijacking as she did because it endangered the lives of passengers and crew. This is a dangerous thesis with which I cannot agree.

title: U.S. Sending Black Officers
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (Reuters)  The State Department has sent three black American Foreign Service officers to South Africa on temporary assignments and is planning to send a fourth.

title: Mattel, Inc.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 25Mattel, Inc., the toy manufacturer that sustained its first deficit year with a $25.1million loss in 1971, increased profits 7 per cent in the quarter ended April 29, the annual, meeting was told here today.

title: Soviet Orbits Cosmos 491
description: MOSCOW, May 25 (AP)The Soviet Union announced today that it had orbited the 491st satellite in its secret Cosmos space series. The Cosmos program covers a wide range of research and spacecraft test shots, weather and communications satellites, and military projects.

title: IRREGULAR RATES ON BONDS PERSIST
description: Interest rates continued yesterday on an even downward course as cashladen investors nought to put their funds to work in various fixedincome securities. Money market rates tended to decline  for Treasury bills rather sharply  while longerterm interest rates were mostly un changed to modestly lower.

title: Washington: For the Record
description: Activities. President Nixon was in Moscow. The White House announced that he had appointed five persons to the board of directors of the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. They are Michael A. Gammino Jr. of Providence, R. I.; Joseph D. Hughes of Pittsburgh; Neal Blackwell Freeman of New York City; Theodore W. Braun of West Los Angeles, and Gloria L. Anderson of Atlanta.

title: Humphrey's Staff in California Is Concerned
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., May 25Hubert H. Humphrey's top staff and closest friends now say he is running behind and facing critical problems in the California primary that they always knew could be his last hurrah.

title: Parties Plan to Share Costs of Conventions
Nation's 2 Largest Can Makers Permitted to Raise Prices 2%
description: The nation's two largest can manufacturers announced yesterday that they had been given permission by the Price Commision to raise can prices by 2 per cent. The new prices will go into effect June 1. Only a month ago the commission rescinded price increases of more than double that amount granted previously to the Continental Can Company and the American Can Company. Yesterday, in announcing the interim price relief granted by the commission, Continental Can said that the commission's final decision on the suspended price increases of 4.22 per cent would follow completion of a review of the metal can industry.

title: HAROLD GAILLARD
description: Harold Hudson Gaillard, proprietor of the Opera House restaurant in Nantucket, Mass., died there Tuesday. He was 60 years old and also lived in Peru, Vt.

title: California Official Will Fight a Ruling Favorable to I.T.T.
description: LOS ANGELES, May 25The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation has won a court ruling that it did not violate a Federal law when it contributed $100,000 toward the Republican National Convention, but Edmund G. Brown Jr., California's Secretary of State, announced today that he would challenge the decision.

title: A Call for Mass Emigration to Israel
description: JERUSALEMI preface what I have to say with two notes of caution. One I speak as an individual, certainly not for the state of Israel, and I speak for myself as a Jew.

title: ARGENTINE LEADER CHALLENGES PERON
description: BUENOS AIRES, May 25Lieut. Gen. Alejandro A. Lanusse, Argentina's military President today challenged Juan D. Perlin to return here to help solve the country's political problems.

title: Market Place: Pay a Broker For Results?
description: The idea comes up again and again, but there is no indication that Wall Street has seriously considered it.

title: Brooklyn Bridge Detour. Due for 4 Hours Saturday
description: The Manhattanbound roadway of the Brooklyn Bridge will be closed to traffic this Saturday from 6 to 10 A.M. for the installation of four large, gantry directional signs inthe westbound lanes.

title: Frazier Stops Stander in 5th Round to Keep Heavyweight Title
description: OMAHA, May 25Joe Frazier retained his world heavyweight boxing title tonight with a fifthround knockout of Ron Stander, the virtually unknown challenger who was literally blinded by the blood from four severe cuts.

title: HUMPHREY IS AHEAD OF M'GOVERN IN POLL
description: Democrats prefer Senator Hubert H. Humphrey of Minnesota to Senator George McGovern of South Dakota by only a narrow margin on the East and West Coasts and by a much larger one in the Middle West and South, the Gallup Poll reported today.

title: Books of The Times
description: FROM RESISTANCE TO REVOLUTION. By Pauline Maier. 318 pages. Knopf. $10.

title: Governor McCall May Run
description: PORTLAND, Ore., May 25 (AP)Gov. Tom McCall, a Republican, says he may reconsider his decision not to run as an independent for the Senate if the two party nominees attack President Nixon. The incumbent Senator, ark O. Hatfield, a Republican, and former Sen. Wayne Morse, a Democrat, won their parties nomin1ations Tuesday. Both are critics of United States involvement in Southeast Asia.

title: KAHANE PROTEST DELAYS A TAPING
description: The taping of the Dick Cavett Show was delayed for an hour and a half yesterday afternoon when Rabbi Meir Kahane and 30 of his followers in the Jewish Defense League staged a brief sitin in the theater lobby to protest the cancellaition of the rabbi's appearance as a guest on the show.

title: BRAFF JAZZ QUARTET PLAYS THE WALDORF
description: Thanks to the influence and insistence of Tony Bennett, who is currently appearing in the Empire. Room of the WaldorfAstoria Hotel, the Waldorf's Peacock Alley has been opened up to jazz for the first time.

title: Mrs. Albert Blidner Dies; InterAmerican Unit Leader
description: Mrs. Patricia Elman Bildner, a former leader in the committee here of the InterAmerican Association for Democracy and Freedom and subsequently prominent in educational exchanges with Brazil, died Tuesday in Sao Paulo where she had undergone brain surgery. She was 49 years old and lived there with her husband, Albert Bildner, head of a liquor concern.

title: ChabanDelrnas Victor in Confidence Vote in Paris
description: PARIS, May 25premier Jacques ChabonDelmas and his Government have won a big vote of confidence in the National Assembly on their past and future policies.

title: Coalition in Vietnam...Not Worth One More Life
description: If the goal of coalition government still lies behind the conditions on which the Nixon Administration is prepared to make its exit from Vietnam, there can be no foreseeable exit. We have been pursuing this goal (whether from conviction or for public consumption one cannot say) for four years. As recently as Mr. Kissinger's last visit to Paris he carried with him, as he told the press, a plan for coalition. On what basis of reasonable expectation? Between erstwhile enemies in a civil conflict, the only form of coalition that can occur is that which results when a snake swallows a rabbit. One side or another must be eventually engorged.

title: StudebakerWorthington
description: D. H. Ruttenberg, chairman of StudebakerWorthington, Inc., said yesterday that the company's repurchases of its own stock, including a recent tender offer for 1,030,000 shares, would more than offset any dilution of earnings from its program of selling minority interests in some subsidiaries to the public.

title: GUY CUNNINGHAM, 59, TV AD BUREAU AIDE
description: Guy H. Cunningham, vice president and director of special projects for the Television Bureau of Advertising, died Tuesday at his home, 9 Red Road, Chatham, N. J. His age was 59.

title: Aircraft Piracy Charge
description: LOS ANGELES, May 25 (UPI)  Richard ChavezOrtiz, who said he hijacked a Frontier Airlines plane last month to call attention to injustices against MexicanAmericans, was indicted by a Federal grand jury today on aircraft piracy charges.

title: Department Store Sales Up
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The Department of Commerce reported today that department store sales last week were an estimated $816,000,000, an increase of 8 per cent above last year's $756,000,000. Total retail store sales totaled about $8,583,000,000, also 8 per cent above last year.

title: Workers at North Korean Plant Politically Engaged
description: HAMHUNG, North Korea, May 25In this densely industrial area on the east coast of North Korea, almost 5,000 men and women put in eighthour days six days a week building heavy machinery in the Ryongsong engineering plant.

title: WASHINGTON
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The North Vietnamese should be getting the message by now. Their main ports are closed, by American mines. There are now, six U. S. aircraft carriers off their coast, bombing them night and day. The railroad lines from China to Hanoi are now under constant attack, and the weather and American air power have slovied down their offensive against Hue and Danang in the north, Kontum city in the central highlands, and Anloc, north of Saigon.

title: Algerian Gas Pact Is Signed by Utility
description: Eascogas, LNG, Inc., which consists of the Public Service Electric Company of New Jersey and the Algonquin Gas Transmission Company, announced yesterday the Signing of a multibillion dollar contract to import liquified natural gas from the Algerian National Oil Company, Sonatrach.

title: Library Racing Deadline To Raise Half a Million
description: With 36 days left, the New York Public Library has raised $394,324 toward matching the challenge grant of $500,000 in Federal funds offered to its research libraries by the National Endowment for the Humanities.

title: Rudy Turcotte Breaks Leg
description: BALTIMORE, May 25 (AP)Rudy Turcotte, the jockey, will be out of action for six weeks after breaking a leg in a fall at home. Turcotte fell down a stairway in his suburban home last night, and reported that some furniture also fell on the leg.

title: Three DeGarmo Troops Shape a New Agency
description: Three or the deGarmo troopers have pulled back to reform and what they've formed is Beckerman Rosner Wyman.

title: Books of The Times
description: Who is Emmett Grogan? He was not so long ago the underground superstar of the counterculture, a young man whom everyone who was hip had heard of, but whom no one could ever findnot the kids, not the media and especially not the police. And while everyone was looking for him, he was providing the inspiration behind the San Francisco Diggers, giving away free food and living the life of FREE, not just talking about it or trying to sell it to the press or promoting his ego on it (as lie says Abbie Hoffman was doing). And when he wasn't slaving for San Francisco's poor, or fighting the commercial interests that promoted hippiedom in HaightAshbury, or vainly trying to organize the East Village of New York, or traveling abroad to represent the counterculture at conferences on revolution, he was teaching the Black Panthers how to give away food, or organizing the illfated free concert at Altamont, or teaching the world that Today is the first day of the rest of your life. Wherever it was happening in the 1960's. Emmett Grogan was there. Or so he now proclaims in Ringolevio, his life story.

title: Italian Design Show Appraised Ambiguous but Beautiful
description: A chair will never be a chair again. It is an object whose formal characteristics are derived from, or motivated by, the semantic manipulation of established sociocultural meanings. And it is just one of 180 objects and 11 specially commissioned environments in the show, Italy: The New Domestic Landscape, opening to the public appraisal today at the Museum of Modern Art after a week of glossy preopening fanfare for one of the most ambitious shows ever mounted by that fashionable institution. The exhibition, sponsored by the Ifalian Ministry of Foreign Trade and subsidized by a blue chip list of Italian industries, has been conceived, nurtured, directed and installed by Emilio Ambasz, the museum's curator of design.

title: Castro Sells Cuba to the Bulgarians
description: SOFIA, Bulgaria, May 24  Fidel, Fidel, the crowd chanted yesterday outside the tall International Hotel in Varna, a Black Sea resort. The Cuban leader stepped out, smiled and waved, and said a few words to his companion. Then together they walked into the group.

title: President Bars Tax Rise And Seeks Cut in Spending
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 The White House declared today that President Nixon and his Administration were opposed to any increase in Federal taxes for the foreseeable future.

title: U.S. Move Checked For Financial Bloc
description: PARIS, May 25The United States has been checked in its desire to set up a restricted group of nations to coordinate monetary and trade negotiations for shaping a new world financial order.

title: Russ Togs, Inc.
description: Russ Togs, Inc., a leading women's apparel maker, told its shareholders at the annual meeting here yesterday that sales results for 13 weeks ended April 29 were down slightly from the preceding year but that earnings, while still undetermined, will be comparable to last year.

title: Kirkland College's First Class Of 116 Women Wins Degrees
description: CLINTON, N.Y., May 25Kirkland College, too young to be maudlin, said goodby to its first graduating class today with champagne, ruffled dogs, dancing bears and all the other trappings of a Renaissance carnival.

title: REGAN ASSAILS BIAS AGAINST HUGENESS
description: Unfavorable attitudes toward large corporations could damage the competitive ability of America, Donald T. Regan, chairman of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., said in a speech last night.

title: F.D.A. TO TAKE OVER BIOLOGICS DIVISION
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The Food and Drug. Administration will take over, on July 1, the division of the National Institutes of Health concerned with licensing of vaccines and other biological products, including blood derivatives..

title: Fuel Consumption Poses Problem for the Indy 500
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 25The 33car field running in the Indianapolis 500 Saturday is the fastest in history  the average qualifying speed is 183.655 miles an hourbut that speed poses a problem for the race teams.

title: Some Were Excited, Some Bored
description: The range of reactions was unusually broadwith enthusiasm high, criticism sharp and boredom occasionally apparentas advance contingents of viewers emerged this week from Italy: The New Domestic Landscape, the largest and most costly ($1.5million) show in the Museum of Modern Art's 43year history. For this show is different. And the movers and shakers of the worlds of art, architecture, design, museums and society knew it as they attended several previews held since Tuesday night. The exhibit opens to the public today and remains through Sept. 11.

title: DEFICIT WORSENS AT J. P. STEVENS
description: J. P. Stevens & Co., Inc., one of the nation's major textile manufacturers, announced yesterday that it had a net loss of more than $5million in the quarter ended April 29. The company also said it was getting completely out of the worstedfabric business, which accounted for the loss.

title: Pennsylvanians Pay Up
description: HARRISBURG, Pa., May 25 (AP)Most of the 4.5 million taxpayers filed their Pennsylvania income tax returns befor the May 15 deadline. Revenue Secretary Robert Kane said today that 4,401,065 returns were submitted on time.

title: I.T.T. Sale of Avis Stock Set to Start Divestiture
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation will soon begin divesting itself of Avis, Inc., the auto rental concern that says it tries harder.

title: Despite Study, State Aide Calls Jersey Restaurants Very Safe
description: TRENTON, May 25  Dr. James R. Cowan, New Jersey Commissioner of Health, said today that restaurants in the state were very safe despite a 1970 departmental report contending that 82 per cent of them were unsanitary.

title: FOE'S TANKS LEAD DRIVE ON KONTUM
description: SAIGON, Friday, May 26North Vietnamese tanks supported by infantry launched a frontal assault on Kontum city in the Central Highlands this morning after other enemy tanks and commandos had slipped into the city past Government defenders, American military sources said.

title: Scramble Betting Draws Mixed Reviews
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 25As the harness racing scene shifted tonight from Yonkers Raceway to Roosevelt Raceway, an overwhelming majority of the 16,538 openingnight fans voiced their objection to the new exotic form of betting the scramble.

title: Philadelphia Drops Bid As Site of 1976 Fair
description: PARIS, May 25 (UPI)Philadelphia, on personal orders from President Nixon, withdrew today as a site for the United States 200th anniversary international exposition in 1976 because of insufficient time to prepare the fair.

title: Free Noontime Concerts Start June 5 at Church
description: Free Noontime Interlude Concerts will be presented at St. Thomas Episcopal Church, Fifth Avenue and 53d Street, by the Orchestra of the City of New York, Torn Paxton, the folk singer, and Herbie Hancock and His Band.

title: Advertising:
description: Adrian M. Butash, director of marketing services for Hoechst Fibers, leafed through a portfolio of current fashion advertising yesterday afternoon. He didn't like what he saw and said so. He could afford to, none of them were his.

title: Seraphic Dialogue Is Danced Strongly In a Studio Setting
description: A stunning performance, surprisingly effective in a studio setting, of Martha Graham's Seraphic Dialogue highlighted the third program Wednesday night of the spring series at the Martha Graham Center of Contemporary Dance.

title: Show Celebrates Arp Sculpture Gift
description: Celebrating the gift of a sculpture by Jean Arp, who died in 1966, the Metropolitan Museum of Art has mounted an exhibition of 23 other sculptures by the artist plus 10 reliefs in wood, plastic and metal, 3 charcoal drawings, 9 watercolors and a suite of 15 woodcuts.

title: Black Fraternities: A Committed Elite
description: ANN ARBOR, Mich.Black college fraternities are making gains on the campuses of the nation at a time when many white fraternities have slipped badly in membership and prestige.

title: Wings Get Rangers'
description: Paring down the roster for the coming expansion draft, the Rangers yesterday traded their journeyman defenseman, Gary Doak, and Rick Newel, a minor league player, to the Detroit Red Wings for the Wings first,round amateur draft choice. In addition, the New Yorkers received Joe Zanussi, a minor league defenseman.

title: 2 Churchmen Walk Out Before Governor Speaks
description: Bishop Patrick V. Ahern and Msgr. Gustaf J. Schultheiss left the Catholic Interracial Council dinner last night before a speech. by Governor Rockefeller as a protest against the Governor's veto of the abortion bill, a church spokesman reported.

title: GALLO AIDE CITED ON PISTOL CHARGE
description: Peter Diapoulas, the bodyguard of Joseph Gallo, was indicted yesterday on charges of illegally carrying a gun when Gallo was murdered on the morning of April 7.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I would like to comment on your May 11 editorial Lobbying for the Public, which supports the bill introduced by Representative Ullman of Oregon to give public interest groups the right to spend a portion of their budgets on legislative lobbying. Now if I say we favor such legislation I will be lobbying, hence placing us in some jeopardy with the I.R.S. which has not yet decided if we can overtly lobby, and to what extent.

title: ElTronics Suitor
description: ElTronics, Inc., a maker of paints and lighting and processed metal products, is seeking further diversification through merger, acquisition or other arrangement with the General Host Corporation, which is engaged in baked goods, candy, food and store operations. In making the disclosure yesterday, John J. Harvey, chairman of ElTronics, said his company had acquired on May 15 over 5 per cent of the outstanding common shares of General Host in the open market. Shares acquired since then bring the total to 200,100, or 9.37 per cent of those outstanding, acquired at an average price of about $17.75 a share.

title: Agnew Calls U.S. Role in War A Moral Response to a Bandit
description: Vice President Agnew, here to accept a Father of the Year Award, lashed out yesterday at unnamed New York City civic and government leaders who expressed outrage in 1964 when neighbors ignored the screams of a young Queens woman who was being murdered, but who now insist that we abandon South Vietnam.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Thank you for publishing [May 17] that fine ad The People vs. The New York Times. It emphasizes what I've been thinkingthat The Times sometimes gives a distorted view of the people's thinking.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BILOXI, Miss, May 25 (UPI) Mr. Gray served notice today that the bureau would continue to investigate domestic subversive groups, despite criticism that such surveillance had included Senators, peace activists and civil rights groups. He spoke to the Crime Control Conference of the Governor of Mississippi.

title: The Split Level at the Summit Conference
description: MOSCOW, May 25So far President Nixon's meeting with the Soviet leadership has been a splitlevel affair.

title: Painting by John Sloan Brings $52,500 Here
description: A painting by John Sloan was auctioned at the ParkeBernet Galleries Wednesday night for $52,500, believed to be the highest price for an artist of the socalled Ashcan School.

title: John Kennedy 1954 Letter Brings $1,000
description: A letter handwritten by John Fitzgerald Kennedy in 1954, in which the then Senator explained why he had to miss one of the most controversial and politically significent votes of his Senate careerthe censure of Senator Joseph R. McCarthy was sold at auction here last night.

title: GOVERNOR SIGNS SCHOOLAID BILL
description: ALBANY, May 25  A bill that could provide as much as $56million in state money for nonpublic schools was signed by Governor Rockefeller on Monday, his office announced today.

title: 2 LOANS TO MEXICO SET BY WORLD BANK
description: The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development announced yesterday that it had approved two loans to Mexico totaling $110million.

title: Auto Production Slows
description: DETROIT, May 25 (AP)Auto production sagged this week because of the approaching Memorial Day weekend.

title: Wilkins Puts Nixon With Foes of Blacks
description: In some of the strongest language he has ever used in referring to any President, Roy Wilkins yesterday condemned Richard Nixon as one who is with the enemies of little black children.

title: EXSTATE U. OFFICIAL ENTERS GUILTY PLEA
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., May 25Donald S. Ackerman, a former director of research contracts at the State University of New York at Stony Brook, pleaded guilty today to four felony ounts of grand larceny and forgery in connection with the, theft of $29,000 in research funds over the last three years.

title: Associated Dry Goods Names New President
description: Richard R. Pivirotto, who is 42 years old, was elected yesterday as president and chief administrative officer of Associated Dry Goods Corporation.

title: 22,000 Autos Called Back By G.M. for Steering Flaw
description: DETROIT, May 25 (AP)The General Motors Corporation announced today that it was recalling 22,000 Buick and Oldsmobile models for inspection and possible repair of their steering linkages.

title: State to Seek Plans From All Colleges To End Segregation
description: ALBANY, May 25  The Board of Regents, in a major policy statement scheduled to be issued tomorrow, will ask all colleges and universities in the state to submit plans by Oct. 1 for the integration of any currently segregated facilities by the fall of 1973 and to take steps to obtain more minoritygroup students and faculty mem bers.

title: TALKS IN MOSCOW SEEK TO DEVELOP U.S.SOVIET TRADE
description: MOSCOW, May 25President. Nixon met today for two hours of intensive talks with Soviet leaders to build a new framework for expanded trade between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Welshing at the U.N.
description: For years United States spokesmen at the United Nations have championed the proposition expressed in an American argument before the World Court, that ... the General Assembly's adoption and apportionment of the organization's expenses create a binding international legal obligation on the part of States Members to pay their assessed shares.

title: APRIL COST OFF 0.7% ON MARKET BASKET
description: WASHINGTON, May 25 (AP) A year's supply of market basket groceries cost consumers $9 less in April as the result of a $6 price cutback among middlemen and a $3 reduction for farmers, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: New Dean at St. John the Divine James Parks Morton
description: Twenty years ago two young Episcopal priests began working together in the slums of Jersey City as part of a team whose accomplishments became nationally known as a model of urban ministry.

title: Germans Seeking Woman
description: HEIDELBERG, West Germany, May 25 (UPI)The police said today that a slim, darkhaired woman was being sought as a suspect in the bombing of the United States Army's European Headquarters here yesterday in which three servicemen were killed and five persons were injured.

title: Arms Blast Area Sealed
description: KILN, Miss., May 25 (UPI)National Guardsmen sealed off today a firescorched area around a munitions plant where five women workers were killed in a series of explosions yesterday.

title: JOINT VENTURE SETS POWER PLANT AT SEA
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., May 25 (UPI)  The Westinghouse Electric Corporation and Tenneco, Inc., today announced the selection of a 900acre site on Blount Island near here tol build a $200million offshore floating nuclear power plant. The project will employ 8,0001 to 10,000 persons.

title: Vote in Senate Gives Fulbright Another in a Series of Rebuffs
description: WASHINGTON, May 25The Senate, by a vote of 42 to 27, today rejected an amendment that the Foreign Relations Committee had put in a State DepartmentUnited States Infernation Agency budget bill prohibiting the agency from distributing unattributed propaganda abroad.

title: GAINS ARE MODEST FOR AMEX STOCKS
description: The American Stock Exchange index inched ahead 0.02 yesterday to close at 27.90, in a session marked by more declines than advances.

title: State Unit Approves 29% Rate Increase For H.I.P. on Aug. 1
description: The Health Insurance Plan, the metropolitan area's only prepaid group practice medical plan, has received the approval of the State Insurance Department to increase subscriber rates an average of 29 per cent starting Aug. 1.

title: GRAND JURY HEARS PENNSY'S EXCHIEF
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 25Stuart T. Saunders, former board chairman of the Penn Central Transportation Cornpany, was among five witnesses who testified today before a Federal grand jury investigating activities that led to the company's collapse.

title: Helsinki Completion Due
description: HELSINKI, Finland, Friday, May 26 (UPI)Sources close to the talks on limitation of strategic arms said today that negotiations for a nuclear arms pact between the United States and the Soviet Union were nearly completed and that Gerard C. Smith, the chief United States negotiator, almost surely would fly to Moscow during the day.

title: Fatal Blast Follows Catholic Peace Gesture in Ulster
description: BELFAST Northern Ireland May 26The Social Democratic and Labor party a moderate Roman Catholic opposition party in Northern Ireland, today urged 400 Catholics who left public office as a protest against internment last August to return to their posts.

title: U.S. TRADE DEFICIT BIG AGAIN IN APRIL
description: WASHINGTON May 26The United States recorded another huge deficit in its foreign trade in April the Commerce Department reported today. Imports exceeded exports by $699million the second largest deficit for a month on record The high was set last October at $821million.

title: Dillon to Buy Fry's
description: Dillion Companies, Inc., said yesterday it had reached an agreement to acquire Fry's Food Stores, Inc., which operates 41 supermarkets. Fry's sales in the fiscal year ended March 31 were $105,170,000 and its profit was $1,146,000.

title: 5 Ohio Youths Die in Crash
description: MACEDONIA, Ohio, May 26 (UPI)  Five teenagers who were returning home from Nordonia High School were killed today when their car was struck by a tractortrailer. The victims were identified as Edmund Matvejs, 17 years old, driver of the car; Dale Nowak, 15; Lawrence Aiken, 15; Thomas Jordan, 15, and Mark Fortell, 16, all of Northfield. The Macedonia police said the car had apparently turned in front of the truck and was struck broadside. The truck driver was not injured.

title: Magazine Finds Increase In Construction Planning
description: New plans added to Engineering NewsRecord's backlog of construction planning reached $27.1billion as of Thursday, an increase of 6 per cent over the first 21 weeks of 1971, the McGrawHill magazine reported yesterday. New projects estimated to most more than $1.1billion entered the planning stage this week, the publication added.

title: The Doctor Draft Halted for 1972 And Maybe Longer
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 The Defense Department dropped the doctor draft today for the rest of this year, and perhaps longer.

title: Media Face Curb at G.O.P. Convention
description: MIAMI BEACH, May 26 News coverage of the Republican National Convention could be jeopardized by a Miami Beach demand that most media, but apparently not the television networks, vacate their assigned places in the convention hall shortly after the Democratic convention.

title: Jazz Is Expanded at Fiddlestix With Curson Group and Singer
description: Fiddlestix, an Italian restaurant on First Avenue between, 77th and 78th Streets, which has been experimenting with jazz on the weekends for several months, has now taken the plunge into a fullweek jazz policy, currently with Ted Curson's quartet and Stella Marrs, a singer.

title: A POLICE RATIO SET FOR PHILADELPHIA
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26 Federal Judge John P. Fullam ordered. Philadelphia today to hire at least one black policeman for every two whites add ed to the force,

title: Focus at Anloc Shifts to Relief Column
For Staffs of Inactive Candidates, the Glamour Is Gone
description: WASHINGTON, May 26An inactive bid for the Presidency is an almost eerie experience for people previously engaged in an intense political battle.

title: State Lottery Has Paid $111Million to Winners
description: ALBANY, May 26 (UPI)The New York State lottery, which will be five years old next week, has paid 335,136 winners $111,570,273 in prizes, it was reported today.

title: New Military Development By Soviet in Space Hinted
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 The nation's leading expert on Soviet space affairs has openly epeculated that the Russians may be developing as many as three space systems for military purposes whose exact intent is unclear.

title: Transport of New Jersey Reports a Drop in Revenue
description: NEWARK, May 26 (AP)Transport of New Jersey, which recently resumed service after a 68day strike, said today its revenue and the. number of its, riders had declined more than 35 per cent, compared with a similar period last year.

title: 1 KILLED AND 2 LOST IN A SHIP EXPLOSION
description: PORTSMOUTH, Va., May 26 (UPI)An explosion aboard the cargo ship Zim Tokyo has killed one man, swept two others into the water and left the vessel crippled in 20foot, galewhipped seas.

title: Crisis Within E.E.C.
description: LUXEMBOURG, May 26 (Reuters)A crisis flared in the European Common Market today when the Community's top policyFraming body, the European Economic Community Commission, threatened to resign.

title: Virginia Jury Rules That Death Occurs When Brain Dies
description: RICHMOND, May 26 (AP)A medical opinion that death occurs when the brain dies even if the heart and other organs continue to function has been reinforced by a jury here in a landmark heart transplant suit.

title: Humphrey and McGovern Offer California Contrast
description: SAN FRANCISCO. May 26  Senators Hubert H. Humphrey and George McGovern, whose rivalry for the Democratic Presidential nomination has taken on a strident tone in the California campaign, addressed noonday audiences here today within 100 yards of each other.

title: 108 Reported to Have Died In Crash of Soviet Airliner
description: MOSCOW March 26 (AP)The crash of a Soviet airliner near the Ukrainian city of Kharkov on May 18 killed all 108 persons on board Soviet sources said today.

title: Text of Treaty to Limit ABM's and the Interim Agreement on Offensive Missiles
description: MOSCOW, May 26 (AP)Following are the texts of the SovietAmerican treaty signed here today on limitation of antiballistic missiles the interim agreement on offensive weapons and a protocol attached to the interim treaty:

title: Girl Blinded for Seeing Theft
description: ST. LOUIS, May 26 (UPI)A jury today found a 30yearold former convict guilty of blinding a 17yearold baby sitter because she witnessed a theft that netted him $30. The prisoner, Johnnie Lee Brooks, was convicted of blinding Miss Wilma Chestnut so that she could not identify him as the man who took a record player, and tape recorder from the apartment where she was babysitting. Judge P. F. Palumbo fixed punishment at 55 years in prison on the assault charge and 15 years on the robbery charge.

title: ESTIMATE BOARD VOTES PORT PLAN
description: The Board of Estimate has acted to revitalize the Brooklyn waterfront by approving a plan to redevelop 219 acres in the Red Hook peninsula Into a modern containerport with warehouse facilities.

title: Mrs. Ruth Sulzberger Golden Is Wed to A.W. Holmberg Jr.
description: STAMFORD, Conn., May 26Mrs. Ruth Sulzberger Golden, publisher of The Chattanooga Times, and Albert William Holmberg Jr., its president and general manager, were married here this afternoon at Hillandale, the home of the bride's mother, Mrs. Arthur Hays Sulzberger.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Having just completed two semesters at a large Eastern university. vouch for the fact that it is simply not true that Weatherpeople policies are totally discredited by the overwhelming mass of the student generation, as you state in your May 20 editorial on the Pentagon bombing. It is the reluctance of movement people, rather, to hazard these young people's freedom or even lives which has so far made protest violence the exception. The candidates for such actions are there.

title: LAIRD DISCOUNTS BIG ARMS SAVINGS
description: WASHINGTON May 26Defense Secretary Melvin R. Laird today hailed the United States arms agreements with the Soviet Union but warned against the expectation of major cost savings.

title: Chinese Are Ignoring Nixon's Visit to Soviet
description: PEKING, May 26 (Agence FrancePresse)Five days after President Nixon's arrival in Moscow, China still maintains a completely unperturbed attitude.

title: JAMES F. HILLMAN, CONSERVATIONIST
description: PITTSBURGH, May 26James Frazer Hillman, a Pittsburgh area coal operator, philanthropist and a pioneer in the field of conservation, died today in PresbyterianUniversity Hospital. He was 83 years old.

title: U.S.'s Hot Ice Cream Gets a Brezhnev Cheer
description: MOSCOW, May 26 (UPI)Richard M. Nixon gave Leonid I. Brezhnev his first baked Alaska tonight. And he loved it.

title: Von Braun's Departure Marks the End of an Era
description: In July, 1969, the time of the first landing on the moon, Dr. Wernher von Braun reflected on his germinal role in space exploration and on the infinite opportunities. He quoted from the late Dr. Robert H. Goddard, the American rocket experimenter, who had written:

title: Willowbrook, Continued
description: The public has been grossly misled by the selfserving and selfjustifying article, Another View of Willowbrook, which appeared on the OpEd page May 6.

title: Navajo Plea on Drought
description: WINDOW ROCK, Ariz., May 26 (Reuters)Peter MacDonald, !Navajo tribal chairman, has written to Interior Secretary Roger C. B. Morton asking that the Navajo reservation here be declared a disaster area because of extended drought.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your May 16 report about my participation in the Emergency Conference of the New York Board of Rabbis needs some clarification.

title: U.S. Drops Case Involving Stainless Steel From Japan
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The Treasury announced today that it was discounting an antidumping case involving stainless steel sheet from Japan. This means that no special dumping duties will be imposed.

title: BOATS BEGIN RACE TO BLOCK ISLAND
description: LARCHMONT, N.Y., May 26 Rush hour on Long Island Sound began at 6 P.M. today when a record fleet of 211 boats started Storm Trysail Club's annual 200mile roundtrip race to Block Island.

title: Soviet Leaders Reaffirm Aid and Support of Sadat
description: CAIRO, May 26 (UPI) Leaders of the Soviet Union told President Anwar elSadat of Egypt today that the Arabs can always count on Soviet aid and support until their efforts to liberate Israelioccupied lands are crowned with complete success, the Middle East News Agency reported.

title: Man to Be Tried on Charge Of Slaying Father in Prison
description: WILLIAMSPORT, Pa.. May 26 (AP)An Indiana man will be tried in Federal court on a charge that he murdered his father during a visit to Lewisburg Federal Penitentiary, where his father was imprisoned on an espionage conviction.

title: Jury in Nebraska Convicts 2 Brothers In Death of Indian
description: ALLIANCE, Neb., May 26 (AP)A District Court jury convicted two Gordon, Neb., brothers of manslaughter and false imprisonment tonight in the death of Raymond Yellow Thunder.

title: Mayhem at City Hall
description: We're all of the same party, but there are also a hundred candidates for Mayor, a high city official said yesterday as he assessed the unprecedented governmental snarl of the last three days, in which a Democratic Mayor, an overwhelmingly Democratic City Council and a Democraticcontrolled Board of Estimate could not agree on the basic document of any governmentthe budget. Echoing other politi cians, the city official, who was in the thick of the budget tangle, said that conflicting ambitions and the widespread distrust among the city's highest officials were the fundamental reasons for the crisis.

title: Bonnie Parker Wins in Devon Show
description: DEVON, Pa., May 26Sara Drake, a 15yearold tenthgrade student at Cantonsville (Md.) Senior High School, turned in the performance of her young career tonight at the opening session of the 76th edition or the Devon horse show.

title: CrudeOil Tankers to Use Portion of Cargo as Fuel
description: Large tankers, the mosteconomical means of moving crude oil over large distances, are about to become even more economical to operate.

title: He's at Home to Make a Living And She to Make It a Home
description: How do you stand having your husband home all day?

title: STOCKS RISE A BIT AS TRADING DROPS
description: The stock market showed little change on balance yesterday and finished slightly higher in slower trading.

title: EQUITY FINANCING
description: The Thrifty Drug Stores Company, Inc., yesterday announced, through Lehman Brothers, Inc., a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission of a registration covering a proposed public offering by certain selling shareholders of 785,000 common shares. According to the underwriting group's manager, none of the proceeds of the sale would be received by the company, whose shares are traded on the New York Stock Exchange where the stock fell 1 to 14 yesterday.

title: Stirrings of Change Discerned in Land of Willkie
description: RUSHVILLE, Ind.  Just about every road that finds its way into Rush County somehow ends up heading straight through this humid little town of 7,264 people.

title: A Lull at Hue: Some Who Fled Homes Creep Back
description: HUE South Vietnam May 26Things are quiet for the moment in this city, which is still awaiting a North Vietnamese attack.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: You reported on May 21 that Senator McGovern wants to guarantee that the minority views of Governor Wallace are heard at the Democratic National Convention and that McGovern's reasons range from political opportunism to a sense of fair play.

title: Armin B. Allen And Miss Ker Married Here
description: Miss Susanna Ker of New York, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Keith Reginald Welbore Ker of London and Capetown, South Africa, was married here yesterday afternoon to Armin Brand Allen, son of Mr. and Mrs. John Hall Allen of New York and Glen Cove, L.I.

title: Markets Idle Monday
description: All securities and commodities exchanges in this country will be closed Monday in observance of Memorial Day. Banks and other financial institutions, along with most Government offices, will also be closed. In Britain most banks and exchanges will be closed for a bank holiday.

title: Political Violence Stirs Crisis in Chile
description: SANTIAGO Chile May 24The spread of political violence in recent weeks is generating growing pressure for law enforcement from the Opposition and a crisis within the governing leftwing coalition of President Salvador Allende Gossens.

title: A Group Run by and for Young People
description: Five years ago, Bobby Newlin was nothing but a lazy teenager, as he put it. Every day after school he would go home to his apartment on the Lower East Side and immediately go upstairs.

title: 30YearOld Christian Commune in Georgia Thrives After Adversity
description: AMERICUS, GaLooking on as a tractor clattered across the dry red earth, Bill Londeree talked about pecans and sewing machines, and about how it felt these hot spring days to drive into town.

title: Pulling No Punches
description: This time we are not pulling our punches, the commander of an American aircraft carrier in the Tonkin Gulf boasted the other day. We've told the world we're going to be the winners.

title: Lindsay Aide Says Council Must Raise Taxes on Property
description: Mayor Lindsay's office insisted yesterday that the City Council had no choice but to approve up to $89million in higher property taxes to close an expected budget gap regardless of the continuing opposition of Council members.

title: A First Step, but a Major Stride
description: MOSCOW, Saturday, May 27 The nuclear age gained its first strategic arms limitation treaty in the Kremlin last night. Its awkward namecommonly

title: Ontario Securities Agency Suspends Head of a Firm
description: TORONTO, May 26 (UPI)The head of one of Canada's most prestigious investment firms was given a sevenday suspension today.

title: Texts of Toasts by Nixon and Kosygin at State Dinner
description: Mr. General Secretary Brezhnev, Mr. Chairman of the Presidium, Mr. Chairman of the Council of Ministers, and all of our distinguished guests:

title: Panatta Ousts Nastase in French Tennis
description: PARIS, May 26 (AP)Adriano Panatta, a 21yearold Italian making his first appearance in the French open tennis tournament, today upset Ills Nastase of Rumania, the tournamen's No. 2 seeded player, 16, 97, 64, 63, on the windswept center court at Roland Garros Stadium.

title: I.T.T. Proxies Withheld By Stanford of Meeting
description: STANFORD, Calif., May 26 (UPI)  Stanford University disclosed today that it withheld proxies on its 43,192 shares of International Telephone and Telegraph stock at the company's last shareholders meeting because of the concern's lack of candor in its actions involving the Federal Government.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I am amazed that The Times had the poor taste to print the OpEd article Obituary: Motherhood by Ellen Peck on May 13, the day before Mother's Day.

title: Gas Plant Planned in Soviet
description: International Systems and Controls, Inc., announced yesterday that its French affiliate, Compagnie Centrale d'Etudes Industrielles had received a $53million contract for a gastreatment plant to be built at Orenburg in the Soviet Union. J. F. Pritchard & Co., a wholly owned engineering subsidiary, will collaborate with the French affiliate to provide basic engineering, procurement and management services for the project.

title: Notes on People
description: When Anna Freud stepped forward yesterday to receive an honorary degree from the University of Vienna it meant much more than simply picking up a doctorate. In conferring the, honorary Doctor of Medicine on the 77yearold daughter of Sigmund Freud, said the university's leading Freudian professor, Dr. Hans Strotzka, the University of Vienna was symbolically ending the repression of psychoanalysis that so long existed there.

title: CITY BACKS PLAN TO TREAT ADDICTS
description: A yearold program for treating heroin addicts with cyclazocine, a socalled antagonist drug, begun at the Downstate Medical Center in Brooklyn under the auspices of the Addiction Services Agency, has received new support.

title: Fabric of the State Shows Needlework As Labors of Love
description: Labors of love and of necessity are focal points in a new show at the Museum of American Folk Art, 49 West 53d Street, displaying small masterpieces of needlework and hand weaving from Colonial times onward,

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his May 15 frontpage article onhis Pyongyang visit, Harrison E. Salisbury asserts that ... not since the grim days of the Korean war had American newsmen glimpsed the North Korean capital until today... This is simply not true, unless The Times publicly acquiesces to the McCarthyite view that reporters for the American left press are either not legitimate members of the journalism profession or are not legitimate Americans.

title: Books of The Times
description: Yehudi Menuhin has always been a virtuoso with a difference. He's not one of those who surface every season, no one knows whence, to give his annual recital or two, take his turn with the Philharmonic and disappear until the following season, only to return to do it all over again. A Menuhin appearance is still an event. For one, the legend of the boy prodigy still hovers over him, impressive even to those to whom it is only history. Not content with appearances as a soloist, he has shown up a number of times as a conductor of chamber orchestras. Then again, he has not been afraid to indicate his interest in all things Indian, in organically grown food, in Yoga ex ercises and to declare himself on man and his culture. When he and his sister Hepzibah played for President Nixon and Charles de Gaulle, he thought it an excellent time to lecture the two men on the superiority of beauty over material things.

title: Black Parley Condemns U.S. on Africa
description: WASHINGTON May 26The conference of black American and African leaders agreed today to set up a new organization to oppose white governments in Africa and their supporters.

title: Castro in Bucharest
description: BUCHAREST May 26 (UPI) Premier Fidel Castro of Cuba arrived in Bucharest today en route to Warsaw. The Cuban leader will be in Poland at the same time as President Nixon but the two men are not expected to meet.

title: Joint Commission Set Up To Resolve Trade Issues
description: MOSCOW, May 26The United States and the Soviet Union announced the formation of a joint commission today to devise a comprehensive trade agreement that has proved impossible to reach during President Nixon's visit to Moscow.

title: A Port Authority Commissioner Quits, Citing Personal Business
description: Hoyt Ammidon, vice chairman of the Port of New York Authority, resigned that post yesterday, citing pressure of personal business. Mr. Ammidon, 62 years old, is New York State's ranking representative on the authority. He is chairman of the board of the United States Trust Company.

title: New Ruling Permits Imports Of Oils for Petrochemicals
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The Interior Department issued new regulations today allowing imports of crude and unfinished oils for use in petrochemical processes.

title: U.S. ORDERS EDIE TO REDUCE PRICES
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The Price Commission announced today that it was ordering Lionel D. Edie & Co., a subsidiary of Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, Inc., to roll back some prices it charged for management advisory services and to make refunds to customers.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I was surprised to note in your May 15 editorial review of Governor Rockefeller's vetoes and the performance of the New York State Legislature the omission of comment on the Governor's veto of the repeal of the improvident authorization they gave five years ago for construction of a sixmile bridge across Long Island Sound from Oyster Bay o Rye.

title: British Government Sells Thos. Cook &
description: LONDON, May 26  Thos. Cook & Son, Ltd'.  the travel business that developed out of temperance workers excursions organized by a printer in the English Midlands 130 years agowas sold by the Government today for $58.5million.

title: A 32ROOM MANSION DESTROYED BY FIRE
description: TUXEDO PARK, N.Y., May 26,A 32room mansion in this Orange County community was destroyed by a fire that took more than 12 hours to put out, last night ,and early this morning.

title: Nicklaus's 64 for 134 Leads Atlanta Golf by a Stroke
Hotel Demolition in 2d Stage
description: ATLANTIC CITY, May 26A demolition team leveled the central portion of the landmark, 15story Traymore Hotel on the Boardwalk here today. It was the second phase of the demolition. Two 13story wings of the 57yearold building, long, admired as magnificent architecture, were blown off April 27. A final blast expected within three weeks is planned to bring down the remaining two wings, one near the boardwalk and the other in the rear on Illinois Avenue.

title: Gulfstream Land to Expand
description: The Gulfstream Land and Development Corporation has agreed to buy Robert L. Turchin, Inc., of Miami Beach from the GAC Corporation, it was announced yesterday. Turchin is a builder with about $39million in work presently underway, including a 500bed Biscayne General Hospital.

title: Dave Anderson
description: OMAHA, May 26Now that the fight is over, everybody is willing to acknowledge that it never should have occurred. Unknown to Ron Stander, a hospital room had been reserved for him.

title: Von Braun Will Leave NASA For Job in Aerospace Industry
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Dr. Wernher von Braun one of the chief architects of man's first landing on the moon is retiring from the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

title: TreasuryBill Yields Drop at Weekly Sale
description: WASHINGTON, May 26Yields on United States Treasury bills fell in the Government's weekly competitive sale today of these shortterm securities.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON May 26A spokesman for the Pakistani Embassy here denied reports from New Delhi today that Pakistani would recognize Bangladesh.

title: Miami Must Pay $80,205 In Death During 1968 Riot
description: TALLAHASSEE, Fla, May 26 (UPI)The city of Miami was ordered today to pay $80,205 damages to the widow of a man killed when riot police raked an apartment building with 75 to 100 bullets during the 1968 Republican National convention.

title: Sing Sing Audience: Captivated, Not Captive
description: OSSINING, N. Y., May 26Inmates in prison would seem to be a completely captive audience. But at the Ossining Correctional Facilitywhich used to be called Sing Sing Prisonattendance at theatricals is voluntary.

title: They Must Surely Die
description: What recourse can an orderly people have against violent enemies who are willing to kill and be killed to have their way? The civilized answer is plain. In domestic disorders, as in war, a legitimate government must be ready to take the lives its enemies are willing to sacrifice. For, where public enemies can kill with impunitykill and yet not be killed in turnthey must sooner or later prevail over the nominal government, as surely as foreign armies prevail over a people unwilling to fight.

title: N. Peter Rathvon, Industrialist And a Film Producer, Is Dead
description: Nathaniel Peter Rathvon, president of RadioKeithOrpheum Corporation from 1942 to 1949 and later a financier of independent film productions, died yesterday of a heart attack on a visit to Syracuse, N.Y. He was 81 years old and lived in Mexico City.

title: Roundup: Orioles'
description: It's too early to write off Mike Cuellar, the Baltimore lefthander, as a 20game winner.

title: The Antiwar University
description: The newest form of student antiwar protest is the antiwar university. Rather than shutting the universities down and urging the students to stay home or organizing a few hundred students to take over one or two buildings, a growing number of student activists favor transforming the schools into organizing centers for the antiwar movement.

title: A SEDATIVE GAINS IN DRUG CULTURE
description: Sopors, the street name and a trade name for a powerful sedativehypnotic, are becoming widely popular as a drug among young people in many cities and on numerous campuses in the United States.

title: Antiques: Redecorating of the State Department
description: Last week the diplomatic reception rooms at the State Department in Washington were opened for a party to celebrate the progress made in transforming the rooms from institutional eyesores to a treasury of the American arts.

title: Hanoi Calls for an Increase In National Security Effort
description: HANOI, North Vietnam, (Agence FrancePresse)  The Communist party daily, Nhan Dan, called today for even greater efforts to maintain security in North Vietnam.

title: Bridge:New York Life's Team Wins Title in Commercial League
description: The Metropolitan Commercial Bridge League closed its 197172 season last week with a new champion.

title: Uniroyal Chemical to Lift Prices of Resins on July 1
description: Uniroyal Chemical, a division of Uniroyal, Inc., said yesterday that it would increase prices by 1 cent a pound for its polyvinyl chloride dispersion resins, beginning July 1.

title: Soviet Equipment For Energy Studies Arrives in Illinois
description: MOSCOW, May 26A high Soviet science official announced today that Russian equipment had arrived at the site of the world's biggest atom smasher, at Batavia, Ill., and was being installed for a joint United StatesSoviet experiment.

title: TALVARD SWEEPS TO FOILS CROWN
description: Bernard Talvard, a member of the crack French foils team that won the Coupe d'Europe the last two years, turned in a remarkable series of performances yesterday at the opening event of the threeday Martini & Rossi fencing tournament.

title: 2 Blasts Damage Separate Buildings In Columbia Area
description: Explosions followed by small fires damaged two separate buildings at Columbia University early this morning.

title: People Movers Exhibited a at Transpo 72 Preview
description: CHANTILLY, Va., May 26 Four Government funded peoplemoverS, a fast evolving class of vehicle designed to help rescue urban America from strangulation by automobile traffic, had their first mass workout here today at the preview of a nineday exposition known as Transpo 72.

title: SENATOR HOPEFUL ON PENSION GOALS
description: The goal of pension reform legislation is both realis' and attainable, Senator Hardson A. Williams Jr. asserted yesterday.

title: 5 Young Painters Each Show Promise
description: New talent is always an uncertain quantity on the art scene, so the show of five young paintersthe oldest is 31now on view at the Forum Gallery, 1018 Madison Avenue, may present a misleadingly rosy pictures of young artists working in a representational vein.

title: Marcel Faribault, Backed Provincial Rights in Canada
description: MONTREAL, May 26 (AP)Marcel Faribault, a businessmanpolitician and adviser to former Premier Daniel Johnson of Quebec, died today at his home of a heart attack. He was 63 years old.

title: TV Venture Planned
description: The Kaiser Broadcasting Corporation and Field Communications, Inc., said yesterday they are forming a partnership to own and operate six ultra high frequency television stations, subject to approval of the Federal Communications Commission. Kaiser Broadcasting is a subsidiary of the Kaiser Industries Corporation and Field Communications is owned by Field Enterprises, Inc.

title: NICHOLAS IANNUZZI, A CRIMINAL LAWYER
description: Nicholas P. Tannuzzi, a lawyer who had held several government positions and who had been a leader in ItalianAmerican activities, died Thursday in Columbus Hospital. He was 73 years old and lived at 240 East 15th Street.

title: Peace Protesters Jailed
description: CHICOPEE, Mass., May 26 (AP)Two peace demonstrators were sentenced to 10 days in jail in Chicopee District Court today after failing to pay $10 fines for disturbing the peace. They were charged after an April 24 sitdown at Westover Air Force Base. The two are James H. Matlack, 34 years old, an assistant English professor at the University of Massachusetts, Amherst, and the Rev. Frank Dorman of Amherst.

title: Appeal Against War Marks Commencement at Cornell
description: ITHACA, N. Y., May 26Some 3,350 Cornell students received degrees here today in a brief commencement ceremony marked by criticism by Dale R. Corson, university president, of the Vietnam war.

title: BILL IS TIGHTENED ON DRUNK DRIVING
description: ALBANY, May 26Governor Rockefeller has signed into law two bills aimed at curbing drunken drivers, his office announced today.

title: Aid for Pakistan Set
description: PARIS, May 26 (Reuters)An international consortium agreed today to provide shortterm debt relief to Pakistan equivalent to $234million over a period of 26 months ending June 30, 1973, the World Bank office here said.

title: Kennedy Won't Attend Democratic Convention
description: LOUISVILLE, Ky, May 26 (Reuters)  Senator Edward M. Kennedy of Massachusetts said today that he would not attend the Democratic National Convention, which starts in Miami Beach July 10.

title: TRADING BLOC TOLD OIL DEARTH LOOMS
description: PARIS, MAY 26The United States told its trading partners today that they all faced a severe shortage of energy supplies by 1980, which could result in major economic disruption.

title: U. S. Airlines Wary of Concorde Purchase
description: Most major United States airlines said yesterday they plan to look long and skeptically before buying the Brit ishFrench Concorde supersonis airliner, despite the new pressure to buy that came Thursday when the British Overseas Airways Corporation said it would buy five of the 1,350mileanhour planes.

title: Payoff Seen in Governor's Appointment
description: In a move regarded by many politicians as a political payoff, Governor Rockefeller yesterday appointed a Democratic Assemblyman, Stephen S. Gottlieb, to a $31,325ayear post on the State Liquor Authority.

title: Pete Paces Soccer Victory
description: TOKYO, May 26 (AP)Brazil's star, Pele, scored two goals tonight to lead the Santos F.C. professional soccer team to a 30 victory over an allJapan selection in an exhibition game.

title: FRANK FOSTER BAND SHOWS OFF STYLE
description: Frank Foster, who was a section of Count Basie's band for many years, now has a big band of his own with a rugged, polished ensemble attack that stands creditable comparison to that Basie specialty. Mr. Foster's band, which has been playing Monday nights for the last five week's at Baron's, 132d Street and Lenox Avenue, made its midtown debut yesterday at the noontime Jazz Adventures session at the Playboy Club.

title: 357th Dies in Eiffel Plunge
description: PARIS, May 26 (Reuters)A man who fell to his death from the first floor of the Eiffel Tower yesterday was the 357th person to die in a plunge from the tower since it was opened in 1889.

title: Executive Changes
description: Champion International Corporation (formerly U.S. PlywoodChampion Papers, Inc.) has elected L. Clair Nelson senior vice presidentlegal affairs.

title: Market Place: Keeping Figures In Your Pocket
description: If Edward A. White sounds a bit arrogant when he talks about cornp'eling with the Japanese, perhaps he can be forgiven.

title: JUNE 21 DEADLINE SET ON RENT RISE
description: A State Supreme Court justice yesterday authorized landlords to raise rents 7.5 per cent in all rentcontrolled apartments on which computerbased rents have not been set by the city before June 21.

title: Court Gets Connecticut Districting Plan
description: NEW HAVEN, May 26A plan that would reduce the number of Connecticut legislators and redraw the lines of the constituencies has been submitted to the United States District Court here as the first step of a courtordered effort to revive Connecticut's stalled election processes.

title: Population Control Plea
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (UPI) John D. Rockefeller 3d testified today that Congress should appropriate the full $93milllion authorized for next year for population control research. Mr. Rockefeller, chairman of the commission on Population Growth the American Future, testified at a hearing of Senate Appropriations subcommittee.

title: 7 NAMED TO STUDY GARBAGE CARTING
description: Mayor Lindsay yesterday named a sevenmember committee headed by Irving Schneider, executive vice president of HelmsleySpear. Inc., the real estate concern, to determine what parts of the city's garbage and refuse should be collected by, private cartmen.

title: Standard Kollsman Expects Improved Results in 1972
description: Lloyd Taylor, president and chief executive of Standard Kollsman Industries, Inc., told the annual meeting here yesterday that the company expects improved results in 1972 but that another losing year is very possible.

title: F.D.A. Issues a Warning on Use 0f Oral Drugs to Fight Diabetes
description: WASHINGTON, May 26 (AP) The Food and DrUg Administration has issued a special warning about an apparent cardiovascular hazard from oral antidiabetes drugs and has urged doctors to restrict their use to certain patients.

title: Keystone Hilliard Posts Victory By 2 Lengths in Roosevelt Trot
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 26A freeforall trot without Fresh Yankee, the Americanbred, Canadianowned millionaire mare, may be likened to a golf classic without Jack Nicklaus. And that's how it was tonight at Roosevelt Raceway as Keystone Hilliard outtrotted six rivals in the $25,000 featured onemile event.

title: UtilityPole Maker Acquired by I.T.T.
description: The International Telephone and Telegraph Corporation has acquired Meyer Industries, Inc., a privately owned company based in Red Wing. Minn., for 750,000 shares of I.T.T. stock, it was disclosed yesterday.

title: Fredericks Finishes First In I.C.4A SixMile Run
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 26Greg Fredericks continues to surprise people, including Harry Groves, his coach at Penn State.

title: Fireman Awarded $1.6Million Here For Injury on Job
description: A Brooklyn fireman, paralyzed from the waist down sin a 22foot fall resulting from his failure to grasp a brass slide pole in a firehouse, has been awarded $1.6million in damages by a State Supreme Court, jury.

title: CEILINGS ARE SET
description: MOSCOW Saturday May 27 President Nixon and the Soviet Communist party leader Leonid I. Brezhnev, signed two historic agreements last night that for the first time put limits on the growth of American and Soviet strategic nuclear arsenals.

title: Arms Agreements in Brief
description: MOSCOW, May 26The agreement on limitation of strategic arms includes two parts: a treaty of unlimited duration on antiballistic missiles, or ABM's, and a fiveyear freeze on offensive strategic weapons pending negotiation of a more complete accord. Following are the highlights:

title: WHITTAKER'S NET OFF FOR QUARTER
description: The Whittaker Corporation reported yesterday that its net income in the quarter ended April 30 declined to $2,076,000, or 9 cents a share, from 37,266,000, or 34 cents, in the corresponding period last year. The 1972 results included a loss of $1,530,000 from discontinued operations and a special credit of $479,000 from the sale of securities.

title: Court Throws Out Jersey Law Barring Primary CrossVoting
description: NEWARK, May 26New Jersey's primary election law prohibiting enrolled voters from casting ballots in other party contests was declared unconstitutional today by a threejudge Federal panel.

title: Explosives to Be Marked
description: ALBANY, May 26The State Board of Standards and Appeals has adopted new safety regulations, requiring identification markings of explosives to assist law enforcement officials in tracing stolen explosives. The board also announced today it had amended the industrial code to provide for increased security in the storage of explosives, more detailed inventory control and safer transportation methods. It will also require that blasters be certified to ensure that the persons who supervise the detonation of explosives are experienced and competent.

title: FOE PUSHES FIGHT IN TWO KEY AREAS
description: SAIGON South Vietnam Saturday, May 27North Vietnamese soldiers hurled themselves against Government defenses in the Central Highlands city of Kontum and near the northern city of Hue through the day yesterday.

title: 2,546 STATE AIDES CITED OVER STRIKE
description: ALBANY, May 26  The state's director of employe relations today announced that he had determined that 2,546 state employes had violated the nostrike provisions of the Taylor Law in connection with twoday walkouts at state facilities early in April.

title: MINTY SETS MARK AT 10,000 METERS
description: ASHLAND, Ohio, May 26Gordon Minty shattered the meet record in the 10,000meter run to pace Eastern Michigan to the firstday lead at the National Collegiate Athletic Association college division track and field championships.

title: NEWSMEN IN ITALY PROTEST POLICE RAID
description: ROME, May 26  Newsmen throughout Italy staged work stoppages today in a broad protest against what they termed curtailment of press freedom. by the police and the judiciary.

title: Price of Gold Hits Peak
description: LONDON, May 26 (Reuters) Increased buying activity on the London gold market today pushed up the price of the precious metal to a record level.

title: Indy 500 to Be Shown On Television Here
description: A shortened, delayedtape version of the Indianapolis 500 will be televised to the New York area by the American Broadcasting Company, Channel 7, from 8:30 P.M. to 10:30 P.M. (E.D.T.) today.

title: SUSAN'S GIRL BIDS FOR 8TH STRAIGHT
description: Susan's Girl the brilliant 3yearold who races for Fred Hooper will try to annex the second leg of the New York Racing Association's triple crown for fillies at Belmont Park today.

title: Waldheim Hails New Pact, Hopes for Cuts in Arsenals
description: UNITED NATIONS, May 26 (Reuters) Secretary General Kurt Waldheim said tonight that he was most gratified by news of SovietUnited States agreement on strategic arms limitation and hoped it would be a first step toward the actual reduction of arsenals.

title: Aussie Leads Osaka Golf
description: OSAKA, Japan, May 26 (AP) German Marsh of Australia carded an eightunderpar 64 today and took the secondround lead with a 134 total in the $39,344 Dunlop international golf tournament.

title: HIJACKED AIRLINER STORMED IN MALAWI
description: BLANTYRE Malawi May 26 UPI) Malawi troops firing machine guns stormed a South African Airways jetliner today to capture two Lebanese men who had tried to extort money from the head of one of the world's biggest diamond companies.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: I applaud your balanced and constructive editorial of May 13 expressing deep reservations regarding the recently negotiated agreement restricting steel shipments to the United States from Western Europe and Japan.

title: Hanoi Backs Saigon Exiles in Coalition
description: HANOI North Vietnam May 25Nguyen Duy Trinh North Vietnam's Foreign Minister and Deputy Premier has suggested in an interview that the coalition government the Communists propose for South Vietnam should include some Vietnamese now living abroad.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Tom Wicker's May 9 column An American Emperor lights up a facet of our national life that demands the closest scrutiny with the least possible delay.

title: Javits Clears Path For a Conservative
description: WASHINGTON, May 26In an indication of a developing relationship between the Republican and Conservative parties in New York, Senator Jacob K. Javits has approved a $36,000ayear job for founder of the Conservative party who ran against Mr. Javits in 1962. Mr. Javits, a liberal Republican from New York, acknowledged that he had given his clearance to President Nixon's nomination last Monday of Kieran O'Doherty, a former vice chairman of the Conservative party, to be member of the Foreign Claims Settlement Commission.

title: Hong Kong Bank Unit Set
description: The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation announced yesterday the formation of new merchant banking subsidiary to be known as Wardley, Ltd. The company, which will have initial capital of $100million Hong Kong dollars (about $18million), will concentrate on securities underwriting, corporate counseling and mediumterm landing.

title: The Plight of the Migrant
description: LA BELLE, Fla.I don't intend to stop speaking up until I can get something better for the farm migrant workers here in Hendry County, for we have been ignored long enough.

title: LEHIGH VALLEY ROAD GETS I.C.C. MANDATE
description: The Lehigh Valley Railroad was authorized yesterday to permanently take over all operations of the bankrupt Central Railroad of New Jersey in Pennsylvania.

title: ACCORD IS SOUGHT OVER LAND ON L.I.
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., May 26 s Suffolk County Executive John V. N. Klein sought a legisative compromise today in a complex case of potential conflict of interest involving the presiding officer of the County Legislature and at least two parcels of prime real estate wanted by both the county and the State of New York.

title: MESKILL ACCUSED ON ABORTION ROLE
description: NEW HAVEN, May 26 Lawyers for Women Versus Connecticut, the organization that has led the fight for liberalized abortion in the state, today asked the Federal District Court here to hold Gov. Thomas J. Meskill in contempt for his role in the enactment of the state's new antiabortion law.

title: Art: Schaffer's Chilly, Kinetic Works
description: Nicolas Schoffer's sculptures, or constructions if you would rather call them that, need a lot of room  room to catch changing shafts of light, room to throw multiple shadows, room to whirl around in and, for that matter, room just to stand still in, since even his stabiles (if that word hasn't been patented by Alexander Calder) make the viewer want to walk around them, to look at them from different angles and distances, supplying the recombinations of form that are so dramatically created by motors in the kinetic pieces.

title: Hair Dryers in Locker Room
description: SEATTLE, May 26 (AP)The men at the University of Washington won an equal rights fight today. Their request for hair dryers in the locker room of the Intramural Activities was approved by the Board of Regents.

title: An Improved Aluminum Tennis Racket Is Devised
description: WASHINGTON, May 26The aluminum racket with which Ken Rosewall successfully defended his world championship tennis title at Dallas May 14 was invented by two Boston industrial designers. Peter A. Latham and Paul E. Brefka were granted Patent 3,664,669 this week for the racket, which is called the Seamless Ken Rosewall and is distributed by a division of Dart Industries. Around the inside of the extruded aluminum frame forming the racket head are plastic supports to which the strings are attached. Mr. Latham lists the advantages of the racket as lowered wind resistance and the ability to be strung tighter with gut than other metal rackets without danger of breakage.

title: Special Dublin Court Set
description: DUBLIN, May 26The Irish Government announced today that it was setting up a special criminal court to try members of the Irish Republican Army. The court, which will have three judges, will have no jury.

title: Foreign Buying Off
description: TOKYO, May 26  Tokyo, stock prices climbed sharply to a record high this week, exceeding 3,500 yen on the Tokyo DowJones average for, the first time since the stock market was reopened in May, 1949, under the Allied occupation.

title: East Germans Greet Visitors From West
description: WERGER East Germany May 23So Willy's finally done it, an East German said a broad grin on his face as he greeted West Berlin relatives and friends at his home near Potsdam for the first time in years.

title: East and West Germany Sign a Transport Pact
description: BERLIN, May 26The East and West German, governments signed their first formal treaty today and used the occasion to announce that they would enter into further negotiations next month aimed at normalizing relations between the two Germanys.

title: Harnessing the Missiles
description: For the first time the United States and the Soviet Union have agreed to put quantitative limits on the numbers of both offensive and defensive strategic missiles they have in place. Under the historic pacts signed in Moscow yesterday, each country has agreed to restrict itself to two groups of antiballistic missilesone group protecting each nation's capital and the other defending a distant collection of offensive missiles. And the number of these offensive missilesthe total emplaced on land and carried in submarinesis frozen as of the situation that existed at the moment of signing yesterday. The result is to call a partial stop in the race for supremacy in instruments that can inflict monumental death and destruction.

title: Bookstalls Along Park Bring A Touch of Paris to Fifth Ave.
