description: Birdwatchers in the densely wooded sanctuary of the Ramble in Central Park feel compelled these days to keep an eye peeled for more than just thrilling flash of feathers.

title: LUNN SCORES 275 TO WIN IN ATLANTA
description: ATLANTA, May 28Several minutes after he holed out for a concluding birdie to win the Atlanta Golf Classic by two strokes today, Bob Lunn was in a daze. I don't remember hitting the putt, he said after his 69 for a 275 had beaten Gary Player of South Africa for the top prize.

title: An AllVolunteer Army?
description: Despite the reescalation of the Vietnam war, Secretary of Defense Laird has reaffirmed that the draft call will not exceed 50,000 in 1972half the number inducted last year and the lowest annual call since before the Korean war. He added that the Administration's goal still an allvolunteer armed force by June 30, 1973.

title: MachineTool Orders Declined in April
description: April orders for machine tools fell below the March level but the cumulative total for the first four months at $368.5million ran 55 per cent higher than the yearago level of $237.15million, the National Machine Tool Builders Association reported over the weekend.

title: The Windsors in International Society: Where They Went,the World Went
description: When A King's Story, the Duke of Windsor's filmed biography, had its premiere in New York in 1967, Mrs. Edwin I. Hilson, the banker's widow who was in charge of the gala benefit performance, was in something of a dither.

title: Belfast: Terror in a Time of Troubles
description: BELFAST  Shortly after dusk one evening last week, a 100pound bomb exploded in a van in the center of deserted Belfast. At the Lyric Theater, the actors rehearsing Brecht's Arturo Ui, paused a moment, and then returned to the script. On Bedford Street, at the Arts Council several canvases in a new group exhibition by four young Ulster painters trembled with the nearby explosion. On Ashley Avenue, Seamus Heaney, the city's bestknown poet, heard the blast and looked up from his desk.

title: Vessel Is First to Drill Deep Into Sea Basins
description: Well, Doc, we wrung her neck this time, a burly, helmeted sea driller said to Dr. William E. Benson of the National Science Foundation. The occasion was one of the more agonizing early moments in the fouryear drilling effort of the Glomar Challenger.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Frank E. Karelsen's May 11 letter urging traffic police in greater numbers in midtown was very much in or der. I would like to take his proposal a step further and urge the police to be more energetic in ticketing and towing away illegally parked cars in midtown, as great a cause of traffic congestion as anything else. There seems to be widespread flouting of parking regulations, ranging from cars to lines of doubleparked taxis in front of hotels.

title: The Life of Edward as Prince, King and Duke
description: In a Paris restaurant some years ago, a 6yearold American boy, Impressed by the attention that was being paid to a slight, whitehaired man with a tanned, deeply lined face, approached the man and asked for his autograph.

title: Mrs. Joan Thompson Stehli Wed To Lloyd Gilmour Jr., an Artist
description: SYOSSET, L.I., May 28Mrs. Joan Thompson Stehli, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Charles Goodrich Thompson of New York and South Tamworth, N.H., was married here this afternoon to Lloyd S. Gilmour Jr. of New York, an artist and independent motionpicture producer. He is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Gilmour of Locust Valley and Palm Beach, Fla.

title: DR. MARTIN LEISER
description: POUGHKEEPSIE, N. Y., May 28Dr. Martin Leiser, a fellow of the American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists who had been on the staffs of Vassar Brothers and St. Francis Hospitals, died yesterday in Vassar Brothers Hospital. His age was 73.

title: TwoWay Exchange
description: For the first time yesterday the Kremlin permitted an American President to speak directly to the Soviet people via radio and television. Though the speech received scant advance publicity, it is certain that large numbers of Russians saw and heard Mr. Nixon's lowkey but effective assertion of this country's desire to live in peace with the Soviet Union. This opportunity was a welcome change from earlier official efforts to minimize the President's contact with ordinary Russians.

title: North Korean Leaders Get Basic Economic Education
description: PYONGYANG, North KoreaIt's not the Harvard Graduate Stool of Business Administration, but the University of the Peoples Economy in Pyongyang is busily training Korean managers for the socialist economy and its political organs.

title: 96th and Broadway Typifies Essence of a Changing City
description: To those who go there just to hang out, the corner of 96th and Broadway, on these warm presummer nights, is the essence. of New York.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Has the almighty power of the United States Government become so impotent and desperate that it must divert the resources of the Internal Revenue Service to harass Dorothy Day and the Catholic Worker Movement in their unblemished work of comforting the afflicted, as well as clothing, feeding and sheltering thousands of needy people in New York? [News story May 19].

title: You Gonna Send Me to the Pen
description: Don't be telling me what is right. You talk that right jive, but where was you when my old man and the neighbors was teaching me how to steal and shoot dope? Where was you when me and my brothers and sisters was crazy and blind from hunger? Where was you when my mama was gambling away the welfare check? Where was you when the World was calling me a dirty nigger and a greasy Mexican and a poor white peckawood? Where was you when the cops was whipping me upside my head just because my skin was dark? Where was you when I was losing respect for your law and your order? Where was you when Wrong was my only salvation?

title: Brewers Dismiss Bristol, Name Crandall Manager
description: MILWAUKEE, May 28 (UPI) The Milwaukee Brewers dismissed Dave Bristol as manager today and replaced him with Del Crandall, manager of the Brewers farm club at Evansville. Ind., and a former favorite here with the Braves.

title: Pamela Ruth Lessing Is Married
description: MAMARONECK, N. Y., May 28Miss Pamela Ruth Leasing, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Fred W. Lessing, was married at the Beach Point Club here today to Neil David Friedman, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jules J. Friedman. Both families are of Scarsdale.

title: Stockton in Tennis Final
description: TULSA, Okla., May 28 (AP) Dick Stockton of Port Washington, L. I., and Eddie Dibbs of Miami moved into the final of the annual Tulsa invitation tennis tournament today. Stockton beat Raz Reid, 61, 76, and Dibbs downed Paul Gerken of Norwalk, Conn., 76, 75.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your April 29 editorial concerning Judge Louis Fusco Jr. does a gross injustice to the judge. The statements made and the innuendos supplied are incorrect.

title: Enduring Love Story
description: In recent years the Duke of Windsor had become almost a forgotten figure; but his death in France at 77 rekindles for millions of people around the world the memory of one of the great love stories of all time. Before it happened, the notion of a twentiethcentury British king voluntarily giving up his throne because he could not carry on without the help and support of the woman I love would have been too improbable even for Hollywood.

title: The Unwanted Children of a New Nation
description: DACCA, Bangladesh  At the instigation of American social workers, the Government of Bangladesh is setting up the legal machinery for international adoption of child victims of occupation and war, including the unwanted offspring of women raped by Pakistani soldiers.

title: Martin Rose Marries Suzan P. Frank on L. I.
description: ROCKVILLE CENTRE, L. I., May 28Miss Suzan P. Frank was married here this afternoon to Martin J. Rose. Rabbi Phillip Berger performed the ceremony at the Arbor Inn.

title: Foyt Is Burned in Mishap While Refueling at Dirt Track
description: DUQUOIN, Ill., May 28 (AP) A. J. Foyt, who failed yesterday in a bid to win the Indianapolis 500 for the fourth time, was hospitalized today after a mishap here. Foyt suffered first and second degree burns on his face, right arm and leg during a pit stop in a 100lap United States Auto Club event.

title: Bridge: Tripp Preparing to Take Over Tilles's Duties at Association
description: The Greater New York Bridge Association recently appointed John Tripp as successor to its retiring business manager, Jules Tilles, a small initial coincidence. Tripp will be styled executive director of the association, and will be undertaking one of the most responsible and complex jobs in the world of bridge.

title: Duke of Windsor Dies
description: LONDON, May 28The Duke of Windsor, who gave up the throne of England to marry the American woman he loved, died early today at his home in Paris in the Bois de Boulogne. He was 77 years old.

title: U.S.Pilot Tells of 6 Days at Anloc In a Bunker Beneath the Storm
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 28In Anloc, security is living burrowed deep under the earth where the North Vietnamese shells cannot get at you.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Whatever other effect they may have, your May 10 editorial Mr. Nixon's Brinkmanship plus Mr. Wicker's venomous attack will surely give comfort to the Communists and strengthen their will to continue on the offensive, hoping that America will cave In under such cries for appeasement.

title: Emma Contestabile Excels at the Piano
description: Since the world is not overrun with pianists who would voluntarily sit down and play Ravel's Alborada del Gracioso immediately after finishing Beethoven's Sonata in C minor (Op. 111), Emma Contestabile automatically distinguished herself by doing just that at Carnegie Recital Hall Saturday night.

title: TollRobbery Suspect Held
description: NORWALK, Conn., May 28Following the third in a series of Connecticut Turnpike tollgate robberies in this area, the state police arrested a Stamford man, Thomas Bedgood, 35 years old, after, they said, he had held up a Norwalk tollgate attendant and taken $50 last night. Mr. Bedgood is believed by the police to be the same man who held up attendants at the Greenwich toll station last Thursday and Friday nights, netting $250 and $150, respectively.

title: MISS PALMER'S 211 LEADS BY 5 SHOTS
description: SOUTHERN PINES, N. C., May 28 (AP)Sandra Palmer slipped to a 72 in today's third round of the Titleholder's golf tournament, but increased her lead from three shots to five with a 211 total, two under par, going into the final round.

title: Chess Set's Creator
description: Present Nixon's gift to the Soviet Union, a porcelain chess set, was inspired by a medieval tapestry seen by the artist, Harry Burger Jr., on a visit to the Cloisters Museum in New York in 1949.

title: FRENCH SEEKING IMPROVED BOURSE
description: PARIS, May 28The French have proposed a series of new measures to improve the functioning of the stock market and have revived the idea of creating the equivalent of a Wall Street quarter for the City of Paris.

title: Roundup: Blue Hurls First 5, A's Win in 10
description: Vida Blue made his first start of the season yesterday andalthough he pitched only five inningsit was in all respects a very pleasant day for the Oakland Athletics.

title: JACK STRACHEY, 78, SONGWRITER, DIES
description: BRIGHTON, England, May 28 (AP)Jack Strachey, composer of These Foolish Things and other hit songs, died yesterday after a long illness. He was 78 years old and lived here.

title: PHASE 2 END SEEN AS BUYING TRIGGER
description: The nation's purchasing agents anticipate a buying spree if they get early notice that Phase Two price controls are to end, according to a random sampling of corporate. buyers.

title: Smoldering Freighter Sinks
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., May 28 (AP)  The smoldering freighter Oriental Warrior sank at her berth in the St. Johns River today, four days after she caught fire off Florida's northeast coast.

title: Sam Oakum, on 11 Points, Wins Working Hunter Title
description: SOUTH BRITAIN, Conn., May 28Symair Farm's Sam Oakum ridden by Mary McGrane, captured both classes over fences and finished fourth in the under saddle event to score 11 points and win the regular working hunter championship today at the Mountain Valley Equestrian Center horse show.

title: ROCKEFELLER SIGNS BILL FOR CABLE TV
description: ALBANY May 28A bill to create a fivemember state commission to regulate the growing cable television industry has been signed into law. Governor Rockefeller's office announced today.

title: U.S. Held Unable to Destroy All Army Data on Civilians
description: WASHINGTON, May 28 (UPI) The Senator who forced the Army to stop its surveillance of civilians said today the information that had been gathered could not be completely destroyed because it had been passed around to other agencies.

title: Agency Terms Upstate Tract A Suitable Nuclear Plant Site
description: The state's Atomic and Space Development Authority has designated a 2,300acre tract along the southern shore of Lake Ontario as a possible nuclear power plant site.

title: Steel Demand Steady
description: PITTSBURGH, May 28Taking stock last week, steel producers saw themselves in a year that was satisfactory but not yet outstanding.

title: No Sight of Missing Plane
description: SUNNYVALE, Calif., May 28 (AP)  Coast Guard searchers found no trace in the Pacific Ocean today of life jackets reported in the general area where a Navy patrol plane was missing with eight men aboard.

title: Baby Found in Rest Room
description: A justborn girl was found abandoned yesterday in a shopping bag in the women's rest room of the IND station at 74th Street and Roosevelt Avenue in Queens, the police reported. The infant, wrapped in towels, was found by a passenger. The baby, about six hours old, was taken to the City Hospital Center at Elmhurst. The police said there were no notes on the wrappings and assigned detectives to investigate.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: It was one of New York's rare and brilliantly sunlit days. In Central Park the buttery green new leaves of the maples, lindens and oaks formed stunning backdrop for the breathtakingly beautiful cherry and magnolia blossoms. ... every prospect pleases, and only man is vile.

title: David Lance Weds Miss Gillian Breese
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 28Miss Gillian Breese, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Breese of Port Washington and Montauk, was married here this afternoon to David Richard Lance, son of Mr. and Mrs. Jack Lance of Hicksville.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: Beginning in the fall, travelers on the Staten Island ferry will pay 10 cents for a round trip rather than cents each way, it was announced yesterday by the Department of Marine and Aviation.

title: Tigers Lose, 51, 42 McKinney Sent to Syracuse Club
description: Confronting embarrassment on several levels, the New York Yankees turned around yesterday and swept a doubleheader from the Detroit Tigers, 5.1 and 42, and left Yankee Stadium for a twoweek Western trip in a surprisingly chipper frame of mind.

title: Vitale Defeats 284 Rivals In Greenwich 5Mile Run
description: GREENWICH, Conn., May 29 John Vitale, 23 years old, of the New Haven Track Club, won the eighth annual fivemile Greenwich Memorial Day road race in 24 minutes 38 seconds in his first try today. A field of 285 started and 215 finished.

title: GUARDSMEN PATROL CITY IN CAROLINA
description: CONCORD, N.C., May 29 (UPI)More than 300 National Guardsmen carrying rifles patrolled a milesquare section of this textile city today after a second consecutive night of burning and looting.

title: CarFancier Brezhnev Given Cadillac by Nixon
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R., May 29 (AP)  Shortly before leaving Moscow today, President Nixon presented a 1972 Cadillac to the Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, who is a car fancier.

title: Memorial in London
description: LONDON, May 29 (UPI)Queen Elizabeth will go ahead with her annual birthday parade Saturday but will in elude a memorial ceremony for the Duke of Windsor.

title: CHOREOGRAPHERS IN HUMOROUS BILL
description: The Rio Grande Union Inc. is a dance company composed entirely of choreographers, which accounts for the imaginative variety of its improvisational evenings and their somewhat anarchic ordering. Sunday evening the company gave a humorous program of fatiguing length at the LoGiudice Gallery on Wooster Street.

title: Poverty a Fact of Life In Europe's Museums
description: MADRID, May 29In his Paris office, Hugues de VarineBohan, director of the International Council of Museums, was comparing the problems of museums in Europe and the United States.

title: FULLMER IS VICTOR IN TRANSAM RACE
description: LOUDON, N. H., May 29George Folimer, who was forced to change cars at the last minute and start from the back of the grid, won the 152mile TransAm race today at Bryar Motorsports Park.

title: Angry U.M.W. Insurgent Arnold Ray Miller
description: OHLEY, W. Va., May 29Struggle has been the way of life for so long in the narrow coal mining hollow of Cabin Creek that Arnold Ray Miller, who was born there 50 years ago, seems much like the land he came fromworn, scarred and inarticulately angry at its depletion. Mr. Miller was nominated yesterday by Miners for Democracy, a dissident faction of the United Mine Workers of America, as the reform candidate for the union presidencyas a surrogate, in fact, for the late Joseph A. Yablonski, who the Government contends was murdered by gunmen hired by U.M.W. officials after losing his bid for leadership in 1969 to W. A. Boyle, president of the union. Boyle's election has been declared void by the courts for fraud and voting irregularities, and the election is to be run again this year under Federal supervision.

title: Proxmire Scores Plane Cost
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI)  Senator William Proxmire, Democrat of Wisconsin, charged in a statement today that the Pentagon was trying to conceal from Congress a $1.2 billion overrun in the Navy's F14 jet fighter. The plane is being built by the Grumman Aerospace Corporation of Bethpage, L. I. He said that the. Navy had contended it could require production of the 313 craft for $5.3billion, while he had Narned that the projected costs were over $6.5billion in a Pentagon report.

title: SUSPICIOUS FIRE ROUTS 27 IN BRONX
description: A suspicious fire destroyed a group of threestory frame buildings in the Bedford Park section of the Bronx before dawn yesterday, leaving 27 Puerto Rican tenants homeless. There were reports in the neighborhood, which is predominantly white, that the families had been harassed recently.

title: U.S. ExportImport Bank Announces Loans in Brazil
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (Reuters)  The United States ExportImport Bank announced today two loans of $1million each to Banco Bandeirantes de Investimentos S.A. of Sao Paulo, Brazil.

title: Alabama Democrats Select Slate to Oppose Regulars
description: EPES, Ala., May 29 (UPI)Laying the groundwork for challenge of the state's regular party delegation to this summer's convention at Miami Beach, the National Democratic Party of Alabama has selected its own slate of 37 delegates.

title: JOHN SEIDLER
description: FAIR LAWN, N. J., May 29John Seidler, a retired vice president and director of Whittaker, Clark & Daniels, Inc., minerals concern in New York, died yesterday in Paramus. He was 65 years old and lived at 4 Burlington Place here.

title: A Hijacker Is Persuaded To Surrender at Athens
description: ATHENS, May 29 (UPI)  A man who carried a toy pistol and sticks tied together to resemble dynamite hijacked an Olympic Airlines plane yesterday, but gave himself up after the plane landed at Athens airport.

title: In Appalachia, It's the Weekend for Homecoming
description: FROST BOTTOM, Tenn., May 29High on the cemetery overlooking Poplar Creek, there is no doubt who are the blessed ones.

title: 10SHOT VICTORY FOR MISS PALER
description: SOUTHERN PINES, N. C., May 29 (AP)Sandra Palmer, shooting oneoverpar 72, made a shambles of the Titleholders golf tournament today, finishing with a 283 total and a 10stroke victory.

title: Mountain Lakes Wins, 3.2 In Jersey School Tennis
description: PRINCETON, N. J., May 29Mountain Lakes High School defeated Ramapo High School, 3.2, today in the final of the New Jersey State Interscholastic Athletic Association tennis allgroup championships on the Princeton campus. The victory gave Mountain Lakes the title for the second year in a row.

title: Ulster Welcomes Move
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 29The ceasefire announcernent by the Official wing of the Irish Republican Army was generally welcomed in Northern Ireland although it is recognized that the Provisionals have been responsible for most of the violence.

title: Tass Is Ahead of the News
description: MOSCOW, May 29 (UPI)While President Nixon was being delayed today by mechanical trouble in the Soviet jet he was to fly to Kiev, the official Soviet press agency Tass announced the arrival of the plane in Kievbefore it had left Moscow.

title: Craft Apparently Capsizes, 18 Japanese Fishermen Die
description: TOKYO, May 29 (UPI)Eighteen Japanese fishermen were killed today when their small vessel apparently capsized and sank in high seas in the North Pacific, the Maritime Safety Agency reported today.

title: First TV Debate Inconclusive for California Precinct
Hartack Rides Winners of CoFeatured Races at Pimlico
description: BALTIMORE, May 29With Bill Hartack aboard both winners, Locust Hill Farm's On Your Toes and Rex Ellsworth's Sentimental Times shared honors at Pimlico Race Course today as they posted narrow victories in the cofeatured races before a Memorial Day crowd of 12,741.

title: 586 Investigations by I.R.S. Reported on Prices and Pay
description: WASHINGTON, Ma'y 29 (UPI) Donald Rumsfeld, director of the Cost of Living Council, said today that the Internal Revenue Service had initiated 586 investigations to see whether concerns were complying with wage and price guidelines.

title: East Germany Seeking to Isolate Churches and Diminish Their Role
description: BERLIN, May 29  Conrad is very religious, the eighthgrade teacher at an East Berlin school recorded in the semiannual report. This remark barred the boy's entrance into an East German high school, excluding him from the higher education he and his parents had sought.

title: LIZZUL'S 4:16.2 WINS C.H.S.A.A. MILE RUN
description: Mike Lizzul of St. Francis Prep upset Kevin McCarey of Cathedral Prep in the mile run yesterday at the BrooklynQueens sectional track and field championships of the Catholic High Schools Athletic Association. Archbishop Molloy won the team title with 64 points.

title: Donna Lynn Stricof Bride of Darryl Jay Kramer
description: WEST HEMPSTEAD, L.I., May 29Miss Donna Lynn Stricof, daughter of Mrs. Lew A. Stricof of New York and the late Mr. Stricof, was married here this afternoon to Darryl Jay Kramer, son of Mr. and Mrs. Paul E. Kramer of Lynbrook. Rabbi Morris Friedman performed the ceremony at the Jewish Community Center.

title: Signs of a New Democratic Split
description: Toward the end of their nationally televised debate on Sunday night, Senator George McGovern was asked whether he thought he could ever win over Senator Hubert H. Humphrey's constituency  the blacks and the Jews and the elderly, for example. Mr. Humphrey was asked the same question in reverse: Could he ever gain the support of the suburbanites and young people and others who have backed Senator McGovern thus far?

title: Executioner $34.80 Victor In the $118,200 Metropolitan
description: Executioner cut down the opposition in the $118,200 Metropolitan Handicap at Belmont Park yesterday. Coming out of a mass huddle near the stretch turn, the October House Farm entrant registered by a neck over the favored Bold Reasoning, with Peace Corps next in the field of 11 that competed in the 79th running of the famous onemile event. Ridden by Eddie Belmonte, Executioner was timed in 1:35 25 and paid $34.80.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Visiting New York City after an absence of several years, we came away with the general impression that New York restaurants are little short of criminal institutions.

title: A Promotion at Downstate
description: Dr. Alfred Stracher of Roslyn Heights, L. I., has been named chairman of the biochemistry department at the Downstate Medical Center in Br000klyn, Dr. Calvin H. Plimpton, Downstate's president, announced. Dr. Stracher has been acting chairman of the department since the retirement of the late. Dr. Edward Muntwyler in 1970.

title: ALABAMA AIDE URGES DEFEAT OF CONNOR
Philharmonic, City do Antibias Pact
description: Three years after two black musicians accused the New York Philharmonic of refusing to hire them because of their race, the orchestra and the city's Commission on Human Rights have finally agreed on a longrange plan aimed at insuring minoritygroup musicians equal employment opportunities in the Philharmonic. The commission and the Philharmonic hope that the program, first of its kind in the history of American symphony orchestras, will serve as a model for such antidiscrimination plans throughout the country.

title: Bomb Found at Consulate
description: SAN FRANCISCO, May 29 (UPI)  A dynamite bomb placed at the door of the Portuguese Consulate was disarmed by a police bomb squad today. The bomb, consisting of ?? sticks of dynamite with crude timing device, had been put against the door, Placed against the bomb on the street side was a pillow case stuffed with dirt, which would have forced the bomb's explosion inwards to the consulate foyer had it gone off. Whoever it was sure knew what he was doing, the police said.

title: Barker Upset by Reiner In L. I. Tennis, 62, 6.3
description: ROSLYN, L. I., May 29Gary Reiner upset Bob Barker, the fifthseeded player, 62, 63, in the fourth round of the Long Island men's claycourt tennis championship at the Tower Tennis Club today.

title: 2,500 in Illinois Flee Area Where Train Spilled Acid
description: CHARLESTON, III., May 29 (UPI)About 2,500 persons in a 40squaremile rural area of eastcentral Illinois were alerted to evacuate the region today after bright orange clouds of toxic nitric acid spewed from a derailed tank car.

title: VIOLETTE LEDUC, FRENCH NOVELIST
description: PARIS, May 29 (Reuters)Violette Leduc, who came to literary prominence with her controversial autobiography, La Batarde, died yesterday at her home in Faucon, Southern France.

title: Inspectors and Company Blamed in Dam Break
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP)  Failure of Federal state and company officials to perform their legal responsibilities led to the dam break that killed 118 people in West Virginia last Feb. 26, the Army Corps of Engineers reported today.

title: Japanese Delaying Cut in Bank Rate Far Several Days
description: TOKYO, May 29 (UPI)A Japanese Government move to curb American pressure for revaluation of the yen by cutting the interest paid millions of Japanese on their savings was delayed today at least until June 3.

title: Home From Canton, 2 See Trade Gain
description: Two American businessmen, who have just returned from the Canton Trade Fair and Peking, say they expect trade with China to grow to a substantial volume including American consumer goods.

title: Miss Connors Has Nuptials
description: HAMBURG, N. Y., May 29 Miss Sheila Marie Connors of East Haven, Conn., and Michael Motte Grove of Providence, R. I., were married here this afternoon in SS. Peter and Paul Roman Catholic Church by the bride's uncle, the Rev. Alphonsus Connors.

title: The Music of Decadence
description: For some time the United States Government has been behaving like a man who, with an expensive house almost completed, decides to place a bomb in the living room and blow to smithereens. For more than twenty years, the United States gave millions of dollars in aid to India, and then, almost overnight, in a seemingly mindless way, it stopped that assistance and began to court India's greatest competitor. This change seems alien to the traditional moral consistency of the American character. Perhaps it is the product of a new computer morality. If so, it represents a dehumanization capable of enslaving or destroying the human race.

title: M'CLELLAITS SEAT IS AT STAKE TODAY
GATT Is Nearing Study on Problem Of Textile Trade
description: GENEVA, May 29  The overaIl textiles problem that has long plagued international trade relations is due to get an airing for the first time in the intergovernmental agency that sets the rules for most of the world's commerce.

title: H. M. Birnbaum Weds Lynn Tugendhaft
description: ROSLYN HEIGHTS, L. I., May 29Miss Lynn Frances Tugendhaft, daughter of Dr. and Mrs. Robert I. Tugendhaft of Massapequa Park, was married here today to Howard Martin Birnbaum, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Birnbaum of Brooklyn. The ceremony was performed in the Renaissance Country Club by Rabbi Bernard Berzon, president of the Rabbinical Council of America, who officiated at the wedding of the bride's parents.

title: Mayor Spends Holiday As Working Vacation
description: Mayor Lindsay spent yesterday's Memorial Day holiday at an undisclosed location in the Bahamas, continuing what his office said was a working vacation that is to continue until the end of this week. The Mayor was said to have taken voluminous papers with him.

title: LockeBailey Are Victors
description: LIME ROCK, Conn., May 29 (AP)Jim Locke of Alton, N. H., and Bob Bailey of Burnt Hill, N. Y., drove a Porsche 911S to victory today in the 200mile Camel GT challenge race at Lime Rock Park.

title: NATURAL SOUND WINS SPRINT IN DELAWARE
description: STANTON, Del., May 28 (AP)  William P. Burke's Natural Sound beat nine other 2yearold fillies in the $25,200 Polly Drummond Stakes at Delaware Park today.

title: Governor Signs Bill To Curb Auto Thefts
description: ALBANY, May 29Governor Rockefeller's office announced today that the Governor had signed a bill requiring every automobile in the state to have a small licenseplate sticker affixed to its windshield.

title: McGovern Places First In a Poll of Democrats
Kennedy Visits Wallace; Says He May Yet Walk
Number of U.S. Troops In Vietnam Unchanged
description: SAIGON South Vietnam, May 29 (AP)For the first time in 16 months there was no reduction in United States troop strength in Vietnam last week.

title: Man Pronounced Dead A 2d Time in California
description: LONG BEACH, Calif., May 29 (UPI) Russell Lee, who began breathing Saturday several hours after doctors pronounced him dead of massive head injuries, clung to life for 33 hours before being pronounced dead a second time last night.

title: Miss Sedransk Wed to E. G. Schwartz
description: HEWLETT HARBOR, L. I., May 29  Miss Cheryl Susan Sedransk and Elwin Garth Schwartz, son of Dr. and Mrs. Jerome Schwartz, were married here this afternoon at the home of the bridegroom's parents. Rabbi Edward T. Sandrow performed the ceremony.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Is the same failing that undid the United States in Vietnam now cropping up in the antiwar movement?

title: PEACE AND JOBS SET AS U.A.W. PRIORITIES
description: CHICAGO, May 29 (AP)The United Auto Workers president, Leonard Woodcock, said today] that an end of the war in Southeast Asia and the creation, of a fullemployment economy were top priorities in what he termed the U.A.W.'s platform for progress.

title: Burglaries in Schools Reach Epidemic Proportions in Some Districts of City
The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Marijuana Worth $95,000 Seized in Suitcase MixUp
description: HAMILTON, Ohio, May 29 (AP)About $95,000 worth of marijuana was confiscated and a man was charged with its possession after a girl mistakenly picked up a suitcase containing 50 pounds of the drug at the Greater Cincinnati Airport, the authorities said.

title: OffBroadway Play to Open Thursday
description: A play and two musicals have been announced for off Broadway production.

title: Arthur Daley
description: Not by any method of measurement could it have been regarded as a trick question even if it did bring a fleeting moment of uneasiness. Nothing embarrasses an author more than to have to eat his words. Yet I was being offered a heaping platter of my own words and asked to swallow them whole if I couldn't explain them. I knew that a statement I had made in this space a couple of weeks ago was preeminently correct. But how could I support my premise in the face of statistics that seemed to indi cate the contrary? cate the contrary?

title: Markets Were Closed
description: All domestic and British exchanges were closed yesterday, but Canadian and most European markets were open. United States markets were closed in observance of Memorial Day. In Britain, markets observed bank holiday.

title: Saigon Force Mauled
description: HUE, South Vietnam, May 9 Two battalions of South Vietnamese rangers have been withdrawn from combat after suffering heavy losses In a battle with North Vietnamese tanks and infantry about 18 miles northwest of Hue.

title: Virgin Isles A Challenge To Lawman
description: ST. THOMAS, V, I.When one of New York City's top black police officials took a leave of absence to come here and revamp the Departmerit of Public Safety at the request of the Governor last year, the job looked easy.

title: Sihanouk Back in Peking
description: PEKING, May 29 (Agence FrancePresse)  Prince Norodom Sihanouk, the former ruler of Cambodia, returned here today after an eightweek journey to North Korea and northeast, China.

title: 60 Gravestones Vandalized
description: BLACKSTONE, Mass., May 29 (UPI)  Vandals overturned and smashed about 60 gravestones over the weekend at Precious Blood Cemetery, the police said today. They said damage to the headstones was in excess of $30,000.

title: U.S. BUSINESSMEN BACK SOVIET TIES
description: A number of leading American industrialists and businessmen have told the Soviet people that they favor substantially increased trade between the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: DEFECTS CHARGED IN JOBS PROGRAM
description: WASHINGTON, May 29A Department of Labor evaluation of the Job Opportunities in the Business Sector program, the Nixon Administration's prime job training project, has found major deficiencies.

title: Mourners for Windsor Line Up In Paris to Sign Sympathy Book
description: PARIS, May 29 (UPI) Friends and admirers of the Duke of Windsor lined up bi the hundreds at the British Embassy today to show their sorrow over the death of the Kingl who gave up his throne for love.

title: A NEW ERA SOUGHT
description: MOSCOW, May 29President Nixon and the Soviet Communist party leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, concluded their historic week of summit talks today with a declaration of principles intended to mark a new, more stable and constructive era of RussianAmerican relations despite continuing differences over such issues as Vietnam.

title: Rules for Coexistence
description: The NixonBrezhnev summit in Moscow accomplished more than the pessimists expected, but less than the optimists had hoped for. On the positive side, it substantially improved the atmosphere of relations between the Soviet Union and the United States. It also made historic beginning toward ending the nuclear weapons race. Unfortunately, the long meetings produced no movement toward ending the Vietnam war or easing the perilous stalemate in the Middle East. However, there is likely to be much more SovietAmerican cooperation in the future in areas of mutual interestspace and medical research, for exampleeven while political and economic competition continue in many areas.

title: UConn Takes District 1 Title
description: STORRS, Conn., May 29 Connecticut spotted Harvard two runs and then roared back for an 112 victory and the National Collegiate Athletic Association District 1 baseball championship today.

title: Solomon and Orantes Gain in Paris Tennis
description: PARIS, May 29 (AP)Harold Solomon of Silver Spring, Md., reached the quarterfinals of the French open tennis tournament today, assuring his biggest payday in a professional career that is barely one month old.

title: Summit Accords in Brief
description: Peaceful Coexistence  Principle Is viewed as sole framework for relations in nuclear age. Differences ideology are termed no obstacle to normal relations.

title: The Federal Trade Commission
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 The Federal Trade Commisslon's emergence as an aggressive and innovative consumer advocate is provoking increasingly hostile reaction among business spokesmen. To some of the agency's supporters, the overtones are ominous.

title: Texts of NixonBrezhnev Declaration and of Joint Communique at End of Visit
description: The United States of America and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics,

title: Gold at $57.90 an Ounce In Trading on Zurich Market
description: ZURICH, May 29 (Reuters)Gold was quoted here today at a high for the day of $57.90 an ounce, compared with an opening rate of $57.70, dealers said.

title: Cops and Education
description: Ramsey Clark's contention that to be truly professional, police must have high standards of education and personal competence in a wide range of subjects with continuous and developing training, has become an accepted liberal credo and I would be the last underpaid professor in the world to contest that perhaps too naive, too simplistic proposition. But one wondershow is it to be achieved?

title: CRAWFORDS FIRST IN DEVON DRIVING
description: DEVON, Pa., May 29Mr. and Mrs. Harden L. Crawford of Gladstone, N. J., kept theirs (stranglehold on the Devon horse show driving marathon tonight by winning the event for the third straight year and retiring the Wethersfield Plate.

title: PRICING IS STABLE ON NEW TV LINES
description: Maybe it's the Price Commission. Or maybe it's competition. But something new and different has happened in recent weeks in the televisionset business: the new lines have been introduced with the usual hoopla and fanfare, but prices have remained relatively stable.

title: Peking Is Reported to Invite Jakarta TableTennis Team
description: RAWALPINDI, Pakistan, May 29  China has invited Indonesia's tabletennis team to compete in Peking, according to senior Indonesian sources here.

title: Steel Furnace Blast Hurts 9
description: DETROIT, May 29 (AP)At least nine workmen were injured, four of them seriously. by an explosion that ripped through a Great Lakes Steel Corporation blast furnace today. Homes within a twomile radius of the Zug Island plant were jarred by the blast, which sent a large cloud of smoke rolling over the Detroit River.

title: Harvard Plans Swiss Office
description: BOSTON, May 29 (AP)Harvard Business School announced today that It would place its new senior management training program and its European research office in Lausanne, Switzerland.

title: Theater: Early Whiting
description: Conditions of Agreement, which opened last night at the Roundabout Theater, was John Whiting's first play, although it was not produced until 1965, after the playwright's death. It is easy to see why the play has been neglected.

title: Rogers Flies to Bonn For a NATO Meeting
description: BONN, May 29 (UPI)Secretary of State William P. Rogers flew here from Moscow today and said President Nixon's meetings with the Soviet leaders have laid the foundations for a better and more peaceful world.

title: Environmentalists Stage Pier 6 Bazaar in Brooklyn
description: South Brooklyn, a waterfront community without waterfront recreation area, showed yesterday what it could do if it had one.

title: 11 DEAD IN LOUISIANA IN HELICOPTER CRASH
description: DULAC, La., May 29 (AP)A helicopter pilot and a 10man drilling crew on their way to an offshore oil rig were killed today when their helicopter crashed into a south Louisiana swamp near here.

title: AMERICO ABOAF
description: Americo Aboaf, who retired five years ago as vice president and general foreign manager of Universal International Pictures, died Friday at his home, 320 Riverside Drive. He was 76 years old.

title: Shoppers Flock to Stores Open on Holiday
description: Although they are normally at the beach on Memorial Day, the Chazins of the Bronx were shopping yesterday on Manhattan's West 34th Street, enjoying it and keeping Ohr bach's happy, until they decided to take a break by visiting Max's Coney Island delicatessen nearby.

title: Harlem's Stores and Peddlers Vie for Customers on 125th St.
description: For nearly two months now, Harlem residents have found the weather warm enough to use the Broadway of Harlem, that stretch of 125th Street between Lenox and St. Nicholas Avenues, as a. boulevard for social and economic transactions.

title: Bridge: Loomis and Freedman Win Gold Pairs Title Here
description: Two littleknown players captured the prestigious Goldman pair championship here during the weekend at the Eastern Regional championships at the New York Hilton. They were David Loomis of Marlboro, Mass., and Richard Freedman of New York. Second were Joseph Goldberg of West Hartford, Conn., and Steve Ekeblad of Fairfield, Conn.

title: CHARLES P. CRANE
description: BALTIMORE, May 29Charles P. Crane, civic leader and retired president and chairman of the Baltimore Gas and Electric Company, died here on Wednesday. He was S3 years old. Mr. Crane had also been chairman of the city's Airport Board for nine years.

title: Wooed by Firms, Many Girl Graduates Say No
description: An architecture firm, The Rouse Company, in Columbia, Md., called up Vassar a couple of weeks ago and asked if any girls about to finish there would like jobs as architects.

title: Governor Signs Bills to Cut Felony Court Case Backlog
description: ALBANY, May 29Governor Rockefeller, whose plan for sweeping statewide court reform was rejected by the Legislature, has signed into law more modest measures to streamline court administration and create more courts and grand juries to handle a backlog of felony cases.

title: 4 Women Flee Connecticut Jail; Caught Here After Wild Chase
description: Four women who escaped from a Connecticut prison early yesterday in a prison official's car with a guard held at knifepoint as hostage were captured here almost four hours later after a highspeed chase by the police of two states and the city.

title: Value of Contracts For Construction In April Set Record
description: More new construction work was started in April than in any previous month on record, the F. W. Dodge division of the McGrawHill Company reported today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: On May 13, two extraordinary expressions of despair appeared on your OpEd page. Anthony Lewis, writing from London about protest against the war in Vietnam and President Nixon's latest escalation, said that the President is remote from human beings... He is impervious to facts.

title: Armed Guard Kills Golfer in a Dispute On Buffalo Course
description: BUFFALO, May 29An armed guard at a municipal golf course in Buffalo shot and killed a golfer at pointblank range today after handcuffing and beating him, the police said.

title: NATO Chief Expects European Security Talks
description: BONN, May 29Dr. Joseph M. A. H. Luns, secretary general of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization, said today that the way was now open to talks between Eastern and Western European countries on security and cooperation.

title: 2 Regional Boards Due to Join CCS
description: The New York Stock Exchange announced yesterday that two regional exchanges will join the Big Board's Central Certificate Service.

title: Moderates Score Gains In Italian Judicial Vote
description: ROME, May 29The returns of an election held among Italy's judges and public prosecutors indicated today a shift from the left to the moderate center in the judiciary branch of the Government.

title: Fronts Stable in Vietnam but Heavy Bombing Goes On
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Tuesday, May 30All three major fronts in the Vietnam ground warnorth of Hue, at Kontum in the central highlands, and at Anloc 60 miles north of Saigonwere reported stable yesterday.

title: DoItYourself Furniture Kits: Hobby and Creative Outlet
description: Cabinetmakers may be disappearing. But in their stead have come the kit assemblers, men and women who may or may not have mastered their skills building Erector sets and model planes in childhood and who now put together chairs, tables, chests and even grandfather clocks from the contents of kits.

title: Francis McCaffrey, 69, Dead; Retired Judge of Family Court
description: Francis J. McCaffrey, who retired as a judge of the Family Court last July, died yesterday in New York Hospital. He was 69 years old and lived at 205 East 69th Street.

title: Foe Using Captured Guns
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, May 29 (UPI)  Communists using captured United States heavy artillery pieces shelled the besieged provincial capital of Svayrieng today for the second consecutive day, it was reported.

title: GUNMAN SLAYS 3 IN SHOPPING MALL
description: RALEIGH, N.C., May 29A gunman fired repeatedly into a crowd at a suburban Raleigh shopping center today with a rifle, killing three shoppers and wounding eight others before killing himself with the weapon.

title: CONGRESS ADDING TO NIXON'S BUDGET
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (UPI) A HouseSenate report showed today that Congress had added $1billion to President Nixon's spending plans and would probably add several billion more.

title: TV: How to Have a Point of View and Still Be Fair
description: While absolute balance in public affairs programing may be possible, it is hardly probable or even desirable. Absolute balance guarantees absolute dullness. The average television news special is akin not to a news report but to a magazine article. The form demands a thesis.

title: Ivy Ellen Broder Is Married To Prof.Gregory K. Schoepfle
description: OLD FIELD, L. I., May 29Miss Ivy Ellen Broder, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Joseph Broder of Riverdale, the Bronx, was married here this afternoon to Prof. Gregory Kern Schoepfle, son of Dr. and Mrs. George Kern Schoepfle of Kent, Ohio. William M. Johnson, Village Justice of Old Field performed the ceremony at the Sunwood Estate.

title: Potofsky, at 77, Reviews His Career as Head of Clothing Union
description: MIAMI, May 29The weight of a 385,000member union seemed removed from the shoulders of Jacob S. Potofsky after he formally announced today that he was ending a 26year span as president of the Amalgamated Clothing Workers of America.

title: To Protect Dolphins
description: The Senate Commerce Committee is nearing a decision on the Marine Mammal Protection Act. As passed by the House, this bill had serious defects which reflected more concern for the profits and convenience of the commercial tuna fishing industry than for the welfare of the highly intelligent dolphins and other ocean mammals threatened with extinction.

title: A Townin New England Remembers War Dead
description: CARLISLE, Mass., May 29  The bright morning sun and laughing children played over the Town Green here today, resisting with sound and color the solemn dignity of Memorial Day ceremonies for the war dead.

title: Royal Ballet Weighs ClosedCircuit TV In Move to Reach a Wider Audience
description: London's Royal Ballet, usually seen in an opera house setting of reddish plush and chandeliers, may soon come into the local British movie house via closedcircuit television.

title: Hill Trades In ShotPut for Helmet
description: While the performances that count are still to come for most top American track and field athletes, John Hill will trade his shotput for a football and his Lehigh uniform for the colors of the New York Giants in the next few months.

title: Chess: New Book Explores Use Of Traps With Openings
description: Many years ago, we ran into two of our former students at the New School, Mrs. Marcel Duchamp and Mrs. Sam Tabbat, and inquired if the ladies recalled anything about our chess course. They replied that they remembered the lecture on how to cheat in chess.

title: STATE AUDIT FINDS CITY JOB POLICIES WASTE MILLIONS
description: State auditors have reported widespread underutilization of employe time in the city government and have declared that Mayor Lindsay's budget has many areas where expenditures could be curtailed without the diminution of service.

title: Study Shows Catholics Having Smaller Families
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The first completed report of the 1970 National Fertility Study shows that Roman Catholic couples have sharply reduced the number of children they are having and intend to have.

title: Stockton Takes Final
description: TULSA, Okla., May 29 (AP) Dick Stockton of POrt Washington, L.I., defeated Eddie Dibbs of Miami, 75, 36, 6.2, in the final of the Tulsa invitational tennis tournament today

title: Roundup: Orioles Sweep Tribe
description: The Baltimore Big Four pitching rotation returned to peak form against the Cleveland Indians, and the Orioles were back in first place in the American League Eastern Divisior, last night.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Your May 12 editorial on the mining victory in West Virginia falls to distinguish between strip mining in hilly terrain in the East and strip mining in flat or rolling terrain in the West.

title: Queens Jewelry Plant Exemplifies State Agencies'
description: Whenever Hubert Ponard or Jacques Nagler can get away from the leased plant at 3300 Northern Boulevard, Long Island City, Queens, where they Manufacture jewelrywhich is not very often, because the company is so busythey go to a building they own not far away at 3711 47th Avenue.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The LTV Aerospace Corporation announced yesterday receipt of the first increment of a contract for about $5million from the United States Army Safeguard Systems Command Contracts Office. LTV Aerospace will conduct an opticalsensor experiment in support )f the Army's advanced ballistic missile defense agency. Work on the program, called Scoop, will be performed by the Vought Missiles and Space Company, a division of LTV Aerospace.

title: Advertising:
description: Don Gussow, president and editor in chief of Magazines for Industry, has been a writer and editor all of his working life, but he'd never written a book. Well, he finally has and just in time to join two of his sons on the shelves of the nation's bookstores.

title: DR. ARTHUR J. MURPHY
description: Dr. Arthur 3. Murphy, a urologist and former chief of the medical staff of St. Francis Hospital in the Bronx, died Saturday at his home, 580 Park Avenue. He was 74 years old.

title: PORTER CONDUCTS PROGRAM ON MALL
description: The Harlem Philharmonic fought the usual outdoorconcert battles yesterday afternoon at Central Park Mall, where the community orchestra presented its fourth annual Memorial Day program. Karl Hampton Porter conducted with extraordinary aplomb, considering that he had to compete wtih planes, shouting children, transistor radios, steeldrum bands from nearby areas, and at one point a loud jurisdictional dispute between food venders.

title: 2 Drown in Brooklyn Lake
description: Robert Sullivan, 27 years old, of 971 58th Street, and his brother, John, 22, of 540 40th Street, both of Brooklyn, drowned yesterday after their rowboat overturned in the Prospect Park Lake in Brooklyn.

title: SIDEROWF VICTOR IN BRITISH GOLF
description: SANDWICH, England, May 29 (AP)  Dick Siderowf, a former United States Walker Cup player, mastered a strong wind today and led 10 Ameri cans into the second round of the British Amateur golf championship.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. I., May 29Vitas Gerulaitis, the nation's sixthranking junior, won three matches today to reach the semifinals of the Eastern Lawn Tennis Association junior spring tournament. Neil Edwab and Ricky Meyer also entered the semifinals.

title: I.R.A. Wing Orders End Of Armed Ulster Action
description: DUBLIN, May 29The Official wing of the Irish Republican Army announced tonight the immediate suspension of all armed offensive operations in Ulster.

title: Acupuncture Is Used to Anesthetize a Patient Here
description: Acupuncture, the ancient Chinese technique of needle therapy, was used to anethetize a surgical patient In a hospital in New York City last week, it was learned last night.

title: U.S. Doubts Foe's Supply Gap Is Healed
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 29Senior American intelligence officials said today that they had seen very little evidence of any significant expansion in the movement of supplies through China to North Vietnam since American planes sealed off seven North Vietnamese ports with mines and cut the rail lines beginning May 9.

title: Mr. Agnew's Future
description: In 1956 Richard M. Nixon wanted very much to be renominated as Vice President, but influential advisers to President Eisenhower thought a less controversial running mate would be preferable. After a period uncertainty, President Eisenhower decided against forcing a change. When he told Mr. Nixon to chart his own course, there was no doubt what that course would be.

title: Brundage Says He'll Retire After Olympics at Munich
description: LAUSANNE, Switzerland, May 29 (UPI)Avery Brundage, the 84yearold president of the International Olympic Committee, said today he definitely was retiring after the Summer Games in Munich in September.

title: JAMES TIMOLAT JR.
description: James G. Timolat Jr., retired president of the Oakland Chemical Company, died yesterday at the ColumbiaPresbyterian Medical Center. He was 78 years old and lived at the Union League Club.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: In his April 26 article, Edward Cowan reported the opposition of a number of scientists and others toward the breeder reactor program of the Nixon Administration. The group, called Environmental Action, based its opposition on questions of safety and environmental impact of such a reactor.

title: Four Killed in Plane Crash
description: VANDALIA, Ill., May 29 (AP) The bodies of four persons, including a Mississippi couple, were found today in the wreckage of a light plane that crashed in a wooded area 12 miles from Vandalia. The victims were identified as William Maple, 35 years old, of East Alton; Robert Bogard, 35, of Biloxi, Miss., and his wife, Belinda, 21; and Robert Ickes, 13, of East St. Louis.

title: Tally on Passed Ball Caps 4Run Rally Againtt Cards
description: ST. LOUIS, May 29The New York Mets struck for four runs in the ninth inning today to upset the St. Louis Cardinals, 76, moments after the Cardinals appeared to have won the game with three in the eighth.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor: Mitchell Wilson's recent OpEd article, The Myth of Hiroshima, is less than convincing. Whether a relatively bloodless demonstration of the atom bomb could have brought about a Japanese surrender is unknowable now, as it was unknowable then.

title: 4 Top Pro Golfers Set Targets Today
description: CLEVELAND, May 29 (AP) Lee Trevino, Jack Nicklaus, Kathy Whitworth and Mrs. JoAnne Career will shoot the target scores tomorrow for the 20th annual National Golf Day tournament, which runs through June 18.

title: OBSERVER
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 Youth spent at the movies before Cinema set in, which is to say roughly during the period from Cagney through Bogart, must have left millions of Americans with permanent mental scars.

title: MOSCOW AFFIRMS ANTIIMPERIALISM
description: MOSCOW, May 29 (AP) Pravda declared today that while the Soviet Union and the United States had signed an arms pact of tremendous significance, Moscow would still defend socialism and wage relentless struggles against aggressive imperialist forces.

title: Most Promising Players Picked by Theater World
description: The season's most promising players on and off Broadway as selected by Theater World, a pictorial and statistical yearbook, were announced yesterday.

title: Thriving Kiev Has Rich Past
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R., May 29This Ukrainian capital is known as the Mother of Russian Cities. It was here, on the steep wooded hillsides overlooking the Dnieper River, that the capital of the first Russian state arose in the ninth century.

title: Millions Play in the Sun As Long Holiday Closes
description: Beaches and parks in the metropolitan area drew millions of people yesterday, the third and final day of a sunny Memorial Day weekend.

title: Hard Times Clouding Future Of Lake Placid and Saranac
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y.It could be wished, as one benign day now follows another, that Lake Placid and Saranac Lake were back in that era of magnificence when the lawns of the very private Lake Placid Club were thronged with bully people in long dresses and white flannels.

title: Amex Names Governor
description: Jack Nash, managing partner of Oppenheimer & Co., has been named a governor of the American Stock Exchange. He fills the vacancy created by the election as board chairman of Robert C. Van Tuyl, who is also board chairman of Shearson, Hammill & Co., Inc.

title: China Cargo Drop Reported
description: PEKING, May 29 (Agence FrancePresse)  A usually well informed diplomatic source said here today that three Polish ships bound for North Vietnam with freight had unloaded their special cargoes at a Chinese port instead, under an agreement between the Chinese and Polish Governments.

title: Hulme Takes British Race
description: OULTON, England, May 29 (UPI)Denny Hulme of New Zealand twice smashed the circuit record today in a YardleyMcLaren in winning the 110 mile Rothman's Gold Cup by more than half a minute.

title: First Steps in Health
description: The necessity for careful selection of priorities Government social policy is now greater than ever. That key conclusion from the grim fiscal projection of the Federal budget just published by the Brookings Institution applies with particular force to the hard choices the country must make on better health care.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: One wonders whether the severely curt ailed commercial harvest of broadhill swordfish, brought about by the discovery that many of them contain levels of mercury presumed harmful to humans, will result in greater numbers of them being taken in this season's fishing tournament.

title: Market Place: Fund Managers And Expertise
description: We're always looking for offbeat indicators on the stock market and  would you believe?commercial paper can be a bellwether, or so it appears.

title: Goldwater Is Recuperating
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP) Senator Barry Goldwater, Republican of Arizona, was reported in good condition today in Bethesda Naval Hospital, where he underwent a gall bladder operation yesterday. Senator Goldwater, 63 years old, was admitted to the hospital Thursday after suffering an attack of severe abdominal pain Wednesday night following a speech. He is expected to be released in a week or 10 days.

title: Aussies Decline China Offer
description: SYDNEY, Australia, May 28 (UPI)  The Australian Swimming Union has declined an invitation to send a team to compete in Peking in July, Syd Grange, secretary, said today. The reason, he said, is that the Aussie swimmers will be preparing for the Olympics.

title: Wheelabrator Sets $18Million Merger
description: WheelabratorFrye, Inc., has signed an agreement to purchase the Rust Engineering Company and its subsidiaries from Litton Industries, Inc., for $18million in cash, it was announced yesterday. The purchase is subject to completion of a final audit and other contingencies, Michael D. Dingman, president and chief executive of WheelabratorFrye, said. Rust Engineering will become a member of its environmental systems group, which after the acquisition will represent about 65 per cent of WheelabratorFrye's continuing sales.

title: DRUG TRAFFICKING SHIFTS TO SUBURBS
description: More and more narcotics traffickers have been moving more and more of their operations from New York City into the suburbs, according to metropolitanarea lawenforcement officials who worked together on last week's mass narcotics arrests.

title: New Batteries May Obviate PumpedStorage Power
description: New technologyparticularly involving batteriesmay be on the verge of ending one of the most persistent disagreements between environmentalists and electric power companies.

title: Kennedy Center Is Home To College Jazz Festival
description: WASHINGTON, May 29The American College Jazz Festival, which was organized in 1969 as an attraction for the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts, finally reached its home base yesterday after spending its first two years in the Midwest. The first College Jazz Festival, held in the spring of 1970, and the second, the following year, both took place at the University of Illinois in Urbana because the Kennedy Center had not been completed.

title: Teacher in Racial Incident To Stay Out of Classroom
description: WATERLOO, Iowa, May 29 (UPI)A junior high school speech teacher who unintentionally, stirred a racial controversy here last week said today that she would not return to the classroom for the remainder of the school year.

title: Kite Rider Killed in Crash At Transpo 72 Air Show
description: WASHINGTON, May 29 (AP) A 26yearold air show performer was killed today when the kite he was riding crashed to the ground as thousands watched at the Transpo 72 international exposition.

title: Sale of Rifle to Suspect Is Described by a Clerk
description: RALEIGH, N. C., May 29 (UPI)  The tall, welldressed, man walked into Thorne's Hard!, ware and Sporting Goods Store and said he wanted to buy a rifle.

title: SHOP TALK
description: Just in time for the 1972 Presidential campaign there is a new chess set with President Nixon as the Republican king and Senator George S. McGovern as the Democratic king.

title: P.S.C. Offers Ways To Reduce Increase In the Use of Energy
description: Some ways to slow down the country's increasing use of energy were outlined yesterday in a Public Service Commission report that said they would be difficult to implement.

title: Miss Heinkele Bride of D. B. Dineen
description: Miss Peggy Anne Heinkele and Daniel Blake Dineen, 1971 graduates of the Fordham Law School, were married yesterday in St. Anastasia Roman Catholic Church in Douglaston, Queens. The Rev. William T. Smith performed the ceremony.

title: RCA Ad Ruffles Power Structure
description: Earlier this month RCA Records and Tapes ran fullpage ad in The Village Voice and the underground press that did not escape the notice of the aboveground power structure.

title: EUROBOND ISSUES ON A RALLY TRAIL
description: BRUSSELS, May 29The Eurobond market is starting out on the rally trail in a big way, with the newissue calender expanding and the secondary market holding firm.

title: GREETING IN KIEV
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R., May 29President Nixon began a visit today to Kiev, his last stop in the Soviet Union, after a series of events that lent a touch of humor to his otherwise sober and businesslike week in the Soviet Union.

title: Mexico Downs Guatemala, Gains Olympic Soccer Spot
description: TOLUCA, Mexico, May 29 (AP)With a 31 victory over Guatemala, Mexico's soccer team today gained a berth in the Olympic Games in Munich in August.

title: U.S.C. Gets Court Star
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29 (UPI) Southern California has recruited Vic Kelley, the leading scorer of the national junior college basketball tournament in March. The guard from Southern Idaho averaged 30 points in the tournament. He attended DeWitt Clinton High in New York. Bob Boyd, the Trojan coach, made the announcement today.

title: JOHN MONTAGUE, FAMED AS GOLFER
description: LOS ANGELES, May 29 (AP) John Montague, a legendary figure in golfing, died Friday a motel in suburban Studio City. He was 66 years old. His real name was La Verne M. Moore.

title: New Envoy to Peking Appointed by Canada
description: OTTAWA, May 29 (Canadian Press)Canada appointed Charles John Small today as her new Ambassador to China to succeed Ralph E. Collins, who is returning to Ottawa.

title: 3 TOP TAIPEI POSTS GIVEN TO TAIWANESE
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, May 29President Chiang KaiShek today appointed three Taiwanese to highlevel Government positions that had previously been filled by natives of mainland Chinese provinces.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, May 29To my eye, the first California debate between Hubert H. Humphrey and George McGovern could be scored about as follows:

title: 9 Dead Fetuses Delivered
description: PHILADELPHIA, May 29 (AP) A woman who had been taking fertility pills for at least three years was delivered of nine dead fetuses today, the University of Pennsylvania hospital reported. The woman, who was not identified, was in her 10th to 12th week of pregnancy.

title: Mexican Auto Industry Problems Mount
description: MEXICO CITY, May 29Mexico's automotive industry, 10 years old come this August is in serious trouble. One company has already gone out of business, one is floundering, two more are now owned by the Government, and the other four are struggling to stay alive.

title: One Way to Win
description: Why Democratic Assemblyman Stephen S. Gottlieb decided to challenge the venerable Democratic minority leader in the State Senate, Joseph Zaretzki, in next month's primary might have been anybody's guess until a few days ago. It's now all too plain.

title: Books of The Times
description: This is a charming book and it's a pity, because Thomas Rogers has shown signs of real talent. If he set his mind to it, he could probably write a genuine novel. think someone ought to tell him, or he might just go on writing charming books. What is a charming book? It's one in which the author disarms his readers by his unpretentiousness, his comfortable air of casualness. Well, I may be an exception, but I don't want to be disarmed. I'm tired of people trying to disarm me. I want to read a book with my critical arsenalsuch as it isintact, and then say what I think or feel.

title: A Celebration of Hope
description: KIEV, U.S.S.R., May 29The summitry ended in the glittering St. George's Hall in Moscow's Kremlin, with what was, after all, a celebration of atmosphere, emotion and hope.

title: $137,200 DERBY TO SMILING JACK
description: CHERRY HILL, N. J., May 29Smiling Jack, whose owner, ElceeH Stable, paid a $7,500 supplementary fee to enter the chestnut colt, raced easily to a sevenlength victory in the $137,200 Jersey Derby today as Garden State Park staged its final racing day of the spring season.

title: Singing of Roberta Long Shows Thoughtful, Sensitive Approach
description: Roberta Long, a Washingtonborn soprano who made her debut here in 1954, has matured into a recitalist of more than ordinary interest. Although her program at Carnegie Recital Hall Sunday night began with a Mozart aria for which her voice did not seem sufficiently warmed up, Miss Long's recital proved her to be a singer of much sensitivity. She had to be, with a program that included Berg's Seven Early Songs, a Debussy group and Barber's, Hermit Songs.

title: Soviet Holds Out Big Prospects in Trade
description: MOSCOW, May 29On the last day of President Nixon's visit to this country, a high Soviet economic planner held out tempting prospects today for the development of a large volume of Soviet American trade based on resource development based on resource development projects and other joint ventures.

title: Double Dare Takes Shields Class Race In Y.R.A. Regatta
description: RYE, N. Y., May 29Dr. George K. Brazill Jr.'s and Joseph F. O'Hora's Double Dare, the national champion of the class, remained undefeated today in the new Yacht Racing Association's championship season on Long Island Sound. Double Dare won a third Shields Class race as a fleet of 103 sailed off American Yacht Club in a southsouthwest breeze that was at 10 knots for the start and 20 knots for the finishes. After 12.3 miles on Gold Cup course, Double Dare won by 57 seconds and about 20 boat lengths.

title: Another Marathon Winner
description: The name of a winner of the 24hour Central Park bike marathon was inadvertently omitted from yesterday's editions of The New York Times. The winner of the trophy for women was Mrs. Kenneth Chase, 26 years old, of North Bergen, N.J., who cycled under her maiden name, JeanneNicole Ledoux. She clocked 333.4 miles. Elton Fisher of Floral Park, L. I., the men's winner, did 280 miles.

title: Sulzberger Says Understanding Of a Free Press Is Inadequate
description: MONTCLAIR, N. J., May 29 Arthur Ochs Sulzberger, president and publisher of The New York Times, warned today of a troubling lack of understanding of the importance of a free press to a free society and an absence of sensitivity to its fragility.

title: Black Is Beautiful
description: In an era of tight family budgets, the margin between income and expendlture is likely to be narrow. And everyone knows that it is better to be in the black than in the red.

title: KLEINDIENST DISPUTE DELAYS SHULTZ VOTE
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI) The Senate's confirmation of George P. Shultz as Treasury Secretary became snarled today in a still pending controversy over Richard G. Kleindienst's nomination as Attorney General.

title: No Radical Economics Seen Via McGovern Head of Fund Cites Moderating Effect
description: GENEVA, May 30The economist for a major American business group and the head of a big mutual fund organization said at an international gathering today that they did not see radical economic changes in store for the United States if Senator George McGovern was elected President.

title: Gunmen Linked to Group Of Ultraleftists in Japan
description: The Army of the Red Star, the group to which one of the attackers at the Israeli airport said he belonged, was reported by Japanese sources to be a faction of an ultraleftist guerrilla group whose members allegedly murdered 14 of their comrades in a purge in recent months.

title: Big Show of 1936, Unghostly Nostalgia
description: At this point in the current nostalgia trend, any vaudeville revue called The Big Show of 1936 with oldtime stars from back when might rightly be approached wanly. Suprisingly, the show is consistently pleasant and the nostalgia never drips. It opened last night at the Felt Forum and runs through June 4.

title: MURRAY R. LAVIN
description: SCARSDALE, N. Y., May 30 Murray R. Lavin, vice chairman of the board of Allen & Co., Inc., stockbrokers at 30 Broad Street, New York, died Sunday at his home. 3 Bethel Road, a day before his 74th birthday.

title: Rebels Organizing an Election Drive in Rural Portuguese Guinea
91 Candidates for House Accused of Fund Laxity
Canada Dollar Stand
description: OTTAWA, May 30 (Reuters) Finance Minister John Turner indicated today that Canada would not consider returning to a pegged internationalexchange rate for its dollar until a new world trade and monetary regime had been perfected.

title: 5 Carolina Children Killed in Explosion In a Bomb Shelter
description: VALDESE, N. C., May 30 (UPI)  An explosion ripped apart a backyard bomb shelter in this western North Carolina hamlet tonight, killing five children and injuring another.

title: MINORITY PLANKS URGED IN BOSTON
description: BOSTON, May 30The first of 10 regional hearings by the Platform Committee of the Democratic National Conventidn was held today in historic Faneuil Hall, and every minority group from gay liberationists to white ethnics turned out to get its own special plank in the party's 1972 platform.

title: Two Are Banned
description: LAUSANNE, May 30 (UPI)The International Olympic Committee today banned a Colombian cyclist, Martin (Cochise) Rodriguez, and a Kenyan Rifle marksman, Vic Preston, from the Summer Games on the ground that they had violated amateur regulations in allowing their photographs and names to be used for publicity purposes.

title: Japanese Report a Decline In April Payments Surplus
description: TOKYO, May 30 (Reuters)Japan's balance of payments for April produced a surplus of $157million, the Finance Ministry announced today. The revised figure showed a decline from a surplus of $421million in the corresponding month of last year.

title: Senator Scores Newspapers For Shoddy Production
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (UPI) Senator Robert C. Byrd, Democrat of West Virginia, today criticized United States newspapers for an increasing tendency toward shoddy technical production  careless mistakes, poor proofreading and lackadaisical editing.

title: Groundbreaking Held in Harlem For $ 10Million Office Building
description: Ground was broken yesterday for a $10million highrise office building  the largest commercial space owned and constructed by blacks in Harlemwith Charles A. Vincent, the principal owner, wielding goldplated shovel at the construction site.

title: LATEST TROTTER PLEASES MILLER
description: WESTBURY, L. I., May 30When a newcomer to harness racing seeks purchasing advice from Del Miller, the advice is: If you're going to get into this sport, buy a trotter, because a good one is worth his weight in gold.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BONN, May 30 (UPI)About a thousand Bonn University students marched under red banners today to protest the visit of Secretary of State Rogers.

title: Getty and Algeria in Accord
description: ALGIERS, May 30 (UPI) The Getty Petroleum Society, subsidiary of the Getty Oil Company of Los Angeles, and Algeria have agreed to modify a protocol they signed in 1968 for the research and exploitation of oil and gas in Algeria, Government sources said today.

title: Robinson Gets Tryout Berth
description: KANSAS CITY, May 30 (UPI)Ron Robinson of Memphis State University was named today to replace Roy Ebron of Southwest Louisiana as one of the 28 National Collegiate players participating in the United States Olympic basketball development camp June 12 at the Air Force Academy. The N.C.A.A. said that Ebron would be unable to participate because of, an injury.

title: Troy Splits With Party to Back Black Minister in the Primary
description: The Queens Democratic leader, Matthew J. Troy Jr., endorsed the Rev. Robert R. Johnson yesterday for the State Senate in the Democratic primary against the choice of the county organization.

title: Metropolitan Briefs
description: A smoky threealarm fire destroyed the interior of a takeeut sandwich shop on 49th Street, a few doors east of Seventh Avenue, at the height of the rush hour last evening.

title: New President Is Named At J. L. Hudson Company
description: Edwin G. Roberts. a former president of Franklin Simon, yesterday was named president of the J. L. Hudson Company, Detroit, one of the nation's largest department stores, effective July 1.

title: Supreme Court Actions
description: WASHINGTON, May 30The Supreme Court took the following actions today:

title: ACCORD IS REACHED IN FRANCHISING SUIT
description: The Consolidated Foods Corporation announced yesterday that it had agreed to settle a class action suit brought against its former subsidiary Chicken Delight, Inc. The suit had been brought by a group of franchisees who had charged that the method of calculating franchise fees was unlawuful.

title: Two New York Men Killed
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 (AP The Defense Department announced today that Timothy J. Monkelbaan of Lockport, N.Y., an Army Specialist 4, and David L. Wagner of Plattsburgh, N.Y., an Air Force technical sergeant, had been killed in action in Southeast Asia.

title: Norman E. Nicholson, 49, Dies; Former Kaiser Vice President
description: WASHINGTON, May 30 Norman E. Nicholson, public affairs vice president of the Highway Users Federation and a former vice president of Kaiser Industries, Inc., died today of head injuries suffered in a fall at his home in Potomac, Md. He was 49 years old.

title: Mosley Reported Fair
description: INDIANAPOLIS, May 30 (AP) Mike Mosley, 25 years old, who was injured when he crashed on the 56th lap, while leading the 500mile race here Saturday, was reported in fair condition today at Methodist Hospital.

title: Saigon Cautiously Approves
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, May 30The South Vietnamese Government tonight extended cautious approval of President Nixon's negotiations in the Soviet Union, but stated it would not accept conditions contrary to the interests of the people of South Vietnam.

title: DR. IVES HENDRICK,74, TAUGHT PSYCHIATRY
description: BOSTON, May 30Dr. Ives Hendrick, professor emeritus of clinical psychiatry at Harvard University and a past president of the American Psychoanalytic Association, died Sunday at his home, 84 Mount Vernon Street. 1He was 74 years old.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Humphrey Makes Apology In Debate With McGovern
description: LOS ANGELES. May 30Senator Hubert H. Humphrey apologized tonight for a remark that had been interpreted as his having called Senator George McGovern a fool. Then their second television con frontation turned into a cool debate of issues, not with each other, but with their panel of questioners.

title: 16 on School Bus Injured
description: PARSIPPANY, N. J., May 30 (AP) Sixteen children and three adults suffered minor injuries today when a tractor,trailer skidded into the rear of a school bus on rainswept Route 46. They were treated at St. Clare's Hospital in Denville and Riverside Hospital in Boonton and released.

title: Assembly Panel Opens Hearings
description: UNION, N.J.. May 30The Assembly Tax Committee today held the first of 11 public hearings on Gov. William T. Cahill's taxreform package of 57 bills.

title: Advertising:
description: The Standard Oil Company (New Jersey) is spending more than $1million in print advertising to bring its story of offshore drilling to thought leaders and the ecology and conservationminded.

title: Nixon Welcomed Warmly by Iranians
description: TEHERAN. Iran, May 30After more than a week of precise and difficult bargaining with old adversaries in Moscow, President Nixon arrived here today to relax in the sunshine and spontaneous approval of an old ally. The Shah of Iran, Mohammad Riza Pahlevi, gave Mr. Nixon a full military welcome at the airport. Tens of thousands of ordinary citizens turned out to smile, wave and cheer as the President stood with his host in the open roof of a big car to absorb and return the affection of the crowd.

title: Duchess, Indisposed, to Rest In Paris Home Until, Friday
description: PARIS, May 30 (Reuters)The Duchess of Windsor is suffering from strain and will not be able to fly to England tomorrow with the body of the Duke.

title: Hijacker in Brazil, Outwitted By Airline, Commits Suicide
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, May 30 (Reuters)A tone hijacker who duped officials into believing he had two accomplices shot himself to death tonight after holding for ransom a Brazilian airliner with 96 people aboard, an airline spokesman here said.

title: Visitations
